TRL: O qoerbineh khad sapra o meereh ileh, ”rabee, bit ateyn baroekh layka dazet.“
ENG: And there came a scribe, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܲܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܙܥܵܙܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܩܸܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܪܹܫܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ta'le biz'aze eet-lhoon, o ṭayre dshmaya qinate, eena broona dnasha layt-leh doeka dmatiw resheh.“
ENG: And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܘܩܵܒ݂ܪܹܢ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh khad khena min talmeedoehy, ”maree, hal-lee psasa qamayta azen o qawren lbabee.“
ENG: And another of the disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܘܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܡܝܼܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ileh, ”ta baree, o shwooq meete qawree meetayhy.“
ENG: But Jesus saith unto him, Follow me; and leave the dead to bury their own dead.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dseeq-leh eeshoo' gaw gamee, 'weerhoon 'ameh talmeedoehy.
ENG: And when he was entered into a boat, his disciples followed him.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ ܟܘܼܣܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ. ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O hwe-leh khad shghoeshya goera byama, hadkha dlape koese-lhoon lgamee. O eeshoo' dmeekha ywa.
ENG: And behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the boat was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܪܥܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܦܲܨܝܼ ܠܲܢ، ܒܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“
TRL: O qoerbinhoon talmeedoehy o moer'ish-lhoon ileh, o meerhoon, ”Maran, paṣee lan, biṭlaqa ywakh.“
ENG: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Save, Lord; we perish.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ؟“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܘܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܬܩܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee bizda'a ytoon, ya baṣoore dhaymanoeta?“ haygah qeem-leh njeew-leh bpawkha o byama, o hwe-leh shitqa goera.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܘܝܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: nashe 'oejib-lhoon o meerhoon, ”manee-yleh aha dpawkha o yama bishlama yna ileh?“
ENG: And the men marveled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܕܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܫܹܐܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܪ̈ܝܼܚܹܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dte-leh eeshoo' lmarza khena gaw atra dgidraye, tpeeq-lhoon bee-eh trey shedane biplaṭa min beyt qwoere, o hadkha ywaw sreekhe doep khad le maṣe wa 'aber wa bhay oerkha.
ENG: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gadarenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming forth out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man could pass by that way.

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܸܬ ܠܲܢ؟“
TRL: Moeqwikh-lhoon o meerhoon, ”ma-loekh minan, ya eeshoo' broona dalaha? te-loekh lakha min qam 'dana djanjirit lan?“
ENG: And behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܪܥܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa rikhqa minayhy khda biqra goerta dkhzoere bir'aya.
ENG: Now there was afar off from them a herd of many swine feeding.

ASY: ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܸܢ ܦܲܠܛܸܬ ܠܲܢ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܲܢ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܓܵܘ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O ṭleeb-lhoon mineh anee shede o meerhoon, ”in palṭit lan, hal lan psasa dazakh gaw biqra dkhzoere.“
ENG: And the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, send us away into the herd of swine.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ.“ ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܫܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”zemoen.“ o bhay 'dana pleeṭ-lhoon o 'weerhoon gaw biqra dkhzoere, o haygah rkheeṭ-laha biqra dkhzoere lshqeepa, o npeel-lhoon gaw yama, o khneeq-lhoon.
ENG: And he said unto them, Go. And they came out, and went into the swine: and behold, the whole herd rushed down the steep into the sea, and perished in the waters.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܪܥܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Anee dmar'oeye ywaw 'reeq-lhoon o zeel-lhoon lmdeeta o hoeqe-lhoon boet kl mindee dhwe-leh, o boet anee deet waw bee-ayhy shede.
ENG: And they that fed them fled, and went away into the city, and told everything, and what was befallen to them that were possessed with devils.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܚܘܼܡܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon klayhy nashe dmdeeta loerkha deeshoo', o eeman dkhze-lhoon ileh, ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dazel min tkhoemayhy.
ENG: And behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought him that he would depart from their borders.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ.
TRL: O seeq-leh eeshoo' gaw gamee, o zeel-leh lhaw marza khena o te-leh lmdeeteh.
ENG: And he entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ”ܗܘܝܼ ܠܸܒܵܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“
TRL: O moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad shpeela dirya bshweeta. Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' haymanoetayhy, meereh lhaw shpeela, ”hwee libana broonee, poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh.“
ENG: And behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, be of good cheer; thy sins are forgiven.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܓܕܵܦܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Haygah meerhoon khakma sapre gaw ganayhy, ”aha bigdapa-yleh.“
ENG: And behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.

ASY: ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: dee' leh eeshoo' khoeshabayhy o meereh, ”qamoodee bikhshawa ytoon beeshta blibawkhoon?
ENG: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂،‘ ܝܲܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܩܘܼܡ ܚܕܘܿܪ؟‘
TRL: ”Aynee-ylaha boesh pshoeqta lemara, ’poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh,‘ yan lemara, ’qoem khdoor?‘
ENG: For whether is easier, to say, Thy sins are forgiven; or to say, Arise, and walk?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܸܠ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ”ܩܘܼܡ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena dyad'eetoon dbroona dnasha eet-leh shoelṭana bar'a dpakhil khṭeeate.“ haygah meereh lhaw shpeela, ”qoem, shqool shweetoekh, o ze lbaytoekh.“
ENG: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins (then saith he to the sick of the palsy), Arise, and take up thy bed, and go unto thy house.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: O qeem-leh o zeel-leh lbayteh.
ENG: And he arose, and departed to his house.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dkhze-lhoon kinshe, zdee' lhoon, o shoebikh-lhoon lalaha dyoebil-leh hadkha shoelṭana lbnaynasha.
ENG: But when the multitudes saw it, they were afraid, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܡܲܬܲܝ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܒܹܝܬ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O kad 'weereh eeshoo' min tama, khze-leh khad nasha shimeh matay, teewa bbeyt makhse, o meereh ileh, ”ta baree.“ qeem-leh o zeel-leh bareh.
ENG: And as Jesus passed by from thence, he saw a man, called Matthew, sitting at the place of toll: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܲܝ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O kad teewa ywa lsoepra gaw bayta dmatay, te-lhoon raba makhse o khaṭaye o teew-lhoon 'al soepra 'am eeshoo' o talmeedoehy.
ENG: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܲܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Kad preeshe khze-lhoon ilayhy, meerhoon ltalmeedoehy, ”qamoodee 'am makhse o khaṭaye bekhala-yleh rabeeawkhoon?“
ENG: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with the publicans and sinners?

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܐܵܣܝܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܘܼܠܡܵܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: O kad shmee' leh eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”le yna sneeqe lasya anee deena bkhoelmana, ila anee dmree'e yna.
ENG: But when he heard it, he said, They that are whole have no need of a physician, but they that are sick.

ASY: ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܝ݇ܠܘܿܦܘܼܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ’ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ.‘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Zemoen o loopoen moodee-yleh, ’rakhme ke ba'eyn, o la diwkha.‘ sabab ana la te-lee dqareyn lzadeeqe, ila lkhaṭaye.“
ENG: But go ye and learn what this meaneth, I desire mercy, and not sacrifice: for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܲܚ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ؟“
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' talmeede dyookhanan o meerhoon, ”qamoodee akhnan o preeshe ke ṣaymakh raba, eena talmeedoekh le ṣaymee?“
ENG: Then come to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܢܘܿܢܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܨܵܝܡܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee, ke maṣee nashe dgnoona 'awdee ta'zee kma dkhitna 'amayhy-yleh? Eena bit atee yawmane eeman dpaesh shqeela minayhy khitna, o haygah bit ṣaymee.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Can the sons of the bride-chamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then will they fast.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܥܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܠܝܼܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܓܵܪܫܵܐ ܥܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܙܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܲܪܘܸܣ.
TRL: ”Oep khad le dare 'arayta khadta 'al lweeshta bleeta, dla hawya dgarsha 'arayta min hay lweeshta, o biz'a boesh garwis.
ENG: And no man putteth a piece of undressed cloth upon an old garment; for that which should fill it up taketh from the garment, and a worse rent is made.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܠܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܪܛܝܼ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܵܦܹܟ݂ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܘܚܵܪܒ݂ܝܼ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܢܛܝܼܪܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O nashe le daree khamra khata gaw goede bilye, dla parṭee goede, o shapekh khamra, o kharwee goede. Eena ke daree khamra khata gaw goede khate, dhadkha tirwayhy payshee nṭeere.“
ENG: Neither do men put new wine into old wineskins: else the skins burst, and the wine is spilled, and the skins perish: but they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܪܵܬܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Kad eeshoo' hamzoeme ywa 'amayhy, te-leh khad shaleeṭa o sgheed-leh ileh, o meereh, ”bratee adeea meet-laha, eena ta o matiw eedoekh 'aloeha o bit khaya.“
ENG: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Qeem-leh eeshoo', o 'ameh talmeedoehy, o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܘܕܩܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܫܸܦܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ.
TRL: O ha khda bakhta dbezala ywa dimoeha qa tri'sar shine, te-laha min bareh, o dqeeraha bshipoela dlweeshteh.
ENG: And behold, a woman, who had an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the border of his garment:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇، ”ܐܵܦܸܢ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܵܩܪܵܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Sabab meeraha bganoeha, ”apin blweeshteh akhchee daqran, bit payshan bseemta.“
ENG: for she said within herself, If I do but touch his garment, I shall be made whole.

ASY: ܘܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܗܘܝܼ ܠܸܒܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܝܼ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܚܝܼܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ.
TRL: O pteel-leh eeshoo' o khizya-leh o meereh iloeha, ”hwee libanta bratee, haymanoetakhy qam makheea lakhy.“ o har bhay 'dana peesh-laha bseemta hay bakhta.
ENG: But Jesus turning and seeing her said, Daughter, be of good cheer; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܚܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܒܝܼܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܹܐ،
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' lbayta dshaleeṭa, o khze-leh lmakhyane dshabeebe o kinsha shgheeshe,
ENG: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute-players, and the crowd making a tumult,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܦܠܘܿܛܘܼܢ. ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“ ܘܓܚܝܼܟ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”plooṭoen. Brata le-ylaha meetta, ila dmeekhta-ylaha.“ o gkheek-lhoon bee-eh.
ENG: he said, Give place: for the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܘܼܗ̇، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dpoeliṭ-leh lkinsha, 'weereh o dweeq-leh beedoeha, o qeem-laha hay brata.
ENG: But when the crowd was put forth, he entered in, and took her by the hand; and the damsel arose.

ASY: ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: O prees-leh aha khabra bklaha hay ar'a.
ENG: And the fame hereof went forth into all that land.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠܲܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ.“
TRL: O kad shoene-leh eeshoo' min tama, zeel-lhoon bareh trey simye, maqwoekhe o bemara, ”'wood rakhme 'alan, broona ddaweed.“
ENG: And as Jesus passed by from thence, two blind men followed him, crying out, and saying, Have mercy on us, thou son of David.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܡܵܪܲܢ.“
TRL: O eeman dte-leh lbayta, qoerbinhoon ileh anee simye. O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”hamoene ytoon dmaṣeyn ana 'awden aha?“ meerhoon ileh, ”he, Maran.“
ENG: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Haygah dqeereh b'aynayhy o meereh, ”aykh dhoeminawkhoon hawe ilawkhoon.“
ENG: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it done unto you.

ASY: ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܩܲܫܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O bhay 'dana khze-lhoon. O qashyaeet soepe-leh ilayhy eeshoo' o meereh, ”khzeymoen doep khad la yade' boet aha.“
ENG: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus strictly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Eena anee pleeṭ-lhoon o prees-lhoon aha khabra bklaha hay ar'a.
ENG: But they went forth, and spread abroad his fame in all that land.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܪܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ.
TRL: O kad biplaṭa ywaw eeshoo' o talmeedoehy, moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad kharsha deet wa bee-eh sheda.
ENG: And as they went forth, behold, there was brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܠܛܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܲܪܫܵܐ. ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܲܝܬ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: O eeman dpeesh-leh poelṭa sheda, hoemzim-leh haw kharsha. O 'oejib-lhoon kinshe o meerhoon, ”khad hadkha mindee layt peesha khizya gaw eesrayel.“
ENG: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb man spake: and the multitudes marveled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܝܲܕ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena preeshe meerhoon, ”byad goera dshede paloeṭe-yleh shede.“
ENG: But the Pharisees said, By the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

ASY: ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܘܼܪ̈ܗܵܢܹܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ.
TRL: Bikhdara ywa eeshoo' bklayhy mdeenate o bmatwate, o maloepe bknoeshyatayhy, o makroeze ewangaleeoon dmalkoeta, o basoeme klayhy koerhane o klayhy mar'e.
ENG: And Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of disease and all manner of sickness.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܕܫܘܼܪܫܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܫܸܪܝܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ.
TRL: O kad khze-leh eeshoo' lkinshe, roekhim-leh 'alayhy, dshoershee-e ywaw o shirye, aykh 'irbe dlayt-lhoon ra'ya.
ENG: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were distressed and scattered, as sheep not having a shepherd.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܚܸܨܕܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”khiṣda raba-yleh, o pa'le baṣoore yna.
ENG: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܚܸܨܕܵܐ، ܕܫܲܕܸܪ ܦܵܥܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܸܨܕܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha, ṭlooboen min mara dkhiṣda, dshadir pa'le lkhiṣdeh.“
ENG: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he send forth labourers into his harvest.

ASY: ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܘܕܒܲܣܡܝܼ ܟܠ ܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܟܘܼܪܗܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O qre-leh ltri'sar talmeedoehy, o yoebil-leh ilayhy shoelṭana dpalṭee roekhe ṭame, o dbasmee kl mar'a o koerhana.
ENG: And he called unto him his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of disease and all manner of sickness.

ASY: ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ: ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ؛ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ؛
TRL: O ane yna shimane danee tri'sar shleekhe: haw qamaya, shim'oon dke paesh qirya kepa, o andreoos akhoonoehy; o ya'qoow broona dzawday, o yookhanan akhoonoehy;
ENG: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܒܲܪ ܬܘܼܠܡܲܝ؛ ܘܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܘܡܲܬܲܝ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ؛ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܠܦܲܝ؛ ܘܠܲܒܲܝ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܬܲܕܲܝ؛
TRL: O peeleepoos, o bar toelmay; o tooma, o matay makhsa; o ya'qoow broona dkhalpay; o labay dpeesh-leh qirya taday;
ENG: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;

ASY: ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܩܢܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O shim'oon qnanaya, o eehoeda skaryooṭa, haw dsoepe-leh ileh.
ENG: Simon the Cananaean, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

ASY: ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: Lane tri'sar shoedireh eeshoo', o pqeeday-leh o meereh, ”la azeetoon boerkha dimwate, o la 'awreetoon gaw mdeeta dshamraye.
ENG: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and charged them, saying, Go not into any way of the Gentiles, and enter not into any city of the Samaritans:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: ”Eena zemoen boesh zawda lkis 'irbe ṭleeqe dbeyt eesrayel.
ENG: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܡܲܟܪܸܙܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ، ’ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O kad azeetoon, makrizoen o mooroen, ’qoerbinaha malkoeta dshmaya.‘
ENG: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ASY: ”ܒܲܣܡܘܼܢ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ، ܘܕܲܟܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܸܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ، ܘܡܲܩܸܡܘܼܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܲܠܛܘܼܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ. ܚܘܼܪܵܝܝܼ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܚܘܼܪܵܝܝܼ ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ.
TRL: ”Basmoen mree'e, o dakeymoen girwane, o maqimoen meete, o palṭoen shede. Khoerayee shqeel lawkhoon, khoerayee haloen.
ENG: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers, cast out devils: freely ye received, freely give.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܠܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܣܹܐܡܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܢܚܵܫܵܐ ܒܟܝܼܣܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛
TRL: ”La lableetoon 'amawkhoon dahwa, o la sema, o la nkhasha bkeesyatawkhoon;
ENG: Get you no gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses;

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܨܘܼܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܨܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܛܪܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܵܥܠܵܐ ܠܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O la janta qa oerkha, o la tartey ṣoedrate, o la ṣawle, o la khoeṭra, sabab khsheekha-yleh pa'la lmekhoelteh.
ENG: no wallet for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the labourer is worthy of his food.

ASY: ”ܘܓܵܘ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܲܩܪܘܼܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܘܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O gaw aynee mdeeta yan mata d'awreetoon, baqroen manee eet khsheekha gawoeha, o poeshoen tama hal dpalṭeetoon.
ENG: And into whatsoever city or village ye shall enter, search out who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go forth.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܕܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”O eeman d'awreetoon lkhad bayta, dreymoen shlama 'aloehy.
ENG: And as ye enter into the house, salute it.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܫܠܵܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܵܪܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܫܠܵܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In haw bayta khsheekha-yleh, shlamawkhoon share 'aloehy; eena in le-yleh khsheekha, shlamawkhoon daer 'alawkhoon.
ENG: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܢܦܘܿܨܘܼܢ ܠܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Man dla qabil lawkhoon, o la shame' hemizmanawkhoon, npooṣoen l'apra min aqlatawkhoon eeman dpalṭeetoon min haw bayta yan min hay mata.
ENG: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, as ye go forth out of that house or that city, shake off the dust of your feet.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܣܕܘܿܡ ܘܕܥܵܡܘܿܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dlar'a dsdoom o d'amoora bit hawe nyakha byawma ddyanta boesh zawda min lhay mdeeta.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment, than for that city.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܹܐܒܹ̈ܐ؛ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܘܼܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܨܸܦܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܘܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Ha ana shadoerawkhoon eewin aykh 'irbe gaw debe; boet aha hweymoen khakeeme aykh khoeܵwate, o ṣipye aykh yawne.
ENG: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܕܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar min bnaynasha: sabab bit sapee lawkhoon lbeyt deene, o gaw knoeshyatayhy bit janjiree lawkhoon.
ENG: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you;

ASY: ”ܘܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ، ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O boet deeee bit maytee lawkhoon qam shaleeṭe o malke, lsahdoeta ilayhy o limwate.
ENG: yea and before governors and kings shall ye be brought for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ؛ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛
TRL: ”Eena eeman dsapee lawkhoon, la akhleetoon kham dakhee yan moodee bit hamzimeetoon; mindee dhamzimeetoon-leh bhay 'dana, bit paesh yoewa ilawkhoon;
ENG: But when they deliver you up, be not anxious how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that hour what ye shall speak.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ؛ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Sabab le haweytoon akhtoon hamzoeme; ila roekha dbabawkhoon bit hamzim beeawkhoon.
ENG: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father that speaketh in you.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܡܝܸܬܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bit sape lmawta akhoona lakhoonoehy, o baba lbrooneh, o bit qaymee bnoone 'al awahayhy o bit mamyitee-lhoon.
ENG: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father his child: and children shall rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

ASY: ”ܘܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܸܢܝܹܐ ܒܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܡܹܠ ܗܲܠ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: ”O boet shimee bit paysheetoon sinye bkl nasha; eena man dkhamel hal kharta, haw bit pareq.
ENG: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܲܡܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܥܪܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܬܲܡܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܡܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dkamree lawkhoon gaw aha mdeeta, 'rooqoen lhay kheta. Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dle tamimeetoon-lhoon klayhy mdeenate dbeyt eesrayel, mqam date broona dnasha.
ENG: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone through the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.

ASY: ”ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”Talmeeda le-yleh boesh ṭawa min malpaneh, o la rega min mareh.
ENG: A disciple is not above his master, nor a servant above his lord.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܡܵܠܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹܗ، ܘܪܹܓܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܵܪܹܗ. ܐܸܢ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ke malya-leh talmeeda dhawe aykh malpaneh, o rega aykh mareh. In lmara dbayta qre-lhoon b'ilzwoow, kma boesh zawda bit qaree lbnoone dbayta?
ENG: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his household!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܸܣܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ، ܘܛܸܫܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, la zad'eetoon minayhy, sabab layt mindee deeleh kisya dla paesh gilya, o ṭishya dla paesh dee'a.
ENG: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܒܲܗܪܵܐ؛ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܵܬܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܲܟܪܸܙܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐ݇ܓܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: ”Mindee dbemara ywin ilawkhoon bkhishka, mooroen-leh akhtoon bbahra; o mindee dbishma'a ytoon bnatyatawkhoon, makrizoen-leh 'al garawate.
ENG: What I tell you in the darkness, speak ye in the light: and what ye hear in the ear, proclaim upon the housetops.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܓܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ؛ ܙܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܵܨܹܐ ܠܓܵܢܵܐ ܘܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܓܵܘ ܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”La zad'eetoon min anee dqaṭlee lpaghra, eena lgana le maṣee qaṭlee; zdi'moen boesh zawda min haw dmaṣe lgana o lpaghra ṭaliq gaw gehana.
ENG: And be not afraid of them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܨܸܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܙܘܼܒܢܹܐ ܒܚܲܕ ܦܘܼܠܣܵܐ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ
TRL: ”Le yna trey ṣipre zoebne bkhad poelsa? Eena oep khad minayhy le napel 'al ar'a dla da'ta dbabawkhoon
ENG: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and not one of them shall fall on the ground without your Father:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܡܸܙܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܹܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon, oep mizyate dreshawkhoon klayhy minye yna.
ENG: but the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ؛ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܨܸܦܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, la zad'eetoon; akhtoon boesh ṭeemane ytoon min raba ṣipre.
ENG: Fear not therefore; ye are of more value than many sparrows.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܘܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܘܕܹܝܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha, kl man dmawde beeee qam bnaynasha, oep ana bit mawdeyn bee-eh qam babee dbshmaya.
ENG: Every one therefore who shall confess me before men, him will I also confess before my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܢܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena man dsarew-lee qam bnaynasha, oep ana bit sarbeneh qam babee dbshmaya.
ENG: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ.
TRL: ”La khashweetoon te-lee ddareyn shlama lar'a, la te-lee ddareyn shlama, ila saypa.
ENG: Think not that I came to send peace on the earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܲܩܸܡܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ܘܟܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܚܡܵܬܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”Sabab teea ywin dmaqimin nasha dalqoewl dbaboehy, o brata dalqoewl dyimoeha, o kalta dalqoewl dkhmatoeha.
ENG: For I came to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law:

ASY: ”ܘܕܸܫܡܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O dishmine dnasha bit hawee bnoone dbayteh.
ENG: and a man’s foes shall be they of his own household.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܚ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܚ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Man dmakhib baba yan yima boesh zawda min dmakhib ilee, le khashekh ilee. O man dmakhib broona yan brata boesh zawda min dmakhib ilee, le khashekh ilee.
ENG: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܚ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”O kl dla shaqel zqeepeh o ate baree, le khashekh ilee.
ENG: And he that doth not take his cross and follow after me, is not worthy of me.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇؛ ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Man dmachikh ganeh, bit ṭaliq-laha; o man dṭaliq lganeh boet deeee, bit machikh-laha.
ENG: He that findeth his life shall lose it; and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ؛ ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܸܠ، ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Man dqabil lawkhoon, ilee qaboele-yleh; o man dilee qabil, lman dshoedrineh qaboele-yleh.
ENG: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ؛ ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ.
TRL: ”O man dqabil lnweea sabab nweea-yleh, poer'ana dnweea bit shaqel; o man dqabil zadeeqa sabab zadeeqa-yleh, poer'ana dzadeeqa bit shaqel.
ENG: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܫܬܹܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܩܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܹܩ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”O kl man dmashte lkhad min ane z'oore kasa dmeea qareere akhchee, sabab talmeeda-yleh, troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon dle ṭaleq poer'aneh.“
ENG: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dpreeq-leh eeshoo' min maloepe ltalmeedoehy, shoene-leh min hay doeka deewa, o zeel-leh lmaloepe o makroeze gaw mdeenate.
ENG: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and preach in their cities.

ASY: ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: O shmee' leh yookhanan gaw beyt aseere boet poelkhane deeshoo', shoedireh lkis-leh talmeedoehy,
ENG: Now when John heard in the prison the works of the Christ, he sent by his disciples,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ، ܝܲܢ ܣܵܦܪܲܚ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: Bemara, ”at eewit haw date, yan saprakh lkhad khena?“
ENG: and said unto him, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ:
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen o mooroen lyookhanan mindeeane dbishma'a ytoon o bikhzaya:
ENG: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Go your way and tell John the things which ye do hear and see:

ASY: ”ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܓܸܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܹܐ، ܘܚܲܪ̈ܫܹܐ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܹܐ، ܘܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܹܐ.
TRL: ”Simye bikhzaya yna, o shpeele bikhdara yna, o girwane pyasha yna doekhye, o kharshe bishma'a yna, o meete pyasha yna moeqime, o miskene pyasha yna moekrize.
ENG: the blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised up, and the poor have good tidings preached to them.

ASY: ”ܘܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܩܸܠ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.“
TRL: ”O ṭoewa lhaw dla tarqil boet deeee.“
ENG: And blessed is he, whosoever shall find none occasion of stumbling in me.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܙܹܠܵܐ ܫܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ؟
TRL: Kad anee zeel-lhoon, shoere-leh eeshoo' lemara lkinshe boet yookhanan, ”moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon likhzaya gaw bareea, zela sh'eesha byad pawkha?
ENG: And as these went their way, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken with the wind?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܲܟܝܼܟܹܐ؟ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܲܟܝܼܟܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Yan moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon likhzaya, nasha lweesha joele rakeeke? Anee dke lawshee joele rakeeke gaw bate dmalke yna.
ENG: But what went ye out for to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft raiment are in kings’ houses.

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ؟ ܗܹܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: ”Moodee pleeṭ lawkhoon likhzaya, nweea? He, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, boesh zawda min nweea.
ENG: But wherefore went ye out? to see a prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ: ܗܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܝܼܙܓܲܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܕܗܲܕܸܪ ܐܘܼܪܚܘܼܟ݂ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Aha-yleh haw dpeesha-yleh kteewa boet dee-eh: ha shadoere ywin eezgadee min qam deeoekh, dhadir oerkhoekh qamoekh.
ENG: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Who shall prepare thy way before thee.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le-yleh qeema gaw bnaynasha boesh goera min yookhanan ma'mdana. Eena haw boesh z'oora gaw malkoeta dshmaya boesh goera-yleh mineh.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not arisen a greater than John the Baptist: yet he that is but little in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠܬܵܐ، ܘܠܲܒܠܵܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܓ̰ܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܢܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Ha min yawmane dyookhanan ma'mdana o hal adeea malkoeta dshmaya bkhayla ke paysha loebilta, o lablanoeha jnawa ke janwee-laha.
ENG: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and men of violence take it by force.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Sabab klayhy nwee-e o namoosa hal yookhanan noebe-lhoon.
ENG: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in hdeere ytoon dqableetoon-leh, aha-yleh eleea dhdeera-yleh letaya.
ENG: And if ye are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, which is to come.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ.
TRL: ”Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a shame'.
ENG: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ASY: ”ܠܡ̇ܢ ܡܲܕܡܸܢܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ؟ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܠܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܕܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: ”Lman madminaha aha sharbta? Ke damya lyale dyatwee bshoeqe o maqwikhee lkhawrawatayhy,
ENG: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the marketplaces, which call unto their fellows,

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܡܚܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܙܘܼܪܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܪܩܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܝ݇ܠܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”O amree, ’mkhe lan zoerna ilawkhoon o la rqeed lawkhoon, le lan o la 'weed lawkhoon ta'zee.‘
ENG: and say, We piped unto you, and ye did not dance; we wailed, and ye did not mourn.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab te-leh yookhanan la bekhala o la bishtaya, o amree, ’sheda eet bee-eh.‘
ENG: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܫܵܬܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܬܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܒܥܒ݂ܵܕܘܼ̈ܗ̇.“
TRL: ”te-leh broona dnasha bekhala o bishtaya, o amree, ’aha nasha akhlana-yleh o shatyana dkhamra, o khawra dmakhse o dkhaṭaye.‘ eena peesh-laha moekshiṭta khikhmta b'wadoeha.“
ENG: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold, a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners! And wisdom is justified by her works.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܠܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܬܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Haygah shoere-leh eeshoo' bilyama lmdeenate d'weed-leh gawayhy khayle goere sabab la toewib-lhoon, o meereh,
ENG: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܟܘܼܪܙܝܼܢ، ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܒܨܘܿܪ ܘܒܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܒܣܲܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܩܸܛܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: ”Way ilakhy koerzeen, way ilakhy beyt ṣayada. In bṣoor o bṣaydoon payshee waw 'weede khayle goere dpeesh-lhoon 'weede gawawkhoon, min jalde bsaqe o bqiṭma bit tawibee waw.
ENG: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܨܘܿܪ ܘܠܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dlṣoor o lṣaydoon bit hawe nyakha byawma ddyanta boesh zawda min dilawkhoon.
ENG: Howbeit I say unto you, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment, than for you.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬܝ ܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܠܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܸܡܬܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܲܬܝ ܓܵܢܵܟ݂ܝ؟ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܬܝ ܡܘܼܟܸܦܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܫܝܘܿܠ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܓܵܘܵܟ݂ܝ، ܐܸܢ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܣܕܘܿܡ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O aty kparnakhoom, la hal shmaya moerimtoeha ywaty ganakhy? Bit payshaty moekipta hal shyool. Sabab khayle goere dpeesh-lhoon 'weede gawakhy, in payshee waw 'weede gaw sdoom, bit paysha wa hal idyoom yawma.
ENG: And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted unto heaven? thou shalt go down unto Hades: for if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in thee, it would have remained until this day.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ: ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܣܕܘܿܡ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilakhy: lar'a dsdoom bit hawe nyakha byawma ddyanta boesh zawda min dilakhy.“
ENG: Howbeit I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܕܛܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܸܠܝܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”shaboekhe ywin iloekh ya baba, mara dshmaya o dar'a, dṭoeshe-loekh ane min khakeeme o yad'ane, o gilyay-loekh lyale z'oore.
ENG: At that season Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou didst hide these things from the wise and understanding, and didst reveal them unto babes:

ASY: ”ܗܹܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”He baba, sabab hadkha bseem-laha-loekh.
ENG: yea, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in thy sight.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܒܵܒܝܼ. ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kl mindee peesh-leh soepya ilee byad babee. Oep khad le yade' lbroona ila baba, o oep khad le yade' lbaba ila broona, o lman dbasma le broona dgale-leh.
ENG: All things have been delivered unto me of my Father: and no one knoweth the Son, save the Father; neither doth any know the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son willeth to reveal him.

ASY: ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܟ̰ܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܥܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܵܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܢܝܸܚܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Teymoen lkis-lee klawkhoon kcheekhe o ṭ'eene karate o ana bit manyikhinawkhoon.
ENG: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

ASY: ”ܛܥܘܿܢܘܼܢ ܢܝܼܪܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܝ݇ܠܘܿܦܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܟܘܼܦܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܠܓܵܢܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ṭ'oonoen neeree 'alawkhoon o loopoen minee, sabab makeekha ywin o koepa blibee, o bit machkheetoon nyakha lganatawkhoon.
ENG: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܝܼܪܝܼ ܒܲܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܟܵܪܬܝܼ ܩܲܠܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Sabab neeree baseema-yleh, o kartee qaloelta-ylaha.“
ENG: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ؛ ܘܟܦܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܫܠܵܓܵܐ ܫܸܒܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaw zawna, bikhdara ywa eeshoo' byawma dshabta gaw khaqlane; o kpeenhoon talmeedoehy, o shoere-lhoon bishlaga shible o bekhala.
ENG: At that season Jesus went on the sabbath day through the cornfields; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck ears of corn, and to eat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dpreeshe khizyay-lhoon, meerhoon leeshoo', ”ha talmeedoekh bi'wada yna mindee dle-yleh qanoonaya li'wada byawma dshabta.“
ENG: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which it is not lawful to do upon the sabbath.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܟܦܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”la qre lawkhoon moodee 'weed-leh daweed eeman dhaw o anee deewaw 'ameh kpeenhoon,
ENG: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܟܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܹܗ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: ”Dakhee 'weereh lbayta dalaha, o lakhma dpatoora dmarya kheel-leh, kad le ywa qanoonayta ileh lekhaleh, o oep la lanee deewaw 'ameh, shwooq min lkahne bnawshayhy?
ENG: how be entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which it was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them that were with him, but only for the priests?

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܕܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܪܝܼ ܠܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܘܡܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: ”Yan la qre lawkhoon gaw namoosa, dbyawma dshabta kahne dhaykla ke sharee lshabta, o layt lawma 'alayhy?
ENG: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath day the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are guiltless?

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon deet lakha khad boesh goera min haykla.
ENG: But I say unto you, that one greater than the temple is here.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ’ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ،‘ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܠܵܘܡܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in haweytoon waw beeda'a moodee-yleh, ’rakhme bib'aya ywin o la diwkha,‘ le dayneetoon wa lanee dla lawma yna.
ENG: But if ye had known what this meaneth, I desire mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Sabab broona dnasha mara dshabta-yleh.“
ENG: For the Son of man is lord of the sabbath.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O shoene-leh eeshoo' min tama, o te-leh lknoeshtayhy.
ENG: And he departed thence, and went into their synagogue:

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܒܪܝܼܙܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ؟“ ܕܩܵܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O eet wa tama khad nasha deedeh breezta ywa. O boeqirhoon mineh o meerhoon, ”qanoonayta-ylaha lbasoeme byawma dshabta?“ dqawlee waw 'aloehy.
ENG: and behold, a man having a withered hand. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day? that they might accuse him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܥܸܪܒܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܓܵܘ ܗܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܕܵܒܹܩ ܘܦܲܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”aynee minawkhoon deet-leh khad 'irba, o in napel gaw hawta byawma dshabta, le dabeq o paliṭ-leh?
ENG: And he said unto them, What man shall there be of you, that shall have one sheep, and if this fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?

ASY: ”ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܪܒܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Kma boesh zawda ṭeemana-yleh barnasha min 'irba. Hadkha qanoonayta-ylaha li'wada ṭawta byawma dshabta.“
ENG: How much then is a man of more value than a sheep! Wherefore it is lawful to do good on the sabbath day.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ، ܘܬܪܝܼܨ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah meereh lhaw nasha, ”pashiṭ eedoekh.“ o poeshṭa-leh eedeh, o treeṣ-laha aykh hay kheta.
ENG: Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth; and it was restored whole, as the other.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܛܲܠܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-lhoon preeshe o soezgirhoon dṭalqee waw-leh.
ENG: But the Pharisees went out, and took counsel against him, how they might destroy him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh baha o shoene-leh min tama, o zeel-lhoon bareh kinshe raba, o boesim-leh lklayhy.
ENG: And Jesus perceiving it withdrew from thence: and many followed him; and he healed them all,

ASY: ܘܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܓܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: O pqeeday-leh dla galee waw boet dee-eh,
ENG: and charged them that they should not make him known:

ASY: ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: Dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesha ywa meera byad esha'ya nweea dmeereh:
ENG: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܹܓܝܼ ܕܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܡܘܼܚܸܒܝܼ ܕܦܨܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܢܝܼ. ܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܪܸܙ.
TRL: Aha-yleh regee dgoebe-lee, moekhibee dpṣeekh-laha bee-eh ganee. Roekhee bit matbin 'aloehy, o dyanta limwate bit makriz.
ENG: Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; My beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit upon him, And he shall declare judgment to the Gentiles.

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܡܲܩܪܸܨ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܩܵܠܹܗ ܒܥܵܠܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Le maqriṣ o le maqwikh, o nasha le shame' qaleh b'aloole.
ENG: He shall not strive, nor cry aloud; Neither shall any one hear his voice in the streets.

ASY: ܙܹܠܵܐ ܒܠܝܼܣܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܛ، ܘܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܕܛܲܦܛܸܦܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܟ̰ܡܸܥ، ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܠܓ݂ܵܠܸܒܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Zela bleesa le shameṭ, o shraya dṭapṭipa le machmi', hal dmamṭe-laha dyanta lghaliboeta.
ENG: A bruised reed shall he not break, And smoking flax shall he not quench, Till he send forth judgment unto victory.

ASY: ܘܒܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܒܪܝܼ.
TRL: O bshimeh imwate bit sabree.
ENG: And in his name shall the Gentiles hope.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܲܕ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܫܵܐ، ܘܩܲܡ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܫܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah moete-lhoon lkis eeshoo' khad deet wa bee-eh sheda, deewa simya o kharsha, o qam basim-leh, hadkha dsimya o kharsha hoemzim-leh o khze-leh.
ENG: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the dumb man spake and saw.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܒܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ؟“
TRL: O peesh-lhoon 'oejbe klayhy kinshe o meerhoon, ”le-yleh aha broona ddaweed?“
ENG: And all the multitudes were amazed, and said, Is this the son of David?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeman dshmee' lhoon preeshe, meerhoon, ”aha le-yleh paloeṭe shede ila bb'ilzwoow goera dshede.“
ENG: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.

ASY: ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ.
TRL: dee' leh eeshoo' khoeshabayhy, o meereh ilayhy, ”kl malkoeta plee'ta 'al ganoeha bit kharwa, o kl mdeeta yan bayta plee'a 'al ganeh le kale.
ENG: And knowing their thoughts he said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ، ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ؟
TRL: ”O in saṭana lsaṭana paliṭ, 'al ganeh pyasha-yleh plee'a. Dakhee hadkha bit kalya malkoeteh?
ENG: and if Satan casteth out Satan, he is divided against himself; how then shall his kingdom stand?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ؟ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܲܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O in ana bb'ilzwoow paloeṭe ywin shede, bnoonawkhoon bmanee ke palṭee-lhoon? Boet aha, anee bit hawee ilawkhoon dayane.
ENG: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܒܲܣ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in boerkha droekha dalaha ana paloeṭe ywin shede, bas qoerbinaha 'alawkhoon malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out devils, then is the kingdom of God come upon you.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܘܣܵܠܹܒ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܵܣܹܪ ܠܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܣܵܠܹܒ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Yan dakhee maṣe nasha 'aber lbayta dkhaylana o saleb lmindee-eh, in la qamayta aser lkhaylana, o haygah saleb lbayteh?
ENG: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܟܲܦܸܫ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܒܲܪܒܸܙ.
TRL: ”Man dle-yleh 'amee, ldalqoewlee-yleh, o man dla kapish 'amee, bit barbiz.
ENG: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܟܠ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dkl khṭeeta o goedapa bit payshee poekhle lbnaynasha, eena goedapa 'al roekha le paesh poekhla lbnaynasha.
ENG: Therefore I say unto you, Every sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men; but the blasphemy against the Spirit shall not be forgiven.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܥܲܠ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܦܘܼܚܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܕܥܲܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܦܘܼܚܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: ”O kl man damer hemizman 'al broona dnasha, bit paysha poekhilta ileh, eena kl d'al roekha dqoedsha amer, le paysha poekhilta ileh, la baha zawna, o la bzawna date.
ENG: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but whosoever shall speak against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, nor in that which is to come.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ، ܘܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ. ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eelana ṭawa ṭ'oenyate ṭabe ke 'abed, o eelana beesha ṭ'oenyate beeshe ke 'abed. Min ṭ'oenyateh ke paesh dee'a eelana.
ENG: Either make the tree good, and its fruit good; or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by its fruit.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܕܐܵܟܸܕܢܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ya zar'e dakidne, dakhee maṣeytoon hamzimeetoon ṭawate kad akhtoon beeshe ytoon? Sabab min zawdoenyoeta dliba ke hamzim poema.
ENG: Ye offspring of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ؛ ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”nasha ṭawa min seemate ṭabe ke paliṭ ṭawate; o nasha beesha min seemate beeshe ke paliṭ beeshate.
ENG: The good man out of his good treasure bringeth forth good things: and the evil man out of his evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܟܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dkl hemizman baṭeelta damree-laha bnaynasha, bit yawee joewab 'aloeha byawma ddyanta.
ENG: And I say unto you, that every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab min hemizmanoekh bit payshet moekshiṭa, o min hemizmanoekh bit payshet deena.“
ENG: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܚܵܙܲܚ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah joewib-lhoon khakma min sapre o min preeshe o meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, ba'akh dkhazakh minoekh khad neeshanqa.“
ENG: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered him, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”sharbta beeshta o gayarta neeshanqa biṭlaba-ylaha, o neeshanqa le paesh yoewa iloeha shwooq min neeshanqa dyawnan nweea.
ENG: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet:

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dhwe-leh yawnan gaw kesa dnoena tlata yawmane o tlata laylawate, hadkha bit hawe broona dnasha gaw liba dar'a tlata yawmane o tlata laylawate.
ENG: for as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܝܼܢܘܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܵܪܘܿܙܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܢ؛ ܘܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”nashe dneenwe bit qaymee byawma ddyanta 'am aha sharbta o bit daynee-laha, sabab anee toewib-lhoon bkaroozoeta dyawnan; o ha khad boesh goera min yawnan eet lakha.
ENG: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.

ASY: ”ܡܲܠܟܬܵܐ ܕܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܙܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܥܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܕܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ، ܘܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Malkta dtaymna bit qayma byawma ddyanta 'am aha sharbta o bit dayna-laha, sabab te-laha min marzane dar'a dsham'a khikhmta dshleymoon, o ha khad boesh goera min shleymoon eet lakha.
ENG: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܪܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܛܵܠܒܵܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman droekha ṭame palṭa min barnasha, ke khadra bdoekane dlayt gawayhy meea, o ke ṭalba nyakha o le machkha.
ENG: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passeth through waterless places, seeking rest, and findeth it not.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ، ’ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܵܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ.‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܦܝܼܩܵܐ ܘܟܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܩܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah ke amra, ’bit dayran lbaytee min ayka dpleeṭ-lee.‘ o ke atya o machkha-leh speeqa o kneesha o soeqla.
ENG: Then he saith, I will return into my house whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܵܠ݇ܐ ܘܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܫܒܲܥ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܥܵܡܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܹܗ، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܣܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Haygah ke aza o labla 'amoeha shba' roekhe boesh beeshe minoeha, o ke 'awree o 'amree gaweh, o ke hawya kharta dhaw nasha boesh sreeta min qamayta. Hadkha bit hawe-laha sharbta beeshta.“
ENG: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man becometh worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this evil generation.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Kad eeshoo' hamzoeme ywa lkinshe, te-lhoon yimeh o akhoonwateh o kle-lhoon qam tar'a, o ba'ee waw dhamzimee waw 'ameh.
ENG: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brethren stood without, seeking to speak to him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܒܵܥܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh ileh khad nasha, ”ha yimoekh o akhoonwatoekh kilye yna qam tar'a, o ba'ee dhamzimee 'amoekh.“
ENG: And one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, seeking to speak to thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܸܡܝܼ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh lhaw dtoene-leh ileh, ”manee-ylaha yimee, o manee yna akhoonwatee?“
ENG: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?

ASY: ܘܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܝܸܡܝܼ، ܘܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈.
TRL: O poeshṭa-leh eedeh lkis talmeedoehy o meereh, ”ha yimee, o ha akhoonwatee.
ENG: And he stretched forth his hand towards his disciples, and said, Behold, my mother and my brethren!

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ ܘܚܵܬܝܼ ܘܝܸܡܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Sabab kl nasha d'abed ṣiwyana dbabee dbshmaya, haw eeleh akhoonee o khatee o yimee.“
ENG: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaw yawma, pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min bayta, o teew-leh 'al marza dyama.
ENG: On that day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O kinshe raba te-lhoon lkis-leh, hada dseeq-leh o teew-leh gaw gamee, o klayhy kinshe kilye ywaw lmarza dyama.
ENG: And there were gathered unto him great multitudes, so that he entered into a boat, and sat; and all the multitude stood on the beach.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܠܦܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܠܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ.
TRL: O moelpay-leh raba bmatle, o meereh, ”pleeṭ-leh khad zar'ana lizra'a.
ENG: And he spake to them many things in parables, saying, Behold, the sower went forth to sow;

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܒܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܩܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kad bizra'a ywa barzar'a, eet wa dnpeel-leh 'al marza doerkha, o te-lhoon ṭayre o lqeeṭ-lhoon ileh.
ENG: and as he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the birds came and devoured them:

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܒܥܲܦܪܵܐ،
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh 'al ar'a kepanta, ayka dlayt wa 'apra raba, o bjaldoeta moejyineh sabab layt wa 'oemqa b'apra,
ENG: and others fell upon the rocky places, where they had not much earth: and straightway they sprang up, because they had no deepness of earth:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܙܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܝ݇ܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ، ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ، ܒܪܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eeman dzreeq-leh shimsha, qeed-leh, o sabab layt wa-leh 'iqra, breez-leh.
ENG: and when the sun was risen, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O khena npeel-leh gaw kitwe, o goerwis-lhoon kitwe o khneeq-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And others fell upon the thorns; and the thorns grew up, and choked them:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܐܸܫܬܝܼ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܬܠܵܬܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena khena npeel-leh 'al ar'a shameenta, o yoebil-leh ṭ'oenyate, eet wa bima, o eet wa bishtee, o eet wa btlatee.
ENG: and others fell upon the good ground, and yielded fruit, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a shame'.“
ENG: He that hath ears, let him hear.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ؟“
TRL: O te-lhoon talmeedoehy lkis-leh o boeqirhoon mineh, ”qamoodee bmatle hamzoeme ywit 'amayhy?“
ENG: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܪ̈ܵܙܹܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”ilawkhoon peesha-yleh yoewa dyad'eetoon raze dmalkoeta dshmaya, eena lanee le-yleh peesha yoewa.
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ؛ ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab man deet-leh bit paesh yoewa o moezyida ileh; o man dlayt-leh, oep haw deet-leh bit paesh shqeela mineh.
ENG: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ، ܘܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܝܼ،
TRL: ”Boet aha hamzoeme ywin 'amayhy bmatle, sabab khzaya le khazee, o shma'a le sham'ee, o le parmee,
ENG: Therefore speak I to them in parables; because seeing they see not, and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Peesh-laha toemimta boet dee-ayhy hemizman desha'ya nweea dmeereh: shma'a bit sham'eetoon o le parmeytoon, o khzaya bit khazeytoon o le yad'eetoon.
ENG: And unto them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall in no wise understand; And seeing ye shall see, and shall in no wise perceive:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܠܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܢܵܬܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܼܩܪܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܘܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܒܢܵܬܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܦܲܪܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܘܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܘܒܲܣܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab khleem-leh liba daha 'ama, o natyatayhy yoeqrinhoon lishma'a, o 'aynayhy cheem-lhoon, dla khazee b'aynayhy o sham'ee bnatyatayhy, o parmee blibayhy, o dayree o basminhoon.
ENG: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes they have closed; Lest haply they should perceive with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And should turn again, And I should heal them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܲܝܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ، ܘܠܢܵܬܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon ṭoewa l'aynawkhoon dke khazee, o lnatyatawkhoon dke sham'ee.
ENG: But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܗܘܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, raba nwee-e o zadeeqe shoehwit-lhoon likhzaya mindee dakhtoon bikhzaya ytoon o la khze-lhoon, o mindee dakhtoon bishma'a ytoon o la shmee' lhoon.
ENG: For verily I say unto you, that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which ye see, and saw them not; and to hear the things which ye hear, and heard them not.

ASY: ”ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܕܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shmi'moen adeea matla dzar'ana.
ENG: Hear then ye the parable of the sower.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܓ̰ܵܢܹܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܪܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl man dshame' hemizman dmalkoeta o la parme-laha, ke ate beesha o janew-laha hemizman dpeesh-laha zree'ta blibeh. Aha-yleh haw barzar'a dnpeel-leh 'al marza doerkha.
ENG: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth it not, then cometh the evil one, and snatcheth away that which hath been sown in his heart. This is he that was sown by the way side.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܢܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”O haw dnpeel-leh 'al ar'a kepanta, haw eeleh dke shame' hemizman, o bjaldoeta o bkhadoeta ke qabil-laha.
ENG: And he that was sown upon the rocky places, this is he that heareth the word, and straightway with joy receiveth it;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܩܪܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܒܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena sabab layt-leh 'iqra, ila qa khad zawna kirya-yleh, o eeman dke hawe oelṣana yan rdoepya boet hemizman dalaha, ke napel btoerqala.
ENG: yet hath he not root in himself, but endureth for a while; and when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, straightway he stumbleth.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸܢܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܘܡܲܚܠܸܛܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܸܠܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܢܩܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O haw dpeesh-leh zree'a gaw kitwe, haw eeleh dshame' hemizman, eena rinya daha zawna o makhliṭanoeta ddawilta ke khanqee-laha, o ke hawya dla ṭ'oenta.
ENG: And he that was sown among the thorns, this is he that heareth the word; and the care of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܡܝܼܢܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܦܲܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܒܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܒܐܸܫܬܝܼ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܒܬܠܵܬܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Eena haw dpeesh-leh zree'a 'al ar'a shameenta, haw eeleh dshame' hemizman o parme-laha, o ke yawa ṭ'oenyate, eet bima, eet bishtee o eet btlatee.“
ENG: And he that was sown upon the good ground, this is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it; who verily beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

ASY: ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܚܲܩܠܹܗ.
TRL: Matla khena meereh ilayhy, ”ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lnasha dzree' leh barzar'a ṭawa bkhaqleh.
ENG: Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man that sowed good seed in his field:

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O eeman ddmeekh-lhoon klayhy nashe, te-leh dishmineh o zree' leh zeewane gaw khiṭe o zeel-leh.
ENG: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares also among the wheat, and went away.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܝܸܢܹܗ ܝܸܩܢܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dmoejyineh yiqna, 'weed-leh ṭ'oenyate, haygah peesh-lhoon khizye oep zeewane.
ENG: But when the blade sprang up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܚܲܩܠܘܼܟ݂، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ؟‘
TRL: ”te-lhoon regawate dmara dbayta o meerhoon ileh, ’Maran, le ywa barzar'a ṭawa zree' loekh bkhaqloekh, dakhee qeem-lhoon zeewane gaweh?‘
ENG: And the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst thou not sow good seed in thy field? whence then hath it tares?

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܸܫܡܸܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ.‘ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ’ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܘܓܲܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ؟‘
TRL: ”O haw joewib-leh, ’nasha dishmin 'weed-leh aha shoela.‘ o meerhoon ileh regawateh, ’ba'eyt dazakh o gabakh-lhoon?‘
ENG: And he said unto them, An enemy hath done this. And the servants say unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܠܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܓܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܥܵܩܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O haw joewib-leh, ’la, dla hawya kad gabeytoon zeewane, 'aqreetoon 'amayhy oep khiṭe.
ENG: But he saith, Nay; lest haply while ye gather up the tares, ye root up the wheat with them.

ASY: ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܓܲܪܘܸܣܝܼ ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܨܕܵܐ، ܘܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܨܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܠܚܲܨܵܕܹ̈ܐ، ’ܓܲܒܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܪ̈ܙܹܐ ܠܡܲܩܘܼܕܹܐ، ܘܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܢܒܵܪܹ̈ܐ.‘“
TRL: ”Shwooqoen-lhoon dgarwisee tirwayhy m'oedale hal 'dana dkhiṣda, o b'dana dkhiṣda bit amren lkhaṣade, ’gabeymoen qamayta zeewane, o sooroen-lhoon darze lmaqoede, o khiṭe jami'moen-lhoon lanbare.‘“
ENG: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of the harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather up first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.

ASY: ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܪܕܲܠ، ܕܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܚܲܩܠܹܗ.
TRL: Matla khena meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ke damya malkoeta dshmaya ldandikta dkhardal, dzree'a-leh khad nasha bkhaqleh.
ENG: Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܥܘܿܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܲܪܙܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܓܲܪܘܸܣܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܲܪ̈ܩܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܫܵܪܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Hay boesh z'oorta-ylaha min klayhy barzar'e, eena eeman dgarwisa, ke hawya boesh goerta min klayhy yarqe, ke hawya eelana, hada datee ṭayre dshmaya o sharee gaw pa'wanoeha.“
ENG: which indeed is less than all seeds; but when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the heaven come and lodge in the branches thereof.

ASY: ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܟܝܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܲܡܚܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܚܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Matla khena meereh ilayhy, ”ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lkhmeera dshqeel-laha bakhta o moetiw-laha gaw tlata kyoele dqamkha hal dkleh khmee' leh.“
ENG: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till it was all leavened.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Klayhy ane hoemzimay-leh eeshoo' bmatle qa kinshe, o dla matle la hoemzim-leh 'amayhy,
ENG: All these things spake Jesus in parables unto the multitudes; and without a parable spake he nothing unto them:

ASY: ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ: ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܥܸܢ ܫܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܛܸܫܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Dpaesh toemima mindee dpeesh-leh meera byad nweea: bit hamzimin bmatle, o bit mad'in shoele ṭishye ha min shoeraya dbreeta.
ENG: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܦܲܫܸܩ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܕܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܚܲܩܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah shweeq-leh eeshoo' lkinshe o te-leh lbayta. te-lhoon talmeedoehy lkis-leh o meerhoon ileh, ”pashiq ilan matla dzeewane o dkhaqla.“
ENG: Then he left the multitudes, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Explain unto us the parable of the tares of the field.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy, ”haw dzree' leh barzar'a ṭawa broona dnasha-yleh.
ENG: And he answered and said, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

ASY: ”ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khaqla doenye-ylaha, o barzar'a ṭawa bnoone dmalkoeta yna, o zeewane bnoone dbeesha yna.
ENG: and the field is the world; and the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom; and the tares are the sons of the evil one;

ASY: ”ܘܕܸܫܡܸܢ ܕܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؛ ܚܸܨܕܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܚܲܨܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O dishmin dzree' leh zeewane, akelqarṣa-yleh; khiṣda shoelama dzawna-yleh, o khaṣade malake yna.
ENG: and the enemy that sowed them is the devil: and the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are angels.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓܘܼܒܝܹܐ ܙܝܼܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܩܕܹܐ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aykh dpayshee goebye zeewane o moeqde bnoera, hadkha bit hawe bshoelama daha zawna.
ENG: As therefore the tares are gathered up and burned with fire; so shall it be in the end of the world.

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܒܸܬ ܓܲܒܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Broona dnasha bit shadir malakhoehy, o bit gabee min malkoeteh klayhy dalqoewlaye o 'awdane d'awla.
ENG: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and them that do iniquity,

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܬܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O bit daree-lhoon gaw atoona dnoera, ayka deeleh bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke.
ENG: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܗܪܸܢܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܲܝܗܝ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.
TRL: ”Haygah zadeeqe bit bahrinee aykh shimsha gaw malkoeta dbabayhy. Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.
ENG: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He that hath ears, let him hear.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܛܘܼܫܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܛܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܹܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܒܸܢܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Mindrish ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lseemta ṭoesheeta bkhaqla, eeman dkhizya-leh khad nasha, ṭoeshya-leh, o min khadoeteh zeel-leh zoebineh kl mindee deet wa-leh o zweena-leh hay khaqla.
ENG: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a treasure hidden in the field; which a man found, and hid; and in his joy he goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܬܲܓܵܪܵܐ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܡܲܪ̈ܓܵܢܝܵܬܹܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Mindrish ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lnasha tagara biṭ'aya lmarganyate shapeere.
ENG: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is a merchant seeking goodly pearls:

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܲܪܓܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܙܘܼܒܸܢܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O eeman dkhze-leh khda marganeeta raba ṭeemanta, zeel-leh o zoebineh kl mindee deet wa-leh o zweena-leh.
ENG: and having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܓܲܪܕܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܕܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܓܸܢܣܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Mindrish ke damya malkoeta dshmaya lgarda dirya byama, djoemi' leh min kl ginsa dnoene.
ENG: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܓܘܼܒܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܪܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O kad mle-leh, greesh-lhoon lmarza dyama, teew-lhoon o goebyay-lhoon, anee ṣpayee diryay-lhoon gaw mane, o khirba roepyay-lhoon.
