ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܚܸܩܪܹܗ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܥܲܠ ܬܪܘܿܢܘܿܣ ܕܚܸܩܪܹܗ،
TRL: ”Eeman date broona dnasha bkhiqreh, o klayhy malakhoehy 'ameh, haygah bit yatew 'al troonoos dkhiqreh,
ENG: But when the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then shall he sit on the throne of his glory:

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܡܥܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܕܦܵܪܹܫ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O bit payshee joem'e qamoehy klayhy imwate, o bit paresh-lhoon nashe khad min haw khena, aykh ra'ya dparesh 'irbe min 'ize.
ENG: and before him shall be gathered all the nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as the shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats:

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܠܹܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ، ܘܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bit makle 'irbe min yameeneh, o 'ize min simaleh.
ENG: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ، ’ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ، ܩܲܒܠܘܼܢ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”Haygah bit amer malka lanee dmin yameeneh, ’teymoen breeke dbabee, qabloen yartoeta lmalkoeta deewa hoedirta ilawkhoon min shoeraya dbreeta,
ENG: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܦܝܼܢܝܼ ܘܡܘܼܐܟܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܨܗܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܡܘܼܫܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܘܡܘܼܫܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”’sabab kpeenee o moekil lawkhoon ilee, ṣhe-lee o moeshte lawkhoon ilee, noekhraya hwe-lee, o moeshre lawkhoon ilee,
ENG: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in;

ASY: ”’ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”’shoelkhaya hwe-lee o moelbish lawkhoon ilee, mree'a hwe-lee o tpeeq lawkhoon beeee, gaw beyt aseere hwe-lee o te lawkhoon lkis-lee.‘
ENG: naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܟܦܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܬܘܼܪܣܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܝܲܢ ܨܹܗܝܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟
TRL: ”Haygah bit jawibee anee zadeeqe o amree ileh, ’Maran, eeman dkhze lan iloekh kpeena o toerse lan iloekh, yan ṣehya o moeshte lan iloekh?
ENG: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed thee? or athirst, and gave thee drink?

ASY: ”’ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟ ܝܲܢ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟
TRL: ”’weeman khze lan iloekh noekhraya o moeshre lan iloekh? Yan shoelkhaya o moelbish lan iloekh?
ENG: And when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?

ASY: ”’ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟‘
TRL: ”’weeman khze lan iloekh mree'a yan gaw beyt aseere o te lan lkis-loekh?‘
ENG: And when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Bit jawib malka o amer ilayhy, ’troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, sabab 'weed lawkhoon ane lkhad min akhoonwatee z'oore, aykh din ilee 'weed lawkhoon.‘
ENG: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it unto one of these my brethren, even these least, ye did it unto me.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܹܗ، ’ܪܚܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܝܵܐ ܠܝܼ̈ܛܹܐ ܠܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܘܦܲܠܵܚܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit amer oep lanee dmin simaleh, ’rkhooqoen minee ya leeṭe lnoera dl'alam, deeleh hoedra qa akelqarṣa o palakhoehy.
ENG: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels:

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܦܝܼܢܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܟܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܨܗܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”’sabab kpeenee o la moekil lawkhoon ilee, o ṣhe-lee o la moeshte lawkhoon ilee.
ENG: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

ASY: ”ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܪܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܵܐ ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Noekhraya hwe-lee o la moeshre lawkhoon ilee, shoelkhaya hwe-lee o la moelbish lawkhoon ilee, mree'a hwe-lee o gaw beyt aseere hwe-lee, o la tpeeq lawkhoon beeee.‘
ENG: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; naked, and ye clothed me not; sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܟܦܝܼܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܨܹܗܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟‘
TRL: ”Haygah oep anee bit jawibee ileh o amree, ’Maran, eeman khze lan iloekh kpeena, yan ṣehya, yan noekhraya, yan shoelkhaya, yan mree'a, yan gaw beyt aseere o la 'weed lan khilmat iloekh?‘
ENG: Then shall they also answer, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”O haw bit jawib o amer ilayhy, ’troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, sabab la 'weed lawkhoon ane lkhad min ane z'oore, ilee la 'weed lawkhoon.‘
ENG: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not unto one of these least, ye did it not unto me.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Ane bit azee ljoenjara dl'alam, o zadeeqe lkhaye dl'alam.“
ENG: And these shall go away into eternal punishment: but the righteous into eternal life.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ:
TRL: Kad toemim-leh eeshoo' klayhy hemizmanoehy, meereh ltalmeedoehy:
ENG: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these words, he said unto his disciples,

ASY: ”ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Beeda'a ytoon dmin bar trey yawmane bit hawe 'eda dpiṣkha, o broona dnasha bit paesh soepya o bit paesh mikhya lzqeepa.“
ENG: Ye know that after two days the passover cometh, and the Son of man is delivered up to be crucified.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah jmee' lhoon goerane dkahne o sapre o khwardiqne d'ama gaw darta dgoera dkahne, shimeh qayapa.
ENG: Then were gathered together the chief priests, and the elders of the people, unto the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas;

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܦܸܠܡܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O klayhy soezgirhoon 'am 'oedale dbpilma dawqee leeshoo' o qaṭlee-leh.
ENG: and they took counsel together that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena meerhoon, ”la b'eda, dla hawe shghoeshya gaw 'ama.“
ENG: But they said, Not during the feast, lest a tumult arise among the people.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܓܸܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O te-leh eeshoo' lbeyt 'anya, o 'weereh gaw bayta dshim'oon girwana.
ENG: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܫܵܛܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܵܐ، ܫܘܼܦܸܟ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ.
TRL: te-laha lkis-leh khda bakhta o 'amoeha khda shaṭeepta dmishkha dbisma raba ṭeemana, shoepikh-laha 'al resha deeshoo' kad haw teewa lsoepra.
ENG: there came unto him a woman having an alabaster cruse of exceeding precious ointment, and she poured it upon his head, as he sat at meat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܘܼܣܪܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Eena talmeedoehy kad khze-lhoon aha, kreeb-lhoon o meerhoon, ”qamoodee kleh aha khoesrana?
ENG: But when the disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܒܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab wale ywa dpaesh wa zoebna aha mishkha bzoeze raba o yoewa lmiskene.“
ENG: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܠܝܘܼܨܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ؟ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh o meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee malyoeṣe ytoon-laha bakhta? Poelkhana ṭawa 'weed-laha ilee.
ENG: But Jesus perceiving it said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

ASY: ”ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Miskene bkl zawna 'amawkhoon eena, eena ana le ywin 'amawkhoon bkl zawna.
ENG: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܦܸܟ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܥܲܠ ܩܒ݂ܵܪܬܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Aha bakhta shoepikh-laha aha bisma 'al paghree, aykh din 'al qwartee 'weed-laha.
ENG: For in that she poured this ointment upon my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܕܟܸܪܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bkl 'dana dpaesh moekriza aha ewangaleeoon bklaha doenye, bit paesh moedkira aha mindee d'weed-laha aha bakhta.“
ENG: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, that also which this woman hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Haygah zeel-leh khad min tri'sar talmeede, shimeh eehoeda skaryooṭa, lkis goerane dkahne,
ENG: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܕܣܲܦܸܝܢܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”moodee bit yaweetoon-lee dsapiyneh ilawkhoon?“ o anee 'weed-lhoon qawla 'ameh dbit yawee-leh tlatee zoeze dsema.
ENG: and said, What are ye willing to give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they weighed unto him thirty pieces of silver.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O min haw yawma hwe-leh biṭ'aya lpirsat dsape wa-leh.
ENG: And from that time he sought opportunity to deliver him unto them.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܗܲܕܪܲܚ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܬ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: Byawma qamaya dpaṭeere te-lhoon talmeede lkis eeshoo' o boeqirhoon mineh, ”ayka ba'eyt dhadrakh iloekh dakhlet piṣkha?“
ENG: Now on the first day of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Where wilt thou that we make ready for thee to eat the passover?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܸܠܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ’ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܥܕܵܢܝܼ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈.‘“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen lmdeeta lkis pilan, o mooroen ileh: ’rabee-an bemara-yleh, 'danee mṭe-laha, ba'eyn 'awden piṣkha lkis-loekh 'am talmeedee.‘“
ENG: And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: O 'weed-lhoon talmeede aykh dpqeeday-leh eeshoo', o hoedirhoon piṣkha.
ENG: And the disciples did as Jesus appointed them; and they made ready the passover.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, teewa ywa eeshoo' lsoepra 'am tri'sar talmeedoehy.
ENG: Now when even was come, he was sitting at meat with the twelve disciples;

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O kad bekhala ywaw, meereh ilayhy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, khad minawkhoon bit sape-lee.“
ENG: and as they were eating, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

ASY: ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܚܲܕ ܒܚܲܕ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܡܵܪܝܼ؟“
TRL: Psheem-lhoon raba, o shoere-lhoon lbaqoere mineh, khad bkhad, ”ana ywin, maree?“
ENG: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began to say unto him every one, Is it I, Lord?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܛܡܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܡܵܐܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: O haw joewib-leh o meereh, ”haw dbiṭmasha-yleh eedeh 'amee bmana, haw bit sape-lee.
ENG: And he answered and said, He that dipped his hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Broona dnasha bezala-yleh dakhee deeleh kteewa boet dee-eh, eena way lhaw nasha dbeedeh paesh soepya broona dnasha. Boesh ṣpayee ywa lhaw nasha dla paesh wa leeda.“
ENG: The Son of man goeth, even as it is written of him: but woe unto that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had not been born.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Boeqireh eehoeda sapyana o meereh, ”rabee, ana ywin?“ joewib-leh eeshoo', ”at meeroekh.“
ENG: And Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Is it I, Rabbi? He saith unto him, Thou hast said.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠܘܼܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: O kad bekhala ywaw, shqeel-leh eeshoo' lakhma o boerikh-leh o qṣe-leh, o yoebil-leh ltalmeedoehy o meereh, ”shqooloen khooloen, aha-yleh paghree.“
ENG: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and brake it; and he gave to the disciples, and said, Take, eat; this is my body.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܣܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܟܸܪܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܘܫܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: O shqeel-leh kasa, o shoekireh o yoebil-leh ilayhy o meereh, ”shqooloen o shteymoen mineh klawkhoon,
ENG: And he took a cup, and gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܝܼ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܦܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab aha-yleh dimee dwa'da khata dmin geba draba pyasha-yleh shoepkha lpoekhala dkhṭeeate.
ENG: for this is my blood of the covenant, which is shed for many unto remission of sins.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܹܝܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܸܦܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܝܢܵܗ̇ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min adeea le shateyn min ṭ'oenta daha gipta hal haw yawma dshateynaha khadta 'amawkhoon bmalkoeta dbabee.“
ENG: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ.
TRL: O min bar dshoebikh-lhoon, pleeṭ-lhoon o zeel-lhoon lṭoera dzayte.
ENG: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out unto the mount of Olives.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܹܝܢ ܠܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܕܦܸܣܩܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”klawkhoon bit shawqeetoon-lee baha layle. Sabab kteewa-yleh, bit makheyn lra'ya o bit payshee boerbize 'irbe dpisqeh.
ENG: Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended in me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܡܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena min bar dpayshen moeqima, bit azen mqam deeawkhoon lgleela.“
ENG: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh ileh, ”oep in dklayhy shawqee-loekh, ana le shawqenoekh.“
ENG: But Peter answered and said unto him, If all shall be offended in thee, I will never be offended.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ، ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin iloekh, baha layle, min qam dqare qarooya, tlat gahe bit sarbet-lee.“
ENG: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, that this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡܵܝܬܹܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܣܵܪܒܹܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”oep in dhawya dmayten 'amoekh le sarbenoekh.“ o hadkha meerhoon oep klayhy talmeede.
ENG: Peter saith unto him, Even if I must die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܲܕܣܹܡܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon ldoeka dpyasha-ylaha qreeta gadseman, o meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”toowoen akhtoon lakha hal dazen o ṣaleyn ṣloota.“
ENG: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto his disciples, Sit ye here, while I go yonder and pray.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܬܪܹܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܦܫܵܡܵܐ ܘܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܒܥܵܘܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Loebil-leh 'ameh lshim'oon kepa o ltrey bnoone dzawday, o shoere-leh lipshama o bi'wara b'awqana.
ENG: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and sore troubled.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܦܫܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ. ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܫܵܗܲܪܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ.“
TRL: O meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”psheemta-ylaha ganee hal mawta. Kleymoen lakha o 'woodoen shaharta 'amee.“
ENG: Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: abide ye here, and watch with me.

ASY: ܘܪܚܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܡܲܥܒܸܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O rkheeq-leh khad mitkha minayhy, o npeel-leh 'al pateh o ṣoele-leh, bemara, ”ya babee, in hawya ma'bir minee aha kasa, eena la aykh dana basma-lee ila aykh dat basma-loekh.“
ENG: And he went forward a little, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass away from me: nevertheless, not as I will, but as thou wilt.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܵܗܲܪܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܚܕܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ؟
TRL: O te-leh lkis talmeedoehy o khizyay-leh dmeeke, o meereh lshim'oon kepa, ”hadkha la mṣe lawkhoon 'awdeetoon waw shaharta 'amee khda sa'at?
ENG: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?

ASY: ”ܪܥܘܿܫܘܼܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܵܐ. ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܙܲܒܘܼܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”R'ooshoen o ṣaleymoen dla 'awreetoon ljoeraba. Roekha ke ba'ya, eena paghra zaboen eeleh.“
ENG: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܝܢܹܗ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Mindrish zeel-leh gaha dtartey o ṣoele-leh, bemara, ”ya babee, in le hawya d'aber minee aha kasa ila dshateyneh, shwooq hawe ṣiwyanoekh.“
ENG: Again a second time he went away, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cannot pass away, except I drink it, thy will be done.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܼܩܪܸܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܸܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: O te-leh mindrish o khizyay-leh dmeeke sabab 'aynayhy yoeqrine ywaw bshinta.
ENG: And he came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

ASY: ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܘܬܸܢܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Shweeqay-leh o zeel-leh mindrish gaha dtlat lṣaloeye, o tinya-leh hay hemizman qamayta.
ENG: And he left them again, and went away, and prayed a third time, saying again the same words.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܕܡܘܿܟ݂ܘܼܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܘܡܲܢܝܸܚܘܼܢ، ܗܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O deereh lkis talmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”dmookhoen adeea o manyikhoen, ha mṭe-laha sa'at dbroona dnasha paesh soepya beedate dkhaṭaye.
ENG: Then cometh he to the disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

ASY: ”ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ، ܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Qoemoen dazakh, ha te-leh haw dsape-lee.“
ENG: Arise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that betrayeth me.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܗܵܐ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kad eeshoo' hamzoeme ywa, ha eehoeda, khad min tri'sar talmeede o kinsha raba 'ameh, te-lhoon byad saype o khoeṭre, shoedre byad goerane dkahne o khwardiqne d'ama.
ENG: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܵܫܩܹܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ. ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O yoewa ywa ilayhy eehoeda sapyana neeshanqa bemara, ”lhaw dnashqen, haw eeleh. Dawqeetoon-leh.“
ENG: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he: take him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܪܲܒܝܼ،“ ܘܢܫܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O te-leh lkis eeshoo' o meereh, ”shlama iloekh, rabee,“ o nsheeq-leh.
ENG: And straightway he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, Rabbi; and kissed him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܒ݂ܪܝܼ؟“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O meereh ileh eeshoo', ”boet aha te-loekh khawree?“ haygah qoerbinhoon o dweeq-lhoon leeshoo'.
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Friend, do that for which thou art come. Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܠܣܲܝܦܹܗ ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: Khad min anee deewaw 'am eeshoo' dre-leh eedeh lsaypeh o greesh-leh o mkhe-leh lrega dgoera dkahne o preema-leh nateh.
ENG: And behold, one of them that were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܕܸܪ ܣܲܝܦܘܼܟ݂ ܠܕܘܼܟܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܦܠܸܚܝܼ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ، ܒܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܝܼ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ileh, ”madir saypoekh ldoekeh, sabab klayhy anee dmaplikhee saypa, bsaypa bit maytee.
ENG: Then saith Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into its place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

ASY: ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܛܵܠܒܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܗܲܪ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܠܸܓ݂ܝܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: ”Bikhshawa ywit le maṣeyn ṭalben min babee dhar adeea shadir ilee zawda min tri'sar lighyoone dmalake?
ENG: Or thinkest thou that I cannot beseech my Father, and he shall even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ؟“
TRL: ”Eena dakhee bit payshee toemime ktabe dbemara yna wale-ylaha dhadkha hawe?“
ENG: How then should the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ”ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܥܲܠ ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܚܘܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܝܼ؟ ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܬܒܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܦܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana meereh eeshoo' lkinsha, ”aykh d'al genawa pleeṭ lawkhoon bsaype o bkhoeṭre lidwaqee? Kl yoom 'amawkhoon ke yatben wa gaw haykla o malpin wa o la qam dawqeetoon-lee.
ENG: In that hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a robber with swords and staves to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and ye took me not.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena aha klaha hwe-laha dpayshee toemime ktabe dnwee-e.“ haygah talmeede klayhy shweeq-lhoon ileh o 'reeq-lhoon.
ENG: But all this is come to pass, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples left him, and fled.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O anee ddweeq-lhoon leeshoo' loebil-lhoon ileh lkis qayapa, goera dkahne, ayka dsapre o khwardiqne jmee'e ywaw.
ENG: And they that had taken Jesus led him away to the house of Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.

ASY: ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O shim'oon kepa zeel-leh bareh min rikhqa hal lkis darta dgoera dkahne. O 'weereh gaw darta o teew-leh 'am palakhe dkhaze wa moodee bit hawe bkharta.
ENG: But Peter followed him afar off, unto the court of the high priest, and entered in, and sat with the officers, to see the end.

ASY: ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܛܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ،
TRL: Goerane dkahne o khwardiqne o kleh knoeshya ṭa'ee waw sahdoeta ddoegla 'al eeshoo' dqaṭlee waw-leh,
ENG: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought false witness against Jesus, that they might put him to death;

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O la moechikh-lhoon. te-lhoon raba sahde dagale, eena bkharta te-lhoon trey sahde,
ENG: and they found it not, though many false witnesses came. But afterward came two,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܣܵܬܪܹܢ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܵܢܹܝܢܹܗ.‘“
TRL: O meerhoon, ”aha nasha meereh, ’maṣeyn satren lhaykla dalaha, o btlata yawmane baneyneh.‘“
ENG: and said, This man said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: O qeem-leh goera dkahne o boeqireh min eeshoo', ”qamoodee le ywit jawoebe mindee 'al ane dbishada yna 'aloekh?“
ENG: And the high priest stood up, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܡܘܼܝܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܲܢ، ܕܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' shteeqa ywa. O hoemzim-leh goera dkahne o meereh ileh, ”mamoeyoekh eewin balaha khaya damret lan, din at eewit msheekha, broona dalaha.“
ENG: But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”at meeroekh. Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min adeea bit khazeytoon lbroona dnasha teewa min yameena dkhayla o betaya 'al 'nana dshmaya.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Henceforth ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟ̰ܘܼܢܟ̰ܸܪܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܓܕܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ! ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܕܵܦܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah goera dkahne choenchireh joeloehy o meereh, ”gdeep-leh! khena le ywakh sneeqe lsahde, adeea shmee' lawkhoon goedapeh.
ENG: Then the high priest rent his garments, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy: what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard the blasphemy:

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Moodee bikhshawa ytoon?“ joewib-lhoon o meerhoon, ”khayawa-yleh lmawta.“
ENG: what think ye? They answered and said, He is worthy of death.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܩܲܪܦܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah reeq-lhoon 'al pateh, o qarpikhee waw-leh, o khene makhee waw-leh.
ENG: Then did they spit in his face and buffet him: and some smote him with the palms of their hands,

ASY: ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܢܲܒܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܡܵܚܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: O amree waw, ”nabee ilan, msheekha, manee qam makhe-loekh?“
ENG: saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ: who is he that struck thee?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܚܹܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena shim'oon kepa teewa ywa gaw darta, o te-laha lkis-leh khda khedamta o meeraha ileh, ”oep at 'am eeshoo' naṣraya ywit wa.“
ENG: Now Peter was sitting without in the court: and a maid came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus the Galilaean.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ.“
TRL: Eena haw sreew-leh qam klayhy o meereh, ”le ywin beeda'a moodee bemara ywaty.“
ENG: But he denied before them all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܒܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh btar'a, o khze-laha ileh khda kheta o meeraha, ”oep aha 'am eeshoo' naṣraya ywa.“
ENG: And when he was gone out into the porch, another maid saw him, and saith unto them that were there, This man also was with Jesus the Nazarene.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Mindrish sreew-leh bmawmeeta, bemara, ”le yad'en-laha nasha.“
ENG: And again he denied with an oath, I know not the man.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܸܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܡܙܲܡܬܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: O min bar khad mitkha, te-lhoon anee dkilye ywaw tama, o meerhoon lshim'oon kepa, ”shareeraeet oep at minayhy ywit, sabab hamzamtoekh madoe'e-ylaha.“
ENG: And after a little while they that stood by came and said to Peter, Of a truth thou also art one of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܚܪܘܼܡܹܐ ܘܠܸܡܝܵܝܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah shoere-leh lmakhroeme o limyaya, ”le yad'en-laha nasha.“ o har bhay 'dana qre-leh qarooya.
ENG: Then began he to curse and to swear, I know not the man. And straightway the cock crew.

ASY: ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܒܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O dkheereh shim'oon kepa hemizman deeshoo' dmeera ywa ileh, ”min qam dqare qarooya bit sarbet-lee tlat gahe.“ o pleeṭ-leh lbadar o bke-leh bmareeroeta.
ENG: And Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh ṣapra, soezgirhoon goerane dkahne o khwardiqne d'ama dqaṭlee leeshoo'.
ENG: Now when morning was come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ.
TRL: O seerhoon ileh o loebil-lhoon o soepe-lhoon ileh lpeelaṭoos shaleeṭa.
ENG: and they bound him, and led him away, and delivered him up to Pilate the governor.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ. ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ،
TRL: Eena kad eehoeda sapyana khze-leh dpeesh-leh deena eeshoo', psheem-leh. zeel-leh o moedireh lanee tlatee zoeze dsema lgoerane dkahne o lkhwardiqne,
ENG: Then Judas, which betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܛܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܙܲܟܵܝܵܐ.“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O meereh, ”khṭe-lee dsoepe-lee dima zakaya.“ eena anee meerhoon ileh, ”layt lan shoela minoekh, at ke yad'et bganoekh.“
ENG: saying, I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood. But they said, What is that to us? see thou to it.

ASY: ܘܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O roepe-leh lzoeze dsema gaw haykla, pleeṭ-leh o zeel-leh khneeqa-leh ganeh.
ENG: And he cast down the pieces of silver into the sanctuary, and departed; and he went away and hanged himself.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena goerane dkahne shqeel-lhoon lzoeze dsema o meerhoon, ”le-ylaha khsheekhta ddarakh-lhoon gaw beyt gaza sabab ṭeema ddima yna.“
ENG: And the chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said, It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.

ASY: ܘܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܵܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: O soezgirhoon o zweenhoon bee-ayhy khaqla dpakhara qa beyt qwoere dnoekhraye.
ENG: And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ”ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ“ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha peesh-laha qreeta hay khaqla, ”khaqla ddima“ hal aha yawma.
ENG: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܹܪܲܡܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ، ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ،
TRL: Haygah peesh-leh toemima mindee dmeera ywa byad eramya nweea, dmeereh: shqeel-lhoon tlatee zoeze dsema, ṭeema dmoetbe ywaw 'aloehy bnay eesrayel,
ENG: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was priced, whom certain of the children of Israel did price;

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܵܪܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O yoebay-lhoon bkhaqla dpakhara, aykh dpqeed-leh ilee Marya.
ENG: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me.

ASY: ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Kle-leh eeshoo' qam peelaṭoos shaleeṭa, o boeqireh mineh shaleeṭa o meereh, ”at eewit malka dyhoedaye?“ joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”at meeroekh.“
ENG: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܹܗ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dgoerane dkahne o khwardiqne hamzoeme ywaw dalqoewleh, eeshoo' shteeqa ywa.
ENG: And when he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ”ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Haygah meereh ileh peelaṭoos ”bishma'a ywit dakhee sahdoeta beeawa yna 'aloekh?“
ENG: Then saith Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ. ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ.
TRL: O la joewib-leh eeshoo' oep khda hemizman. 'oejib-leh raba shaleeṭa.
ENG: And he gave him no answer, not even to one word: insomuch that the governor marveled greatly.

ASY: ܒܟܠ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Bkl 'eda dpiṣkha eet wa 'adat dshare wa shaleeṭa lkhad aseera qa kinsha, haw danee ba'ee waw.
ENG: Now at the feast the governor was wont to release unto the multitude one prisoner, whom they would.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ.
TRL: O eet waw-lhoon khad aseera dee'a shimeh bar aba.
ENG: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad jmee'e ywaw, boeqireh minayhy peelaṭoos, ”manee ba'eytoon dshareyn ilawkhoon, bar aba, yan eeshoo' dpyasha-yleh qirya msheekha?“
ENG: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܚܸܠܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Sabab ke yade' wa dmin bakhilanoeta soepye ywaw leeshoo'.
ENG: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him up.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܠܡܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: O kad teewa ywa peelaṭoos 'al koersya ddeewan, shoediraha bakhteh khabra ileh, bemara, ”la hawe-loekh shoela bhaw zadeeqa, sabab idyoom gaw khilmee raba joenjiree boet dee-eh.“
ENG: And while he was sitting on the judgment-seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that righteous man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ ܘܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eena goerane dkahne o khwardiqne moelip-lhoon lkinsha dṭalbee waw lbar aba o qaṭlee waw leeshoo'.
ENG: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes that they should ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh shaleeṭa minayhy, ”laynee min ane trey ba'eytoon dshareyn ilawkhoon?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”lbar aba.“
ENG: But the governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? And they said, Barabbas.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ!“
TRL: O boeqireh peelaṭoos, ”moodee 'awden beeshoo' dpyasha-yleh qirya msheekha?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”paesh mikhya lzqeepa!“
ENG: Pilate saith unto them, What then shall I do unto Jesus which is called Christ? They all say, Let him be crucified.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ!“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy peelaṭoos, ”moodee beeshta 'weeda-yleh?“ eena anee boesh zawda moeqwikh-lhoon, bemara, ”paesh mikhya lzqeepa!“
ENG: And he said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out exceedingly, saying, Let him be crucified.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܢܬܘܼܝܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܸܙܝܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Kad khze-leh peelaṭoos dle ywa mantoeye, ila shghoeshya boesh bizyada ywa, shqeel-leh meea o khoelil-leh eedateh qam 'ayne dkinsha o meereh, ”preeq-lee min dima daha zadeeqa, akhtoon khzeymoen moodee bit 'awdeetoon.“
ENG: So when Pilate saw that he prevailed nothing, but rather that a tumult was arising, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this righteous man: see ye to it.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܕܸܡܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܘܥܲܠ ܒܢܘܿܢܲܢ̈.“
TRL: Joewib-leh kleh 'ama o meereh, ”dimeh 'alan o 'al bnoonan.“
ENG: And all the people answered and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah peelaṭoos shre-leh ilayhy lbar aba, o moemkhe-leh leeshoo' bshawṭe, o soepe-leh dpaesh zqeepa.
ENG: Then released he unto them Barabbas: but Jesus he scourged and delivered to be crucified.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah naṭoore dshaleeṭa loebil-lhoon leeshoo' lbeyt deena o joemi' lhoon 'aloehy klaha see'ta.
ENG: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the palace, and gathered unto him the whole band.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܠܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܒܵܐ ܣܡܘܿܩܬܵܐ.
TRL: O shoelikh-lhoon joeloehy, o moelbish-lhoon ileh joeba smooqta.
ENG: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

ASY: ܘܓܕܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ، ܘܙܹܠܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ، ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܥܲܠ ܒܘܼܪ̈ܟܵܟܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O gdeel-lhoon kleela dkitwe o moetiw-lhoon bresheh, o zela beedeh dyameena, o breek-lhoon qamoehy 'al boerkakayhy, o moeskhirhoon bee-eh, bemara, ”shlama iloekh, ya malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And they plaited a crown of thorns and put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!

ASY: ܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܹܠܵܐ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܹܗ.
TRL: Reeq-lhoon gaw pateh, o shqeel-lhoon zela o mkhe-lhoon bee-eh 'al resheh.
ENG: And they spat upon him, and took the reed and smote him on the head.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܫܘܼܠܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܒܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: O min bar dmoeskhirhoon bee-eh, shoelikh-lhoon mineh joeba o moelbish-lhoon ileh joeloehy, o loebil-lhoon ileh dpaesh zqeepa.
ENG: And when they had mocked him, they took off from him the robe, and put on him his garments, and led him away to crucify him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܚܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܛܵܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: Kad biplaṭa ywaw, tpeeq-lhoon bkhad nasha qiwreenaya shimeh shim'oon. 'weed-lhoon shoekhra ileh dṭa'en wa lzqeepa.
ENG: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܓ݂ܘܿܠܬܵܐ، ܕܦܘܼܫܵܩܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܲܪܩܲܦܬܵܐ.
TRL: O te-lhoon ldoeka dke paysha qreeta gaghoolta, dpoeshaqoeha eeleh qarqapta.
ENG: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, The place of a skull,

ASY: ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܚܒ݂ܝܼܛܵܐ ܒܡܪܲܪܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܛܥܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܹܗ.
TRL: Yoebil-lhoon ileh khamra lishtaya, khweeṭa bmrarta, eena eeman dṭ'eem-leh la b'e-leh lishtayeh.
ENG: they gave him wine to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted it, he would not drink.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܕܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܸܫܟܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dzqeep-lhoon, poeli' lhoon joeloehy bdrayta dpishka.
ENG: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots:

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O teew-lhoon binṭara ileh tama.
ENG: and they sat and watched him there.

ASY: ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Moetiw-lhoon 'ilil min resheh kteewta makhzoeye 'ilta dmawteh, ”aha-yleh eeshoo', malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And they set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: O peesh-lhoon zqeepe 'ameh trey gayase, khad min yameeneh o khad min simaleh.
ENG: Then are there crucified with him two robbers, one on the right hand, and one on the left.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܫܵܥܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܹ̈ܫܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O anee dbi'wara ywaw min lkis-leh gadpee waw 'aloehy, o sha'shee waw reshayhy,
ENG: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads,

ASY: ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܝܵܐ ܣܵܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܒܵܢܝܵܢܹܗ ܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܲܪܸܩ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܨܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.“
TRL: O amree waw, ”ya satrana dhaykla o banyaneh btlata yawmane, pariq ganoekh in broona dalaha ywit, ṣlee min zqeepa.“
ENG: and saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself: if thou art the Son of God, come down from the cross.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ،
TRL: Hadkha oep goerane dkahne 'am sapre o khwardiqne o preeshe maskhiree waw o amree waw,
ENG: In like manner also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,

ASY: ”ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܸܩ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇. ܐܸܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܨܵܠܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܲܚ ܘܗܲܡܸܢܲܚ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Lkhene poeriq-leh, eena ganeh le maṣe pariq-laha. In malka deesrayel eeleh, ṣale min zqeepa dkhazakh o haminakh bee-eh.
ENG: He saved others; himself he cannot save. He is the King of Israel; let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe on him.

ASY: ”ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.‘“
TRL: ”Dre-leh hewee-eh 'al Alaha, shwooq Alaha pariq-leh adeea in ke makhib-leh, sabab meereh, ’broona dalaha ywin.‘“
ENG: He trusteth on God; let him deliver him now, if he desireth him: for he said, I am the Son of God.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha oep anee gayase dpeesh-lhoon zqeepe 'ameh maskhiree waw bee-eh.
ENG: And the robbers also that were crucified with him cast upon him the same reproach.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ.
TRL: O min sa'at dtri'sar hwe-leh khishka 'al klaha ar'a hal sa'at dtlat.
ENG: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

ASY: ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܹܝܠܝ، ܐܹܝܠܝ، ܠܡܵܢܵܐ ܫܒܲܩܬܵܢܝ؟“ ܝܲܥܢܹܐ، ”ܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ، ܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܸܢܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: O aykh sa'at dtlat moeqwikh-leh eeshoo' bqala rama o meereh, ”eyly, eyly, lmana shbaqtany?“ ya'ne, ”alahee, alahee, qamoodee shweeqinoekh?“
ENG: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Khakma min nashe dkilye ywaw tama, eeman dshmee' lhoon, meerhoon, ”aha leleea biqraya-yleh.“
ENG: And some of them that stood there, when they heard it, said, This man calleth Elijah.

ASY: ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܣܦܘܼܓܵܐ ܘܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܠܵܐ، ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܲܝܣܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Bjaldoeta rkheeṭ-leh khad minayhy o shqeel-leh ispoega o milya-leh khala, moetwa-leh 'al qaysa o yoewa-leh ileh lishtaya.
ENG: And straightway one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܚܵܙܲܚ ܐܸܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܘܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O khene amree waw, ”shwooqoen khazakh in bit ate eleea o pariq-leh.“
ENG: And the rest said, Let be; let us see whether Elijah cometh to save him.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Eeshoo' mindrish moeqwikh-leh bqala rama o soepya-leh ganeh.
ENG: And Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ، ܣܸܬܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟ̰ܠܝܼܦܹܐ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܣܵܗܡܹ̈ܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܗܲܠ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ، ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟ̰ܠܝܼܦܹܐ.
TRL: O ha, sitre dhaykla peesh-lhoon chleepe ltrey sahme, min l'ilil hal lltikht, o ar'a sh'eesh-laha, o kepe peesh-lhoon chleepe.
ENG: And behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake; and the rocks were rent;

ASY: ܘܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ، ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: O beyt qwoere peesh-lhoon pteekhe, o paghre draba qadeeshe ddmeeke ywaw qeem-lhoon,
ENG: and the tombs were opened; and many bodies of the saints that had fallen asleep were raised;

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon min beyt qwoere min bar qyamta dmsheekha o 'weerhoon lmdeeta qadeeshta, o peesh-lhoon khizye braba.
ENG: and coming forth out of the tombs after his resurrection they entered into the holy city and appeared unto many.

ASY: ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܘܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: Rab ima o anee d'ameh dbinṭara ywaw leeshoo', eeman dkhze-lhoon rawdana o mindeeane dhwe-lhoon, zdee' lhoon raba o meerhoon, ”shareeraeet aha broona dalaha ywa.“
ENG: Now the centurion, and they that were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake, and the things that were done, feared exceedingly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: Eet waw tama bakhtate raba dbikhyara ywaw min rikhqa, anee dtee-e ywaw bar eeshoo' min gleela d'awdee waw-leh khilmat.
ENG: And many women were there beholding from afar, which had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:

ASY: ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܕܝܘܿܣܹܐ، ܘܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ.
TRL: Minayhy eewaw maryam maghdlayta, o maryam yima dya'qoow o dyoose, o yima dbnoone dzawday.
ENG: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܡܬܵܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܘܼܠܡܸܕܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh ramsha, te-leh khad nasha 'ateera min ramta, shimeh yawsip, dpeesha ywa toelmida byad eeshoo'.
ENG: And when even was come, there came a rich man from Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus’ disciple:

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܘܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Aha te-leh lkis peelaṭoos o ṭleeb-leh paghra deeshoo'. O peelaṭoos pqeed-leh dpaesh yoewa ileh.
ENG: this man went to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded it to be given up.

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܟܪܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ.
TRL: Shqeel-leh yawsip lpaghra o kreekh-leh bkitana dikhya.
ENG: And Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܢܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܝܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O moetiw-leh gaw beyt qwoera khata dganeh, nqeera gaw qaya, o moekhdireh kepa goera 'al tar'a dbeyt qwoera o zeel-leh.
ENG: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, and departed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܚܕܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa tama maryam maghdlayta o khda maryam kheta teebe lbalqoewl dqawra.
ENG: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.

ASY: ܘܒܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ،
TRL: O bqaydamta, deewa min bar yawma dhadarta, jmee' lhoon goerane dkahne o preeshe lkis peelaṭoos,
ENG: Now on the morrow, which is the day after the Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together unto Pilate,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܸܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܚܠܸܛܵܢܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.
TRL: O meerhoon ileh, ”Maran, bidkhara ywakh dhaw makhliṭana, kad khaya ywa, meereh dmin bar tlata yawmane bit qaem.
ENG: saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I rise again.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܦܩܘܿܕ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܓܵܢܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܠܛܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha, pqood dpaesh nṭeera beyt qwoera hal yawma dtlata, dla atee talmeedoehy o ganwee-leh blayle, o amree l'ama dqeem-leh min gaw meete. O aha khilṭa kharaya bit hawe boesh khirba min haw qamaya.“
ENG: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest haply his disciples come and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: and the last error will be worse than the first.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܢܛܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh peelaṭoos, ”shqooloen naṭoore, zemoen o nṭooroen-leh dakhee dyad'eetoon.“
ENG: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a guard: go your way, make it as sure as ye can.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܢܛܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܚܬܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O anee zeel-lhoon o nṭeerhoon lqawra, o khteem-lhoon lkepa qam 'ayne dnaṭoore.
ENG: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, the guard being with them.

ASY: ܒܦܪܵܩܬܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܘܒܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܕܚܲܕܒܫܲܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Bpraqta dshabta o bzraqa dkhadbshaba, te-lhoon maryam maghdlayta o maryam kheta dkhazee lqawra.
ENG: Now late on the sabbath day, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܪܵܘܕܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O ha rawdana goera hwe-leh, sabab malakha dmarya ṣle-leh min shmaya, o moekhdireh lkepa min tar'a, o teew-leh 'aloehy.
ENG: And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled away the stone, and sat upon it.

ASY: ܦܵܬܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܸܪܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܚܘܵܪܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܲܠܓܵܐ.
TRL: Pateh aykh birqa ywa, o lweeshteh khwarta aykh talga.
ENG: His appearance was as lightning, and his raiment white as snow:

ASY: ܪܓܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Rgeed-lhoon naṭoore min zdoe'tayhy mineh, o hwe-lhoon aykh meete.
ENG: and for fear of him the watchers did quake, and became as dead men.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: Eena hoemzim-leh malakha o meereh lbakhtate, ”akhtoon la zad'eetoon, sabab beeda'a ywin dbiṭ'aya ytoon leeshoo' dpeesh-leh mikhya lzqeepa.
ENG: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which hath been crucified.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: ”Le-yleh lakha, qeem-leh dakhee dmeera ywa. Teymoen o khzeymoen ldoeka dgawoeha moetwa ywa Maran.
ENG: He is not here; for he is risen, even as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

ASY: ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ. ܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Zemoen bjaldoeta o mooroen ltalmeedoehy dqeem-leh min gaw meete, o bit azel min qam deeawkhoon lgleela, tama bit khazeytoon-leh. Ha meeree ilawkhoon.“
ENG: And go quickly, and tell his disciples, He is risen from the dead; and lo, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܡܲܠܝܲܙܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܒܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: O deerhoon anee bakhtate bmalyazta min qawra, bzdoe'ta o bkhadoeta goerta, o rkheeṭ-lhoon o moedi' lhoon ltalmeede.
ENG: And they departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O ha eeshoo' tpeeq-leh bee-ayhy o meereh ilayhy, ”shlama ilawkhoon.“ o anee te-lhoon o dweeq-lhoon aqlateh o sgheed-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And behold, Jesus met them, saying, All hail. And they came and took hold of his feet, and worshipped him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la zad'eetoon, zemoen o mooroen lakhoonwatee dazee lgleela o tama bit khazee-lee.“
ENG: Then saith Jesus unto them, Fear not: go tell my brethren that they depart into Galilee, and there shall they see me.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ،
TRL: O kad anee bezala ywaw, te-lhoon nashe min anee naṭoore lmdeeta o moekhbirhoon lgoerane dkahne kl mindee dhwe-leh,
ENG: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city, and told unto the chief priests all the things that were come to pass.

ASY: ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ، ܘܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Jmee' lhoon goerane dkahne 'am khwardiqne, o soezgirhoon, o yoebil-lhoon zoeze raba lnaṭoore,
ENG: And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ، ’ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܓܢܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ.‘
TRL: O meerhoon ilayhy, ”mooroen, ’talmeedoehy te-lhoon blayle o gneew-lhoon ileh kad akhnan dmeeke.‘
ENG: saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ، ܘܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܣܸܪܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O in paysha shmee'ta aha qam shaleeṭa, akhnan bit mashlakh-leh, o 'alawkhoon le ate mindee sirya.“
ENG: And if this come to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him, and rid you of care.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܠܦܹܐ. ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Anee shqeel-lhoon zoeze o 'weed-lhoon dakhee dpeesh-lhoon moelpe. O pleeṭ-laha aha hemizman gaw yhoedaye hal aha yawma.
ENG: So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continueth until this day.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ.
TRL: Haygah zeel-lhoon khadi'sar talmeede lgleela, lṭoera ayka dmeera ywa eeshoo' dazee.
ENG: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, unto the mountain where Jesus had appointed them.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܲܡ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܹܗ، ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܫܸܟܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dqam khazee-leh, sgheed-lhoon ileh. Eena khakma minayhy npeel-lhoon gaw shikoeta.
ENG: And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܠ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' o hoemzim-leh 'amayhy o meereh ilayhy, ”peesh-leh yoewa ilee kl shoelṭana bshmaya o bar'a.
ENG: And Jesus came to them and spake unto them, saying, All authority hath been given unto me in heaven and on earth.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܬܲܠܡܸܕܘܼܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܥܡܸܕܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, zemoen o talmidoen lklayhy imwate, o ma'midoen-lhoon bshima dbaba o broona o roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: Go ye therefore, and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost:

ASY: ”ܘܡܲܠܦܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܗܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܠ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.“ ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: ”O malpoen-lhoon dnaṭree kl mindee dpqeed-lee ilawkhoon, o ha, ana 'amawkhoon eewin klayhy yawmane, hal shoelama dzawna.“ ameyn.
ENG: teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I commanded you: and lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Aha-yleh shoeraya dewangaleeoon deeshoo' msheekha broona dalaha.
ENG: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ: ܗܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܝܼܙܓܲܕܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂ ܕܗܲܕܸܪ ܐܘܼܪܚܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Dakhee deeleh kteewa besha'ya nweea: ha shadoere ywin eezgadee qamoekh dhadir oerkhoekh.
ENG: Even as it is written in Isaiah the prophet, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Who shall prepare thy way;

ASY: ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ”ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܡܲܫܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: Qala dkhad biqraya gaw bareea, ”hadroen oerkha dmarya, o mashweymoen shweeloehy.“
ENG: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ye ready the way of the Lord, Make his paths straight;

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O haw yookhanan ma'moede ywa gaw bareea o makroeze ma'moodeeta dtyawoeta lpoekhala dkhṭeeate.
ENG: John came, who baptized in the wilderness and preached the baptism of repentance unto remission of sins.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܢܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ ܟܲܕ ܡܵܘܕܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon lkis-leh klayhy nashe deehoed o oep doorishlim, o payshee waw 'meede mineh bnahra dyoordnan kad mawdoeye bkhṭeeatayhy.
ENG: And there went out unto him all the country of Judaea, and all they of Jerusalem; and they were baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

ASY: ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܲܥܪܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܡܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܘܼܢܵܪܵܐ ܕܓܸܠܕܵܐ ܒܚܲܨܹܗ، ܘܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܹܗ ܩܲܡܨܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܸܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Lweeshta dyookhanan min sa'ra dgoemle ywa, o eet wa zoenara dgilda bkhaṣeh, o mekhoelteh qamṣe o diwsha dbareea ywa.
ENG: And John was clothed with camel’s hair, and had a leathern girdle about his loins, and did eat locusts and wild honey.

ASY: ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܠܸܟܝܵܦܵܐ ܘܠܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܬܲܣܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O makriz wa, bemara, ”ha betaya-yleh min bar minee khad boesh khaylana minee, haw dana le khashkhen likyapa o lishraya tasmate dṣawloehy.
ENG: And he preached, saying, There cometh after me he that is mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ana ma'moede ywin ilawkhoon bmeea, eena haw bit ma'mid lawkhoon broekha dqoedsha.“
ENG: I baptized you with water; but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܢܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ.
TRL: Banee yawmane te-leh eeshoo' min naṣrat dgleela, o peesh-leh moe'mida min yookhanan gaw nahra dyoordnan.
ENG: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in the Jordan.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܘܢܵܐ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana seeq-leh min meea, khze-leh shmaya pteekhta o roekha aykh yawna biṣlaya 'aloehy.
ENG: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens rent asunder, and the Spirit as a dove descending upon him:

ASY: ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O qala te-leh min shmaya, bemara, ”at eewit broonee moekhiba dbeeoekh bseem-laha-lee.“
ENG: And a voice came out of the heavens, Thou art my beloved Son, in thee I am well pleased.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana poeliṭ-leh ileh roekha lbareea.
ENG: And straightway the Spirit driveth him forth into the wilderness.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܟܲܕ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ. ܘܥܲܡ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O hwe-leh tama gaw bareea arb'ee yawmane, kad pyasha joerba min saṭana. O 'am haywane dbareea ywa, o malake bi'wada ywaw khilmat ileh.
ENG: And he was in the wilderness forty days tempted of Satan; and he was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Min bar dpeesh-leh dirya yookhanan gaw beyt aseere, te-leh eeshoo' lgleela, makroeze ewangaleeoon dmalkoeta dalaha,
ENG: Now after that John was delivered up, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of God,

ASY: ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܬܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ، ܘܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܒܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ.“
TRL: O bemara, ”toemim-leh zawna, o qoerbinaha malkoeta dalaha. Tawiboen, o haminoen bewangaleeoon.“
ENG: and saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe in the gospel.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܠܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܨܲܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O kad bikhdara ywa eeshoo' bmarza dyama dgleela, khze-leh lshim'oon o landreoos akhoonoehy bidraya gardayhy byama, sabab ṣayade ywaw.
ENG: And passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net in the sea: for they were fishers.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܨܲܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”teymoen baree o bit 'awdenawkhoon ṣayade dbnaynasha.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana shweeq-lhoon lgardayhy o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And straightway they left the nets, and followed him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܬܲܪܘܼܨܹܐ ܓܲܪ̈ܕܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad zeel-leh khad mitkha kirya, khze-leh lya'qoow broona dzawday, o yookhanan akhoonoehy, o oep anee gaw gamee taroeṣe gardayhy.
ENG: And going on a little further, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the boat mending the nets.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ ܒܵܒܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana qiryay-leh, o shweeq-lhoon lzawday babayhy gaw gamee 'am regawate dweeqe bhaqa, o zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ.
TRL: Kad te-lhoon lkparnakhoom, 'weereh eeshoo' lknoeshta byawma dshabta o shoere-leh lmaloepe.
ENG: And they go into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

ASY: ܘܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O 'ajbee waw byoelpaneh sabab malip wa-lhoon aykh khad deet-leh shoelṭana, o la aykh sapre.
ENG: And they were astonished at his teaching: for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: O eet wa gaw knoeshtayhy khad nasha deet wa bee-eh roekha ṭame, o moeqwikh-leh, bemara,
ENG: And straightway there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

ASY: ”ܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ؟ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܛܲܠܩܸܬ ܠܲܢ؟ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ma-loekh minan, ya eeshoo' naṣraya? te-loekh dṭalqit lan? Beeda'a ywin manee ywit, at eewit qadeesha dalaha.“
ENG: saying, What have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

ASY: ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܬܘܿܩ، ܘܦܠܘܿܛ ܡܸܢܹܗ!“
TRL: Njeew-leh bee-eh eeshoo', bemara, ”shtooq, o plooṭ mineh!“
ENG: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

ASY: ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: Roepe-laha ileh roekha ṭame, o moeqwikh-laha bqala rama o pleeṭ-laha mineh.
ENG: And the unclean spirit, tearing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ! ܐܘܼܦ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ ܘܡܲܨܝܘܼܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O klayhy 'ajbee waw, hadkha dbaqree waw khad 'am haw khena, bemara, ”moodee-yleh aha? Yoelpana khata bshoelṭana! Oep bipqada-yleh lroekhe ṭame o maṣyoete yna ileh.“
ENG: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What is this? a new teaching! with authority he commandeth even the unclean spirits, and they obey him.

ASY: ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: O bjaldoeta prees-leh khabra boet dee-eh bkleh atra dgleela.
ENG: And the report of him went out straightway everywhere into all the region of Galilee round about.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ، ܥܲܡ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana, kad pleeṭ-lhoon min knoeshta, 'weerhoon lbayta dshim'oon o andreoos, 'am ya'qoow o yookhanan.
ENG: And straightway, when they were come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

ASY: ܘܚܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O khmata dshim'oon dweeqtoeha ywa khamkhamta, o har bhay 'dana meerhoon leeshoo' boet deeoeha.
ENG: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever; and straightway they tell him of her:

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܘܼܗ̇ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: te-leh o dweeqa-leh beedoeha o moeqima-leh, o har bhay 'dana shweeqa-laha khamkhamta, o shoere-laha bi'wada ilayhy khilmat.
ENG: and he came and took her by the hand, and raised her up; and the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.

ASY: ܘܒܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܒܓܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O bramsha, bgnayta dshimsha, moete-lhoon lkis-leh klayhy anee deewaw mree'e, o anee deet waw bee-ayhy shede.
ENG: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were sick, and them that were possessed with devils.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: O klayhy nashe dmdeeta jmee' lhoon qam tar'a.
ENG: And all the city was gathered together at the door.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܪܝܼܥܹܐ ܒܡܲܪ̈ܥܹܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O boesim-leh raba min anee deewaw mree'e bmar'e preeshe, o poeliṭ-leh raba shede o la shweeq-leh shede dhamzimee waw, sabab ke yad'ee waw-leh.
ENG: And he healed many that were sick with divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and he suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.

ASY: ܘܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܨܲܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O bṣapra, qam zraqa dyawma, qeem-leh o pleeṭ-leh lbareea, o tama ṣale wa.
ENG: And in the morning, a great while before day, he rose up and went out, and departed into a desert place, and there prayed.

ASY: ܘܛܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O ṭ'e-lhoon bareh shim'oon o anee d'ameh.
ENG: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him;

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O eeman dmoechikh-lhoon ileh meerhoon, ”klayhy nashe biṭ'aya yna baroekh.“
ENG: and they found him, and say unto him, All are seeking thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܢ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”azakh lmatwate dkhadirwanan dmakrizin oep tama, sabab boet aha te-lee.“
ENG: And he saith unto them, Let us go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also; for to this end came I forth.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O zeel-leh makroeze gaw knoeshyatayhy bklaha gleela, o paloeṭe shede.
ENG: And he went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out devils.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܓܸܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ، ܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ، ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ، ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܕܲܟܹܝܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O te-leh lkis-leh khad girwana, breek-leh qamoehy, parpoele bee-eh, bemara, ”in ba'eyt, maṣeyt dakeyt-lee.“
ENG: And there cometh to him a leper, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

ASY: ܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܦܘܼܫܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܗܘܝܼ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Roekhim-leh 'aloehy eeshoo', poeshiṭ-leh eedeh o dqeereh bee-eh o meereh ileh, ”bib'aya ywin, hwee dikhya.“
ENG: And being moved with compassion, he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou made clean.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܸܪܒܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana, zeel-leh girbeh mineh, o peesh-leh doekhya.
ENG: And straightway the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.

ASY: ܘܩܲܫܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܹܗ،
TRL: O qashyaeet pqeed-leh ileh eeshoo', o har bhay 'dana qam shadireh,
ENG: And he strictly charged him, and straightway sent him out,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ ܘܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܠܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: Bemara ileh, ”la amret lnasha mindee, eena ze o makhzee ganoekh lkahna o maqriw qoerbana boet dakhaytoekh dakhee dpqeed-leh moeshe, lsahdoetayhy.“
ENG: and saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw pleeṭ-leh o shoere-leh lhamzoeme raba, o prees-leh-laha khabra, hada deeshoo' la mṣe-leh galyaeet 'aber lmdeeta, ila lbadar eewa gaw bareea, o nashe ke atee waw lkis-leh min kl doeka.
ENG: But he went out, and began to publish it much, and to spread abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: Mindrish 'weereh eeshoo' lkparnakhoom min bar khakma yawmane, o kad shmee' lhoon dgaw bayta ywa,
ENG: And when he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was noised that he was in the house.

ASY: ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ.
TRL: Jmee' lhoon kinshe raba hada dlayt wa doeka, oep la qam tar'a, o hamzim wa ilayhy hemizman.
ENG: And many were gathered together, so that there was no longer room for them, no, not even about the door: and he spake the word unto them.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܛܥܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon o moete-lhoon lkis-leh khad shpeela, peesha ṭ'eena byad arb'a nashe.
ENG: And they come, bringing unto him a man sick of the palsy, borne of four.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܓܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dla mṣe-lhoon qarbinee waw lkis eeshoo' min kinsha, goele-lhoon lgare ayka deewa eeshoo', o moeṣle-lhoon lshweeta d'aloeha ywa haw shpeela.
ENG: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the crowd, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed whereon the sick of the palsy lay.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“
TRL: Kad khze-leh eeshoo' haymanoetayhy, meereh lhaw shpeela, ”broonee, poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh.“
ENG: And Jesus seeing their faith saith unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins are forgiven.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Eena khakma sapre dteebe ywaw tama, bikhshawa ywaw blibayhy,
ENG: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܓܕܵܦܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ؟“
TRL: ”Qamoodee bigdapa-yleh aha? Manee maṣe pakhil khṭeeate ila Alaha akhchee?“
ENG: Why doth this man thus speak? he blasphemeth: who can forgive sins but one, even God?

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܹܗ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eeshoo' har bhay 'dana dee' leh broekheh dhadkha bikhshawa ywaw bganayhy, meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee bikhshawa ytoon hadkha blibawkhoon?
ENG: And straightway Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, saith unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ’ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂،‘ ܝܲܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܩܘܼܡ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܕܘܿܪ؟‘
TRL: ”Aynee-yleh boesh pshoeqa lemara lshpeela, ’poekhle yna iloekh khṭeeatoekh,‘ yan lemara, ’qoem, shqool shweetoekh o khdoor?‘
ENG: Whether is easier, to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins are forgiven; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܸܠ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ،“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: ”Eena dyad'eetoon dbroona dnasha eet-leh shoelṭana 'al ar'a dpakhil khṭeeate,“ haygah meereh lshpeela,
ENG: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins (he saith to the sick of the palsy),

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ: ܩܘܼܡ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Iloekh bemara ywin: qoem, shqool shweetoekh o ze lbaytoekh.“
ENG: I say unto thee, Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thy house.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܝܼܬܹܗ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܲܒܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗܲܪ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: O har bhay 'dana qeem-leh, shqeel-leh shweeteh o pleeṭ-leh qam 'ayne dklayhy, hadkha d'ajbee waw klayhy, o shabkhee waw lalaha, bemara, ”har le ywakh khizye hadkha mindee.“
