ENG: And he said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh, ”kteewa-yleh dmakhibit lmarya alahoekh min kleh liboekh, o min klaha ganoekh, o min kleh khayloekh, o min kleh ri'yanoekh o makhibit lshwawoekh aykh ganoekh.“
ENG: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܝܬ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”bshareeroeta joewib-loekh. 'wood hadkha o bit khayeyt.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܟܫܘܼܛܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܝܼ؟“
TRL: Eena haw b'e-leh lmakshoeṭe ganeh, boeqireh min eeshoo', ”manee-yleh shwawee?“
ENG: But he, desiring to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ. ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܲܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܘܼܠܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܹܝܠ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܚܵܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”khad nasha biṣlaya ywa min oorishlim leereekhoo. Dweeq-lhoon ileh shalkhane o shoelikh-lhoon ileh, o mkhe-lhoon o shweeq-lhoon ileh beyl meeta o khaya, o zeel-lhoon.
ENG: Jesus made answer and said, A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho; and he fell among robbers, which both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

ASY: ”ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܲܕ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ. ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O hwe-laha dkhad kahna bezala ywa bhay oerkha. Khze-leh ileh, o 'weereh min dhaw geba khena.
ENG: And by chance a certain priest was going down that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܘܵܝܵܐ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”te-leh khad lewaya, mṭe-leh lhay doeka, oep haw khze-leh ileh, o 'weereh min haw geba khena.
ENG: And in like manner a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܫܵܡܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Eena khad shamraya bi'wara ywa min tama, te-leh lhay doeka o khze-leh ileh o roekhim-leh 'aloehy.
ENG: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he was moved with compassion,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܕܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܗ، ܘܨܘܼܢܨܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܘܡܸܫܚܵܐ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܚܡܵܪܹܗ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܡܲܫܪܝܵܐ، ܘܬܘܼܓܒܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”seereh ldarbateh, o ṣoenṣil-leh 'alayhy khamra o mishkha, moetiw-leh 'al khmareh, moete-leh lbeyt mashrya, o toegbireh ileh.
ENG: and came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on them oil and wine; and he set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

ASY: ”ܘܒܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܓܒܸܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܡܲܫܪܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܬܲܓܒܸܪܸܬ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐܸܢ ܨܵܪܦܹܬ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”O bqaydamta dyawma khena eeman dbezala ywa, poeliṭ-leh trey deenare o yoebil-leh ltagbirana dbeyt mashrya, o meereh ileh, ’tagbirit-leh, o in ṣarpet 'aloehy mindee zawda, eeman ddayren bit par'enoekh.‘
ENG: And on the morrow he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, I, when I come back again, will repay thee.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܫܲܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: ”Aynee min ane tlata bikhshawa ywit hwe-leh shwawa lhaw dnpeel-leh gaw shalkhane?“
ENG: Which of these three, thinkest thou, proved neighbour unto him that fell among the robbers?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh, ”haw droekhim-leh 'aloehy.“ meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ze oep at o 'wood hadkha.“
ENG: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. And Jesus said unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Kad bezala ywaw boerkha, 'weereh eeshoo' lkhda mata, o khda bakhta shimoeha marta qoebil-laha ileh gaw baytoeha.
ENG: Now as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܵܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O hay eet wa-laha khata shimoeha maryam. Aha teew-laha lkis aqlate dmaran bishma'a hemizmanoehy.
ENG: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at the Lord’s feet, and heard his word.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܒܠܝܼܓܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ؟ ܚܵܬܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܝܼ ܠܗܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܕܗܲܝܸܪܵܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Eena marta bleegta ywa bkhilmat raba. te-laha o meeraha leeshoo', ”maree, le ywit takhmoene boet deeee? Khatee qam shawqa-lee bnawshee lhadoere mindee. moor iloeha dhayira-lee.“
ENG: But Martha was cumbered about much serving; and she came up to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister did leave me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܡܵܪܬܵܐ، ܡܵܪܬܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬܝ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ ܚܲܡ ܘܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh iloeha, ”marta, marta, aty bekhala ywaty kham o shgheeshta boet raba mindeeane,
ENG: But the Lord answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art anxious and troubled about many things:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܵܐ، ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Eena akhchee khad mindee-yleh ananqaya, maryam goebe-laha sahma ṭawa dle paesh shqeela minoeha.“
ENG: but one thing is needful: for Mary hath chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܲܢ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: Kad ṣaloeye ywa eeshoo' ṣloota bkhda doeka, eeman dpreeq-leh, meereh ileh khad min talmeedoehy, ”Maran, malip lan lṣaloeye ṣloota, dakhee dyookhanan moelip-leh ltalmeedoehy.“
ENG: And it came to pass, as he was praying in a certain place, that when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, even as John also taught his disciples.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܨܲܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ، ܒܵܒܲܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂، ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”eeman dṣaleytoon ṣloota, mooroen, baban dbshmaya, paesh mqoedsha shimoekh, atya malkoetoekh, hawe ṣiwyanoekh, dakhee dbshmaya oep bar'a.
ENG: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Father, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come.

ASY: ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܣܘܼܢܩܵܢܲܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Hal lan lakhma dsoenqanan idyoom yawma.
ENG: Give us day by day our daily bread.

ASY: ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܲܢ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܢ̈، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܕܵܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ. ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܸܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܢܸܣܝܘܿܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܦܲܨܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Shwooq lan khṭeeatan, dakhee doep akhnan shweeq lan lklayhy ddaynane yna ilan. O la ma'birit lan lnisyoona, ila paṣee lan min beesha.“
ENG: And forgive us our sins; for we ourselves also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And bring us not into temptation.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܪܵܚܡܝܼ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܒܕܲܝܢܵܐ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܸܪ̈ܕܲܝܹܐ،
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”in khad minawkhoon eet-leh khawra, o azel lkis-leh bpalga dlayle o amer ileh, ’rakhmee, hal-lee bdayna tlat girdaye,
ENG: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say to him, Friend, lend me three loaves;

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܚܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܵܪ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”’sabab rakhma te-leh lkis-lee min sapar, o layt-lee mindee dmatbin qamoehy.‘
ENG: for a friend of mine is come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him;

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܪܵܚܡܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ، ’ܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܝܸܨ ܠܝܼ، ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܝܵܠܕ݇ܝܼ̈ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܩܵܝܡܹܢ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܘܼܟ݂،‘
TRL: ”O in rakhmeh min lgawa jawib-leh o amer, ’la malyiṣ-lee, tar'a dweera-yleh, o yalee 'amee yna bshweeta, le maṣeyn qaymen o yabenoekh,‘
ENG: and he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee?

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܪܵܚܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܘܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܸܘܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܘܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ.
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, din boet rakhmoeta la qaem o yabil-leh, eena boet qiwyoeta dpateh bit qaem o yabil-leh kma dba'e.
ENG: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will arise and give him as many as he needeth.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ: ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܛܥܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܬܲܩܬܸܩܘܼܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Oep ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon: ṭlooboen o bit paesh yoewa ilawkhoon, ṭ'eymoen o bit machkheetoon, o taqtiqoen o bit paesh pteekha ilawkhoon.
ENG: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܵܠܹܒ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܛܵܥܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܲܩܬܸܩ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl man dṭaleb bit shaqel, o haw dṭa'e bit machikh, o haw dtaqtiq bit paesh pteekha ileh.
ENG: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ؟ ܘܐܸܢ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܢܘܼܢܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܘܹܐ؟
TRL: ”O aynee baba minawkhoon, in brooneh ṭaleb mineh lakhma, bit yabil-leh kepa? O in ṭaleb mineh noena, bit yabil-leh khoewe?
ENG: And of which of you that is a father shall his son ask a loaf, and he give him a stone? or a fish, and he for a fish give him a serpent?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܹܥܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܩܸܪܒ݂ܵܐ؟
TRL: ”O in ṭaleb mineh be'ta, bit yabil-leh 'aqirwa?
ENG: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he give him a scorpion?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܡܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ؟“
TRL: ”Hadkha in akhtoon beeshe ke yad'eetoon leeawa mawhwate ṭabe lbnoonawkhoon, kma zawda babawkhoon dbshmaya bit yabil roekha dqoedsha lanee dṭalbee mineh?“
ENG: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

ASY: ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܪܫܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܲܪܫܵܐ، ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Paloeṭe ywa eeshoo' sheda min khad kharsha, min bar dpoeliṭ-leh sheda, hoemzim-leh haw kharsha, o 'oejib-lhoon kinshe.
ENG: And he was casting out a devil which was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb man spake; and the multitudes marveled.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena khakma min nashe meerhoon, ”aha bb'ilzwoow, goera dshede paloeṭe-yleh shede.“
ENG: But some of them said, By Beelzebub the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: O khene b'e-lhoon djarbee waw-leh, o ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dmakhze-lhoon neeshanqa min shmaya.
ENG: And others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܥܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܘܼܠܸܥܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܹܠ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' dee' leh khoeshabayhy, meereh ilayhy, ”kl malkoeta dpaysha poeli'ta 'al ganoeha bit kharwa, o kl bayta dpaesh poeli'a 'al ganeh bit napel.
ENG: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܹܗ؟ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”O in saṭana dalqoewl dsaṭana palekh, dakhee bit kalya malkoeteh? Akhtoon bemara ytoon dana bb'ilzwoow paloeṭe ywin shede,
ENG: And if Satan also is divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils by Beelzebub.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܥܸܠܙܒ݂ܘܿܒ݂ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ؟ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܲܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”In ana bb'ilzwoow paloeṭe ywin shede, bnoonawkhoon bmoodee ke palṭee-lhoon? Boet aha anee bit hawee ilawkhoon dayane.
ENG: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ، ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena in bkhayla dalaha paloeṭe ywin shede, qoerbinaha 'alawkhoon malkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: But if I by the finger of God cast out devils, then is the kingdom of God come upon you.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܲܕ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܘܟ̰ܘܼܟܒܸܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eeman dkhad khaylana o choekbina hawe binṭara bayteh, bshayna-yleh mindee-eh.
ENG: When the strong man fully armed guardeth his own court, his goods are in peace:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܓ݂ܵܠܹܒ ܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܟܠܹܗ ܙܲܝܢܹܗ ܕܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܣܠܵܒܬܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܠܸܥ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Eena in ate khad boesh khaylana mineh o ghaleb-leh, bit shaqel kleh zayneh dbhewee ywa 'aloehy, o slabteh bit pali' laha.
ENG: but when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him his whole armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܸܥ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܒܲܪܒܸܙ.
TRL: ”Man dle-yleh 'amee dalqoewlee-yleh, o man dla jami' 'amee ke barbiz.
ENG: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܛܲܡܐܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܪܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ، ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܢܝܵܚܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ، ’ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Eeman droekha ṭame palṭa min barnasha, ke khadra bdoekane dmeea layt gawayhy, biṭlaba nyakha. O eeman dle machkha nyakha, ke amra, ’bit dayran min ayka dpleeṭ-lee.‘
ENG: The unclean spirit when he is gone out of the man, passeth through waterless places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will turn back unto my house whence I came out.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܕܵܝܪܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܟܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܩܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”O eeman dke dayra, ke machkha-leh bayta kneesha o soeqla.
ENG: And when he is come, he findeth it swept and garnished.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܵܠ݇ܐ ܘܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܫܒܲܥ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܬܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܥܵܡܪܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܣܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Haygah ke aza o labla 'amoeha shba' roekhate khene boesh beeshe min ganoeha, o ke 'awree o 'amree tama, o ke hawya kharta dhaw nasha boesh sreeta min qamayta.“
ENG: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more evil than himself; and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man becometh worse than the first.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܠܘܼܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܩܲܡ ܛܵܥܢܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܒܸܙܵܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܲܡ ܡܲܡܸܨܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Kad haw hamzoeme ywa ane, moerim-laha qaloeha khda bakhta min gaw kinsha o meeraha, ”ṭoewa lkesa dqam ṭa'na-loekh, o lbizaze dqam mamiṣee-loekh.“
ENG: And it came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the breasts which thou didst suck.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh iloeha, ”ṭoewa boesh zawda lanee dsham'ee hemizman dalaha o naṭree-laha.“
ENG: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Kad jmee'e ywaw kinshe, meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”aha sharbta beeshta neeshanqa biṭlaba-ylaha, o neeshanqa le paesh yoewa iloeha shwooq min neeshanqa dyawnan nweea.
ENG: And when the multitudes were gathering together unto him, he began to say, This generation is an evil generation: it seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it but the sign of Jonah.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܢܵܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܢܝܼܢ̈ܘܵܝܹܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dhwe-leh yawnan neeshanqa lneenwaye, hadkha bit hawe oep broona dnasha neeshanqa-laha sharbta.
ENG: For even as Jonah became a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.

ASY: ”ܡܲܠܟܬܵܐ ܕܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܒܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܥܲܡ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪ̈ܙܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܥܵܐ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܕܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ، ܘܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Malkta dtaymna bit kalya bdeewan 'am nashe daha sharbta o bit dayna-lhoon, sabab te-laha min marzane dar'a dsham'a khikhmta dshleymoon, o lakha eet khad boesh goera min shleymoon.
ENG: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and shall condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܝܼܢܘܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܵܪܘܿܙܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܢ، ܘܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܢܵܢ.
TRL: ”nashe dneenwe bit qaymee byawma ddyanta 'am aha sharbta o bit daynee-laha, sabab anee toewib-lhoon bkaroozoeta dyawnan, o lakha eet khad boesh goera min yawnan.
ENG: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܗܹܐ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܛܲܫܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇، ܝܲܢ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܣܲܐܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܢܵܪܬܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܲܗܪܘܼܗ̇ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”nasha le malhe shraya o ṭashe-laha, yan matiw-laha tkhoot sata, ila 'al mnarta, qa dkhazee bahroeha anee d'awree.
ENG: No man, when he hath lighted a lamp, putteth it in a cellar, neither under the bushel, but on the stand, that they which enter in may see the light.

ASY: ”ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇. ܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܘܼܦ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܘܼܦ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܚܸܫܟܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Shraya dpaghroekh 'aynoekh eelaha. In 'aynoekh dkheeta-ylaha, oep paghroekh bit hawe bahrana, eena in 'aynoekh beeshta-ylaha, oep paghroekh khishkana-yleh.
ENG: The lamp of thy body is thine eye: when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when it is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܝܼ ܙܗܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܘܘܼܟ݂ ܚܸܫܟܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha hwee zheera dla hawe bahra dgawoekh khishkana.
ENG: Look therefore whether the light that is in thee be not darkness.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܠܲܝܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܒܲܗܪܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܫܲܦ̮ܩܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena in kleh paghroekh bahrana-yleh o layt bee-eh khishka, bit bahrin iloekh aykh shawqa dshraya.“
ENG: If therefore thy whole body be full of light, having no part dark, it shall be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining doth give thee light.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kad hamzoeme ywa eeshoo', ṭleeb-leh mineh khad preesha dakel 'ameh. O 'weereh lbayta o teew-leh.
ENG: Now as he spake, a Pharisee asketh him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw preesha 'oejib-leh eeman dkhze-leh deeshoo' la khoelil-leh min qam dakel wa.
ENG: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed before dinner.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܲܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܕܟܵܣܵܐ ܘܕܙܵܒ݂ܘܿܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܛܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܘܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ileh Maran, ”akhtoon preeshe ke dakeytoon lbadar dkasa o dzawoora, eena gawawkhoon milya-yleh khṭoepya o beeshta.
ENG: And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter; but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Ya sakhle, le ywa haw d'weed-leh lbadar oep lgawa haw 'weed-leh?
ENG: Ye foolish ones, did not he that made the outside make the inside also?

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܘܒܙܵܒ݂ܘܿܪܵܐ ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܒܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Mindee deet lawkhoon gaw kasa o bzawoora haloen birwana, o kl mindee khena bit hawe dikhya ilawkhoon.
ENG: Howbeit give for alms those things which are within; and behold, all things are clean unto you.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܢܥܵܐ ܘܦܸܓ݂ܢܵܐ ܘܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܲܪ̈ܩܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon preeshe, ke yaweetoon ma'sare dnan'a o pighna o dklayhy yarqe, eena ke shamṭeetoon deewan o khoeba dalaha. Ane wale ywa d'awdeetoon waw, o la shawqeetoon waw lanee khene.
ENG: But woe unto you Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and every herb, and pass over judgment and the love of God: but these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝ݇ܬܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܵܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon preeshe, ke makhibeetoon tawta bresha dknoeshyate o qabalta dshlama bshoeqe.
ENG: Woe unto you Pharisees! for ye love the chief seats in the synagogues, and the salutations in the marketplaces.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܲܒܝܸܢܝܼ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܪܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon sapre o preeshe, mashpirane, deetoon aykh qawre dle mabyinee, o nashe ke khadree 'alayhy o le yad'ee.“
ENG: Woe unto you! for ye are as the tombs which appear not, and the men that walk over them know it not.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܡܲܣܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh khad namoosaya o meereh, ”malpana, kad bemara ywit ane oep ilan masloeye ywit.“
ENG: And one of the lawyers answering saith unto him, Master, in saying this thou reproachest us also.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܛܥܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܵܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܝܲܩܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܸܒܥܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܩܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܵܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”oep akhtoon namoosaye way ilawkhoon, sabab ke maṭ'ineetoon lbnaynasha karate yaqoere, eena akhtoon oep bkhda min ṣib'atawkhoon le daqreetoon banee karate.
ENG: And he said, Woe unto you lawyers also! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܟܹܐ ܒܵܢܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon, dke baneytoon qawre qa nwee-e dpeesh-lhoon qṭeele byad awahatawkhoon.
ENG: Woe unto you! for ye build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܡܫܲܪܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ ܩܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Hadkha beeawa ytoon sahdoeta o msharoere ytoon lpoelkhana dawahatawkhoon. Anee qṭeel-lhoon lnwee-e, o akhtoon bibnaya qawrawatayhy.
ENG: So ye are witnesses and consent unto the works of your fathers: for they killed them, and ye build their tombs.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܹܗ، ’ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܟܲܡܪܝܼ ܘܩܵܛܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Boet aha meereh Alaha bkhikhmteh, ’ha ana shadoere ywin ilayhy nwee-e o shleekhe, minayhy bit kamree o qaṭlee.‘
ENG: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send unto them prophets and apostles; and some of them they shall kill and persecute;

ASY: ”ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܛܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܦܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”Dpaesh ṭleeba min aha sharbta dima dklayhy nwee-e dpeesh-leh shpeekha ha min shoeraya dbreeta,
ENG: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܒܹܝܠ ܗܲܠ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܙܟܲܪܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ. ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܛܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min dima dhabeyl hal dima dzkarya, haw dpeesh-leh qṭeela beyl haykla o madbkha. Shareeraeet bemara ywin ilawkhoon dbit paesh ṭleeba min aha sharbta.
ENG: from the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary: yea, I say unto you, it shall be required of this generation.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܫܩܝܼܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܕܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ. ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ، ܘܡܲܟܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Way ilawkhoon namoosaye, dshqeele ytoon qdeela dda'ta. Bganawkhoon le ytoon bi'wara, o makloeye ytoon lanee dba'ee 'awree.“
ENG: Woe unto you lawyers! for ye took away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܠܡܲܠܝܘܼܨܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min tama, shoere-lhoon sapre o preeshe lmalyoeṣeh raba dpalṭee mineh khabra boet raba mindeeane.
ENG: And when he was come out from thence, the scribes and the Pharisees began to press upon him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things;

ASY: ܘܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ، ܕܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O naṭree waw-leh dakhee dawqee waw-leh bhemizman min poemeh, ddaynee waw-leh.
ENG: laying wait for him, to catch something out of his mouth.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܓ̰ܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܸ̈ܒܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܒܸܕܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܠܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܲܫܦܲܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Bhay 'dana kad bijma'a ywaw ribwate dkinsha, hadkha dkhad bidyasha ywa lhaw khena, meereh eeshoo' qamayta ltalmeedoehy, ”hweymoen hishyar lganawkhoon min khmeera dpreeshe, deeleh mashparta.“
ENG: In the mean time, when the many thousands of the multitude were gathered together, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܣܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܛܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Layt mindee moeksa dla paesh gilya, o la mindee ṭoeshya dla paesh dee'a.
ENG: But there is nothing covered up, that shall not be revealed: and hid, that shall not be known.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܟܘܼܚܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܛܦܸܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܥܲܠ ܐ݇ܓܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab kl mindee dbkhishka amreetoon, bit paesh shmee'a bbahra, o mindee dbkoekhyate gaw natyate paṭpiṭeetoon, 'al garawate bit paesh moekriza.
ENG: Wherefore whatsoever ye have said in the darkness shall be heard in the light; and what ye have spoken in the ear in the inner chambers shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܪ̈ܵܚܡܝܼ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ،
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon aykh dlrakhmee, la zad'eetoon min anee dqaṭlee lpaghra o min bar hada le maṣee mindee zawda 'awdee,
ENG: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them which kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ: ܙܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܓܹܗܲܢܵܐ. ܗܹܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܙܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ.
TRL: ”Eena amrenawkhoon min manee zad'eetoon: zdi'moen min haw dmin bar dqaṭel eet-leh shoelṭana lidraya bgehana. He, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min haw zdi'moen.
ENG: But I will warn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.

ASY: ”ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܨܸܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܙܘܼܒܢܹܐ ܒܬܪܹܝ ܦܘܼܠܣܹ̈ܐ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܢܫܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khamsha ṣipre le payshee zoebne btrey poelse? Eena oep khad minayhy le paesh moensheea byad Alaha.
ENG: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings? and not one of them is forgotten in the sight of God.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܸܙܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܹܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ. ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܨܸܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O akhtoon oep mizyate dreshawkhoon minye yna. La zad'eetoon, min ṣipre boesh ṭeemane ytoon.
ENG: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not: ye are of more value than many sparrows.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܘܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܘܕܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl man dmawde beeee qam bnaynasha, oep broona dnasha bit mawde bee-eh qam malake dalaha.
ENG: And I say unto you, Every one who shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܵܪܹܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena man dsarew-lee qam bnaynasha, bit paesh sreewa qam malake dalaha.
ENG: but he that denieth me in the presence of men shall be denied in the presence of the angels of God.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܵܕܹܦ ܥܲܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl man dhamzim dalqoewl dbroona dnasha bit paesh poekhla, eena man dgadep 'al roekha dqoedsha le paesh poekhla.
ENG: And every one who shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Spirit it shall not be forgiven.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܘܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝܲܢ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Eeman dmaytee lawkhoon lknoeshyate o qam reshane o shaleeṭe, la akhleetoon kham dakhee yan moodee bit jawibeetoon yan amreetoon,
ENG: And when they bring you before the synagogues, and the rulers, and the authorities, be not anxious how or what ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Sabab roekha dqoedsha bit malip lawkhoon bhay 'dana mindee dwale-yleh damreetoon.“
ENG: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in that very hour what ye ought to say.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ ܕܦܲܠܸܥ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ileh khad nasha min gaw kinsha, ”malpana, moor lakhoonee dpali' 'amee yartoeta.“
ENG: And one out of the multitude said unto him, Master, bid my brother divide the inheritance with me.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܦܲܠܸܥܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”ya nasha, manee qam maqim-lee 'alawkhoon dayana o pali'ana?“
ENG: But he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܛܲܡܲܥܟܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”khzeymoen o hweymoen hishyar min klaha ṭama'karoeta, sabab le-ylaha bzawdoenyoeta ddawilta dke khaye nasha.“
ENG: And he said unto them, Take heed, and keep yourselves from all covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܪܥܹܗ ܡܲܗܨܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ،
TRL: O meereh ilayhy matla, ”khad nasha 'ateera moete-laha ileh ar'eh mahṣoele raba,
ENG: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:

ASY: ”ܬܘܼܚܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܢ ܡܲܗܨܘܼܠܝܼ̈.‘
TRL: ”Toekhmineh o meereh bganeh, ’moodee 'awden? Layt-lee doeka djam'in mahṣoelee.‘
ENG: and he reasoned within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have not where to bestow my fruits?

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ. ܒܸܬ ܬܵܠܚܹܢ ܐܲܢܒܵܪ̈ܝܼ، ܘܒܵܢܹܝܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܗܨܘܼܠܝܼ̈ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܝܼ،
TRL: ”O meereh, ’hadkha bit 'awden. Bit talkhen anbaree, o baneyn boesh goere, o bit jam'in tama klayhy mahṣoelee o kleh mindeeee,
ENG: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my corn and my goods.

ASY: ”’ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܠܓܵܢܝܼ، ܝܵܐ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܢܝܸܚܝ، ܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠܝ، ܘܫܬܝܼ ܘܡܲܒܣܸܡܝ.‘
TRL: ”’wbit amren lganee, ya ganee, eet lakhy raba mindeeane moetbe qa raba shine, manyikhy, khooly, o shtee o mabsimy.‘
ENG: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, be merry.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܝܵܐ ܣܪܝܼܩܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܢܵܐ، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܗܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ؟‘
TRL: ”Eena Alaha meereh ileh, ’ya sreeqa dhawna, baha layle bit shaqlee-laha ganoekh minoekh, o ane dhoedray ywit lmanee bit hawee?‘
ENG: But God said unto him, Thou foolish one, this night is thy soul required of thee; and the things which thou hast prepared, whose shall they be?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Hadkha-yleh haw dmatiw lganeh seemate, o lkis Alaha le-yleh 'ateera.“
ENG: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ،
TRL: O meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon, la akhleetoon kham boet ganawkhoon dmoodee bit akhleetoon, o la boet paghrawkhoon dmoodee bit lawsheetoon,
ENG: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Be not anxious for your life, what ye shall eat; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ، ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab gana boesh zawda-ylaha min mekhoelta, o paghra min lweeshta.
ENG: For the life is more than the food, and the body than the raiment.

ASY: ”ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܒܩܲܪ̈ܓܹܐ، ܕܠܹܐ ܙܵܪܥܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܝܼ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܐܲܢܒܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܬܲܪܣܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܟܡܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Gashqoen bqarge, dle zar'ee o le khaṣdee, o layt-lhoon doekane dshrayta o anbare, eena Alaha ke tarse-lhoon. Kma akhtoon boesh ṭeemane ytoon min ṭayre.
ENG: Consider the ravens, that they sow not, neither reap; which have no store-chamber nor barn; and God feedeth them: of how much more value are ye than the birds!

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܸܒ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܡܲܙܝܸܕ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܘܡܬܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Aynee minawkhoon kma djarib maṣe mazyid 'al qawmteh khda yameena?
ENG: And which of you by being anxious can add a cubit unto his stature?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ؟
TRL: ”In hadkha mindee z'oora le maṣeytoon 'awdeetoon, qamoodee boet mindeeane khene bekhala ytoon kham?
ENG: If then ye are not able to do even that which is least, why are ye anxious concerning the rest?

ASY: ”ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܒܫܘܿܫܲܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܓܲܪܘܸܣܝܼ. ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܥܵܙܠܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Gashqoen bshooshane dakhee ke garwisee. Le palkhee o le 'azlee. Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, oep shleymoon bkleh khiqreh le ywa lweesha aykh khad minayhy.
ENG: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they toil not, neither do they spin; yet I say unto you, Even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܒܸܫ ܠܓܸܠܵܐ ܕܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܬܲܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܠܒܸܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”In Alaha hadkha ke malbish lgila didyoom bkhaqla-yleh, o qaydamta ke paesh dirya btanoera, kma boesh zawda bit malbish lawkhoon akhtoon ya baṣoore dhaymanoeta?
ENG: But if God doth so clothe the grass in the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven; how much more shall he clothe you, O ye of little faith?

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܬܲܚܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ. ܠܵܐ ܫܵܓ݂ܫܝܼ ܚܘܼܫܵܒ݂ܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon la takhmineetoon moodee bit akhleetoon, yan moodee bit shateytoon. La shaghshee khoeshawawkhoon.
ENG: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, and what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܛܵܥܝܼ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Sabab ane klayhy imwate d'alma ke ṭa'ee barayhy. Eena babawkhoon ke yade' doep akhtoon sneeqe ytoon 'alayhy.
ENG: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: but your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena ṭlooboen malkoeta dalaha, o klayhy ane bit payshee moezyide ilawkhoon.
ENG: Howbeit seek ye his kingdom, and these things shall be added unto you.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ ܝܵܐ ܦܸܣܩܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”La zad'et ya pisqa z'oora, sabab bseem-laha-leh babawkhoon dyabil lawkhoon malkoeta.
ENG: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

ASY: ”ܙܲܒܢܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܐ. ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܝܼܣܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܒܵܠܝܼ، ܘܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܬܵܝܡܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܲܪܒܸܢ، ܘܡܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܚܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Zabnoen mindeeawkhoon o haloen irwana. 'woodoen lawkhoon keesyate dle balee, o seemta bshmaya dle tayma, ayka dgenawa le qarbin, o mrayta le makhriwa.
ENG: Sell that ye have, and give alms; make for yourselves purses which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief draweth near, neither moth destroyeth.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܣܝܼܡܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Sabab ayka deelaha seemtawkhoon, tama bit hawe oep libawkhoon.“
ENG: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

ASY: ”ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܨܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܪ̈ܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܘܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Hawee khaṣawkhoon seere o shrayatawkhoon bahroene.
ENG: Let your loins be girded about, and your lamps burning;

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܵܐܹܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܘܬܲܩܬܸܩ ܠܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܵܬܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hdeere aykh nashe dbispara lmarayhy. Eeman ddaer min khloela o taqtiq ltar'a, bjaldoeta patkhee-leh ileh tar'a.
ENG: and be ye yourselves like unto men looking for their lord, when he shall return from the marriage feast; that, when he cometh and knocketh, they may straightway open unto him.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܕܸܪ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܘܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lanee regawate eeman date marayhy o machikh-lhoon r'eeshe. Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bit matiw-lhoon o haw bit hadir ganeh o 'abed-lhoon khilmat.
ENG: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them sit down to meat, and shall come and serve them.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܒܲܕܠܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ، ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: ”O in ate bbadla dtartey yan dtlat o machikh-lhoon hdeere, ṭoewa lanee regawate.
ENG: And if he shall come in the second watch, and if in the third, and find them so, blessed are those servants.

ASY: ”ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܙܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”di'moen aha, in yade' wa mara dbayta baynee sa'at bit ate wa genawa, bit paesh wa r'eesha o le shabeq wa dpaesh wa bzee'a bayteh.
ENG: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not have left his house to be broken through.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Oep akhtoon hweymoen hadkha hdeere, sabab bsa'at dle khashweetoon bit ate broona dnasha.“
ENG: Be ye also ready: for in an hour that ye think not the Son of man cometh.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐܸܠܲܢ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh mineh shim'oon kepa, ”Maran, ilan eewit bemara aha matla yan lkl nasha?“
ENG: And Peter said, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even unto all?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܘܚܲܟܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܘܼܗ̇؟
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh Maran, ”manee-yleh mdabrana mhoemna o khakeema dmaqim-leh mareh 'al bnay bayteh, dyabil-lhoon mekhoelta b'danoeha?
ENG: And the Lord said, Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall set over his household, to give them their portion of food in due season?

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewa lhaw rega date mareh o machikh-leh bi'wada hadkha.
ENG: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ASY: ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bshareeroeta bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bit 'abed-leh mdabrana dkleh mindee-eh.
ENG: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will set him over all that he hath.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ ܥܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ،‘ ܘܫܲܪܹܐ ܠܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܘܠܚܹܕܲܡܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܲܪܹܐ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ ܘܠܸܪܘܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”Eena in amer haw rega bganeh, ’maree 'oerqil-leh letaya,‘ o share limkhaya lregawate o lkhedamyate, o share lekhala o lishtaya o lirwaya,
ENG: But if that servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܒ݂ ܘܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܹܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܚܲܫܒܸܢܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Bit ate mara dhaw rega byawma dle khashew o bsa'at dle yade', o bit qaṭel-leh, o bit khashbineh 'am danee la mhoemne.
ENG: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he expecteth not, and in an hour when he knoweth not, and shall cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the unfaithful.

ASY: ”ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܹܥ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܕܸܪ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ ܒܵܥܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Rega dyade' ṣiwyana dmareh eena la hadir ganeh o la 'abed aykh dmareh ba'e, bit paesh mikhya raba.
ENG: And that servant, which knew his lord’s will, and made not ready, nor did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܘܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܡܚܵܝܬܵܐ، ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܛܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw dle yade' o 'abed mindee dkhashekh lmkhayta, baṣoora bit paesh mikhya. Sabab man dpeesh-leh yoewa ileh raba, raba bit paesh ṭleeba mineh, o lhaw dpeesh-leh soepya ileh raba, raba bit ṭalbee mineh.
ENG: but he that knew not, and did things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. And to whomsoever much is given, of him shall much be required: and to whom they commit much, of him will they ask the more.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܟܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܠܗܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”te-lee ddareyn noera lar'a, o kma bit basma wa-lee in min jalde hawe wa bilhaya.
ENG: I came to cast fire upon the earth; and what will I, if it is already kindled?

ASY: ”ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗܲܠ ܕܬܲܡܸܡܸܢܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Ma'moodeeta eet-lee dpayshen moe'mida beeoeha, o raba janjoere ywin hal dtamiminaha.
ENG: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!

ASY: ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ؟ ܠܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bikhshawa ytoon te-lee ddareyn shlama lar'a? La, ila te-lee ddareyn poelagha.
ENG: Think ye that I am come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܬܪܹܝ، ܘܬܪܹܝ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min adeea bit hawee khamsha gaw khad bayta, tlata bit hawee dalqoewl trey, o trey dalqoewl tlata.
ENG: for there shall be from henceforth five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܒܪܵܬܘܼܗ̇، ܘܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܝܸܡܘܼܗ̇، ܚܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܟܲܠܬܘܼܗ̇، ܘܟܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܚܡܵܬܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Bit qaem baba dalqoewl dbroona, o broona dalqoewl dbaboehy, yima dalqoewl dbratoeha, o brata dalqoewl dyimoeha, khmata dalqoewl dkaltoeha, o kalta dalqoewl dkhmatoeha.“
ENG: They shall be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother in law against her daughter in law, and daughter in law against her mother in law.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ،
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lkinshe, ”eeman dkhazeytoon 'nana besaqa min ma'rwa, ke amreetoon, ’bit atya miṭra,‘ o ke atya miṭra,
ENG: And he said to the multitudes also, When ye see a cloud rising in the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it cometh to pass.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܵܚܹܐ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܕܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܚܸܡܵܐ،‘ ܘܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܚܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O eeman dmakhe pawkha dtaymna, ke amreetoon, ’bit hawe khima,‘ o ke hawe khima.
ENG: And when ye see a south wind blowing, ye say, There will be a scorching heat; and it cometh to pass.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܪܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܦܪܵܫܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ya mashpirane, pata dar'a o dshmaya ke yad'eetoon dparsheetoon, eena dakhee le ytoon biprasha-laha zawna?
ENG: Ye hypocrites, ye know how to interpret the face of the earth and the heaven; but how is it that ye know not how to interpret this time?

ASY: ”ܘܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”O qamoodee bganawkhoon le ytoon bidyana dyanta dzadeeqoeta?
ENG: And why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ ܥܲܡ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܗܹܫ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܓ̰ܲܪܸܒ ܕܣܲܙܓܸܪܸܬ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܕܦܵܪܩܹܬ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܕܠܵܐ ܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܸܣ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ، ܘܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ، ܘܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dazet 'am dishminoekh ldeewan, hesh at 'ameh ywit boerkha, jarib dsazgirit 'ameh qa dparqet mineh, dla labil-loekh lkis dayana, o dayana sape-loekh lnaṭoora, o naṭoora dare-loekh gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: For as thou art going with thine adversary before the magistrate, on the way give diligence to be quit of him; lest haply he hale thee unto the judge, and the judge shall deliver thee to the officer, and the officer shall cast thee into prison.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܛܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܪܥܹܬ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin iloekh, dle palṭet min tama hal dpar'et zoeza kharaya.“
ENG: I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou have paid the very last mite.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܕܸܒ݂ܚܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana te-lhoon nashe o meerhoon leeshoo' boet gleelaye, anee dpeelaṭoos gweel-leh dimayhy bdiwkhayhy.
ENG: Now there were some present at that very season which told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”bikhshawa ytoon danee gleelaye boesh khaṭaye ywaw min klayhy gleelaye dhadkha qoewim-leh ilayhy?
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, Think ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they have suffered these things?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܬܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”La. Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, oep akhtoon hadkha bit ṭalqeetoon in la tawibeetoon.
ENG: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all in like manner perish.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܡܵܢܸܥܣܲܪ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܪܓ̰ܵܐ ܒܫܝܼܠܘܿܚܵܐ، ܘܩܛܝܼܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ؟
TRL: ”Yan anee tmani'sar dnpeel-leh 'alayhy boerja bsheelookha, o qṭeelay-leh, bikhshawa ytoon boesh khaṭaye ywaw min klayhy 'amrane dgaw oorishlim?
ENG: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them, think ye that they were offenders above all the men that dwell in Jerusalem?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܬܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”La. Eena bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in la tawibeetoon, klawkhoon hadkha bit ṭalqeetoon.“
ENG: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܡܹܗ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' aha matla, ”khad nasha eet wa-leh khad eelana dtene nṣeewa gaw karmeh. te-leh biṭ'aya bee-eh ṭ'oenyate o la moechikh-leh.
ENG: And he spake this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came seeking fruit thereon, and found none.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܵܐ، ’ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܠܵܬ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ. ܦܪܘܿܡ ܠܹܗ. ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܒܛܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”meereh lpalakha, ’ane tlat shine betaya ywin biṭ'aya ṭ'oenyate baha eelana dtene o le ywin machoekhe. Proom-leh. Qamoodee mabṭoele-yleh lar'a?‘
ENG: And he said unto the vinedresser, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why doth it also cumber the ground?

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܠܵܚܵܐ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܕܚܵܦܪܹܢ ܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܙܸܒܠܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬܘܼܗܝ،
TRL: ”Joewib-leh palakha, ’maree, shwooq-leh oep aha sheta, hal dkhapren khadirwanoehy o dareyn zibla tkhootoehy,
ENG: And he answering saith unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung it:

ASY: ”’ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܕܲܥܬܝܼܕ، ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܵܪܡܹܬ ܠܹܗ.‘“
TRL: ”’qawma d'abed ṭ'oenyate bda'teed, o in la, haygah parmet-leh.‘“
ENG: and if it bear fruit thenceforth, well; but if not, thou shalt cut it down.

ASY: ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Maloepe ywa eeshoo' byawma dshabta gaw khda min knoeshyate,
ENG: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath day.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܬܡܵܢܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ. ܟܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܩܬܵܐ.
TRL: O ha, eet wa khda bakhta tama deet wa-laha roekha dmar'a tmani'sar shine. Keepta ywa o le maṣya wa kalya psheeqta.
ENG: And behold, a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years; and she was bowed together, and could in no wise lift herself up.

ASY: ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܦܘܼܫܝ ܒܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܥܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: Khizya-leh eeshoo', qirya-leh lkis-leh o meereh iloeha, ”bakhta, poeshy bseemta min mar'akhy.“
ENG: And when Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.

ASY: ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇، ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Moetiw-leh eedeh 'aloeha, o bhay 'dana psheeq-laha, o shoebikh-laha lalaha.
ENG: And he laid his hands upon her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ، ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena goera dknoeshta, kad khze-leh dboesim-leh eeshoo' byawma dshabta, joewib-leh bkarba lkinshe o meereh, ”ishta yawmane eet liplakha, bane yawmane ateytoon o paysheetoon bseeme, o la byawma dshabta.“
ENG: And the ruler of the synagogue, being moved with indignation because Jesus had healed on the sabbath, answered and said to the multitude, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the day of the sabbath.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܪܹܐ ܬܵܘܪܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܚܡܵܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܼܪܹܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܘܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܫܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh Maran o meereh ileh, ”ya mashpirane, kl khad minawkhoon le share tawreh yan khmareh min oere byawma dshabta o labil-leh dmashte-leh?
ENG: But the Lord answered him, and said, Ye hypocrites, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܬܡܵܢܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܸܣܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Aha brata dawraham, seera-leh saṭana tmani'sar shine, le ywa ananqayta dpaysha wa shreeta min aha isoera byawma dshabta?“
ENG: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound, lo, these eighteen years, to have been loosed from this bond on the day of the sabbath?

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܢܵܟ݂ܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kad hamzim wa hadkha nakhpee waw klayhy anee dqaymee waw ldalqoewleh. Eena kleh kinsha ke khade wa bklayhy doemare d'abed wa.
ENG: And as he said these things, all his adversaries were put to shame: and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܕܡܹܝܢܵܗ̇؟
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”lmoodee ke damya malkoeta dalaha, o lmoodee madmeynaha?
ENG: He said therefore, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I liken it?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܠܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܪܕܲܠ ܕܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܲܢܬܹܗ، ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܢܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܢܵܐ ܒܦܲܥܘܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Ke damya ldandikta dkhardal dshqeela-leh nasha o zree'a-leh bganteh, goerwis-laha o hwe-laha eelana goera, o ṭayre dshmaya bne-lhoon qina bpa'wanoehy.“
ENG: It is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his own garden; and it grew, and became a tree; and the birds of the heaven lodged in the branches thereof.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܕܡܹܝܢܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟
TRL: Mindrish meereh eeshoo', ”lmoodee madmeynaha malkoeta dalaha?
ENG: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܝܵܐ ܠܚܡܝܼܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܟܝܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܲܡܚܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܚܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Ke damya lkhmeera, haw dshqeel-laha bakhta o moetiw-laha gaw tlata kyoele dqamkha hal dkhmee' leh kleh.“
ENG: It is like unto leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till it was all leavened.

ASY: ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Maloepe ywa eeshoo' gaw matwate o mdeenate boerkheh kad bezala loorishlim.
ENG: And he went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and journeying on unto Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܵܪܩܝܼ؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O meereh ileh khad nasha, ”Maran, baṣoore yna anee dparqee?“ o haw joewib-leh ilayhy,
ENG: And one said unto him, Lord, are they few that be saved? And he said unto them,

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܲܪܒܘܼܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܒܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܥܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ.
TRL: ”Jarboen li'wara btar'a 'eeqa, sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon, raba bit ba'ee li'wara o le maṣee.
ENG: Strive to enter in by the narrow door: for many, I say unto you, shall seek to enter in, and shall not be able.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܕܵܒܹܪ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܬܲܩܬܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܦܬܘܿܚ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ.‘ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Eeman dqaem mara dbayta o daber tar'a, haygah bit shareytoon liklaya lbadar o taqtoeqe ltar'a o bemara, ’Maran, Maran, ptookh tar'a ilan.‘ o haw bit jawib ilawkhoon, ’le yad'enawkhoon, min ayka ytoon.‘
ENG: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, open to us; and he shall answer and say to you, I know you not whence ye are;

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܘܫܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ، ܘܒܥܵܠܘܿܠܵܢܲܢ̈ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”Haygah bit shareytoon lemara, ’lkis-loekh kheel lan o shte lan, o b'aloolanan moelip-loekh.‘
ENG: then shall ye begin to say, We did eat and drink in thy presence, and thou didst teach in our streets;

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ. ܪܚܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܝܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O haw bit jawib lawkhoon, ’bemara ywin ilawkhoon dle yad'en min ayka ytoon. Rkhooqoen minee ya palakhe d'awla.‘
ENG: and he shall say, I tell you, I know not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.

ASY: ”ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܚܲܪܚܲܟ̰ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܟܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܠܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܛܪܝܼܕܹܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ.
TRL: ”Tama bit hawe bikhya o kharkhachta dkeke eeman dkhazeytoon lawraham o leeskhaq o lya'qoow o lklayhy nwee-e gaw malkoeta dalaha, eena akhtoon peeshe ṭreede lbadar.
ENG: There shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and yourselves cast forth without.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܕܢܚܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܲܪܒܝܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit atee min madnkha o min ma'rwa o min taymna o min garbya, o bit yatwee gaw malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And they shall come from the east and west, and from the north and south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

ASY: ”ܘܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O ha kharaye bit hawee qamaye, o qamaye bit hawee kharaye.“
ENG: And behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܦܠܘܿܛ ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܡܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Bhaw yawma te-lhoon nashe min preeshe o meerhoon leeshoo', ”plooṭ o ze makha, sabab heroodis ba'e dqaṭel-loekh.“
ENG: In that very hour there came certain Pharisees, saying to him, Get thee out, and go hence: for Herod would fain kill thee.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܥܠܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܹܐܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܘܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܡܸܡܸܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”zemoen o mooroen lhaw ta'la, ana paloeṭe ywin shede o basoeme ywin idyoom o qaydamta, o byawma dtlata bit tamimin poelkhanee.
ENG: And he said unto them, Go and say to that fox, Behold, I cast out devils and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I am perfected.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܘܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܘܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܦܵܠܚܹܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: ”Eena wale-ylaha ilee didyoom o qaydamta o yawma khena palkhen, sabab nwee-e ke payshee qṭeele akhchee gaw oorishlim.
ENG: Howbeit I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܩܵܛܠܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܵܓ̰ܡܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܗ̇، ܟܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܝܼ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܸܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܵܟ݂ܝ̈ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܟܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܵܐ ܙܲܥܝܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܓܘܼܠܦܵܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ya oorishlim, oorishlim, qaṭlanta dnwee-e o rajmanta danee deena shoedre lkis loeha, kma gahe bseem-laha-lee djam'in bnoonakhy aykh ktayta djam'a za'yoeha tkhoot goelpanoeha, o akhtoon la bseem-laha lawkhoon.
ENG: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killeth the prophets, and stoneth them that are sent unto her! how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her own brood under her wings, and ye would not!

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܵܪܵܒܵܐ. ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ’ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.‘“
TRL: ”Bit paesh shweeqa baytawkhoon kharaba. O bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dle khazeytoon-lee hal date zawna damreetoon, ’breekha-yleh haw date bshima dmarya.‘“
ENG: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: 'weereh eeshoo' lbayta dkhad min goerane dpreeshe dakel wa lakhma byawma dshabta, o anee naṭree waw ileh.
ENG: And it came to pass, when he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a sabbath to eat bread, that they were watching him.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ، ܙܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: O eet wa tama qamoehy khad nasha mree'a, zeera min meea.
ENG: And behold, there was before him a certain man which had the dropsy.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh eeshoo' min namoosaye o preeshe o meereh, ”qanoonayta-ylaha lbasoeme byawma dshabta yan la?“
ENG: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath, or not?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܫܬܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ.
TRL: Eena anee shteeq-lhoon. Dweeq-leh o boesim-leh, o shweeq-leh dazel.
ENG: But they held their peace. And he took him, and healed him, and let him go.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܬܵܘܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܐܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܦܲܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”aynee minawkhoon in napel brooneh yan tawreh gaw bera byawma dshabta, le paliṭ-leh har bhay 'dana?“
ENG: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a well, and will not straightway draw him up on a sabbath day?

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O la mṣe-lhoon jawibee ileh boet aha.
ENG: And they could not answer again unto these things.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܓܲܒܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: meereh aha matla lanee deewaw cheede, sabab bikhzaya ywa dakhee gaboeye ywaw doekane bresha dmishtoeyate. meereh ilayhy,
ENG: And he spake a parable unto those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief seats; saying unto them,

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܝܵܬܒܹܬ ܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: ”Eeman dpayshet cheeda lkhloela byad nasha, la yatbet bresha dmishtoeta, dla hawya khad khena boesh mare eeqara minoekh paesh cheeda tama,
ENG: When thou art bidden of any man to a marriage feast, sit not down in the chief seat; lest haply a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him,

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ’ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܕܘܼܟܘܼܟ݂ ܩܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ،‘ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܒܹܬ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ate haw deeleh cheedawkhoon o amer iloekh, ’hal doekoekh qa aha,‘ haygah bnkheepta bit yatbet bdoeka kheta.
ENG: and he that bade thee and him shall come and say to thee, Give this man place; and then thou shalt begin with shame to take the lowest place.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܵܐ، ܙܹܠ݇ ܘܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟ̰ܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ’ܚܲܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܐ݇ܣܘܿܩ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ.‘ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܨܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Eeman dpayshet cheeda, ze o toow bkharta dklayhy, o eeman date haw dcheedoekh eeleh, bit amer iloekh, ’khawree, sooq l'ilil.‘ haygah bit hawe-loekh eeqara qam klayhy anee dteebe yna lṣoepra 'amoekh.
ENG: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest place; that when he that hath bidden thee cometh, he may say to thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have glory in the presence of all that sit at meat with thee.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܕܡܲܪܸܡ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܸܦܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܕܡܲܟܸܦ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab kl dmarim ganeh bit paesh moekipa, o kl dmakip ganeh bit paesh moerma.“
ENG: For every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܫܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܟ̰ܵܝܕܹܬ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܘܼܟ݂، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܝܲܢ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܝܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܟ̰ܵܝܕܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܡܲܕܸܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: O meereh lmara dbayta, ”eeman d'awdet sharoeta yan kharamsha, la chaydet khawrawatoekh, oep la akhoonwatoekh, yan khizmanoekh, yan shwawoekh 'ateere, dla hawya oep anee chaydee-loekh o madiree-leh poer'anoekh.
ENG: And he said to him also that had bidden him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, nor thy kinsmen, nor rich neighbours; lest haply they also bid thee again, and a recompense be made thee.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܐܲܪܚܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܪܝܼ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܣܲܩܲܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman d'awdet arkhoeta, qree lmiskene, o lsaqate, o lshpeele o lsimye.
ENG: But when thou makest a feast, bid the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܪܥܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܦܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Ṭoewa iloekh dlayt-lhoon dpar'ee-loekh, sabab bit payshet pree'a bqyamta dzadeeqe.“
ENG: and thou shalt be blessed; because they have not wherewith to recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed in the resurrection of the just.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Khad min anee deewa teebe, eeman dshmee' leh ane hemizmane, meereh ileh, ”ṭoewa lman dakel mekhoelta gaw malkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”khad nasha 'weed-leh kharamsha goerta o qre-leh raba arkhe.
ENG: But he said unto him, A certain man made a great supper; and he bade many:

ASY: ”ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܹܗ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ، ’ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”O shoedireh regeh b'dana dkharamsha damer wa lanee deewaw cheede, ’teymoen, adeea kl mindee hoedra-yleh.‘
ENG: and he sent forth his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

ASY: ”ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܚܲܕ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܵܐ ܡܵܗܵܢܵܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ’ܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܘܚܵܙܹܝܢܵܗ̇. ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܦܲܚܠܸܬ ܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”O shoere-lhoon khad bkhad lidwaqa mahana. meereh ileh haw qamaya, ’zweena ywin khaqla, wale-ylaha dazen o khazeynaha. Bib'aya ywin minoekh dpakhlit-lee.‘
ENG: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a field, and I must needs go out and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܙܵܘܓܹ̈ܐ ܬܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ. ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܦܲܚܠܸܬ ܠܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Haw khena meereh, ’zweena ywin khamsha zawge tawre, o bezala ywin djarbinhoon. Biṭlaba ywin minoekh dpakhlit-lee.‘
ENG: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.

ASY: ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ.‘
TRL: ”Khad khena meereh, ’adeea ywin gweera, boet aha le maṣeyn ateyn.‘
ENG: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܹܗ. ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܪܹܓܹܗ، ’ܦܠܘܿܛ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܩܘܼܪ̈ܢܝܼܵܬܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡܲܥܒܸܪ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܣܲܩܲܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”te-leh haw rega o moedi' leh lmareh. Kreeb-leh mara dbayta, o meereh lregeh, ’plooṭ jalde l'aloole o lqoerneeate dmdeeta, o ma'bir lakha lmiskene, o lsaqate, o lsimye o lshpeele.‘
ENG: And the servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor and maimed and blind and lame.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܗܹܫ ܐܝܼܬ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O meereh rega, ’maree, 'weed-lee aykh dpqeed-loekh, o hesh eet doeka.‘
ENG: And the servant said, Lord, what thou didst command is done, and yet there is room.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܪܹܓܵܐ، ’ܦܠܘܿܛ ܠܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܘܠܒܹܝܬ ܣܝܵܓܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܥܒܸܕ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܝܼ.
TRL: ”O meereh mara lrega, ’plooṭ loerkhate o lbeyt syage, o ma'bid lnashe d'awree, dpaesh milya baytee.
ENG: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and constrain them to come in, that my house may be filled.

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܝܼ.‘“
TRL: ”’sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon, oep khad min anee nashe dcheede ywaw le ṭa'em-laha kharamshee.‘“
ENG: For I say unto you, that none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Kad bezala ywaw 'am eeshoo' kinshe raba, deereh o meereh ilayhy,
ENG: Now there went with him great multitudes: and he turned, and said unto them,

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܘܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܠܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܠܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Man date baree o la sane lbaboehy, o lyimeh, o lakhoonwateh o lkhatwateh, o lbakhteh o lbnoonoehy, o oep lganeh, le maṣe hawe ilee talmeeda.
ENG: If any man cometh unto me, and hateth not his own father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ ܘܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”O man dla shaqel zqeepeh o ate baree, le maṣe hawe ilee talmeeda.
ENG: Whosoever doth not bear his own cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܒܵܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܪܓ̰ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܚܲܫܒܸܢ ܢܲܦܩܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܕܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܡܘܼܡܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Aynee minawkhoon in ba'e bane boerja, le yatew qamayta o khashbin napqateh, din eet-leh ltamoemeh?
ENG: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doth not first sit down and count the cost, whether he have wherewith to complete it?

ASY: ”ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܒܸܢܝܲܬ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܬܲܡܸܡ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܫܲܪܝܼ ܡܲܣܚܘܼܪܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Dla hawya dmatiw binyat o la maṣe tamim, o klayhy anee dkhazee-leh sharee maskhoere bee-eh.
ENG: Lest haply, when he hath laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, all that behold begin to mock him,

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܲܡܘܼܡܹܐ.‘
TRL: ”Bit amree, ’aha nasha shoere-leh libnaya o la mṣe-leh ltamoeme.‘
ENG: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܸܦܠܵܫܵܐ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܚܲܫܒܸܢ ܕܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܒܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܠܹܫ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܥܸܣܪܝܼ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: ”Yan aynee malka dazel liplasha ldalqoewl dkhad malka khena, le yatew qamayta o khashbin din maṣe b'isra alpe palesh 'am haw date 'aloehy b'isree alpe?
ENG: Or what king, as he goeth to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ، ܗܹܫ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܐܝܼܙܓܲܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”In yade' dle maṣe, hesh haw rikhqa mineh, bit shadir eezgade d'abed shlama 'ameh.
ENG: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and asketh conditions of peace.

ASY: ”ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܟܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”O hadkha kl khad minawkhoon, in la shabeq kleh mindee-eh, le maṣe hawe ilee talmeeda.
ENG: So therefore whosoever he be of you that renounceth not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.

ASY: ”ܡܸܠܚܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܦܵܝܟܵܐ ܡܸܠܚܵܐ، ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܡܠܸܚܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Milkha ṣpayee-ylaha, eena in payka milkha, bmoodee bit paysha moemlikhta?
ENG: Salt therefore is good: but if even the salt have lost its savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܙܸܒܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ. ܟܹܐ ܪܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܫܵܡܹܥ.“
TRL: ”La qa ar'a o la qa zibla eet-laha yoetrana. Ke rapee-laha lbadar. Man deet-leh natyate lishma'a, shame'.“
ENG: It is fit neither for the land nor for the dunghill: men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' makhse o khaṭaye dsham'ee waw-leh.
ENG: Now all the publicans and sinners were drawing near unto him for to hear him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: Eena sapre o preeshe ṭoerṭim-lhoon o meerhoon, ”aha nasha qaboele-yleh khaṭaye o bekhala-yleh 'amayhy.“
ENG: And both the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ:
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo' aha matla:
ENG: And he spake unto them this parable, saying,

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ، ܐܸܢ ܛܵܠܹܩ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܬܸܫܥܝܼ ܘܬܸܫܥܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ ܛܵܥܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Aynee-yleh minawkhoon dhawe-leh ima 'irbe, in ṭaleq khad minayhy le shabeq tish'ee o tish'a gaw bareea o azel ṭa'e bar dhaw deeleh ṭleeqa hal dmachikh-leh?
ENG: What man of you, having a hundred sheep, and having lost one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܪ̈ܘܼܦ̮ܫܵܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”O eeman dmachikh-leh, ke khade o ke shaqel-leh 'al roewshanoehy.
ENG: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܘܩܵܪܹܐ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܚܕܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܥܸܪܒܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Ke ate lbayteh o qare lkhawrawateh o lshwawoehy, o amer ilayhy, ’khdeymoen 'amee dmoechikh-lee 'irbee deewa ṭleeqa.‘
ENG: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and his neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܕܬܲܘܸܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܠ ܬܸܫܥܝܼ ܘܬܸܫܥܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܬܵܘܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, hadkha bit hawya khadoeta boesh zawda gaw shmaya 'al khad khaṭaya dtawib min 'al tish'ee o tish'a zadeeqe dle yna sneeqe ltawabta.
ENG: I say unto you, that even so there shall be joy in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine righteous persons, which need no repentance.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܲܠܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܗܝܼܵܐ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܟܵܢܫܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܛܵܥܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܒܚܦܝܼܛܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Yan aynee bakhta dhawe-laha 'isra zoeze o ṭalqa khad minayhy, le malheea shraya o kansha bayta o ṭa'ya bareh bkhpeeṭoeta hal dmachkha-leh?
ENG: Or what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a lamp, and sweep the house, and seek diligently until she find it?

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܩܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܒܲܪ̈ܝܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܘܠܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܝܵܬܘܼ̈ܗ̇ ܘܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܚܕܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܙܘܼܙܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O eeman dmachkha-leh, ke qarya lkhabaryatoeha o lshwawyatoeha o amra ilayhy, ’khdeymoen 'amee sabab moechikh-lee zoezee deewa ṭleeqa.‘
ENG: And when she hath found it, she calleth together her friends and neighbours, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the piece which I had lost.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܕܬܲܘܸܒ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, hadkha bit hawya khadoeta qam malake dalaha 'al khad khaṭaya dtawib.“
ENG: Even so, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Mindrish meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”khad nasha eet wa-leh trey bnoone.
ENG: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ’ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܛܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.‘ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”meereh broona z'oora lbaboehy, ’babee, hal-lee sahma dmaṭe-lee min mindee.‘ o poeli' leh beylayhy mindee-eh.
ENG: and the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of thy substance that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܒܫܪܝܼܚܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar khakma yawmane joemi' leh haw broona z'oora kl mindee dmṭe-leh ileh o zeel-leh latra rikhqa, o tama boerbiz-leh mindee-eh kad bikhaya bshreekhoeta.
ENG: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country; and there he wasted his substance with riotous living.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܘܼܪܸܓ̰ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܣܢܵܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar dkhoerij-leh kl mindee deet wa-leh, hwe-leh kipna goera gaw haw atra, o haw shoere-leh lisnaqa.
ENG: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that country; and he began to be in want.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܙܘܼܘܸܓ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܩܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܪܥܹܐ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”zeel-leh o zoewig-leh 'am khad min bnay haw atra, o haw shoedireh ileh lkhaqleh dmar'e khzoere.
ENG: And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
