ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܫܲܗܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܡܠܵܝܵܐ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܪ̈ܘܼܒܹܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܙܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ke shahwit wa limlaya keseh min anee kharoebe dakhlee waw khzoere. O nasha le yabil wa-leh mindee lekhala.
ENG: And he would fain have been filled with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܟܡܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܙܵܐܹܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܡܝܵܬܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܦܢܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eeman dr'eesh-leh lganeh, meereh, ’kma palakhe dweeqe bhaqa eet gaw bayta dbabee dke zaed min qamayhy lakhma, o ana lakha bimyata ywin min kipnee.
ENG: But when he came to himself he said, How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish here with hunger!

ASY: ”’ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܹܢ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܚܛܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”’bit qaymen o azen lkis babee, o bit amren ileh, babee, khṭe-lee qam shmaya o qamoekh,
ENG: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight:

ASY: ”’ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂. ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܲܠܵܚܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’wmin adeea le ywin khsheekha dpayshen qirya broonoekh. 'wood-lee aykh khad min palakhoekh dweeqe bhaqa.‘
ENG: I am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

ASY: ”ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܘܗܹܫ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܪܘܼܚܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܢܫܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Qeem-leh o te-leh lkis baboehy, o hesh haw rikhqa ywa, khze-leh ileh baboehy o roekhim-leh 'aloehy, o rkheeṭ-leh o khpeeq-leh ileh o nsheeq-leh.
ENG: And he arose, and came to his father. But while he was yet afar off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ’ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܚܛܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”O meereh ileh brooneh, ’babee, khṭe-lee qam shmaya o qamoekh, min adeea le khashkhen dpayshen qirya broonoekh.‘
ENG: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight: I am no more worthy to be called thy son.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ’ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܲܠܛܘܼܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܒܵܐ ܪܹܫܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܒܸܫܘܼܢ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܡܚܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܥܸܙܲܩܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ، ܘܡܲܠܒܸܫܘܼܢ ܨܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ،
TRL: ”Eena meereh baboehy lregawateh, ’bjaldoeta palṭoen joeba reshayta o malbishoen-laha 'aloehy, o mkheymoen 'izaqta beedeh, o malbishoen ṣawle baqlateh,
ENG: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth quickly the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:

ASY: ”’ܘܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܪܘܿܡܘܼܢ ܬܵܘܪܵܐ ܛܪܝܼܨܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܲܚ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: ”’wmayteymoen o proomoen tawra ṭreeṣa dakhlakh o 'awdakh boesama,
ENG: and bring the fatted calf, and kill it, and let us eat, and make merry:

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܚܝܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܫ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܚܵܐ.‘ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”’sabab aha broonee meeta ywa o khye-leh, ṭleeqa ywa o peesh-leh mcheekha.‘ o shoere-lhoon li'wada boesama.
ENG: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܙܡܵܪܵܐ ܘܪܸܩܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Brooneh goera gaw khaqla ywa, o eeman dte-leh o qoerbineh lbayta, shmee' leh qala dzmara o riqda.
ENG: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing.

ASY: ”ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”Qre-leh khad min regawate o boeqireh mineh, ’moodee-yleh aha?‘
ENG: And he called to him one of the servants, and inquired what these things might be.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܦܪܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܘܪܵܐ ܛܪܝܼܨܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܵܝܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ileh, ’akhoonoekh te-leh, o baboekh preem-leh tawra ṭreeṣa, sabab qoebil-leh ileh khaya.‘
ENG: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.

ASY: ”ܟܪܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ. ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kreeb-leh broona goera o le ba'e wa li'wara. Pleeṭ-leh baboehy o poerpil-leh bee-eh.
ENG: But he was angry, and would not go in: and his father came out, and entreated him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ’ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ، ܘܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܡܝܼܛܵܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܓܸܕܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܡܲܒܣܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena haw joewib-leh o meereh lbaboehy, ’ane kma shine biplakha ywin iloekh aykh khad 'awda, o hich le ywin shmeeṭa poeqdanoekh, eena oep khad gidya le ywit yoewa ilee dmabsimin 'am khawrawatee.
ENG: But he answered and said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, and I never transgressed a commandment of thine: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:

ASY: ”’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡ ܙܵܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܡ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܵܘܪܵܐ ܛܪܝܼܨܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’eena aha broonoekh dboerbiz-leh mindeeoekh 'am zanyate, eeman dte-leh preem-loekh ileh tawra ṭreeṣa.‘
ENG: but when this thy son came, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou killedst for him the fatted calf.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ’ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”meereh ileh baboehy, ’broonee, at bkl 'dana 'amee ywit, o kl mindee deet-lee deeoekh eeleh.
ENG: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that is mine is thine.

ASY: ”’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ ܘܠܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܚܝܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܫ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܚܵܐ.‘“
TRL: ”’eena wale ywa ilan li'wada boesama o likhdaya, sabab aha akhoonoekh meeta ywa o khye-leh, ṭleeqa ywa o peesh-leh mcheekha.‘“
ENG: But it was meet to make merry and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܒ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܒܲܪܒܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”eet wa khad nasha 'ateera, o eet wa-leh rab bayta, haw dqweel-lhoon 'aloehy dbarboeze ywa mindee dmareh.
ENG: And he said also unto the disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he was wasting his goods.

ASY: ”ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂؟ ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܚܸܫܒܘܼܢܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Qre-leh mareh o meereh ileh, ’moodee-yleh aha dbishma'a ywin boet deeoekh? Hal-lee khishboena dpoelkhanoekh, sabab min adeea le maṣeyt haweyt ilee rab bayta.‘
ENG: And he called him, and said unto him, What is this that I hear of thee? render the account of thy stewardship; for thou canst be no longer steward.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ؟ ܡܵܪܝܼ ܒܸܫܩܵܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܼ. ܚܦܵܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܚܵܦܪܹܢ، ܘܠܸܓܒ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܢܟ݂ܵܦܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”meereh rab bayta bganeh, ’moodee 'awden? Maree bishqaloeha-yleh rab baytoeta minee. Khpara le maṣeyn khapren, o ligwaya binkhapa ywin.
ENG: And the steward said within himself, What shall I do, seeing that my lord taketh away the stewardship from me? I have not strength to dig; to beg I am ashamed.

ASY: ”’ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ، ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܛܪܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܒܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”’dee' lee moodee bit 'awden, deeman dpayshen ṭreeda min rab baytoeta qablee-lee gaw batayhy.‘
ENG: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

ASY: ”ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܒܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ’ܟܡܵܐ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ؟‘
TRL: ”Qre-leh khad bkhad min daynane dmareh, o meereh lqamaya, ’kma daynana ywit qa maree?‘
ENG: And calling to him each one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܟܝܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܫܚܵܐ.‘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܫܩܘܿܠ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܘܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܟܬܘܿܒ݂ ܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܟܝܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”Joewib-leh, ’ima kyoele dmishkha.‘ meereh ileh, ’shqool ktawoekh o toow bjaldoeta o ktoow khamshee kyoele.‘
ENG: And he said, A hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bond, and sit down quickly and write fifty.

ASY: ”ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ’ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ؟‘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܟܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ.‘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܫܩܘܿܠ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܘܼܟ݂ ܘܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܘܟܬܘܿܒ݂ ܬܡܵܢܝܼ ܟܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”O boeqireh min khad khena, ’at kma daynana ywit qa maree?‘ joewib-leh, ’ima koore dkhiṭe.‘ meereh ileh, ’shqool ktawoekh o toow o ktoow tmanee koore.‘
ENG: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, A hundred measures of wheat. He saith unto him, Take thy bond, and write fourscore.

ASY: ”ܚܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܪܲܒ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܥܵܘܵܠܵܐ ܕܒܗܵܘܢܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܘܪܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܗܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khqeereh mara lrab bayta 'awala dbhawnanoeta pleekh-leh, sabab nashe daha zawna boesh khakeeme yna gaw dawrayhy min bnoone dbahra.
ENG: And his lord commended the unrighteous steward because he had done wisely: for the sons of this world are for their own generation wiser than the sons of the light.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܪܹܩ، ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܫܪ̈ܵܝܵܬܹܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”Oep ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, 'woodoen lawkhoon khawrawate min zoeza d'awla, deeman dpareq, qablee lawkhoon bmashrayate dl'alam.
ENG: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends by means of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when it shall fail, they may receive you into the eternal tabernacles.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܥܵܘܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܵܘܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Man dbkhacha mhoemna-yleh, oep braba mhoemna-yleh, o man dbkhacha 'awala-yleh, oep braba 'awala-yleh.
ENG: He that is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much: and he that is unrighteous in a very little is unrighteous also in much.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”In bmindee d'awla la haweytoon mhoemne, manee bit sape ilawkhoon mindee dshareeroeta?
ENG: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: ”In bmindee dle-yleh deeawkhoon la haweytoon mhoemne, manee bit yabil lawkhoon mindee dganawkhoon?
ENG: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܕܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܘܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܚܲܕ ܘܡܲܣܠܹܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܵܠܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܙܘܼܙܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Layt 'awda dmaṣe palekh ltrey marawate, sabab bit sane lkhad o makhib lhaw khena, yan bit myaqir lkhad o masle lhaw khena. Le maṣeytoon palkheetoon lalaha o lzoeza.“
ENG: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܙܘܼܙܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon preeshe ane klayhy, moeskhirhoon bee-eh sabab ke makhibee waw zoeza.
ENG: And the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things; and they scoffed at him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܫܸܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܛܲܢܦܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”akhtoon eetoon dke makshiṭeetoon ganawkhoon qam bnaynasha, eena Alaha ke yade' libawkhoon. Mindee deeleh myoeqra lkis bnaynasha, ṭanpa-yleh lkis Alaha.
ENG: And he said unto them, Ye are they that justify yourselves in the sight of men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

ASY: ”ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܹܐ. ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܬܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”Namoosa o nwee-e hal yookhanan peeshe ywaw moekrize. Min haygah malkoeta dalaha pyasha-ylaha moekrizta, o kl khad ba'e bkhayla 'aber gawoeha.
ENG: The law and the prophets were until John: from that time the gospel of the kingdom of God is preached, and every man entereth violently into it.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܛܵܠܩܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܚܕܵܐ ܐܵܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boesh pshoeqta-ylaha dshmaya o ar'a ṭalqee min dkhda atoeta napla min namoosa.
ENG: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tittle of the law to fall.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܪܲܦܹܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܓܵܒܹܪ ܚܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܓܵܒܹܪ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܪܘܼܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl man drape bakhteh o gaber khda kheta, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta, o kl man dgaber bakhta roepeeta byad gawra, bi'wada-yleh gayaroeta.
ENG: Every one that putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and he that marrieth one that is put away from a husband committeth adultery.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eet wa khad nasha 'ateera, o ke labesh wa kitana o argwana, o kl yoom ke khaye wa gaw boesama.
ENG: Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, faring sumptuously every day:

ASY: ”ܚܲܕ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ، ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ، ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khad miskena eet wa shimeh la'azar, milya min darbate, moetwa qam tar'a dhaw 'ateera.
ENG: and a certain beggar named Lazarus was laid at his gate, full of sores,

ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܫܲܗܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܵܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܸܪ̈ܬܘܼܚܹܐ ܕܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܟܲܠܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܠܵܟܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”O ke shahwit wa dmale wa keseh min pirtoekhe dnaplee waw min patoora dhaw 'ateera. Oep kalbe ke atee waw o lakkhee waw-lhoon darbateh.
ENG: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table; yea, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

ASY: ”ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܵܐ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܠܥܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Meet-leh haw miskena o loebil-lhoon ileh malake l'oeba dawraham. O oep haw 'ateera meet-leh o peesh-leh qweera.
ENG: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: and the rich man also died, and was buried.

ASY: ”ܘܓܵܘ ܫܝܘܿܠ، ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܒܥܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ،
TRL: ”O gaw shyool, kad haw janjoere, moerim-leh 'aynoehy min rikhqa o khze-leh lla'azar b'oeba dawraham,
ENG: And in Hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܘܫܲܕܸܪ ܠܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܕܛܵܡܹܫ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܨܸܒܥܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܘܡܲܬܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܵܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܗܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Moeqwikh-leh bqala rama o meereh, ’ya babee awraham, rakhim 'alee, o shadir lla'azar dṭamesh resha dṣib'eh gaw meea o matre-leh lishanee, sabab janjoere ywin gaw aha-laha.‘
ENG: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am in anguish in this flame.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ’ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܘܼܟ݂ ܒܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܘܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܢܝܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ileh awraham, ’broonee, dkhoor dat qoebil-loekh boesamoekh bkhayoekh, o la'azar qoebil-leh joenjare bkhayoehy. Adeea at janjoere ywit, o haw manyoekhe-yleh.
ENG: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and Lazarus in like manner evil things: but now here he is comforted, and thou art in anguish.

ASY: ”ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗܵܘܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܢ ܘܒܹܝܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”'Al klayhy ane, eet hawta goerta moetiwta beylan o beylawkhoon, hadkha anee dba'ee min lakha 'awree lkis lawkhoon le maṣee, o anee dmin lkis lawkhoon ba'ee atee lkis lan le maṣee.‘
ENG: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that they which would pass from hence to you may not be able, and that none may cross over from thence to us.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܒܲܣ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܕܫܲܕܪܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ،
TRL: ”meereh ileh, ’bas parpoele ywin beeoekh babee, dshadrit-leh la'azar lbayta dbabee,
ENG: And he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house;

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐܵܙܹܠ ܡܲܕܸܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܕܠܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’sabab eet-lee khamsha akhoonwate. Azel madi' ilayhy, dla oep anee atee-laha doeka djoenjara.‘
ENG: for I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ’ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”meereh ileh awraham, ’eet-lhoon moeshe o nwee-e, sham'ee ilayhy.‘
ENG: But Abraham saith, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܠܵܐ، ܒܵܒܝܼ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Eena haw joewib-leh, ’la, babee awraham, in khad nasha min meete azel lkis layhy bit tawibee.‘
ENG: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one go to them from the dead, they will repent.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ.‘“
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ileh awraham o meereh, ’in le sham'ee lmoeshe o lnwee-e, oep in nasha min meete qaem le haminee.‘“
ENG: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, if one rise from the dead.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܬܘܼܪ̈ܩܵܠܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܪ̈ܩܵܠܹܐ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”le hawya dla atee toerqale, eena way lhaw nasha dhawe 'ilta dtoerqale.
ENG: And he said unto his disciples, It is impossible but that occasions of stumbling should come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܐܸܪܚܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܸܠܝܵܐ ܒܩܕܵܠܹܗ ܘܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܕܬܲܪܩܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Boesh ṣpayee ywa ileh in kepa dirkhe hawe wa tilya bqdaleh o roepya byama, min dtarqil wa lkhad min ane z'oore.
ENG: It were well for him if a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ. ܐܸܢ ܚܵܛܹܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂، ܡܲܢܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐܸܢ ܬܲܘܸܒ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar. In khaṭe akhoonoekh 'aloekh, mankis-leh, o in tawib pakhil-leh.
ENG: Take heed to yourselves: if thy brother sin, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܫܒܲܥ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܚܵܛܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܫܒܲܥ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ، ’ܬܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ،‘ ܦܲܚܸܠ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”In shba' gahe byawma khaṭe 'aloekh, o shba' gahe byawma daer lkis-loekh o amer, ’tawoebe ywin,‘ pakhil-leh.“
ENG: And if he sin against thee seven times in the day, and seven times turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܡܲܙܝܸܕ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O meerhoon shleekhe, ”Maran, mazyid ilan haymanoeta.“
ENG: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܪܕܲܠ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܘܼܬܵܐ، ’ܦܘܼܫܝ ܥܩܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܢܨܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ،‘ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh Maran ilayhy, ”in hawe wa lawkhoon haymanoeta aykh dandikta dkhardal o amreetoon waw-laha toeta, ’poeshy 'qeerta, o nṣeewta byama,‘ bit sham'a wa ilawkhoon.
ENG: And the Lord said, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye would say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou rooted up, and be thou planted in the sea; and it would have obeyed you.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܛܵܪܹܐ ܦܕܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܕܡܲܪܥܹܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ’ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ، ܘܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠ‘؟
TRL: ”Aynee minawkhoon deet-leh rega dṭare pdana, yan dmar'e 'irbe, o eeman date min khaqla bit amer ileh mareh, ’'woor, o toow o khool‘?
ENG: But who is there of you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say unto him, when he is come in from the field, Come straightway and sit down to meat;

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܗܲܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܸܪ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܠܝܼ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢ ܘܫܵܬܹܝܢ، ܘܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܬ ܘܫܵܬܹܝܬ‘؟
TRL: ”Le amer ileh, ’hadir ilee mindee dakhlen kharamsha, o hadir ganoekh, 'wood-lee khilmat hal dakhlen o shateyn, o bkharta at akhlet o shateyt‘?
ENG: and will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܹܢ ܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Bit ṭa'en minta min haw rega d'weed-leh mindee dpeesha ywa pqeeda ileh?
ENG: Doth he thank the servant because he did the things that were commanded?

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܦܩܝܼܕܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ، ’ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.‘“
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon, eeman d'weed lawkhoon klayhy ane deena peeshe pqeede ilawkhoon li'wada, mooroen, ’regawate la yoetrana ywakh. 'weed lan akhchee mindee dwale ywa ilan d'awdakh waw.‘“
ENG: Even so ye also, when ye shall have done all the things that are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants; we have done that which it was our duty to do.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ ܘܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Kad bezala ywa eeshoo' loorishlim, 'weereh gaw shamreyn o gleela.
ENG: And it came to pass, as they were on the way to Jerusalem, that he was passing through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܸܪ̈ܒ݂ܵܢܹܐ. ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ،
TRL: O eeman dqoerbineh lkhda mata, tpeeq-lhoon bee-eh 'isra nashe girwane. Kle-lhoon min rikhqa,
ENG: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܲܢ.“
TRL: O moeqwikh-lhoon bqala rama o meerhoon, ”eeshoo', rabee, rakhim 'alan.“
ENG: and they lifted up their voices, saying, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

ASY: ܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܡܲܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ.
TRL: Khizyay-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen makhzeymoen ganawkhoon lkahne.“ o kad bezala ywaw, peesh-lhoon dikhye.
ENG: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go and shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, as they went, they were cleansed.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Khad minayhy kad khze-leh dpeesh-leh dikhya, deereh shaboekhe lalaha bqala rama.
ENG: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, with a loud voice glorifying God;

ASY: ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܵܡܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O npeel-leh qam aqlate deeshoo' shakoere ileh. O aha nasha shamraya ywa.
ENG: and he fell upon his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ؟ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܸܫܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh, ”le ywaw 'isra anee dpeesh-lhoon dikhye? Ayka yna anee tish'a khene?
ENG: And Jesus answering said, Were not the ten cleansed? but where are the nine?

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Qamoodee la deerhoon dyawee tishbookhta lalaha shwooq min aha noekhraya?“
ENG: Were there none found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܙܹܠ݇، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܡ ܒܲܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh lhaw nasha, ”qoem ze, haymanoetoekh qam basma-loekh.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Arise, and go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܢܛܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Boeqirhoon preeshe min eeshoo', ”eeman bit atya malkoeta dalaha?“ joewib-leh ilayhy, ”malkoeta dalaha le atya kad nashe bi'wada nṭoerta iloeha.
ENG: And being asked by the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God cometh, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܗܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܝܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.‘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܵܐ، ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Le amree, ’ha lakha-ylaha, yan tama-ylaha.‘ sabab ha, malkoeta dalaha gawawkhoon eelaha.“
ENG: neither shall they say, Lo, here! or, There! for lo, the kingdom of God is within you.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܗܘܸܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: O meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”bit atee yawmane dshahwiteetoon likhzaya khad min yawmane dbroona dnasha, o le khazeytoon.
ENG: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܗܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ،‘ ܝܲܢ، ’ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܬܵܒܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O in amree ilawkhoon, ’ha lakha-yleh broona dnasha,‘ yan, ’tama-yleh,‘ la azeetoon, o la tab'eetoon ilayhy.
ENG: And they shall say to you, Lo, there! Lo, here! go not away, nor follow after them:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܸܪܩܵܐ ܒܵܪܹܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܩܝܼܥܵܐ ܘܒܲܗܪܸܢ ܠܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab dakhee dbirqa bareq min rqee'a o bahrin lkl mindee tkhoot shmaya, hadkha bit hawe broona dnasha byawmeh.
ENG: for as the lightning, when it lighteneth out of the one part under the heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall the Son of man be in his day.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena qamayta wale-ylaha dqabil khasha raba, o dpaesh moesleea byad aha sharbta.
ENG: But first must he suffer many things and be rejected of this generation.

ASY: ”ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܘܿܚ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”O dakhee dhwe-leh byawmane dnookh, hadkha bit hawe byawmane dbroona dnasha.
ENG: And as it came to pass in the days of Noah, even so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܘܡܲܓܒ݂ܘܼܪܹܐ، ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܢܘܿܚ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܛܵܘܦܵܢܵܐ ܘܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hwe-lhoon bekhala o bishtaya, bigwara o magwoere, hal yawma d'weereh nookh gaw qewoeta, o te-leh ṭawpana o khneeq-leh lkl nasha.
ENG: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܘܿܛ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܒܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܒܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܘܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ، ܒܸܢܨܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܒܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”Mindrish dakhee dhwe-leh byawmane dlooṭ, nashe bekhala ywaw o bishtaya, bizwana o zaboene, binṣawa o bibnaya,
ENG: Likewise even as it came to pass in the days of Lot; they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;

ASY: ”ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܘܿܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܕܘܿܡ، ܡܘܼܥܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܟܸܒܪܝܼܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܛܘܼܠܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O byawma dpleeṭ-leh Looṭ min sdoom, moe're-leh Marya noera o kibreet min shmaya o ṭoeliq-leh lklayhy.
ENG: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all:

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha bit hawe eeman dpaesh khizya broona dnasha.
ENG: after the same manner shall it be in the day that the Son of man is revealed.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܹܗ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bhaw yawma, man deeleh 'al gare o mindee-eh gaw bayta, la ṣale lishqaleh, o haw deeleh gaw khaqla, la daer lbareh.
ENG: In that day, he which shall be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away: and let him that is in the field likewise not return back.

ASY: ”ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܠܘܿܛ.
TRL: ”Dkhooroen lbakhta dlooṭ.
ENG: Remember Lot’s wife.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܡܲܚܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܛܲܠܸܩ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Man dba'e makhe ganeh bit ṭaliq-laha, o man dṭaliq ganeh bit makhe-laha.
ENG: Whosoever shall seek to gain his life shall lose it: but whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܗ̇ܘ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ؛ ܚܲܕ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bhaw layle trey bit hawee gaw khda shweeta; khad bit paesh loebla o haw khena shweeqa.
ENG: I say unto you, In that night there shall be two men on one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

ASY: ”ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܓܪܵܣܵܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ؛ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܘܚܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O tartey bakhtate bit hawee bigrasa m'oedale; khda bit paysha loebilta o khda bit paysha shweeqta.
ENG: There shall be two women grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

ASY: ”ܬܪܹܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܚܲܩܠܵܐ؛ ܚܲܕ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܘܚܲܕ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Trey bit hawee bkhaqla; khad bit paesh loebla o khad bit paesh shweeqa.“
ENG: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܢܸܫܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy, ”layka Maran?“ joewib-leh, ”ayka deeleh paghra, tama bit jam'ee nishre.“
ENG: And they answering say unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Where the body is, thither will the eagles also be gathered together.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܨܲܠܝܼ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܣܵܩܕܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo' matla, dwale-ylaha nashe ṣalee ṣloota bkl 'dana o la saqdee.
ENG: And he spake a parable unto them to the end that they ought always to pray, and not to faint;

ASY: ”ܚܲܕ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܟܹܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khad dayana eet wa gaw khda mdeeta, dmin Alaha le zade' wa o min bnaynasha le nakep wa.
ENG: saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, and regarded not man:

ASY: ”ܚܕܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܘܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܝܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”Khda armilta eet wa bhay mdeeta, o ke atya wa lkis-leh o amra wa ileh, ’'wood-laha deewanee min dalqoewlayee.‘
ENG: and there was a widow in that city; and she came oft unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ’ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܢܟ݂ܵܦܵܐ،
TRL: ”Le ba'e wa qa khad zawna yareekha, eena min bar hada meereh bganeh, ’oep in dmin Alaha le ywin bizda'a, o min bnaynasha le ywin binkhapa,
ENG: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

ASY: ”’ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܟܟ̰ܘܼܚܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܘܡܲܣܩܘܼܕܝܼ.‘“
TRL: ”’bit 'awdenaha deewan daha armilta sabab makchoekhee-ylaha, o dla hawya bkl 'dana betaya o masqoedee.‘“
ENG: yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest she wear me out by her continual coming.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ”ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܥܵܘܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh Maran, ”shmi'moen moodee meereh dayana 'awala.
ENG: And the Lord said, Hear what the unrighteous judge saith.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܲܪܦܸܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܪܝܸܟ݂ ܒܹܐܢܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: ”Le ytoon bikhshawa Alaha bit 'abed-laha deewan dgoebyoehy, aynee dke parpilee bee-eh byawma o blayle, o bit maryikh beneh 'alayhy?
ENG: And shall not God avenge his elect, which cry to him day and night, and he is longsuffering over them?

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, bit 'abed-laha deewanayhy bjaldoeta. Eena eeman date broona dnasha, bit machikh haymanoeta 'al ar'a?“
ENG: I say unto you, that he will avenge them speedily. Howbeit when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܲܣܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: O meereh eeshoo' aha matla ldalqoewl danee dke haminee waw bganayhy dzadeeqe ywaw o maslee waw lkhene.
ENG: And he spake also this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and set all others at nought:

ASY: ”ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܚܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ.
TRL: ”Trey nashe seeq-lhoon lhaykla lṣaloeye, khad preesha o haw khena makhsa.
ENG: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ’ܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܲܟܘܼܪܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܚܵܛܘܿܦܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܙܲܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haw preesha kilya ywa ṣaloeye gaw ganeh hadkha, ’ya Alaha, shakoeroekh eewin dle ywin maykh nashe khene, khaṭoope, o 'awale, o zanaye, o la aykh aha makhsa.
ENG: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as the rest of men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

ASY: ”’ܟܹܐ ܨܵܝܡܹܢ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܵܢܹܝܢ.‘
TRL: ”’ke ṣaymen tartey gahe bshabta, o ke yaben ma'sare 'al kl mindee dqaneyn.‘
ENG: I fast twice in the week; I give tithes of all that I get.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡܲܪܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܨܲܕܪܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Eena makhsa kilya ywa min rikhqa, o le ba'e wa oep 'aynoehy marim wa-lhoon lshmaya, ila bimkhaya ywa 'al ṣadreh, bemara, ’ya Alaha, rakhim 'alee, ana khaṭaya.‘
ENG: But the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote his breast, saying, God, be merciful to me a sinner.

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܟ݂ܣܵܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܪܸܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܸܦܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܟܸܦ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, aha makhsa ṣle-leh lbayteh boesh zadeeqa qam Alaha min dhaw preesha. Sabab kl man dmarim-laha ganeh bit paesh moekipa, o kl man dmakip ganeh bit paesh moerma.“
ENG: I say unto you, This man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled; but he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܢܟܸܣܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Moete-lhoon nashe yale z'oore lkis eeshoo' dmatiw wa eeda 'alayhy. Eena talmeede eeman dkhizyay-lhoon moenkisay-lhoon.
ENG: And they brought unto him also their babes, that he should touch them: but when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' qiryay-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”shwooqoen yale z'oore atee lkis-lee o la makleytoon-lhoon, sabab malkoeta dalaha qa anee-ylaha deena maykh dane.
ENG: But Jesus called them unto him, saying, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dla qabil malkoeta dalaha aykh khad yala z'oora le 'aber gawoeha.“
ENG: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܕܝܵܪܬܹܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh khad min goerane, o meereh ileh, ”malpana ṭawa, moodee 'awden dyarten khaye dl'alam?“
ENG: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”qamoodee biqrayee ywit ṭawa? Layt ṭawa ila khad, Alaha.
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, even God.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ: ܠܵܐ ܩܵܛܠܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܢܹܝܬ، ܠܵܐ ܓܵܢܒܹܬ، ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ، ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Ke yad'et poeqdane: la qaṭlet, la zaneyt, la ganbet, la yabet sahdoeta ddoegla, myaqir lbaboekh o lyimoekh.“
ENG: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and mother.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܛܝܼܪܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh, ”ane klayhy nṭeeray ywin min yaloetee.“
ENG: And he said, All these things have I observed from my youth up.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂: ܙܲܒܸܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo', meereh ileh, ”khad mindee baṣoora-yleh iloekh: zabin kl mindee deet-loekh o hal-leh lmiskene, o bit hawe-loekh seemta bshmaya, o ta baree.“
ENG: And when Jesus heard it, he said unto him, One thing thou lackest yet: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw eeman dshmee' leh ane, psheem-leh, sabab raba 'ateera ywa.
ENG: But when he heard these things, he became exceeding sorrowful; for he was very rich.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܟܡܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܘܼܬܪܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kad khze-leh eeshoo' dpsheem-leh, meereh, ”kma 'asqa-ylaha lanee deet-lhoon 'oetra d'awree lmalkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And Jesus seeing him said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܫ ܦܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܘܼܡܠܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܒܢܸܩܒܵܐ ܕܚܡܵܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boesh pshoeqta-ylaha lgoemla li'wara bniqba dkhmaṭa min d'ateera 'aber lmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܲܣ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܩ؟“
TRL: Anee dshmee' lhoon meerhoon, ”bas manee maṣe pareq?“
ENG: And they that heard it said, Then who can be saved?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܬܡܲܨܝܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܡܸܬܡܲܨܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', ”kl mindee dle-yleh mitmaṣyana lkis bnaynasha, mitmaṣyana-yleh lkis Alaha.“
ENG: But he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”akhnan shweeq lan kl mindee o te lan baroekh.“
ENG: And Peter said, Lo, we have left our own, and followed thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܲܝܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܫܵܒܹܩ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' ilayhy, ”troeṣa bemara ywin, layt nasha dshabeq bayta yan awahe yan akhoonwate yan bakhta yan bnoone, boet malkoeta dalaha,
ENG: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or wife, or brethren, or parents, or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܘܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ، ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”O la qabil raba boesh zawda baha zawna, o bzawna date, khaye dl'alam.“
ENG: who shall not receive manifold more in this time, and in the world to come eternal life.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Loebil-leh eeshoo' ltri'sar talmeedoehy o meereh ilayhy, ”ha besaqa ywakh loorishlim, o bit payshee toemime klayhy anee dpeeshe yna kteebe byad nwee-e boet broona dnasha.
ENG: And he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written by the prophets shall be accomplished unto the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܒܸܬ ܪܵܝܩܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bit paesh soepya limwate, bit maskhiree bee-eh o bit rayqee 'al pateh.
ENG: For he shall be delivered up unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and shamefully entreated, and spit upon:

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: ”Bit makhee-leh bshawṭe, o bit qaṭlee-leh, o byawma dtlata bit qaem.“
ENG: and they shall scourge and kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܛܫܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena anee la poerme-lhoon oep khda min ane, sabab ṭsheeta ywa minayhy aha hemizman, o le ywaw beeda'a mindeeane dpyasha ywaw meere ilayhy.
ENG: And they understood none of these things; and this saying was hid from them, and they perceived not the things that were said.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ، ܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Kad qoerbineh eeshoo' leereekhoo, ha khad simya teewa ywa 'al marza doerkha bigwaya.
ENG: And it came to pass, as he drew nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh kinsha bi'wara, boeqireh, ”moodee-yleh aha?“
ENG: and hearing a multitude going by, he inquired what this meant.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh, ”eeshoo' naṣraya bi'wara-yleh.“
ENG: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

ASY: ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Moeqwikh-leh o meereh, ”eeshoo', broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alee.“
ENG: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܓ̰ܝܼܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܫܵܬܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܲܚܸܡ ܥܲܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Anee dbezala ywaw min qam eeshoo' njeew-lhoon bee-eh dshateq wa. Eena haw boesh zawda maqwikh wa, ”ya broona ddaweed, rakhim 'alee.“
ENG: And they that went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: O kle-leh eeshoo' o pqeed-leh dmaytee waw-leh lkis-leh. O eeman dte-leh, boeqireh mineh,
ENG: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢ.“
TRL: ”Moodee ba'eyt d'awden iloekh?“ o haw joewib-leh, ”maree, ba'eyn dkhazeyn.“
ENG: What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܚܙܝܼ. ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܡ ܒܲܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”khzee. Haymanoetoekh qam basma-loekh.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath made thee whole.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܲܒܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana khze-leh, o te-leh bar eeshoo' shaboekhe lalaha. O oep klayhy anee dkhze-lhoon shabkhee waw lalaha.
ENG: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ.
TRL: 'weereh eeshoo' min gaw eereekhoo.
ENG: And he entered and was passing through Jericho.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܬܝܼܪܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܙܲܟܲܝ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eet wa tama khad nasha 'ateera shimeh zakay, goera dmakhse.
ENG: And behold, a man called by name Zacchaeus; and he was a chief publican, and he was rich.

ASY: ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܩܵܘܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: Ba'e wa dkhaze wa leeshoo' manee-yleh, o le maṣe wa min kinsha, sabab kirya ywa bqawmta.
ENG: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the crowd, because he was little of stature.

ASY: ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: Rkheeṭ-leh lqama o seeq-leh leelana dtene dkhaze wa-leh, sabab bit 'aber wa min hay oerkha.
ENG: And he ran on before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that way.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܓܘܼܫܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܙܲܟܲܝ، ܡܲܠܝܸܙ ܘܨܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Eeman dte-leh eeshoo' lhay doeka, goeshiq-leh l'ilil, o meereh, ”zakay, malyiz o ṣlee, sabab wale-ylaha idyoom yawma dshareyn gaw baytoekh.“
ENG: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for today I must abide at thy house.

ASY: ܡܘܼܠܝܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܟܲܝ ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Moelyiz-leh zakay o ṣle-leh, o qoebil-leh ileh bkhadoeta.
ENG: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena klayhy anee dkhze-lhoon ṭoerṭim-lhoon o meerhoon, ”'weereh o shre-leh lkis nasha khaṭaya.“
ENG: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, He is gone in to lodge with a man that is a sinner.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܟܲܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ، ”ܚܙܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܛܠܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܒܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ.“
TRL: O kle-leh zakay o meereh lmaran, ”khzee maree, palga dmindeeee bit yabeneh lmiskene, o in ṭleema ywin lnasha, bit par'eneh khad barb'a.“
ENG: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord, Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have wrongfully exacted aught of any man, I restore fourfold.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”idyoom yawma hwe-leh poerqana-laha bayta, sabab oep aha broona dawraham eeleh.
ENG: And Jesus said unto him, Today is salvation come to this house, forasmuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܛܵܥܹܐ ܘܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab broona dnasha te-leh dṭa'e o pariq lhaw deewa ṭleeqa.“
ENG: For the Son of man came to seek and to save that which was lost.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon ane, meereh ilayhy khad matla khena, sabab qarboene ywa loorishlim, o khashwee waw bhay 'dana bit paysha wa gleeta malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they supposed that the kingdom of God was immediately to appear.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܥܲܠܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܕܵܐܹܪ.
TRL: meereh, ”khad nasha m'alya zeel-leh lkhad atra rikhqa dqabil malkoeta o daer.
ENG: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country, to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

ASY: ”ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܲܦܠܸܚܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܕܕܵܝܪܹܢ.‘
TRL: ”Qre-leh 'isra regawateh o yoebil-leh ilayhy 'isra kakre o meereh, ’maplikhoen-lhoon hal ddayren.‘
ENG: And he called ten servants of his, and gave them ten pounds, and said unto them, Trade ye herewith till I come.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܝܼܙܓܲܕܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܠܹܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܢ.‘
TRL: ”Eena bnay mdeeteh ke sanee waw-leh, o shoedirhoon min bar mineh eezgade, bemara, ’le basma lan daha nasha 'abed malkoeta 'alan.‘
ENG: But his citizens hated him, and sent an ambassage after him, saying, We will not that this man reign over us.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ، ܕܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܩܸܢܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar dpeesh-leh 'weeda malka, deereh o pqeed-leh dpayshee qirye anee regawate dyoewa ywa ilayhy zoeze, dyade' wa moodee kl khad minayhy qinya ywa.
ENG: And it came to pass, when he was come back again, having received the kingdom, that he commanded these servants, unto whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by trading.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܟܲܟܪܘܼܟ݂ ܩܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.‘
TRL: te-leh haw qamaya o meereh, ’maree, kakroekh qne-leh 'isra kakre khene.‘
ENG: And the first came before him, saying, Lord, thy pound hath made ten pounds more.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ’ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ، ܗܘܝܼ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܣܲܪ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”meereh ileh mareh, ’ṭoewa iloekh rega ṭawa, sabab hwe-loekh mhoemna bkhad mindee z'oora, hwee mdabrana 'al 'sar mdeenate.‘
ENG: And he said unto him, Well done, thou good servant: because thou wast found faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܟܲܟܪܘܼܟ݂ ܩܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.‘
TRL: ”te-leh haw dtrey o meereh, ’maree, kakroekh qne-leh khamsha kakre khene.‘
ENG: And the second came, saying, Thy pound, Lord, hath made five pounds.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܗܘܝܼ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”Oep lhaw meereh, ’hwee mdabrana 'al khamish mdeenate.‘
ENG: And he said unto him also, Be thou also over five cities.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܗܵܐ، ܫܩܘܿܠ ܟܲܟܪܘܼܟ݂ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܠܸܚܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”te-leh haw khena o meereh, ’maree, ha, shqool kakroekh dhwe-leh lkis-lee, kad seera byalikhta,
ENG: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I kept laid up in a napkin:

ASY: ”’ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ. ܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܹܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”’sabab zdee' lee minoekh, dnasha qishya ywit. Ke shaqlet min ayka dla moetiw-loekh, o ke khaṣdet mindee min ayka dla zree' loekh.‘
ENG: for I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ’ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܵܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ. ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܹܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܝܼ، ܘܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܕܹܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܪܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ileh mareh, ’min poemoekh bit daynenoekh ya rega beesha. Beeda'a ywit wa dnasha qishya ywin, ke shaqlen mindee min ayka dla moetiw-lee, o ke khaṣden mindee min ayka dla zree' lee,
ENG: He saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I am an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow;

ASY: ”’ܒܲܣ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܙܘܼܙܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܫܵܩܠܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܹܗ؟‘
TRL: ”’bas qamoodee la moetiw-loekh zoezee lkis ṣarape dateyn wa o shaqlen wa-leh 'am zawdoenyeh?‘
ENG: then wherefore gavest thou not my money into the bank, and I at my coming should have required it with interest?

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ’ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܟܲܟܪܵܐ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”O meereh lanee dkilye ywaw lkis-leh, ’shqooloen mineh kakra o haloen-leh lhaw deet-leh 'isra kakre.‘
ENG: And he said unto them that stood by, Take away from him the pound, and give it unto him that hath the ten pounds.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܟܲܟܪܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”O anee meerhoon ileh, ’Maran, haw eet-leh 'isra kakre.‘
ENG: And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.

ASY: ”ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Joewib-leh ilayhy, ’bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl man deet-leh bit paesh yoewa ileh, o man dlayt-leh, oep haw deet-leh bit paesh shqeela mineh.
ENG: I say unto you, that unto every one that hath shall be given; but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away from him.

ASY: ”’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܝܼ̈، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܩܛܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܝܼ.‘“
TRL: ”’eena dishminee, anee dla bseem-laha-lhoon dhaweyn wa malka 'alayhy, mayteymoen-lhoon lakha, o qṭooloen-lhoon qamee.‘“
ENG: Howbeit these mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Kad hoemzim-leh eeshoo' ane, pleeṭ-leh loerkheh o zeel-leh qama qamayhy besaqa loorishlim.
ENG: And when he had thus spoken, he went on before, going up to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܦܵܓܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-leh lbeyt page o lbeyt 'anya, lgeba dṭoera dpyasha-yleh qirya ṭoera dzayte, shoedireh trey min talmeedoehy,
ENG: And it came to pass, when he drew nigh unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount that is called the mount of Olives, he sent two of the disciples,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܠܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܢ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܟܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ. ܫܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen lmata deelaha lbalqoewlan, o eeman d'awreetoon gawoeha, bit machkheetoon ja'sha seera haw dnasha hich le-yleh rkeewa 'aloehy. Shreymoen o mayteymoen-leh.
ENG: saying, Go your way into the village over against you; in the which as ye enter ye shall find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat: loose him, and bring him.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܲܩܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟‘ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ’ܡܵܪܲܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.‘“
TRL: ”O in nasha baqirawkhoon, ’qamoodee bishraya ytoon ileh?‘ jawibeetoon-leh, ’Maran sneeqa-yleh ileh.‘“
ENG: And if any one ask you, Why do ye loose him? thus shall ye say, The Lord hath need of him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܘܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon anee dpeesh-lhoon shoedre o moechikh-lhoon dakhee dmeereh ilayhy eeshoo'.
ENG: And they that were sent went away, and found even as he had said unto them.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: O kad bishraya ywaw lja'sha, boeqirhoon marawateh, ”qamoodee bishraya ytoon-laha ja'sha?“
ENG: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ilayhy, ”Maran sneeqa-yleh ileh.“
ENG: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܪܟܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O moete-lhoon lkis eeshoo' o dre-lhoon 'al ja'sha joelayhy, o rkeew-leh eeshoo' 'aloehy.
ENG: And they brought him to Jesus: and they threw their garments upon the colt, and set Jesus thereon.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܫܲܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: Kad bezala ywa eeshoo', anee d'ameh shawee waw joelayhy boerkha.
ENG: And as he went, they spread their garments in the way.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܨܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܘܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-leh lmaṣlayta dṭoera dzayte, shoere-leh kleh kinsha dtalmeede bikhdaya o shaboekhe lalaha bqala rama boet klayhy khayle goere dkhze-lhoon.
ENG: And as he was now drawing nigh, even at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen;

ASY: ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ. ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܒܲܡܪ̈ܵܘܡܹܐ.“
TRL: O amree waw, ”breekha-yleh malka dbetaya-yleh bshima dmarya. Shlama bshmaya o shoewkha bamrawme.“
ENG: saying, Blessed is the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܵܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܡܲܫܬܸܩ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“
TRL: Eena nashe min preeshe min gawa dkinshe amree waw-leh, ”rabee, mashtiq ltalmeedoekh.“
ENG: And some of the Pharisees from the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܫܵܬܩܝܼ، ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy, ”bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in ane shatqee, kepe bit maqwikhee.“
ENG: And he answered and said, I tell you that, if these shall hold their peace, the stones will cry out.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇،
TRL: Kad qoerbineh eeshoo' lmdeeta o khizya-leh, bke-leh 'aloeha,
ENG: And when he drew nigh, he saw the city and wept over it,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܲܬܝ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ! ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܛܸܫܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: O meereh, ”ṭoewa dyad'aty wa at baha yawma moodee bit mayte wa 'alakhy shlama! Eena adeea ṭishya-yleh minakhy.
ENG: saying, If thou hadst known in this day, even thou, the things which belong unto peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܚܲܪܕܝܼ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ̈، ܡܵܚܝܼ ܫܘܼܪܵܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܵܟ݂ܝ، ܘܚܵܠܨܝܼ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܓܹܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit atee 'alakhy yawmane dbit khardee lakhy dishminakhy, makhee shoera lkhadirwanakhy, o khalṣee lakhy min kl geba.
ENG: For the days shall come upon thee, when thine enemies shall cast up a bank about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܬܵܠܚܝܼ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܘܒܢܘܿܢܵܟ݂ܝ̈ ܓܵܘܵܟ݂ܝ. ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܓܵܘܵܟ݂ܝ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܣܲܚܒܲܪܬܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: ”Bit talkhee lakhy o bnoonakhy gawakhy. Le shawqee gawakhy kepa 'al kepa sabab la dee' lakhy zawna dsakhbartakhy.“
ENG: and shall dash thee to the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: 'weereh eeshoo' lhaykla o shoere-leh lpaloeṭe lanee dbizwana ywaw o zaboene.
ENG: And he entered into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܒܲܝܬܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܸܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܹܢܵܒܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”kteewa-yleh dbaytee bit hawe bayta dṣloota, eena akhtoon 'weed lawkhoon gipeeta dgenabe.“
ENG: saying unto them, It is written, And my house shall be a house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of robbers.

ASY: ܘܟܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܛܲܠܘܼܩܹܗ.
TRL: O kl yawma ke malip wa bhaykla, eena goerane dkahne o sapre o reshane d'ama ba'ee waw lṭaloeqeh.
ENG: And he was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the principal men of the people sought to destroy him:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eena la mṣe-lhoon machkhee waw khda oerkha dakhee qaṭlee waw-leh, sabab klayhy bishma'a ywaw lhemizmanoehy.
ENG: and they could not find what they might do; for the people all hung upon him, listening.

ASY: ܒܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ،
TRL: Bkhad min yawmane kad maloepe ywa eeshoo' o makroeze gaw haykla qa 'ama, qeem-lhoon 'aloehy goerane dkahne o sapre o khwardiqne,
ENG: And it came to pass, on one of the days, as he was teaching the people in the temple, and preaching the gospel, there came upon him the chief priests and the scribes with the elders;

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh, ”moor ilan, baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywit ane, o manee yoebil-leh iloekh aha shoelṭana?“
ENG: and they spake, saying unto him, Tell us: By what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܵܐ، ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', ”oep ana bit baqrinawkhoon khad boeqara, jawiboen-lee.
ENG: And he answered and said unto them, I also will ask you a question; and tell me:

ASY: ”ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Ma'moodeeta dyookhanan min Alaha ywa yan min bnaynasha?“
ENG: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ’ܒܲܣ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟‘
TRL: O anee dreesh-lhoon 'am 'oedale o meerhoon, ”in amrakh, min Alaha, bit amer ilan, ’bas qamoodee la hoeminawkhoon bee-eh?‘
ENG: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why did ye not believe him?

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܪܵܓ̰ܹܡ ܠܲܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”O in amrakh, min bnaynasha, kleh 'ama bit rajem lan, sabab hoemine yna dyookhanan nweea-yleh.“
ENG: But if we shall say, From men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh, ”le yad'akh min ayka ywa.“
ENG: And they answered, that they knew not whence it was.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”oep ana le amren ilawkhoon baynee shoelṭana bi'wada ywin ane.“
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh eeshoo' aha matla l'ama, ”khad nasha nṣeew-leh karma, o soepe-leh lpalakhe, o zeel-leh lkhad atra rikhqa qa khad zawna yareekha.
ENG: And he began to speak unto the people this parable: A man planted a vineyard, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country for a long time.

ASY: ”ܘܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܣܦܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”O b'dana dṭ'oenyate shoedireh regeh lkis palakhe dyawee-leh min ṭ'oenyate dkarma. Eena palakhe mkhe-lhoon ileh o shoedirhoon speeqa.
ENG: And at the season he sent unto the husbandmen a servant, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܣܦܝܼܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Mindrish shoedireh rega khena, eena oep lhaw mkhe-lhoon palakhe, o moesle-lhoon ileh, o shoedirhoon speeqa.
ENG: And he sent yet another servant: and him also they beat, and handled him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

ASY: ”ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܛܪܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O shoedireh rega dtlata, eena oep lhaw doerbinhoon o ṭreed-lhoon.
ENG: And he sent yet a third: and him also they wounded, and cast him forth.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ؟ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܪܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ. ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܝܲܩܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”O meereh mara dkarma, ’moodee 'awden? Bit shadrin broonee moekhiba. Qawma bit myaqree-leh.‘
ENG: And the lord of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ’ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܵܪܘܿܬܵܐ. ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܬܲܢ.‘
TRL: ”Eena eeman dkhze-lhoon palakhe lbroona, meerhoon bganayhy, ’aha-yleh yaroota. Teymoen qaṭlakh-leh dpaysha yartoeta qatan.‘
ENG: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned one with another, saying, This is the heir: let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

ASY: ”ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܡܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Poeliṭ-lhoon ileh lbadar min karma o qṭeel-lhoon ileh. Moodee bit 'abed ilayhy mara dkarma?
ENG: And they cast him forth out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܟܲܪܡܵܐ ܠܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.“ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bit ate o bit ṭaliq lanee palakhe, o bit yabil karma lpalakhe khene.“ eeman dshmee' lhoon nashe ane hemizmane, meerhoon, ”aha la hawya.“
ENG: He will come and destroy these husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪܢܝܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Eena haw kheereh bee-ayhy o meereh, ”moodee-ylaha ma'naya dhay dkteewta-ylaha, kepa dmoesle-lhoon banaye, haw hwe-leh kepa dqoerneeta?
ENG: But he looked upon them, and said, What then is this that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, The same was made the head of the corner?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܦܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܡܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܛܒ݂ܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Kl man dnapel 'al haw kepa bit paesh shmeeṭa, o kl man d'aloehy napel haw kepa, bit paesh ṭweekha.“
ENG: Every one that falleth on that stone shall be broken to pieces; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will scatter him as dust.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana b'e-lhoon goerane dkahne o sapre dawqee waw-leh, eena zdee' lhoon min 'ama sabab dee' lhoon dilayhy meereh aha matla.
ENG: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to lay hands on him in that very hour; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he spake this parable against them.

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܫܘܿܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܢܦܸܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܕܣܲܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܠܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ،
TRL: Shoedirhoon lkis eeshoo' gashooshe bdmoeta dzadeeqe dmanpilee waw-leh bhemizman, dsapee waw-leh ldeewan o lshoelṭana dshaleeṭa,
ENG: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which feigned themselves to be righteous, that they might take hold of his speech, so as to deliver him up to the rule and to the authority of the governor.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܬ ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܦܸܬ، ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܦܸܬ.
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, ”malpana, ke yad'akh dshrara ke hamzimit o ke malpit, o le khazeyt pata ila bshareeroeta oerkha dalaha ke malpit.
ENG: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, and acceptest not the person of any, but of a truth teachest the way of God:

ASY: ”ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܹܫܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ ܝܲܢ ܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Qanoonayta-ylaha dyabakh zoeze dresheeta lqesar yan la?“
ENG: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܸܠܡܲܝܗܝ، ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eena haw dee' leh pilmayhy, joewib-leh, ”qamoodee jaroebee ytoon?
ENG: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them,

ASY: ”ܡܲܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܵܐ.“ ܘܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ، ”ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܨܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܕܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: ”Makhzeymoen-lee deenara.“ o moekhze-lhoon ileh. O boeqireh, ”dmanee-yleh aha ṣoerta, o dmanee-ylaha aha kteewta?“ joewib-lhoon ileh, ”dqesar.“
ENG: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? And they said, Caesar’s.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”haloen hadkha mindee dqesar lqesar, o mindee dalaha lalaha.“
ENG: And he said unto them, Then render unto Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and unto God the things that are God’s.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܢܦܸܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܡܵܐ. ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒܹܗ، ܘܫܬܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O la mṣe-lhoon manpilee-leh bhemizman qam 'ama. 'oejib-lhoon 'al joewabeh, o shteeq-lhoon.
ENG: And they were not able to take hold of the saying before the people: and they marveled at his answer, and held their peace.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: te-lhoon lkis eeshoo' khakma zadoeqaye, anee dke amree dlayt qyamta, o boeqirhoon mineh,
ENG: And there came to him certain of the Sadducees, they which say that there is no resurrection; and they asked him,

ASY: ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܓܵܒܹܪ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܘܡܲܩܸܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Malpana, moeshe kteew-leh ilan, in akhoona dnasha maet o eet-leh bakhta eena layt-leh bnoone, gaber akhoonoehy lbakhteh o maqim bnoone lakhoonoehy.
ENG: saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, that if a man’s brother die, having a wife, and he be childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eet waw shaw'a akhoonwate. Haw qamaya gweereh bakhta o meet-leh dla bnoone.
ENG: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died childless;

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Akhoona dtrey gweera-leh, eena oep haw meet-leh dla bnoone.
ENG: and the second;

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܘܿܢܬܲܝܗܝ. ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Haw dtlata gweera-leh, hadkha hal shaw'oontayhy. Klayhy meet-lhoon dla bnoone.
ENG: and the third took her; and likewise the seven also left no children, and died.

ASY: ”ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Bkharta oep bakhta meet-laha.
ENG: Afterward the woman also died.

ASY: ”ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܠܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܘܿܢܬܲܝܗܝ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Byawma dqyamta, lmanee bit hawya hay bakhta? Sabab shaw'oontayhy gweera-lhoon.“
ENG: In the resurrection therefore whose wife of them shall she be? for the seven had her to wife.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܡܲܓܒܸܪܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”bnoone daha 'alma ke gawree o magbiree.
ENG: And Jesus said unto them, The sons of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܠܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܓܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܓܒܸܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena anee deena khsheekhe lhaw 'alma khena, o lqyamta min gaw meete, le gawree o le magbiree.
ENG: but they that are accounted worthy to attain to that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܡܝܵܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܡܵܝܬܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep myata le maṣee maytee khena, sabab aykh malake yna, o bnoone dalaha yna, sabab hwe-lhoon bnoone dqyamta.
ENG: for neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܦܵܣܘܿܩܵܐ ܕܣܲܢܝܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ’ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂.‘
TRL: ”Eena boet qyamta dmeete, oep moeshe moedi' leh gaw pasooqa dsanya, kad qre-leh lmarya, ’Alaha dawraham, o Alaha deeskhaq, o Alaha dya'qoow.‘
ENG: But that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed, in the place concerning the Bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܬܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Alaha le-yleh Alaha dmeete ila dkhaye, sabab qateh klayhy khaye yna.“
ENG: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon nashe min sapre o meerhoon, ”malpana, shapeera hamzoeme ywit.“
ENG: And certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: O khena la qoeshdirhoon lbaqoere mineh boeqara.
ENG: For they durst not any more ask him any question.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܝܼܠܹܗ؟
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”dakhee ke amree sapre dmsheekha broona ddaweed eeleh?
ENG: And he said unto them, How say they that the Christ is David’s son?

ASY: ”ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܲܙܡܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ:
TRL: ”Daweed bganeh meereh gaw ktawa dmazmoore:
ENG: For David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

ASY: ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.‘
TRL: Hal dmatbin dishminoekh koewsha tkhoot aqlatoekh.‘
ENG: Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ؟“
TRL: ”In daweed hadkha biqrayeh-yleh Marya, dakhee bit hawe brooneh?“
ENG: David therefore calleth him Lord, and how is he his son?

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ،
TRL: O kad kleh 'ama bishma'a, meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy,
ENG: And in the hearing of all the people he said unto his disciples,

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܫܘܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܒܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܡܸܫܬܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar min sapre dke basma-lhoon likhdara blweeshyate yareeke, o ke makhibee shlama bshoeqe, o resha dmawtbe gaw knoeshyate o bmishtoeyate.
ENG: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love salutations in the marketplaces, and chief seats in the synagogues, and chief places at feasts;

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܘܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܡܲܪܝܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܨܠܵܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܕܲܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ ܒܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ke akhlee bate darmilyate o makhzee ganayhy bmaryakhta dṣlawatayhy bdagaloeta. Ane bit payshee deene bqishyoeta.“
ENG: which devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater condemnation.

ASY: ܓܘܼܫܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܥܲܬܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܒ݂ܵܚܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ.
TRL: Goeshiq-leh eeshoo' b'ateere dbidraya ywaw dwakhyatayhy gaw beyt gaza.
ENG: And he looked up, and saw the rich men that were casting their gifts into the treasury.

ASY: ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܬܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܪܹܝ ܦܘܼܠܣܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khze-leh khda armilta miskenta, oep hay dre-laha trey poelse.
ENG: And he saw a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܪܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܬܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh, ”shareeraeet bemara ywin ilawkhoon, aha armilta miskenta dre-laha boesh zawda min kl nasha.
ENG: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, This poor widow cast in more than they all:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܘܼܗ̇ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Sabab ane klayhy dre-lhoon gaw beyt gaza dalaha mindee dzawda ywa ilayhy, eena aha min baṣooroetoeha kl mindee deet wa-laha dre-laha.“
ENG: for all these did of their superfluity cast in unto the gifts: but she of her want did cast in all the living that she had.

ASY: ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ ܒܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܘܼܩܠܵܐ ܒܚܲܠܥܲܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Hamzoeme ywaw nashe boet haykla dakhee peesha ywa binya bkepe shapeere o soeqla bkhal'ate. meereh eeshoo',
ENG: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and offerings, he said,

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܲܝ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܬܝܼܪܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ane dbikhzayay ytoon, bit atee yawmane dle paesh shweeqa kepa 'al kepa dla paesh steera.“
ENG: As for these things which ye behold, the days will come, in which there shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟ ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܠܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh, ”malpana, eeman bit hawee ane? O moodee-yleh neeshanqa eeman dane qarbinee lihwaya?“
ENG: And they asked him, saying, Master, when therefore shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when these things are about to come to pass?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܕܚܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܘܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇.‘ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O haw joewib-leh ilayhy, ”hweymoen hishyar la hawe dkhalṭeetoon, sabab raba bit atee bshimee o bit amree, ’ana ywin msheekha, o 'dana qoerbinaha.‘ eena la azeetoon barayhy.
ENG: And he said, Take heed that ye be not led astray: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am he; and, The time is at hand: go ye not after them.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܠܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O eeman dsham'eetoon plashe o shghoeshye, la zad'eetoon, sabab ane bit hawee qamayta, eena hesh le-yleh shoelama.“
ENG: And when ye shall hear of wars and tumults, be not terrified: for these things must needs come to pass first; but the end is not immediately.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy, ”bit qayma oemta 'al oemta, o malkoeta 'al malkoeta,
ENG: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:
