ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܪ̈ܵܘܕܵܢܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܟܸܦܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܵܘܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ؛ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܙܕܸܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O bit hawee rawdane goere, kipne o mawtane bdoekane preeshe; bit hawee mindeeane mazdi'ane o neeshanqe goere min shmaya.
ENG: and there shall be great earthquakes, and in divers places famines and pestilences; and there shall be terrors and great signs from heaven.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܵܘܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܟܲܡܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena min qam ane klayhy hawee, bit dawqee lawkhoon, o bit kamree lawkhoon, o bit sapee lawkhoon lknoeshyate o lbeyt aseere, o bit maytee lawkhoon qam malke o shaleeṭe boet shimee.
ENG: But before all these things, they shall lay their hands on you, and shall persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena klaha aha bit hawya dyaweetoon sahdoeta.
ENG: It shall turn unto you for a testimony.

ASY: ”ܩܛܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܒܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܡ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Qṭi'moen blibawkhoon dla akhleetoon kham gaw ganawkhoon boet moodee bit jawibeetoon,
ENG: Settle it therefore in your hearts, not to meditate beforehand how to answer:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܗ̇ ܘܡܲܕܸܪܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒܘܼܗ̇ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Sabab ana bit yabenawkhoon hemizman o khikhmta, hay dla maṣee qaymee ldalqoewloeha o madiree joewaboeha klayhy dishminawkhoon.
ENG: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to withstand or to gainsay.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܚܸܙܡܵܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܡܝܸܬܝܼ ܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bit sapee lawkhoon awahawkhoon, o akhoonwatawkhoon, o khizmanawkhoon, o khawrawatawkhoon, o bit mamyitee lkhakma minawkhoon.
ENG: But ye shall be delivered up even by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolk, and friends; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death.

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܸܢܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”O bit paysheetoon sinye min kl nasha boet shimee.
ENG: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܸܙܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܩܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena oep khda mizta min reshawkhoon le ṭalqa.
ENG: And not a hair of your head shall perish.

ASY: ܘܒܟܠܵܝܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: O bklaytawkhoon qweeta bit parqeetoon lganawkhoon.
ENG: In your patience ye shall win your souls.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܚܘܼܪܕܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”Eeman dkhazeytoon oorishlim khoerdeeoeha khaylawate, haygah di'moen dqoerbina-yleh khrawoeha.
ENG: But when ye see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that her desolation is at hand.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܥܵܪܩܝܼ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”Haygah anee deena beehoed 'arqee lṭoera, o anee deena gawoeha palṭee, o anee deena gaw matwate la 'awree gawoeha.
ENG: Then let them that are in Judaea flee unto the mountains; and let them that are in the midst of her depart out; and let not them that are in the country enter therein.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܩܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܥܠܵܐ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Anee yawmane bit hawee yawmane dshqalta dtoe'la, dpaesh toemima kl mindee deeleh kteewa.
ENG: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܘܵܝ ܠܒܛܝܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܡܲܡܸܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Way lbṭeene o lmamiṣane banee yawmane. Sabab bit hawe oelṣana goera bar'a, o karba 'al aha 'ama.
ENG: Woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days! for there shall be great distress upon the land, and wrath unto this people.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܠܝܼ ܒܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܣܲܝܦܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܠܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܬܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܘܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܕܘܼܫܕܸܫܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܬܲܡܸܡܝܼ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Bit naplee bpoema dsaypa, o bit payshee loeble aseere gaw klayhy atrawate, o oorishlim bit paysha doeshdishta byad imwate hal dtamimee zawne dimwate.
ENG: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led captive into all the nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܘܒܣܲܗܪܵܐ ܘܒܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ. ܘܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܲܪܓܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Bit hawee neeshanqe bshimsha o bsahra o bkawkhbe. O 'al ar'a bit hawe oelṣana gaw imwate, shghoeshya o zdoe'ta min gargamta dyama o lape.
ENG: And there shall be signs in sun and moon and stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the billows;

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܦܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܘܸܡ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܥܝܼܫܹܐ.
TRL: ”nashe bit shaplee min zdoe'ta, beeda'a moodee bit qawim 'al ar'a, sabab khaylawate dshmaya bit payshee sh'eeshe.
ENG: men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens shall be shaken.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܘܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bit khazee broona dnasha betaya 'al 'nana bkhayla o bkhiqra goera.
ENG: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܲܪܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ، ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܡܲܪܡܘܼܢ ܪܹܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Eeman dsharee ane lihwaya, kleymoen o marmoen reshawkhoon, sabab qoerbina-yleh poerqanawkhoon.“
ENG: But when these things begin to come to pass, look up, and lift up your heads; because your redemption draweth nigh.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ، ”ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܒܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O meereh ilayhy matla, ”gashqoen beelana dtene, o bklayhy eelane,
ENG: And he spake to them a parable: Behold the fig tree, and all the trees:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܲܪܛܸܢܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܩܲܝܛܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dbarṭinee, ke khazeytoon o yad'eetoon bganawkhoon dqoerbineh qayṭa.
ENG: when they now shoot forth, ye see it and know of your own selves that the summer is now nigh.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ، ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon eeman dkhazeytoon ane bihwaya, di'moen dqoerbinaha malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: Even so ye also, when ye see these things coming to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le 'aber aha dawra hal dhawee ane klayhy.
ENG: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all things be accomplished.

ASY: ”ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܩܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܩܝܼ.
TRL: ”Shmaya o ar'a bit ṭalqee, eena hemizmanee le ṭalqee.
ENG: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܵܠܝܼ ܠܸܒܵܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܣܘܿܛܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܪܵܘܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܪܸܢܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ،
TRL: ”Hweymoen hishyar bganawkhoon, o la malee libawatawkhoon basooṭoeta o rawayoeta o rinya boet ane khaye, o minshiltane ate 'alawkhoon haw yawma,
ENG: But take heed to yourselves, lest haply your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day come on you suddenly as a snare:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܸܫܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab bit ate haw yawma aykh nishwa 'al klayhy anee dbi'mara yna 'al pata dklaha ar'a.
ENG: for so shall it come upon all them that dwell on the face of all the earth.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܕܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ، ܘܕܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Hweymoen hadkha r'eeshe o ṣaloeye bkl 'dana, dmaṣeytoon 'arqeetoon min ane dhdeere yna lihwaya, o dkaleytoon qam broona dnasha.“
ENG: But watch ye at every season, making supplication, that ye may prevail to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ.
TRL: Byawma ke malip wa eeshoo' gaw haykla, o blayle ke paleṭ wa o paesh wa bṭoera dzayte.
ENG: And every day he was teaching in the temple; and every night he went out, and lodged in the mount that is called the mount of Olives.

ASY: ܘܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kleh 'ama ke atee waw lkis-leh gaw haykla qaydamta jalde dsham'ee waw-leh.
ENG: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, to hear him.

ASY: ܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ،
TRL: Qarboene ywa 'eda dpaṭeere dke paesh qirya 'eda dpiṣkha,
ENG: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

ASY: ܘܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: O biṭ'aya ywaw goerane dkahne o sapre lkhda pirsat dakhee qaṭlee leeshoo', sabab bizda'a ywaw min 'ama.
ENG: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death; for they feared the people.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ.
TRL: O 'weereh saṭana beehoeda skaryooṭa deewa khad min tri'sar.
ENG: And Satan entered into Judas who was called Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: zeel-leh o hoemzim-leh 'am goerane dkahne o reshane dnaṭoore dhaykla dakhee sape-leh ilayhy eeshoo'.
ENG: And he went away, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might deliver him unto them.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O anee khde-lhoon, o 'weed-lhoon qawla dyawee-leh zoeze.
ENG: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: O haw yoebil-leh qawla ilayhy, o biṭ'aya ywa bar pirsat dsape-leh dla da'ta dkinsha.
ENG: And he consented, and sought opportunity to deliver him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

ASY: ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܐܝܼܬ ܥܝܵܕܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܦܹܐܪܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: Mṭe-leh yawma dpaṭeere dbee-eh eet 'yada dke paesh preema pera dpiṣkha.
ENG: And the day of unleavened bread came, on which the passover must be sacrificed.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܲܚ.“
TRL: O shoedireh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa o lyookhanan o meereh ilayhy, ”zemoen o hadroen ilan piṣkha dakhlakh.“
ENG: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and make ready for us the passover, that we may eat.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܗܲܕܪܲܚ؟“
TRL: Anee boeqirhoon mineh, ”ayka basma-loekh dhadrakh?“
ENG: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we make ready?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܬܵܦܹܩ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܥܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ. ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”eeman d'awreetoon gaw mdeeta, bit tapeq beeawkhoon khad nasha ṭ'eena talma dmeea. Zemoen bareh o 'wooroen lbayta d'aber.
ENG: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house whereinto he goeth.

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ’ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈؟“‘
TRL: ”O mooroen lmara dbayta, ’rabee-an bemara-yleh, ”ayka-ylaha doeka dakhlen piṣkha 'am talmeedee?“‘
ENG: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guest-chamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܘܝܼܬܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ.“
TRL: ”O haw bit makhze lawkhoon 'ileeta goerta o shoeweeta. Tama hadroen.“
ENG: And he will shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon o moechikh-lhoon aykh dmeereh ilayhy. O hoedirhoon tama piṣkha.
ENG: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-laha 'dana, te-leh eeshoo' o teew-leh o tri'sar shleekhe 'ameh.
ENG: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the apostles with him.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܗܘܸܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܲܒܠܸܢ ܚܲܫܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”shahwatta shoehwit-lee dakhleneh aha piṣkha 'amawkhoon min qam dqablin khasha.
ENG: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢܹܗ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min adeea le akhleneh khena hal dpaesh toemima bmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: for I say unto you, I will not eat it, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܟܸܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܦܲܠܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܒܹܝܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh kasa o shoekireh o meereh, ”shqooloen aha o pali'moen beylawkhoon.
ENG: And he received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, Take this, and divide it among yourselves:

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܹܝܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܓܸܦܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bemara ywin ilawkhoon, dle shateyn min ṭ'oenta dgipta hal datya malkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: for I say unto you, I will not drink from henceforth of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܟܸܪܹܗ ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܠܕܟ݂ܵܪܝܼ.“
TRL: O shqeel-leh lakhma o shoekireh o qṣe-leh o yoebil-leh ilayhy o meereh, ”aha-yleh paghree dboet deeawkhoon pyasha-yleh yoewa, aha haweytoon bi'wada ldkharee.“
ENG: And he took bread, and when he had given thanks, he brake it, and gave to them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܟܵܣܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܝܼ، ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܦܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep lkasa, min bar dkheel-lhoon kharamsha, meereh, ”aha kasa-yleh dwa'da khata bdimee, boet deeawkhoon pyasha-yleh shoepkha.
ENG: And the cup in like manner after supper, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood, even that which is poured out for you.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ha eeda dhaw dsape-lee 'am eedee-ylaha 'al patoora.
ENG: But behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table.

ASY: ”ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܛܝܼܥܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Broona dnasha bezala-yleh dakhee deeleh qṭee'a ileh dazel, eena way lhaw nasha dsape-leh.“
ENG: For the Son of man indeed goeth, as it hath been determined: but woe unto that man through whom he is betrayed!

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܨܲܚܨܘܼܝܹܐ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O shoere-lhoon ṣakhṣoeye ganayhy o baqoere aynee minayhy bit hawe sapyana.
ENG: And they began to question among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܕܘܼܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܕܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Hwe-leh oep doerasha beyl talmeedoehy, daynee minayhy khsheekha-yleh dhawe boesh goera.
ENG: And there arose also a contention among them, which of them is accounted to be greatest.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”malke dimwate marawatayhy yna, o anee dke 'awdee shoelṭana ke payshee qirye 'awdane dṭawate.
ENG: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles have lordship over them; and they that have authority over them are called Benefactors.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon la haweytoon hadkha, ila haw deeleh goera gawawkhoon, hawe aykh z'oora, o haw deeleh qamaya hawe aykh 'awdana dkhilmat.
ENG: But ye shall not be so: but he that is the greater among you, let him become as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

ASY: ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ.
TRL: ”Manee-yleh boesh goera, haw dke yatew lsoepra yan haw dke 'abed khilmat? Le-yleh haw dyatew lsoepra? Ana te-lee gawawkhoon aykh dhaw d'abed khilmat.
ENG: For whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? is not he that sitteth at meat? but I am in the midst of you as he that serveth.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܠܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon eetoon anee dkle lawkhoon 'amee b'dana djoerabee.
ENG: But ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations;

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܩܲܡ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”O ana bi'wada ywin qawla ilawkhoon dyabenawkhoon malkoeta, dakhee dbabee 'weed-leh qawla ilee o qam yabil-lee malkoeta,
ENG: and I appoint unto you a kingdom, even as my Father appointed unto me,

ASY: ”ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܘܿܪܝܼ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܝܼ، ܘܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܬܪ̈ܘܿܢܘܿܣܹܐ ܘܕܵܝܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: ”Dakhleetoon o shateytoon 'al patooree bmalkoetee, o yatweetoon 'al troonoose o dayneetoon tri'sar shawṭe deesrayel.“
ENG: that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom; and ye shall sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܗܵܐ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܣܵܪܹܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa, ”shim'oon, shim'oon, ha saṭana bib'aya-yleh dsared lawkhoon aykh khiṭe.
ENG: Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have you, that he might sift you as wheat:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܵܨܪܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܵܝܪܹܬ، ܡܲܩܘܹܝܬ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena ana ṣoele-lee boet deeoekh dla baṣra haymanoetoekh. O oep at eeman ddayret, maqweyt haymanoeta dakhoonwatoekh.“
ENG: but I made supplication for thee, that thy faith fail not: and do thou, when once thou hast turned again, stablish thy brethren.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O haw joewib-leh, ”maree, ana hdeera ywin dazen 'amoekh lbeyt aseere o lmawta.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Lord, with thee I am ready to go both to prison and to death.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ، ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”bemara ywin iloekh shim'oon kepa, min qam dqare qarooya idyoom, tlat gahe bit sarbet dke yad'et-lee.
ENG: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, until thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܟܝܼܣܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܨܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ، ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”eeman dshoediree ilawkhoon dla keesyate, o dla janyate o ṣawle, baṣoora ywa mindee ilawkhoon?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”la. Oep khad mindee le ywa baṣoora ilan.“
ENG: And he said unto them, When I sent you forth without purse, and wallet, and shoes, lacked ye any thing? And they said, Nothing.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܟܝܼܣܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܲܢܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܙܲܒܸܢ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܹܗ ܘܙܵܒܹܢ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ،
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”eena min adeea man deet-leh keesyate shaqel-lhoon, o hadkha oep haw deet-leh janta, o man dlayt-leh saypa zabin lweeshteh o zaben saypa,
ENG: And he said unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet: and he that hath none, let him sell his cloke, and buy a sword.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ’ܥܲܡ ܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܵܐ،‘ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ. ܗܹܐ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab bemara ywin ilawkhoon, haw dpeesha-yleh kteewa boet deeee, ’'am 'awale peesh-leh minya,‘ wale-ylaha dpaesh toemima. He, kl mindee dkteewa-yleh boet deeee bit paesh toemima.“
ENG: For I say unto you, that this which is written must be fulfilled in me, And he was reckoned with transgressors: for that which concerneth me hath fulfillment.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܲܣܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: O meerhoon ileh talmeede, ”Maran, eet lan lakha trey saype.“ o haw meereh ilayhy, ”basawkhoon.“
ENG: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܕܲܬ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' o zeel-leh lṭoera dzayte aykh deet wa-leh 'adat, o zeel-lhoon bareh oep talmeedoehy.
ENG: And he came out, and went, as his custom was, unto the mount of Olives; and the disciples also followed him.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: O eeman dmṭe-leh tama, meereh ilayhy, ”ṣaleymoen dla 'awreetoon ljoeraba.“
ENG: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܪܚܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܪܲܦܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ،
TRL: O haw rkheeq-leh minayhy aykh rapayta dkhad kepa o breek-leh o ṣoele-leh,
ENG: And he was parted from them about a stone’s cast; and he kneeled down and prayed,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܲܥܒܸܪ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܣܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܵܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܝܼ.“
TRL: O meereh, ”ya baba, in basma-loekh ma'bir minee aha kasa. Eena hawe ṣiwyanoekh o la ṣiwyanee.“
ENG: saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܚܲܠܘܼܢܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O peesh-leh khizya ileh malakha min shmaya khaloene ileh.
ENG: And there appeared unto him an angel from heaven, strengthening him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܥܵܘܩܵܢܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܲܥܬܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܛܘܿܦܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ ܒܸܢܦܵܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Kad haw b'awqana, hwe-leh ṣaloeye boesh khaylana, o hwe-laha da'teh aykh naṭoopyate ddima binpala 'al ar'a.
ENG: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat became as it were great drops of blood falling down upon the ground.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܫܝܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ،
TRL: Qeem-leh min ṣloota o te-leh lkis talmeedoehy o khizyay-leh dmeeke sabab psheeme ywaw,
ENG: And when he rose up from his prayer, he came unto the disciples, and found them sleeping for sorrow,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟ ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܘܨܲܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܪܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”qamoodee dmeeke ytoon? Qoemoen o ṣaleymoen dla 'awreetoon ljoeraba.“
ENG: and said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, that ye enter not into temptation.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ، ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ. ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܢܫܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kad eeshoo' hamzoeme ywa, te-leh kinsha, o eehoeda, khad min tri'sar, bezala qamayhy. Qoerbineh lkis eeshoo' o nsheeq-leh.
ENG: While he yet spake, behold, a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them; and he drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܢܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܣܲܦܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”bnshoeqta sapoeye ywit lbroona dnasha?“
ENG: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܡܵܚܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܲܝܦܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad khze-lhoon anee deewaw 'am eeshoo' mindee dhwe-leh, meerhoon ileh, ”Maran, makhakh-lhoon bsaypa?“
ENG: And when they that were about him saw what would follow, they said, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

ASY: ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܹܗ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: O mkhe-leh khad minayhy lrega dgoera dkahne o preema-leh nateh dyameena.
ENG: And a certain one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his right ear.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.“ ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܢܵܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh, ”la hadkha.“ o dqeereh bnata dhaw nasha o boesma-leh.
ENG: But Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far. And he touched his ear, and healed him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܠܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܹܗ، ”ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܣܲܝܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܚܘܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lgoerane dkahne o lkhwardiqne o lreshane dnaṭoore dhaykla dte-lhoon lidwaqeh, ”pleeṭ lawkhoon 'alee bsaype o bkhoeṭre lidwaqee aykh din genawa ywin.
ENG: And Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and elders, which were come against him, Are ye come out, as against a robber, with swords and staves?

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Kl yoom ke haweyn wa 'amawkhoon gaw haykla, o la dweeq lawkhoon ilee. Eena adeea-ylaha sa'atawkhoon, dshoelṭana dkhishka bi'mara-yleh beeawkhoon.“
ENG: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched not forth your hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

ASY: ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ.
TRL: O dweeq-lhoon leeshoo' o moete-lhoon ileh lbayta dgoera dkahne, o shim'oon kepa betaya ywa bareh min rikhqa.
ENG: And they seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed afar off.

ASY: ܫܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Sheerhoon noera bey palga ddarta o teew-lhoon lkhadirwanoehy, o oep shim'oon kepa teewa ywa 'amayhy.
ENG: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the court, and had sat down together, Peter sat in the midst of them.

ASY: ܘܚܕܵܐ ܚܵܡܬܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܚܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: O khda khamta khze-laha ileh teewa lkis noera, kheeraha bee-eh o meeraha, ”oep aha 'ameh ywa.“
ENG: And a certain maid seeing him as he sat in the light of the fire, and looking stedfastly upon him, said, This man also was with him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena haw sreew-leh o meereh, ”bakhta, le yad'eneh.“
ENG: But he denied, saying, Woman, I know him not.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܸܬ.“ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: O min bar khad mitkha kirya, khze-leh ileh khad khena o meereh, ”oep at minayhy ywit.“ o joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”ya nasha, ana le ywin minayhy.“
ENG: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou also art one of them. But Peter said, Man, I am not.

ASY: ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܕܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ، ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܩܵܘܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܒܸܠܝܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O bar khda sa'at, khad khena meereh mqawyaeet, ”shareeraeet oep aha 'ameh ywa, sabab gbilyaya-yleh.“
ENG: And after the space of about one hour another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this man also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ.“ ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”ya nasha, le ywin beeda'a moodee hamzoeme ywit.“ o bhay 'dana kad haw hamzoeme, qre-leh qarooya.
ENG: But Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Deereh eeshoo' o kheereh bshim'oon kepa. O dkheereh shim'oon hemizman dmaran dmeera ywa ileh, ”min qam dqare qarooya, bit sarbet-lee tlat gahe.“
ENG: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how that he said unto him, Before the cock crow this day, thou shalt deny me thrice.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܒܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh shim'oon lbadar o bke-leh bmareeroeta.
ENG: And he went out, and wept bitterly.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O nashe ddweeqe ywaw leeshoo' maskhiree waw bee-eh o makhee waw-leh.
ENG: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and beat him.

ASY: ܡܲܟܣܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܢܲܒܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܡܵܚܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Maksee waw 'aynoehy o makhee waw 'al pateh, o amree waw, ”nabee, manee qam makhe-loekh?“
ENG: And they blindfolded him, and asked him, saying, Prophesy: who is he that struck thee?

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O raba mindeeane khene gadpee waw 'aloehy.
ENG: And many other things spake they against him, reviling him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh yawma, jmee' lhoon khwardiqne d'ama o goerane dkahne o sapre, o loebil-lhoon leeshoo' qam knoeshya.
ENG: And as soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people was gathered together, both chief priests and scribes; and they led him away into their council, saying,

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh, ”in at eewit msheekha, moor ilan.“ o haw joewib-leh, ”in amrenawkhoon le hamineetoon ilee.
ENG: If thou art the Christ, tell us. But he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”O in baqrinawkhoon le jawibeetoon-lee, o le shareytoon-lee.
ENG: and if I ask you, ye will not answer.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܬܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Min adeea bit yatew broona dnasha min yameena dalaha khayltana.“
ENG: But from henceforth shall the Son of man be seated at the right hand of the power of God.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܲܣ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O klayhy boeqirhoon, ”bas hadkha at eewit broona dalaha?“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”he, aykh dbemara ytoon, ana ywin broona dalaha.“
ENG: And they all said, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ؟ ܒܓܵܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ.“
TRL: O meerhoon, ”qamoodee khena sneeqe ywakh lsahde? Bganan shmee' lan min poemeh.“
ENG: And they said, What further need have we of witness? for we ourselves have heard from his own mouth.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: O qeem-lhoon kleh kinshayhy o loebil-lhoon leeshoo' lkis peelaṭoos.
ENG: And the whole company of them rose up, and brought him before Pilate.

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܹܗ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܲܚܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܲܢ ܘܡܲܟܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܹܫܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪ، ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܡܲܠܟܵܐ.“
TRL: O shoere-lhoon hamzoeme ldalqoewleh o bemara, ”khze lan aha nasha makhloeṭe lṭayipan o makloeye min leeawa zoeze dresheeta lqesar, o bemara boet ganeh dhaw eeleh msheekha, malka.“
ENG: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this man perverting our nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ a king.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ.“
TRL: Boeqireh mineh peelaṭoos, ”at eewit malka dyhoedaye?“ joewib-leh eeshoo', ”he, aykh dbemara ywit.“
ENG: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh peelaṭoos lgoerane dkahne o lkinsha, ”ana le ywin machoekhe 'ilta dalqoewl daha nasha.“
ENG: And Pilate said unto the chief priests and the multitudes, I find no fault in this man.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܲܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܲܢ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ. ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena anee maqwikhee waw, bemara, ”mashghoeshe-yleh l'aman byoelpaneh gaw kleh eehoed. Shoere-leh min gleela o hal lakha.“
ENG: But they were the more urgent, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judaea, and beginning from Galilee even unto this place.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܕܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܒܸܠܝܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh peelaṭoos shima dgleela, boeqireh din aha nasha gbilyaya ywa.
ENG: But when Pilate heard it, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܓܒܸܠܝܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eeman ddee' leh dgbilyaya ywa o tkhoot shoelṭana dheroodis, shoedireh ileh lkis heroodis sabab haw gaw oorishlim eewa banee yawmane.
ENG: And when he knew that he was of Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him unto Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem in these days.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dheroodis khze-leh leeshoo', khde-leh raba, sabab min jalde ke ba'e wa likhzayeh, sabab shmee'a ywa boet dee-eh raba mindeeane, o bispara ywa d'abed wa khad neeshanqa.
ENG: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was of a long time desirous to see him, because he had heard concerning him; and he hoped to see some miracle done by him.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ.
TRL: Raba boeqare boeqireh heroodis mineh, eena eeshoo' la joewib-leh ileh oep khad.
ENG: And he questioned him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

ASY: ܘܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kilye ywaw tama goerane dkahne o sapre, o bqishyoeta hamzimee waw dalqoewleh.
ENG: And the chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.

ASY: ܘܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܘܕܲܚܫܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: O heroodis o dakhshoehy moesle-lhoon ileh, o moeskhirhoon bee-eh, o moelbish-lhoon ileh lweeshta shapeerta, o moedirhoon ileh lkis peelaṭoos.
ENG: And Herod with his soldiers set him at nought, and mocked him, and arraying him in gorgeous apparel sent him back to Pilate.

ASY: ܘܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܘܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O bhaw yawma peelaṭoos o heroodis hwe-lhoon khawrawate m'oedale, sabab dishminayoeta min jalde eet wa beylayhy.
ENG: And Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day: for before they were at enmity between themselves.

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܥܲܡܵܐ،
TRL: Qre-leh peelaṭoos lgoerane dkahne o lreshane dyhoedaye o d'ama,
ENG: And Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܚܵܒ݂ܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܨܘܼܚܨܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܠܝܵܡܹܗ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”moete lawkhoon aha nasha lkis-lee aykh khad khawṭana d'ama, o ana ṣoekhṣe-lee ileh qamawkhoon o la moechikh-lee bee-eh 'ilta dboet deeoeha bilyameh ytoon.
ENG: and said unto them, Ye brought unto me this man, as one that perverteth the people: and behold, I, having examined him before you, found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep heroodis la khze-leh bee-eh gnaha, hadkha shoedireh ileh lakha. Le-yleh 'weeda mindee dkhashekh lmawta.
ENG: no, nor yet Herod: for he sent him back unto us; and behold, nothing worthy of death hath been done by him.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܥܠܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܫܵܪܹܝܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha bit ta'limineh o shareyneh.“
ENG: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܝܵܕܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܥܹܐܕܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa 'yada dshare wa peelaṭoos ilayhy khad aseera byawma d'eda.
ENG: Now he was obliged to release one man to them at the festival

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܚܲܕ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܫܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ!“
TRL: Eena klayhy moeqwikh-lhoon bkhad qala o meerhoon, ”ṭaliq-laha nasha, o shree ilan lbar aba!“
ENG: But they cried out all together, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:

ASY: ܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bar aba peesha ywa dirya gaw beyt aseere boet shghoeshya o qiṭla d'weeda ywa gaw mdeeta.
ENG: one who for a certain insurrection made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Mindrish hoemzim-leh 'amayhy peelaṭoos kad bib'aya dshare wa leeshoo'.
ENG: And Pilate spake unto them again, desiring to release Jesus;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ، ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ!“
TRL: Eena anee maqwikhee waw, bemara, ”zqoop-leh, zqoop-leh!“
ENG: but they shouted, saying, Crucify, crucify him.

ASY: ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܫܚܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܒܸܬ ܬܲܥܠܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܫܵܪܹܝܢܹܗ.“
TRL: Gaha dtlat meereh ilayhy peelaṭoos, ”moodee beeshta 'weeda-yleh? 'Ilta dkhashkha lmawta le ywin machoekhe bee-eh. Bit ta'limineh o shareyneh.“
ENG: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath this man done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him and release him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܲܠܝܸܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ. ܘܓ݂ܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena anee malyizee waw bqala rama o ṭalbee waw mineh dpaesh mikhya lzqeepa. O ghleeb-leh qalayhy o qala dgoerane dkahne.
ENG: But they were instant with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. And their voices prevailed.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܒܵܥܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah qṭee' leh peelaṭoos dpaysha toemimta ba'oetayhy.
ENG: And Pilate gave sentence that what they asked for should be done.

ASY: ܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Shre-leh ilayhy lbar aba, haw dboet shghoeshya o qiṭla peesha ywa dirya gaw beyt aseere, haw danee ṭleeb-lhoon. O leeshoo' soepe-leh lṣiwyanayhy.
ENG: And he released him that for insurrection and murder had been cast into prison, whom they asked for; but Jesus he delivered up to their will.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܠܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܨܹܗ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܕܛܵܥܹܢܹܗ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad laboele ywaw leeshoo', dweeq-lhoon lshim'oon qiwreenaya dbetaya ywa min khaqla, o moetiw-lhoon lkhaṣeh zqeepa dṭa'eneh o azel bara bar eeshoo'.
ENG: And when they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to bear it after Jesus.

ASY: ܘܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܘܒܝܼܠܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O betaya ywa bareh kinsha raba, o bakhtate bi'wada ta'zee o beelaya 'aloehy.
ENG: And there followed him a great multitude of the people, and of women who bewailed and lamented him.

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܠܵܐ ܒܵܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܟܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܥܲܠ ܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: O deereh eeshoo' lkis bakhtate o meereh ilayhy, ”bnate doorishlim, la bakeytoon 'alee, eena bkeymoen 'al ganawkhoon o 'al bnoonawkhoon.
ENG: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ، ’ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܲܩܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܘܠܟܹܪ̈݇ܣܵܬܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܨܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܠܒܸܙܵܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܡܸܨ ܠܗܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab bit atee yawmane dbit amree, ’ṭoewa l'aqrate o lkesate dla hoeṣil-lhoon, o lbizaze dla moemiṣ-lhoon.‘
ENG: For behold, the days are coming, in which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the breasts that never gave suck.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܪܝܼ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ’ܢܦܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܥܲܠܲܢ، ܘܠܪ̈ܘܼܡܝܵܬܹܐ، ܟܲܣܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܲܢ.‘
TRL: ”Haygah bit sharee lemara lṭoerane, ’npooloen 'alan, o lroemyate, kaseymoen lan.‘
ENG: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܒܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܒܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܵܪܘܿܙܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”In beelana taleela ane bi'wada yna, moodee bit 'awdee beelana barooza?“
ENG: For if they do these things in the green tree, what shall be done in the dry?

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ.
TRL: O peesh-lhoon loeble 'ameh trey khene, 'awdane dbeeshate dpayshee waw qṭeele.
ENG: And there were also two others, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܲܪܩܲܦܬܵܐ، ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܸܡܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kad mṭe-lhoon lkhda doeka dpyasha-ylaha qreeta qarqapta, zqeep-lhoon ileh tama. Oep lanee trey 'awdane dbeeshate zqeep-lhoon, khad min yameeneh o khad min simaleh.
ENG: And when they came unto the place which is called The skull, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand and the other on the left.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܦܲܚܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ.“ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܸܫܟܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh eeshoo', ”ya baba, pakhil-lhoon sabab le yna beeda'a moodee yna bi'wada.“ o poeli' lhoon joeloehy, o dre-lhoon 'alayhy pishka.
ENG: And Jesus said, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And parting his garments among them, they cast lots.

ASY: ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܸܩ ܠܹܗ، ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Kilya ywa tama 'ama o bikhzaya, o oep goerane maskhiree waw bee-eh o amree waw, ”lkhene poeriq-leh, pariq lganeh, in aha-yleh msheekha goebya dalaha.“
ENG: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also scoffed at him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܩܲܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܠܵܐ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Oep dakhshe maskhiree waw bee-eh. Qarbinee waw lkis-leh o yawee waw-leh khala lishtaya.
ENG: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, offering him vinegar,

ASY: ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܦܲܪܸܩ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O amree waw ileh, ”in at eewit malka dyhoedaye, pariq ganoekh.“
ENG: and saying, If thou art the King of the Jews, save thyself.

ASY: ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ ܘܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܘܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Kteew-lhoon oep kteewta l'ilil min resheh blishana yawnaya o roomaya o 'iwraya, ”aha-yleh malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And there was also a superscription over him, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܓܵܕܹܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: Khad min anee trey 'awdane dbeeshate dzqeepa ywa 'ameh gadep wa 'aloehy o amer wa, ”le ywit at msheekha? Pariq ganoekh, o oep ilan.“
ENG: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, Art not thou the Christ? save thyself and us.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܢܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ؟
TRL: Eena haw khena moenkis-leh ileh o meereh, ”oep min Alaha le ywit bizda'a, kad tkhoot dhay dyanta ywit aykh deeleh haw?
ENG: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, Dost thou not even fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܗܵܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܚܵܫܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܲܢ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܦܪܝܼܥܹܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Akhnan bhaqoeta pyasha ywakh deene, aykh dkhashkha ilan o aykh poelkhanan pyasha ywakh pree'e. Eena aha nasha mindee khirba le-yleh 'weeda.“
ENG: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܬ ܒܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Haygah meereh, ”ya eeshoo', dkhooree eeman dateyt bmalkoetoekh.“
ENG: And he said, Jesus, remember me when thou comest in thy kingdom.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܪܕܲܝܣܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”troeṣa bemara ywin iloekh, idyoom bit haweyt 'amee gaw pardaysa.“
ENG: And he said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, Today shalt thou be with me in Paradise.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܕܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh sa'at dtri'sar dkawitra, hwe-leh khishka 'al klaha ar'a hal sa'at dtlat min bar kawitra.
ENG: And it was now about the sixth hour, and a darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,

ASY: ܚܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܛܵܐ ܣܸܬܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܹܗ.
TRL: Khbe-leh shimsha, o peesh-leh preeṭa sitra dhaykla min bey palgeh.
ENG: the sun’s light failing: and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܣܲܦܘܼܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܝܼ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ.
TRL: O moeqwikh-leh eeshoo' bqala rama o meereh, ”ya babee, beedatoekh sapoeyoeha ywin roekhee.“ meereh hadkha o soepya-leh roekheh.
ENG: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said this, he gave up the ghost.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh rab ima mindee dhwe-leh, shoebikh-leh lalaha o meereh, ”shareeraeet aha nasha zadeeqa ywa.“
ENG: And when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܓܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܨܲܕܪܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O klayhy kinshe djmee'e ywaw lgashoeqe, eeman dkhze-lhoon mindee dhwe-leh, deerhoon bimkhaya 'al ṣadrayhy.
ENG: And all the multitudes that came together to this sight, when they beheld the things that were done, returned smiting their breasts.

ASY: ܘܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܵܕܥܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: O kilye ywaw min rikhqa klayhy yad'anoehy, oep bakhtate deewaw tee-e 'ameh min gleela, o bikhzaya ywaw ane.
ENG: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed with him from Galilee, stood afar off, seeing these things.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܡܬܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܡܵܠܘܿܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܟܹܐܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha shimeh yawsip dte-leh min ramta mdeeta deehoed, malookha, nasha ṭawa o kena.
ENG: And behold, a man named Joseph, who was a councillor, a good man and a righteous

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Aha la 'weed-leh aykh ṣiwyanayhy o la aykh poelkhanayhy, o bispara ywa lmalkoeta dalaha.
ENG: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), a man of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was looking for the kingdom of God:

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Aha te-leh lkis peelaṭoos o ṭleeb-leh paghra deeshoo'.
ENG: this man went to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ ܢܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: O moeṣle-leh lpaghra o koermikh-leh bkitana, o moetiw-leh gaw beyt qwoera nqeera gaw kepa, doep khad le ywa hesh moetwa gaweh.
ENG: And he took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was hewn in stone, where never man had yet lain.

ASY: ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܒܸܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Yawma dhadarta ywa, o shabta bizraqa ywa.
ENG: And it was the day of the Preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

ASY: ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O bakhtate dtee-e ywaw 'am eeshoo' min gleela khze-lhoon lqawra, o dakhee ywa moetwa gaweh paghra deeshoo'.
ENG: And the women, which had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and beheld the tomb, and how his body was laid.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܣܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܗܹܪ̈ܘܿܡܹܐ، ܘܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܫܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Deerhoon o hoedirhoon bisme o heroome, o bshabta shle-lhoon aykh poeqdana.
ENG: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments. And on the sabbath they rested according to the commandment.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܗܹܫ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܹܪ̈ܘܿܡܹܐ ܕܗܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma qamaya dshabta, bṣapra, kad hesh khishka, shqeel-lhoon anee bakhtate heroome dhoedray ywaw o zeel-lhoon lqawra.
ENG: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they came unto the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: O khze-lhoon lkepa moekhdira min qawra.
ENG: And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O 'weerhoon o la khze-lhoon paghra dmaran eeshoo'.
ENG: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܥܓ̰ܝܼܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܒܪܸ̈ܩܵܢܹܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܕܸܦܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Kad anee 'jeebe baha, ha trey nashe bjoele mabriqane kle-lhoon bdipnayhy.
ENG: And it came to pass, while they were perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling apparel:

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܟܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: O hwe-lhoon bzdoe'ta, o moekip-lhoon patayhy lar'a. Eena anee nashe meerhoon ilayhy, ”qamoodee biṭ'aya ytoon lkhaya gaw meete?
ENG: and as they were affrighted, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܹܫ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: ”Le-yleh lakha, qeema-yleh. Dkhooroen dakhee hoemzim-leh 'amawkhoon hesh haw gaw gleela,
ENG: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,

ASY: ”ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ.“
TRL: ”Dwale-ylaha broona dnasha paesh soepya beedate dnashe khaṭaye, paesh mikhya lzqeepa, o byawma dtlata qaem.“
ENG: saying that the Son of man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah anee dkheerhoon hemizmanoehy.
ENG: And they remembered his words,

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: O deerhoon min qawra, o hoeqe-lhoon klayhy ane lkhadi'sar o lklayhy khene.
ENG: and returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

ASY: ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ: ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢ، ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O ane ywaw bakhtate: maryam maghdlayta, o yookhan, o maryam yima dya'qoow, o bakhtate khene 'amayhy. Ane hoeqe-lhoon kl mindee lshleekhe.
ENG: Now they were Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James: and the other women with them told these things unto the apostles.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܹܐܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena anee la hoeminhoon lbakhtate, o khsheew-lhoon hemizmanayhy aykh hemizmane dshedane.
ENG: And these words appeared in their sight as idle talk; and they disbelieved them.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܟܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ. ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܥܲܓ̰ܘܼܒܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Qeem-leh shim'oon kepa o rkheeṭ-leh lqawra, o keep-leh o khze-leh lkitane moetbe bnawshayhy. O zeel-leh kad 'ajoebe boet mindee dhwe-leh.
ENG: But Peter arose, and ran unto the tomb; and stooping and looking in, he seeth the linen cloths by themselves; and he departed to his home, wondering at that which was come to pass.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܥܲܡܵܐܘܿܣ، ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܡܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Bhaw yawma trey minayhy bezala ywaw lkhda mata shimoeha 'amaoos, rikhqa min oorishlim shaw'a meele,
ENG: And behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was threescore furlongs from Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O hamzoeme ywaw khad 'am dhaw khena boet klayhy ane dqoewim-lhoon.
ENG: And they communed with each other of all these things which had happened.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܘܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Kad anee hadkha hamzoeme o baqoere khad min haw khena, eeshoo' bganeh te-leh lkis layhy o shoere-leh bezala 'amayhy.
ENG: And it came to pass, while they communed and questioned together, that Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܝܼܕܵܥܹܗ.
TRL: Eena anee la dee' lhoon ileh sabab 'aynayhy dweeqe ywaw min leeda'eh.
ENG: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܫܝܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: O boeqireh minayhy, ”moodee yna ane hemizmane dhamzoeme ytoon khad 'am dhaw khena kad bezala?“ o anee kle-lhoon psheeme.
ENG: And he said unto them, What communications are these that ye have one with another, as ye walk? And they stood still, looking sad.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܩܲܠܝܘܿܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh khad minayhy shimeh qalyoopa o meereh ileh, ”akhchee at eewit noekhraya min oorishlim dle ywit beeda'a boet mindee dhwe-leh gawoeha bane yawmane?“
ENG: And one of them, named Cleopas, answering said unto him, Dost thou alone sojourn in Jerusalem and not know the things which are come to pass there in these days?

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܘܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܘܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy, ”moodee?“ joewib-lhoon ileh, ”boet eeshoo' naṣraya, nasha nweea o khaylana bhemizman o bpoelkhana qam Alaha o qam kleh 'ama.
ENG: And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:

ASY: ”ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܠܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ.
TRL: ”Soepe-lhoon ileh goerane dkahne o reshane dee-an ldeewan dmawta o mkhe-lhoon lzqeepa.
ENG: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ. ܥܲܠ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Akhnan bhewee ywakh waw dhaw bit pariq wa leesrayel. 'Al kleh aha, idyoom yawma dtlata-yleh ha min dane hwe-lhoon.
ENG: But we hoped that it was he which should redeem Israel. Yea and beside all this, it is now the third day since these things came to pass.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܥܓ̰ܸܒܝܼ ܠܲܢ. ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ،
TRL: ”Oep khakma min bakhtate minan qam ma'jibee lan. zeel-lhoon lqawra qaydamta jalde,
ENG: Moreover certain women of our company amazed us, having been early at the tomb;

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O kad la khze-lhoon lpaghreh, te-lhoon o meerhoon ilan dkhze-lhoon malake tama, aynee dmeerhoon ilayhy dkhaya-yleh.
ENG: and when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܩܒ݂ܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Oep nashe minan zeel-lhoon lbeyt qwoera, o moechikh-lhoon hadkha, aykh dmeerhoon bakhtate, eena ileh la khze-lhoon.“
ENG: And certain of them that were with us went to the tomb, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܪܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܝܲܩܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ya baṣoore dparmayta, o yaqoere bliba lhamoene klayhy anee dhoemzim-lhoon nwee-e,
ENG: And he said unto them, O foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܘܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܹܗ؟“
TRL: ”Le ywa ananqayta dqabil wa khasha msheekha bane o 'aber wa ltishbookhteh?“
ENG: Behoved it not the Christ to suffer these things, and to enter into his glory?

ASY: ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O shoere-leh min moeshe o min klayhy nwee-e pashoeqe ilayhy klayhy ktabe boet ganeh.
ENG: And beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he interpreted to them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ.
TRL: O qoerbinhoon lmata dbezala ywaw iloeha, eena eeshoo' moekhze-leh aykh din bezala ywa lkhda doeka boesh rikhqa.
ENG: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they were going: and he made as though he would go further.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܦܘܼܫ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܓܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena anee moelyiṣ-lhoon ileh, bemara, ”poesh lkis lan, sabab ramsha qarboene-yleh, o yawma bignaya-yleh.“ o 'weereh dpaesh wa lkis layhy.
ENG: And they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is now far spent. And he went in to abide with them.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad teew-lhoon lsoepra, shqeel-leh lakhma o boerikh-leh o qṣe-leh o yoebil-leh ilayhy.
ENG: And it came to pass, when he had sat down with them to meat, he took the bread, and blessed it, and brake, and gave to them.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana mṣe-lhoon khazee ywaw, o dee' lhoon ileh, eena haw ṭleeq-leh min qam 'aynayhy.
ENG: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܒܲܢ ܒܸܩܝܵܕܵܐ ܒܓܵܘܲܢ، ܟܲܕ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܘܦܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ؟“
TRL: O meerhoon khad lhaw khena, ”le ywa liban biqyada bgawan, kad hamzoeme ywa 'aman boerkha o pashoeqe ktabe ilan?“
ENG: And they said one to another, Was not our heart burning within us, while he spake to us in the way, while he opened to us the scriptures?

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܠܸܚܕܵܕܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Qeem-lhoon bhay 'dana o deerhoon loorishlim, o khze-lhoon lkhadi'sar talmeede o khene 'amayhy jmee'e likhdade,
ENG: And they rose up that very hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

ASY: ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.“
TRL: O bemara, ”shareeraeet Maran qeema-yleh, o peesh-leh khizya lshim'oon kepa.“
ENG: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.
TRL: Oep anee trey hoeqe-lhoon mindee dhwe-leh boerkha, o dakhee dee' lhoon ileh eeman dqṣe-leh lakhma.
ENG: And they rehearsed the things that happened in the way, and how he was known of them in the breaking of the bread.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: O kad talmeede hamzoeme hadkha, eeshoo' bganeh kle-leh gawayhy o meereh, ”shlama ilawkhoon, ana ywin la zad'eetoon.“
ENG: And as they spake these things, he himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܓ̰ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O anee khjeel-lhoon o zdee' lhoon, bikhshawa droekha bikhzaya ywaw.
ENG: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they beheld a spirit.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܫܓ݂ܵܫܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qamoodee bishghasha ytoon, o qamoodee bi'wara yna khoeshabe gaw libawkhoon?
ENG: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and wherefore do reasonings arise in your heart?

ASY: ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܝܼ̈ ܘܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ. ܕܩܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܘܓܲܪ̈ܡܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Khzeymoen eedatee o aqlatee dana ywin bganee. Dqooroen beeee o khzeymoen, sabab roekha layt-laha bisra o garme, aykh dbikhzaya ytoon dana eet-lee.“
ENG: See my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye behold me having.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Min bar dmeereh hadkha, moekhze-leh ilayhy eedateh o aqlateh.
ENG: And when he had said this, he shewed them his hands and his feet.

ASY: ܗܹܫ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: Hesh anee la hamoene min khadoeta o 'oejaba, meereh ilayhy, ”eet lawkhoon lakha mindee lekhala?“
ENG: And while they still disbelieved for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here anything to eat?

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܘܼܢܵܐ ܛܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܫܵܢܵܐ ܕܕܸܒ݂ܫܵܐ.
TRL: O yoebil-lhoon ileh khad sahma min noena ṭweeta o shana ddiwsha.
ENG: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh o kheel-leh qam 'aynayhy.
ENG: And he took it, and did eat before them.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܒܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܡܲܙܡܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”ane hemizmane hoemzim-lee ilawkhoon kad 'amawkhoon eewin wa, dwale ywa dpaesh toemima kl mindee dkteewa-yleh boet deeee bnamoosa dmoeshe o bnwee-e o bmazmoore.“
ENG: And he said unto them, These are my words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, how that all things must needs be fulfilled, which are written in the law of Moses, and the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܸܥܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܦܲܪܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah pteekh-leh lri'yanayhy dparmee waw lktabe.
ENG: Then opened he their mind, that they might understand the scriptures;

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”hadkha kteewa-yleh, wale ywa dmsheekha qabil wa khasha o byawma dtlata qaem wa min gaw meete.
ENG: and he said unto them, Thus it is written, that the Christ should suffer, and rise again from the dead the third day;

ASY: ”ܘܒܫܸܡܹܗ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܹܐ ܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܲܪܘܼܝܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: ”O bshimeh payshee moekrize tyawoeta o poekhala dkhṭeeate lklayhy imwate, sharoeye qamayta min oorishlim.
ENG: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name unto all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”O akhtoon sahde ytoon 'al ane.
ENG: Ye are witnesses of these things.

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܘܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ha ana bit shadrinawkhoon mindee dbabee qoewil-leh dbit shadirawkhoon. Eena akhtoon kleymoen gaw mdeeta doorishlim hal dqableetoon khayla min rawma.“
ENG: And behold, I send forth the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city, until ye be clothed with power from on high.

ASY: ܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܒܘܼܪܟܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Poelṭay-leh 'al beyt 'anya, moerim-leh eedateh o boerkay-leh.
ENG: And he led them out until they were over against Bethany: and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܪܘܼܟܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Kad haw baroekay ywa, preesh-leh minayhy o peesh-leh moesqa lshmaya.
ENG: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he parted from them, and was carried up into heaven.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O anee sgheed-lhoon ileh, o deerhoon loorishlim bkhadoeta goerta.
ENG: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܸܚܩܵܪܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: O anee bkl 'dana gaw haykla ywaw shaboekhe o bikhqara lalaha. Ameyn.
ENG: and were continually in the temple, blessing God.

ASY: ܒܪܵܫܝܼܬ ܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Brasheet milta eewa, o haw milta lkis Alaha ywa, o Alaha ywa haw milta.
ENG: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܵܫܝܼܬ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Aha brasheet lkis Alaha ywa.
ENG: The same was in the beginning with God.

ASY: ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kl mindee byad dee-eh hwe-leh, o bla dee-eh oep khad mindee la hwe-leh min haw dhwe-leh.
ENG: All things were made by him; and without him was not anything made that hath been made.

ASY: ܒܝܼܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Bee-eh khaye ywaw, o khaye bahra ywaw lbnaynasha.
ENG: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

ASY: ܘܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܪܹܩ، ܘܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܓ݂ܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O bahra gaw khishka ke zareq, o khishka la ghleeb-leh ileh.
ENG: And the light shineth in the darkness; and the darkness apprehended it not.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha shoedra min Alaha, shimeh yookhanan.
ENG: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Aha te-leh dyabil sahdoeta boet haw bahra, hadkha dkl nasha hamin byad dee-eh.
ENG: The same came for witness, that he might bear witness of the light, that all might believe through him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ.
TRL: Haw le ywa haw bahra, eena te-leh dyabil sahdoeta 'al bahra.
ENG: He was not the light, but came that he might bear witness of the light.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܒܲܗܪܸܢ ܠܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: Haw bahra shareera dke bahrin lkl nasha, betaya ywa l'alma.
ENG: There was the true light, even the light which lighteth every man, coming into the world.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haw gaw 'alma ywa, o 'alma byad dee-eh hwe-leh, eena 'alma la dee' leh ileh.
ENG: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

ASY: ܠܟܸܣ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Lkis dee-eh te-leh o 'ama dganeh la qoebil-lhoon ileh.
ENG: He came unto his own, and they that were his own received him not.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܹܗ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Eena klayhy anee dqoebil-lhoon ileh, o dhoeminhoon bshimeh, yoebil-leh ilayhy shoelṭana dhawee bnoone dalaha,
ENG: But as many as received him, to them gave he the right to become children of God, even to them that believe on his name:

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܘܝܼܹܐ.
TRL: Anee dla min dima, o la min ṣiwyana dpaghra, o la min ṣiwyana dgawra, ila min Alaha peesh-lhoon hwee-e.
ENG: which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

ASY: ܘܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ، ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܘܲܢ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܚܸܩܪܹܗ، ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܫܪܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: O milta hwe-leh bisra, o shre-leh bgawan, o khze lan khiqreh, khiqra deekheedaya dmin baba, milya shapaqat o shrara.
ENG: And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us (and we beheld his glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father), full of grace and truth.

ASY: ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܝܼ.“
TRL: Yookhanan sheed-leh boet dee-eh, o moeqwikh-leh, bemara, ”aha ywa haw dmeeree boet dee-eh dbetaya-yleh min bar deeee, haw deeleh boesh goera minee, sabab eewa min qam deeee.“
ENG: John beareth witness of him, and crieth, saying, This was he of whom I said, He that cometh after me is become before me: for he was before me.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܹܗ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܠܲܢ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܥܲܠ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ.
TRL: O min milyoeteh akhnan klan shqeel lan shapaqat 'al shapaqat.
ENG: For of his fulness we all received, and grace for grace.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab namoosa byad moeshe peesh-leh yoewa, eena shapaqat o shrara byad eeshoo' msheekha peesh-lhoon yoebe.
ENG: For the law was given by Moses; grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܥܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܗ̇ܘ ܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Oep khad le-yleh khizya lalaha. Eena broona eekheedaya, haw deeleh b'oeba dbaboehy, haw moedi' leh boet dee-eh.
ENG: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܹܘܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟“
TRL: Aha ywa sahdoeta dyookhanan, eeman dyhoedaye min oorishlim shoedirhoon lkis-leh kahne o lewaye dbaqree waw-leh, ”at manee ywit?“
ENG: And this is the witness of John, when the Jews sent unto him from Jerusalem priests and Levites to ask him, Who art thou?

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܠܵܐ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: Haw moede-leh o la sreew-leh, bemara, ”ana le ywin msheekha.“
ENG: And he confessed, and denied not; and he confessed, I am not the Christ.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܒܲܣ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“ ”ܗ̇ܘ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, ”bas manee ywit, eleea ywit?“ joewib-leh, ”la, le ywin.“ ”haw nweea ywit?“ joewib-leh, ”la.“
ENG: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elijah? And he saith, I am not. Art thou the prophet? And he answered, No.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟ ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ. ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: meerhoon ileh, ”manee ywit? moor ilan dyabakh joewab lanee dshoedirhoon ilan. Moodee bemara ywit boet ganoekh?“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ’ܡܲܫܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ،‘ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh yookhanan: ”ana qala ywin biqraya gaw bareea, ’mashweymoen oerkha dmarya,‘ dakhee dmeereh esha'ya nweea.“
ENG: He said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said Isaiah the prophet.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ،
TRL: Anee dpeeshe ywaw shoedre min preeshe ywaw,
ENG: And they had been sent from the Pharisees.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܒܲܣ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܐܹܠܝܼܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh, ”bas qamoodee ma'moede ywit, in le ywit msheekha o la eleea o la haw nweea?“
ENG: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why then baptizest thou, if thou art not the Christ, neither Elijah, neither the prophet?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܹܗ،
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy yookhanan, ”ana ma'moede ywin bmeea, eena eet kilya gawawkhoon haw dakhtoon le ytoon beeda'eh,
ENG: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: in the midst of you standeth one whom ye know not,

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܬܲܣܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Aha-yleh haw dbetaya-yleh min bar deeee, haw dana le khashkhen dshareyn tasmate dṣawloehy.“
ENG: even he that cometh after me, the latchet of whose shoe I am not worthy to unloose.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܒܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Ane hwe-lhoon gaw beyt 'anya, bmarza khena dyoordnan ayka dyookhanan ma'moede ywa.
ENG: These things were done in Bethany beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

ASY: ܘܠܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܦܹܐܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: O lyawma dbareh khze-leh yookhanan leeshoo' betaya lkis-leh, o meereh, ”ha pera dalaha, haw dshaqel khṭeeta d'alma.
ENG: On the morrow he seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold, the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world!

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aha-yleh haw dana meeree boet dee-eh: min bar deeee betaya-yleh khad boesh goera minee, sabab min qam deeee ywa.
ENG: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is become before me: for he was before me.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܒܘܼܬ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O ana le yad'en wa-leh, ila qa dpaesh wa dee'a leesrayel, boet hada ana te-lee ma'moede bmeea.“
ENG: And I knew him not; but that he should be made manifest to Israel, for this cause came I baptizing with water.

ASY: ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܘܢܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Yookhanan sheed-leh, bemara, ”khze-lee roekha biṣlaya min shmaya aykh yawna o bishraya 'aloehy.
ENG: And John bare witness, saying, I have beheld the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven; and it abode upon him.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܲܥܡܸܕܸܢ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܪܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O ana la dee' lee ileh, ila haw dshoedrineh dma'midin bmeea meereh ilee, ’lman dkhazeyt roekha biṣlaya o bishraya 'aloehy, aha-yleh haw dma'mid broekha dqoedsha.‘
ENG: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, he said unto me, Upon whomsoever thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and abiding upon him, the same is he that baptizeth with the Holy Spirit.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O ana khze-lee o beeawa ywin sahdoeta daha-yleh broona dalaha.“
ENG: And I have seen, and have borne witness that this is the Son of God.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: Mindrish byawma khena yookhanan o trey min talmeedoehy kilye ywaw tama,
ENG: Again on the morrow John was standing, and two of his disciples;

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܦܹܐܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O kheereh beeshoo' kad bikhdara, o meereh, ”ha pera dalaha.“
ENG: and he looked upon Jesus as he walked, and saith, Behold, the Lamb of God!

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon anee trey talmeedoehy, zeel-lhoon bar eeshoo'.
ENG: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ؟“ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ (ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܫܩܵܐ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ)، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ؟“
TRL: Deereh eeshoo' o khizyay-leh betaya bareh o boeqireh minayhy, ”moodee ba'eytoon?“ anee joewib-lhoon, ”rabee (dpyasha-yleh poeshqa malpana), ayka ke payshet?“
ENG: And Jesus turned, and beheld them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye? And they said unto him, Rabbi (which is to say, being interpreted, Master), where abidest thou?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ.“ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: meereh, ”teymoen o khzeymoen.“ o te-lhoon o khze-lhoon ayka pyasha ywa, o peesh-lhoon lkis-leh bhaw yawma, o aykh sa'at darba' ywa min bar kawitra.
ENG: He saith unto them, Come, and ye shall see. They came therefore and saw where he abode; and they abode with him that day: it was about the tenth hour.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܪܹܝ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.
