TRL: Khad min anee trey dshmee' lhoon min yookhanan o zeel-lhoon bar eeshoo', andreoos eewa, akhoona dshim'oon kepa.
ENG: One of the two that heard John speak, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܠܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: Aha moechikh-leh qamayta lshim'oon akhoonoehy o meereh ileh, ”moechikh lan lmsheekha.“
ENG: He findeth first his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messiah (which is, being interpreted, Christ).

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.“
TRL: O moete-leh lshim'oon lkis eeshoo'. Kheereh bee-eh eeshoo' o meereh, ”at eewit shim'oon broona dyawna, at bit payshet qirya kepa.“
ENG: He brought him unto Jesus. Jesus looked upon him, and said, Thou art Simon the son of John: thou shalt be called Cephas (which is by interpretation, Peter).

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ. ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Byawma khena b'e-leh eeshoo' dazel lgleela. Moechikh-leh lpeeleepoos o meereh ileh, ”ta baree.“
ENG: On the morrow he was minded to go forth into Galilee, and he findeth Philip: and Jesus saith unto him, Follow me.

ASY: ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.
TRL: Peeleepoos min beyt ṣayada ywa, mdeeta dandreoos o shim'oon kepa.
ENG: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.

ASY: ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ.“
TRL: Peeleepoos moechikh-leh lnatneeeyl o meereh ileh, ”moechikh lan lhaw dmoeshe kteew-leh boet dee-eh bnamoosa, o oep nwee-e kteew-lhoon boet dee-eh, deeleh eeshoo' broona dyawsip, min naṣrat.“
ENG: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ، ”ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܨܪܲܬ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ؟“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܝܼ.“
TRL: Boeqireh natneeeyl, ”ke hawya dmin naṣrat paleṭ mindee ṭawa?“ meereh ileh peeleepoos, ”ta o khzee.“
ENG: And Nathanael said unto him, Can any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܦܸܠܡܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' lnatneeeyl betaya lkis-leh, meereh boet dee-eh, ”ha, shareeraeet broona deesrayel dlayt pilma bee-eh.“
ENG: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܝܼ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܟܲܕ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ، ܩܲܡ ܚܵܙܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Boeqireh mineh natneeeyl, ”min ayka ke yad'et-lee?“ joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”min qam dqare wa-loekh peeleepoos, kad tkhoot eelana dtene, qam khazeynoekh.“
ENG: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh natneeeyl, ”rabee, at eewit broona dalaha, at eewit malka deesrayel.“
ENG: Nathanael answered him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art King of Israel.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܩܲܡ ܚܵܙܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܝܼܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”sabab meeree iloekh dqam khazeynoekh tkhoot eelana dtene, hamoene ywit? Bit khazeyt mindeeane boesh goere min aha.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee underneath the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܘܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min adeea bit khazeytoon shmaya pteekhta o malake dalaha besaqa o biṣlaya lkis broona dnasha.
ENG: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye shall see the heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܛܢܹܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ. ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma dtlata hwe-leh khloela gaw qaṭne dgleela. Yima deeshoo' tama ywa.
ENG: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟ̰ܝܼܕܹܐ ܠܚܠܘܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Oep eeshoo' o talmeedoehy peeshe ywaw cheede lkhloela.
ENG: and Jesus also was bidden, and his disciples, to the marriage.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dpreeq-leh khamra, yima deeshoo' meeraha ileh, ”layt-lhoon khamra.“
ENG: And when the wine failed, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ؟ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܬܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”ma lakhy minee, bakhta? Hesh le-ylaha teeta sa'atee.“
ENG: And Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: O hay meeraha lregawate, ”'woodoen kl mindee damer ilawkhoon.“
ENG: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܚܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܩܵܐ ܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܕܵܒܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eet waw tama ishta khawde dkepa, moetbe qa dakhayta dyhoedaye, o kl khad dabeq wa trey yan tlata goede.
ENG: Now there were six waterpots of stone set there after the Jews’ manner of purifying, containing two or three firkins apiece.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ، ”ܡܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.“ ܘܡܸܠܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܦܘܼܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' l'awdane dkhilmat, ”mleymoen-lhoon ane khawde meea.“ o milyay-lhoon hal poemayhy.
ENG: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܠܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܬܵܐ.“ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”adeea dreymoen o haloen lgoera dmishtoeta.“ o dre-lhoon o yoebil-lhoon.
ENG: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the ruler of the feast. And they bare it.

ASY: ܘܛܥܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܠܝܲܝ ܚܵܘܕܹ̈ܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܚܸܬܢܵܐ،
TRL: O ṭ'eem-leh goera dmishtoeta meea dhwe-lhoon khamra, eena la dee' leh min ayka ywa. Regawate ke yad'ee waw, sabab anee ywaw milyay khawde meea. Haygah qre-leh goera dmishtoeta lkhitna,
ENG: And when the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and knew not whence it was (but the servants which had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast calleth the bridegroom,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܕܸܪ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܕܸܪ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”kl nasha ke makhdir khamra ṣpayee qamayta, o eeman drwe-lhoon nashe, ke makhdir khamra la ṣpayee. Eena at shweeq-loekh khamra ṣpayee hal adeea.“
ENG: and saith unto him, Every man setteth on first the good wine; and when men have drunk freely, then that which is worse: thou hast kept the good wine until now.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܛܢܹܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܹܗ، ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Aha ywa haw neeshanqa qamaya d'weed-leh eeshoo' gaw qaṭne dgleela, o moedi' leh khiqreh, o hoeminhoon bee-eh talmeedoehy.
ENG: This beginning of his signs did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ. ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Min bar aha ṣle-leh eeshoo' lkparnakhoom, haw o yimeh o akhoonwateh o talmeedoehy. O peesh-lhoon tama khakma yawmane.
ENG: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and there they abode not many days.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: O eeman dqarboene ywa piṣkha dyhoedaye, seeq-leh eeshoo' loorishlim.
ENG: And the passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܬܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܨܲܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Gaw haykla khze-leh nashe zaboene tawre o 'irbe o yawne, o ṣarape teebe ṣaroepe zoeze.
ENG: And he found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

ASY: ܬܘܼܪܸܨ ܠܹܗ ܩܲܡܟ̰ܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܠܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܠܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܘܠܬܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܲܪ̈ܵܦܹܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܹܗ ܦܵܬܘܿܪ̈ܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Toeriṣ-leh qamchee min khawla, o poeliṭ-leh lklayhy min haykla, o l'irbe o ltawre, o boerbiz-leh zoeze dṣarape, o moekhdireh patoorayhy.
ENG: and he made a scourge of cords, and cast all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܙܲܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܵܘܢܹ̈ܐ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܫܘܼܩܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh lanee dzaboene ywaw yawne, ”shqooloen ane makha, o la 'awdeetoon-leh bayta dbabee shoeqa.“
ENG: and to them that sold the doves he said, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house a house of merchandise.

ASY: ܘܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ”ܛܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܡ ܐܵܟܹܠ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: O dkheerhoon talmeedoehy dkteewa-yleh, ”ṭnana dbaytoekh qam akel-lee.“
ENG: His disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house shall eat me up.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh yhoedaye, ”moodee neeshanqa bit makhzeyt lan deet-loekh shoelṭana li'wada ane?“
ENG: The Jews therefore answered and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܣܬܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”stooroen-leh aha haykla, o ana bit maqimineh btlata yawmane.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܒܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܘܐܸܫܸܬ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”barb'ee o ishit shine peesh-leh binya aha haykla, o at bit maqimit-leh btlata yawmane?“
ENG: The Jews therefore said, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou raise it up in three days?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Eena haw hamzoeme ywa boet haykla dpaghreh.
ENG: But he spake of the temple of his body.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Min bar dqeem-leh min gaw meete, dkheerhoon talmeedoehy moodee ywa meera. Haygah hoeminhoon bktabe o bhemizman dmeera ywa eeshoo'.
ENG: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he spake this; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: Kad eeshoo' gaw oorishlim eewa b'eda dpiṣkha, raba nashe khze-lhoon neeshanqe dbi'wada ywa o hoeminhoon bshimeh.
ENG: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, during the feast, many believed on his name, beholding his signs which he did.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ،
TRL: Eena eeshoo' la dirya-leh hewee-eh 'alayhy sabab ke yade' wa lkl nasha,
ENG: But Jesus did not trust himself unto them, for that he knew all men,

ASY: ܘܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O le ywa sneeqa lnasha dyabil-leh sahdoeta boet barnasha, sabab ke yade' wa moodee eet bbarnasha.
ENG: and because he needed not that any one should bear witness concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha min preeshe shimeh neeqademoos, goera dyhoedaye.
ENG: Now there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.“
TRL: Aha te-leh lkis eeshoo' blayle o meereh ileh, ”rabee, beeda'a ywakh dmin Alaha teea ywit malpana, sabab oep khad nasha le maṣe 'abed ane neeshanqe dat bi'waday ywit, in Alaha la hawe 'ameh.“
ENG: The same came unto him by night, and said to him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these signs that thou doest, except God be with him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin iloekh, in nasha la paesh leeda gaha dtartey le maṣe khaze malkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born anew, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܣܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh ileh neeqademoos, ”dakhee maṣe nasha paesh leeda kad sawa-yleh? Maṣe gaha dtartey 'aber gaw kesa dyimeh o paesh leeda?“
ENG: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin iloekh, in nasha la paesh leeda min meea o roekha, le maṣe 'aber lmalkoeta dalaha.
ENG: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ، ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Haw deeleh leeda min bisra, bisra-yleh, o haw deeleh hweea min roekha, roekha-yleh.
ENG: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܸܬ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܹܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ.
TRL: ”La 'ajbit dmeeree iloekh dwale-ylaha dpaysheetoon leede gaha dtartey.
ENG: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born anew.

ASY: ”ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܚܹܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܩܵܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Pawkha ke makhe bhay doeka dbasma-leh. Ke sham'et qaleh, eena le yad'et min ayka betaya-yleh o layka bezala-yleh. Hadkha-yleh kl man deeleh leeda min roekha.“
ENG: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the voice thereof, but knowest not whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh neeqademoos o meereh, ”dakhee maṣee ane hawee?“
ENG: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ؟
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”at eewit malpana deesrayel, o ane le ywit beeda'a?
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou the teacher of Israel, and understandest not these things?

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܘܼܗ̇ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܲܢ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin iloekh, mindee dbeeda'a ywakh hamzoeme ywakh, o mindee dkhizya ywakh beeawa ywakh sahdoeta boet dee-eh, eena akhtoon le ytoon qaboeloeha sahdoetan.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and bear witness of that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܵܝܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: ”In mindeeane ar'anaye meeree ilawkhoon o le ytoon hamoene, dakhee bit hamineetoon in amren ilawkhoon mindeeane shmayanaye?
ENG: If I told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you heavenly things?

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep khad le-yleh seeqa lshmaya shwooq min haw dṣle-leh min shmaya, broona dnasha deeleh gaw shmaya.
ENG: And no man hath ascended into heaven, but he that descended out of heaven, even the Son of man, which is in heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܚܘܼܘܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ،
TRL: ”O dakhee dmoerim-leh moeshe khoewe gaw bareea, hadkha wale-ylaha dpaesh moerma broona dnasha,
ENG: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:

ASY: ”ܕܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Dkl man dhamin bee-eh hawe-leh khaye dl'alam.“
ENG: that whosoever believeth may in him have eternal life.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ، ܕܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܛܵܠܹܩ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Sabab hadkha moekhib-leh Alaha l'alma dakhee dyoebil-leh lbrooneh eekheedaya, dkl man dhamin bee-eh la ṭaleq, ila hawe-leh khaye dl'alam.
ENG: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth on him should not perish, but have eternal life.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܕܵܐܹܢ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܦܵܪܹܩ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab la shoedireh Alaha lbrooneh l'alma ddaen l'alma, ila dpareq 'alma bee-eh.
ENG: For God sent not the Son into the world to judge the world; but that the world should be saved through him.

ASY: ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Man dhamin bee-eh le paesh deena, o man dla hamin min jalde peesha-yleh deena, sabab la hoemineh bshima dbroona eekheedaya dalaha.
ENG: He that believeth on him is not judged: he that believeth not hath been judged already, because he hath not believed on the name of the only begotten Son of God.

ASY: ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ، ܕܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O aha-ylaha dyanta, dbahra te-leh l'alma, eena nashe moekhib-lhoon lkhishka boesh zawda min bahra sabab poelkhanayhy beeshe ywaw.
ENG: And this is the judgment, that the light is come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.

ASY: ܟܠ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓܸܠܝܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Kl d'abed beeshate ke sane lbahra, o le ate lkis bahra dla payshee gilye poelkhanoehy.
ENG: For every one that doeth ill hateth the light, and cometh not to the light, lest his works should be reproved.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ.
TRL: Eena kl d'abed shrara, ke ate lkis bahra dpayshee dee'e poelkhanoehy dbalaha yna 'weede.
ENG: But he that doeth the truth cometh to the light, that his works may be made manifest, that they have been wrought in God.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar ane te-leh eeshoo' 'am talmeedoehy lar'a deehoed, o peesh-leh tama 'amayhy o ma'mid wa.
ENG: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܝܢ ܝܘܿܢ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܫܵܠܝܼܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ،
TRL: Oep yookhanan ma'mid wa gaw 'eyn yoon qoerba lshaleem, sabab eet wa meea raba tama, o atee waw nashe o payshee waw 'meede,
ENG: And John also was baptizing in AEnon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab hesh yookhanan le ywa peesha dirya gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: For John was not yet cast into prison.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܚܲܕ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Hwe-leh doerasha beyl talmeede dyookhanan o khad yhoedaya boet dakhayta bmeea.
ENG: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew about purifying.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܒܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O te-lhoon lkis yookhanan o meerhoon ileh, ”rabee-an, haw deewa 'amoekh bmarza khena dyoordnan, haw dyoebil-loekh sahdoeta boet dee-eh, oep haw ma'moede-yleh, o raba bezala yna lkis-leh.“
ENG: And they came unto John, and said to him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou hast borne witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all men come to him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy yookhanan, ”le maṣe nasha shaqel mindee, in la paesh yoewa ileh min shmaya.
ENG: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it have been given him from heaven.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ، ’ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”Akhtoon sahde ytoon dana meeree, ’le ywin ana msheekha, ila dpeesha ywin shoedra min qam dee-eh.‘
ENG: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but, that I am sent before him.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܠܬܵܐ ܚܸܬܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܪܵܚܡܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܵܠܹܐ ܘܡܲܨܝܸܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܸܬܢܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Man deet-leh kalta khitna-yleh, o rakhma dkhitna, haw dkale o maṣyit ileh, ke khade khadoeta goerta eeman dshame' qala dkhitna. Aha khadoeta deeee-ylaha, o adeea toemim-laha.
ENG: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܙܵܐܹܕ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܨܪܹܢ.
TRL: ”Haw wale-ylaha dzaed, o ana dbaṣren.
ENG: He must increase, but I must decrease.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܠܸܠ، ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Haw date min 'ilil, l'ilil min kl eeleh, o haw deeleh min ar'a, ar'anaya-yleh o min ar'a ke hamzim. Eena haw date min shmaya, l'ilil min kl eeleh.
ENG: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is of the earth, and of the earth he speaketh: he that cometh from heaven is above all.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܘܼܗ̇ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Haw bishada-yleh boet mindee dkhze-leh o shmee' leh, eena oep khad le-yleh qaboeloeha sahdoeteh.
ENG: What he hath seen and heard, of that he beareth witness; and no man receiveth his witness.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܹܗ، ܒܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܵܬܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena kl man dqoebla-yleh sahdoeteh, bimkhaya-yleh khatma dalaha shareera-yleh.
ENG: He that hath received his witness hath set his seal to this, that God is true.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ، ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab haw dalaha shoedireh, hemizmane dalaha ke hamzim, sabab Alaha ke yabil-leh roekha dla kyoela.
ENG: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for he giveth not the Spirit by measure.

ASY: ”ܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: ”Baba ke makhib lbroona, o moetwa-yleh kl mindee beedateh.
ENG: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܪܩܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Man dhamin bbroona eet-leh khaye dl'alam, o man dla hamin bbroona, le khaze khaye, ila karba dalaha 'arqoele-ylaha 'aloehy.“
ENG: He that believeth on the Son hath eternal life; but he that obeyeth not the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abideth on him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܡܲܥܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ،
TRL: Kad dee' leh eeshoo' dshmee' lhoon preeshe dhaw bi'wada ywaw talmeede o ma'moede boesh zawda min yookhanan,
ENG: When therefore the Lord knew how that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

ASY: (ܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ)،
TRL: (kad eeshoo' bganeh le ma'mid wa ila talmeedoehy),
ENG: (although Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples),

ASY: ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Shweeqa-leh eehoed o zeel-leh mindrish lgleela.
ENG: he left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.

ASY: ܘܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ.
TRL: O wale ywa ileh d'aber wa min gaw shamreyn.
ENG: And he must needs pass through Samaria.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܫܟܲܪ، ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗܒ݂ܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ.
TRL: O te-leh lmdeeta dshamraye dke paysha qreeta shkar, qoerba dkhaqla dyoehwoeha ywa ya'qoow lyawsip brooneh.
ENG: So he cometh to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph:

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܹܐܪܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂. ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܟܲܕ ܟܟ̰ܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܪܵܐ. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O eet wa tama bera dmeea dya'qoow. O eeshoo', kad kcheekha min lezala boerkha, teew-leh bdipna dbera. Aykh sa'at dtri'sar eewa.
ENG: and Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ ܠܸܡܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܫܵܬܹܝܢ.“
TRL: O te-laha bakhta min shamreyn limlaya meea. meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”hal-lee meea dshateyn.“
ENG: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܸܙܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab talmeedoehy zeele ywaw lmdeeta lizwana mekhoelta.
ENG: For his disciples were gone away into the city to buy food.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܫܵܡܪܵܝܬܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܵܡܪܵܝܬܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ؟“ (ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܒ݂ܛܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ).
TRL: meeraha ileh hay bakhta shamrayta, ”at yhoedaya ywit o ana shamrayta, dakhee biṭlaba ywit minee meea lishtaya?“ (yhoedaye o shamraye le khawṭee 'am 'oedale).
ENG: The Samaritan woman therefore saith unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a Samaritan woman? (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܥܲܬܝ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܸܫܬܵܝܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬܝ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܒܲܬܝ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh iloeha eeshoo', ”in yad'aty wa mawhawta dalaha, o manee-yleh haw dbiṭlaba-yleh minakhy meea lishtaya, aty bit ṭalbaty wa mineh o haw bit yabil wa lakhy meea khaye.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܘܲܕܪܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܒܹܐܪܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܡܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: meeraha ileh bakhta, ”maree, wadra layt-loekh o bera 'amoeqa-yleh. Mayka-loekh meea khaye?
ENG: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܪܵܐ ܘܫܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܩܸܢܝܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ؟“
TRL: ”Qamoodee at boesh goera ywit min baban ya'qoow, haw dyoebil-leh ilan aha bera o shte-leh mineh, haw o bnoonoehy o qinyanoehy?“
ENG: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his sons, and his cattle?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܸܬ ܨܵܗܹܐ.
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”kl man dshate min ane meea mindrish bit ṣahe.
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto her, Every one that drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܨܵܗܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܢܵܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Eena kl man dshate min meea dana yabeneh le ṣahe l'alam, ila meea dana yabeneh bit hawee gaweh 'ayna dmeea dnaw'ee lkhaye dl'alam.“
ENG: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up unto eternal life.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܨܵܗܝܵܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܢ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܒܸܓܪܵܫܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: meeraha ileh hay bakhta, ”maree, hal-lee min ane meea dla ṣahyan o la hawyan betaya lakha o bigrasha meea.“
ENG: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come all the way hither to draw.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ܝ ܩܪܝܼ ܠܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܟ݂ܝ ܘܬܵܐܝ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”zey qree lgawrakhy o tay lakha.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܟ݂ܝ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-laha ileh, ”layt-lee gawra.“ meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”shrara hoemzim lakhy kad meerakhy dlayt-lee gawra.
ENG: The woman answered and said unto him, I have no husband. Jesus saith unto her, Thou saidst well, I have no husband:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ، ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܟ݂ܝ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: ”Sabab khamsha gawrane eet wa lakhy, o aha dadeea eet lakhy le-yleh gawrakhy. Aha shareeraeet hoemzim lakhy.“
ENG: for thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: this hast thou said truly.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ.
TRL: Joewib-laha ileh hay bakhta, ”maree, bikhzaya ywan dnweea ywit.
ENG: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

ASY: ”ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܲܚ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Awahatan sgheed-lhoon baha ṭoera, eena akhtoon yhoedaye ke amreetoon doeka dwale-ylaha dsaghdakh gawoeha oorishlim eelaha.“
ENG: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܗܲܡܸܢܝ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܣܵܥܲܬ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”bakhta, haminy ilee, sa'at betaya-ylaha dla baha ṭoera o oep la boorishlim bit saghdeetoon lbaba.
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܲܚ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon shamraye ke saghdeetoon lmindee dle yad'eetoon. Akhnan yhoedaye ke saghdakh lmindee dke yad'akh, sabab poerqana min yhoedaye-yleh.
ENG: Ye worship that which ye know not: we worship that which we know: for salvation is from the Jews.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܒܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ.
TRL: ”Eena betaya-ylaha sa'at o adeea-ylaha, eeman dsaghdane shareere bit saghdee lbaba broekha o bshrara, sabab oep baba hadkha saghdane ke ba'e.
ENG: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth: for such doth the Father seek to be his worshippers.

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܒܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Alaha roekha-yleh, o anee dsaghdee-leh wale-ylaha broekha o bshrara saghdee-leh.“
ENG: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship in spirit and truth.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܵܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: meeraha ileh bakhta, ”ana ke yad'an dmsheekha betaya-yleh, o eeman date, haw bit malip lan kl mindee.“
ENG: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messiah cometh (which is called Christ): when he is come, he will declare unto us all things.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”ana ywin, dhamzoeme ywin 'amakhy.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

ASY: ܘܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ؟“ ܝܲܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇؟“
TRL: O baha 'dana te-lhoon talmeedoehy o 'oejib-lhoon dhamzoeme ywa 'am bakhta. Eena oep khad minayhy la meereh ileh, ”moodee ba'eyt?“ yan, ”qamoodee hamzoeme ywit 'amoeha?“
ENG: And upon this came his disciples; and they marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her?

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܬܲܠܸܡܬܘܼܗ̇ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O shweeq-laha bakhta ltalimtoeha o zeel-laha lmdeeta o meeraha lnashe,
ENG: So the woman left her waterpot, and went away into the city, and saith to the men,

ASY: ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ. ܗܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Teymoen khzeymoen nasha dmeereh ilee kl mindee d'weedta ywan. Ha, le-yleh aha msheekha?“
ENG: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: can this be the Christ?

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon min mdeeta o te-lhoon lkis-leh.
ENG: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ، ܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠ.“
TRL: Bhay 'dana ṭleeb-lhoon mineh talmeedoehy bemara, ”rabee-an, khool.“
ENG: In the mean while the disciples prayed him, saying, Rabbi, eat.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܹܢ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܗ̇.“
TRL: Eena haw meereh ilayhy, ”ana eet-lee mekhoelta dakhlen dakhtoon le yad'eetoon-laha.“
ENG: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: meerhoon talmeede beylayhy, ”qamoo moetya-yleh ileh nasha mindee lekhala?“
ENG: The disciples therefore said one to another, Hath any man brought him aught to eat?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܝܼ ܗ̇ܝ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܬܲܡܸܡܸܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”mekhoeltee hay eelaha d'awden ṣiwyana dhaw dshoedireh ilee o tamimin poelkhaneh.
ENG: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to accomplish his work.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܚܸܨܕܵܐ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܲܪܡܘܼܢ ܥܲܝܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܘܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܚܸܨܕܵܐ ܡܸܛܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Le ytoon akhtoon bemara dmin bar arb'a yarkhe bit hawe khiṣda? Eena ana bemara ywin ilawkhoon, marmoen 'aynawkhoon o khzeymoen dkhaqlane khweere yna, o khiṣda miṭya-yleh.
ENG: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh the harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields, that they are white already unto harvest.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܹܕ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܸܥ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܙܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܘܚܵܨܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܕܝܼ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Haw dke khaṣed ke shaqel poer'ana, o ke jami' ṭ'oenyate lkhaye dl'alam, o hadkha dzar'ana o khaṣdana khadee m'oedale.
ENG: He that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal; that he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܪܹܥ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܨܹܕ.
TRL: ”Hadkha ke paysha toemimta hemizman dshrara, khad ke zare' o khena ke khaṣed.
ENG: For herein is the saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܚܵܨܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܟܟ̰ܝܼܚ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܟ̰ܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܚܨܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܡܠܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Ana shoediree ilawkhoon dkhaṣdeetoon mindee dakhtoon la kcheekh lawkhoon bee-eh, ila khene kcheekh-lhoon, o akhtoon khṣeed lawkhoon ṭ'oenyate d'amlayhy.“
ENG: I sent you to reap that whereon ye have not laboured: others have laboured, and ye are entered into their labour.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܕܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ.“
TRL: Raba shamraye min hay mdeeta hoeminhoon bee-eh boet khabra dbakhta dsheed-laha, bemara, ”meereh ilee kl mindee d'weedta ywan.“
ENG: And from that city many of the Samaritans believed on him because of the word of the woman, who testified, He told me all things that ever I did.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eeman dte-lhoon shamraye lkis-leh, ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dpaesh wa lkis layhy, o peesh-leh lkis layhy trey yawmane.
ENG: So when the Samaritans came unto him, they besought him to abide with them: and he abode there two days.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܒܪܹܗ.
TRL: O boesh zawda hoeminhoon bee-eh boet khabreh.
ENG: And many more believed because of his word;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܒܪܵܟ݂ܝ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ، ܘܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܦܵܪܘܿܩܵܐ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ.“
TRL: O meerhoon lbakhta, ”adeea la akhchee boet khabrakhy hamoene ywakh, eena bganan shmee' lan, o beeda'a ywakh daha nasha shareeraeet msheekha-yleh, parooqa d'alma.“
ENG: and they said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy speaking: for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar trey yawmane, pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' min tama o zeel-leh lgleela.
ENG: And after the two days he went forth from thence into Galilee.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab eeshoo' bganeh sheed-leh dnweea gaw mdeeta dganeh layt-leh eeqara.
ENG: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dte-leh lgleela, qoebil-lhoon ileh gleelaye, dkhizye ywaw kl mindee d'weed-leh eeshoo' gaw oorishlim b'eda, sabab oep anee tama ywaw b'eda.
ENG: So when he came into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܩܵܛܢܹܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܚܲܡܪܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ ܚܲܕ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh mindrish eeshoo' lqaṭne dgleela, ayka dmoekhdira ywa meea lkhamra, o eet wa gaw kparnakhoom khad shaleeṭa dbrooneh mree'a ywa.
ENG: He came therefore again unto Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܨܵܠܹܐ ܘܒܲܣܸܡ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh aha nasha deeshoo' teea ywa lgleela min eehoed, zeel-leh lkis-leh o poerpil-leh bee-eh dṣale o basim lbrooneh sabab qoerba dmawta ywa.
ENG: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”in la khazeytoon neeshanqe o doemare le hamineetoon.“
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will in no wise believe.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܨܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܡܵܐܹܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh shaleeṭa, ”maree, ṣlee min qam dmaet broonee.“
ENG: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܙܹܠ݇، ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ.“ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”ze, broonoekh bit khaye.“ o hoemineh haw nasha bhemizman dmeereh ileh eeshoo', o zeel-leh.
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. The man believed the word that Jesus spake unto him, and he went his way.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܹܫ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: O kad haw hesh biṣlaya, tpeeq-lhoon bee-eh regawateh o meerhoon ileh, ”broonoekh khaya-yleh.“
ENG: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, saying, that his son lived.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܬܸܡܵܠܝ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܚܕܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O eeman dboeqireh minayhy baynee sa'at bseem-leh, meerhoon ileh, ”timaly bsa'at dkhda shweeq-laha ileh khamkhamta.“
ENG: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to amend. They said therefore unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

ASY: ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܕܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ.“ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: O dee' leh baboehy dbaha sa'at eewa deeshoo' meereh ileh, ”broonoekh bit khaye.“ o hoemineh haw o kleh bayteh.
ENG: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܬܪܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܠܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Aha ywa neeshanqa trayana d'weed-leh eeshoo' eeman dte-leh min eehoed lgleela.
ENG: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judaea into Galilee.

ASY: ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܩܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bar ane, seeq-leh eeshoo' loorishlim qa 'eda dyhoedaye.
ENG: After these things there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܟܸܣ ܕܲܪܘܵܙܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܗܵܘܘܼܙ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܚܸܣܕܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܣܛܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eet tama gaw oorishlim lkis darwaza d'irbe khda hawoez dke paysha qreeta blishana 'iwraya beyt khisda, o eet gawoeha khamsha sṭoene.
ENG: Now there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porches.

ASY: ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܛܝܼܚܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ، ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܪ̈ܝܼܙܹܐ، ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܠܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܫܥܸܫܹܐ.
TRL: Lakha eet waw shṭeekhe raba nashe mree'e, simye, o shpeele, o breeze, bispara lmeea dpayshee moesh'ishe.
ENG: In these lay a multitude of them that were sick, blind, halt, withered waiting for the moving of the water;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܗܵܘܘܼܙ ܘܡܲܫܥܸܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܨܵܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܫܥܵܫܬܵܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab min 'dana l'dana ke ṣale wa malakha lhay hawoez o mash'ish wa-lhoon meea, o haw qamaya dṣale wa tama min bar sh'ashta dmeea ke paesh wa bseema min kl mar'a deet wa-leh.
ENG: for an angel of the Lord went down at certain seasons into the pool, and stirred the water: whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܘܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eet wa bhay doeka khad nasha dmree'a ywa tlatee o tmanya shine.
ENG: And a certain man was there, which had been thirty and eight years in his infirmity.

ASY: ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܒܘܼܣܡܵܐ؟“
TRL: Khze-leh eeshoo' ileh dmeekha tama, dee' leh dzawna yareekha mree'a ywa, meereh ileh, ”ba'eyt dpayshet boesma?“
ENG: When Jesus saw him lying, and knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he saith unto him, Wouldest thou be made whole?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܗܵܘܘܼܙ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܥܸܫܹܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh haw mree'a o meereh, ”maree, layt-lee nasha ddare-lee gaw hawoez eeman dpyasha yna moesh'ishe meea. Eeman dana betaya ywin, khad khena min qam deeee biṣlaya-yleh.“
ENG: The sick man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܕܘܿܪ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”qoem shqool shweetoekh o khdoor.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, Arise, take up thy bed, and walk.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܝܼܬܹܗ ܘܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana bseem-leh haw nasha. O shqeel-leh shweeteh o khdeereh. Aha hwe-laha byawma dshabta.
ENG: And straightway the man was made whole, and took up his bed and walked. Now it was the sabbath on that day.

ASY: ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܣܡܵܐ، ”ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Yhoedaye meerhoon lhaw dpeesh-leh boesma, ”idyoom shabta-ylaha, le-ylaha qanoonayta iloekh lishqala shweetoekh.“
ENG: So the Jews said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath, and it is not lawful for thee to take up thy bed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܒܲܣܸܡ ܠܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܕܘܿܪ.‘“
TRL: Eena haw joewib-leh ilayhy, ”haw dqam basim-lee, haw meereh ilee, ’shqool shweetoekh o khdoor.‘“
ENG: But he answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ’ܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܚܕܘܿܪ؟‘“
TRL: O anee boeqirhoon mineh, ”manee-yleh haw nasha dmeereh iloekh, ’shqool shweetoekh o khdoor?‘“
ENG: They asked him, Who is the man that said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena haw dpeesh-leh boesma le yade' wa manee ywa, sabab raba kinsha eet wa tama bhay doeka, o eeshoo' greesha-leh ganeh min gawayhy.
ENG: But he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in the place.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܠܵܐ ܚܵܛܹܝܬ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܩܲܘܸܡ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Min bar khad zawna, eeshoo' moechikh-leh gaw haykla o meereh ileh, ”ha, bseem-loekh, la khaṭeyt khena dla khad mindee boesh khirba min haw qamaya qawim 'aloekh.“
ENG: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing befall thee.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O zeel-leh haw nasha o meereh lyhoedaye deeshoo' eewa haw dboesim-leh ileh.
ENG: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus which had made him whole.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܲܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha kamree waw yhoedaye leeshoo' o ba'ee waw liqṭaleh, sabab bi'wada ywa ane bshabta.
ENG: And for this cause did the Jews persecute Jesus, because he did these things on the sabbath.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Eena eeshoo' meereh ilayhy, ”babee biplakha-yleh hal adeea, oep ana biplakha ywin.“
ENG: But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh even until now, and I work.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ؛ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܘܼܗ̇ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܫܲܘܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha boesh zawda ba'ee waw yhoedaye liqṭaleh, la akhchee dbishmaṭa ywa shabta, ila dbemara ywa Alaha baboehy ywa; hadkha bi'wadoeha ganeh shawya 'am Alaha.
ENG: For this cause therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only brake the sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ، ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ.
TRL: Haygah joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, broona le maṣe 'abed mindee min ganeh, ila haw mindee dkhaze baba bi'wada, sabab kl mindee dbaba 'abed, hada oep broona ke 'abed.
ENG: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father doing: for what things soever he doeth, these the Son also doeth in like manner.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Sabab baba ke makhib lbroona, o ke makhze-leh kl mindee d'abed, o boesh goera min ane poelkhane bit makhze-leh, hadkha dakhtoon 'ajbeetoon.“
ENG: For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and greater works than these will he shew him, that ye may marvel.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܹܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab dakhee dbaba ke maqim meete o makhe-lhoon, hadkha oep broona ke makhe lanee dba'e.
ENG: For as the Father raiseth the dead and quickeneth them, even so the Son also quickeneth whom he will.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab baba le daen lnasha, ila klaha dyanta yoewa-leh beeda dbroona.
ENG: For neither doth the Father judge any man, but he hath given all judgment unto the Son;

ASY: ”ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hada dkl nasha myaqir lbroona aykh dke myaqir lbaba, o man dla myaqir lbroona, le myaqir lbaba dshoedireh lbroona.
ENG: that all may honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which sent him.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ ܘܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܸܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dshame' hemizmanee o hamin bhaw dshoedrineh, eet-leh khaye dl'alam, o le ate ldyanta, ila shoene-leh min mawta lkhaye.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth him that sent me, hath eternal life, and cometh not into judgment, but hath passed out of death into life.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܝܼ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, betaya-ylaha sa'at o adeea-ylaha, eeman dmeete bit sham'ee qala dbroona dalaha, o anee dsham'ee bit khayee.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour cometh, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God; and they that hear shall live.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab dakhee dbaba eet-leh khaye bganeh, hadkha yoebil-leh oep lbroona dhawe-leh khaye bganeh.
ENG: For as the Father hath life in himself, even so gave he to the Son also to have life in himself:

ASY: ”ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O yoebil-leh ileh shoelṭana d'abed deewan, sabab broona dnasha-yleh.
ENG: and he gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of man.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܹܗ،
TRL: ”La 'ajbeetoon baha, sabab betaya-ylaha sa'at eeman dklayhy anee dgaw qawrawate yna bit sham'ee-leh qaleh,
ENG: Marvel not at this: for the hour cometh, in which all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice,

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ.
TRL: ”O bit palṭee, anee d'weed-lhoon ṭawate lqyamta dkhaye, o anee d'weed-lhoon beeshate lqyamta ddeewan.
ENG: And shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done ill, unto the resurrection of judgment.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܹܢ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܝܢܹܢ، ܘܕܝܵܢܬܝܼ ܗܲܩ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ana min ganee le maṣeyn mindee 'awden. Dakhee dsham'en ke daynen, o dyantee haq eelaha, sabab le ba'eyn d'awden ṣiwyanee ila ṣiwyana dhaw dshoedireh ilee.
ENG: I can of myself do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is righteous; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”In ana bishada ywin 'al ganee, sahdoetee le-ylaha shareerta.
ENG: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Eet khad khena dke yabil sahdoeta 'alee, o ana beeda'a ywin dsahdoeteh boet deeee shareerta-ylaha.
ENG: It is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon shoedirawkhoon lkis yookhanan, o haw yoebil-leh sahdoeta boet shrara.
ENG: Ye have sent unto John, and he hath borne witness unto the truth.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܸܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Le-ylaha dana ke qablin sahdoeta min bnaynasha, eena ane bemara ywin ilawkhoon dparqeetoon.
ENG: But the witness which I receive is not from man: howbeit I say these things, that ye may be saved.

ASY: ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܠܗܵܝܵܐ ܘܒܲܗܪܘܼܢܹܐ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܨܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܒܒܲܗܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”Yookhanan shraya ywa bilhaya o bahroene, o akhtoon bseem-laha lawkhoon dpaṣkheetoon waw khda sa'at bbahreh.
ENG: He was the lamp that burneth and shineth: and ye were willing to rejoice for a season in his light.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ. ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܬܲܡܸܡܸܢ، ܘܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena ana eet-lee sahdoeta boesh goerta min sahdoeta dyookhanan. Poelkhane dbaba yoebil-leh ilee dtamimin, o aynee dbi'waday ywin, ane bishada yna 'alee dbaba shoedireh ilee.
ENG: But the witness which I have is greater than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to accomplish, the very works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

ASY: ”ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܵܠܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ، ܘܚܸܙܘܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ.
TRL: ”O baba dshoedireh ilee haw sheed-leh 'alee, haw dqaleh har le ytoon shmee'e, o khizweh le ytoon khizye.
ENG: And the Father which sent me, he hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.

ASY: ”ܘܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܡܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”O hemizmaneh le 'amra gawawkhoon, sabab le ytoon hamoene bhaw dshoedireh.
ENG: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he sent, him ye believe not.

ASY: ”ܨܲܚܨܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ṣakhṣeymoen ktabe dke khashweetoon gawayhy eet lawkhoon khaye dl'alam. Ane ktabe beeawa yna sahdoeta boet deeee.
ENG: Ye search the scriptures, because ye think that in them ye have eternal life; and these are they which bear witness of me;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon le ba'eytoon dateytoon lkis-lee dhawe lawkhoon khaye.
ENG: and ye will not come to me, that ye may have life.

ASY: ”ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܸܢ،
TRL: ”Khiqra min bnaynasha le qablin,
ENG: I receive not glory from men.

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ila ke yad'enawkhoon dkhoeba dalaha layt beeawkhoon.
ENG: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in yourselves.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܠܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ana te-lee bshima dbabee, o le ytoon qaboele ilee. Eena in khad khena ate bshima dganeh, lhaw bit qableetoon.
ENG: I am come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܟܲܕ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Dakhee maṣeytoon hamineetoon, kad qaboele ytoon khiqra khad min haw khena, eena khiqra dmin khad Alaha le ytoon biṭ'aya?
ENG: How can ye believe, which receive glory one of another, and the glory that cometh from the only God ye seek not?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܒ݂ܠܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܒܵܒܵܐ. ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܒܹܠ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”La khashweetoon dana bit qawlen ilawkhoon qam baba. Moeshe bit qabel ilawkhoon, haw dklaha heweeawkhoon bee-eh-ylaha.
ENG: Think not that I will accuse you to the Father: there is one that accuseth you, even Moses, on whom ye have set your hope.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Sabab in hamineetoon waw bmoeshe, oep beeee bit hamineetoon waw, sabab haw kteew-leh boet deeee.
ENG: For if ye believed Moses, ye would believe me; for he wrote of me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ؟“
TRL: ”Eena in lktabe dmoeshe le hamineetoon, dakhee bit hamineetoon lhemizmane deeee?“
ENG: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܛܹܒܲܪܝܼܘܿܣ.
TRL: Min bar khakma yawmane 'weereh eeshoo' lmarza khena dyama dgleela, deelaha yama dṭebareeoos.
ENG: After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: O zeel-lhoon bareh kinshe raba sabab khze-lhoon neeshanqe raba d'weed-leh bmar'ane.
ENG: And a great multitude followed him, because they beheld the signs which he did on them that were sick.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O seeq-leh eeshoo' lṭoera, o tama teew-leh 'am talmeedoehy.
ENG: And Jesus went up into the mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

ASY: ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: 'Eda dpiṣkha dyhoedaye qarboene ywa.
ENG: Now the passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand.

ASY: ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ. ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܙܵܒ݂ܢܲܚ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Moerim-leh eeshoo' 'aynoehy o khze-leh kinsha raba betaya lkis-leh. Boeqireh min peeleepoos, ”min ayka zawnakh lakhma dakhlee ane nashe?“
ENG: Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude cometh unto him, saith unto Philip, Whence are we to buy bread, that these may eat?

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Aha boeqireh mineh ljaroebeh, sabab haw bganeh ke yade' wa moodee bit 'abed wa.
ENG: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܬܪܲܝܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܩܸܛܥܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh peeleepoos, ”lakhma bṭeema dtrayma deenare le male-lhoon, oep in dkl khad shaqel akhchee khad qiṭ'a.“
ENG: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one may take a little.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ،
TRL: meereh ileh khad talmeeda khena, andreoos akhoona dshim'oon kepa,
ENG: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, saith unto him,

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܓܸܪ̈ܕܲܝܹܐ ܕܣܥܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Eet khad yala lakha deet-leh khamish girdaye ds'are o tartey noene z'oore, eena ane moodee bit 'awdee qa kleh aha kinsha?“
ENG: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two fishes: but what are these among so many?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܬܒ݂ܝܼ.“ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܸܠܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”shwooqoen nashe dyatwee.“ eet wa gila raba bhay doeka. O anee dteew-lhoon aykh khamsha alpe gawre ywaw.
ENG: Jesus said, Make the people sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܕܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O shqeel-leh eeshoo' lakhma o boerikh-leh o poeli' leh lanee deewaw teebe, o hadkha oep noene, kma db'e-lhoon.
ENG: Jesus therefore took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to them that were set down; likewise also of the fishes as much as they would.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܓ̰ܲܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܠܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܙܝܼܕܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܵܠܹܩ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: Min bar dkheel-lhoon o swee' lhoon, meereh eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy, ”jami'moen lqiṭ'aṭe zeede dla ṭaleq mindee.“
ENG: And when they were filled, he saith unto his disciples, Gather up the broken pieces which remain over, that nothing be lost.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܩܘܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܓܸܪ̈ܕܲܝܹܐ ܕܣܥܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Joemi' lhoon o mle-lhoon tri'sar qoepe min qiṭ'aṭe dzeed-lhoon min khamish girdaye ds'are dkheel-lhoon anee nashe.
ENG: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which remained over unto them that had eaten.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon nashe neeshanqa d'weed-leh eeshoo', meerhoon, ”shareeraeet aha-yleh nweea date ldoenye.“
ENG: When therefore the people saw the sign which he did, they said, This is of a truth the prophet that cometh into the world.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ.
TRL: Eeshoo' dee' leh dba'ee waw atee waw o bkhayla 'awdee waw-leh malka, hadkha shoene-leh khda gaha kheta lṭoera bnawsheh.
ENG: Jesus therefore perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again into the mountain himself alone.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܝܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh ramsha, ṣle-lhoon talmeedoehy lyama,
ENG: And when evening came, his disciples went down unto the sea;

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܘܗܹܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O seeq-lhoon lgamee o ṭre-lhoon 'al yama lgeba dkparnakhoom, o hwe-leh khishka o hesh eeshoo' le ywa adeea lkis layhy.
ENG: and they entered into a boat, and were going over the sea unto Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.

ASY: ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܝܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܫܓ݂ܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Pawkha khaylana bimkhaya ywa, o yama bishghasha ywa.
ENG: And the sea was rising by reason of a great wind that blew.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܲܠܓܹܗ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eeman dṭre-lhoon maykh tlata meele yan tlata meele o palgeh, khze-lhoon leeshoo' bikhdara 'al yama, o qarboene lgamee, o zdee' lhoon.
ENG: When therefore they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they behold Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the boat: and they were afraid.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ana ywin, la zad'eetoon.“
ENG: But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.

ASY: ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O b'e-lhoon dqablee waw-leh gaw gamee, o har bhay 'dana gamee mṭe-laha lbirza ldoeka dbezala ywaw iloeha.
ENG: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat: and straightway the boat was at the land whither they were going.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Byawma khena kinsha dkilya ywa lhaw geba khena dyama khze-lhoon dakhchee khda gamee eet wa tama, aynee deeshoo' o talmeedoehy le ywaw gawoeha, ila zeele ywaw bnawshayhy.
ENG: On the morrow the multitude which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save one, and that Jesus entered not with his disciples into the boat, but that his disciples went away alone

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܹܒܲܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eena gamee-e khene te-lhoon min ṭebareeoos qoerba ldoeka ayka dkinshe kheele ywaw lakhma min bar dboerikh-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: (howbeit there came boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks):

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐܵܦܠܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܓܵܡܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eeman ddee' leh kinsha dla eeshoo' o apla talmeedoehy tama ywaw, seeq-lhoon lanee gamee-e o te-lhoon lkparnakhoom biṭ'aya bar eeshoo'.
ENG: when the multitude therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼܲܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon ileh lmarza khena dyama, boeqirhoon mineh, ”rabee-an, eeman te-loekh lakha?“
ENG: And when they found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, biṭ'aya ytoon baree la dkhze lawkhoon neeshanqe, eena dkheel lawkhoon lakhma o swee' lawkhoon.
ENG: Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw signs, but because ye ate of the loaves, and were filled.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܦܵܠܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܩܵܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܦܠܘܿܚܘܼܢ ܩܵܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܚܵܬܡܹܗ.“
TRL: ”La palkheetoon qa mekhoelta dle paysha, ila plookhoen qa mekhoelta dpaysha lkhaye dl'alam, hay dbroona dnasha yabil lawkhoon, sabab 'aloehy Alaha baba moetiw-leh khatmeh.“
ENG: Work not for the meat which perisheth, but for the meat which abideth unto eternal life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him the Father, even God, hath sealed.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܕܦܵܠܚܲܚ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Haygah anee boeqirhoon mineh, ”moodee 'awdakh dpalkhakh poelkhane dalaha?“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, What must we do, that we may work the works of God?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܡ̇ܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”aha-yleh poelkhana dalaha, dhamineetoon bman dhaw shoedireh.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܲܚ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂؟ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟
TRL: O anee boeqirhoon mineh, ”moodee neeshanqa bit 'awdet dhaminakh beeoekh? Moodee bi'wada ywit?
ENG: They said therefore unto him, What then doest thou for a sign, that we may see, and believe thee? what workest thou?

ASY: ”ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܢܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ’ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ.‘“
TRL: ”Babawatan kheel-lhoon manna gaw bareea, dakhee dkteewa-yleh, ’yoebil-leh ilayhy lakhma min shmaya dakhlee.‘“
ENG: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written, He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, le ywa moeshe dyoebil-leh ilawkhoon lakhma min shmaya, ila babee beeawawkhoon eeleh lakhma shareera min shmaya,
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, It was not Moses that gave you the bread out of heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread out of heaven.

ASY: ”ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Lakhma dalaha haw eeleh dṣle-leh min shmaya o beeawa-yleh khaye l'alma.“
ENG: For the bread of God is that which cometh down out of heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܠܲܢ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meerhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”Maran, hal lan bkl 'dana aha lakhma.“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܟܵܦܹܢ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܨܵܗܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ana ywin lakhma dkhaye. Man date lkis-lee le kapen, o man dhamin beeee le ṣahe l'alam.
ENG: Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall not hunger, and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܩܲܡ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Eena dakhee dmeeree ilawkhoon, qam khazeytoon-lee eena le ytoon hamoene.
ENG: But I said unto you, that ye have seen me, and yet believe not.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ، ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܪܕܹܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kl khad dbaba yabil ilee, lkis-lee ke ate, o kl man date lkis-lee le ṭardeneh.
ENG: All that which the Father giveth me shall come unto me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Sabab te-lee min shmaya la d'awden ṣiwyanee, ila ṣiwyana dman dshoedireh ilee.
ENG: For I am come down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܝܼ، ܕܠܵܐ ܛܵܠܹܩ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O aha-yleh ṣiwyana dhaw dqam shadiree, dla ṭaleq oep khad min klayhy anee dyoebil-leh ilee, ila dmaqimineh byawma kharaya.
ENG: And this is the will of him that sent me, that of all that which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up at the last day.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ، ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܘܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O aha-yleh ṣiwyana dbabee, kl khad dkhaze lbroona o hamin bee-eh bit hawe-leh khaye dl'alam, o ana bit maqimineh byawma kharaya.“
ENG: For this is the will of my Father, that every one that beholdeth the Son, and believeth on him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Boet aha yhoedaye ṭoerṭim-lhoon 'aloehy, sabab meereh, ”ana ywin lakhma dṣle-leh min shmaya.“
ENG: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said, I am the bread which came down out of heaven.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ؟ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܘܝܸܡܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: O meerhoon, ”le-yleh aha eeshoo', broona dyawsip? Baboehy o yimeh ke yad'akh-lhoon. Dakhee adeea bemara-yleh dana ṣle-lee min shmaya?“
ENG: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how doth he now say, I am come down out of heaven?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܛܲܪܛܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la ṭarṭimeetoon bganawkhoon,
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܓܵܪܹܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”nasha le maṣe ate lkis-lee in la garesh-leh baba, haw dshoedireh ilee, o ana bit maqimineh byawma kharaya.
ENG: No man can come to me, except the Father which sent me draw him: and I will raise him up in the last day.

ASY: ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܠܦܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܘܝܵܠܹܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Kteewa-yleh byad nwee-e, dklayhy bit payshee moelpe byad Alaha. Hadkha kl man dshame' o yalep min baba ke ate lkis-lee.
ENG: It is written in the prophets, And they shall all be taught of God. Every one that hath heard from the Father, and hath learned, cometh unto me.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep khad nasha le-yleh khizya lbaba shwooq min haw deeleh min Alaha. Akhchee haw khizya-yleh lbaba.
ENG: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is from God, he hath seen the Father.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, haw dhamin beeee eet-leh khaye dl'alam.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth hath eternal life.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Ana ywin lakhma dkhaye.
ENG: I am the bread of life.

ASY: ”ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܢܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Awahatawkhoon kheel-lhoon manna gaw bareea eena meet-lhoon.
ENG: Your fathers did eat the manna in the wilderness, and they died.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܕܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ.
TRL: ”Eena aha-yleh lakhma dṣle-leh min shmaya, dkl man dakel mineh le maet.
ENG: This is the bread which cometh down out of heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܵܟܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ. ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Ana ywin lakhma dkhaye dṣle-lee min shmaya. In nasha akel min aha lakhma bit khaye l'alam. O paghree-yleh aha lakhma dyabeneh, o boet khaye d'alma bit yabeneh.“
ENG: I am the living bread which came down out of heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: yea and the bread which I will give is my flesh, for the life of the world.

ASY: ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܵܪܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܲܚ؟“
TRL: Yhoedaye darshee waw khad 'am haw khena o amree waw, ”dakhee maṣe aha yabil lan paghreh dakhlakh?“
ENG: The Jews therefore strove one with another, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܫܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܸܡܹܗ، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in la akhleetoon paghra dbroona dnasha o shateytoon dimeh, layt lawkhoon khaye bganawkhoon.
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, ye have not life in yourselves.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܫܵܬܹܐ ܕܸܡܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Man dakel paghree o shate dimee eet-leh khaye dl'alam, o ana bit maqimineh byawma kharaya.
ENG: He that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܕܸܡܝܼ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܫܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab paghree bshareeroeta mekhoelta-yleh, o dimee bshareeroeta shtayta-yleh.
ENG: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܘܫܵܬܹܐ ܕܸܡܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܡܩܵܘܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Man dakel paghree o shate dimee, ke mqawe beeee o ana bee-eh.
ENG: He that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood abideth in me, and I in him.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܠܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dbaba khaya shoedireh ilee o ana bikhaya ywin boet baba, hadkha oep haw dakel-lee bit khaye boet deeee.
ENG: As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he that eateth me, he also shall live because of me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܟܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: ”Aha-yleh lakhma dṣle-leh min shmaya, la aykh haw dkheel-lhoon awahatawkhoon eena meet-lhoon. Man dakel min aha lakhma bit khaye l'alam.“
ENG: This is the bread which came down out of heaven: not as the fathers did eat, and died: he that eateth this bread shall live for ever.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܦܲܪܢܵܚܘܿܡ.
