TRL: Ane meereh eeshoo' kad maloepe bknoeshta gaw kparnakhoom.
ENG: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Raba min talmeede, eeman dshmee' lhoon ane hemizmane, meerhoon, ”aha yoelpana 'asqa-yleh. Manee maṣe shame' leh?“
ENG: Many therefore of his disciples, when they heard this, said, This is a hard saying; who can hear it?

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܛܲܪܛܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܘܼܪܩܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Eeshoo' dee' leh bganeh dtalmeedoehy ṭarṭoeme ywaw boet aha, o meereh ilayhy, ”aha toerqala-yleh ilawkhoon?
ENG: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said unto them, Doth this cause you to stumble?

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Moodee in khazeytoon broona dnasha besaqa ldoeka deewa min qamayta?
ENG: What then if ye should behold the Son of man ascending where he was before?

ASY: ”ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Roekha ke yabil khaye, paghra le-yleh mindee. Hemizmane dhamzoeme ywin 'amawkhoon roekha yna o khaye.
ENG: It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I have spoken unto you are spirit, and are life.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ.“ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ، ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena eet gawawkhoon nashe dle haminee.“ min qamayta eeshoo' ke yade' wa manee ywaw anee dle haminee, o manee ywa haw dsape wa-leh.
ENG: But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who it was that should betray him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܥܒܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”boet aha meeree ilawkhoon dnasha le maṣe ate lkis-lee in babee la ma'bid-leh date.“
ENG: And he said, For this cause have I said unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it be given unto him of the Father.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.
TRL: Min hay 'dana raba min talmeedoehy deerhoon o khena la zeel-lhoon bareh.
ENG: Upon this many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: meereh eeshoo' ltri'sar talmeedoehy, ”oep akhtoon ba'eytoon dshawqeetoon-lee?“
ENG: Jesus said therefore unto the twelve, Would ye also go away?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܟܸܣ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ؟ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh, ”maree, lkis manee azakh? At eet-loekh hemizmane dkhaye dl'alam.
ENG: Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܘܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O akhnan hamoene ywakh o beeda'a ywakh dat eewit qadeesha dalaha.“
ENG: And we have believed and know that thou art the Holy One of God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܓܲܒܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܘܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la ana qam gabeynawkhoon tri'sar o khad minawkhoon akelqarṣa-yleh?“
ENG: Jesus answered them, Did not I choose you the twelve, and one of you is a devil?

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Aha meereh boet eehoeda skaryooṭa broona dshim'oon, khad min tri'sar, sabab hdeera ywa dsape wa-leh.
ENG: Now he spake of Judas the son of Simon Iscariot, for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܣܒܵܒ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar ane, bikhdara ywa eeshoo' gaw gleela, sabab le ba'e wa dpaesh wa gaw eehoed, sbab dyhoedaye ba'ee waw liqṭaleh.
ENG: And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Judaea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܡܛܲܠܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O qoerbina ywa 'eda dmṭalle dyhoedaye.
ENG: Now the feast of the Jews, the feast of tabernacles, was at hand.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܲܢܝܼ ܡܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ.
TRL: O meerhoon akhoonwate deeshoo' ileh, ”shanee makha o ze leehoed dkhazee oep talmeedoekh poelkhane dbi'wada ywit.
ENG: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may behold thy works which thou doest.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܘܸܬ، ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”In nasha ba'e dpaesh dee'a, le palekh bṭishwa. In ane poelkhane bi'waday ywit, makhzee ganoekh l'alma.“
ENG: For no man doeth anything in secret, and himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou doest these things, manifest thyself to the world.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab oep akhoonwateh le ywaw hoemine bee-eh.
ENG: For even his brethren did not believe on him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܥܕܵܢܝܼ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”'danee hesh le-ylaha mṭeeta, eena 'dana deeawkhoon bkl zawna-ylaha.
ENG: Jesus therefore saith unto them, My time is not yet come; but your time is alway ready.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Le maṣe 'alma sane lawkhoon, eena ilee ke sane sabab ana bishada ywin boet dee-eh dpoelkhanoehy beeshe yna.
ENG: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that its works are evil.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܣܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܥܹܐܕܵܐ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܣܩܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܕܵܢܝܼ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܛܝܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”sooqoen akhtoon l'eda. Ana adeea le asqen-laha 'eda, sabab 'danee hesh le-ylaha mṭeeta.“
ENG: Go ye up unto the feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; because my time is not yet fulfilled.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Kad meereh ane, peesh-leh gaw gleela.
ENG: And having said these things unto them, he abode still in Galilee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܠܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena min bar dseeq-lhoon akhoonwateh l'eda, oep eeshoo' seeq-leh, eena la galyaeet, ila bṭishwa.
ENG: But when his brethren were gone up unto the feast, then went he also up, not publicly, but as it were in secret.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܘܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eena yhoedaye ṭa'ee waw bareh b'eda o baqree waw, ”ayka-yleh haw nasha?“
ENG: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܛܲܪܛܲܡܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ. ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،“ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܡܲܚܠܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Hwe-laha ṭarṭamta raba boet dee-eh gaw kinsha. Khakma amree waw, ”nasha ṭawa-yleh,“ o khene amree waw, ”la, makhloeṭe-yleh lkinsha.“
ENG: And there was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him: some said, He is a good man; others said, Not so, but he leadeth the multitude astray.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena oep khad le hamzim wa galyaeet boet dee-eh min zdoe'ta dyhoedaye.
ENG: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar d'weerhoon palga dyawmane d'eda, seeq-leh eeshoo' lhaykla o malip wa.
ENG: But when it was now the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

ASY: ܘܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܦܵܐ؟“
TRL: O 'ajbee waw yhoedaye o amree waw, ”dakhee aha beeda'a-yleh ktabe kad le-yleh leepa?“
ENG: The Jews therefore marveled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”yoelpanee le-yleh min ganee ila min dhaw dshoedrineh.
ENG: Jesus therefore answered them, and said, My teaching is not mine, but his that sent me.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܕܐܸܢ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ.
TRL: ”Man dbasma-leh d'abed ṣiwyaneh, bit yade' din yoelpanee min Alaha-yleh yan min ganee ywin maloepe.
ENG: If any man willeth to do his will, he shall know of the teaching, whether it be of God, or whether I speak from myself.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ، ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܛܵܥܹܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Haw dmin ganeh hamzim, khiqra qa ganeh ke ṭa'e, eena haw dṭa'e khiqra dman dshoedireh ilee, haw shareera-yleh, o 'awla layt bee-eh.
ENG: He that speaketh from himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh the glory of him that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ؟ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ. ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: ”Le ywa moeshe dyoebil-leh ilawkhoon namoosa? Eena oep khad minawkhoon le-yleh binṭara lnamoosa. Qamoodee bib'aya ytoon liqṭalee?“
ENG: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you doeth the law? Why seek ye to kill me?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂. ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh kinsha ileh, ”sheda eet beeoekh. Manee ba'e liqṭaloekh?“
ENG: The multitude answered, Thou hast a devil: who seeketh to kill thee?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܚܲܕ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܘܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܓ̰ܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”khad poelkhana 'weed-lee o klawkhoon 'ajoebe ytoon.
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto them, I did one work, and ye all marvel.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓܵܙܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Moeshe yoebil-leh ilawkhoon gzoerta, apin dle ywa moeshe dyoewa-leh ilawkhoon ila babawate, o byawma dshabta ke gazreetoon barnasha.
ENG: For this cause hath Moses given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers); and on the sabbath ye circumcise a man.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܟܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܕܟܠܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”In nasha paesh gzeera byawma dshabta qa dla paesh shirya namoosa dmoeshe, qamoodee bikraba ytoon minee dklanaeet boesim-lee aha nasha byawma dshabta?
ENG: If a man receiveth circumcision on the sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken; are ye wroth with me, because I made a man every whit whole on the sabbath?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܒܚܙܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܘܼܢ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”La haweytoon bidyana bkhzayta dpata, eena doenoen dyanta shareerta.“
ENG: Judge not according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Bhay 'dana khakma nashe min oorishlim shoere-lhoon lbaqoere, ”le-yleh aha haw dba'ee dqaṭlee-leh?
ENG: Some therefore of them of Jerusalem said, Is not this he whom they seek to kill?

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܟܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܲܢ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ha maloepe-yleh galyaeet, oep khad le-yleh makloeye ileh. Ke yad'ee goeranan bshareeroeta daha-yleh msheekha?
ENG: And lo, he speaketh openly, and they say nothing unto him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is the Christ?

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Aha ke yad'akh-leh min ayka-yleh, eena eeman dmsheekha ate, oep khad le yade' min ayka-yleh.“
ENG: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when the Christ cometh, no one knoweth whence he is.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O kad eeshoo' maloepe ywa bhaykla, moeqwikh-leh o meereh, ”ilee ke yad'eetoon, o min ayka ywin ke yad'eetoon. Eena ana min ganee la te-lee. Haw dshoedireh ilee shareera-yleh, haw dakhtoon le yad'eetoon-leh.
ENG: Jesus therefore cried in the temple, teaching and saying, Ye both know me, and know whence I am; and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Eena ana ke yad'eneh, sabab ana mineh ywin o haw qam shadiree.“
ENG: I know him; because I am from him, and he sent me.

ASY: ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܣܵܥܲܬܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O b'e-lhoon lidwaqeh, eena oep khad la dre-leh 'aloehy eeda sabab hesh sa'ateh le ywa teeta.
ENG: They sought therefore to take him: and no man laid his hand on him, because his hour was not yet come.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Eena raba min kinsha hoeminhoon bee-eh o amree waw, ”qamoo eeman date msheekha bit 'abed neeshanqe boesh zawda min aha dbi'wada-yleh?“
ENG: But of the multitude many believed on him; and they said, When the Christ shall come, will he do more signs than those which this man hath done?

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܟ̰ܦܘܼܟ̰ܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܪ̈ܛܹܐ ܕܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon preeshe lkinshe pachpoeche ane khabre boet dee-eh, shoedirhoon anee o goerane dkahne shoerṭe ddawqee waw-leh.
ENG: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him; and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to take him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”'amawkhoon eewin qa khad zawna kirya, o haygah bit azen lkis haw dshoedireh ilee.
ENG: Jesus therefore said, Yet a little while am I with you, and I go unto him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Bit ṭa'eytoon baree o le machkheetoon-lee, o ayka dana ywin, akhtoon le maṣeytoon ateytoon.“
ENG: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, ye cannot come.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܲܚ ܠܹܗ؟ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܐܘܼܡܬܲܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: meerhoon yhoedaye khad lhaw khena, ”layka ba'e azel aha dakhnan le khazakh-leh? Qamoodee ba'e azel lkis bnay oemtan deena boerbize gaw yawnaye o malip lyawnaye?
ENG: The Jews therefore said among themselves, Whither will this man go that we shall not find him? will he go unto the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ’ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ‘؟“
TRL: ”Moodee-yleh aha dbemara-yleh, ’bit ṭa'eytoon baree o le machkheetoon-lee, o layka dana ywin akhtoon le maṣeytoon ateytoon‘?“
ENG: What is this word that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, ye cannot come?

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܨܹܗܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܘܫܵܬܹܐ،
TRL: Byawma kharaya d'eda, yawma goera, kle-leh eeshoo' o hoemzim-leh bqala rama o meereh, ”man dṣehya-yleh, ate lkis-lee o shate,
ENG: Now on the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܢܲܗܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܫܦܵܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܹܗ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”O kl man dhamin beeee, nahrawate dmeea khaye bit hawee bishpakha min keseh, dakhee dmeerhoon ktabe.“
ENG: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Aha meereh boet roekha dqablee waw anee dhaminee waw bee-eh. Hal aha 'dana roekha le ywa peesha yoewa sabab hesh eeshoo' le ywa peesha khqeera.
ENG: But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believed on him were to receive: for the Spirit was not yet given; because Jesus was not yet glorified.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: Raba min kinsha eeman dshmee' lhoon hemizmanoehy meerhoon, ”shareeraeet aha-yleh haw nweea.“
ENG: Some of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, This is of a truth the prophet.

ASY: ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.“ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ؟
TRL: khene amree waw, ”aha-yleh msheekha.“ o khene baqree waw, ”qamoo ke hawya dmsheekha ate min gleela?
ENG: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, What, doth the Christ come out of Galilee?

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬܠܚܸܡ ܡܵܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܥܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”La meereh ktawa, dmin zar'a ddaweed o min beytlkhim mata, ayka ddaweed 'meereh bit ate msheekha?“
ENG: Hath not the scripture said that the Christ cometh of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha hwe-leh gaw kinsha poelagha boet dee-eh.
ENG: So there arose a division in the multitude because of him.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Khakma b'e-lhoon ddawqee waw-leh, eena oep khad la dre-leh eeda 'aloehy.
ENG: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܪ̈ܛܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Eeman ddeerhoon shoerṭe lkis goerane dkahne o preeshe, meerhoon ilayhy kahne, ”qamoodee la moete lawkhoon ileh?“
ENG: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why did ye not bring him?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܪ̈ܛܹܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon shoerṭe, ”oep khad nasha le-yleh hoemzima maykh deeleh aha nasha hamzoeme.“
ENG: The officers answered, Never man so spake.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܚܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: meerhoon ilayhy preeshe, ”ha oep ilawkhoon moekhliṭ-leh?
ENG: The Pharisees therefore answered them, Are ye also led astray?

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟
TRL: ”Qamoo nasha min goerane yan min preeshe hoemineh bee-eh?
ENG: Hath any of the rulers believed on him, or of the Pharisees?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena leeṭa-yleh aha kinsha dle yade' namoosa.“
ENG: But this multitude which knoweth not the law are accursed.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ، ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ،
TRL: meereh ilayhy neeqademoos, khad minayhy, haw dte-leh lkis eeshoo' qamayta,
ENG: Nicodemus saith unto them (he that came to him before, being one of them),

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܲܢ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܫܵܡܥܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܵܙܲܚ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”Qamoo namoosan ke daen lkhad nasha mqam dsham'akh-leh o khazakh moodee-yleh 'weeda?“
ENG: Doth our law judge a man, except it first hear from himself and know what he doeth?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟ ܨܲܚܨܝܼ ܘܚܙܝܼ، ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܛ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh o meerhoon, ”qamoo oep at min gleela ywit? Ṣakhṣee o khzee, dnweea min gleela le paleṭ.“
ENG: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and see that out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah kl khad zeel-leh lbayteh.
ENG: And they went every man unto his own house:

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ.
TRL: zeel-leh eeshoo' lṭoera dzayte.
ENG: but Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

ASY: ܘܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܘܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ.
TRL: O bṣapra mindrish te-leh lhaykla, o kleh 'ama te-leh lkis-leh, o kad teew-leh, shoere-leh lmaloepay.
ENG: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܒܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ،
TRL: Moete-lhoon lkis-leh sapre o preeshe khda bakhta dweeqta bgayaroeta, o kad moekleea-lhoon bey palga,
ENG: And the scribes and the Pharisees bring a woman taken in adultery; and having set her in the midst,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: meerhoon ileh, ”malpana, aha bakhta peesh-laha dweeqta galyaeet bshoela dgayaroeta,
ENG: they say unto him, Master, this woman hath been taken in adultery, in the very act.

ASY: ”ܘܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܪܓ̰ܝܼܡܹܐ. ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“
TRL: ”O moeshe bnamoosa pqeed-leh ilan, anee d'awdee hadkha payshee rjeeme. At moodee bemara ywit?“
ENG: Now in the law Moses commanded us to stone such: what then sayest thou of her?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܩܵܒ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܨܸܒܥܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: meerhoon hadkha djarbee waw-leh, dhawe wa-lhoon 'ilta dqawlee waw 'aloehy. Eena eeshoo' keep-leh o shoere-leh biktawa bṣib'eh 'al ar'a.
ENG: And this they said, tempting him, that they might have whereof to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܗ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܵܪܹܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena kad moezyid-lhoon lbaqoereh, qeem-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”kl minawkhoon deeleh dla khṭeeta dare beeoeha kepa qamaya.“
ENG: But when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish keep-leh biktawa 'al ar'a.
ENG: And again he stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܚܲܕ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܗܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܟܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ.
TRL: O anee eeman dshmee' lhoon aha, pleeṭ-lhoon khad bkhad, shoere-lhoon min khwardiqne hal haw kharaya, o peesh-leh eeshoo' bnawsheh, o bakhta kleeta bey palga.
ENG: And they, when they heard it, went out one by one, beginning from the eldest, even unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman, where she was, in the midst.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܕܵܐܹܢܵܟ݂ܝ؟“
TRL: Eeman dqeem-leh eeshoo', boeqireh minoeha, ”bakhta, ayka yna? nasha la qam daenakhy?“
ENG: And Jesus lifted up himself, and said unto her, Woman, where are they? did no man condemn thee?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܝ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ”ܐܵܦܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ، ܡܵܪܝܼ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܝܢܹܢܵܟ݂ܝ. ܙܹܠ݇ܝ، ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܛܝܲܬܝ.“
TRL: O hay joewib-laha, ”apla khad, maree.“ meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”oep ana le daynenakhy. Zey, min adeea khena la khaṭyaty.“
ENG: And she said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said, Neither do I condemn thee: go thy way; from henceforth sin no more.

ASY: ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Hoemzim-leh eeshoo' mindrish lkinsha o meereh, ”ana ywin bahra ddoenye. Man date baree le khader gaw khishka, ila bit hawe-leh bahra dkhaye.“
ENG: Again therefore Jesus spake unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in the darkness, but shall have the light of life.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh preeshe, ”at bishada ywit 'al ganoekh, o sahdoetoekh le-ylaha shareerta.“
ENG: The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest witness of thyself; thy witness is not true.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܝܼ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”oep in dbishada ywin 'al ganee, sahdoetee shareerta-ylaha sabab ke yad'en min ayka te-lee o layka bezala ywin. Eena akhtoon le yad'eetoon min ayka te-lee o layka bezala ywin.
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto them, Even if I bear witness of myself, my witness is true; for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye know not whence I come, or whither I go.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܟܝܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon bidyana ytoon bkyoela dbnaynasha, ana lnasha le ywin bidyana.
ENG: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܵܝܢܹܢ، ܕܝܵܢܬܝܼ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Oep in dana daynen, dyantee shareerta-ylaha, sabab ana le ywin bnawshee, ila baba dshoedireh ilee 'amee-yleh.
ENG: Yea and if I judge, my judgment is true; for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

ASY: ”ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Kteewa-yleh bnamoosawkhoon, sahdoeta dtrey nashe shareerta-ylaha.
ENG: Yea and in your law it is written, that the witness of two men is true.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Ana beeawa ywin sahdoeta boet ganee, oep babee, haw dshoedireh ilee, beeawa-yleh sahdoeta boet deeee.“
ENG: I am he that beareth witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ. ܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, ”ayka-yleh baboekh?“ joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la ilee ke yad'eetoon o la lbabee. In yad'eetoon waw-lee, oep lbabee bit yad'eetoon waw.“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye know neither me, nor my Father: if ye knew me, ye would know my Father also.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܵܥܲܬܹܗ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Ane hemizmane hoemzim-leh eeshoo' gaw haykla qoerba dbeyt gaza kad maloepe, o la nasha dre-leh 'aloehy eeda, sabab sa'ateh hesh le ywa teeta.
ENG: These words spake he in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man took him; because his hour was not yet come.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Mindrish meereh eeshoo' lyhoedaye, ”ana bezala ywin. Bit ṭa'eytoon baree o bit mayteetoon gaw khṭeeatawkhoon. Ayka dana bezala ywin akhtoon le maṣeytoon ateytoon.“
ENG: He said therefore again unto them, I go away, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sin: whither I go, ye cannot come.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܛܹܠ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Boeqirhoon yhoedaye khad min haw khena, ”qamoo bit qaṭel ganeh dbemara-yleh, ayka dana bezala ywin akhtoon le maṣeytoon ateytoon?“
ENG: The Jews therefore said, Will he kill himself, that he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܝܼܘܸܢ. ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”akhtoon min lltikht eetoon, ana min l'ilil eewin. Akhtoon min aha doenye ytoon, eena ana le ywin min aha doenye.
ENG: And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܗܹܐ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”meeree ilawkhoon dbit mayteetoon gaw khṭeeatawkhoon. He, in la hamineetoon dana ywin, bit mayteetoon gaw khṭeeatawkhoon.“
ENG: I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for except ye believe that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, ”at manee ywit?“ joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ana ywin haw dmin shoeraya hweea ywin bemara ilawkhoon.
ENG: They said therefore unto him, Who art thou? Jesus said unto them, Even that which I have also spoken unto you from the beginning.

ASY: ”ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܸܕܝܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Raba eet-lee lemara boet deeawkhoon o lidyanawkhoon, ila haw dshoedireh ilee shareera-yleh, o mindee dshmee' lee mineh bemara ywin gaw 'alma.“
ENG: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you: howbeit he that sent me is true; and the things which I heard from him, these speak I unto the world.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena anee la poerme-lhoon dboet baba hamzoeme ywa.
ENG: They perceived not that he spake to them of the Father.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܪܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Bas meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”eeman dmarmeetoon lbroona dnasha, haygah bit yad'eetoon dana ywin. O mindee min ganee le ywin bi'wada, ila hamzoeme ywin mindee dbaba moelip-leh ilee.
ENG: Jesus therefore said, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself, but as the Father taught me, I speak these things.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܝܼ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Haw dshoedireh ilee 'amee-yleh, o le-yleh shweeqee bnawshee, sabab bkl 'dana ke 'awden mindee dbasma-leh.“
ENG: And he that sent me is with me; he hath not left me alone; for I do always the things that are pleasing to him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Kad haw hamzoeme hadkha, raba hoeminhoon bee-eh.
ENG: As he spake these things, many believed on him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܢܵܛܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܝܼ، ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lyhoedaye dhoeminhoon bee-eh, ”in naṭreetoon lyoelpanee, shareeraeet talmeedee ytoon.
ENG: Jesus therefore said to those Jews which had believed him, If ye abide in my word, then are ye truly my disciples;

ASY: ”ܘܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܘܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”O bit yad'eetoon lshrara, o shrara bit 'abed lawkhoon khere.“
ENG: and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܘܲܚ، ܘܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ’ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ‘؟“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”akhnan bnoone dawraham eewakh, o 'awdoeta loep khad le ywakh 'weede. Dakhee at bemara ywit, ’bit haweytoon khere‘?“
ENG: They answered unto him, We be Abraham’s seed, and have never yet been in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl d'abed khṭeeta rega dkhṭeeta-yleh.
ENG: Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Every one that committeth sin is the bondservant of sin.

ASY: ”ܘܪܹܓܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”O rega le kale gaw bayta hal 'alam, eena broona ke kale gaw bayta hal 'alam.
ENG: And the bondservant abideth not in the house for ever: the son abideth for ever.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ، ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”In broona 'abed lawkhoon khere, shareeraeet bit haweytoon bnay khere.
ENG: If therefore the Son shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ana beeda'a ywin dbnoone dawraham eetoon, eena ba'eytoon liqṭalee sabab hemizmanee layt-laha doeka gawawkhoon.
ENG: I know that ye are Abraham’s seed; yet ye seek to kill me, because my word hath not free course in you.

ASY: ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Mindee dkhze-lee min lkis baba hamzoeme ywin, o akhtoon bi'wada ytoon mindee dshmee' lawkhoon min babawkhoon.“
ENG: I speak the things which I have seen with my Father: and ye also do the things which ye heard from your father.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”baban awraham eeleh.“ meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”in haweytoon waw bnoone dawraham, poelkhane dawraham bit 'awdeetoon waw.
ENG: They answered and said unto him, Our father is Abraham. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham’s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena adeea ba'eytoon liqṭalee, sabab meeree ilawkhoon shrara dshmee' lee min Alaha. Awraham la 'weed-leh hadkha.
ENG: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I heard from God: this did not Abraham.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ. ܚܲܕ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Akhtoon ke 'awdeetoon poelkhane dbabawkhoon.“ joewib-lhoon ileh, ”akhnan le ywakh bnoone dzanyoeta. Khad baba eet lan, Alaha.“
ENG: Ye do the works of your father. They said unto him, We were not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ. ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”in Alaha hawe wa babawkhoon, bit makhibeetoon waw-lee, sabab min Alaha pleeṭ-lee o te-lee. La te-lee min ganee, ila haw shoedireh ilee.
ENG: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I came forth and am come from God; for neither have I come of myself, but he sent me.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Qamoodee le ytoon parmoeye hemizmanee? Le ytoon parmoeye sabab le maṣeytoon sham'eetoon mindee dbemara ywin ilawkhoon.
ENG: Why do ye not understand my speech? Even because ye cannot hear my word.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ، ܘܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܕܲܓܸܠ، ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܕܲܓܸܠ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܲܓܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܕܲܓܵܠܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon eetoon min babawkhoon akelqarṣa, o shahwatyate dbabawkhoon ke ba'eytoon d'awdeetoon. Haw dmin shoeraya qaṭoola ywa, o shrara le hamzim sabab layt shrara bee-eh. O eeman dke dagil, min ganeh ke dagil, sabab dagala-yleh o baba ddagaloeta.
ENG: Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father it is your will to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and stood not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father thereof.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena ana shrara hamzoeme ywin o akhtoon le ytoon hamoene beeee.
ENG: But because I say the truth, ye believe me not.

ASY: ”ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܡܲܢܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ؟ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ؟
TRL: ”Aynee minawkhoon maṣe mankis-lee boet khṭeeta? In ana hamzoeme ywin shrara, qamoodee le ytoon hamoene ilee?
ENG: Which of you convicteth me of sin? If I say truth, why do ye not believe me?

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ. ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Man deeleh min Alaha, hemizmane dalaha ke shame'. Akhtoon le sham'eetoon sabab le ytoon min Alaha.“
ENG: He that is of God heareth the words of God: for this cause ye hear them not, because ye are not of God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܵܡܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”le ywakh shrara hamzoeme dbemara ywakh dshamraya ywit o eet beeoekh sheda?“
ENG: The Jews answered and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܪܸܢ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܣܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”layt sheda beeee. Ana ke myaqrin lbabee, eena akhtoon masloeye ytoon ilee.
ENG: Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye dishonour me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܛܵܥܹܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana le ywin biṭ'aya khiqra qa ganee. Eena eet khad khena dke ṭa'e, o haw eeleh dayana.
ENG: But I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܛܹܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ، ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dnaṭer hemizmanee, mawta l'alam le khaze.“
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my word, he shall never see death.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂. ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ’ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܵܛܹܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ، ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ.‘
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”adeea beeda'a ywakh dsheda eet beeoekh. Awraham o nwee-e meet-lhoon, o at bemara ywit, ’man dnaṭer hemizmanee, mawta l'alam le khaze.‘
ENG: The Jews said unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my word, he shall never taste of death.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ؟ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ. ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: ”Qamoo at boesh goera ywit min baban awraham? Haw meet-leh, o hadkha oep klayhy nwee-e. At moodee bikhshawa ywit boet ganoekh?“
ENG: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܩܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܓܵܢܝܼ، ܚܸܩܪܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܹܗ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܩܹܪܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”in ana bikhqara ywin lganee, khiqree le-yleh mindee. Babee, haw dakhtoon biqrayeh ytoon alahawkhoon, haw ke khaqeree.
ENG: Jesus answered, If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing: it is my Father that glorifieth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God;

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܹܗ. ܐܸܢ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܕܲܓܵܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܹܗ ܘܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܢܵܛܪܹܢܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Oep in dakhtoon le yad'eetoon-leh, eena ana ke yad'eneh. In amren le yad'eneh, bit haweyn dagala aykh deeawkhoon, ila ana ke yad'eneh o hemizmaneh ke naṭrenaha.
ENG: and ye have not known him: but I know him; and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be like unto you, a liar: but I know him, and keep his word.

ASY: ”ܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܦܨܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܝܼ. ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Babawkhoon awraham pṣeekh-leh likhzaya yawmee. O kad khze-leh khde-leh.“
ENG: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day; and he saw it, and was glad.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ؟“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon yhoedaye, ”at layt-loekh oep khamshee shine o khizya ywit lawraham?“
ENG: The Jews therefore said unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, min qam dhawe wa awraham ana eewin.“
ENG: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

ASY: ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܓ̰ܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܛܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O shqeel-lhoon yhoedaye kepe drajmee waw-leh, eena eeshoo' ṭoeshya-leh ganeh, o pleeṭ-leh min haykla o 'weereh gawayhy o zeel-leh.
ENG: They took up stones therefore to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple.

ASY: ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: Bezala ywa eeshoo' o khze-leh khad nasha simya min kesa dyimeh.
ENG: And as he passed by, he saw a man blind from his birth.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܚܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon mineh talmeedoehy, ”rabee, manee khṭe-leh, aha yan awahoehy dpeesha-yleh leeda simya?“
ENG: And his disciples asked him, saying, Rabbi, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he should be born blind?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”la aha o la awahoehy khṭe-lhoon dhwe-leh simya, ila dpoelkhane dalaha payshee khizye bkhayoehy.
ENG: Jesus answered, Neither did this man sin, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

ASY: ”ܟܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܵܡܵܐ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ.
TRL: ”Kma deeleh eemama, wale-ylaha d'awdakh poelkhane dhaw dshoedireh ilee. Betaya-yleh layle dnasha le maṣe palekh.
ENG: We must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

ASY: ”ܟܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: ”Kma dgaw doenye ywin, bahra ddoenye ywin.“
ENG: When I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܓܒ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܩܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ،
TRL: Min bar dmeereh hadkha, reeq-leh 'al ar'a o gweel-leh ṭeena min roeqeh, o moetiw-leh 'al 'ayne dhaw simya,
ENG: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and anointed his eyes with the clay,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܙܹܠ݇ ܘܚܲܠܸܠ ܒܗܵܘܘܿܙ ܕܫܝܼܠܘܿܚܵܐ“ (ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܦܘܼܫܸܩܬܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ). ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ileh, ”ze o khalil bhawooz dsheelookha“ (dpeeshta-ylaha poeshiqta, shoedra). zeel-leh o khoelil-leh o te-leh bikhzaya.
ENG: and said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam (which is by interpretation, Sent). He went away therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

ASY: ܫܒ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܝܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܓܵܒܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ؟“
TRL: Shwawoehy o anee dmin qamayta khizyeh ywaw bigwaya, boeqirhoon, ”le-yleh aha haw dyatew wa o gabe wa?“
ENG: The neighbours therefore, and they which saw him aforetime, that he was a beggar, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܕܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Khakma meerhoon, ”haw eeleh.“ khene meerhoon, ”la, ila bidmaya-yleh ileh.“ eena haw bganeh meereh, ”ana ywin.“
ENG: Others said, It is he: others said, No, but he is like him. He said, I am he.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂؟“
TRL: Haygah boeqirhoon mineh, ”dakhee pteekh-lhoon 'aynoekh?“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, How then were thine eyes opened?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܝܢܝܼ̈، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܙܹܠ݇ ܘܚܲܠܸܠ ܒܗܵܘܘܿܙ ܕܫܝܼܠܘܿܚܵܐ.‘ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܝܼ، ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh haw o meereh ilayhy, ”khad nasha shimeh eeshoo' gweel-leh ṭeena o moetiw-leh 'al 'aynee, o meereh ilee, ’ze o khalil bhawooz dsheelookha.‘ zeel-lee o khoelil-lee, o adeea bikhzaya ywin.“
ENG: He answered, The man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to Siloam, and wash: so I went away and washed, and I received sight.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ.“
TRL: Boeqirhoon mineh, ”ayka-yleh haw nasha?“ joewib-leh, ”le yad'en.“
ENG: And they said unto him, Where is he? He saith, I know not.

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Moete-lhoon lkis preeshe haw nasha deewa simya min qamayta.
ENG: They bring to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

ASY: ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Yawma dshabta ywa eeman d'weed-leh eeshoo' ṭeena o pteekh-leh 'ayne dhaw nasha.
ENG: Now it was the sabbath on the day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܥܲܝܢܝܼ̈، ܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Mindrish boeqirhoon mineh preeshe, ”dakhee khze-loekh?“ joewib-leh ilayhy, ”ṭeena moetiw-leh 'al 'aynee, khoelil-lee o khze-lee.“
ENG: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. And he said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܪܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Khakma min preeshe meerhoon, ”aha nasha le-yleh min Alaha sabab le-yleh binṭara shabta.“ khene meerhoon, ”dakhee maṣe khad khaṭaya 'abed ane neeshanqe?“ o hwe-leh doerasha gawayhy.
ENG: Some therefore of the Pharisees said, This man is not from God, because he keepeth not the sabbath. But others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such signs? And there was a division among them.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Mindrish boeqirhoon min haw simya, ”at moodee bemara ywit boet aha nasha, sabab haw pteekh-leh 'aynoekh?“ joewib-leh ilayhy, ”nweea-yleh.“
ENG: They say therefore unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, in that he opened thine eyes? And he said, He is a prophet.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܠ ܕܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eena yhoedaye la hoeminhoon 'aloehy dsimya ywa o khze-leh, hal dqre-lhoon lawahoehy.
ENG: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight,

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ؟ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: O boeqirhoon minayhy, ”aha broonawkhoon eeleh, dbemara ytoon peesha ywa leeda simya? Adeea dakhee-ylaha dbikhzaya-yleh?“
ENG: and asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-lhoon awahoehy, ”he, beeda'a ywakh daha broonan eeleh, o leeda ywa simya,
ENG: His parents answered and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ. ܒܲܩܪܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܡܸܛܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Eena dakhee adeea bikhzaya-yleh yan manee pteekh-leh 'aynoehy, le yad'akh. Baqroen mineh, miṭya-yleh lshine dkmeeloeta, haw bit hamzim boet ganeh.“
ENG: but how he now seeth, we know not; or who opened his eyes, we know not: ask him; he is of age; he shall speak for himself.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܒܸܬ ܛܵܪܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܵܘܕܹܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Aha meerhoon awahoehy sabab bizda'a ywaw min yhoedaye dmeere ywaw dbit ṭardee min knoeshta kl man dmawde daha msheekha-yleh.
ENG: These things said his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man should confess him to be Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܒܲܩܪܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܡܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Boet aha meerhoon awahoehy, ”baqroen mineh sabab kmeela-yleh bshine.“
ENG: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

ASY: ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Khda gaha kheta qre-lhoon yhoedaye lhaw simya o meerhoon ileh, ”hal shoewkha lalaha. Akhnan beeda'a ywakh daha nasha khaṭaya-yleh.“
ENG: So they called a second time the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give glory to God: we know that this man is a sinner.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ، ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Haw joewib-leh ilayhy, ”in khaṭaya-yleh le yad'en. Eena khad mindee ke yad'en, simya ywin wa o adeea bikhzaya ywin.“
ENG: He therefore answered, Whether he be a sinner, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂؟ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܬܝܼܚܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂؟“
TRL: Mindrish boeqirhoon mineh, ”moodee 'weed-leh qatoekh? Dakhee pteekhay-leh 'aynoekh?“
ENG: They said therefore unto him, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ؟ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy, ”meeree ilawkhoon min qamayta o la shmee' lawkhoon. Qamoodee ba'eytoon dsham'eetoon mindrish? Oep akhtoon ba'eytoon dhaweytoon talmeedoehy?“
ENG: He answered them, I told you even now, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear it again? would ye also become his disciples?

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؛ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ.
TRL: Anee moesle-lhoon ileh o meerhoon, ”at eewit talmeeda dhaw nasha; akhnan talmeede dmoeshe ywakh.
ENG: And they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are disciples of Moses.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Ke yad'akh dalaha hoemzim-leh 'am moeshe, eena aha nasha le yad'akh min ayka-yleh.“
ENG: We know that God hath spoken unto Moses: but as for this man, we know not whence he is.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܕܘܼܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܟܲܕ ܥܲܝܢܝܼ̈ ܦܬܝܼܚܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haw joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”doemara-yleh aha. Le yad'eetoon min ayka-yleh, kad 'aynee pteekhay-leh.
ENG: The man answered and said unto them, Why, herein is the marvel, that ye know not whence he is, and yet he opened mine eyes.

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܠܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܙܵܕܹܥ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܥܵܒܹܕ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ke yad'akh dalaha le shame' lkhaṭaye, eena ke shame' lhaw dzade' mineh o 'abed ṣiwyaneh.
ENG: We know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and do his will, him he heareth.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܬܹܚ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min l'alam le ywakh shmee'e dkhad nasha patekh 'ayne dkhad leeda simya.
ENG: Since the world began it was never heard that any one opened the eyes of a man born blind.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: ”In aha nasha la hawe wa min Alaha, le maṣe wa li'wada mindee.“
ENG: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ، ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܸܠܲܢ؟“ ܘܛܪܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-lhoon o meerhoon ileh, ”at klaha ganoekh bkhṭeeta peesha ywit wa leeda, o maloepe ywit ilan?“ o ṭreed-lhoon ileh.
ENG: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܛܪܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Shmee' leh eeshoo' dṭreed-lhoon ileh. Eeman dmoechikh-leh boeqireh mineh, ”at hamoene ywit bbroona dalaha?“
ENG: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and finding him, he said, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܕܗܲܡܸܢܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh haw dpeesh-leh bseema o meereh, ”manee-yleh, maree, dhaminin bee-eh?“
ENG: He answered and said, And who is he, Lord, that I may believe on him?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܚܸܙܝܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”khizyeh ywit, o haw eeleh dhamzoeme-yleh 'amoekh.“
ENG: Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and he it is that speaketh with thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܡܵܪܝܼ.“ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh haw nasha o meereh, ”hamoene ywin, maree.“ o sgheed-leh ileh.
ENG: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ، ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܣܸܡܝܹܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”ldyanta te-lee-laha doenye, dkhazee anee dle yna bikhzaya, o payshee simye anee dbikhzaya yna.“
ENG: And Jesus said, For judgment came I into this world, that they which see not may see; and that they which see may become blind.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܣܸܡܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ؟“
TRL: Shmee' lhoon aha khakma min preeshe d'ameh ywaw, meerhoon ileh, ”qamoo oep akhnan simye ywakh?“
ENG: Those of the Pharisees which were with him heard these things, and said unto him, Are we also blind?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ: ’ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ،‘ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”in haweytoon waw simye layt waw lawkhoon khṭeeta, eena sabab bemara ytoon: ’bikhzaya ywakh,‘ khṭeetawkhoon bit paysha 'alawkhoon.“
ENG: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye would have no sin: but now ye say, We see: your sin remaineth.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܣܹܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܓܲܝܵܣܵܐ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dla 'aber min tar'a gaw goema d'irbe, ila aseq min doeka kheta, genawa-yleh o gayasa.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the fold of the sheep, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw d'aber min tar'a, ra'ya d'irbe-yleh.
ENG: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

ASY: ”ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܵܛܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܬܹܚ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܥܸܪ̈ܒܘܼܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܹܗ، ܘܟܹܐ ܩܵܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܲܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Laha naṭrana dtar'a ke patekh tar'a, o 'irboehy ke sham'ee-leh qaleh, o ke qare-lhoon bshimayhy o paliṭ-lhoon.
ENG: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܲܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ، ܘܥܸܪ̈ܒܘܼܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O eeman dpaliṭ-lhoon klayhy 'irbe dganeh, ke azel qamayhy, o 'irboehy ke azee bareh sabab ke yad'ee-leh qaleh.
ENG: When he hath put forth all his own, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܪܩܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena bar noekhraya hich le azee, ila ke 'arqee mineh, sabab le yad'ee-leh qala dnoekhraya.“
ENG: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܬܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: meereh eeshoo' aha matla ilayhy, eena anee la poerme-lhoon moodee hamzoeme ywa.
ENG: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ.
TRL: Mindrish meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, ana ywin tar'a d'irbe.
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܓܹܢܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܓܲܝܵܣܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Klayhy anee dte-lhoon min qam deeee genabe yna o gayase, eena 'irbe la shmee' lhoon ilayhy.
ENG: All that came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ، ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܡܲܪܸܥܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana ywin tar'a. In nasha 'aber beeee bit pareq, bit 'aber o bit paleṭ o bit machikh mari'ya.
ENG: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and go out, and shall find pasture.

ASY: ”ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܓܵܢܹܒ݂ ܘܩܵܛܹܠ ܘܛܲܠܸܩ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Genawa ke ate akhchee dganew o qaṭel o ṭaliq. Eena ana te-lee dhawe-lhoon khaye, o khaye bmilyoeta hawe-lhoon.
ENG: The thief cometh not, but that he may steal, and kill, and destroy: I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܒܹܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Ana ywin ra'ya ṭawa, o ra'ya ṭawa ke dabekh-lhoon khayoehy min geba d'irboehy.
ENG: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd layeth down his life for the sheep.

ASY: ”ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ، ܘܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܕܹܐܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܫܵܒܹܩ ܠܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܘܥܵܪܹܩ. ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܕܹܐܒ݂ܵܐ ܚܵܛܹܦ ܠܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܘܒܲܪܒܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Dweeqa bhaqa dle-yleh ra'ya, o 'irbe le yna dee-eh, eeman dkhaze dewa betaya, ke shabeq l'irbe o 'areq. O ke ate dewa khaṭep l'irbe o barbiz-lhoon,
ENG: He that is a hireling, and not a shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, beholdeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth, and the wolf snatcheth them, and scattereth them:

ASY: ”ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܪܹܩ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܗܵܩܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܬܲܚܡܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Dweeqa bhaqa ke 'areq sabab dweeqa-yleh bhaqa, o le takhmin boet 'irboehy.
ENG: he fleeth because he is a hireling, and careth not for the sheep.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ. ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ ܘܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܐܸܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”Ana ywin ra'ya ṭawa. Ke yad'en l'irbee o 'irbee ke yad'ee ilee,
ENG: I am the good shepherd; and I know mine own, and mine own know me,

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ. ܘܟܹܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܚܹܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dbaba ke yade' lee, o ana ke yad'en lbaba. O ke dawkhen ganee min geba d'irbee.
ENG: even as the Father knoweth me, and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܘܼܡܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܝܢܗܘܿܢ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܝܼ. ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܦܸܣܩܵܐ ܘܚܲܕ ܪܵܥܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eet-lee 'irbe khene aynee dle yna min aha goema. Oep anee wale-ylaha dmayteynhoon. Anee bit sham'ee-leh qalee. Klayhy bit hawee khad pisqa o khad ra'ya.
ENG: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and they shall become one flock, one shepherd.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܒܵܒܵܐ: ܕܕܵܒ݂ܚܹܢ ܠܓܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܩܠܹܢܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ.
TRL: ”Boet aha ke makhib-lee baba: ddawkhen lganee dshaqlenaha mindrish.
ENG: Therefore doth the Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܝܼ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܕܒ݂ܵܚܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ. ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܒ݂ܚܹܢܵܗ̇ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܵܩܠܹܢܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Oep khad le shaqel-laha minee. Ana min ganee bidwakhoeha ywin. Eet-lee shoelṭana ddawkhenaha o eet-lee shoelṭana dshaqlenaha mindrish. Aha poeqdana qoebil-lee min babee.“
ENG: No one taketh it away from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment received I from my Father.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Boet ane hemizmane, mindrish hwe-leh poelagha beyl yhoedaye.
ENG: There arose a division again among the Jews because of these words.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ، ܘܫܹܐܕܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Raba minayhy meerhoon, ”eet bee-eh sheda, o shedana-yleh. Qamoodee bishma'a ytoon ileh?“
ENG: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ. ܡܵܨܹܐ ܫܹܐܕܵܐ ܦܵܬܹܚ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܸܡܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eena khene meerhoon, ”ane hemizmane le yna hemizmane dkhad deet bee-eh sheda. Maṣe sheda patekh 'ayne dsimya?“
ENG: Others said, These are not the sayings of one possessed with a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܚܘܼܕܵܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܣܸܬܘܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Hwe-leh 'eda dkhoedata gaw oorishlim, o sitwa ywa.
ENG: And it was the feast of the dedication at Jerusalem: it was winter;

ASY: ܘܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܨܘܼܦܵܐ ܕܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ.
TRL: O bikhdara ywa eeshoo' bhaykla gaw ṣoepa dshleymoon.
ENG: and Jesus was walking in the temple in Solomon’s porch.

ASY: ܘܩܲܡ ܟܵܪܟ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܲܠ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܠܲܢ ܒܫܸܟܘܼܬܵܐ؟ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ.“
TRL: O qam karkhee-leh yhoedaye o meerhoon ileh, ”hal eeman bit shawqet lan bshikoeta? In at eewit msheekha, moor ilan galyaeet.“
ENG: The Jews therefore came round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou hold us in suspense? If thou art the Christ, tell us plainly.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ. ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ،
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' ilayhy, ”meeree ilawkhoon o le ytoon hamoene. Poelkhane dana bi'wada ywin bshima dbabee bishada yna boet deeee,
ENG: Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believe not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, these bear witness of me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena akhtoon le ytoon hamoene sabab le ytoon min 'irbee.
ENG: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep.

ASY: ”ܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܩܵܠܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”'Irbee ke sham'ee qalee, o ana ke yad'enhoon, o anee ke atee baree.
ENG: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܩܝܼ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܛܹܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ.
TRL: ”O ana beeawa ywin ilayhy khaye dl'alam, o le ṭalqee l'alam, o nasha le khaṭep-lhoon min eedee.
ENG: and I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, and no one shall snatch them out of my hand.

ASY: ”ܒܵܒܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܚܵܛܹܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Babee dyoehbay-leh ilee boesh goera-yleh min kl, o nasha le maṣe khaṭep-lhoon min eeda dbabee.
ENG: My Father, which hath given them unto me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of the Father’s hand.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܵܒܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܘܲܚ.“
TRL: ”Ana o babee khad eewakh.“
ENG: I and the Father are one.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܓ̰ܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Mindrish shqeel-lhoon yhoedaye kepe drajmee waw-leh.
ENG: The Jews took up stones again to stone him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܪܓ̰ܵܡܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”moekhze-lee ilawkhoon raba poelkhane ṭabe min lkis baba. Boet aynee min ane poelkhane birjamee ytoon?“
ENG: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from the Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܪܓ̰ܵܡܘܼܟ݂ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܸܓܕܵܦܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”le ywakh birjamoekh boet poelkhane ṭabe, eena deewit bigdapa. O kad at barnasha ywit, bi'wadoeha ywit ganoekh Alaha.“
ENG: The Jews answered him, For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ، ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟‘
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”le-yleh kteewa bnamoosawkhoon, ’ana meeree, alahe ytoon?‘
ENG: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܒܘܼܛܠܵܐ،
TRL: ”In qre-leh alahe lanee dqatayhy te-laha hemizman dalaha, o ktawa le maṣe paesh boeṭla,
ENG: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came (and the scripture cannot be broken),

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫ ܠܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܓܕܵܦܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ، ’ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ؟‘
TRL: ”Moodee boet haw dbaba mqoedish-leh o shoedireh ldoenye, dakhtoon bemara ytoon bigdapa ywit, sabab meeree, ’broona dalaha ywin?‘
ENG: say ye of him, whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ، ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”In la 'awden poelkhane dbabee, la hamineetoon ilee,
ENG: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܦܲܪܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena in 'awden, apin dla hamineetoon ilee, eena haminoen lane poelkhane, dyad'eetoon o parmeytoon dbaba beeee-yleh o ana bbaba.“
ENG: But if I do them, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know and understand that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܕܒ݂ܵܩܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Mindrish b'e-lhoon lidwaqeh, eena haw pleeṭ-leh min gawayhy.
ENG: They sought again to take him: and he went forth out of their hand.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܪܕܢܵܢ، ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܥܡܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O zeel-leh mindrish lmarza khena dyoordnan, ldoeka dyookhanan ke ma'mid wa bqamayta, o peesh-leh tama.
ENG: And he went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John was at the first baptizing; and there he abode.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: te-lhoon lkis-leh raba nashe, o amree waw, ”yookhanan la 'weed-leh oep khad neeshanqa, eena kl mindee dmeereh boet aha nasha shareera-yleh.“
ENG: And many came unto him; and they said, John indeed did no sign: but all things whatsoever John spake of this man were true.

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O raba hoeminhoon bee-eh tama.
ENG: And many believed on him there.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܘܚܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha mree'a shimeh la'azar, min beyt 'anya mata dmaryam o khatoeha marta.
ENG: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister Martha.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܒܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܘܡܸܫܝܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܟܵܘܣܘܼܗ̇. ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Aha maryam eewa hay dmsheekh-laha aqlate dmaran bbisma o mishyay-laha bkawsoeha. La'azar mree'a akhoonoeha ywa.
ENG: And it was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Ane khatwate shoedirhoon khabra lkis eeshoo', bemara, ”Maran, haw dke makhibit-leh mree'a-yleh.“
ENG: The sisters therefore sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh eeshoo', meereh, ”aha mar'a le-yleh mar'a dmawta, eena qa tishbookhta dalaha-yleh, dbee-eh paesh khqeera broona dalaha.“
ENG: But when Jesus heard it, he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified thereby.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܘܠܚܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܘܠܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ.
TRL: Eeshoo' ke makhib wa lmarta o lkhatoeha maryam o lla'azar.
ENG: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܥܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh dla'azar mree'a ywa, 'oerqil-leh bhay doeka deewa trey yawmane.
ENG: When therefore he heard that he was sick, he abode at that time two days in the place where he was.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh ltalmeedoehy, ”qoemoen mindrish azakh leehoed.“
ENG: Then after this he saith to the disciples, Let us go into Judaea again.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܓ̰ܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ؟“
TRL: meerhoon ileh talmeedoehy, ”rabee, min qam adeea yhoedaye ba'ee waw rajmee waw-loekh, o at ba'eyt mindrish azet ltama?“
ENG: The disciples say unto him, Rabbi, the Jews were but now seeking to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܣܵܥܲܬܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ؟ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܵܕܹܪ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܬܲܪܩܸܠ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ha layt tri'sar sa'ate gaw khad yawma? In nasha khader byawma le tarqil, sabab ke khaze bahra daha doenye.
ENG: Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If a man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܚܵܕܹܪ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܬܲܪܩܸܠ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Eena in khader blayle, bit tarqil sabab layt bahra bee-eh.“
ENG: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because the light is not in him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܲܢ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܲܪܥܸܫܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh hadkha, meereh ilayhy, ”la'azar moekhiban dmeekha-yleh, eena bezala ywin dmar'ishineh.“
ENG: These things spake he: and after this he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarus is fallen asleep; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐܸܢ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon talmeede, ”Maran, in dmeekha-yleh, bit hawe boesh ṣpayee.“
ENG: The disciples therefore said unto him, Lord, if he is fallen asleep, he will recover.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܘܬܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܡܵܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܫܸܢܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeshoo' hamzoeme ywa boet mawteh, eena talmeedoehy khsheew-lhoon dhamzoeme ywa boet dmakha dshinta.
ENG: Now Jesus had spoken of his death: but they thought that he spake of taking rest in sleep.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ”ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah meereh ilayhy eeshoo' galyaeet, ”la'azar meeta-yleh.
ENG: Then Jesus therefore said unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”O ana bikhdaya ywin dle ywin wa tama, qa dakhtoon hamineetoon. Eena qoemoen dazakh lkis-leh.“
ENG: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܡܵܝܬܲܚ ܥܲܡܹܗ.“
TRL: Haygah tooma, haw dpaesh qirya jama, meereh lkhawrawateh talmeede, ”azakh oep akhnan dmaytakh 'ameh.“
ENG: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said unto his fellow-disciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ، ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-leh eeshoo' lbeyt 'anya, moechikh-leh dla'azar hweea ywa gaw qawra arb'a yawmane.
ENG: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.

ASY: ܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܪܹܝ ܡܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ،
TRL: Beyt 'anya maykh trey meele rikhqa ywa min oorishlim,
ENG: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off;

ASY: ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒܲܝ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O raba yhoedaye tee-e ywaw lkis marta o maryam leeabay liba boet akhoonayhy.
ENG: and many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' laha marta dte-leh eeshoo', pleeṭ-laha loerkheh, eena maryam teewta ywa gaw bayta.
ENG: Martha therefore, when she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary still sat in the house.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ.
TRL: meeraha marta leeshoo', ”maree, in haweyt wa lakha, le maet wa akhoonee.
ENG: Martha therefore said unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena oep adeea beeda'a ywan, kl mindee dṭalbet min Alaha bit yabil-loekh.“
ENG: And even now I know that, whatsoever thou shalt ask of God, God will give thee.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”bit qaem akhoonakhy.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ، ”ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܒܢܘܼܚܵܡܵܐ، ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: meeraha ileh marta, ”beeda'a ywan dbit qaem bnoekhama, byawma kharaya.“
ENG: Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܢܘܼܚܵܡܵܐ ܘܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”ana ywin noekhama o khaye. Man dhamin beeee, apin maet bit khaye.
ENG: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth on me, though he die, yet shall he live:

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܝܹܐ ܘܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ. ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”O kl man dkhaye o hamin beeee, le maet l'alam. Hamoene ywaty baha?“
ENG: and whosoever liveth and believeth on me shall never die. Believest thou this?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meeraha ileh, ”he, maree, hamoene ywan dat eewit msheekha, broona dalaha, haw date l'alma.“
ENG: She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I have believed that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, even he that cometh into the world.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܚܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܪܲܒܝܼ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܟ݂ܝ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Min bar dmeeraha aha, zeel-laha o qre-laha lmaryam khatoeha bṭishwa o meeraha, ”rabee lakha-yleh, o biqrayakhy eeleh.“
ENG: And when she had said this, she went away, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is here, and calleth thee.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' laha maryam, qeem-laha bjaldoeta o te-laha lkis-leh.
ENG: And she, when she heard it, arose quickly, and went unto him.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeshoo' hesh le ywa 'weera gaw mata, eena bhay doeka ywa dtpeeq-laha bee-eh marta.
ENG: (Now Jesus was not yet come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met him.)

ASY: ܘܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܘܼܗ̇ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O yhoedaye deewaw 'amoeha gaw bayta beeawoeha liba kad khze-lhoon lmaryam dqeem-laha bjaldoeta o pleeṭ-laha, pleeṭ-lhoon baroeha bikhshawa dbezala ywa lqawra libkhaya tama.
ENG: The Jews then which were with her in the house, and were comforting her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing that she was going unto the tomb to weep there.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman dte-laha maryam ldoeka deewa eeshoo' o khze-laha ileh, npeel-laha qam aqlateh o meeraha ileh, ”maree, in haweyt wa lakha, le maet wa akhoonee.“
ENG: Mary therefore, when she came where Jesus was, and saw him, fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܫܥܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dkhizya-leh eeshoo' bibkhaya, o oep anee yhoedaye deewaw 'amoeha bibkhaya, peesh-leh shgheesha o sh'eesha broekheh.
ENG: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܝܼ.“
TRL: Boeqireh eeshoo', ”ayka moetiw lawkhoon ileh?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”Maran, ta o khzee.“
ENG: and said, Where have ye laid him? They say unto him, Lord, come and see.

ASY: ܒܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Bke-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: Jesus wept.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: meerhoon yhoedaye, ”khzeymoen kma ke makhib wa-leh.“
ENG: The Jews therefore said, Behold how he loved him!

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ؟“
