TRL: O khene minayhy meerhoon, ”le maṣe aha dpteekh-leh 'ayne dsimya 'abed doep aha la maet?“
ENG: But some of them said, Could not this man, which opened the eyes of him that was blind, have caused that this man also should not die?

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ. ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܸܦܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܪܥܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Mindrish eeshoo' peesh-leh shgheesha. te-leh lkis qawra, deewa gipeeta, o kepa moetwa 'al tar'oeha.
ENG: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܚܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܚܡܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh eeshoo', ”shqooloen-leh kepa.“ meeraha marta khata dmeeta, ”maree, adeea khmeeqa-yleh, sabab arb'a yawmane yna dgaw qawra-yleh.“
ENG: Jesus saith, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been dead four days.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܕܐܸܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܲܬܝ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܲܬܝ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh iloeha eeshoo', ”la meeree ilakhy din haminaty bit khazyaty shoewkha dalaha?“
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou believedst, thou shouldest see the glory of God?

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܘܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܩܲܡ ܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Shqeel-lhoon lkepa. O moerim-leh eeshoo' 'aynoehy lshmaya o meereh, ”ya baba, shakoere ywin iloekh dqam sham'et-lee.
ENG: So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou heardest me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܕܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܠܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Ana ke yad'en dbkl 'dana ke sham'et-lee. Eena boet aha kinsha dkilya-yleh lakha meeree ane hemizmane dhaminee dat shoediroekh ilee.“
ENG: And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the multitude which standeth around I said it, that they may believe that thou didst send me.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ”ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ، ܬܵܐ، ܦܠܘܿܛ!“
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh hadkha, moeqwikh-leh bqala rama, ”la'azar, ta, plooṭ!“
ENG: And when he had thus spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐܲܩܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܐ ܒܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܵܬܹܗ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܠܸܚܬܵܐ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܫܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ، ܘܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܐܵܙܹܠ.“
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh haw meeta, eedoehy o aqloehy seere bqiṭ'aṭe djoele, o pateh seerta byalikhta. O meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”shreymoen-leh, o shwooqoen azel.“
ENG: He that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with grave-clothes; and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ، ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Raba min yhoedaye dtee-e ywaw lkis maryam, kad khze-lhoon mindee d'weed-leh eeshoo', hoeminhoon bee-eh.
ENG: Many therefore of the Jews, which came to Mary and beheld that which he did, believed on him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eena khene minayhy zeel-lhoon lkis preeshe o meerhoon ilayhy mindee d'weed-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah goerane dkahne o preeshe qre-lhoon knoeshya o meerhoon, ”moodee 'awdakh? Sabab aha nasha raba neeshanqe bi'wada-yleh.
ENG: The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many signs.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ ܘܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܐܲܬܪܲܢ ܘܛܵܝܸܦܲܢ.“
TRL: ”O in shawqakh-leh hadkha, klayhy bit haminee bee-eh, o bit atee roomaye o shaqlee atran o ṭayipan.“
ENG: If we let him thus alone, all men will believe on him: and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ،
TRL: Khad minayhy shimeh qayapa, deewa goera dkahne bhay sheta, meereh ilayhy, ”akhtoon le ytoon beeda'a mindee,
ENG: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,

ASY: ”ܐܵܦܠܵܐ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܕܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܛܵܠܩܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Apla takhmoene ytoon, dboesh ṣpayee-ylaha ilan dkhad nasha maet min geba dkleh 'ama o la klaha oemta ṭalqa.“
ENG: nor do ye take account that it is expedient for you that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ،
TRL: Aha la meereh min ganeh. Eena sabab goera dkahne ywa bhay sheta, noebe-leh deeshoo' bit maet wa min geba dklaha oemta,
ENG: Now this he said not of himself: but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for the nation;

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܓ̰ܲܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܚܲܝܸܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O la akhchee min geba doemta, eena min geba dklayhy bnoone boerbize dalaha, djami' lhoon o khayid-lhoon.
ENG: and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God that are scattered abroad.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min haw yawma moekhshikh-lhoon dqaṭlee-leh.
ENG: So from that day forth they took counsel that they might put him to death.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܠܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܐܲܦܪܹܝܡ. ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Boet aha eeshoo' la khdeereh khena galyaeet gaw yhoedaye, ila zeel-leh lkhda doeka qoerba lbareea, lkhda mata shimoeha apreym. O peesh-leh tama 'am talmeedoehy.
ENG: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed thence into the country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim; and there he tarried with the disciples.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܕܕܲܟ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dqoerbineh 'eda dpiṣkha dyhoedaye, raba seeq-lhoon min matwate loorishlim ddakhee waw ganayhy min qam 'eda,
ENG: Now the passover of the Jews was at hand: and many went up to Jerusalem out of the country before the passover, to purify themselves.

ASY: ܘܛܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܥܹܐܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: O ṭa'ee waw bar eeshoo' o baqree waw khad min haw khena, anee dkilye ywaw gaw haykla, ”moodee bikhshawa ytoon, le ate l'eda?“
ENG: They sought therefore for Jesus, and spake one with another, as they stood in the temple, What think ye? That he will not come to the feast?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܦܩܝܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܡܲܕܸܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena goerane dkahne o preeshe pqeede ywaw din nasha yade' wa ayka-yleh eeshoo', madi' wa-lhoon, ddawqee waw-leh.
ENG: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandment, that, if any man knew where he was, he should shew it, that they might take him.

ASY: ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܥܲܢܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ishta yawmane min qam piṣkha, te-leh eeshoo' lbeyt 'anya ayka deewa la'azar, haw deeshoo' moeqim-leh min gaw meete.
ENG: Jesus therefore six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom Jesus raised from the dead.

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܡܵܪܬܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܘܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Tama 'weed-lhoon kharamsha qa eeshoo'. Marta bi'wada ywa khilmat o la'azar khad min anee ywa dteebe ywaw 'am eeshoo'.
ENG: So they made him a supper there: and Martha served; but Lazarus was one of them that sat at meat with him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܠܝܼܛܪܵܐ ܕܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ ܕܢܵܪܕܝܼܢ ܪܹܫܵܝܵܐ ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܡܸܫܝܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܟܵܘܣܘܼܗ̇، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹܝܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܡܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah shqeel-laha maryam leeṭra dmishkha dbisma dnardeen reshaya o raba ṭeemana, o msheekh-laha aqlate deeshoo', o mishyay-laha bkawsoeha, o peesh-leh milya bayta min reykha dbisma.
ENG: Mary therefore took a pound of ointment of spikenard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Eena eehoeda skaryooṭa, khad min talmeedoehy, haw dbit sape wa-leh, meereh,
ENG: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, which should betray him, saith,

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܫܚܵܐ ܒܬܠܵܬܡܵܐܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: ”Qamoodee la peesh-leh zoebna aha mishkha btlatma deenare o zoeze yoebe lmiskene?“
ENG: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܬܲܚܡܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܹܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܣܲܢܕܘܼܩܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: Aha meereh la dke takhmin wa boet miskene, eena sabab genawa ywa, o sandoeqa lkis-leh ywa, o ke shaqel wa mindee dpaesh wa moetwa gaweh.
ENG: Now this he said, not because he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and having the bag took away what was put therein.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܩܒ݂ܵܪܬܝܼ ܢܛܝܼܪܬܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' joewib-leh o meereh, ”shwooq-laha, sabab qa yawma dqwartee nṭeerteh ywa.
ENG: Jesus therefore said, Suffer her to keep it against the day of my burying.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Sabab miskene bkl 'dana eet 'amawkhoon, eena ana bkl 'dana le ywin 'amawkhoon.“
ENG: For the poor ye have always with you; but me ye have not always.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܠܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman ddee' lhoon kinshe raba min yhoedaye deeshoo' tama ywa, te-lhoon, la dkhazee leeshoo' akhchee, eena dkhazee-leh oep la'azar, haw dmoeqim-leh min gaw meete.
ENG: The common people therefore of the Jews learned that he was there: and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah moekhshikh-lhoon goerane dkahne doep la'azar paesh qṭeela,
ENG: But the chief priests took counsel that they might put Lazarus also to death;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab raba min yhoedaye boet dee-eh bezala ywaw bar eeshoo' o hamoene ywaw bee-eh.
ENG: because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.

ASY: ܠܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ،
TRL: Lyawma khena, kinshe raba dtee-e ywaw l'eda, eeman dshmee' lhoon deeshoo' betaya ywa loorishlim,
ENG: On the morrow a great multitude that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܘܼܪ̈ܡܹܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ: ܐܘܿܫܲܥܢܵܐ، ܒܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ!
TRL: Shqeel-lhoon pa'wane deelane dkhoerme o pleeṭ-lhoon loerkheh maqwoekhe: oosha'na, breekha-yleh haw dbetaya-yleh bshima dmarya, malka deesrayel!
ENG: took the branches of the palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried out, Hosanna: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord, even the King of Israel.

ASY: ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܲܕ ܓ̰ܲܥܫܵܐ ܘܪܟܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ:
TRL: Moechikh-leh eeshoo' khad ja'sha o rkeew-leh 'aloehy, dakhee dkteewa-yleh:
ENG: And Jesus, having found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܲܬܝ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܨܸܗܝܘܿܢ. ܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܟ݂ܝ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܪܟܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܪܵܐ ܕܚܡܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: La zad'aty brata dṣihyoon. Ha malkakhy betaya-yleh, rkeewa 'al koerra dkhmarta.
ENG: Fear not, daughter of Zion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܘܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Ane talmeedoehy la poermyay-lhoon qamayta. Eena min bar dpeesh-leh khqeera eeshoo', dkheerhoon dane peeshe ywaw kteebe boet dee-eh, o ileh peeshe ywaw 'weede klayhy ane.
ENG: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.

ASY: ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܠܲܥܵܙܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kinsha deewa 'ameh yabil wa sahdoeta dqre-leh lla'azar min qawra o moeqim-leh min gaw meete.
ENG: The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, bare witness.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha, klayhy kinshe te-lhoon likhzayeh kad dshmee' lhoon d'weed-leh aha neeshanqa.
ENG: For this cause also the multitude went and met him, for that they heard that he had done this sign.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܨܵܝܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܗܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ.“
TRL: Eena preeshe meerhoon khad lhaw khena, ”khzeymoen, le ywakh mṣaya d'awdakh mindee. Ha kleh 'alma zeel-leh bareh.“
ENG: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Behold how ye prevail nothing: lo, the world is gone after him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܥܹܐܕܵܐ.
TRL: Eet waw oep yawnaye gaw anee dseeqe ywaw lisghada b'eda.
ENG: Now there were certain Greeks among those that went up to worship at the feast:

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܨܲܝܵܕܵܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܒܵܥܲܚ ܚܵܙܲܚ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: Ane te-lhoon lkis peeleepoos, deewa min beyt ṣayada dgleela, o meerhoon ileh, ”maree, ba'akh khazakh leeshoo'.“
ENG: these therefore came to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.

ASY: ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Peeleepoos zeel-leh o meereh landreoos, o zeel-lhoon andreoos o peeleepoos o meerhoon leeshoo'.
ENG: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: Andrew cometh, and Philip, and they tell Jesus.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ilayhy, ”mṭe-laha sa'at dpaesh khqeera broona dnasha.
ENG: And Jesus answereth them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܕܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܘܼܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, in dandikta dkhiṭe la napla gaw ar'a o mayta, bit paysha bnawshoeha, eena in mayta, ṭ'oenyate raba bit yawa.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a grain of wheat fall into the earth and die, it abideth by itself alone; but if it die, it beareth much fruit.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܛܲܠܸܩ ܠܵܗ̇، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܵܢܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܛܹܪܵܗ̇ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: ”Man dmakhib ganeh bit ṭaliq-laha, o man dsane ganeh baha doenye bit naṭeraha lkhaye dl'alam.
ENG: He that loveth his life loseth it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܝܼ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ، ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”In nasha 'abed-lee khilmat, ate baree, o ayka dana haweyn oep haw bit hawe tama, o babee bit myaqir lhaw d'abed khilmat ilee.
ENG: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will the Father honour.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ؟ ’ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ‘؟ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Adeea ganee shgheeshta-ylaha, o moodee amren? ’ya baba, pariq-lee min aha sa'at‘? Ila qa aha sa'at te-lee.
ENG: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour. But for this cause came I unto this hour.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܡܝܲܩܸܪ ܠܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܸܬ ܡܝܲܩܪܸܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Ya baba, myaqir lshimoekh.“ o qala te-leh min shmaya, bemara, ”myoeqreh ywin, o mindrish bit myaqrineh.“
ENG: Father, glorify thy name. There came therefore a voice out of heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.

ASY: ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܪܲܥܡܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ،“ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ.“
TRL: Kinsha dkilya ywa tama shmee' lhoon o meerhoon, ”ra'ma mkhe-leh,“ o khene meerhoon, ”malakha hoemzim-leh 'ameh.“
ENG: The multitude therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it had thundered: others said, An angel hath spoken to him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena eeshoo' joewib-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”la boet deeee hwe-leh aha qala ila boet deeawkhoon.
ENG: Jesus answered and said, This voice hath not come for my sake, but for your sakes.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ.
TRL: ”Adeea-ylaha dyanta daha 'alma, adeea goera daha 'alma bit paesh roepya lbadar.
ENG: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܓܵܪܫܹܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”O ana eeman dpayshen moerma min ar'a, bit garshen klayhy nashe lkis-lee.“
ENG: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto myself.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Aha meereh lmakhzoeye dakhee bit maet wa.
ENG: But this he said, signifying by what manner of death he should die.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: Haygah meerhoon ileh kinshe, ”akhnan shmee'e ywakh min namoosa, dmsheekha bit paesh hal 'alam, o at dakhee bemara ywit dwale-ylaha dpaesh moerma broona dnasha? Manee-yleh aha broona dnasha?“
ENG: The multitude therefore answered him, We have heard out of the law that the Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ. ܚܕܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܡܵܛܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܕܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”qa khad zawna kirya eet lawkhoon bahra. Khdooroen kad eet lawkhoon aha bahra, min qam dmaṭe lawkhoon khishka. Man dkhader gaw khishka le yade' layka bezala-yleh.
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto them, Yet a little while is the light among you. Walk while ye have the light, that darkness overtake you not: and he that walketh in the darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

ASY: ”ܟܡܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܒܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܗܪܵܐ.“ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܛܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Kma deet lawkhoon bahra, haminoen bbahra dhaweytoon bnoone dbahra.“ hoemzim-leh eeshoo' ane o pleeṭ-leh o ṭoeshya-leh ganeh minayhy.
ENG: While ye have the light, believe on the light, that ye may become sons of light. These things spake Jesus, and he departed and hid himself from them.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Oep in draba neeshanqe 'weed-leh eeshoo' qam 'aynayhy, eena anee la hoeminhoon bee-eh,
ENG: But though he had done so many signs before them, yet they believed not on him:

ASY: ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܕܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ؟ ܘܕܪܲܥܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܡܵܢܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ؟
TRL: Dpaesh toemima khabra desha'ya nweea dmeereh:Marya, manee hoemineh hemizman? O dra'na dmarya lmanee peesh-leh gilya?
ENG: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ:
TRL: Boet aha la mṣe-lhoon haminee, sabab mindrish meereh esha'ya:
ENG: For this cause they could not believe, for that Isaiah said again,

ASY: ܡܘܼܣܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܩܫܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܘܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܕܒܲܣܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Moesme-leh 'aynayhy o moeqshe-leh libayhy, dla khazee b'aynayhy o la parmee blibayhy, o dayree dbasminhoon.
ENG: He hath blinded their eyes, and he hardened their heart; Lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, And should turn, And I should heal them.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Ane meereh esha'ya sabab khze-leh khiqra dmsheekha o hoemzim-leh boet dee-eh.
ENG: These things said Isaiah, because he saw his glory; and he spake of him.

ASY: ܩܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܪܝܼܕܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: Qa klaha aha, raba min goerane hoeminhoon bee-eh, eena sabab bizda'a ywaw min preeshe, la moede-lhoon bee-eh, dla payshee waw ṭreede min knoeshta.
ENG: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess it, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab moekhib-lhoon khiqra dbnaynasha boesh zawda min shoewkha dalaha.
ENG: for they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܝܼ.
TRL: Haygah moeqwikh-leh eeshoo', ”man dhamin beeee, le-yleh hamoene beeee, ila bhaw dqam shadiree.
ENG: And Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”O man dkhaze-lee, bikhzaya-yleh lman dshoedireh ilee.
ENG: And he that beholdeth me beholdeth him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܕܟܠ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana bahra te-lee-laha doenye, dkl dhamin beeee la paesh gaw khishka.
ENG: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me may not abide in the darkness.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܘܠܵܐ ܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܝܢܹܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܕܵܝܢܹܢ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܩܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”O in nasha shame' hemizmanee o la naṭerhoon, ana le dayneneh, sabab ana la te-lee ddaynen l'alma eena dparqineh.
ENG: And if any man hear my sayings, and keep them not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

ASY: ”ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܣܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܐܹܢܹܗ؛ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ، ܗ̇ܝ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”O man dmasle ilee o la qabil hemizmanee, eet khad khena ddaeneh; hemizman dhoemzim-lee, hay bit dayna-leh byawma kharaya.
ENG: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my sayings, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I spake, the same shall judge him in the last day.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ. ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ.
TRL: ”Ana min ganee le hamzimin. Baba dshoedireh ilee, haw pqeed-leh ilee moodee o dakhee hamzimin.
ENG: For I spake not from myself; but the Father which sent me, he hath given me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܝܼܢܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ.“
TRL: ”O ana ke yad'en dpoeqdanoehy khaye dl'alam eena. Boet aha ana hamzoeme ywin dakhee dbaba pqeed-leh ilee dhamzimin.“
ENG: And I know that his commandment is life eternal: the things therefore which I speak, even as the Father hath said unto me, so I speak.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܫܲܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ، ܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܡܘܼܚܸܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: Min qam 'eda dpiṣkha, dee' leh eeshoo' dmṭe-laha sa'at dshane min aha doenye lkis baboehy, kad moekhib-leh lanee deena dee-eh gaw daha doenye, moekhibay-leh hal kharta.
ENG: Now before the feast of the passover, Jesus knowing that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad anee teebe lkharamsha, dirya ywa akelqarṣa bliba deehoeda skaryooṭa, broona dshim'oon, dsape-leh eeshoo'.
ENG: And during supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him,

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eeshoo' beeda'a ywa dbaba yoewa ywa kleh shoelṭana beedeh, o min lkis Alaha te-leh o lkis Alaha bezala ywa.
ENG: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came forth from God, and goeth unto God,

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܫܘܼܠܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܒܵܝܬܹܗ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܠܸܚܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܚܲܨܹܗ،
TRL: Qeem-leh min kharamsha, shoelkha-leh 'abayteh o shqeel-leh yalikhta o seereh bkhaṣeh,
ENG: riseth from supper, and layeth aside his garments; and he took a towel, and girded himself.

ASY: ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܠܘܼܠܹܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܸܡܫܵܝܲܝ ܒܝܵܠܸܚܬܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܲܨܹܗ.
TRL: O dre-leh meea gaw mana, o shoere-leh lkhaloele aqlate dtalmeedoehy o bimshayay byalikhta dseeroeha ywa bkhaṣeh.
ENG: Then he poureth water into the bason, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܚܲܠܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܬ ܚܲܠܸܠܸܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈؟“
TRL: Eeman dte-leh dkhalil wa aqlate dshim'oon kepa, meereh ileh shim'oon, ”maree, at bit khalilit aqlatee?“
ENG: So he cometh to Simon Peter. He saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”adeea at le yad'et moodee bi'wada ywin, eena bar hada bit yad'et.“
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt understand hereafter.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܹܐ ܚܲܠܸܠܸܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܠܸܠܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh shim'oon kepa, ”la, at l'alam le khalilit aqlatee.“ joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”in la khalilinoekh, layt-loekh sahma beeee.“
ENG: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܚܲܠܸܠܸܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܝܼ̈ ܘܪܹܫܝܼ.“
TRL: Haygah meereh shim'oon kepa, ”maree, la akhchee khalilit aqlatee, ila oep eedatee o reshee.“
ENG: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܸܚܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܕܚܲܠܸܠ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”haw dsikhya-yleh, le-yleh sneeqa dkhalil shwooq min aqlateh, ila klanaeet dikhya-yleh. Oep akhtoon dikhye ytoon, eena la klawkhoon.“
ENG: Jesus saith to him, He that is bathed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ.“
TRL: Sabab eeshoo' ke yade' wa manee bit sape wa-leh, boet aha meereh, ”le ytoon klawkhoon dikhye.“
ENG: For he knew him that should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܒܵܝܬܹܗ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Min bar dkhoelil-leh aqlatayhy, lweesh-leh 'abayteh o teew-leh mindrish o meereh ilayhy, ”beeda'a ytoon moodee 'weed-lee ilawkhoon?
ENG: So when he had washed their feet, and taken his garments, and sat down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܪܲܒܝܼ ܘܡܵܪܲܢ، ܘܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon ke qareytoon-lee rabee o Maran, o ṣpayee ke amreetoon, sabab eewin.
ENG: Ye call me, Master, and, Lord: and ye say well; for so I am.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܘܸܢ ܡܵܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܪܲܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܡܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܲܠܸܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”In ana deewin marawkhoon o rabeeawkhoon hadkha khoelil-lee aqlatawkhoon, kma akhtoon wale-ylaha dkhalileetoon aqlate dkhad dhaw khena.
ENG: If I then, the Lord and the Master, have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.

ASY: ”ܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ṭoewsa yoebil-lee ilawkhoon, dakhee dana 'weed-lee ilawkhoon, hadkha oep akhtoon 'awdeetoon.
ENG: For I have given you an example, that ye also should do as I have done to you.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܲܝܬ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܕܪܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, layt rega boesh goera min mareh, o la shleekha boesh goera min shadraneh.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, A servant is not greater than his lord; neither one that is sent greater than he that sent him.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In yad'eetoon ane, ṭoewa ilawkhoon in 'awdeetoon-lhoon.
ENG: If ye know these things, blessed are ye if ye do them.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܩܒܹܗ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Le ywin boet klawkhoon bemara aha, ana ke yad'en lanee dgoebyay ywin; eena dpaesh toemima ktawa dmeereh: haw dbekhala-yleh lakhma 'amee, moerim-leh 'iqbeh 'alee.
ENG: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth my bread lifted up his heel against me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ، ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”Adeea bemara ywin ilawkhoon min qam dhawe, deeman dhwe-leh, hamineetoon dana ywin.
ENG: From henceforth I tell you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am he.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܲܕܪܸܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܲܒܸܠ، ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dqabil lhaw dshadrineh, ilee qaboele-yleh, o man dilee qabil, qaboele-yleh lhaw dshoedireh ilee.“
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Kad hoemzim-leh ane eeshoo', shgheesh-leh broekha, o sheed-leh o meereh, ”troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, khad minawkhoon bit sape-lee.“
ENG: When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in the spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

ASY: ܚܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kheerhoon talmeede khad bhaw khena, la beeda'a boet manee hoemzim-leh.
ENG: The disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܣܢܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܥܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Khad min talmeedoehy, haw deeshoo' ke makhib wa-leh, sneeda ywa b'oeba deeshoo'.
ENG: There was at the table reclining in Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.

ASY: ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܪܡܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܒܲܩܸܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Laha rmeez-leh shim'oon kepa dbaqireh boet manee hamzoeme ywa.
ENG: Simon Peter therefore beckoneth to him, and saith unto him, Tell us who it is of whom he speaketh.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܲܠ ܨܲܕܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: Haygah gne-leh haw 'al ṣadra deeshoo', o meereh ileh, ”maree, manee-yleh?“
ENG: He leaning back, as he was, on Jesus’ breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܛܵܡܫܹܢ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“ ܘܛܡܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', ”haw eeleh dṭamshen lakhma o yabeneh ileh.“ o ṭmeesh-leh lakhma o yoebil-leh leehoeda, broona dshim'oon skaryooṭa.
ENG: Jesus therefore answereth, He it is, for whom I shall dip the sop, and give it him. So when he had dipped the sop, he taketh and giveth it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

ASY: ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O bar dshqeel-leh eehoeda lakhma, 'weereh bee-eh saṭana. Haygah meereh ileh eeshoo', ”mindee dbit 'awdet, 'wood-leh bjaldoeta.“
ENG: And after the sop, then entered Satan into him. Jesus therefore saith unto him, That thou doest, do quickly.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eena oep khad min anee dteebe ywaw la dee' leh qamoodee meereh ileh aha.
ENG: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܲܢܕܘܼܩܵܐ ܕܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܙܵܒܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܕܗܲܝܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab sandoeqa dzoeze lkis eehoeda ywa, khakma minayhy khsheew-lhoon deeshoo' meereh ileh dzaben wa mindee dsneeqa ywa qa 'eda, yan dhayir wa lmiskene.
ENG: For some thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus said unto him, Buy what things we have need of for the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ؛ ܘܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kad shqeel-leh eehoeda lakhma pleeṭ-leh har bhay 'dana; o layle ywa.
ENG: He then having received the sop went out straightway: and it was night.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar dpleeṭ-leh eehoeda skaryooṭa, meereh eeshoo', ”adeea peesh-leh khqeera broona dnasha, o Alaha peesh-leh khqeera bee-eh.
ENG: When therefore he was gone out, Jesus saith, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him;

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܩܹܪ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܩܹܪܹܗ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”In Alaha peesh-leh khqeera bee-eh, Alaha bit khaqer lbroona bganeh, o bit khaqereh bjaldoeta.
ENG: and God shall glorify him in himself, and straightway shall he glorify him.

ASY: ”ܒܢܘܿܢܝܼ̈، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ. ܒܸܬ ܛܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bnoonee, bit haweyn 'amawkhoon qa khad zawna kirya. Bit ṭa'eytoon baree, o dakhee dmeeree lyhoedaye, oep ilawkhoon bemara ywin, layka dana bezala ywin, akhtoon le maṣeytoon ateytoon.
ENG: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me: and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say unto you.

ASY: ”ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܚܸܒܘܼܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Poeqdana khata beeawa ywin ilawkhoon, dmakhibeetoon khad lhaw khena. Dakhee dana moekhib-lee ilawkhoon, hadkha oep akhtoon makhiboen khad lhaw khena.
ENG: A new commandment I give unto you, that ye love one another; even as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

ASY: ”ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Baha klayhy nashe bit yad'ee dtalmeedee ytoon, in makhibeetoon khad lhaw khena.“
ENG: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܬ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܬ.“
TRL: Boeqireh shim'oon kepa, ”maree, layka bezala ywit?“ joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”layka dbezala ywin le maṣeyt ateyt baree adeea, eena bkharta bit ateyt.“
ENG: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow afterwards.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ؟ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Boeqireh shim'oon kepa, ”maree, qamoodee le maṣeyn ateyn baroekh adeea? Ganee bit matbinaha min geboekh.“
ENG: Peter saith unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee even now? I will lay down my life for thee.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܝܼ؟ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܪܒܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”at bit matbit ganoekh min gebee? Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin iloekh, min qam dqare qarooya bit sarbet-lee tlat gahe.“
ENG: Jesus answereth, Wilt thou lay down thy life for me? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ.
TRL: ”La paesh shgheesha libawkhoon, haminoen balaha o oep beeee haminoen.
ENG: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

ASY: ”ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܲܥܡܪܹ̈ܐ. ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܗܲܕܪܸܢ ܩܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: ”Gaw bayta dbabee eet raba ma'mre. In la hawya wa hadkha, bit amren wa ilawkhoon, sabab ana bezala ywin dhadrin qatawkhoon doeka.
ENG: In my Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you; for I go to prepare a place for you.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܘܗܲܕܪܸܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܘܠܲܒܠܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”O in azen o hadrin doeka qatawkhoon, bit dayren o lablinawkhoon lkis-lee, doep akhtoon haweytoon ayka dana ywin.
ENG: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I come again, and will receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: ”O akhtoon ke yad'eetoon oerkha ldoeka dana bezala ywin.“
ENG: And whither I go, ye know the way.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh tooma, ”maree, le ywakh beeda'a layka bezala ywit, dakhee maṣakh yad'akh loerkha?“
ENG: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; how know we the way?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܘܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܘܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”ana ywin oerkha o shrara o khaye. Oep khad le ate lkis baba ila beeee.
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, and the truth, and the life: no one cometh unto the Father, but by me.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”In ilee yad'eetoon waw, oep lbabee bit yad'eetoon waw. Eena min adeea ke yad'eetoon-leh, o khze lawkhoon ileh.“
ENG: If ye had known me, ye would have known my Father also: from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܡܵܠܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: meereh ileh peeleepoos, ”maree, makhzee lan baba o malyanta-ylaha ilan.“
ENG: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܘܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܝܼ؟ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܸܠܝܼ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ’ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ‘؟
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”ya peeleepoos, kleh aha zawna 'amawkhoon eewin o hesh le ywit beeda'ee? Man dilee khaze khizya-yleh lbaba. Dakhee bemara ywit, ’makhzee lan baba‘?
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and dost thou not know me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; how sayest thou, Shew us the Father?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܲܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Le ywit hamoene dana bbaba ywin o baba beeee-yleh? Hemizmane dana hamzoeme ywin ilawkhoon le ywin hamzoemay min ganee, ila baba dbi'mara-yleh beeee, haw bi'wada-yleh poelkhanoehy.
ENG: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I say unto you I speak not from myself: but the Father abiding in me doeth his works.

ASY: ”ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ. ܐܸܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܗܲܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Haminoen dana bbaba ywin o baba beeee-yleh. In baha le hamineetoon, haminoen boet poelkhane.
ENG: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, man dhamin beeee bit 'abed poelkhane dana bi'wada ywin, o boesh goere minayhy bit 'abed, sabab ana lkis baba bezala ywin.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto the Father.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ana bit 'awden mindee dṭalbeetoon bshimee, dpaesh khqeera baba bbroona.
ENG: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܹܗ.“
TRL: ”In ṭalbeetoon mindee bshimee, ana bit 'awdeneh.“
ENG: If ye shall ask me anything in my name, that will I do.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܢܛܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܝܼ̈،
TRL: ”In makhibeetoon-lee, nṭooroen poeqdanee,
ENG: If ye love me, ye will keep my commandments.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܒܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܝܸܪܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܥܵܠܲܡ،
TRL: ”O ana bit ṭalben min baba o haw bit yabil lawkhoon khad hayirana khena dhawe 'amawkhoon hal 'alam,
ENG: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may be with you for ever,

ASY: ”ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܠܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Deeleh roekha dshrara, haw d'alma le maṣe lqaboeleh, sabab le-yleh bikhzayeh, o le-yleh beeda'eh. Eena akhtoon ke yad'eetoon-leh, sabab lkis lawkhoon eeleh, o bit hawe gawawkhoon.
ENG: even the Spirit of truth: whom the world cannot receive; for it beholdeth him not, neither knoweth him: ye know him; for he abideth with you, and shall be in you.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܵܬܘܿܡܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Le shawqenawkhoon yatoome, bit dayren lkis lawkhoon.
ENG: I will not leave you desolate: I come unto you.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Min bar khad zawna kirya 'alma le khaze-lee, eena akhtoon bit khazeytoon-lee, sabab ana khaya ywin oep akhtoon bit khayeytoon.
ENG: Yet a little while, and the world beholdeth me no more; but ye behold me: because I live, ye shall live also.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bhaw yawma bit yad'eetoon dana bbaba ywin, o akhtoon beeee, o ana beeawkhoon.
ENG: In that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܝܼ̈ ܘܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ. ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܢܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܝܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Man deet-leh poeqdanee o naṭerhoon, haw ke makhib-lee. O haw dmakhib-lee bit paesh moekhiba min babee, o ana bit makhibineh, o bit makhzeyn ganee ileh.“
ENG: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself unto him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، (ܠܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ)، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܝܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh ileh eehoeda, (la skaryooṭa), ”maree, dakhee-ylaha dbit makhzeyt ganoekh ilan eena la l'alma?“
ENG: Judas (not Iscariot) saith unto him, Lord, what is come to pass that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܢܵܛܹܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈، ܘܒܵܒܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܲܚ ܘܡܲܬܒܲܚ ܡܲܥܡܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”in nasha makhib-lee, bit naṭer hemizmanee, o babee bit makhib-leh, o bit atakh o matbakh ma'mra lkis-leh.
ENG: Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my word: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܢܵܛܹܪ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈. ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܩܲܡ ܫܲܕܸܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”O haw dle makhib-lee, le naṭer hemizmanee. Hemizman dbishma'a ytoon le-ylaha deeee, ila dbaba dqam shadiree.
ENG: He that loveth me not keepeth not my words: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܗܹܫ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ.
TRL: ”Ane hoemzim-lee ilawkhoon kad hesh ana 'amawkhoon eewin.
ENG: These things have I spoken unto you, while yet abiding with you.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܫܲܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܝܸܪܵܢܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܟܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dbaba shadirawkhoon hayirana bshimee, deeleh roekha dqoedsha, haw bit malip lawkhoon kl mindee, o bit madkirawkhoon kl mindee dmeeree ilawkhoon.
ENG: But the Comforter, even the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all that I said unto you.

ASY: ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܫܒ݂ܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ.
TRL: ”Shlama bishwaqa ywin lkis lawkhoon, shlama deeee beeawa ywin ilawkhoon. La dakhee d'alma yabil ana beeawa ywin ilawkhoon. La paesh shgheesha libawkhoon, o la zade'.
ENG: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ’ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘ ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܲܚܘܼܒܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ.
TRL: ”Shmee' lawkhoon dmeeree ilawkhoon, ’bezala ywin, eena bit dayren lkis lawkhoon.‘ in haweytoon waw makhoebee bit khadeytoon waw dana bezala ywin lkis baba, sabab baba boesh goera-yleh minee.
ENG: Ye heard how I said to you, I go away, and I come unto you. If ye loved me, ye would have rejoiced, because I go unto the Father: for the Father is greater than I.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ، ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ.
TRL: ”meeree ilawkhoon min qam dhawe, dhamineetoon eeman dhawe.
ENG: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Adeea le hamzimin 'amawkhoon raba, sabab goera daha doenye betaya-yleh, eena layt-leh khayla 'alee.
ENG: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world cometh: and he hath nothing in me;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܹܥ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܢ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ. ܩܘܼܡܘܼܢ ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܡܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena dyade' 'alma dke makhibin lbaba, aykh dpqeed-leh ilee baba, hadkha ke 'awden. Qoemoen azakh makha.
ENG: but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܸܦܬܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܘܒܵܒܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܲܢܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana ywin gipta dshrara o babee-yleh ganana.
ENG: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܦܲܥܘܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܛܹܥ ܠܹܗ، ܘܟܠ ܦܲܥܘܵܐ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܲܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kl pa'wa dla yabil beeee ṭ'oenyate ke qaṭe' leh, o kl pa'wa dyabil ṭ'oenyate ke dake-leh dyabil ṭ'oenyate boesh zawda.
ENG: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit, he taketh it away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he cleanseth it, that it may bear more fruit.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Adeea akhtoon dikhye ytoon byad hemizman dhoemzim-lee ilawkhoon.
ENG: Already ye are clean because of the word which I have spoken unto you.

ASY: ”ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܦܲܥܘܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܸܦܬܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Kleymoen beeee o ana beeawkhoon. Pa'wa le maṣe yabil ṭ'oenyate min ganeh in la kale 'al gipta. Hadkha oep akhtoon le maṣeytoon yaweetoon ṭ'oenyate in la kaleytoon beeee.
ENG: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; so neither can ye, except ye abide in me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܸܦܬܵܐ ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܵܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ana ywin gipta o akhtoon pa'wane. Haw dkale beeee o ana bee-eh, aha bit yabil ṭ'oenta raba, sabab la deeee le maṣeytoon 'awdeetoon mindee.
ENG: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same beareth much fruit: for apart from me ye can do nothing.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܲܥܘܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܙܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܲܥܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܥܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܵܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܝܵܩܕܝܼ.
TRL: ”Man dla kale beeee, aykh pa'wa breeza-yleh, dpaesh roepya lbadar. Hadkha pa'wane ke jam'ee-lhoon o daree-lhoon bnoera dyaqdee.
ENG: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܟܵܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In kaleytoon beeee o hemizmanee kalee beeawkhoon, kl mindee dbasma lawkhoon ṭlooboen, o bit hawe ilawkhoon.
ENG: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask whatsoever ye will, and it shall be done unto you.

ASY: ”ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܵܒܝܼ، ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܡܲܚܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܝܼ̈ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Baha bit paesh khqeera babee, dyaweetoon ṭ'oenyate raba o makhzeytoon ganawkhoon dtalmeedee ytoon.
ENG: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; and so shall ye be my disciples.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܚܘܼܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dbaba moekhib-leh ilee, hadkha oep ana moekhib-lee ilawkhoon. Kleymoen bkhoebee.
ENG: Even as the Father hath loved me, I also have loved you: abide ye in my love.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܢܵܛܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܝܼ̈، ܒܸܬ ܟܵܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܚܘܼܒܝܼ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܝܼ ܘܒܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܚܘܼܒܹܗ.
TRL: ”In naṭreetoon poeqdanee, bit kaleytoon bkhoebee, dakhee dana nṭeeree poeqdana dbabee o biklaya ywin bkhoebeh.
ENG: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܚܲܕܘܼܬܝܼ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ane meeree ilawkhoon dkhadoetee hawya beeawkhoon, o khadoetawkhoon paysha toemimta.
ENG: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Poeqdanee ilawkhoon aha-yleh, dmakhibeetoon khad lhaw khena dakhee dana moekhib-lee ilawkhoon.
ENG: This is my commandment, that ye love one another, even as I have loved you.

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܚܸܒܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Layt khoeba boesh goera min daha, dnasha yabil khayoehy min geba dmoekhiboehy.
ENG: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܝܼ̈ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܵܩܕܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon moekhibee ytoon in 'awdeetoon mindee dpaqdenawkhoon.
ENG: Ye are my friends, if ye do the things which I command you.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܡܵܪܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܹ̈ܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܓܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”khena le qareynawkhoon regawate, sabab rega le yade' moodee ke 'abed mareh. Eena qre-lee ilawkhoon moekhibe sabab kl mindee dshmee' lee min baba gle-lee ilawkhoon.
ENG: No longer do I call you servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I heard from my Father I have made known unto you.

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”La akhtoon goebe lawkhoon, ilee ila ana goebe-lee ilawkhoon, o yoebil-lee ilawkhoon poelkhana dazeetoon o yaweetoon ṭ'oenyate, o payshee ṭ'oenyatawkhoon, dyabil lawkhoon baba kl mindee dṭalbeetoon bshimee.
ENG: Ye did not choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that ye should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should abide: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܡܲܚܸܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Ane bipqada ywin ilawkhoon, dmakhibeetoon khad lhaw khena.“
ENG: These things I command you, that ye may love one another.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܣܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܣܵܢܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In 'alma sane lawkhoon, di'moen dsne-leh ilee min qam dsane ilawkhoon.
ENG: If the world hateth you, ye know that it hath hated me before it hated you.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܓܲܒܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”In haweytoon waw min aha 'alma, 'alma bit makhib wa lawkhoon, eena sabab le ytoon mineh, o ana qam gabeynawkhoon min 'alma, boet aha 'alma ke sane lawkhoon.
ENG: If ye were of the world, the world would love its own: but because ye are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

ASY: ”ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܠܲܝܬ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܹܗ. ܐܸܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܟܘܼܡܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܟܲܡܪܝܼ، ܘܐܸܢ ܢܛܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dkhooroen hemizmane dmeeree ilawkhoon, layt rega boesh goera min mareh. In ilee koemirhoon, oep ilawkhoon bit kamree, o in nṭeerhoon hemizmanee, oep hemizmanawkhoon bit naṭree.
ENG: Remember the word that I said unto you, A servant is not greater than his lord. If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Klayhy ane bit 'awdee-lhoon ilawkhoon boet shimee, sabab le yad'ee-leh haw dshoedireh ilee.
ENG: But all these things will they do unto you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܗܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”In la haweyn wa teea o hoemzima ilayhy, layt waw-lhoon khṭeeta. Eena adeea layt-lhoon mahana boet khṭeeatayhy.
ENG: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no excuse for their sin.

ASY: ”ܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܵܢܹܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: ”Man dsane ilee oep lbabee ke sane.
ENG: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܚܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܚܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܣܢܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܒܵܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”In la haweyn wa pleekha gawayhy poelkhane doep khad khena la pleekhay-leh, le hawe wa-lhoon khṭeeta. Eena adeea khze-lhoon lane poelkhane o sne-lhoon ilee o oep lbabee.
ENG: If I had not done among them the works which none other did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.

ASY: ”ܣܢܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܲܝܗܝ: ܣܢܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sne-lhoon ilee dpaysha toemimta hemizman dkteewta-ylaha gaw namoosayhy: sne-lhoon ilee dla 'ilta.
ENG: But this cometh to pass, that the word may be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗܲܝܸܪܵܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܕܦܵܠܹܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eeman date hayirana, haw dana shadrineh ilawkhoon min lkis baba, roekha dshrara dpaleṭ min baba, haw bit yabil sahdoeta boet deeee.
ENG: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall bear witness of me:

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Oep akhtoon bit yaweetoon sahdoeta boet deeee, sabab hwe lawkhoon 'amee ha min shoeraya.
ENG: and ye also bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܬܲܪܩܸܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Ane meeree ilawkhoon dla tarqileetoon.
ENG: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be made to stumble.

ASY: ”ܒܸܬ ܛܵܪܕܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܟܠ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܫܹܒ݂ ܕܡܲܩܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bit ṭardee lawkhoon min knoeshyate. Betaya-ylaha sa'at dkl dqaṭel lawkhoon bit khashew dmaqroebe-yleh khilmat lalaha.
ENG: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the hour cometh, that whosoever killeth you shall think that he offereth service unto God.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܹܐ ܠܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ane bit 'awdee ilawkhoon, sabab le yna dee'e lbaba oep la ilee.
ENG: And these things will they do, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܣܵܥܲܬܲܝܗܝ، ܕܵܟ݂ܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ane adeea bemara ywin ilawkhoon, deeman datya sa'atayhy, dakhreetoon dana meeree ilawkhoon. La meeree ilawkhoon min qamayta sabab 'amawkhoon eewin wa.
ENG: But these things have I spoken unto you, that when their hour is come, ye may remember them, how that I told you. And these things I said not unto you from the beginning, because I was with you.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܝܼ، ’ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”Adeea bezala ywin lkis haw dshoedireh ilee, o oep khad minawkhoon le-yleh baqoeree, ’layka ywit bezala?‘
ENG: But now I go unto him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Adeea dmeeree ilawkhoon ane, khasha mle-leh blibawkhoon.
ENG: But because I have spoken these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

ASY: ”ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ. ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ، ܗܲܝܸܪܵܢܵܐ (ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ) ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ، ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Shrara hamzoeme ywin 'amawkhoon, ṣpayee-ylaha qatawkhoon dana azen. In la azen, hayirana (roekha dqoedsha) le ate lkis lawkhoon. Eena in azen, bit shadrineh lkis lawkhoon.
ENG: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I go, I will send him unto you.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܢܟܸܣ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ.
TRL: ”O eeman date, bit mankis l'alma 'al khṭeeta, o 'al zadeeqoeta, o 'al deewan.
ENG: And he, when he is come, will convict the world in respect of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

ASY: ”ܥܲܠ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ،
TRL: ”'Al khṭeeta, sabab la hoeminhoon beeee,
ENG: of sin, because they believe not on me;

ASY: ”ܘܥܲܠ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”O 'al zadeeqoeta, sabab bezala ywin lkis baba, o khena le khazeytoon-lee.
ENG: of righteousness, because I go to the Father, and ye behold me no more;

ASY: ”ܘܥܲܠ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O 'al deewan, sabab goera daha doenye peesh-leh deena.
ENG: of judgment, because the prince of this world hath been judged.

ASY: ”ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܠܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Raba khene eet-lee lemara ilawkhoon, eena adeea le maṣeytoon qableetoon-lhoon.
ENG: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܗܲܕܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܟܠ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܸܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman droekha dshrara ate, bit mhade lawkhoon bkl shrara. Haw le hamzim min ganeh, ila bit hamzim mindee dshmee' leh, o bit madi' lawkhoon boet mindeeane dbetaya yna.
ENG: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he shall guide you into all the truth: for he shall not speak from himself; but what things soever he shall hear, these shall he speak: and he shall declare unto you the things that are to come.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܘܡܲܕܸܥ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Haw khiqra ilee bit yabil, sabab minee bit shaqel o madi' ilawkhoon.
ENG: He shall glorify me: for he shall take of mine, and shall declare it unto you.

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܘܡܲܕܸܥ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Kl mindee deet-leh baba deeee-yleh. Boet aha meeree ilawkhoon, droekha bit shaqel minee o madi' ilawkhoon.
ENG: All things whatsoever the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he taketh of mine, and shall declare it unto you.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Min bar khad zawna kirya le khazeytoon-lee khena. Eena mindrish min bar khad zawna kirya bit khazeytoon-lee, sabab bezala ywin lkis baba.“
ENG: A little while, and ye behold me no more; and again a little while, and ye shall see me.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ’ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ‘؟“
TRL: meerhoon talmeede khad lhaw khena, ”moodee-yleh aha dbemara-yleh ilan, ’min bar khad zawna kirya le khazeytoon-lee, eena mindrish min bar khad zawna kirya bit khazeytoon-lee, sabab bezala ywin lkis baba‘?“
ENG: Some of his disciples therefore said one to another, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye behold me not; and again a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ’ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ‘؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Mindrish boeqirhoon talmeede, ”moodee-ylaha aha hemizman, ’qa khad zawna kirya‘? Le ywakh beeda'a moodee hamzoeme-yleh.“
ENG: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? We know not what he saith.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ، ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ؟
TRL: Eeshoo' dee' leh dba'ee waw baqree waw-leh, meereh ilayhy, ”moodee ytoon baqoere khad min haw khena, dmeeree ilawkhoon dmin bar khad zawna kirya le khazeytoon-lee, o mindrish min bar khad zawna kirya bit khazeytoon-lee?
ENG: Jesus perceived that they were desirous to ask him, and he said unto them, Do ye inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, A little while, and ye behold me not, and again a little while, and ye shall see me?

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܟܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ، ܘܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܹܐ. ܒܸܬ ܦܵܫܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܪܵܐ ܠܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, akhtoon bit bakeytoon o bit 'awdeetoon ta'zee, o 'alma bit khade. Bit pashmeetoon, eena pashamtawkhoon bit khadra lkhadoeta.
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܠܗܲܨܘܼܠܹܐ، ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬܘܼܗ̇، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܢܫܝܼܵܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dbakhta atya lhaṣoele, ke hawya boelṣana sabab mṭe-laha sa'atoeha, eena eeman dhaṣla yala, ke mansheea kleh oelṣana sabab khad barnasha te-leh ldoenye.
ENG: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but when she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for the joy that a man is born into the world.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܒܸܬ ܚܵܕܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Hadkha oep akhtoon adeea-ylaha 'dana dkhashawkhoon. Eena bit khazeynawkhoon mindrish o bit khadeytoon, o oep khad le shaqel-laha khadoetawkhoon minawkhoon.
ENG: And ye therefore now have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one taketh away from you.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܲܩܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bhaw yawma le baqreetoon-lee mindee. Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin ilawkhoon, kl mindee dṭalbeetoon min baba bshimee bit yabil lawkhoon.
ENG: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, If ye shall ask anything of the Father, he will give it you in my name.

ASY: ”ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܛܠܝܼܒܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ. ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Hal adeea le ytoon ṭleebe mindee bshimee. Ṭlooboen o bit shaqleetoon, o bit paysha toemimta khadoetawkhoon.
ENG: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ. ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܩܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܵܒܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ane hoemzim-lee 'amawkhoon bmatle. Betaya-ylaha sa'at dle hamzimin 'amawkhoon bmatle, ila galyaeet bit haqeynawkhoon boet babee.
ENG: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: the hour cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but shall tell you plainly of the Father.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܒܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܝܼ. ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܒܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bhaw yawma bit ṭalbeetoon bshimee. Le ywin bemara ilawkhoon dana bit ṭalben min baba min gebawkhoon.
ENG: In that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you;

ASY: ”ܒܵܒܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Baba bganeh ke makhib lawkhoon sabab ilee moekhib lawkhoon, o hoeminawkhoon dmin lkis baba pleeṭ-lee.
ENG: for the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from the Father.

ASY: ”ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܢܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܘܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Pleeṭ-lee min lkis baba o te-lee-laha doenye. Adeea bit shawqenaha aha doenye o dayren lkis baba.“
ENG: I came out from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go unto the Father.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܡܲܬܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah meerhoon talmeedoehy, ”adeea hamzoeme ywit galyaeet o la bmatle.
ENG: His disciples say, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܲܩܸܪܘܼܟ݂. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Adeea beeda'a ywakh dke yad'et kl mindee, o le ywit sneeqa lnasha dbaqiroekh. Boet aha hamoene ywakh dmin Alaha pleeṭ-loekh.“
ENG: Now know we that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ؟
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”hamoene ytoon adeea?
ENG: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?

ASY: ”ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܕܒܸܬ ܒܲܪܒܸܙܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܠܕܘܼܟܹܗ ܘܒܸܬ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܝܼ. ܒܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Betaya-ylaha sa'at o adeea-ylaha, dbit barbizeetoon kl khad ldoekeh o bit shawqeetoon-lee bnawshee. Eena le ywin bnawshee. Baba 'amee-yleh.
ENG: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ. ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓ݂ܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Ane meeree ilawkhoon dhawe lawkhoon shlama beeee. Gaw doenye bit hawe lawkhoon oelṣana, eena hweymoen libane, ana ghleeba ywin ldoenye.“
ENG: These things have I spoken unto you, that in me ye may have peace. In the world ye have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܥܲܬ، ܚܩܘܿܪ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܚܵܩܹܪܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh eeshoo' ane, moerim-leh 'aynoehy lshmaya o meereh, ”ya baba, te-laha sa'at, khqoor lbroonoekh, doep broonoekh khaqeroekh.
ENG: These things spake Jesus; and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that the Son may glorify thee:

ASY: ”ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Yoebil-loekh ileh shoelṭana 'al klayhy bnaynasha, dyabil khaye dl'alam lklayhy anee dyoehbay-loekh ileh.
ENG: even as thou gavest him authority over all flesh, that whatsoever thou hast given him, to them he should give eternal life.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܘܼܟ݂ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Ane yna khaye dl'alam, dyad'ee-loekh, at deewit bnawshoekh Alaha shareera, o eeshoo' msheekha haw dshoediroekh.
ENG: And this is life eternal, that they should know thee the only true God, and him whom thou didst send, even Jesus Christ.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܩܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܬܵܡܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ana khqeeree iloekh 'al ar'a btamamta dpoelkhana dyoebil-loekh ilee d'awden wa-leh.
ENG: I glorified thee on the earth, having accomplished the work which thou hast given me to do.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܚܩܘܿܪܝܼ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O adeea khqooree 'amoekh ya baba, bkhiqra deet wa-lee lkis-loekh min qam ddoenye paysha wa breeta.
ENG: And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.

ASY: ”ܓܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܢܛܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Gle-lee shimoekh lanee dyoehbay-loekh ilee min gaw 'alma daha doenye. Anee ddeeoekh eewaw, o at yoebay-loekh ilee, o nṭeerhoon hemizmanoekh.
ENG: I manifested thy name unto the men whom thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them to me; and they have kept thy word.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O adeea ke yad'ee dkl mindee dyoebil-loekh ilee min lkis-loekh eeleh.
ENG: Now they know that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are from thee:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܲܝ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܝܼ ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Sabab hemizmane dyoebil-loekh ilee yoebay-lee ilayhy, o anee qoeblay-lhoon, o shareeraeet dee' lhoon o hoeminhoon dmin lkis-loekh pleeṭ-lee o at shoediroekh ilee.
ENG: for the words which thou gavest me I have given unto them; and they received them, and knew of a truth that I came forth from thee, and they believed that thou didst send me.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet ane ṣaloeye ywin, o la boet kleh 'alma, eena boet anee dyoehbay-loekh ilee, sabab deeoekh eena.
ENG: I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for those whom thou hast given me; for they are thine:

ASY: ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Kl mindee deeee-yleh, deeoekh eeleh, o kl mindee deeoekh eeleh, deeee-yleh, o pyasha ywin khqeera bee-ayhy.
ENG: and all things that are mine are thine, and thine are mine: and I am glorified in them.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܹܫ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܒܵܒܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ، ܢܛܘܿܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ.
TRL: ”Min adeea ana le haweyn gaw doenye, eena anee hesh gaw doenye yna, o ana betaya ywin lkis-loekh. Baba qadeesha, nṭoorhoon bshimoekh dyoebil-loekh ilee, dhawee khad, dakhee deewakh akhnan.
ENG: And I am no more in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, that they may be one, even as we are.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܢܛܝܼܪܲܝ ܠܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman d'amayhy ywin wa gaw doenye, nṭeeray-lee bshimoekh dyoebil-loekh ilee. O oep khad minayhy la ṭleeq-leh ila broona dawdana, dpaesh toemima ktawa.
ENG: While I was with them, I kept them in thy name which thou hast given me: and I guarded them, and not one of them perished, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܝܼ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”O adeea betaya ywin lkis-loekh, hamzoeme ywin ane gaw doenye dpaysha toemimta khadoetee bee-ayhy.
ENG: But now I come to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܘܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܣܵܢܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana yoebil-lee ilayhy hemizmanoekh, o 'alma qam sane-lhoon, sabab le yna min 'alma, dakhee dana le ywin min 'alma.
ENG: I have given them thy word; and the world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܕܫܵܩܠܹܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܛܪܹܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Le ywin ṣaloeye dshaqlet-lhoon min gaw doenye, eena dnaṭret-lhoon min beesha.
ENG: I pray not that thou shouldest take them from the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil one.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Anee le yna min aha 'alma dakhee dana le ywin min aha 'alma.
ENG: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

ASY: ”ܩܲܕܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܪܵܪܵܐ. ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Qadish-lhoon bshrara. Hemizmanoekh shrara-ylaha.
ENG: Sanctify them in the truth: thy word is truth.

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.
TRL: ”Dakhee dat shoediroekh ilee gaw doenye, hadkha oep ana shoedray-lee gaw doenye.
ENG: As thou didst send me into the world, even so sent I them into the world.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܕܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܩܘܼܕܫܹܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boet dee-ayhy ana qadoeshe ywin ganee, doep anee hawee qoedshe bshareeroeta.
ENG: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: ”Le ywin ṣaloeye boet ane akhchee, ila oep boet anee dhaminee beeee byad hemizmanayhy,
ENG: Neither for these only do I pray, but for them also that believe on me through their word;

ASY: ”ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ، ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܒܝܼܲܢ، ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dklayhy hawee khad, dakhee dat, ya baba, beeee ywit, o ana beeoekh, doep anee hawee khad bee-an, dhamin 'alma dat shoediroekh ilee.
ENG: that they may all be one; even as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be in us: that the world may believe that thou didst send me.

ASY: ”ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܝܼܘܲܚ،
TRL: ”Yoebil-lee ilayhy khiqra dyoebil-loekh ilee, dhawee khad dakhee dakhnan khad eewakh,
ENG: And the glory which thou hast given me I have given unto them; that they may be one, even as we are one;

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܝܵܕܵܐ، ܕܝܵܕܹܥ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܕܡܘܼܚܸܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
