TRL: ”Ana bee-ayhy ywin o at beeee ywit. Hadkha bit paesh moekmila khoeyada, dyade' 'alma dat shoediroekh ilee, o dmoekhibay-loekh dakhee dmoekhib-loekh ilee.
ENG: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that thou didst send me, and lovedst them, even as thou lovedst me.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ya baba, biṭlaba ywin danee dyoehbay-loekh ilee hawee 'amee bhay doeka dana ywin, dkhazee khiqra dat yoebil-loekh ilee, sabab moekhib-loekh ilee min qam shoeraya dbreeta.
ENG: Father, that which thou hast given me, I will that, where I am, they also may be with me; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢܘܼܟ݂. ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ya baba zadeeqa, apin d'alma le yad'ee-loekh, eena ana ke yad'enoekh. O oep ane ke yad'ee dat shoediroekh ilee.
ENG: O righteous Father, the world knew thee not, but I knew thee; and these knew that thou didst send me;

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܝܼ ܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܥܸܢܹܗ، ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܝܼ، ܘܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Moedi' lee shimoekh ilayhy, o boesh zawda bit mad'ineh, dhawe gawayhy haw khoeba dbee-eh qam makhibit-lee, o dana haweyn bee-ayhy.“
ENG: and I made known unto them thy name, and will make it known; that the love wherewith thou lovedst me may be in them, and I in them.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܓܲܠܝܼܵܐ ܕܩܸܕܪܘܿܢ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܲܢܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Min bar dpreeq-leh eeshoo' min ṣaloeye, zeel-lhoon haw o talmeedoehy lhaw marza khena dgaleea dqidroon. Tama eet wa khda ganta, ayka d'weerhoon haw o talmeedoehy.
ENG: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, himself and his disciples.

ASY: ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܟܲܪܝܘܿܛܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܹܗ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eehoeda skaryooṭa sapyaneh, ke yade' wa-laha hay doeka sabab raba gahe eeshoo' ke jame' wa 'am talmeedoehy tama.
ENG: Now Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus oft-times resorted thither with his disciples.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܕܵܐ ܕܲܣܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܲܡܦܹܝ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܡܲܫܥܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܙܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O te-leh eehoeda lhay doeka 'am khda dasta dnaṭoore o 'am regawate min lkis goerane dkahne o preeshe, beedatayhy lampeyde o mash'ale o zayne.
ENG: Judas then, having received the band of soldiers, and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.

ASY: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܬ ܩܲܘܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eeshoo', beeda'a boet kl mindee dbit qawim wa 'aloehy, pleeṭ-leh o meereh ilayhy, ”bar manee ytoon biṭ'aya?“
ENG: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were coming upon him, went forth, and saith unto them, Whom seek ye?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܝܵܢܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Joewib-lhoon, ”leeshoo' naṣraya.“ meereh ilayhy, ”ana ywin eeshoo'.“ oep eehoeda sapyana kilya ywa tama 'amayhy.
ENG: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am he. And Judas also, which betrayed him, was standing with them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ،“ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dmeereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”ana ywin,“ deerhoon lbara o npeel-lhoon 'al ar'a.
ENG: When therefore he said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground.

ASY: ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Gaha kheta boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”bar manee ytoon biṭ'aya?“ joewib-lhoon, ”bar eeshoo' naṣraya.“
ENG: Again therefore he asked them, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܐܸܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ilayhy eeshoo', ”meeree ilawkhoon dana ywin. In ilee ba'eytoon, shwooqoen lane nashe azee.“
ENG: Jesus answered, I told you that I am he: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܛܘܼܠܸܩ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ.“
TRL: meereh aha dpaysha toemimta hemizman dmeeroeha ywa, ”anee dyoehbay-loekh ilee la ṭoeliq-lee minayhy oep khad.“
ENG: that the word might be fulfilled which he spake, Of those whom thou hast given me I lost not one.

ASY: ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ. ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܪܝܼܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܬܹܗ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ. ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܪܹܓܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܿܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Shim'oon kepa eet wa-leh saypa. Greesh-leh o mkhe-leh lrega dgoera dkahne o preema-leh nateh dyameena. Shima dhaw rega malkoos eewa.
ENG: Simon Peter therefore having a sword drew it, and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. Now the servant’s name was Malchus.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܣܲܝܦܘܼܟ݂ ܠܕܘܼܟܹܗ. ܠܵܐ ܫܵܬܹܝܢܹܗ ܟܵܣܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܵܒܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa, ”matiw saypoekh ldoekeh. La shateyneh kasa dyoebil-leh ilee baba?“
ENG: Jesus therefore said unto Peter, Put up the sword into the sheath: the cup which the Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ، ܘܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah naṭoore o rab alpa, o dakhshe dyhoedaye, dweeq-lhoon leeshoo' o seerhoon ileh.
ENG: So the band and the chief captain, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,

ASY: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܲܢܵܢ، ܚܸܡܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Moete-lhoon ileh qamayta lkis khanan, khimyana dqayapa, deewa goera dkahne bhay sheta.
ENG: and led him to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was high priest that year.

ASY: ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Qayapa ywa haw dmoekhshikh-leh o meereh lyhoedaye, ”ṣpayee-ylaha dkhad nasha maet min geba d'ama.“
ENG: Now Caiaphas was he which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

ASY: ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܚܲܕ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܕܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Shim'oon kepa o khad talmeeda khena te-lhoon bara bar eeshoo'. Aha talmeeda 'weereh 'am eeshoo' gaw darta dgoera dkahne, sabab goera dkahne ke yade' wa-leh.
ENG: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. Now that disciple was known unto the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܲܪܵܝܵܐ. ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܢܵܛܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena shim'oon kepa kle-leh lkis tar'a baraya. O pleeṭ-leh haw talmeeda dke yade' wa-leh goera dkahne, o hoemzim-leh 'am naṭranta dtar'a, o moe'bireh lshim'oon.
ENG: but Peter was standing at the door without. So the other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, went out and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܢܵܛܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: O boeqiraha hay brata naṭranta dtar'a min shim'oon kepa o meeraha, ”le ywit oep at min talmeede daha nasha?“ joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”la, le ywin.“
ENG: The maid therefore that kept the door saith unto Peter, Art thou also one of this man’s disciples? He saith, I am not.

ASY: ܩܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܘܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܲܫܚܘܼܢܹܐ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ. ܐܘܼܦ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܫܚܘܼܢܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Qarta ywa, o regawate o dakhshe sheere ywaw noera o kilye ywaw mashkhoene ganayhy. Oep shim'oon kepa kilya ywa 'amayhy mashkhoene ganeh.
ENG: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals; for it was cold; and they were warming themselves: and Peter also was with them, standing and warming himself.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah boeqireh goera dkahne min eeshoo' boet talmeedoehy o boet yoelpaneh.
ENG: The high priest therefore asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his teaching.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo' o meereh ileh, ”ana galyaeet hoemzim-lee l'alma. Ana bkl zawna moelip-lee gaw knoeshta o gaw haykla ayka dke jam'ee yhoedaye. Bṭishwa le ywin hoemzima mindee.
ENG: Jesus answered him, I have spoken openly to the world; I ever taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where all the Jews come together; and in secret spake I nothing.

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܸܢܝܼ؟ ܒܲܩܸܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Qamoodee baqoere ywit minee? Baqir min anee dshmee'e yna ilee. Anee ke yad'ee kl mindee dhoemzim-lee ilayhy.“
ENG: Why askest thou me? ask them that have heard me, what I spake unto them: behold, these know the things which I said.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܸܬ ܠܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Kad ane meereh, khad min dakhshe dkilya ywa tama mkhe-leh leeshoo' 'al pateh o meereh ileh, ”hadkha bit jawibit lgoera dkahne?“
ENG: And when he had said this, one of the officers standing by struck Jesus with his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܚܸܠܛܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ، ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܡܚܵܝܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”in khilṭa hoemzim-lee, hal sahdoeta 'al beeshta, o in ṭawta hoemzim-lee, qamoodee bimkhayee ywit?“
ENG: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܚܲܢܵܢ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah khanan shoedireh leeshoo' seera lkis qayapa goera dkahne.
ENG: Annas therefore sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.

ASY: ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡܲܫܚܘܼܢܹܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ. ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Kilya ywa shim'oon kepa mashkhoene ganeh. Boeqirhoon mineh mindrish, ”le ywit at khad min talmeedoehy?“ o haw sreew-leh o meereh, ”la, le ywin.“
ENG: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore unto him, Art thou also one of his disciples? He denied, and said, I am not.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܚܸܙܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܡܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܵܬܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܚܵܙܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܓܲܢܬܵܐ؟“
TRL: Khad min regawate dgoera dkahne, khizma dhaw dshim'oon kepa preemoeha ywa nateh, meereh ileh, ”la qam khazeynoekh 'ameh gaw ganta?“
ENG: One of the servants of the high priest, being a kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܪܘܿܝܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish sreew-leh shim'oon kepa. O har bhay 'dana qre-leh qarooya.
ENG: Peter therefore denied again: and straightway the cock crew.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ ܠܩܲܨܪܵܐ ܕܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ، ܘܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܘܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܨܪܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܲܡܐܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡܵܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah loebil-lhoon leeshoo' min lkis qayapa lqaṣra dshaleeṭa roomaya, o ṣapra ywa. O yhoedaye la 'weerhoon gaw qaṣra dla payshee waw ṭame, dmaṣee waw akhlee waw piṣkha.
ENG: They lead Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the palace: and it was early; and they themselves entered not into the palace, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the passover.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ؟“
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh peelaṭoos lkis layhy o boeqireh minayhy, ”moodee qwalta eet lawkhoon 'al daha nasha?“
ENG: Pilate therefore went out unto them, and saith, What accusation bring ye against this man?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܣܲܦܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon o meerhoon ileh, ”in la hawe wa 'awdana dbeeshta, le sapakh wa-leh iloekh.“
ENG: They answered and said unto him, If this man were not an evil-doer, we should not have delivered him up unto thee.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܕܘܼܢܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy peelaṭoos, ”shqooloen-leh akhtoon o doenoen-leh aykh namoosawkhoon.“ joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”layt lan psasa dqaṭlakh lnasha.“
ENG: Pilate therefore said unto them, Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law. The Jews said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܵܐܹܬ.
TRL: Aha hadkha hwe-laha dpaesh toemima khabra dmeereh eeshoo' baynee mawta hdeera ywa dmaet.
ENG: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying by what manner of death he should die.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܩܲܨܪܵܐ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: 'weereh peelaṭoos lqaṣra o qre-leh leeshoo' o boeqireh mineh, ”at eewit malka dyhoedaye?“
ENG: Pilate therefore entered again into the palace, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܩܲܡ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”min ganoekh eewit bemara aha yan khene qam amree-loekh aha boet deeee?“
ENG: Jesus answered, Sayest thou this of thyself, or did others tell it thee concerning me?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ؟ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܡ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh peelaṭoos, ”bikhshawa ywit ana yhoedaya ywin? Bnay 'amoekh o goerane dkahne qam sapee-loekh ilee. Moodee ywit 'weeda?“
ENG: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ. ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܦܲܠܵܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh eeshoo', ”malkoetee le-ylaha min aha doenye. In hawya wa malkoetee min aha doenye, palakhe deena 'amee bit palshee waw dla payshen wa soepya lyhoedaye. Eena malkoetee le-ylaha min aha doenye.“
ENG: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܒܲܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ. ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܩܵܠܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh peelaṭoos, ”bas malka ywit?“ joewib-leh eeshoo', ”at bemara ywit dmalka ywin. Boet aha peesh-lee leeda o boet aha te-lee ldoenye, dyaben sahdoeta boet shrara. Man deeleh min shrara ke shame' qalee.“
ENG: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end have I been born, and to this end am I come into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ؟“ ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ،
TRL: Boeqireh mineh peelaṭoos, ”moodee-yleh shrara?“ o kad meereh aha, pleeṭ-leh lkis yhoedaye o meereh ilayhy, ”oep khda 'ilta le ywin machoekhe baha nasha,
ENG: Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find no crime in him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܸܨܚܵܐ. ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: ”Eena eet lawkhoon 'adat dshareyn ilawkhoon khad aseera b'dana dpiṣkha. Ba'eytoon dshareyn ilawkhoon malka dyhoedaye?“
ENG: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ.“ ܘܒܲܪ ܐܲܒܵܐ ܓܲܝܵܣܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: O anee moeqwikh-lhoon mindrish o meerhoon, ”la aha nasha, ila bar aba.“ o bar aba gayasa ywa.
ENG: They cried out therefore again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah peelaṭoos soepe-leh leeshoo' dpaesh mikhya bshawṭe.
ENG: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged him.

ASY: ܘܓܕܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܠܒܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ،
TRL: O gdeel-lhoon dakhshe kleela min kitwe o moetiw-lhoon bresheh, o moelbish-lhoon ileh joeba dargwana,
ENG: And the soldiers plaited a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and arrayed him in a purple garment;

ASY: ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ.
TRL: Atee waw lkis-leh o amree waw, ”shlama-loekh, ya malka dyhoedaye.“ o makhee waw-leh 'al pateh.
ENG: and they came unto him, and said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they struck him with their hands.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.“
TRL: Mindrish pleeṭ-leh peelaṭoos lbadar o meereh lyhoedaye, ”moete-lee lkis lawkhoon dyad'eetoon le ywin machoekhe gnaha bee-eh.“
ENG: And Pilate went out again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him out to you, that ye may know that I find no crime in him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܟܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dpleeṭ-leh eeshoo' lbadar, kleela dkitwe bresheh o joeba dargwana 'aloehy, meereh peelaṭoos lyhoedaye, ”ha, gawra.“
ENG: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. And Pilate saith unto them, Behold, the man!

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ، ܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ!“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܙܩܘܿܦܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Kad khze-lhoon goerane dkahne o dakhshe leeshoo', moeqwikh-lhoon, ”zqoop-leh, zqoop-leh!“ joewib-leh ilayhy peelaṭoos, ”shqooloen akhtoon o zqoopoen-leh. Ana bganee le ywin machoekhe bee-eh 'ilta.“
ENG: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Take him yourselves, and crucify him: for I find no crime in him.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܵܐܹܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-lhoon ileh yhoedaye, ”akhnan eet lan namoosa, o aykh namoosa wale-ylaha dmaet, sabab 'weeda-leh ganeh broona dalaha.“
ENG: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by that law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh peelaṭoos aha, boesh zdee' leh.
ENG: When Pilate therefore heard this saying, he was the more afraid;

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܓܵܘ ܩܲܨܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: 'weereh lgaw qaṣra mindrish o boeqireh min eeshoo', ”min ayka ywit?“ eena eeshoo' la joewib-leh ileh.
ENG: and he entered into the palace again, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܚܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ؟“
TRL: meereh ileh peelaṭoos, ”qamoodee le ywit hamzoeme 'amee? Le ywit beeda'a deet-lee shoelṭana dshareynoekh o eet-lee shoelṭana dmakheynoekh lzqeepa?“
ENG: Pilate therefore saith unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to release thee, and have power to crucify thee?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܚܛܝܼܬܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”le hawe wa-loekh shoelṭana 'alee in la paesh wa yoewa iloekh min shmaya. Boet aha haw dqam sape-lee iloekh, khṭeeteh boesh goerta-ylaha min dhay deeoekh.“
ENG: Jesus answered him, Thou wouldest have no power against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath greater sin.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܸܢ ܫܵܪܹܝܬ ܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ. ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Min hay 'dana peelaṭoos ke ba'e wa dshare wa leeshoo', eena yhoedaye boesh zawda maqwikhee waw o amree waw, ”in shareyt-leh, le ywit lgeba dqesar. Kl man d'abed ganeh malka, dalqoewl dqesar eeleh.“
ENG: Upon this Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou release this man, thou art not Caesar’s friend: every one that maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ، ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ، ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ، ”ܪܨܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐܦܹ̈ܐ،“ ܘܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܪܵܡܵܝܵܐ، ”ܓܦܝܼܦܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh peelaṭoos ane khabre, poeliṭ-leh leeshoo' lbadar, o teew-leh 'al koersya ddeewan, bdoeka dpaysha wa qreeta, ”rṣeepta dkepe,“ o blishana aramaya, ”gpeepta.“
ENG: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment-seat at a place called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

ASY: ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܵܐ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ، ܘܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܡܲܠܟܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Yawma dhadarta ywa, o yhoedaye hadoere ywaw qa piṣkha, o sa'at dtri'sar eewa. meereh peelaṭoos lyhoedaye, ”ha, malkawkhoon.“
ENG: Now it was the Preparation of the passover: it was about the sixth hour. And he saith unto the Jews, Behold, your King!

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܙܩܘܿܦ ܠܹܗ.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܠܡܲܠܟܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܙܵܩܦܹܢ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: O anee moeqwikh-lhoon, ”shqool-leh o zqoop-leh.“ meereh ilayhy peelaṭoos, ”lmalkawkhoon zaqpen?“ joewib-lhoon, ”layt lan malka shwooq min qesar.“
ENG: They therefore cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah peelaṭoos soepe-leh ilayhy dpaesh zqeepa, o poeliṭ-lhoon leeshoo' o loebil-lhoon ileh.
ENG: Then therefore he delivered him unto them to be crucified.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܛܥܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܩܝܼܦܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܲܪܩܲܦܬܵܐ، ܘܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܪܵܡܵܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܓ݂ܘܿܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh eeshoo' ṭ'eena zqeepeh ldoeka dpaysha wa qreeta qarqapta, o blishana aramaya ke paysha qreeta gaghoolta.
ENG: They took Jesus therefore: and he went out, bearing the cross for himself, unto the place called The place of a skull, which is called in Hebrew Golgotha:

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܥܲܡܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܹܒܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܹܗ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ.
TRL: Tama zqeep-lhoon ileh, o 'ameh trey khene, khad min aha gebeh o khad min haw gebeh khena, o eeshoo' bey palga.
ENG: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.

ASY: ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܠܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܘܼܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ. ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ”ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: O kteewa ywa peelaṭoos loekha o moetwoeha 'al zqeepa. O kteewta hadkha ywa, ”eeshoo' naṣraya malka dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. And there was written, JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܘܼܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܘܠܘܼܚܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ܘܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ، ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Raba min yhoedaye qre-lhoon-laha loekha, sabab doeka d'aloeha peesha ywa zqeepa eeshoo' qoerba ywa lmdeeta. O loekha peeshta ywa kteewta blishana 'iwraya, o roomaya, o yawnaya.
ENG: This title therefore read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, and in Latin, and in Greek.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܠܵܐ ܟܬܘܿܒ݂، ’ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ،‘ ܐܸܠܵܐ، ’ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܸܢ.‘“
TRL: meerhoon goerane dkahne lpeelaṭoos, ”la ktoow, ’malka dyhoedaye,‘ ila, ’haw meereh, dmalka dyhoedaye ywin.‘“
ENG: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but, that he said, I am King of the Jews.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ، ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh peelaṭoos, ”mindee dkteew-lee, kteew-lee.“
ENG: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.

ASY: ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܣܵܗܡܹ̈ܐ، ܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܠ ܕܲܚܫܵܐ. ܨܘܼܕܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܝܼܛܬܵܐ، ܙܩܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܩܸܛܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܥܸܠܸܠ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ.
TRL: Dakhshe dzqeep-lhoon leeshoo' shqeel-lhoon joeloehy o 'weeday-lhoon arb'a sahme, khad sahma qa kl dakhsha. Ṣoedreh peeshta ywa. Le ywa kheeṭta, zqeerta ywa khad qiṭ'a min l'ilil lltikht.
ENG: The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܦܵܪܛܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܵܪܲܚ ܦܸܫܟܵܐ ܘܚܵܙܲܚ ܠܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ،“ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܝܼ̈ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܥܲܠ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܝܼ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܸܫܟܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: meerhoon khad lhaw khena, ”la parṭakh-laha, ila darakh pishka o khazakh lmanee bit hawya,“ dpaesh toemima ktawa dmeereh: poeli' lhoon joelee beylayhy, o 'al lweeshtee dre-lhoon pishka. Hadkha 'weed-lhoon dakhshe.
ENG: They said therefore one to another, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my garments among them, And upon my vesture did they cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.

ASY: ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܚܵܬܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ، ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܩܲܠܝܘܿܦܵܐ، ܘܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Kilye ywaw lkis zqeepa deeshoo' yimeh, o khata dyimeh, maryam bakhta dqalyoopa, o maryam maghdlayta.
ENG: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܸܡܹܗ ܟܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܸܡܹܗ، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh eeshoo' yimeh kleeta tama, o oep haw talmeeda dmakhib wa-leh, meereh lyimeh, ”bakhta, aha-yleh broonakhy.“
ENG: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold, thy son!

ASY: ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܸܡܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: O lhaw talmeeda meereh, ”aha-ylaha yimoekh.“ o min hay sa'at loebla-leh haw talmeeda lbayteh.
ENG: Then saith he to the disciple, Behold, thy mother! And from that hour the disciple took her unto his own home.

ASY: ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܵܐ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܨܹܗܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Bar ane, kad dee' leh eeshoo' dkl mindee peesh-leh moekmila, dpaesh toemima ktawa, meereh, ”ṣehya ywin.“
ENG: After this Jesus, knowing that all things are now finished, that the scripture might be accomplished, saith, I thirst.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܚܲܠܵܐ. ܛܡܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܐܸܣܦܘܼܓܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܩܲܝܣܵܐ ܕܙܘܿܦܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܫܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܘܼܡܹܗ.
TRL: Eet wa tama mana milya khala. Ṭmeesh-lhoon gaweh ispoega, o moetiw-lhoon bresha dqaysa dzoopa, o poeshiṭ-lhoon lpoemeh.
ENG: There was set there a vessel full of vinegar: so they put a sponge full of the vinegar upon hyssop, and brought it to his mouth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܛܥܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܠܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܡܘܼܟܸܦ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dṭ'eem-leh khala eeshoo', meereh, ”toemima-yleh.“ eeman dmeereh aha, moekip-leh resheh o soepya-leh roekheh.
ENG: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ. ܘܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܫܠܲܕܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܡܝܼܛܹܐ ܫܵܩܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܫܠܲܕܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܨܠܝܼܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܠ ܙܩܝܼܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haw yawma, yawma dhadarta ywa, hadarta qa piṣkha. O yawma khena shabta goerta ywa, o yhoedaye la b'e-lhoon dshlade payshee waw 'al zqeepe byawma dshabta. Boet aha ṭleeb-lhoon min peelaṭoos dpayshee shmeeṭe shaqanayhy, o shlade moeṣlee-e min 'al zqeepe.
ENG: The Jews therefore, because it was the Preparation, that the bodies should not remain on the cross upon the sabbath (for the day of that sabbath was a high day), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܡܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܵܩܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon dakhshe o shmeeṭ-lhoon shaqane dhaw qamaya dzqeepa ywa 'am eeshoo', o oep dhaw khena.
ENG: The soldiers therefore came, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܬܒ݂ܝܼܪܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܵܩܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eena kad te-lhoon lkis eeshoo', khze-lhoon dmeeta ywa min qam 'dana, la tweeray-lhoon shaqanoehy.
ENG: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܡܚܵܐ ܠܕܸܦܢܹܗ. ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܘܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Eena khad min dakhshe mkhe-leh broemkha ldipneh. O bhay 'dana pleeṭ-lhoon dima o meea.
ENG: howbeit one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and straightway there came out blood and water.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܘܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܹܗ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇. ܗ̇ܘ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haw dkhze-leh ane beeawa-yleh sahdoeta dakhtoon hamineetoon, o sahdoeteh shareerta-ylaha. Haw beeda'a-yleh dshrara hamzoeme-yleh.
ENG: And he that hath seen hath borne witness, and his witness is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye also may believe.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܲܪ̈ܡܘܼܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܡܝܼܛܵܐ.“
TRL: Ane hwe-lhoon dpaesh toemima ktawa, ”oep khad min garmoehy le paesh shmeeṭa.“
ENG: For these things came to pass, that the scripture might be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ، ”ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܪܝܼ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܟ̰ܪܝܼܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Mindrish ktawa meereh bkhda doeka kheta, ”bit khayree bhaw dchreez-lhoon.“
ENG: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܵܡܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܒܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar ane te-leh yawsip min ramta, haw deewa talmeeda deeshoo' bṭishwa min zdoe'ta dyhoedaye, o ṭleeb-leh min peelaṭoos dshaqel paghra deeshoo'. Bpsasa dpeelaṭoos zeel-leh yawsip o shqeel-leh paghra.
ENG: And after these things Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore, and took away his body.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ. ܢܝܼܩܵܕܹܡܘܿܣ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܠܝܼܛܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܥܸܠܘܲܝ ܡܙܝܼܓܹܐ ܒܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: te-leh 'ameh oep neeqademoos, haw dteea ywa qamayta lkis eeshoo' blayle. Neeqademoos moete-leh 'ameh maykh ima leeṭre dmoera o 'ilway mzeege b'oedale.
ENG: And there came also Nicodemus, he who at the first came to him by night, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds weight.

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܟܪܝܼܟ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܒܸܣܡܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܩܒ݂ܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shqeel-lhoon lpaghra deeshoo' o kreekh-lhoon bkitane o bbisme, aykh 'adat dqwarta dyhoedaye.
ENG: So they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܲܢܬܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ. ܘܓܵܘ ܗ̇ܝ ܓܲܢܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܫ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Eet wa ganta bhay doeka deeshoo' peesha ywa zqeepa. O gaw hay ganta eet wa qawra khadta dhesh nasha le ywa moetwa gawoeha.
ENG: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new tomb wherein was never man yet laid.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܗܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab yawma dhadarta dyhoedaye ywa, o qawra qoerba ywa, moetiw-lhoon leeshoo' tama.
ENG: There then because of the Jews’ Preparation (for the tomb was nigh at hand) they laid Jesus.

ASY: ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ ܕܚܲܕܒܫܲܒܵܐ، ܗܹܫ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܕܸܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Bṣapra dkhadbshaba, hesh khishka, te-laha maryam maghdlayta lqawra o khze-laha kepa moekhdira min poema dqawra.
ENG: Now on the first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, while it was yet dark, unto the tomb, and seeth the stone taken away from the tomb.

ASY: ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܗ.“
TRL: Rkheeṭ-laha lkis shim'oon kepa o lkis haw talmeeda khena dmakhib wa-leh eeshoo', o meeraha ilayhy, ”shqeel-lhoon Maran min qawra, o le ywakh beeda'a ayka yna moetbeh.“
ENG: She runneth therefore, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we know not where they have laid him.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-lhoon shim'oon kepa o haw talmeeda khena o zeel-lhoon lqawra.
ENG: Peter therefore went forth, and the other disciple, and they went toward the tomb.

ASY: ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Tirwayhy rkheeṭ-lhoon m'oedale. Eena haw talmeeda khena rkheeṭ-leh min qam shim'oon kepa, o mṭe-leh qamaya lqawra.
ENG: And they ran both together: and the other disciple outran Peter, and came first to the tomb;

ASY: ܟܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: Keep-leh o khze-leh kitane moetbe, eena la 'weereh gaw qawra.
ENG: and stooping and looking in, he seeth the linen cloths lying; yet entered he not in.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ،
TRL: te-leh min bar mineh shim'oon kepa. 'weereh gaw qawra o khze-leh kitane moetbe,
ENG: Simon Peter therefore also cometh, following him, and entered into the tomb; and he beholdeth the linen cloths lying,

ASY: ܘܝܵܠܸܚܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܪܹܫܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܟܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܘܼܗ̇ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: O yalikhta deewa bresheh le ywa moetiwta 'am kitane, ila koermikhta bnawshoeha bkhda doeka kheta.
ENG: and the napkin, that was upon his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܡܸܛܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܠܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ. ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ،
TRL: Haygah 'weereh oep haw talmeeda khena dmiṭya ywa qamaya lqawra. Khze-leh o hoemineh,
ENG: Then entered in therefore the other disciple also, which came first to the tomb, and he saw, and believed.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab hesh le yad'ee waw min ktabe dwale ywa dqaem wa eeshoo' min gaw meete.
ENG: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah deerhoon anee talmeede lbaytayhy.
ENG: So the disciples went away again unto their own home.

ASY: ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܟܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ. ܟܲܕ ܗܹܫ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ، ܟܝܼܦ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܚܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ،
TRL: Maryam maghdlayta kleeta ywa lbadar min qawra bibkhaya. Kad hesh bibkhaya, keep-laha o kheeraha gaw qawra,
ENG: But Mary was standing without at the tomb weeping: so, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb;

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܪܹܝ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܚܘܵܪܬܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܚܲܕ ܠܟܸܣ ܪܹܫܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: O khze-laha trey malake blweeshta khwarta teebe ayka dpeesha ywa moetwa paghra deeshoo', khad lkis resheh o khad lkis aqlateh.
ENG: and she beholdeth two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ”ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܗ.“
TRL: Boeqirhoon minoeha, ”bakhta, qamoodee bibkhaya ywaty?“ joewib-laha, ”shqeel-lhoon maree, o le ywan beeda'a ayka yna moetbeh.“
ENG: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܗ̇، ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kad meeraha aha, deeraha lbaroeha, o khze-laha eeshoo' kilya, eena la dee' laha deeshoo' ywa.
ENG: When she had thus said, she turned herself back, and beholdeth Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ؟ ܠܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܬܝ؟“ ܘܗ̇ܝ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܓܲܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܵܢܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”bakhta, qamoodee bibkhaya ywaty? Lmanee biṭ'aya ywaty?“ o hay khsheew-laha dganana ywa, meeraha ileh, ”maree, in at shqeel-loekh ileh, moor ilee ayka moetbeh ywit, o ana bit shaqlaneh.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou hast borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܪܝܲܡ.“ ܕܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ”ܪܲܒܘܿܢܝܼ،“ ܒܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”maryam.“ deeraha maryam o meeraha ileh blishana 'iwraya, ”raboonee,“ bma'naya dmalpana.
ENG: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turneth herself, and saith unto him in Hebrew, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܠܵܐ ܕܵܩܪܲܬܝ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇ܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪܝ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܒܵܒܝܼ ܘܒܵܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh iloeha eeshoo', ”la daqraty beeee, sabab hesh le ywin seeqa lkis babee. Eena zey lkis akhoonwatee o moory ilayhy dbesaqa ywin lkis babee o babawkhoon, o lkis alahee o alahawkhoon.“
ENG: Jesus saith to her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended unto the Father: but go unto my brethren, and say to them, I ascend unto my Father and your Father, and my God and your God.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܡܲܓ݂ܕܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ.“ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Haygah te-laha maryam maghdlayta o meeraha ltalmeede, ”khze-lee lmaran.“ o meeraha ilayhy moodee meereh iloeha Maran.
ENG: Mary Magdalene cometh and telleth the disciples, I have seen the Lord; and how that he had said these things unto her.

ASY: ܒܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕܒܫܲܒܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Bramsha dhaw yawma, deewa khadbshaba, kad tar'ane dweere ayka djmee'e ywaw talmeede min zdoe'ta dyhoedaye, te-leh eeshoo' o kle-leh gawayhy o meereh, ”shlama ilawkhoon.“
ENG: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were shut where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܕܸܦܢܹܗ. ܘܦܨܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Min bar dmeereh aha, moekhze-leh ilayhy eedateh o dipneh. O pṣeekh-lhoon raba talmeede dkhze-lhoon lmaran.
ENG: And when he had said this, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad, when they saw the Lord.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Mindrish meereh ilayhy, ”shlama ilawkhoon. Dakhee dshoedireh baba ilee oep ana shadoerawkhoon eewin.“
ENG: Jesus therefore said to them again, Peace be unto you: as the Father hath sent me, even so send I you.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܢܦܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܩܲܒܠܘܼܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: Kad meereh aha, npeekh-leh bee-ayhy o meereh, ”qabloen roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: ”In pakhleetoon lnashe khṭeeatayhy, bit payshee poekhle ilayhy, o in la pakhleetoon lnashe khṭeeatayhy, le payshee poekhle ilayhy.“
ENG: whose soever sins ye forgive, they are forgiven unto them; whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.

ASY: ܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Tooma, khad min tri'sar dke paesh wa qirya jama, le ywa 'am talmeede eeman dte-leh eeshoo' lkis layhy.
ENG: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ.“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܢ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܫܵܘܦܵܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܨܸܒܥܵܬܝܼ̈ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܲܫܛܸܢ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܒܕܸܦܢܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܸܢ.“
TRL: meerhoon ileh talmeede khene, ”khze lan lmaran.“ o haw joewib-leh, ”in la khazeyn bganee shawpape dmeekhe gaw eedateh o matbin ṣib'atee gawayhy o pashṭin eedee bdipneh, le haminin.“
ENG: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ، ܘܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܟܲܕ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Min bar tmanya yawmane, mindrish jmee'e ywaw talmeedoehy lgawa, o tooma 'amayhy. Kad tar'ane dweere, te-leh eeshoo' o kle-leh gawayhy o meereh ilayhy, ”shlama ilawkhoon.“
ENG: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus cometh, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ”ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܨܸܒܥܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܚܙܝܼ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܝܼ̈، ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܘܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܒܕܸܦܢܝܼ، ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh ltooma, ”matiw ṣib'oekh lakha o khzee eedatee, pashiṭ eedoekh o matiw bdipnee, o la haweyt la mhoemna, ila mhoemna.“
ENG: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and see my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and put it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ ܘܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh tooma o meereh ileh, ”maree o alahee.“
ENG: Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂؟ ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo', ”sabab khze-loekh ilee hoeminoekh? Ṭoewa lanee dla khze-lhoon ilee o hoeminhoon.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, Because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Raba neeshanqe khene 'weed-leh eeshoo' qam 'ayne dtalmeede, aynee dle yna kteebe gaw daha ktawa.
ENG: Many other signs therefore did Jesus in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: Eena ane peeshe yna kteebe dhamineetoon deeshoo' eeleh msheekha, broona dalaha, o eeman dhamineetoon, hawe lawkhoon khaye bshimeh.
ENG: but these are written, that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye may have life in his name.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡܘܼܚܙܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܛܹܒܲܪܝܼܘܿܣ. ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܙܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar ane, moekhzeea-leh eeshoo' ganeh mindrish ltalmeede lmarza dyama dṭebareeoos. O hadkha moekhzeea-leh ganeh.
ENG: After these things Jesus manifested himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and he manifested himself on this wise.

ASY: ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܵܐ، ܘܢܵܬܢܝܼܐܹܝܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܛܢܹܐ ܕܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܕܲܝ، ܘܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: 'Am 'oedale ywaw shim'oon kepa, o tooma dpaesh wa qirya jama, o natneeeyl min qaṭne dgleela, o bnoone dzawday, o trey khene min talmeede.
ENG: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܨܲܝܕܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܲܚ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ. ܘܒܗ̇ܘ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy shim'oon kepa, ”ana bezala ywin lṣayda dnoene.“ o meerhoon ileh anee talmeede khene, ”oep akhnan bit atakh 'amoekh.“ o seeq-lhoon lgamee. O bhaw layle mindee la dweeq-lhoon.
ENG: Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also come with thee. They went forth, and entered into the boat; and that night they took nothing.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh ṣapra, kle-leh eeshoo' 'al marza dyama. Eena talmeede la dee' lhoon deeshoo' ywa.
ENG: But when day was now breaking, Jesus stood on the beach: howbeit the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy eeshoo', ”yale, eet lawkhoon noene lekhala?“ joewib-lhoon, ”la.“
ENG: Jesus therefore saith unto them, Children, have ye aught to eat? They answered him, No.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܕܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܲܪܕܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“ ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܪܫܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”dreymoen gardawkhoon lgeba dyameena dgamee o bit dawqeetoon.“ o dre-lhoon o la mṣe-lhoon garshee-leh sabab milya ywa garda noene.
ENG: And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ!“ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܨܘܼܕܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܨܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Haw talmeeda dke makhib wa-leh eeshoo' meereh lshim'oon kepa, ”Maran eeleh!“ eeman dshmee' leh shim'oon kepa dmaran eewa, shqeela-leh ṣoedreh o seera-leh bkhaṣeh, sabab shoelkhaya ywa, o roepya-leh ganeh gaw yama dazel wa lkis eeshoo'.
ENG: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his coat about him (for he was naked), and cast himself into the sea.

ASY: ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܓܪܵܫܵܐ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܸܫܥܝܼ ܡܸܬܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Talmeede khene deewaw gaw gamee te-lhoon bigrasha garda dnoene, sabab le ywaw raba rikhqa min birza, ila aykh tish'ee mitre.
ENG: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits off), dragging the net full of fishes.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܡܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܠܗܵܝܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܘܼܢܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dte-lhoon lbirza, khze-lhoon goemre bilhaya, o 'alayhy noena, o eet wa lakhma.
ENG: So when they got out upon the land, they see a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܝܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”mayteymoen min noene ddweeq lawkhoon adeea.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now taken.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܘܬܠܵܬ. ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܛܵܐ ܓܲܪܕܵܐ.
TRL: 'weereh shim'oon kepa gaw gamee, o greesh-leh garda lbirza kad milya noene goere, ima o khamshee o tlat. Bklayhy ane noene gaw garda, la peesh-leh preeṭa garda.
ENG: Simon Peter therefore went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, the net was not rent.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܫܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.“ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: meereh ilayhy eeshoo', ”teymoen o khooloen sharoeta.“ oep khad min talmeede la qoeshdireh lbaqoereh manee ywa, sabab ke yad'ee waw dmaran eewa.
ENG: Jesus saith unto them, Come and break your fast. And none of the disciples durst inquire of him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: te-leh eeshoo' o shqeel-leh lakhma o noene o yoebil-leh ilayhy.
ENG: Jesus cometh, and taketh the bread, and giveth them, and the fish likewise.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Aha gaha dtlat ywa dpeesh-leh khizya eeshoo' ltalmeedoehy min bar dqeem-leh min gaw meete.
ENG: This is now the third time that Jesus was manifested to the disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܗܹܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܪܥܝܼ ܦܹܐܪ̈ܝܼ.“
TRL: Min bar dkheel-lhoon sharoeta, meereh eeshoo' lshim'oon kepa, ”shim'oon broona dyawna, ke makhibit-lee boesh zawda min ane?“ joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”he maree, at ke yad'et dke makhibinoekh.“ meereh ileh eeshoo', ”mar'ee peree.“
ENG: So when they had broken their fast, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܝܼ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܗܹܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܪܥܝܼ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh eeshoo' gaha dtartey, ”shim'oon broona dyawna, ke makhibit-lee?“ joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”he maree, at ke yad'et dke makhibinoekh.“ meereh ileh eeshoo', ”mar'ee 'irbee.“
ENG: He saith to him again a second time, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Tend my sheep.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܝܼ؟“ ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬ، ”ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܬ ܠܝܼ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܸܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܲܪܥܝܼ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܝܼ.
TRL: meereh ileh eeshoo' gaha dtlat, ”shim'oon broona dyawna, ke makhibit-lee?“ psheem-leh shim'oon kepa dboeqireh mineh eeshoo' gaha dtlat, ”ke makhibit-lee?“ joewib-leh, ”maree, at ke yad'et kl mindee. At ke yad'et dke makhibinoekh.“ meereh ileh eeshoo', ”mar'ee 'irbee.
ENG: He saith unto him the third time, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.

ASY: ”ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܘܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܣܵܝܒܹܬ، ܒܸܬ ܦܲܫܛܸܬ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܘܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܠܒܸܫ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Troeṣa, troeṣa, bemara ywin iloekh, eeman d'layma ywit wa ke lawshet wa joeloekh o azet wa layka dbasma wa-loekh. Eena eeman dsaybet, bit pashṭit eedatoekh, o khad khena bit malbish-loekh, o labil-loekh layka dle basma-loekh.“
ENG: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܒܸܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Aha meereh dmakhze wa-leh bmoodee mawta bit shabikh wa lalaha. Min bar dmeereh hadkha, meereh ileh, ”ta baree.“
ENG: Now this he spake, signifying by what manner of death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.

ASY: ܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܓܸܢܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܨܲܕܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠ݇ܪܲܡܫܵܐ، ܘܕܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Deereh shim'oon kepa o khze-leh lhaw talmeeda dmakhib wa-leh eeshoo' betaya bareh. Aha ywa talmeeda dginya ywa 'al ṣadra deeshoo' b'dana dkharamsha, o dboeqireh mineh, ”maree, manee-yleh haw dsape-loekh?“
ENG: Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned back on his breast at the supper, and said, Lord, who is he that betrayeth thee?

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Eeman dshim'oon kepa khze-leh-laha talmeeda, boeqireh min eeshoo', ”maree, moodee boet aha?“
ENG: Peter therefore seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗܲܠ ܕܕܵܝܪܹܢ، ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ؟ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh eeshoo', ”in basma-lee daha paesh hal ddayren, qatoekh moodee? At ta baree.“
ENG: Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܕܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗܲܠ ܕܕܵܝܪܹܢ، ܩܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ؟“
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh khabra gaw akhoonwate, daha talmeeda le maet. Eena eeshoo' la meereh dle maet, ila, ”in basma-lee dpaesh hal ddayren, qatoekh moodee?“
ENG: This saying therefore went forth among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, that he should not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܟܬܝܼܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Aha-yleh haw talmeeda dbeeawa-yleh sahdoeta 'al klayhy ane, o oep kteebay-leh, o beeda'a ywakh dshareerta-ylaha sahdoeteh.
ENG: This is the disciple which beareth witness of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his witness is true.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܐܸܢ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ.
TRL: Raba mindeeane khene 'weed-leh eeshoo'. In kl khad minayhy paesh wa kteewa, le ywin bikhshawa dbit hawya wa doeka gaw daha breeta qa ktabe dpayshee waw kteebe.
ENG: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself would not contain the books that should be written.

ASY: ܝܵܐ ܬܹܐܘܿܦܝܼܠܵܐ، ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܘܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ،
TRL: Ya teoopeela, kteew-lee gaw ktawee qamaya boet klayhy mindeeane dshoere-leh Maran eeshoo' li'wada o lmaloepe,
ENG: The former treatise I made, O Theophilus, concerning all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,

ASY: ܗܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Hal haw yawma dpeesh-leh moesqa lshmaya, min bar dpqeeday-leh shleekhe byad roekha dqoedsha, anee dgoebyay-leh.
ENG: until the day in which he was received up, after that he had given commandment through the Holy Ghost unto the apostles whom he had chosen:

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܚܙܝܼܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܣܒܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O min bar dqoebil-leh oelṣana, moekhzeea-leh ganeh ilayhy o moesbit-leh braba mindeeane dkhaya ywa. Qa mitkha darb'ee yawmane anee bikhzayeh ywaw, o haw hoemzim-leh ilayhy boet malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: To whom he also shewed himself alive after his passion by many proofs, appearing unto them by the space of forty days, and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God:

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܵܐ ܪܵܚܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܦܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܝܼ.
TRL: O kad jmee'a ywa 'amayhy, pqeeday-leh, bemara, ”min oorishlim la rakhqeetoon, eena spooroen lqawla dbaba, haw dshmee' lawkhoon minee.
ENG: and, being assembled together with them, he charged them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, said he, ye heard from me:

ASY: ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Yookhanan moe'mid-leh bmeea, eena akhtoon, min bar khakma yawmane, bit paysheetoon 'meede broekha dqoedsha.“
ENG: For John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܕܸܪܸܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ؟“
TRL: O kad anee jmee'e ywaw, boeqirhoon mineh talmeede, ”Maran, baha zawna bit madirit malkoeta leesrayel?“
ENG: They therefore, when they were come together, asked him, saying, Lord, dost thou at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܣܝܼܩܘܿܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Haw joewib-leh ilayhy, ”le-ylaha deeawkhoon leeda'a zawne yan seeqoome aynee dbaba moetbay-leh tkhoot shoelṭana dganeh.
ENG: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know times or seasons, which the Father hath set within his own authority.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܓܵܘ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܓܵܘ ܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ، ܘܗܲܠ ܡܲܪ̈ܙܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena bit qableetoon khayla eeman date roekha dqoedsha 'alawkhoon, o bit haweytoon sahde ilee, gaw oorishlim, gaw klaha eehoed, gaw shamreyn, o hal marzane dar'a.“
ENG: But ye shall receive power, when the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be my witnesses both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea and Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܟܸܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dmeereh ane, peesh-leh moesqa kad anee bikhyara, o moekis-laha ileh 'nana min 'aynayhy.
ENG: And when he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܒܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ، ܗܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܚܘܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad anee bikhyara bshmaya, o bikhzayeh besaqa, ha, khze-lhoon trey nashe bjoele khware kilye lkis layhy.
ENG: And while they were looking stedfastly into heaven as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ؟ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ.“
TRL: meerhoon ilayhy, ”ya nashe gleelaye, qamoodee kilye ytoon o bikhyara bshmaya? Aha eeshoo' dpeesh-leh moesqa minawkhoon lshmaya, hadkha bit ate dakhee dkhze lawkhoon besaqa lshmaya.“
ENG: which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye looking into heaven? this Jesus, which was received up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye beheld him going into heaven.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܙܲܝ̈ܬܹܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܪ̈ܒ݂ܝܼܥܵܝܹܐ ܕܡܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah deerhoon shleekhe loorishlim min ṭoera dzayte deeleh qoerba loorishlim maykh tlata rwee'aye dmeela.
ENG: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is nigh unto Jerusalem, a sabbath day’s journey off.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇: ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܐܲܢܕܪܹܐܘܿܣ، ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܬܐܘܿܡܵܐ، ܘܡܲܬܲܝ، ܒܲܪ ܬܘܼܠܡܲܝ، ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܠܦܲܝ، ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܛܲܢܵܢܵܐ، ܘܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂.
TRL: Eeman d'weerhoon lmdeeta, seeq-lhoon l'ileeta ayka dhawee waw gawoeha: shim'oon kepa, yookhanan, ya'qoow, andreoos, peeleepoos, tooma, o matay, bar toelmay, ya'qoow broona dkhalpay, o shim'oon ṭanana, o eehoeda broona dya'qoow.
ENG: And when they were come in, they went up into the upper chamber, where they were abiding; both Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܡ ܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Ane klayhy bkl 'dana m'oedale ywaw bkhda gana ṣaloeye, 'am bakhtate o 'am maryam yima deeshoo' o akhoonwateh.
ENG: These all with one accord continued stedfastly in prayer, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܥܸܣܪܝܼ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Banee yawmane kle-leh shim'oon kepa gaw akhoonwate deewaw minyanayhy aykh ima o 'isree, o meereh,
ENG: And in these days Peter stood up in the midst of the brethren, and said (and there was a multitude of persons gathered together, about a hundred and twenty),

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: ”nashe akhoonwate, wale ywa dpaesh wa toemima ktawa, aynee droekha dqoedsha min qamayta hoemzim-leh bpoema ddaweed boet eehoeda, haw dloebil-leh lanee ddweeq-lhoon leeshoo' lhay doeka dtama ywa eeshoo'.
ENG: Brethren, it was needful that the scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost spake before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to them that took Jesus.

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Peesha ywa khoeshbina khad minan, o eet wa-leh sahma baha poelkhana.“
ENG: For he was numbered among us, and received his portion in this ministry.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܹܗ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܒܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܥܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Aha eehoeda zweeneh khaqla bzoeze d'awla, o tama npeel-leh 'al pateh lar'a, pteekh-leh gaweh o pleeṭ-lhoon klayhy ma'yoehy.
ENG: (Now this man obtained a field with the reward of his iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

ASY: ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܲܝܗܝ ”ܚܩܲܠ ܕܡܵܐ،“ ܘܡܲܥܢܵܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ”ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Kl khad gaw oorishlim ke yade' boet aha mindee. Boet aha qirya-lhoon hay doeka blishanayhy ”khqal dma,“ o ma'nayoeha eelaha ”khaqla ddima.“
ENG: And it became known to all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch that in their language that field was called Akeldama, that is, The field of blood.)

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܲܙܡܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ: ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܡܲܥܡܪܹܗ ܚܵܪܵܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܡܹܪ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܘܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: ”Sabab kteewa-yleh gaw ktawa dmazmoore: hawya beyt ma'mreh kharaba, nasha la 'amer gawoeha, o khad khena shaqel mdabranoeteh.
ENG: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be made desolate, And let no man dwell therein: and, His office let another take.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܓܲܒܲܚ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܢ،
TRL: ”Boet aha wale-ylaha dgabakh khad nasha dhweea-yleh 'aman bklaha 'dana dmaran eeshoo' bikhdara ywa gawan,
ENG: Of the men therefore which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܣܩܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ. ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܣܵܗܕܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܠܩܝܵܡܬܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Min shoeraya dma'moodeeta dyookhanan hal yawma dpeesh-leh moesqa lshmaya min lkis lan. Haw bit hawe sahda 'aman lqyamteh.“
ENG: beginning from the baptism of John, unto the day that he was received up from us, of these must one become a witness with us of his resurrection.

ASY: ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܒܲܪ ܫܲܒܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܘܼܣܛܘܿܣ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܲܬܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Goebe-lhoon trey nashe, yawsip bar shaba dke paesh wa qirya yoesṭoos, o haw khena mateea.
ENG: And they put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

ASY: ܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ. ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܓܘܼܒܝܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ،
TRL: Ṣoele-lhoon o meerhoon, ”ya Marya, at ke yad'et liba dkl khad. Makhzee lan aynee min ane trey goebyeh ywit,
ENG: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all men, shew of these two the one whom thou hast chosen,

ASY: ”ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܘܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܟܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Dshaqel-laha poelkhana o-laha shleekhoeta dnpeel-leh minoeha eehoeda o zeel-leh ldoekeh.“
ENG: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.

ASY: ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܸܫܟܵܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܬܝܼܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܒ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O dre-lhoon pishka, o npeel-leh 'al mateea, o peesh-leh khweesha 'am khadi'sar shleekhe.
ENG: And they gave lots for them; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܲܢܛܹܩܘܼܣܛܹܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh yawma dpanṭeqoesṭe, klayhy talmeede jmee'e ywaw m'oedale bkhda doeka.
ENG: And when the day of Pentecost was now come, they were all together in one place.

ASY: ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: Minshiltane hwe-leh aykh qala dpawkha raba khaylana min shmaya, o mle-leh lkleh bayta dteebe ywaw gaweh.
ENG: And suddenly there came from heaven a sound as of the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O peesh-lhoon khizye ilayhy lishane preeshe aykh noera o teew-lhoon 'al kl khad minayhy.
ENG: And there appeared unto them tongues parting asunder, like as of fire; and it sat upon each one of them.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: Klayhy peesh-lhoon milye min roekha dqoedsha, o shoere-lhoon hamzoeme blishane preeshe aykh droekha yoebil-leh ilayhy lhamzoeme.
ENG: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܕܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eet waw nashe bi'mara gaw oorishlim, zad'ane min Alaha, min kl oemta dtkhoot shmaya.
ENG: Now there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܠܵܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon lhaw qala, jmee' leh kleh kinsha o shgheesh-leh sabab kl khad minayhy shmee' leh ilayhy hamzoeme blishana dganeh.
ENG: And when this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speaking in his own language.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: Klayhy 'oejib-lhoon raba, o amree waw khad lhaw khena, ”klayhy ane dhamzoeme yna, ha le yna gleelaye?
ENG: And they were all amazed and marveled, saying, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܲܝ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܝܸܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܢ؟
TRL: ”Dakhee-ylaha dakhnan bishma'ay ywakh dhamzoeme yna blishana yimaya dkl khad minan?
ENG: And how hear we, every man in our own language, wherein we were born?

ASY: ”ܦܲܪ̈ܬܵܝܹܐ، ܘܡܵܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܝܼܠܵܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܢܲܗܪ̈ܝܼܢ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܘܩܵܦܵܕܘܿܩܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܢܛܘܿܣ ܘܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ،
TRL: ”Partaye, o madaye o 'eelamaye, o 'amrane dbeyt nahreen, o min eehoed, o qapadooqeea, o min poenṭoos o aseea,
ENG: Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, in Judaea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia,

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܦܪܘܼܓ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܘܦܲܡܦܘܼܠܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܝܼܒܝܼܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܹܐ، ܘܚܵܙܘܿܩܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ،
TRL: ”Min proegheea, o pampoeleea, o miṣreyn, o min oekhdane dleebeea qoerba dqiwreene, o khazooqe min roome,
ENG: in Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and sojourners from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,

ASY: ”ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܠܝܼܒܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܪܹ̈ܛܵܝܹܐ، ܘܥܵܪ̈ܵܒܵܝܹܐ، ܒܸܫܡܵܥܲܝ ܝܘܲܚ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܒ݂ܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܲܢ.“
TRL: ”Yhoedaye, o qleebaye, o qreṭaye, o 'arabaye, bishma'ay ywakh hamzoeme 'wade goere dalaha blishana dganan.“
ENG: Cretans and Arabians, we do hear them speaking in our tongues the mighty works of God.

ASY: ܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܫܵܓ݂ܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ؟“
TRL: 'Ajbee waw klayhy o shaghshee waw, bemara, ”aha moodee-yleh?“
ENG: And they were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

ASY: ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡܲܣܚܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܵܘܵܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܡܪܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ.“
TRL: khene maskhiree waw o amree waw, ”ane nashe rawaye yna bkhamra khata.“
ENG: But others mocking said, They are filled with new wine.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܕܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܹܗ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܡܲܕܥܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ. ܡܲܨܝܸܬܘܼܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈.
TRL: Haygah kle-leh shim'oon kepa 'am khadi'sar shleekhe, moerim-leh qaleh o hoemzim-leh qa kinsha, ”nashe yhoedaye o klayhy 'amrane dboorishlim, ba'eyn dmad'inawkhoon boet aha. Maṣyitoen lhemizmanee.
ENG: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spake forth unto them, saying, Ye men of Judaea, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and give ear unto my words.

ASY: ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܪ̈ܵܘܵܝܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܫܲܥ ܕܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”Ane nashe le yna rawaye aykh dbikhshawa ytoon, sabab akhchee sa'at dtsha' dqaydamta-ylaha.
ENG: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose; seeing it is but the third hour of the day;

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܘܼܒܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܘܼܐܹܝܠ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: ”Aha peeshta ywa noebeeta byad yoeeyl nweea dmeereh:
ENG: but this is that which hath been spoken by the prophet Joel;

ASY: ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܫܲܦܟܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܢܲܒܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܒܢܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛ ܓ̰ܘܲܢܩܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܚܸܙܘܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܵܒ݂ܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܠܡܝܼ ܚܸܠܡܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bit hawya byawmane kharaye, bemara-yleh Alaha, bit shapkin roekhee 'al klayhy nashe, o bit nabee bnoonawkhoon o bnatawkhoon; jwanqawkhoon bit khazee khizwe, o sawawkhoon bit khalmee khilme.
ENG: And it shall be in the last days, saith God, I will pour forth of my Spirit upon all flesh: And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, And your young men shall see visions, And your old men shall dream dreams:

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܠ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܝܼ ܘܥܲܠ ܚܹܕܲܡܝܵܬܝܼ̈ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܦܟܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܢܲܒܝܼ،
TRL: O oep 'al regawatee o 'al khedamyatee bit shapkin roekhee banee yawmane o bit nabee,
ENG: Yea and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days Will I pour forth of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy.

ASY: ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܹܝܢ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܸܠܸܠ ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܠܬܸܚܬ، ܕܸܡܵܐ ܘܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܗܵܘܓܵܐ ܘܬܸܢܵܐ.
TRL: Bit makhzeyn doemare bshmaya min 'ilil o neeshanqe 'al ar'a min lltikht, dima o noera o hawga o tina.
ENG: And I will shew wonders in the heaven above, And signs on the earth beneath; Blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

ASY: ܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܠܚܸܫܟܵܐ، ܘܣܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܕܸܡܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܣܲܗܡܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Shimsha bit paesh shoekhlipa lkhishka, o sahra ldima, min qam date yawma goera o sahmana dmarya.
ENG: The sun shall be turned into darkness, And the moon into blood, Before the day of the Lord come, That great and notable day:

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: Bhaw yawma kl man dqare bshima dmarya bit pareq.
ENG: And it shall be, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈: ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܚܙܝܼܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”nashe bnay eesrayel, shmi'moen lhemizmanee: eeshoo' naṣraya, nasha min Alaha, peesh-leh moekhzeea ilawkhoon bkhayle o bdoemare, o bneeshanqe aynee dalaha 'weed-leh beedeh gawawkhoon aykh dklawkhoon ke yad'eetoon.
ENG: Ye men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God unto you by mighty works and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, even as ye yourselves know;

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܒܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Aha eeshoo' peesh-leh soepya ilawkhoon bṣiwyana o bda'ta qamayta dalaha, o beedate 'awale zqeep lawkhoon o qṭeel lawkhoon ileh.
ENG: him, being delivered up by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye by the hand of lawless men did crucify and slay:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܘܼܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܡܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena Alaha moeqim-leh min gaw meete, o poeṣe-leh ileh min joenjare dmawta, sabab mawta le maṣe wa khame wa-leh gaw qawra.
ENG: whom God raised up, having loosed the pangs of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ: ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܲܠ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܥܫܹܢ،
TRL: ”Sabab daweed meereh boet dee-eh: khze-lee lmarya bkl zawna qamee, sabab 'al yameenee-yleh dla sha'shen,
ENG: For David saith concerning him, I beheld the Lord always before my face; For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܝܼ ܘܦܨܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܵܢܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: Boet aha khde-leh libee o pṣeekh-leh lishanee, oep paghree bit khaye bhewee.
ENG: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced; Moreover my flesh also shall dwell in hope:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܠܓܵܢܝܼ ܒܫܝܘܿܠ، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܬ ܠܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܟ݂ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab le shawqet lganee bshyool, le yabet lqadeeshoekh likhzaya khrawa.
ENG: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in Hades, Neither wilt thou give thy Holy One to see corruption.

ASY: ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܵܠܹܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦܲܪܨܘܿܦܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Moekhze-loekh oerkha dkhaye, o bit maleyt-lee boesama qam parṣoopoekh.
ENG: Thou madest known unto me the ways of life; Thou shalt make me full of gladness with thy countenance.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܡܪܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܫܝܼܛܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ، ܘܩܲܒ݂ܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”nashe akhoonwate, amrenawkhoon psheeṭaeet boet daweed, resha dawahate, dmeet-leh o peesh-leh qweera, o qawreh lakha-yleh hal idyoom yawma.
ENG: Brethren, I may say unto you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us unto this day.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܒܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܒܫܵܘܦܹܗ،
TRL: ”Eena sabab nweea ywa, o ke yade' wa dbmawmate me-leh ileh Alaha, dmin zar'eh bit matiw khad malka bshawpeh,
ENG: Being therefore a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins he would set one upon his throne;

ASY: ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܫܝܘܿܠ، ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khze-leh min qam 'dana o hoemzim-leh boet qyamta dmsheekha, dla peesh-leh shweeqa bshyool, o paghreh la khze-leh khrawa.
ENG: he foreseeing this spake of the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was he left in Hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.

ASY: ”ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܠܲܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܲܚ.
