TRL: ”Laha eeshoo' moeqim-leh Alaha min gaw meete o akhnan klan sahdoehy ywakh.
ENG: This Jesus did God raise up, whereof we all are witnesses.

ASY: ”ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܠܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܦܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ.
TRL: ”Peesh-leh moerma lyameena dalaha, o shqeel-leh min baba qawla, deeleh roekha dqoedsha, o shoepikh-leh-laha qawla dakhee dbikhzaya ytoon o bishma'a.
ENG: Being therefore by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath poured forth this, which ye see and hear.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܝܼ، ܝ݇ܬܘܿܒ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܝܼ،
TRL: ”Sabab daweed la seeq-leh lshmaya, eena meereh: meereh Marya lmaree, toow min yameenee,
ENG: For David ascended not into the heavens: but he saith himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

ASY: ܗܲܠ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܹܗ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.
TRL: Hal d'awdeneh dishminoekh koewsha tkhoot aqlatoekh.
ENG: Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܘܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha paysha dee'ta lklayhy beyt eesrayel, laha eeshoo' dakhtoon zqeep lawkhoon 'weed-leh Alaha Marya o msheekha.“
ENG: Let all the house of Israel therefore know assuredly, that God hath made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom ye crucified.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܨܹܐ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܫܲܪܟܵܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon ane hemizmane, peesh-lhoon neeṣe blibayhy o meerhoon lshim'oon kepa o lsharka dshleekhe, ”nashe akhoonwate, moodee 'awdakh?“
ENG: Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and the rest of the apostles, Brethren, what shall we do?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܬܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ، ܘܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܕܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”tawiboen, o poeshoen 'meede kl khad minawkhoon bshima deeshoo' msheekha dpayshee poekhle khṭeeatawkhoon o dqableetoon mawhawta droekha dqoedsha,
ENG: And Peter said unto them, Repent ye, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ unto the remission of your sins; and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܘܠܒܢܘܿܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ، ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Sabab qawla ilawkhoon eeleh o lbnoonawkhoon o lklayhy anee deena rikhqa, lklayhy anee dalaha qare-lhoon.“
ENG: For to you is the promise, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call unto him.

ASY: ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܚܘܼܦܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܦܲܪܩܘܼܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܦܟ̰ܝܼܠܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Braba hemizmane khene khoepiṭ-leh ilayhy o poerpil-leh bee-ayhy, bemara, ”parqoen ganawkhoon min aha sharbta pcheelta.“
ENG: And with many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, Save yourselves from this crooked generation.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ. ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܹܐ ܠܡܸܢܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Anee dhoeminhoon peesh-lhoon 'meede. Bhaw yawma maykh tlata alpe nashe peesh-lhoon moezyide lminyanayhy.
ENG: They then that received his word were baptized: and there were added unto them in that day about three thousand souls.

ASY: ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܫܲܪܝܼܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܩܨܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.
TRL: O ane kl 'dana 'am 'oedale ywaw byoelpana dshleekhe, o bshareekoeta, o bqṣayta dlakhma o bṣloota.
ENG: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread and the prayers.

ASY: ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Npeel-laha zdoe'ta 'al kl khad nasha, o raba doemare o neeshanqe payshee ywaw 'weede byad shleekhe gaw oorishlim.
ENG: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܟܹܐ ܫܲܪܸܟܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O klayhy mhoemne 'am 'oedale ywaw, o ke sharikee waw beylayhy kl mindee deet waw-lhoon.
ENG: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܩܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܘܼܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Mindee o qinyana deet waw-lhoon zoebinhoon o poeli' lhoon lkl khad aykh dsneeqoeteh.
ENG: and they sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all, according as any man had need.

ASY: ܟܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܘܩܵܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܦܫܝܼܛܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ،
TRL: Kl yawma ke jam'ee waw gaw haykla bkhda gana o qaṣee waw lakhma gaw batayhy, o akhlee waw mekhoelta bkhadoeta o psheeṭoeta dliba,
ENG: And day by day, continuing stedfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they did take their food with gladness and singleness of heart,

ASY: ܘܫܲܒܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹܐ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܡܵܪܲܢ ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܙܝܸܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܵܪܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: O shabkhee waw lalaha, pyasha myoeqre bkleh 'ama, o Maran kl yoom ke mazyid wa lminyana danee dparqee waw.
ENG: praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to them day by day those that were being saved.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܒܹܐܣܵܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: Khad yawma shim'oon kepa o yookhanan besaqa ywaw lhaykla b'dana dṣloota, sa'at dtlat min bar kawitra.
ENG: Now Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܓܒ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa tama khad nasha shpeela min kesa dyimeh. Aha ke paesh wa loebla kl yoom o moetwa qam tar'a dhaykla dke paesh qirya tar'a shapeera. Tama ke hawe wa bigwaya min nashe d'awree waw lhaykla.
ENG: And a certain man that was lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Aha eeman dkhze-leh lshim'oon kepa o lyookhanan bi'wara lhaykla, ṭleeb-leh minayhy dyawee waw-leh zoeze.
ENG: who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked to receive an alms.

ASY: ܚܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܓܲܫܸܩ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: Kheerhoon bee-eh shim'oon kepa o yookhanan, o meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”gashiq ilan.“
ENG: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him, with John, said, Look on us.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O haw kheereh bee-ayhy bispara dqabil wa mindee minayhy.
ENG: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something from them.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܘܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂. ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܩܘܼܡ ܚܕܘܿܪ.“
TRL: Haygah shim'oon kepa meereh ileh, ”sema o dahwa layt-lee, eena mindee deet-lee beeawa ywin iloekh. Bshima deeshoo' msheekha naṣraya qoem khdoor.“
ENG: But Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but what I have, that give I thee. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܕܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ، ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܥܸܩܒܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Dweeq-leh beedeh dyameena o moeqim-leh, o bhay 'dana khoelinhoon aqlateh o 'iqboehy.
ENG: And he took him by the right hand, and raised him up: and immediately his feet and his ankle-bones received strength.

ASY: ܢܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܘܒܸܫܘܵܪܵܐ ܘܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Nde-leh laqlateh, o shoere-leh bikhdara. O 'weereh 'amayhy lhaykla, bikhdara o bishwara o shaboekhe lalaha.
ENG: And leaping up, he stood, and began to walk; and he entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܘܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dkleh 'ama khze-lhoon ileh bikhdara o shaboekhe lalaha,
ENG: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

ASY: ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܓܵܒܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: dee' lhoon daha ywa haw dke yatew wa o gabe wa qam tar'a dhaykla dke paesh qirya tar'a shapeera. Peesh-lhoon milye 'oejaba o doemara 'al mindee dhwe-leh ileh.
ENG: and they took knowledge of him, that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܥܘܼܓ̰ܵܒܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܨܘܼܦܵܐ ܕܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ.
TRL: Kad haw nasha dweeqa bshim'oon kepa o yookhanan, rkheeṭ-leh kleh 'ama lkis layhy b'oejaba ldoeka dke paysha qreeta ṣoepa dshleymoon.
ENG: And as he held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܲܓ̰ܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܘܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܢ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܚܲܝܠܲܢ ܝܲܢ ܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܲܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܚܵܕܹܪ؟
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh shim'oon kepa aha, meereh ilayhy, ”nashe bnay eesrayel, qamoodee 'ajoebe ytoon baha? O qamoodee bikhyara ytoon bee-an, aykh din bkhaylan yan bzadeeqoetan 'weed lan daha nasha dkhader?
ENG: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this man? or why fasten ye your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him to walk?

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܚܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ، ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Alaha dawraham o deeskhaq o dya'qoow, Alaha dbabawatan, khqeereh lbrooneh eeshoo', haw dakhtoon soepe lawkhoon dpaesh qṭeela, o sreew lawkhoon qam peelaṭoos, kad haw ba'e wa dshare wa-leh.
ENG: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Servant Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied before the face of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܣܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܘܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon sreew lawkhoon lhaw deeleh qadeesha o zadeeqa, o ṭleeb lawkhoon min gebeh nasha qaṭoola dpaesh yoewa ilawkhoon.
ENG: But ye denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted unto you,

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon qṭeel lawkhoon lresha dkhaye, eena Alaha moeqim-leh ileh min gaw meete, o akhnan sahde ywakh-laha.
ENG: and killed the Prince of life; whom God raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

ASY: ”ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܝܼܕܵܥܹܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ. ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Bhaymanoeta bshima deeshoo', aha nasha dakhtoon bikhzayeh ytoon o beeda'eh peesh-leh bseema. Haymanoeta bshima deeshoo' boesim-laha ileh aykh dbikhzaya ytoon klawkhoon.
ENG: And by faith in his name hath his name made this man strong, whom ye behold and know: yea, the faith which is through him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Akhoonwatee, ana beeda'a ywin dla da'ta 'weed lawkhoon aha, dakhee doep goeranawkhoon 'weed-lhoon.
ENG: And now, brethren, I wot that in ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܕܡܫܝܼܚܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena hadkha Alaha toemim-leh kl mindee dpeesha ywa meera byad nwee-e, dmsheekheh bit qabil khasha.
ENG: But the things which God foreshewed by the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.

ASY: ”ܒܲܣ ܬܲܘܸܒܘܼܢ ܘܕܘܼܪܘܼܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܝܵܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”Bas tawiboen o doeroen dpayshee shweeqe khṭeeatawkhoon, o datee 'alawkhoon zawne dnyakha min Marya,
ENG: Repent ye therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, that so there may come seasons of refreshing from the presence of the Lord;

ASY: ”ܘܫܲܕܸܪ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: ”O shadir ilawkhoon lhaw dqamayta hoedreh ywa ilawkhoon msheekha, deeleh eeshoo',
ENG: and that he may send the Christ who hath been appointed for you, even Jesus:

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܵܘ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܕܸܪ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haw dbit paesh gaw shmaya hal datya 'dana dalaha madir kl mindee, aykh dhoemzim-leh byad nweeoehy qadeeshe min shoeraya.
ENG: whom the heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, whereof God spake by the mouth of his holy prophets which have been since the world began.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈: ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: ”Sabab moeshe meereh lawahatan: Marya alahawkhoon bit maqim gawawkhoon khad nweea aykh deeee min gaw akhoonwatawkhoon. Ileh sham'eetoon kl mindee dhamzim 'amawkhoon,
ENG: Moses indeed said, A prophet shall the Lord God raise up unto you from among your brethren, like unto me; to him shall ye hearken in all things whatsoever he shall speak unto you.

ASY: ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܹܥ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܛܝܼܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: O kl man dla shame' lhaw nweea, bit paesh qṭee'a min gaw 'ama.
ENG: And it shall be, that every soul, which shall not hearken to that prophet, shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܘܼܐܹܝܠ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Klayhy nwee-e, min shmoeeyl nweea o anee dte-lhoon min bar mineh, noebe-lhoon boet anee yawmane.
ENG: Yea and all the prophets from Samuel and them that followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ’ܒܙܲܪܥܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܒܘܼܪܟܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”O akhtoon eetoon bnoone dnwee-e o bnoone dwa'da d'weed-leh Alaha 'am babawatan, bemara lawraham, ’bzar'oekh bit payshee mboerke klayhy imwate dar'a.‘
ENG: Ye are the sons of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with your fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܸܟ݂ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܕܝܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: ”Eeman dalaha moeqim-leh lbrooneh, shoedireh ileh lkis lawkhoon qamayta dbarikh lawkhoon, bdyarta dkl khad minawkhoon min beeshatawkhoon.“
ENG: Unto you first God, having raised up his Servant, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your iniquities.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad hamzoeme ywaw shim'oon kepa o yookhanan l'ama, qeem-lhoon 'alayhy kahne, o goera dnaṭoore dhaykla, o zadoeqaye.
ENG: And as they spake unto the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them,

ASY: ܘܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O shgheesh-lhoon raba sabab shleekhe maloepe ywaw o makroeze l'ama qyamta min gaw meete byad eeshoo'.
ENG: being sore troubled because they taught the people, and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Dweeq-lhoon lshim'oon kepa o lyookhanan, o sabab ramsha ywa, diryay-lhoon gaw beyt aseere hal yawma khena.
ENG: And they laid hands on them, and put them in ward unto the morrow: for it was now eventide.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena raba dshmee' lhoon hemizman hoeminhoon, o hwe-leh minyanayhy aykh khamsha alpe nashe.
ENG: But many of them that heard the word believed; and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Byawma khena jmee' lhoon goerane o khwardiqne o sapre gaw oorishlim.
ENG: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem;

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܢܵܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܲܝܵܦܵܐ، ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܘܿܣ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ ܕܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Eet waw gawayhy khanan goera dkahne, o qayapa, o yookhanan, o aliksandroos, o klayhy anee deewaw min sharbta dgoera dkahne,
ENG: and Annas the high priest was there, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest.

ASY: ܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Moekle-lhoon lshim'oon kepa o lyookhanan bey palga o boeqirhoon minayhy, ”baynee khayla yan baynee shima 'weed lawkhoon aha?“
ENG: And when they had set them in the midst, they inquired, By what power, or in what name, have ye done this?

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah shim'oon kepa peesh-leh milya min roekha dqoedsha joewib-leh, ”goerane o khwardiqne d'ama,
ENG: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders,

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ،
TRL: ”In idyoom akhnan pyasha ywakh deene beeawkhoon boet shoela ṭawa dpeesh-leh 'weeda lkhad nasha mree'a o dakhee peesh-leh bseema,
ENG: if we this day are examined concerning a good deed done to an impotent man, by what means this man is made whole;

ASY: ”ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܙܩܝܼܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”di'moen-laha, akhtoon o klayhy 'ama dbnay eesrayel, bshima deeshoo' msheekha naṣraya, haw dakhtoon zqeep lawkhoon eena Alaha moeqim-leh min gaw meete, baha shima aha nasha kilya-yleh qamawkhoon bseema.
ENG: be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, even in him doth this man stand here before you whole.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ: ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܲܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪܢܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Haw eeleh: kepa dakhtoon banaye moesle lawkhoon, eena hwe-leh kepa dqoerneeta.
ENG: He is the stone which was set at nought of you the builders, which was made the head of the corner.

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܒܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܦܵܪܩܲܚ.“
TRL: ”Layt poerqana bnasha khena, sabab layt khad shima khena tkhoot shmaya yoewa lbnaynasha dbee-eh parqakh.“
ENG: And in none other is there salvation: for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, wherein we must be saved.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܫܝܼܛܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܘܝܼܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon joerat dshim'oon kepa o dyookhanan, o dee' lhoon dnashe psheeṭe ywaw dla yoelpana, 'oejib-lhoon o poerme-lhoon dhwee-e ywaw 'am eeshoo'.
ENG: Now when they beheld the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O kad khze-lhoon lnasha dpeesh-leh bseema kilya lkis layhy, la peesh-leh mindee lhamzoeme ldalqoewlayhy.
ENG: And seeing the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah pqeeday-lhoon dpalṭee waw min knoeshya, o hoemzim-lhoon khad 'am dhaw khena,
ENG: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܣܵܪܒܲܚ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Bemara, ”moodee 'awdakh bane nashe? Sabab klayhy 'amrane doorishlim ke yad'ee galyaeet neeshanqa goera peesh-leh 'weeda bee-ayhy, o le maṣakh sarbakh-leh.
ENG: saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been wrought through them, is manifest to all that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny it.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܟܠܲܚ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܦܪܵܣܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܡܲܙܕܸܥܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܠܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena dmaklakh-laha mindee min liprasa boesh zawda gaw 'ama, mazdi'akh-lhoon dla hamzimee khena baha shima loep khad nasha.“
ENG: But that it spread no further among the people, let us threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܸܟ̃ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܦܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Haygah qiryay-lhoon khda gaha kheta o pqeeday-lhoon dhich la hamzimee o la malpee bshima deeshoo'.
ENG: And they called them, and charged them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܘܼܢܘܼܢ ܐܸܢ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah joewib-lhoon shim'oon kepa o yookhanan o meerhoon ilayhy, ”akhtoon doenoen in shareerta-ylaha qam Alaha lishma'a ilawkhoon boesh zawda min lishma'a lalaha.
ENG: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you rather than unto God, judge ye:

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܲܚ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܘܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ.“
TRL: ”Le maṣakh dla hamzimakh boet mindee dkhze lan o dshmee' lan.“
ENG: for we cannot but speak the things which we saw and heard.

ASY: ܓܙܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܫܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܠܬܲܥܠܘܼܡܲܝ، ܒܘܼܬ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ،
TRL: Gzeem-lhoon 'alayhy o shiryay-lhoon, kad la moechikh-lhoon 'ilta lta'loemay, boet 'ama, sabab klayhy nashe shaboekhe ywaw lalaha boet mindee dhwe-leh,
ENG: And they, when they had further threatened them, let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people; for all men glorified God for that which was done.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab haw nasha dpeesh-leh bseema bdoemara eet wa-leh zawda min arb'ee shine.
ENG: For the man was more than forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was wrought.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ.
TRL: Kad peesh-lhoon shirye shim'oon kepa o yookhanan, te-lhoon lkis khawrawatayhy o hoeqe-lhoon kl mindee dmeerhoon ilayhy goerane dkahne o khwardiqne.
ENG: And being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said unto them.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܪܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O anee kad shmee' lhoon aha, klayhy m'oedale moerim-lhoon qalayhy lkis Alaha o ṣoele-lhoon, bemara, ”ya Marya, at bre-loekh shmaya o ar'a o yama o kl deet gawayhy,
ENG: And they, when they heard it, lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, O Lord, thou that didst make the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that in them is:

ASY: ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܪܹܓܘܼܟ݂ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܵܒܲܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ: ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܲܡܡܹ̈ܐ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܪܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: ”At hoemzim-loekh byad roekha dqoedsha bpoema dregoekh daweed baban, bemara: qamoodee shgheesh-lhoon imwate, o 'amme khsheew-lhoon sreeqoeta?
ENG: who by the Holy Ghost, by the mouth of our father David thy servant, didst say, Why did the Gentiles rage, And the peoples imagine vain things?

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܡܫܝܼܚܹܗ.
TRL: Qeem-lhoon malke dar'a o shaleeṭe o 'weed-lhoon milka 'al Marya o 'al msheekheh.
ENG: The kings of the earth set themselves in array, And the rulers were gathered together, Against the Lord, and against his Anointed:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܘܦܵܢܛܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܥܲܡ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Sabab shareeraeet baha mdeeta jmee' lhoon heroodis o panṭeeoos peelaṭoos 'am imwate o kinsha deesrayel 'al broonoekh qadeesha eeshoo', haw dat msheekh-loekh,
ENG: for of a truth in this city against thy holy Servant Jesus, whom thou didst anoint, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel, were gathered together,

ASY: ”ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܲܝܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܪܫܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Li'wada kl mindee dkhayloekh o ṣiwyanoekh min qamayta rsheem-lhoon dpaesh 'weeda.
ENG: to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel foreordained to come to pass.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܚܘܼܪ ܒܓܸܙܡܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܲܥܒܸܕ ܠܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܘܼܟ݂ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܟܠ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ.
TRL: ”O adeea ya Marya, khoer bgizmayhy o ma'bid lregawatoekh dhamzimee hemizmanoekh bkl joerat.
ENG: And now, Lord, look upon their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants to speak thy word with all boldness,

ASY: ”ܦܲܫܸܛ ܐܝܼܕܘܼܟ݂ ܘܒܲܣܸܡ، ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܟ݂ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: ”Pashiṭ eedoekh o basim, o 'wood neeshanqe o doemare bshima dbroonoekh qadeesha eeshoo'.“
ENG: while thou stretchest forth thy hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of thy holy Servant Jesus.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ.
TRL: Min bar dṣoele-lhoon, sh'eesh-laha doeka djmee'e ywaw gawoeha, o klayhy peesh-lhoon milye min roekha dqoedsha, o hoemzim-lhoon hemizmane dalaha bjoerat.
ENG: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken wherein they were gathered together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܒܚܲܕ ܠܸܒܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܹܗ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Klayhy anee dhoeminhoon bkhda gana ywaw o bkhad liba. Oep khad minayhy le amer wa boet mindee-eh deewa dganeh, ila shareeke ywaw bkl mindee deet wa-lhoon.
ENG: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and soul: and not one of them said that aught of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.

ASY: ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Bkhayla goera ke yawee waw sahdoeta ane shleekhe lqyamta dmaran eeshoo', o shapaqat goerta eet wa 'al klayhy.
ENG: And with great power gave the apostles their witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.

ASY: ܘܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܙܲܒܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܝܼܡܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: O layt wa gawayhy nasha sneeqa, sabab anee deet waw-lhoon khaqlane yan bate zabnee waw-lhoon o maytee waw ṭeemayhy,
ENG: For neither was there among them any that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

ASY: ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: O matwee waw-leh lkis aqlate dshleekhe dpaesh wa yoewa lkl khad nasha aykh sneeqoeteh.
ENG: and laid them at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto each, according as any one had need.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܠܹܘܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܒܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܝܵܐܵܐ،
TRL: Hadkha oep yawsip, lewaya min qiwproos, haw dpeesh-leh qirya barnwa byad shleekhe, bma'naya dbroona dboeyaa,
ENG: And Joseph, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of exhortation), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,

ASY: ܙܘܼܒܸܢܹܗ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܛܝܼܡܘܼܗ̇ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Zoebineh khaqla deet wa-leh o moete-leh ṭeemoeha o moetiw-leh qam aqlate dshleekhe.
ENG: having a field, sold it, and brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ ܙܘܼܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܩܸܛܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Khad nasha shimeh khananya o bakhteh shimoeha shapeera zoebinhoon khad qiṭ'a dar'a.
ENG: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,

ASY: ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܛܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܩܠܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khananya ṭoeshe-leh khad sahma min ṭeema dkhaqla kad bakhteh eet wa-laha khabra, o moetiw-leh haw sahma khena lkis aqlate dshleekhe.
ENG: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܕܲܓܠܸܬ ܥܲܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܛܲܫܹܝܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܩܠܵܐ؟
TRL: Haygah meereh shim'oon kepa, ”khananya, qamoodee hadkha mle-leh saṭana bliboekh ddaglit 'al roekha dqoedsha o ṭasheyt min ṭeema dkhaqla?
ENG: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thy heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܙܲܒܢܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇؟ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܡܘܼܗ̇؟ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ؟ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܵܐ ܕܘܼܓܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Le ywa deeoekh min qam dzabnit wa-laha? O min bar dzoebna-loekh, layt wa-loekh shoelṭana dkl mindee dba'eyt wa 'awdet wa bṭeemoeha? Qamoodee qṭee' loekh bliboekh li'wada aha shoela? At la doegil-loekh 'al barnasha ila 'al Alaha.“
ENG: Whiles it remained, did it not remain thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thy power? How is it that thou hast conceived this thing in thy heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ. ܘܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh khananya ane khabre, npeel-leh o meet-leh. O zdoe'ta goerta npeel-laha 'al klayhy anee dshmee' lhoon mindee dhwe-leh.
ENG: And Ananias hearing these words fell down and gave up the ghost: and great fear came upon all that heard it.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܠܲܝܡܹ̈ܐ، ܟܘܼܪܡܸܟ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ، ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Haygah te-lhoon 'layme, koermikh-lhoon paghreh, o loebil-lhoon o qweerhoon.
ENG: And the young men arose and wrapped him round, and they carried him out and buried him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬ ܣܵܥܲܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar tlat sa'ate, oep bakhteh 'weeraha kad la beeda'a moodee ywa qoewima.
ENG: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܩܠܵܐ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇، ”ܗܹܐ، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh minoeha shim'oon kepa, ”baha ṭeema zoebna lawkhoon khaqla?“ joewib-laha, ”he, baha ṭeema.“
ENG: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much. And she said, Yea, for so much.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܒܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ؟ ܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܟ݂ܝ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh iloeha shim'oon kepa, ”qamoodee 'weed lawkhoon khabrawkhoon khad ljaroebe roekha dmarya? Ha, nashe dqweerhoon gawrakhy qam tar'a yna, o anee bit palṭee lakhy.“
ENG: But Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and they shall carry thee out.

ASY: ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܠܲܝܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ، ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: O har bhay 'dana npeel-laha lkis aqlateh o meet-laha. Haygah 'weerhoon 'layme o khizya-lhoon meetta, loebla-lhoon o qweera-lhoon bdipna dgawroeha.
ENG: And she fell down immediately at his feet, and gave up the ghost: and the young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.

ASY: ܘܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: O zdoe'ta goerta npeel-laha 'al klaha 'edta o 'al klayhy anee dshmee' lhoon ane.
ENG: And great fear came upon the whole church, and upon all that heard these things.

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܨܘܼܦܵܐ ܕܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ.
TRL: Ke 'awdee waw shleekhe raba neeshanqe o doemare gaw 'ama, o klayhy bkhda gana ke jam'ee waw gaw ṣoepa dshleymoon.
ENG: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܲܫܕܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܬܒܵܥܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: nashe khene le qashdiree waw litba'a 'alayhy, ila ke khaqree waw-lhoon gaw 'ama.
ENG: But of the rest durst no man join himself to them: howbeit the people magnified them;

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܙܝܸܕܹܐ ܠܡܸܢܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Raba gawre o bakhtate hoeminhoon bmaran o peesh-lhoon moezyide lminyanayhy.
ENG: and believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women;

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܫܘܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܲܚܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܒܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ، ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܹܗ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Hadkha dnashe moete-lhoon mree'e 'al shweeate o takhte, o moetbay-lhoon gaw 'aloole, deeman dshim'oon kepa 'aber wa, oep in dhawya wa, ṭilaneeteh napla wa 'al khakma minayhy.
ENG: insomuch that they even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that, as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some one of them.

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܹܐ ܒܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܣܝܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: O ke atee waw raba min mdeenate o khadirwanayhy loorishlim o maytee waw mree'e o anee deewaw joenjire broekhe ṭame, o klayhy ke payshee waw bseeme.
ENG: And there also came together the multitude from the cities round about Jerusalem, bringing sick folk, and them that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܒܲܚܸܠܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah qeem-leh goera dkahne o klayhy anee d'ameh, deewaw min see'ta dzadoeqaye, o peesh-lhoon milye bakhilanoeta.
ENG: But the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy,

ASY: ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O dweeq-lhoon lshleekhe o diryay-lhoon gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public ward.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Eena blayle malakha dmarya pteekh-leh tar'a dbeyt aseere o poelṭay-leh, o meereh ilayhy,
ENG: But an angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them out, and said,

ASY: ”ܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܘܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܘܼܢ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Zemoen o kleymoen gaw haykla, o hamzimoen l'ama klayhy ane hemizmane dkhaye.“
ENG: Go ye, and stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this Life.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܒܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ. ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon ane, zeel-lhoon, o bqaydamta 'weerhoon gaw haykla o shoere-lhoon maloepe. Kad te-lhoon goera dkahne o anee d'ameh, qre-lhoon lknoeshya o lgoerane deesrayel, o shoedirhoon lbeyt aseere dmaytee-lhoon shleekhe.
ENG: And when they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison-house to have them brought.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: Eena eeman dzeel-lhoon dakhshe la moechkhay-lhoon gaw beyt aseere. Haygah deerhoon o moekhbirhoon, bemara,
ENG: But the officers that came found them not in the prison; and they returned, and told,

ASY: ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܚܦܝܼܛܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܲܢ، ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Khze lan beyt aseere dweera bkl khpeeṭoeta, o naṭoore kilye qam tar'a, o eeman dpteekh lan, la khze lan nasha tama.“
ENG: saying, The prison-house we found shut in all safety, and the keepers standing at the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܟܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܬܘܼܚܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon ane khabre resha ddakhshe dhaykla o goerane dkahne, hwe-lhoon bshikoeta, o toekhminhoon moodee bit hawe plaṭa daha.
ENG: Now when the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were much perplexed concerning them whereunto this would grow.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܗܵܐ، ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah te-leh khad nasha o meereh, ”anee nashe ddiryay lawkhoon gaw beyt aseere, ha, kilye yna gaw haykla o maloepe l'ama.“
ENG: And there came one and told them, Behold, the men whom ye put in the prison are in the temple standing and teaching the people.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܩܘܿܕܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܪܵܓ̰ܹܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Haygah zeel-leh paqooda 'am dakhshe o moete-leh lshleekhe, eena la bkhayla, sabab bizda'a ywaw min 'ama dla rajem-lhoon.
ENG: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them, but without violence; for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܨܘܼܚܨܝܼܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dmoetay-lhoon, moeklee-ay-lhoon qam knoeshya dpayshee waw ṣoekhṣee-e byad goera dkahne.
ENG: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܦܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy, ”pqeed lan ilawkhoon bqishyoeta dla malpeetoon baha shima. Eena akhtoon milya lawkhoon oorishlim min yoelpanawkhoon, o ba'eytoon dmayteytoon 'alan dima daha nasha.“
ENG: saying, We straitly charged you not to teach in this name: and behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܨܝܸܬܲܚ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa 'am shleekhe khene o meerhoon, ”wale-ylaha dmaṣyitakh lalaha boesh zawda min dlbarnasha.
ENG: But Peter and the apostles answered and said, We must obey God rather than men.

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܲܕ ܬܠܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܩܲܝܣܵܐ.
TRL: ”Alaha dawahatan moeqim-leh leeshoo' min gaw meete, haw dakhtoon qṭeel lawkhoon, kad tle lawkhoon 'al qaysa.
ENG: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew, hanging him on a tree.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܹܗ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܘܦܵܪܘܿܩܵܐ، ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ،
TRL: ”Eena Alaha moerim-leh ileh o moetiw-leh min yameeneh, o 'weed-leh resha o parooqa, dyabil tyawoeta o poekhala dkhṭeeate leesrayel,
ENG: Him did God exalt with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Akhnan sahde ywakh lane, o hadkha-yleh oep roekha dqoedsha dyoebil-leh Alaha lanee dsham'ee ileh.“
ENG: And we are witnesses of these things; and so is the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܒ݂ܝܼܟ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܲܝ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon ane hemizmane, lweekh-lhoon bkarba o b'e-lhoon liqṭalay.
ENG: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were minded to slay them.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܓܲܡܠܝܼܐܹܝܠ، ܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܡܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܩܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah qeem-leh min gaw knoeshya khad preesha, shimeh gamleeeyl, malpana dnamoosa, o myoeqra byad kleh 'ama dyhoedaye, o pqeed-leh dpalṭee waw-lhoon shleekhe lbadar qa khda 'dana kreeta.
ENG: But there stood up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in honour of all the people, and commanded to put the men forth a little while.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ، ܘܬܲܚܡܸܢܘܼܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O meereh, ”nashe bnay eesrayel, hweymoen hishyar, o takhminoen moodee bit 'awdeetoon bane nashe,
ENG: And he said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves as touching these men, what ye are about to do.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܬܵܘܕܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܡܵܐܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܛܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ. ܘܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab min qam khad mitkha qeem-leh khad nasha shimeh tawda, o meereh boet ganeh dkhad mindee ywa. Joemi' leh bareh aykh arba'ma nashe. Haw peesh-leh qṭeela, o anee dzeel-lhoon bareh peesh-lhoon boerbize. O plaṭa dkleh aha hwe-leh baṭeela.
ENG: For before these days rose up Theudas, giving himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nought.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܓܒܸܠܝܵܝܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܟܬܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar mineh qeem-leh eehoeda gbilyaya byawmane dmaktawta, o greesh-leh bareh 'ama raba. Oep haw ṭleeq-leh, o klayhy anee dmoeṣyit-lhoon ileh peesh-lhoon boerbize.
ENG: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some of the people after him: he also perished; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܪܚܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ. ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܝܼܵܠ ܝܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ،
TRL: ”O adeea bemara ywin ilawkhoon, rkhooqoen min ane nashe o shwooqoen-lhoon dazee. In aha kheeal yan aha shoela min bnaynasha-yleh bit ate lkhrawa,
ENG: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will be overthrown:

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܦܠܵܫܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”O in min Alaha-yleh, le maṣeytoon makleytoon lane nashe, sabab bit haweytoon biplasha dalqoewl dalaha.“ o shmee' lhoon ileh.
ENG: but if it is of God, ye will not be able to overthrow them; lest haply ye be found even to be fighting against God.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܸܚܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܫܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Haygah qre-lhoon lshleekhe o mikhyay-lhoon, o pqeeday-lhoon dla hamzimee bshima deeshoo', o shiryay-lhoon.
ENG: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles unto them, they beat them and charged them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܚܸܕܝܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-lhoon shleekhe min qam knoeshya khidye sabab khsheekhe ywaw dpayshee ywaw moeslee-e boet shima deeshoo'.
ENG: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonour for the Name.

ASY: ܘܟܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܫܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܘܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: O kl yawma gaw haykla o min bayta lbayta, le shalee waw min lmaloepe o lmakroeze deeshoo' eeleh msheekha.
ENG: And every day, in the temple and at home, they ceased not to teach and to preach Jesus as the Christ.

ASY: ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܙܝܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܛܘܼܪܛܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Banee yawmane kad bizyada ywa minyana dtalmeede, ṭoerṭim-lhoon talmeede yhoedaye dke hamzimee waw lishana yawnaya 'al talmeede dke hamzimee waw lishana 'iwraya, sabab armilyatayhy le ywaw qaboele khilmate yawmaye.
ENG: Now in these days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, there arose a murmuring of the Grecian Jews against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܣܘܼܦܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah qre-lhoon tri'sar lklayhy talmeede o meerhoon ilayhy, ”le-ylaha shapeerta dshawqakh hemizman dalaha o 'awdakh khilmat lsoepre.
ENG: And the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them, and said, It is not fit that we should forsake the word of God, and serve tables.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܓܲܒܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܠܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ،
TRL: ”Akhoonwate, gabeymoen shaw'a nashe minawkhoon, anee deet boet dee-ayhy sahdoeta dmilye yna roekha o khikhmta dyabakh-lhoon aha shoela,
ENG: Look ye out therefore, brethren, from among you seven men of good report, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܲܚ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: ”O akhnan bit hawakh bkl 'dana bṣloota o bkhilmat lhemizman dalaha.“
ENG: But we will continue stedfastly in prayer, and in the ministry of the word.

ASY: ܫܦܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܠܦܪܵܟ݂ܵܪܘܿܣ، ܘܠܢܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܪ، ܘܠܛܝܼܡܘܿܢ، ܘܠܦܲܪܡܝܼܢܵܐ، ܘܠܢܝܼܩܵܠܹܐܘܿܣ، ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܩܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Shpeeraha aha hemizman qam klayhy, o goebe-lhoon lisṭapanoos, gawra milya roekha dqoedsha o haymanoeta, o lpeeleepoos, o lprakharoos, o lneeqanoor, o lṭeemoon, o lparmeena, o lneeqaleoos, noekhraya min anṭyookhy qleeba lyhoedayoeta.
ENG: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ane nashe moeklee-ay-lhoon qam shleekhe, ṣoele-lhoon o moetiw-lhoon 'alayhy eedate.
ENG: whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.

ASY: ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܙܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O prees-laha hemizman dalaha, o minyana dtalmeede zeed-leh raba gaw oorishlim, o kinsha raba min kahne bishlama ywa lhaymanoeta.
ENG: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

ASY: ܘܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܚܲܝܠܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: O isṭapanoos milya shapaqat o khayla, 'weed-leh doemare o neeshanqe goere gaw 'ama.
ENG: And Stephen, full of grace and power, wrought great wonders and signs among the people.

ASY: ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ”ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܚܹܐܪܹ̈ܐ،“ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܪ̈ܝܼܢܵܝܹܐ ܘܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ ܘܕܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܘܕܵܪܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ.
TRL: O qeem-lhoon nashe min knoeshta dke paysha qreeta ”knoeshta dbnay khere,“ o min qiwreenaye o aliksandraye, o min oekhdane dqeeleeqeea o daseea, o darshee waw 'am isṭapanoos.
ENG: But there arose certain of them that were of the synagogue called the synagogue of the Libertines, and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and Asia, disputing with Stephen.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܵܠܝܼ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena la mṣe-lhoon kalee dalqoewl dkhikhmta o roekha dbeeoeha hamzoeme ywa.
ENG: And they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spake.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah moelip-lhoon bṭishwa lkhakma nashe damree waw, ”akhnan shmee' lan aha nasha hamzoeme goedapa 'al moeshe o 'al Alaha.“
ENG: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܠܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܠܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ.
TRL: O moeshgish-lhoon l'ama o lkhwardiqne o lsapre, o te-lhoon o dweeq-lhoon lisṭapanoos, o moete-lhoon ileh qam knoeshya ddeewan.
ENG: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon him, and seized him, and brought him into the council,

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܫܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܘܼܕܵܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: O moeqim-lhoon 'aloehy sahde dagale o meerhoon, ”aha nasha le-yleh bishlaya min lhamzoeme hemizmane dgoedapa 'al aha doeka qadeeshta o 'al namoosa.
ENG: and set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak words against this holy place, and the law:

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܵܠܹܚ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܫܲܚܠܸܦ ܥܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Akhnan shmee' lan mineh bemara deeshoo' naṣraya bit talekh-laha doeka o bit shakhlip 'yade dsoepe-leh ilawkhoon moeshe.“
ENG: for we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered unto us.

ASY: ܘܚܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: O kheerhoon bisṭapanoos klayhy anee dteebe ywaw gaw knoeshya o khze-lhoon pateh aykh pata dmalakha.
ENG: And all that sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܲܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂؟“
TRL: Haygah boeqireh mineh goera dkahne, ”shareere yna ane dbemaray yna 'aloekh?“
ENG: And the high priest said, Are these things so?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ. ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܢܲܗܪ̈ܝܼܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܥܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܵܪܵܢ،
TRL: Joewib-leh isṭapanoos, ”nashe akhoonwate o babawate, shmi'moen ilee. Alaha dshoewkha peesh-leh khizya lbaban awraham kad haw gaw beyt nahreen, min qam d'amer wa bkharan,
ENG: And he said, Brethren and fathers, hearken. The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܠܐܲܬܪܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܚܙܸܝܢܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”O meereh ileh, ’shwooq latroekh o lkhizmanoekh, o ze latra dana makhziynoekh.‘
ENG: and said unto him, Get thee out of thy land, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

ASY: ”ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܟܲܠܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܚܵܪܵܢ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇،
TRL: ”O pleeṭ-leh awraham min ar'a dkaldaye, o te-leh o 'meereh bkharan. O min bar dmeet-leh baboehy tama, shoedireh ileh Alaha-laha ar'a dakhtoon idyoom bi'mara ytoon gawoeha,
ENG: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Haran: and from thence, when his father was dead, God removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell:

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܘܦܵܐ ܕܐܲܩܠܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܠܙܲܪܥܹܗ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܟܲܕ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”O la yoebil-leh ileh yartoeta gawoeha, oep la shawpa daqla. Eena qoewil-leh Alaha dbit yabil wa-laha yartoeta ileh o lzar'eh dmin bar mineh, kad bhay 'dana awraham layt wa-leh broona.
ENG: and he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on: and he promised that he would give it to him in possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.

ASY: ”ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܙܲܪܥܹܗ ܬܵܘܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܡܵܐܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Hoemzim-leh Alaha 'ameh, bemara, dbit hawe zar'eh tawtawa bar'a noekhrayta, o bit paesh 'awda, o bit paesh moelyiṣa qa arba'ma shine.
ENG: And God spake on this wise, that his seed should sojourn in a strange land, and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat them evil, four hundred years.

ASY: ”’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܹܢ ܠܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ،‘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ’ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܘܒܸܬ ܣܵܓܹܕ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’eena bit daynen loemta d'abed iloeha 'awdoeta,‘ meereh Alaha. ’min bar aha, bit paleṭ o bit saged ilee baha doeka.‘
ENG: And the nation to which they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.

ASY: ”ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܕܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ. ܘܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ، ܘܓܙܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܡܘܼܠܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O yoebil-leh lawraham wa'da dgzoerta. O awraham moelid-leh leeskhaq, o gzeereh ileh byawma dtmanya, o eeskhaq moelid-leh lya'qoow, o ya'qoow moelid-leh ltri'sar awahate.
ENG: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob the twelve patriarchs.

ASY: ”ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܘܙܘܼܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: ”O ane awahate boekhil-lhoon byawsip, o zoebinhoon ileh l'awdoeta gaw miṣreyn, eena Alaha 'ameh ywa,
ENG: And the patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt: and God was with him,

ASY: ”ܘܦܘܼܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܒܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܸܪܥܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ ܘܥܲܠ ܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ،
TRL: ”O poeṣe-leh ileh min klayhy oelṣanoehy, o yoebil-leh ileh shapaqat o khikhmta b'ayne dpir'oon malka dmiṣreyn, o 'weed-leh ileh mdabrana 'al klaha miṣreyn o 'al kleh bayteh,
ENG: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

ASY: ”ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ ܘܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ ܘܒܟܢܲܥܢ، ܘܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hwe-leh kipna o oelṣana goera bklaha ar'a dmiṣreyn o bkna'n, o awahatan la moechikh-lhoon mekhoelta.
ENG: Now there came a famine over all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܲܚܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”Eeman dshmee' leh ya'qoow deet wa dakhla gaw miṣreyn, shoedray-leh awahatan ltama gaha qamayta,
ENG: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent forth our fathers the first time.

ASY: ”ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ، ܡܘܼܕܸܥܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ. ܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܠܦܸܪܥܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Gaha dtartey, moedi'a-leh yawsip ganeh lakhoonwateh. Oep bayta dyawsip peesh-leh dee'a lpir'oon.
ENG: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s race became manifest unto Pharaoh.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܫܲܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܘܚܲܡܸܫ ܓܵܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar aha, shoedireh yawsip o moete-leh lbaboehy ya'qoow o lklayhy khizmanoehy, shaw'ee o khamish ganate.
ENG: And Joseph sent, and called to him Jacob his father, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.

ASY: ”ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܠܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈.
TRL: ”O ṣle-leh ya'qoow lmiṣreyn o meet-leh tama, haw o oep awahatan.
ENG: And Jacob went down into Egypt; and he died, himself, and our fathers;

ASY: ”ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪ̈ܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܠܫܟܹܝܡ، ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܡܘܿܪ ܒܫܟܹܝܡ.
TRL: ”O paghrayhy peesh-lhoon shoenye lshkeym, moetbe gaw qawra dzweeneh ywa awraham bzoeze dsema min bnoone dkhmoor bshkeym.
ENG: and they were carried over unto Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver of the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܲܡܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܹܗ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܙܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ،
TRL: ”O kad qoerbinaha 'dana dtamim wa Alaha qawleh d'weed-leh 'am awraham, zeed-leh 'ama dee-an raba gaw miṣreyn,
ENG: But as the time of the promise drew nigh, which God vouchsafed unto Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

ASY: ”ܗܲܠ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܘܣܸܦ.
TRL: ”Hal dqeem-leh khad malka khena 'al miṣreyn, aynee dla dee' leh lyawsip.
ENG: till there arose another king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܥܘܼܠܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܲܢ، ܘܡܘܼܠܝܸܨ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܪܲܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܲܠܘܼܕܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܕܡܵܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: ”Aha malka 'oelde-leh l'aman, o moelyiṣ-leh lawahatan, o pqeed-leh drapee waw lyaloedayhy dmaytee waw.
ENG: The same dealt subtilly with our race, and evil entreated our fathers, that they should cast out their babes to the end they might not live.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܘܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: ”Bhay 'dana peesh-leh leeda moeshe, o shapeera ywa qam Alaha, o qa mitkha dtlata yarkhe goerwis-leh gaw bayta dbaboehy.
ENG: At which season Moses was born, and was exceeding fair; and he was nourished three months in his father’s house:

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܦܝܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܦܸܪܥܘܿܢ، ܘܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: ”O eeman dpeesh-leh roepya, shqeel-laha ileh brata dpir'oon, o goerwis-laha ileh aykh broona dganoeha.
ENG: and when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

ASY: ”ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܠܦܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܨܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”O peesh-leh moelpa moeshe bklaha khikhmta dmiṣraye, o khaylana ywa bhemizmanoehy o bpoelkhanoehy.
ENG: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians; and he was mighty in his words and works.

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ ܕܬܵܦܹܩ ܒܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: ”O eeman dhwe-leh moeshe arb'ee shine, qṭee' leh blibeh dtapeq bakhoonwateh bnay eesrayel.
ENG: But when he was well-nigh forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.

ASY: ”ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܵܐ ܒܚܲܕ ܡܸܨܪܵܝܵܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܨܹܗ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܥܠܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܵܐ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܸܨܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Khze-leh khad minayhy pyasha moelyiṣa bkhad miṣraya, qeem-leh lkhaṣeh o shqeel-leh toe'la dhaw moelyiṣa o qṭeel-leh lmiṣraya.
ENG: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him that was oppressed, smiting the Egyptian:

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Moeshe khsheew-leh dakhoonwateh bit parmee waw dalaha beedeh bit pariq wa-lhoon. Eena la poerme-lhoon.
ENG: and he supposed that his brethren understood how that God by his hand was giving them deliverance; but they understood not.

ASY: ”ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܒܸܦܠܵܫܵܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ. ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܣܲܙܓܘܼܪܲܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܦܠܵܫܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”Byawma khena, moeshe khze-leh trey nashe min bnay eesrayel biplasha m'oedale. B'e-leh lsazgoeray, bemara, ’ya nashe, akhoonwate ytoon akhtoon, qamoodee biplasha ytoon khad 'am haw khena?‘
ENG: And the day following he appeared unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܪܙܸܦ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Eena haw deewa biṭlama lhaw khena khoerzip-leh ileh o meereh, ’manee qam 'abed-loekh 'alan goera o dayana?
ENG: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

ASY: ”’ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܩܵܛܠܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܬܸܡܵܠܝ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܡܸܨܪܵܝܵܐ؟‘
TRL: ”’ba'eyt dqaṭlet-lee aykh dtimaly qṭeel-loekh lmiṣraya?‘
ENG: Wouldest thou kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian yesterday?

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ، ܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܡܸܕܝܲܢ، ܘܚܝܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܘܩܲܡ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dshmee' leh moeshe ane khabre, 'reeq-leh latra dmidyan, o khye-leh tama aykh khad noekhraya o qam hawe-leh trey bnoone.
ENG: And Moses fled at this saying, and became a sojourner in the land of Midian, where he begat two sons.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܣܲܢܝܵܐ، ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܣܝܼܢܲܝ.
TRL: ”Min bar dhwe-leh tama arb'ee shine, peesh-leh khizya ileh malakha gaw-laha dnoera bsanya, gaw bareea qoerba lṭoera dseenay.
ENG: And when forty years were fulfilled, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

ASY: ”ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”'oejib-leh moeshe bmindee dkhze-leh. Eeman dqoerbineh dkhaze moodee ywa, shmee' leh qala dmarya,
ENG: And when Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold, there came a voice of the Lord,

ASY: ”’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܘܕܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂.‘ ܘܪܓܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”’ana ywin Alaha dawahatoekh, Alaha dawraham o deeskhaq o dya'qoow.‘ o rgeed-leh moeshe, o la qoeshdireh likhyara bkhizwa.
ENG: I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob. And Moses trembled, and durst not behold.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ’ܫܲܠܸܚ ܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: ”meereh ileh Marya, ’shalikh ṣawloekh min aqlatoekh, sabab ar'a dkilya ywit 'aloeha qadeeshta-ylaha.
ENG: And the Lord said unto him, Loose the shoes from thy feet: for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.

ASY: ”’ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܬܵܢܲܚܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܲܨܹܝܢܗܘܿܢ. ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܬܵܐ، ܫܲܕܪܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܠܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ.‘
TRL: ”’shareeraeet khzaya khze-lee oelṣana d'amee gaw miṣreyn, o shmee' lee tanakhyatayhy, o ṣle-lee dpaṣeynhoon. O adeea ta, shadrinoekh lmiṣreyn.‘
ENG: I have surely seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning, and I am come down to deliver them: and now come, I will send thee into Egypt.

ASY: ”ܗܲܪ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܕܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ؟‘ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܘܦܵܪܘܿܩܵܐ، ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܣܲܢܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Har-laha moeshe, dmoesle-lhoon ileh, bemara, ’manee qam 'abed-loekh 'alan goera o dayana?‘ shoedireh ilayhy Alaha resha o parooqa, byad malakha dpeesh-leh khizya ileh bsanya.
ENG: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? him hath God sent to be both a ruler and a deliverer with the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܣܘܿܦ، ܘܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: ”Aha poelṭay-leh min miṣreyn, o 'weed-leh doemare o neeshanqe gaw miṣreyn, o byama dsoop, o arb'ee shine gaw bareea.
ENG: This man led them forth, having wrought wonders and signs in Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ’ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: ”Aha-yleh moeshe, haw dmeereh lbnay eesrayel, ’Alaha bit shadirawkhoon nweea maykh deeee min gaw akhoonwatawkhoon.‘
ENG: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall God raise up unto you from among your brethren, like unto me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܥܲܡ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܣܝܼܢܲܝ، ܘܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: ”Aha jmee' leh 'am awahatan gaw bareea, o 'am malakha, haw dhoemzim-leh 'ameh gaw ṭoera dseenay, o qoebil-leh hemizmane dkhaye dsoepyay-leh ilan.
ENG: This is he that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sinai, and with our fathers: who received living oracles to give unto us:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܠܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ.
TRL: ”Eena awahatan la shmee' lhoon ileh, ila shweeq-lhoon ileh o blibayhy deerhoon lmiṣreyn.
ENG: to whom our fathers would not be obedient, but thrust him from them, and turned back in their hearts unto Egypt,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܗܪܘܿܢ، ’ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”meerhoon lahroon, ’'wood ilan alahe dazee qaman, sabab aha moeshe dpoeliṭ-leh ilan min miṣreyn, le ywakh beeda'a moodee hwe-leh ileh.‘
ENG: saying unto Aaron, Make us gods which shall go before us: for as for this Moses, which led us forth out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

ASY: ”ܬܘܼܪܸܨ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܨܲܠܡܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܵܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: ”Toeriṣ-lhoon ṣalma dmoeja banee yawmane, o dweekh-lhoon diwkhe ileh, o 'weed-lhoon boesama bpoelkhana deedatayhy.
ENG: And they made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ: ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܡܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ، ܒܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ؟
TRL: ”Eena pteel-leh Alaha o soepyay-leh dsaghdee lkhaylawate dshmaya, aykh deeleh kteewa bktawa dnwee-e: moete lawkhoon ilee haywane preeme yan diwkhe, bmitkha darb'ee shine gaw bareea, ya beyt eesrayel?
ENG: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, Did ye offer unto me slain beasts and sacrifices Forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܿܡ، ܘܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܪܦܵܢ، ܨܲܠܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܪܕܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܹܠ.
TRL: ”Moerim lawkhoon mashkna dmalkoom, o kawkhwa dalaha rpan, ṣalme d'weed lawkhoon o sgheed lawkhoon ilayhy. Boet aha bit ṭardenawkhoon lhaw geba khena dbabel.
ENG: And ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, And the star of the god Rephan, The figures which ye made to worship them: And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

ASY: ”ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܕܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ. ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܘܼܪܨܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܬܲܪܸܨ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Awahatan eet waw-lhoon 'amayhy mashkna dsahdoeta gaw bareea. Peesha ywa toerṣa aykh dpqeed-leh Alaha lmoeshe dtariṣ wa-leh, bdmoeta dmoekhze-leh ileh.
ENG: Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he appointed who spake unto Moses, that he should make it according to the figure that he had seen.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܲܪ ܢܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܪܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ،
TRL: ”Moe'birhoon awahatan-laha mashkna 'amayhy b'dana deeshoo' bar noon, eeman dshqeel-lhoon lar'a min imwate dṭreeday-leh Alaha min qamayhy, o peesh-leh tama hal yawmane ddaweed,
ENG: Which also our fathers, in their turn, brought in with Joshua when they entered on the possession of the nations, which God thrust out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܕܒܵܢܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂.
TRL: ”Haw dmoechikh-leh shapaqat qam Alaha, o ṭleeb-leh dbane wa khad bayta qa Alaha dya'qoow.
ENG: who found favour in the sight of God, and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܠܹܝܡܘܿܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena shleymoon eewa dbne-leh ileh bayta.
ENG: But Solomon built him a house.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܡܹܪ ܓܵܘ ܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ:
TRL: ”Eena 'ilaya le 'amer gaw bate 'weede beedate dbarnasha, aykh dmeereh nweea:
ENG: Howbeit the Most High dwelleth not in houses made with hands; as saith the prophet,

ASY: ’ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ”ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܬܪܘܿܢܘܿܣܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܝܼ̈، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܢܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ؟ ܝܲܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܢܝܵܚܬܝܼ؟
TRL: ’bemara-yleh Marya, ”shmaya troonoosee-ylaha, o ar'a koewsha tkhoot aqlatee, moodee bayta bit baneytoon ilee? Yan ayka-ylaha doeka dnyakhtee?
ENG: The heaven is my throne, And the earth the footstool of my feet: What manner of house will ye build me? saith the Lord: Or what is the place of my rest?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܬܲܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟“‘
TRL: ”Le-ylaha eedee 'weedtay klayhy ane?“‘
ENG: Did not my hand make all these things?

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܩܕܵܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܒܠܸܒܵܐ ܘܒܢܵܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܝܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ya qdalayhy qishya, o la gzeere bliba o bnatyate, oep akhtoon aykh awahatawkhoon eetoon, bkl 'dana ke qaymeetoon dalqoewl droekha dqoedsha.
ENG: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do ye.

ASY: ”ܠܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܟܘܼܡܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Laynee min nwee-e la koemirhoon awahatawkhoon? Qṭeel-lhoon oep lanee nwee-e dqamayta noebe-lhoon boet tayta dzadeeqa, haw dakhtoon adeea soepe lawkhoon o qṭeel lawkhoon.
ENG: Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute? and they killed them which shewed before of the coming of the Righteous One; of whom ye have now become betrayers and murderers;

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Akhtoon dqoebil lawkhoon namoosa byad poeqdana dmalake, la nṭeerawkhoon lnamoosa.“
ENG: ye who received the law as it was ordained by angels, and kept it not.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܚܘܼܪܚܸܟ̃ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܹܟܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ.
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon ane hemizmane, mle-lhoon karba blibayhy o khoerkhich-lhoon kekayhy lisṭapanoos.
ENG: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܟܲܕ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: O haw kad milya roekha dqoedsha, kheereh lshmaya o khze-leh shoewkha dalaha, o eeshoo' kilya min yameena dalaha,
ENG: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܡܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: O meereh, ”ha bikhzaya ywin shmaye pteekhe, o broona dnasha kilya min yameena dalaha.“
ENG: and said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܬܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܨܦܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena anee moeqwikh-lhoon bqala rama, o cheem-lhoon natyatayhy, o ṣpeekh-lhoon 'aloehy klayhy m'oedale.
ENG: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed upon him with one accord;

ASY: ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܪܓ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܘܪ̈ܵܓ̰ܡܵܢܹܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܓ̰ܘܲܢܩܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ.
TRL: Poeliṭ-lhoon ileh lbadar min mdeeta o rjeem-lhoon ileh. O rajmane moetiw-lhoon joelayhy lkis aqlate dkhad jwanqa shimeh shaool.
ENG: and they cast him out of the city, and stoned him: and the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܪܓ̰ܵܡܹܗ، ܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܘܼܚܝܼ.“
TRL: Kad anee birjameh, ṣoele-leh isṭapanoos, ”Maran eeshoo', qabil roekhee.“
ENG: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon the Lord, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

ASY: ܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ”ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܠܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ.“ ܘܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Breek-leh o moeqwikh-leh bqala rama, ”Maran, la dawqet ilayhy aha khṭeeta.“ o kad meereh aha, dmeekh-leh.
ENG: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

ASY: ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܕܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ. ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shaool basma wa-leh bqiṭla disṭapanoos. O hwe-leh bhaw yawma rdoepya goera 'al 'edta dgaw oorishlim, o klayhy peesh-lhoon boerbize gaw matwate deehoed o shamreyn, shwooq min shleekhe.
ENG: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And there arose on that day a great persecution against the church which was in Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܥܙܝܼ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: nashe mhoemne qweerhoon lisṭapanoos, o 'weed-lhoon ta'zee goerta 'aloehy.
ENG: And devout men buried Stephen, and made great lamentation over him.

ASY: ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܓܲܪܓܘܼܫܹܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܕܪܵܝܲܝ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O shaool shoere-leh kamoere l'edta, bi'wara min bayta lbayta, gargoeshe gawre o bakhtate, o bidrayay gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: But Saul laid waste the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed them to prison.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Anee dpeesh-lhoon boerbize ke makrizee waw hemizman dalaha bkl doeka dazee waw.
ENG: They therefore that were scattered abroad went about preaching the word.

ASY: ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ، ܘܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Ṣle-leh peeleepoos lmdeeta dshamreyn, o moekriz-leh tama boet msheekha.
ENG: And Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed unto them the Christ.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܒܚܲܕ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: Eeman dkinshe shmee' lhoon lpeeleepoos o khze-lhoon neeshanqe dbi'wada ywa, bkhad liba moeṣyit-lhoon ileh,
ENG: And the multitudes gave heed with one accord unto the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard, and saw the signs which he did.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ. ܐܘܼܦ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܦܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܸܠܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܣܝܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab raba deet waw bee-ayhy roekhe ṭame maqwikhee waw bqala rama o palṭee waw minayhy. Oep raba shpeele o shile peesh-lhoon bseeme.
ENG: For from many of those which had unclean spirits, they came out, crying with a loud voice: and many that were palsied, and that were lame, were healed.

ASY: ܘܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: O khadoeta goerta hwe-laha gaw hay mdeeta.
ENG: And there was much joy in that city.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܣܝܼܡܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܸܪ̈ܫܹܐ، ܘܡܲܥܓ̰ܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha gaw hay mdeeta shimeh seemoon dke 'abed wa khirshe, o ma'jib wa lnashe dshamreyn kad bemara boet ganeh dkhad nasha goera ywa.
ENG: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, which beforetime in the city used sorcery, and amazed the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
