TRL: O ke maṣyitee waw 'aloehy klayhy, goera o z'oora, o amree waw daha-yleh khayla dalaha, haw khayla dke paesh qirya goera.
ENG: to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is that power of God which is called Great.

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܬܵܒܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܚܸܪ̈ܫܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: O ke tab'ee waw 'aloehy sabab qa khad zawna yareekha 'oejbe ywaw bkhirshoehy.
ENG: And they gave heed to him, because that of long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dhoeminhoon lpeeleepoos deewa makroeze boet malkoeta dalaha o boet shima dmaran eeshoo' msheekha, 'meed-lhoon gawre o bakhtate.
ENG: But when they believed Philip preaching good tidings concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܣܝܼܡܘܿܢ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ، ܘܟܹܐ ܬܵܒܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܲܓ̰ܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Oep seemoon hoemineh o 'meed-leh, o ke tabe' wa lpeeleepoos, o ke 'ajib wa bneeshanqe o bkhayle goere dkhaze wa.
ENG: And Simon also himself believed: and being baptized, he continued with Philip; and beholding signs and great miracles wrought, he was amazed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon shleekhe dgaw oorishlim doep shamreyn qoebil-laha hemizman dalaha, shoedirhoon lkis layhy shim'oon kepa o yookhanan.
ENG: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:

ASY: ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ،
TRL: Mṭe-lhoon ltama o ṣoele-lhoon ṣloota 'alayhy dqablee waw roekha dqoedsha,
ENG: who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܨܸܠܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab hesh le ywa ṣilya 'al oep khad minayhy, eena akhchee 'meede ywaw bshima dmaran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: for as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they had been baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah shim'oon kepa o yookhanan moetiw-lhoon 'alayhy eedate, o qoebil-lhoon roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: Then laid they their hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܝܼܡܘܿܢ ܕܒܡܲܬܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh seemoon dbmatawta deedate dshleekhe pyasha ywa yoewa roekha dqoedsha, moeqriw-leh ilayhy zoeze o meereh,
ENG: Now when Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

ASY: ”ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Haloen oep ilee aha shoelṭana, dhaw dmatbin eedee 'aloehy qabil roekha dqoedsha.“
ENG: saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܙܘܼܙܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܢܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”zoezoekh azee 'amoekh lawdana, sabab bikhshawa ywit mawhawta dalaha bzoeze ke paysha qneeta.
ENG: But Peter said unto him, Thy silver perish with thee, because thou hast thought to obtain the gift of God with money.

ASY: ”ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Layt-loekh sahma oep la shareekoeta baha shoela, sabab liboekh le-yleh troeṣa qam Alaha.
ENG: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right before God.

ASY: ”ܒܲܣ ܬܲܘܸܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܛܠܘܿܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܦܲܚܸܠ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: ”Bas tawib min aha beeshoetoekh, o ṭloob min Marya, qawma dpakhil iloekh aha khoeshawa dliboekh,
ENG: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray the Lord, if perhaps the thought of thy heart shall be forgiven thee.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܥܵܘܠܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab bikhzaya ywin dmilya ywit mareeroeta, o seera ywit b'awla.“
ENG: For I see that thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܣܝܼܡܘܿܢ، ”ܛܠܘܿܒܘܼܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܓܹܒܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh seemoon, ”ṭlooboen akhtoon mgebee min Marya dla ate 'alee mindee min ane dmeerawkhoon.“
ENG: And Simon answered and said, Pray ye for me to the Lord, that none of the things which ye have spoken come upon me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܫܚܸܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܫܚܘܼܕܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܡܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: Haygah min bar dshim'oon kepa o yookhanan sheed-lhoon o moeshkhid-lhoon hemizman dmarya, deerhoon loorishlim kad mashkhoede gaw raba matwate dshamraye.
ENG: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.

ASY: ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ، ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ، ܕܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܓܵܙܵܐ.“
TRL: Hoemzim-leh malakha dmarya 'am peeleepoos, bemara, ”qoem ze ltaymna, boerkha dbareea, dbiṣlaya-ylaha min oorishlim lgaza.“
ENG: But an angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza: the same is desert.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܒܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܗܲܝܡܢܵܐ ܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ، ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܘܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܓܲܙܵܐ ܕܩܲܢܕܵܩ ܡܲܠܟܬܵܐ ܕܟܘܼܫܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: O zeel-leh peeleepoos, o boerkheh khze-leh khad mhaymna koeshaya, shaleeṭa o mdabrana dbeyt gaza dqandaq malkta dkoeshaye. Aha teea ywa lisghada gaw oorishlim.
ENG: And he arose and went: and behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem for to worship;

ASY: ܒܸܕܝܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܬܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܪܟܲܒ݂ܬܹܗ، ܘܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Bidyara ywa latreh gaw markawteh, o biqraya ywa min ktawa desha'ya nweea.
ENG: and he was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܩܲܪܒܸܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܪܟܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܝܼ ܒܕܸܦܢܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: O meereh roekha lpeeleepoos, ”qarbin-laha markawta o hwee bdipnoeha.“
ENG: And the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

ASY: ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܲܪܟܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ. ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Rkheeṭ-leh peeleepoos lkis markawta, o shmee' leh lhaw nasha biqraya min esha'ya nweea. Boeqireh mineh peeleepoos, ”parmoeye ywit moodee ywit biqraya?“
ENG: And Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܢ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܫܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ؟“ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܕܐܵܣܹܩ ܘܝܵܬܹܒ݂ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: O haw joewib-leh, ”dakhee maṣeyn parmeyn in nasha la pashiq-leh ilee?“ o ṭleeb-leh min peeleepoos daseq o yatew 'ameh.
ENG: And he said, How can I, except some one shall guide me? And he besought Philip to come up and sit with him.

ASY: ܘܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܣܘܿܩܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܸܪܒܵܐ ܠܦܪܵܡܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܘܼܒܠܵܐ، ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܹܐܪܵܐ ܫܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܓܵܪܥܵܢܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ.
TRL: O koeshaya biqraya ywa min pasooqa dbemara-yleh: aykh 'irba lpramta peesh-leh loebla, o aykh pera shteeqa qam gar'ana, hadkha la pteekh-leh poemeh.
ENG: Now the place of the scripture which he was reading was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; And as a lamb before his shearer is dumb, So he openeth not his mouth:

ASY: ܒܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܕܵܘܪܹܗ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܩܹܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܩܝܼܠܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Bmakeekhoeteh, la 'weed-lhoon deewan shareerta 'aloehy, o boet dawreh manee bit haqe? Sabab khayoehy peesh-lhoon shqeele min ar'a.
ENG: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: His generation who shall declare? For his life is taken from the earth.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: Boeqireh koeshaya min peeleepoos, ”moor ilee, parpoele ywin, boet manee-yleh hamzoeme nweea, boet ganeh yan boet khad khena?“
ENG: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other?

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܣܘܿܩܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Haygah shoere-leh peeleepoos min aha pasooqa makroeze ileh boet eeshoo'.
ENG: And Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ، ”ܗܵܐ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܡܲܟܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad anee bezala ywaw boerkha, mṭe-lhoon lkhda doeka deet wa meea. meereh haw koeshaya, ”ha meea lakha, eet maklayta dla payshen 'meeda?“
ENG: And as they went on the way, they came unto a certain water; and the eunuch saith, Behold, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂، ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܥܡܝܼܕܵܐ.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh peeleepoos, ”in hamoene ywit min kleh liboekh, maṣeyt payshet 'meeda.“ joewib-leh, ”ana hamoene ywin deeshoo' msheekha broona dalaha-yleh.“
ENG: And Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” And he replied, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”

ASY: ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܪܟܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܸܪܘܲܝܗܝ ܠܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܥܡܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ.
TRL: Pqeed-leh dkalya wa markawta, o ṣle-lhoon tirwayhy lmeea, peeleepoos o oep haw koeshaya, o moe'mid-leh ileh peeleepoos.
ENG: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܢܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܘܼܫܵܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dpleeṭ-lhoon min meea, roekha dmarya jneew-leh lpeeleepoos, o khena la khze-leh ileh koeshaya, eena zeel-leh boerkheh bikhdaya.
ENG: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip; and the eunuch saw him no more, for he went on his way rejoicing.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܙܘܿܛܘܿܣ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O peeleepoos peesh-leh khizya gaw azooṭoos, o min tama bikhdara ywa o makroeze gaw klayhy mdeenate hal dte-leh lqesarya.
ENG: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached the gospel to all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.

ASY: ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܗܹܫ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܓܸܙܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: O shaool hesh milya gizme o qiṭla 'al talmeede dmaran, te-leh lkis goera dkahne,
ENG: But Saul, yet breathing threatening and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,

ASY: ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܕܐܸܢ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: O ṭleeb-leh mineh igarta qa knoeshyate dgaw darmsooq, din machikh wa nashe yan bakhtate deewaw min aha oerkha, mayte wa-lhoon seere loorishlim.
ENG: and asked of him letters to Damascus unto the synagogues, that if he found any that were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܘܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܙܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Kad bezala ywa, mṭe-leh qoerba ldarmsooq, o minshiltane zreeq-leh 'aloehy bahra min shmaya.
ENG: And as he journeyed, it came to pass that he drew nigh unto Damascus: and suddenly there shone round about him a light out of heaven:

ASY: ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟“
TRL: O npeel-leh 'al ar'a, o shmee' leh qala min shmaya, bemara, ”shaool, shaool, qamoodee kamoeree ywit?“
ENG: and he fell upon the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ”ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܡܵܪܝܼ؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ.
TRL: Joewib-leh shaool, ”manee ywit, maree?“ o haw joewib-leh, ”ana ywin eeshoo', haw dat kamoereh ywit.
ENG: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest:

ASY: ”ܩܘܼܡ ܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ.“
TRL: ”Qoem 'woor lmdeeta o bit paesh meera iloekh moodee wale-ylaha d'awdet.“
ENG: but rise, and enter into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܬܝܼܩܹܐ، ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: nashe dbezala ywaw 'am shaool kle-lhoon shteeqe, shmee' lhoon qala eena nasha la khze-lhoon.
ENG: And the men that journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing the voice, but beholding no man.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ. ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ.
TRL: Qeem-leh shaool min ar'a, 'aynoehy pteekhe eena la bikhzaya. Dweeq-lhoon beedeh o moe'birhoon ileh ldarmsooq.
ENG: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw nothing; and they led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

ASY: ܘܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O tlata yawmane le khaze wa, o la kheel-leh o la shte-leh.
ENG: And he was three days without sight, and did neither eat nor drink.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ ܚܲܕ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ. ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ.“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܡܵܪܝܼ.“
TRL: Eet wa gaw darmsooq khad talmeeda shimeh khananya. Hoemzim-leh Marya 'ameh bkhizwa o meereh, ”khananya.“ o haw joewib-leh, ”he, maree.“
ENG: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and the Lord said unto him in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here, Lord.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܥܵܠܘܿܠܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܘܒܲܩܸܪ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܵܪܣܘܿܣ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.
TRL: meereh Maran ileh, ”qoem ze l'aloola dpyasha-yleh qirya troeṣa, o 'woor lbayta deehoeda, o baqir 'al khad nasha shimeh shaool min ṭarsoos, sabab ha ṣaloeye-yleh ṣloota.
ENG: And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus: for behold, he prayeth;

ASY: ”ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܲܬܘܼܒܹܐ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ.“
TRL: ”O khze-leh shaool bkhizwa khad nasha shimeh khananya bi'wara lkis-leh o matoebe eedeh 'aloehy dkhaze.“
ENG: and he hath seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܫܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܕܟܡܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Eena khananya joewib-leh, ”maree, shmee'a ywin raba boet aha nasha, dkma beeshate 'weeda-yleh 'al qadeeshoekh gaw oorishlim.
ENG: But Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard from many of this man, how much evil he did to thy saints at Jerusalem:

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܣܹܪ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Adeea lakha-yleh bshoelṭana min goera dkahne daser lklayhy anee dqaree bshimoekh.“
ENG: and here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call upon thy name.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ، ”ܙܹܠ݇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܕܠܲܒܸܠ ܫܸܡܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ.
TRL: Eena Marya meereh lkhananya, ”ze, sabab mana goebya-yleh ilee, dlabil shimee gaw imwate o malke o bnay eesrayel.
ENG: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles and kings, and the children of Israel:

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܸܝܢܹܗ ܕܟܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Ana bit makhziyneh dkma bit janjir boet shimee.“
ENG: for I will shew him how many things he must suffer for my name’s sake.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ، ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ، ܘܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Haygah zeel-leh khananya o 'weereh lbayta, o moetiw-leh eeda 'aloehy o meereh, ”shaool akhoona, Maran, deeleh eeshoo', dpeesh-leh khizya iloekh boerkha eeman dbetaya ywit wa lakha, haw bganeh shoedireh ilee dkhazeyt mindrish, o payshet milya min roekha dqoedsha.“
ENG: And Ananias departed, and entered into the house; and laying his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus, who appeared unto thee in the way which thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mayest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܩܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ. ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Har bhay 'dana npeel-leh min 'aynoehy mindee aykh qalpe. Khze-leh mindrish, o qeem-leh o 'meed-leh.
ENG: And straightway there fell from his eyes as it were scales, and he received his sight; and he arose and was baptized;

ASY: ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܘܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܗ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ.
TRL: Shqeel-leh mekhoelta o kheel-leh, o khoelineh. Peesh-leh khakma yawmane lkis anee talmeede deewaw gaw darmsooq.
ENG: and he took food and was strengthened. And he was certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah shoere-leh shaool makroeze gaw knoeshyate boet eeshoo', dhaw eeleh broona dalaha.
ENG: And straightway in the synagogues he proclaimed Jesus, that he is the Son of God.

ASY: ܘܥܲܓ̰ܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܟܲܡܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ؟ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܕܐܵܣܹܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: O 'ajbee waw klayhy anee dsham'ee waw-leh, o amree waw, ”le-yleh aha haw dke kamir wa lanee dqaree waw baha shima gaw oorishlim? O le-yleh boet aha adeea lakha, daserhoon o labil-lhoon lkis goerane dkahne?“
ENG: And all that heard him were amazed, and said, Is not this he that in Jerusalem made havock of them which called on this name? and he had come hither for this intent, that he might bring them bound before the chief priests.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܢܵܐ، ܘܡܲܫܥܸܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܡܲܕܘܼܥܲܝ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Eena shaool boesh zawda paesh wa khoelina, o mash'ish wa lyhoedaye 'amrane dgaw darmsooq, madoe'ay daha eeshoo' eeleh msheekha.
ENG: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar khakma yawmane tama, 'weed-lhoon yhoedaye boeṣa 'aloehy dqaṭlee waw-leh.
ENG: And when many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel together to kill him:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܒܘܼܨܲܝܗܝ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena shaool dee' leh bboeṣayhy. O anee naṭree waw tar'ane dmdeeta byawma o blayle dqaṭlee waw-leh.
ENG: but their plot became known to Saul. And they watched the gates also day and night that they might kill him:

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܸܪܛܵܠܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܪܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܕܵܐ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ.
TRL: Haygah talmeede moetiw-lhoon ileh gaw qirṭala o moeshriṭ-lhoon min goeda blayle.
ENG: but his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܘܘܼܓܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: zeel-leh shaool loorishlim, o b'e-leh lzawoege 'am talmeede, eena klayhy zad'ee waw mineh, sabab le ywaw hamoene dtalmeeda ywa.
ENG: And when he was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: and they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܹܗ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena barnwa shqeel-leh o moete-leh lkis shleekhe o hoeqe-leh ilayhy dakhee shaool boerkheh ldarmsooq khze-leh lmarya, o dakhee Marya hoemzim-leh 'ameh, o dakhee haw gaw darmsooq hoemzim-leh dla zdoe'ta bshima dmarya.
ENG: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how at Damascus he had preached boldly in the name of Jesus.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܘܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O peesh-leh shaool 'amayhy, bi'wara o biplaṭa gaw oorishlim, hamzoeme dla zdoe'ta bshima dmarya.
ENG: And he was with them going in and going out at Jerusalem,

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ.
TRL: O ke daresh wa o ke hamzim wa 'am yhoedaye, anee dke hamzimee waw lishana yawnaya, eena anee ba'ee waw liqṭaleh.
ENG: preaching boldly in the name of the Lord: and he spake and disputed against the Grecian Jews; but they went about to kill him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܛܵܪܣܘܿܣ.
TRL: Eeman ddee' lhoon akhoonwate, loebil-lhoon ileh lqesarya, o min tama shoedirhoon ileh lṭarsoos.
ENG: And when the brethren knew it, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.

ASY: ܘܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܒܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܒܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ، ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܒܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܢܬܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܘܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܒܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O 'edta dbklaha eehoed o bgleela o bshamreyn bi'mara ywa bshlama, pyasha bneeta o khoelinta broekha dqoedsha, o zeed-laha kad bikhaya bzdoe'ta dmarya.
ENG: So the church throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, being edified; and, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, was multiplied.

ASY: ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܬܵܦܹܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܠܘܿܕ.
TRL: Bikhdara ywa shim'oon kepa gaw mdeenate, o ṣle-leh dtapeq wa bmhoemne dgaw lood.
ENG: And it came to pass, as Peter went throughout all parts, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.

ASY: ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܲܢܝܼܵܣ، ܕܢܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܬܡܵܢܹܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O khze-leh tama khad nasha shpeela shimeh aneeas, dnpeela ywa bshweeta qa tmane shine.
ENG: And there he found a certain man named AEneas, which had kept his bed eight years; for he was palsied.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢܝܼܵܣ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܲܣܘܼܡܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܩܘܼܡ ܘܫܩܘܿܠ ܫܘܝܼܬܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ileh shim'oon kepa, ”aneeas, eeshoo' msheekha basoemoekh eeleh, qoem o shqool shweetoekh.“ o har bhay 'dana qeem-leh.
ENG: And Peter said unto him, AEneas, Jesus Christ healeth thee: arise, and make thy bed. And straightway he arose.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܠܘܿܕ ܘܓܵܘ ܣܵܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Klayhy anee dbikhaya ywaw gaw lood o gaw saroona khze-lhoon ileh, o hoeminhoon bmarya.
ENG: And all that dwelt at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܛܒ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ، ܕܦܘܼܫܵܩܘܼܗ̇ ܝܼܠܹܗ ”ܕܘܿܪܟܵܣ.“ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khda talmeedta gaw yoope shimoeha ṭweeta, dpoeshaqoeha eeleh ”doorkas.“ aha eet wa-laha raba poelkhane ṭabe o ke 'awda wa irwane.
ENG: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܪܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇. ܚܝܼܦܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana mree' laha o meet-laha. Kheepa-lhoon o moetwa-lhoon gaw 'ileeta.
ENG: And it came to pass in those days, that she fell sick, and died: and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper chamber.

ASY: ܠܘܿܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܝܘܿܦܹܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܘܿܕ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܲܪܩܲܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Lood qoerba ywa lyoope. Eeman dshmee' lhoon talmeede dshim'oon kepa gaw lood eewa, shoedirhoon lkis-leh trey nashe biṭlaba mineh date lkis layhy dla 'arqalta.
ENG: And as Lydda was nigh unto Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men unto him, entreating him, Delay not to come on unto us.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܐܣܸܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ. ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܘܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܨܘܼܕܪ̈ܵܬܹܐ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܛܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܒ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܚܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Qeem-leh shim'oon kepa o zeel-leh 'amayhy. Eeman dmṭe-leh, moesiq-lhoon ileh l'ileeta. Klayhy armilyate kle-lhoon lkhadirwanoehy bibkhaya o makhzoeye ṣoedrate o joele dke khayṭa wa-lhoon ṭweeta kad khayta ywa 'amayhy.
ENG: And Peter arose and went with them. And when he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ، ܘܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ. ܘܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܠܲܕܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܛܒ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܡܝ.“ ܘܗ̇ܝ ܦܬܝܼܚܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܝܢܘܼ̈ܗ̇، ܘܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Eena poeliṭ-leh shim'oon kepa lklayhy lbadar, o breek-leh o ṣoele-leh. O pteel-leh lkis shlada o meereh, ”ṭweeta qoemy.“ o hay pteekhay-laha 'aynoeha, o kad khze-laha lshim'oon kepa, teew-laha.
ENG: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes; and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܘܼܗ̇ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܐܲܪ̈ܡܸܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Dweeq-leh shim'oon kepa beedoeha o moeqima-leh. Qre-leh lmhoemne o larmilyate o yoewa-leh ilayhy khayta.
ENG: And he gave her his hand, and raised her up; and calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܿܦܹܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Peesh-laha dee'ta aha bklaha yoope, o raba hoeminhoon bmaran.
ENG: And it became known throughout all Joppa: and many believed on the Lord.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܟܸܣ ܕܲܒܵܓ݂ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ.
TRL: O hwe-laha dpeesh-leh shim'oon kepa gaw yoope raba yawmane, lkis dabagh shimeh shim'oon.
ENG: And it came to pass, that he abode many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ، ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܛܵܠܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad nasha gaw qesarya shimeh qoerneleeoos, rab ima dsee'ta dke paysha qreeta see'ta deeṭaleea.
ENG: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,

ASY: ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ. ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܨܲܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Zadeeqa ywa o ke zade' wa min Alaha, haw o kleh bayteh. Ke 'abed wa irwane l'ama, o bkl zawna ke ṣale wa lalaha.
ENG: a devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, who gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ.“
TRL: Khad yawma, maykh sa'at dtlat min bar kawitra, khze-leh malakha dmarya bkhizwa galyaeet. 'weereh lkis-leh o meereh ileh, ”qoerneleeoos.“
ENG: He saw in a vision openly, as it were about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming in unto him, and saying to him, Cornelius.

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܼ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܨܠܵܘܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂ ܘܐܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O qoerneleeoos kheereh bee-eh kad bizda'a o meereh, ”moodee maree?“ joewib-leh malakha, ”ṣlawatoekh o irwanoekh seeq-lhoon dkhara qam Alaha.
ENG: And he, fastening his eyes upon him, and being affrighted, said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are gone up for a memorial before God.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ.
TRL: ”O adeea shadir nashe lyoope dmaytee lshim'oon dke paesh qirya kepa.
ENG: And now send men to Joppa, and fetch one Simon, who is surnamed Peter:

ASY: ”ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܕܲܒܵܓ݂ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Shirya-yleh lkis dabagh shimeh shim'oon, haw dbayteh 'al marza dyama-yleh.“
ENG: he lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܘܚܲܕ ܕܲܚܫܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dzeel-leh malakha dhoemzim-leh 'ameh, qre-leh qoerneleeoos trey min regawateh o khad dakhsha zad'ana min Alaha, dke hawe wa lkis-leh.
ENG: And when the angel that spake unto him was departed, he called two of his household-servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܘܿܦܹܐ.
TRL: Min bar dhoeqe-leh ilayhy kl mindee, shoedray-leh lyoope.
ENG: and having rehearsed all things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܲܝܗܝ، ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܓܵܪܹܐ ܕܨܲܠܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma khena aykh sa'at dtri'sar kawitra, kad anee nashe boerkhayhy, qoerbinhoon lmdeeta, shim'oon kepa seeq-leh lgare dṣale wa ṣloota.
ENG: Now on the morrow, as they were on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray, about the sixth hour:

ASY: ܟܦܝܼܢܹܗ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ. ܟܲܕ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܬܸܡܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kpeeneh o b'e-leh lekhala. Kad kawitra pyasha ywa hoedirta, npeel-leh 'aloehy timha.
ENG: and he became hungry, and desired to eat: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance;

ASY: ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܬܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܒܸܕܡܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܢܝܼܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Khze-leh shmaya pteekhta, o khad mana bidmaya lkitana goera, seera barba' qoerneeate o biṣlaya min shmaya 'al ar'a.
ENG: and he beholdeth the heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet, let down by four corners upon the earth:

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪܸ̈ܓ̰ܒܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eet wa gaweh klayhy haywane darba' aqlate, o rijbe dar'a, o ṭayre dshmaya.
ENG: wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts and creeping things of the earth and fowls of the heaven.

ASY: ܘܩܵܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܩܘܼܡ، ܦܪܘܿܡ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠ.“
TRL: O qala te-leh ileh, bemara, ”kepa, qoem, proom o khool.“
ENG: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill and eat.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ”ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܓܵܘ ܚܲܝܝܼ̈ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܛܲܡܐܵܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh shim'oon kepa, ”khas-lee maree, gaw khayee le ywin kheela mindee la dikhya o ṭama.“
ENG: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common and unclean.

ASY: ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܛܲܡܐܵܐ.“
TRL: Gaha dtartey hwe-leh qala bemara ileh, ”mindee dalaha doeke-leh, at la qareyt-leh ṭama.“
ENG: And a voice came unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, make not thou common.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Aha hwe-laha tlat gahe, haygah bjaldoeta peesh-leh moerma mana lshmaya.
ENG: And this was done thrice: and straightway the vessel was received up into heaven.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ. ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܘܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: Kad shim'oon kepa peesha ywa heera boet khizwa dkhze-leh, mṭe-lhoon nashe dpeeshe ywaw shoedre byad qoerneleeoos. Moechikh-lhoon bayta dshim'oon o kle-lhoon qam tar'a ddarta.
ENG: Now while Peter was much perplexed in himself what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold, the men that were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon’s house, stood before the gate,

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Qre-lhoon o boeqirhoon in shim'oon dke paesh qirya kepa shirya ywa tama.
ENG: and called and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodging there.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܗܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Kad shim'oon kepa takhmoene ywa boet khizwa, meereh ileh roekha, ”shim'oon, ha tlata nashe baqoere yna 'aloekh.
ENG: And while Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

ASY: ”ܩܘܼܡ، ܨܠܝܼ ܘܙܹܠ݇ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܘܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܒܫܸܟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Qoem, ṣlee o ze 'amayhy, o la haweyt bshik sabab ana shoedray-lee.“
ENG: But arise, and get thee down, and go with them, nothing doubting: for I have sent them.

ASY: ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ. ܒܘܼܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: O ṣle-leh shim'oon kepa lkis anee nashe o meereh ilayhy, ”ana ywin haw dbaqoere ytoon 'aloehy. Boet moodee tee-e ytoon?“
ENG: And Peter went down to the men, and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܹܐܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܙܵܕܥܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܫܲܕܸܪ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܬ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: meerhoon ileh, ”qoerneleeoos rab ima, nasha kena-yleh o zad'ana min Alaha, o ke yabil sahdoeta boet dee-eh kleh ṭayipa dyhoedaye. Peesh-leh meera ileh byad malakha qadeesha dshadir lkis-loekh dateyt lbayteh dshame' minoekh hemizmane.“
ENG: And they said, Cornelius a centurion, a righteous man and one that feareth God, and well reported of by all the nation of the Jews, was warned of God by a holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words from thee.

ASY: ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܪܝܼܲܝ ܠܹܗ. ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Moe'biray-leh lbayta o moeshree-ay-leh. O byawma khena zeel-leh 'amayhy. Oep khakma akhoonwate min yoope zeel-lhoon 'ameh.
ENG: So he called them in and lodged them. And on the morrow he arose and went forth with them, and certain of the brethren from Joppa accompanied him.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ. ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܸܙܡܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Byawma khena mṭe-lhoon lqesarya. Qoerneleeoos bispara ywa ilayhy, o qirya ywa khizmanoehy o khawrawateh moekhibe.
ENG: And on the morrow they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his kinsmen and his near friends.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Kad bi'wara ywa shim'oon kepa lbayta, tpeeq-leh bee-eh qoerneleeoos, o npeel-leh o sgheed-leh qam aqlateh.
ENG: And when it came to pass that Peter entered, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܡ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Eena shim'oon kepa moeqim-leh o meereh ileh, ”qoem, oep ana barnasha ywin.“
ENG: But Peter raised him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O haw hamzoeme 'ameh, 'weereh shim'oon kepa lbayta o khze-leh raba nashe jmee'e tama.
ENG: And as he talked with him, he went in, and findeth many come together:

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܲܕ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܫܵܘܬܵܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܛܲܡܐܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy, ”akhtoon ke yad'eetoon dlayt psasa lkhad yhoedaya dazel lkis khad noekhraya, yan 'abed shawtapoeta 'ameh. Eena Alaha moekhze-leh ilee dla qareyn lnasha la dikhya o ṭama.
ENG: and he said unto them, Ye yourselves know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to join himself or come unto one of another nation; and yet unto me hath God shewed that I should not call any man common or unclean:

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ. ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܒܲܩܪܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ؟“
TRL: ”Boet aha dla maklayta te-lee eeman dshoedirawkhoon baree. Ba'eyn dbaqrinawkhoon, qamoodee shoedirawkhoon baree?“
ENG: wherefore also I came without gainsaying, when I was sent for. I ask therefore with what intent ye sent for me.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܝܼ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܠܵܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܟܵܘܸܬܪܵܐ. ܗܵܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܡܲܒܪܸܩܵܢܬܵܐ،
TRL: Joewib-leh qoerneleeoos o meereh, ”arb'a yawmane min qam adeea, ṣaloeye ywin wa gaw baytee baha 'dana aykh sa'at dtlat min bar kawitra. Ha kle-leh qamee khad nasha blweeshta mabriqanta,
ENG: And Cornelius said, Four days ago, until this hour, I was keeping the ninth hour of prayer in my house; and behold, a man stood before me in bright apparel,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܩܘܼܪܢܹܠܝܼܘܿܣ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܡܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܨܠܘܿܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”O meereh ilee, ’qoerneleeoos, peesh-laha shmee'ta ṣlootoekh, o irwanoekh seeq-lhoon dkhara qam Alaha.
ENG: and saith, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

ASY: ”’ܫܲܕܸܪ ܠܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܘܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܕܲܒܵܓ݂ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ، ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”’shadir lyoope o maytee lshim'oon dpyasha-yleh qirya kepa, shirya-yleh gaw bayta ddabagh shimeh shim'oon, 'al marza dyama.‘
ENG: Send therefore to Joppa, and call unto thee Simon, who is surnamed Peter; he lodgeth in the house of Simon a tanner, by the sea side.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܝܼ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܠܲܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܵܡܥܲܚ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܬ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: ”Ana bjaldoeta shoediree baroekh, o at ṣpayee 'weed-loekh dte-loekh. O akhnan adeea klan qam Alaha ywakh dsham'akh kl mindee dpqeed-leh iloekh Marya dhamzimit ilan.“
ENG: Forthwith therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God, to hear all things that have been commanded thee of the Lord.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܵܙܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܵܐ،
TRL: Haygah shoere-leh shim'oon kepa lhamzoeme o meereh, ”bshareeroeta adeea beeda'a ywin dalaha le-yleh khazyana dpata,
ENG: And Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ila klayhy imwate dzad'ee mineh o palkhee zadeeqoeta, qoeble yna lkis-leh.
ENG: but in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is acceptable to him.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ.
TRL: ”Aha-ylaha hemizman dshoedra-leh Alaha lbnay eesrayel, moekriz-leh ilayhy shlama byad eeshoo' msheekha, haw deeleh Marya 'al kl.
ENG: The word which he sent unto the children of Israel, preaching good tidings of peace by Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all)—

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ،
TRL: ”Hay hemizman doep akhtoon beeda'a ytoon dhwe-laha bklaha eehoed, shoere-laha min gleela, min bar ma'moodeeta dmoekriz-leh yookhanan,
ENG: that saying ye yourselves know, which was published throughout all Judaea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

ASY: ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܘܒܲܣܘܼܡܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Dakhee Alaha msheekh-leh leeshoo' naṣraya byad roekha dqoedsha o bkhayla, o dakhee bikhdara ywa bi'wada ṭawta, o basoeme klayhy anee deewaw tkhoot khayla dakelqarṣa, sabab Alaha 'ameh ywa.
ENG: even Jesus of Nazareth, how that God anointed him with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܘܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܬܠܵܝܬܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܩܲܝܣܵܐ،
TRL: ”Akhnan sahde ywakh boet kl mindee d'weed-leh bar'a deehoed o boorishlim. O anee qṭeel-lhoon ileh btlayteh 'al qaysa,
ENG: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom also they slew, hanging him on a tree.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܥܒܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”Eena Alaha moeqim-leh ileh byawma dtlata, o moe'bid-leh dpaesh khizya,
ENG: Him God raised up the third day, and gave him to be made manifest,

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܓܲܒܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܗܵܘܲܚ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܘܫܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܩܝܵܡܬܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena la peesh-leh khizya lkleh 'ama, shwooq minan, akhnan dqamayta Alaha qam gabe lan dhawakh sahde, o kheel lan o shte lan 'ameh min bar qyamteh min gaw meete.
ENG: not to all the people, but unto witnesses that were chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.

ASY: ”ܘܩܲܡ ܦܵܩܹܕ ܠܲܢ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܲܚ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܒܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O qam paqed lan dmakrizakh o yabakh sahdoeta lkleh 'ama, dhaw peesh-leh goebya byad Alaha dayana dkhaye o dmeete.
ENG: And he charged us to preach unto the people, and to testify that this is he which is ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܕܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܹܗ.“
TRL: ”Klayhy nwee-e yoebil-lhoon sahdoeta boet dee-eh, dkl man dhamin bee-eh bit paesh poekhla bshimeh.“
ENG: To him bear all the prophets witness, that through his name every one that believeth on him shall receive remission of sins.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ.
TRL: Kad shim'oon kepa hamzoeme ywa ane hemizmane, shre-laha roekha dqoedsha 'al klayhy anee dbishma'a ywaw hemizman.
ENG: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.

ASY: ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܘܼܦܸܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܠ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: 'oejib-lhoon mhoemne gzeere, anee dte-lhoon 'am shim'oon kepa, eeman dkhze-lhoon dmawhawta droekha dqoedsha peesh-laha shoepikhta oep 'al imwate.
ENG: And they of the circumcision which believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab bishma'a ywaw hamzoeme blishane o shaboekhe lalaha. Haygah meereh shim'oon kepa,
ENG: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,

ASY: ”ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܲܢ.“
TRL: ”Maṣe nasha makle ane nashe dla payshee 'meede bmeea? Sabab oep ane qoebil-lhoon roekha dqoedsha aykh dee-an.“
ENG: Can any man forbid the water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ. ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah pqeed-leh dpayshee 'meede bshima deeshoo' msheekha. O ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dpaesh lkis layhy khakma yawmane.
ENG: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Shmee' lhoon shleekhe o akhoonwate dgaw eehoed doep imwate qoebil-lhoon hemizman dalaha.
ENG: Now the apostles and the brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܕܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Eeman dseeq-leh shim'oon kepa loorishlim, dreesh-lhoon 'ameh mhoemne gzeere,
ENG: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܸܣ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܥܘܼܪ̈ܠܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.“
TRL: Bemara, ”'weeroekh lkis nashe 'oerle o kheel-loekh 'amayhy.“
ENG: saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

ASY: ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܲܩܘܼܝܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܪܹܐܙܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: Shoere-leh shim'oon kepa haqoeye ilayhy rezanaeet kl mindee dhwe-leh, bemara,
ENG: But Peter began, and expounded the matter unto them in order, saying,

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܦܹܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܬܸܡܗܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ، ܚܲܕ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܟܸܬܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܢܝܼܵܬܹܐ ܘܒܸܨܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Ana ṣaloeye ywin wa gaw mdeeta dyoope, o npeel-leh 'alee timha o khze-lee khizwa, khad mana aykh kitana goera, seera barba' qoerneeate o biṣlaya min shmaya, o te-leh lkis-lee.
ENG: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even unto me:

ASY: ”ܚܝܼܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܸ̈ܓ̰ܒܹܐ، ܘܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”Kheeree gaweh o khze-lee haywane dar'a darba' aqlate, o dabe o rijbe, o ṭayre dshmaya,
ENG: upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw the fourfooted beasts of the earth and wild beasts and creeping things and fowls of the heaven.

ASY: ”ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܩܘܼܡ، ܦܪܘܿܡ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܘܿܠ.‘
TRL: ”O shmee' lee qala bemara ilee, ’kepa, qoem, proom o khool.‘
ENG: And I heard also a voice saying unto me, Rise, Peter; kill and eat.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܝܼ، ’ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܡܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܘܛܲܡܐܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Ana joewib-lee, ’khas-lee maree, le-yleh 'weera lpoemee mindee la dikhya o ṭama.‘
ENG: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath ever entered into my mouth.

ASY: ”ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ’ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܪܹܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܛܲܡܐܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Gaha dtartey meereh ilee qala min shmaya, ’mindee dalaha doeke-leh, at la qareyt-leh ṭama.‘
ENG: But a voice answered the second time out of heaven, What God hath cleansed, make not thou common.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܠܵܬ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Hadkha hwe-laha tlat gahe. Haygah peesh-leh moerma mana lshmaya.
ENG: And this was done thrice: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

ASY: ”ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bhay 'dana tlata gawre dpeeshe ywaw shoedre lkis-lee min qesarya, kle-lhoon qam tar'a dbayta dshirya ywin wa gaweh.
ENG: And behold, forthwith three men stood before the house in which we were, having been sent from Caesarea unto me.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܵܝܬܵܐ. ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܲܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”meereh ilee roekha dazen 'amayhy dla maklayta. O te-lhoon 'amee oep ane ishta akhoonwate, o 'weeran lbayta dhaw nasha.
ENG: And the Spirit bade me go with them, making no distinction. And these six brethren also accompanied me; and we entered into the man’s house:

ASY: ”ܘܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ’ܫܲܕܸܪ ܠܝܘܿܦܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ،
TRL: ”O haw hoeqe-leh ilan dakhee khze-leh malakha gaw bayteh o meereh ileh, ’shadir lyoope bar shim'oon dpyasha-yleh qirya kepa,
ENG: and he told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying, Send to Joppa, and fetch Simon, whose surname is Peter;

ASY: ”’ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܩܹܬ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”’haw bit hamzim 'amoekh hemizmane dbee-ayhy bit parqet, at o kleh baytoekh.‘
ENG: who shall speak unto thee words, whereby thou shalt be saved, thou and all thy house.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܒܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kad shoere-lee lhamzoeme, ṣle-leh roekha dqoedsha 'alayhy aykh dṣle-leh 'alan bshoeraya.
ENG: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܪܝܼ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ، ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܡܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.‘
TRL: ”Haygah dkheeree hemizmane dmaran, dmeereh, ’yookhanan moe'mid-leh bmeea, eena akhtoon bit 'amdeetoon broekha dqoedsha.‘
ENG: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܗ̇ܝ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܲܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܲܟܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: ”In hadkha Alaha yoebil-leh ilayhy hay mawhawta dyoebil-leh ilan eeman dhoeminan bmaran eeshoo' msheekha, manee ywin wa ana dmaṣeyn wa lmakloeye lalaha?“
ENG: If then God gave unto them the like gift as he did also unto us, when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܬܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܘܚܵܝܝܼ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon ane hemizmane, shteeq-lhoon, o shoebikh-lhoon lalaha, bemara, ”hadkha Alaha 'weed-leh oep limwate dtawibee o khayee.“
ENG: And when they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then to the Gentiles also hath God granted repentance unto life.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܸܛܠܵܐ ܕܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܲܠ ܦܹܘܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܘܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ، ܘܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ، ܟܲܕ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Anee dboerbiz-lhoon min oelṣana dhwe-leh boet qiṭla disṭapanoos, mṭe-lhoon hal pewneeqe, o qiwproos, o anṭyookhy, kad lnasha le makrizee waw ila lyhoedaye.
ENG: They therefore that were scattered abroad upon the tribulation that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phoenicia, and Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to none save only to Jews.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܹܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܘܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eena eet waw khakma minayhy min qiwproos o min qiwreene. Ane zeel-lhoon lanṭyookhy o moekriz-lhoon lyawnaye boet Maran eeshoo'.
ENG: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Greeks also, preaching the Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: O eeda dmarya 'amayhy ywa, o raba hoeminhoon o deerhoon lkis Marya.
ENG: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number that believed turned unto the Lord.

ASY: ܘܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: O mṭe-leh khabra boet aha l'edta dgaw oorishlim, o shoedirhoon barnwa lanṭyookhy.
ENG: And the report concerning them came to the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas as far as Antioch:

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܬܵܒܥܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-leh tama o khze-leh moodee shapaqat dalaha bi'wada ywa, khde-leh, o ṭleeb-leh minayhy dtab'ee lmarya min kleh libayhy,
ENG: who, when he was come, and had seen the grace of God, was glad; and he exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Sabab nasha ṭawa ywa, o milya min roekha dqoedsha o haymanoeta, o raba hoeminhoon bmaran.
ENG: for he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܛܵܪܣܘܿܣ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܫܵܐܘܿܠ.
TRL: Haygah zeel-leh barnwa lṭarsoos biṭ'aya lshaool.
ENG: And he went forth to Tarsus to seek for Saul:

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ. ܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܚܕܵܐ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ. ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: O kad moechikh-leh, moete-leh 'ameh lanṭyookhy. Qa mitkha dkhda sheta barnwa o shaool ke jam'ee waw 'am 'edta o malpee waw minyana goera min nashe. O talmeede peesh-lhoon qirye msheekhaye qamayta gaw anṭyookhy.
ENG: and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that even for a whole year they were gathered together with the church, and taught much people; and that the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: Bhay 'dana te-lhoon khakma nwee-e min oorishlim lanṭyookhy.
ENG: Now in these days there came down prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܵܓ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܿܣ ܘܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ. ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܩܠܵܘܕܝܘܿܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ.
TRL: Qeem-leh khad minayhy shimeh aghawoos o noebe-leh broekha dbit hawe kipna goera bklaha ar'a. O aha kipna hwe-leh b'dana dqlawdyoos qesar.
ENG: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be a great famine over all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius.

ASY: ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܨܵܝܬܹܗ، ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܫܲܕܪܝܼ ܗܵܝܲܪܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ.
TRL: O talmeede, kl khad aykh mṣayteh, moekhshikh-lhoon dshadree hayarta qa akhoonwate dbikhaya ywaw gaw eehoed.
ENG: And the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren that dwelt in Judaea:

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܫܵܕܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܗܵܝܲܪܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ.
TRL: 'weed-lhoon aha bshadarta dhayarta byad barnwa o shaool lkis khwardiqne.
ENG: which also they did, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

ASY: ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Baha 'dana heroodis malka dweeq-leh lkhakma nashe min 'edta li'wada beeshta ilayhy.
ENG: Now about that time Herod the king put forth his hands to afflict certain of the church.

ASY: ܩܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Qṭeel-leh bsaypa lya'qoow akhoona dyookhanan.
ENG: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܫܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad khze-leh daha shoela shpeereh lyhoedaye, dweeq-leh oep lshim'oon kepa. Aha hwe-laha byawmane dpaṭeere.
ENG: And when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. And those were the days of unleavened bread.

ASY: ܕܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܣܝܼܥܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ. ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Dre-leh ileh gaw beyt aseere, o soepe-leh larba' see'ate, kl minayhy arb'a naṭoore, dnaṭree waw-leh. B'e-leh dmin bar 'eda sape wa-leh l'ama dyhoedaye.
ENG: And when he had taken him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to guard him; intending after the Passover to bring him forth to the people.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܒܚܲܡܝܼܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Kad shim'oon kepa pyasha ywa nṭeera gaw beyt aseere, 'edta bkhameemoeta ṣaloeye ywa lalaha boet dee-eh.
ENG: Peter therefore was kept in the prison: but prayer was made earnestly of the church unto God for him.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܒܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܬܪܹܝ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhaw layle, min qam dheroodis mayte wa-leh ldeewan bṣapra, shim'oon kepa dmeekha ywa beyl trey dakhshe, o seera btartey sheshlate, o naṭoore qam tar'a binṭara beyt aseere.
ENG: And when Herod was about to bring him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and guards before the door kept the prison.

ASY: ܘܗܵܐ، ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܘܼܓ̰ܠܸܓ̰ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܩܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܪܥܸܫ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ.“ ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: O ha, malakha dmarya peesh-leh khizya ileh, o bahra loejlij-leh gaw beyt aseere, o dqeereh bdipna dshim'oon kepa o moer'ish-leh, o meereh ileh, ”qoem jalde.“ o npeel-lhoon sheshlate min eedateh.
ENG: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shined in the cell: and he smote Peter on the side, and awoke him, saying, Rise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܣܘܿܪ ܚܲܨܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܒ݂ܘܿܫ ܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܕܪܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܵܒܵܝܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܬܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ.“
TRL: meereh ileh malakha, ”soor khaṣoekh, o lwoosh ṣawloekh.“ o 'weed-leh kepa hadkha, meereh ileh, ”dree 'aloekh 'abaytoekh o ta baree.“
ENG: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And he did so. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܐܸܢ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܩܲܘܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh shim'oon kepa o zeel-leh bareh, eena le ywa beeda'a din shareeraeet qawoeme ywa mindee dpeesha ywa 'weeda byad malakha, sabab bikhshawa ywa dkhizwa bikhzaya ywa.
ENG: And he went out, and followed; and he wist not that it was true which was done by the angel, but thought he saw a vision.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܘܬܪܲܝܵܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܦܪܸܙܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܥܵܠܘܿܠܵܐ. ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kad 'weerhoon min naṭoora qamaya o trayana, te-lhoon ltar'a dprizla dke labil lmdeeta. Pteekh-leh tar'a min ganeh, o pleeṭ-lhoon mineh o te-lhoon lkhad 'aloola. Har bhay 'dana shweeq-leh ileh malakha tama.
ENG: And when they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth into the city; which opened to them of its own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and straightway the angel departed from him.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹܗ ܘܦܘܼܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Haygah r'eesh-leh lganeh shim'oon kepa, o meereh, ”adeea dee' lee bshareeroeta dmarya shoedireh malakeh o poeṣe-leh ilee min eeda dheroodis, o min kl mindee dbikhshawa ywa 'alee 'ama dyhoedaye.“
ENG: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a truth, that the Lord hath sent forth his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܪܝܲܡ ܝܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܩܘܿܣ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ.
TRL: Eeman dpoerme-leh aha, te-leh lbayta dmaryam yima dyookhanan, dpaesh wa qirya marqoos, ayka draba jmee'e ywaw o ṣaloeye.
ENG: And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together and were praying.

ASY: ܬܘܼܩܬܸܩ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܠܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܬܵܐ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܪܘܿܕܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܚܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ،
TRL: Toeqtiq-leh shim'oon kepa ltar'a ddarta, o pleeṭ-laha khda brata shimoeha rooda dpatkha wa-leh tar'a,
ENG: And when he knocked at the door of the gate, a maid came to answer, named Rhoda.

ASY: ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܘܼܗ̇ ܠܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: dee' laha qala dshim'oon kepa, o min khadoetoeha la pteekh-laha tar'a, ila rkheeṭ-laha lgawa o meeraha, ”kepa kilya-yleh qam tar'a ddarta.“
ENG: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for joy, but ran in, and told that Peter stood before the gate.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇، ”ܫܘܼܕܸܢܵܟ݂ܝ!“ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܘܼܫ ܩܸܘܝܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Anee joewib-lhoon iloeha, ”shoedinakhy!“ eena hay boesh qiwya amra wa dshim'oon kepa-yleh. Eena anee meerhoon, ”malakeh-yleh.“
ENG: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she confidently affirmed that it was even so. And they said, It is his angel.

ASY: ܘܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܬܲܩܬܘܼܩܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O kepa hesh taqtoeqe ywa 'al tar'a. Eeman dpteekh-lhoon o khze-lhoon ileh, 'oejib-lhoon.
ENG: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.

ASY: ܘܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ. ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܲܚܒܸܪܘܼܢ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: O sh'eesh-leh eedeh 'alayhy dla hamzimee. Hoeqe-leh ilayhy dakhee Marya poeliṭ-leh ileh min beyt aseere. Haygah meereh ilayhy, ”makhbiroen lya'qoow o lakhoonwate.“ o pleeṭ-leh o zeel-leh lkhda doeka kheta.
ENG: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him forth out of the prison. And he said, Tell these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went to another place.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh yawma, npeel-leh shghoeshya goera gaw dakhshe boet shim'oon kepa dmoodee hwe-leh ileh.
ENG: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

ASY: ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܨܘܼܚܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ. ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Ṭleeb-leh heroodis lshim'oon kepa eena la moechikh-leh. Min bar dṣoekhṣe-leh lnaṭoore, pqeed-leh dpayshee qṭeele. O ṣle-leh min eehoed lqesarya o peesh-leh tama.
ENG: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and tarried there.

ASY: ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܟܪܝܼܒܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܨܘܿܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܨܲܝܕܘܿܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܬܵܦܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܡܸܨܥܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܠܹܣܛܘܿܣ، ܪܹܓܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ. ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܘܼܪܣܵܝܵܐ ܕܐܲܬܪܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Heroodis kreeba ywa 'al ṣooraye o 'al ṣaydoonaye. Ane soezgirhoon m'oedale o te-lhoon dtapqee waw bee-eh bmiṣ'ayoeta dblesṭoos, rega mhoemna dmalka. Ṭleeb-lhoon d'awdee waw shlama 'am heroodis sabab toersaya datrayhy min atra dheroodis eewa.
ENG: Now he was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: and they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was fed from the king’s country.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ، ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Byawma dee'a, lweesh-leh heroodis lweeshta dmalkoeta o teew-leh 'al koersya ddeewan o hoemzim-leh ilayhy.
ENG: And upon a set day Herod arrayed himself in royal apparel, and sat on the throne, and made an oration unto them.

ASY: ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Kinsha moeqwikh-leh, bemara, ”aha qala dalaha-yleh, la dbarnasha.“
ENG: And the people shouted, saying, The voice of a god, and not of a man.

ASY: ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܩܲܡ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܬܸܘܸܠܥܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Har bhay 'dana mkhe-leh ileh malakha dmarya, sabab la yoebil-leh shoewkha lalaha, o qam akhlee-leh tiwil'e o meet-leh.
ENG: And immediately an angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

ASY: ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Hemizman dalaha prees-laha o zeed-laha.
ENG: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

ASY: ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܩܘܿܣ.
TRL: O barnwa o shaool deerhoon min oorishlim min bar dtoemim-lhoon khilmatayhy, o shqeel-lhoon 'amayhy lyookhanan, dpeesh-leh qirya marqoos.
ENG: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministration, taking with them John whose surname was Mark.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܫܸܡܵܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܢܝܼܓܲܪ، ܘܠܘܼܩܝܼܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܪܝܼܢܹܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡܵܢܵܐܹܝܠ ܚܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ ܛܸܛܪܲܪܟܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܹܗ، ܘܫܵܐܘܿܠ.
TRL: Eet wa gaw 'edta danṭyookhy nwee-e o malpane, shimanayhy barnwa, o shim'oon dpaesh wa qirya neegar, o loeqeeoos min qiwreene mdeeta, o manaeyl khawra dheroodis ṭiṭrarka min yaloeteh, o shaool.
ENG: Now there were at Antioch, in the church that was there, prophets and teachers, Barnabas, and Symeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen the foster-brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܨܝܵܡܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ”ܦܪܘܿܫܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ.“
TRL: Kad ane biplakha ywaw lmarya o biṣyama, meereh ilayhy roekha dqoedsha, ”prooshoen ilee shaool o barnwa lpoelkhana dana qiryay ywin.“
ENG: And as they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܨܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Min bar dṣeem-lhoon o ṣoele-lhoon, moetiw-lhoon 'alayhy eedate o shoedray-lhoon.
ENG: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܣܹܠܵܘܩܝܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ.
TRL: Ane kad peesh-lhoon shoedre byad roekha dqoedsha, ṣle-lhoon lselawqya, o min tama ṭre-lhoon byama hal qiwproos.
ENG: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, went down to Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܣܵܠܵܡܹܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܝܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-lhoon lsalamena, moekriz-lhoon hemizman dalaha gaw knoeshyate dyhoedaye, o oep yookhanan ke hayir wa-lhoon.
ENG: And when they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John as their attendant.

ASY: ܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܦܘܿܣ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܒܲܪ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܚܲܪܵܫܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Khdeerhoon bklaha gazarta hal dte-lhoon lpapoos mdeeta. Tama khze-lhoon khad nasha yhoedaya shimeh bar eeshoo', kharasha o nweea dagala.
ENG: And when they had gone through the whole island unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-Jesus;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܕܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܣܲܪܓܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܟܝܼܡܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܘܠܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܫܵܡܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Aha ke hawe wa lkis shaleeṭa dqiwproos dke paesh wa qirya sargeeoos pawloos, khad nasha khakeema. Aha qre-leh lshaool o lbarnwa o ba'e wa dshame' wa minayhy hemizman dalaha.
ENG: which was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. The same called unto him Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܪܵܫܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܘܼܪܓܸܡܵܐ ܐܵܠܘܼܡܘܿܣ، ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܠܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena kharasha dshimeh ke paesh wa toergima aloemoos, kilya ywa dalqoewlayhy, o ba'e wa dmaqlib wa lshaleeṭa min haymanoeta.
ENG: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܟܲܕ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Eena shaool, dpeesh-leh qirya pawloos, kad milya min roekha dqoedsha, kheereh bee-eh o meereh,
ENG: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Ghost, fastened his eyes on him,

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܸܠܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܟܹܠܩܲܪܨܵܐ، ܘܣܵܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܫܠܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܦܟ̰ܘܼܠܹܐ ܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ؟
TRL: ”Ya milya min klayhy pilme o min klayhy beeshate, broona dakelqarṣa, o sanyana dklaha zadeeqoeta, qamoodee le ywit bishlaya min mapchoele oerkhate shareere dmarya?
ENG: and said, O full of all guile and all villany, thou son of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

ASY: ”ܗܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܣܸܡܝܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.“ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܘܥܲܡܛܵܢܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܕܵܒܹܩ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ.
TRL: ”Ha adeea eeda dmarya 'aloekh eelaha, bit haweyt simya o le khazeyt bahra dshimsha qa khad zawna.“ har bhay 'dana npeel-leh 'aloehy khishka o 'amṭana, o shoere-leh biṭ'aya o bib'aya nasha ddabeq beedeh.
ENG: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܥܘܼܓ̰ܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܒܡܲܠܦܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-leh shaleeṭa mindee dhwe-leh, hoemineh, sabab 'oejib-leh bmalpanoeta dboet Marya.
ENG: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܦܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܓܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܡܦܘܼܠܝܼܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Pawloos o khawrawateh ṭre-lhoon byama min papoos o te-lhoon lmdeeta dparge gaw pampoeleea. Tama preesh-leh minayhy yookhanan o deereh loorishlim.
ENG: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܲܪܓܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܓܵܘ ܦܝܼܣܝܼܕܝܵܐ. ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena anee pleeṭ-lhoon min parge o te-lhoon lmdeeta danṭyookhy gaw peeseedya. Byawma dshabta 'weerhoon lknoeshta o teew-lhoon.
ENG: But they, passing through from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia; and they went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܩܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ، ܗܲܡܙܸܡܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ.“
TRL: Min bar qrayta dnamoosa o nwee-e, shoedirhoon lkis layhy khwardiqne dknoeshta, bemara, ”nashe akhoonwate, in eet lawkhoon hemizman dyabalta dliba l'ama, hamzimoen ilan.“
ENG: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Haygah kle-leh pawloos, sh'eesh-leh eedeh o meereh, ”nashe bnay eesrayel, o khene dke zad'ee min Alaha, shmi'moen ilee.
ENG: And Paul stood up, and beckoning with the hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, hearken.

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈، ܘܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܘܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”Alaha daha 'ama eesrayel goebe-leh lawahatan, o moerim-leh l'ama b'dana deewaw tawtabe bar'a dmiṣreyn, o bkhayla goera poelṭay-leh min haw atra.
ENG: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they sojourned in the land of Egypt, and with a high arm led he them forth out of it.

ASY: ”ܘܬܘܼܪܣܝܼܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܒܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O toersee-ay-leh gaw bareea bmitkha darb'ee shine.
ENG: And for about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܫܒܲܥ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܟܢܲܥܢ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܠܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shmeeṭ-leh shba' imwate bar'a dkna'n, o yoebil-leh ilayhy ar'a lyartoeta.
ENG: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred and fifty years:

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܡܵܐܐ ܘܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܲܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܡܘܼܐܹܝܠ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar aha, aykh arba'ma o khamshee shine, yoebil-leh ilayhy dayane hal 'dana dshmoeeyl nweea.
ENG: and after these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ. ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܵܐܘܿܠ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܩܝܼܫ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܕܒܸܢܝܵܡܹܝܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Haygah bnay eesrayel ṭleeb-lhoon malka. O Alaha yoebil-leh ilayhy shaool broona dqeesh, min shawṭa dbinyameyn, o 'weed-leh malkoeta qa mitkha darb'ee shine.
ENG: And afterward they asked for a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for the space of forty years.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܘܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ’ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܫܲܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܠܸܒܝܼ. ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܢ.‘
TRL: ”Min bar dshqeel-leh lshaool, yoebil-leh ilayhy daweed malka, o sheed-leh boet dee-eh, bemara, ’khze-lee ldaweed broona deeshay nasha aykh libee. Haw bit 'abed kl mindee dba'eyn.‘
ENG: And when he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king; to whom also he bare witness, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who shall do all my will.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܦܵܪܘܿܩܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Min zar'a ddaweed moeqim-leh Alaha qa eesrayel parooqa, eeshoo', dakhee dqoewil-leh.
ENG: Of this man’s seed hath God according to promise brought unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus;

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܕܬܲܘܸܒ ܘܥܵܡܹܕ.
TRL: ”Min qam tayta dmsheekha, yookhanan moekriz-leh lkleh 'ama deesrayel dtawib o 'amed.
ENG: when John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܬܲܡܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܪܲܗܛܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ̇ܘ. ܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܫܵܪܹܝܢ ܠܨܵܘܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”Kad tamoeme ywa yookhanan rahṭeh, meereh, ’bikhshawa ytoon manee ywin ana? Ana le ywin haw. La, eena betaya-yleh baree khad dana le khashkhen dshareyn lṣawloehy.‘
ENG: And as John was fulfilling his course, he said, What suppose ye that I am? I am not he. But behold, there cometh one after me, the shoes of whose feet I am not worthy to unloose.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”nashe akhoonwate, bnoone dawraham, o khene deena gawawkhoon zad'ane min Alaha, ilawkhoon peesh-laha shoedirta hemizman daha poerqana.
ENG: Brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you that fear God, to us is the word of this salvation sent forth.

ASY: ”ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܒܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܕܝܵܢܬܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܒܟܠ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”'Amrane dboorishlim o goeranayhy la dee' lhoon leeshoo'. Eena bdyantayhy ileh toemim-lhoon hemizmane dnwee-e dke payshee qirye bkl shabta.
ENG: For they that dwell in Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܵܛܘܿܣ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Oep in dla moechikh-lhoon 'ilta dmawta bee-eh, ṭleeb-lhoon min peelaṭoos dqaṭel-leh.
ENG: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet asked they of Pilate that he should be slain.

ASY: ”ܘܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܲܝܣܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”O kad toemim-lhoon kl mindee deewa kteewa boet dee-eh, moeṣle-lhoon ileh min qaysa o moetiw-lhoon gaw qawra.
ENG: And when they had fulfilled all things that were written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”Eena Alaha moeqim-leh ileh min gaw meete,
ENG: But God raised him from the dead:

ASY: ”ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܥܲܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O peesh-leh khizya raba yawmane lanee dseeq-lhoon 'ameh min gleela loorishlim. Anee adeea sahdoehy yna lkis 'ama.
ENG: and he was seen for many days of them that came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses unto the people.
