ASY: ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈،
TRL: ”Akhnan makroeze ywakh ilawkhoon qawla dalaha d'weed-leh 'am awahatan,
ENG: And we bring you good tidings of the promise made unto the fathers,

ASY: ”ܘܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܒܢܘܿܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܡܲܙܡܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܗܲܨܠܸܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”O toemim-leh ilan, deewakh bnoonayhy, sabab moeqim-leh leeshoo', aykh deeleh kteewa bmazmoora dtrey: at broonee ywit, idyoom yawma qam haṣlinoekh.
ENG: how that God hath fulfilled the same unto our children, in that he raised up Jesus; as also it is written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

ASY: ”ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܸܟ̃ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܠܕܵܘܝܼܕ.
TRL: ”Dmoeqim-leh ileh Alaha min gaw meete dhich la ate lkhrawa, dakhee dmeereh: bit yabenoekh mindeeane mqoedshe o mhoemne dyoebil-lee ldaweed.
ENG: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he hath spoken on this wise, I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.

ASY: ”ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇: ܠܹܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܟ݂ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bkhda doeka kheta kteewta-ylaha: le shawqet qadeeshoekh dkhaze khrawa.
ENG: Because he saith also in another psalm, Thou wilt not give thy Holy One to see corruption.

ASY: ”ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܒܕܵܘܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܘܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܡܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܹ̈ܗ ܘܚܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ.
TRL: ”Daweed bdawra dganeh pleekh-leh o toemim-leh ṣiwyana dalaha, dmeekh-leh, o peesh-leh qweera 'am awahateh o khreew-leh paghreh.
ENG: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܠܵܐ ܚܪܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena haw dalaha moeqim-leh min gaw meete paghreh la khreew-leh.
ENG: but he whom God raised up saw no corruption.

ASY: ”ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Ba'eyn dyad'eetoon, nashe akhoonwatee, baha eeshoo' pyasha-yleh moekriza ilawkhoon poekhala dkhṭeeate.
ENG: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is proclaimed unto you remission of sins:

ASY: ”ܘܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܟܫܸܛ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”O kl man dhamin bee-eh bit paesh moekshiṭa min kl mindee dnamoosa dmoeshe la mṣe-leh makshiṭ lawkhoon.
ENG: and by him every one that believeth is justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܗܸܫܝܵܪ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ:
TRL: ”Boet aha hweymoen hishyar dla ate 'alawkhoon mindee dpeesh-leh meera byad nwee-e:
ENG: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken in the prophets;

ASY: ܓܲܫܩܘܼܢ ܡܲܣܚܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܥܲܓ̰ܒܘܼܢ ܘܛܠܘܿܩܘܼܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܩܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Gashqoen maskhirane, 'ajboen o ṭlooqoen, sabab bit 'awden khad mindee byawmanawkhoon, dle hamineetoon in nasha haqe lawkhoon.“
ENG: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish; For I work a work in your days, A work which ye shall in no wise believe, if one declare it unto you.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Kad pawloos o barnwa biplaṭa ywaw min knoeshta, ṭleeb-lhoon minayhy nashe datee waw o hamzimee waw ilayhy aykh ane hemizmane bshabta kheta.
ENG: And as they went out, they besought that these words might be spoken to them the next sabbath.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܩܠܝܼܒܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܬܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ. ܘܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܲܩܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Raba min yhoedaye o oep qleebaye zad'ane min Alaha zeel-lhoon bar pawloos o barnwa min bar dkhteem-laha khilmat dknoeshta. O ane hamzimee waw 'amayhy o maqwee waw-lhoon bshapaqat dalaha.
ENG: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

ASY: ܒܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Bshabta kheta khacha paysha klaha mdeeta jmee' lhoon lishma'a hemizman dmarya.
ENG: And the next sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܒܲܚܸܠܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܓܕܝܼܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena eeman dkhze-lhoon yhoedaye lkinshe, peesh-lhoon milye bakhilanoeta, o hoemzim-lhoon dalqoewl mindeeane dhamzoemay ywa pawloos, o gdeep-lhoon.
ENG: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܘܼܗ̇ ܘܡܫܘܼܪܸܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙܲܚ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah joewib-lhoon pawloos o barnwa bjoerat, o meerhoon, ”wale ywa dqamayta ilawkhoon makrizakh waw hemizman dalaha, eena sabab le ytoon qaboeloeha o mshoerirawkhoon 'al ganawkhoon dle khashkheetoon lkhaye dl'alam, bit azakh o makrizakh limwate.
ENG: And Paul and Barnabas spake out boldly, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first be spoken to you. Seeing ye thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܡܲܪ̈ܙܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab hadkha pqeed-leh ilan Maran, bemara: 'weed-lee iloekh bahra limwate, dhaweyt poerqana hal marzane dar'a.“
ENG: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee for a light of the Gentiles, That thou shouldest be for salvation unto the uttermost part of the earth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܚܩܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܘܼܒܝܹܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon imwate, khde-lhoon, o khqeerhoon lhemizman dmarya, o hoeminhoon klayhy anee dpeeshe ywaw goebye lkhaye dl'alam.
ENG: And as the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.

ASY: ܘܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܟܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ.
TRL: O prees-laha hemizman dmarya bkleh haw atra.
ENG: And the word of the Lord was spread abroad throughout all the region.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܚܘܼܦܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹ̈ܐ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܥܲܠ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܚܘܼܡܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eena yhoedaye khoepiṭ-lhoon lbakhtate myoeqre zad'ane min Alaha, o lreshane dmdeeta, o hadkha moeqim-lhoon rdoepya 'al pawloos o 'al barnwa, o poelṭay-lhoon min tkhoemayhy.
ENG: But the Jews urged on the devout women of honourable estate, and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and cast them out of their borders.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܦܝܼܨ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ.
TRL: Anee kad pleeṭ-lhoon npeeṣ-lhoon 'apra min aqlatayhy o zeel-lhoon leeqanoon.
ENG: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.

ASY: ܘܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.
TRL: O talmeede peesh-lhoon milye khadoeta o roekha dqoedsha.
ENG: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Ghost.

ASY: ܘܓܵܘ ܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O gaw eeqanoon 'weerhoon pawloos o barnwa m'oedale gaw knoeshta dyhoedaye, o hadkha moekriz-lhoon tama dkinsha raba min yhoedaye o yawnaye hoeminhoon.
ENG: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ، ܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܥܒܸܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܣܵܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena anee min yhoedaye dla b'e-lhoon dhaminee, moeshgish-lhoon limwate o moe'biday-lhoon dsanee waw lakhoonwate.
ENG: But the Jews that were disobedient stirred up the souls of the Gentiles, and made them evil affected against the brethren.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Eena pawloos o barnwa peesh-lhoon tama qa khad zawna yareekha, o ke hamzimee waw bjoerat boet Marya, o haw ke yabil wa sahdoeta lhemizman dshapaqateh byad neeshanqe o doemare d'awdee waw.
ENG: Long time therefore they tarried there speaking boldly in the Lord, which bare witness unto the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena kinsha dmdeeta plee'a ywa. Eet wa minayhy 'am yhoedaye, o khene 'am shleekhe.
ENG: But the multitude of the city was divided; and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܸܙܡܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܪܵܓ̰ܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: 'weed-lhoon gizme 'alayhy imwate o yhoedaye 'am goeranayhy d'awdee waw sreeta ilayhy o rajmee waw-lhoon.
ENG: And when there was made an onset both of the Gentiles and of the Jews with their rulers, to entreat them shamefully, and to stone them,

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ ܘܠܕܲܪܒܹܐ، ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܘܼܩܵܢܝܼܵܐ ܘܠܡܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Kad dee' lhoon baha, 'reeq-lhoon lloesṭra o ldarbe, mdeenate dloeqaneea o lmatwate dkhadirwanayhy.
ENG: they became aware of it, and fled unto the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the region round about:

ASY: ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ.
TRL: O tama hwe-lhoon makroeze.
ENG: and there they preached the gospel.

ASY: ܓܵܘ ܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܩܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܫܦܝܼܠܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܹܪ݇ܣܵܐ ܕܝܸܡܹܗ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Gaw loesṭra eet wa khad nasha teewa, aqloehy shpeele min kesa dyimeh, o le ywa khdeera bklayhy khayoehy.
ENG: And at Lystra there sat a certain man, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ. ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܒܣܝܼܡܵܐ.
TRL: Aha shmee' leh lpawloos hamzoeme. Kheereh bee-eh pawloos o dee' leh deet wa-leh haymanoeta dpaesh bseema.
ENG: The same heard Paul speaking: who, fastening his eyes upon him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ”ܩܘܼܡ ܘܟܠܝܼ ܠܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂.“ ܘܫܘܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ.
TRL: meereh bqala rama, ”qoem o klee laqlatoekh.“ o shweereh o khdeereh.
ENG: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped up and walked.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘܲܢ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon kinshe mindee d'weed-leh pawloos, moeqwikh-lhoon blishana deeqanoon, bemara, ”alahe bdmoeta dbnaynasha ṣle-lhoon gawan.“
ENG: And when the multitudes saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

ASY: ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܙܘܿܣ، ܘܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܗܲܪܡܝܼܣ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܵܢܵܐ ܐܲܨܠܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Moetiw-lhoon shima dbarnwa zoos, o shima dpawloos harmees, sabab haw eewa hamzimana aṣlaya.
ENG: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercury, because he was the chief speaker.

ASY: ܘܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܕܙܘܿܣ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O kahna dzoos, haw dhaykleh lbadar min mdeeta ywa, moete-leh tawre o kleele ltar'ane dmdeeta sabab haw o kinsha b'e-lhoon d'awdee waw diwkha qa shleekhe.
ENG: And the priest of Jupiter whose temple was before the city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the multitudes.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ، ܟ̰ܘܼܢܟ̰ܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon shleekhe, pawloos o barnwa, choenchirhoon joelayhy, o rkheeṭ-lhoon gaw kinsha maqwoekhe o bemara,
ENG: But when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they rent their garments, and sprang forth among the multitude, crying out

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ؟ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܕܵܝܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܫܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Ya nashe, qamoodee bi'wada ytoon aha? Oep akhnan nashe ywakh maykh deeawkhoon. Makroeze ywakh ilawkhoon ddayreetoon min ane shoele baṭeele lkis Alaha khaya. Haw dbre-leh shmaya o ar'a o yama o kl deet gawayhy.
ENG: and saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and bring you good tidings, that ye should turn from these vain things unto the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that in them is:

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܕܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܒܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܕܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: ”Haw dbdawre 'weere shweeq-leh lklayhy imwate dazee boerkhate dganayhy,
ENG: who in the generations gone by suffered all the nations to walk in their own ways.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܘܼܗ̇ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܛܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܩܲܡ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܘܡܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena le-yleh shweeqoeha ganeh dla sahde. 'weed-leh ilawkhoon ṭawate byabalta dmiṭra min shmaya, o ṭ'oenyate bzawnayhy, o qam yabil lawkhoon mekhoelta o mle-leh libawkhoon boesama.“
ENG: And yet he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave you from heaven rains and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.

ASY: ܘܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O bklayhy ane hemizmane, bkhayla moekle-lhoon lkinsha, dla dawkhee waw ilayhy diwkhe.
ENG: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the multitudes from doing sacrifice unto them.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܠܓܹܒܲܝܗܝ، ܘܪܓ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon khakma yhoedaye min anṭyookhy o min eeqanoon o greesh-lhoon lkinsha lgebayhy, o rjeem-lhoon lpawloos, o greesh-lhoon ileh lbadar min mdeeta, kad bikhshawa dmeeta ywa.
ENG: But there came Jews thither from Antioch and Iconium: and having persuaded the multitudes, they stoned Paul, and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܘܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܲܪܒܹܐ.
TRL: Min bar djmee' lhoon lkis-leh talmeede, qeem-leh o 'weereh lmdeeta. O yawma khena zeel-lhoon ldarbe.
ENG: But as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and entered into the city: and on the morrow he went forth with Barnabas to Derbe.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܒܹܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ ܘܠܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ ܘܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: Min bar dmoekriz-lhoon gaw darbe o 'weed-lhoon raba talmeede tama, deerhoon lloesṭra o leeqanoon o lanṭyookhy.
ENG: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, and to Iconium, and to Antioch,

ASY: ܡܲܩܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܟܵܠܝܼ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܚ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.“
TRL: Maqwee waw ganate dtalmeede, yawee waw-lhoon liba dkalee qiwye bhaymanoeta, bemara, ”boelṣane raba wale-ylaha d'awrakh lmalkoeta dalaha.“
ENG: confirming the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that through many tribulations we must enter into the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܟܠ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܘܒܨܵܘܡܵܐ ܘܒܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Goebe-lhoon pawloos o barnwa khwardiqne ilayhy bkl 'edta, o bṣawma o bṣloota soepyay-lhoon lmaran, haw dhoeminhoon bee-eh.
ENG: And when they had appointed for them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܦܝܼܣܝܼܕܝܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܲܡܦܘܼܠܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dkhdeerhoon gaw peeseedya, te-lhoon lpampoeleea.
ENG: And they passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܪܓܹܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܛܲܠܝܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dmoekriz-lhoon hemizman gaw parge, ṣle-lhoon laṭalya.
ENG: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia;

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Min tama deerhoon byama lanṭyookhy, ayka dpeeshe ywaw moetbe tkhoot shapaqat dalaha qa poelkhana dadeea toemimeh ywaw.
ENG: and thence they sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dte-lhoon tama, joemi' lhoon l'edta o hoeqe-lhoon kl mindee d'weed-leh Alaha 'amayhy, o dakhee dpteekh-leh tar'a dhaymanoeta oep limwate.
ENG: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all things that God had done with them, and how that he had opened a door of faith unto the Gentiles.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O peesh-lhoon tama lkis talmeede raba 'dana.
ENG: And they tarried no little time with the disciples.

ASY: ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܘܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܪܝܼܩܹܐ.“
TRL: Ṣle-lhoon nashe min eehoed lanṭyookhy o maloepe ywaw lakhoonwate, bemara, ”in la paysheetoon gzeere aykh 'adat dmoeshe, le maṣeytoon paysheetoon preeqe.“
ENG: And certain men came down from Judaea and taught the brethren, saying, Except ye be circumcised after the custom of Moses, ye cannot be saved.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܕܘܼܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܹܝܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܣܩܝܼ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Hwe-leh raba shghoeshya o doerasha beylayhy o beyl pawloos o barnwa. Haygah moekhshikh-lhoon dasqee pawloos o barnwa 'am mhoemne khene lkis shleekhe o khwardiqne dgaw oorishlim boet aha 'ilta.
ENG: And when Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and questioning with them, the brethren appointed that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.

ASY: ܡܘܼܦܫܸܛܲܝ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܦܹܘܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܘܫܵܡܪܹܝܢ، ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Moepshiṭay-laha 'edta, 'weerhoon min gaw pewneeqe o shamreyn, o hoeqe-lhoon dakhee oep imwate deerhoon o hoeminhoon. Ane khabre moekhde-lhoon lklayhy akhoonwate.
ENG: They therefore, being brought on their way by the church, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܘܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ. ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-lhoon loorishlim, peesh-lhoon qoeble byad 'edta o shleekhe o khwardiqne. O hoeqe-lhoon ilayhy kl mindee d'weed-leh Alaha bee-ayhy.
ENG: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church and the apostles and the elders, and they rehearsed all things that God had done with them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܘܦܩܝܼܕܹܐ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ.“
TRL: Eena qeem-lhoon khakma min mhoemne deewaw min see'ta dpreeshe, o meerhoon, ”wale-ylaha dnoekhraye payshee gzeere o pqeede dnaṭree namoosa dmoeshe.“
ENG: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees who believed, saying, It is needful to circumcise them, and to charge them to keep the law of Moses.

ASY: ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܠܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Jmee' lhoon shleekhe o khwardiqne lidrasha 'al aha 'ilta.
ENG: And the apostles and the elders were gathered together to consider of this matter.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܘܼܪܵܫܵܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܒܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܘܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ.
TRL: Min bar raba doerasha, kle-leh shim'oon kepa o meereh ilayhy, ”nashe akhoonwate, akhtoon ke yad'eetoon dbyawmane 'weere, min gawawkhoon goebe-leh Alaha dmin poema deeee sham'ee imwate hemizman dewangaleeoon o haminee.
ENG: And when there had been much questioning, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among you, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

ASY: ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܕܥܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܲܕ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: ”Alaha yad'ana dlibawate sheed-leh ilayhy kad yoebil-leh ilayhy roekha dqoedsha, dakhee dyoebil-leh oep ilan.
ENG: And God, which knoweth the heart, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us;

ASY: ”ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܢ ܘܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܘܼܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”La moetiw-leh poershoenya beylan o beylayhy, sabab doeke-leh libayhy bhaymanoeta.
ENG: and he made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܡܲܬܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܢܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܩܕܵܠܵܐ ܕܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܛܵܥܢܲܚ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Adeea qamoodee jaroebe ytoon lalaha bmatawta dneera 'al qdala dtalmeede, haw dla awahatan o la akhnan mṣe lan ṭa'nakh-leh.
ENG: Now therefore why tempt ye God, that ye should put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

ASY: ”ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܦܘܼܪܩܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: ”Ila hamoene ywakh doep akhnan maykh danee peeshe ywakh poerqe byad shapaqat dmaran eeshoo'.“
ENG: But we believe that we shall be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, in like manner as they.

ASY: ܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܫܬܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܗܲܩܘܼܝܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܡܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kleh kinsha shteeq-leh eeman dshmee' lhoon pawloos o barnwa haqoeye boet neeshanqe o doemare d'weed-leh Alaha bee-ayhy gaw imwate.
ENG: And all the multitude kept silence; and they hearkened unto Barnabas and Paul rehearsing what signs and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ،
TRL: Min bar danee preeq-lhoon min hamzoeme, qeem-leh ya'qoow o meereh ilayhy, ”nashe akhoonwate, shmi'moen ilee,
ENG: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Brethren, hearken unto me:

ASY: ”ܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܣܘܼܚܒܸܪܹܗ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܫܩܵܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: ”Shim'oon hoeqe-leh ilawkhoon dakhee min shoeraya Alaha soekhbireh limwate lishqala minayhy 'ama qa ganeh.
ENG: Symeon hath rehearsed how first God did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.

ASY: ”ܘܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܣܲܙܓܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ:
TRL: ”O hemizmane dnwee-e sazgoere yna 'am aha, aykh deeleh kteewa:
ENG: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

ASY: ’ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܒܵܢܹܝܢܹܗ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܬܠܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܒܸܬ ܒܵܢܹܝܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܢܦܝܼܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ.
TRL: ’min bar aha bit dayren o bit baneyneh mashkna ddaweed deeleh tleekha, bit maqimineh mindrish o bit baneyn mindee deeleh npeela mineh.
ENG: After these things I will return, And I will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen; And I will build again the ruins thereof, And I will set it up:

ASY: ’ܕܛܵܥܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܸܡܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ،‘ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ’dṭa'ee lmarya sahma peesha dbnaynasha, klayhy imwate dshimee 'alayhy-yleh,‘ bemara-yleh Marya d'weed-leh ane mindeeane.
ENG: That the residue of men may seek after the Lord, And all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called,

ASY: ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Poelkhane dalaha peeshe yna dee'e min 'alam.
ENG: Saith the Lord, who maketh these things known from the beginning of the world.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܚܫܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܕܒܸܕܝܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: ”Ana makhshoekhe ywin dla 'awdakh-laha 'asqa 'al anee deena min imwate noekhraye dbidyara yna lkis Alaha,
ENG: Wherefore my judgment is, that we trouble not them which from among the Gentiles turn to God;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܵܬܒܲܚ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܲܚܒܸܪܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܪܵܚܩܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܲܡܐܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܢܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena katbakh ilayhy o makhbirakh-lhoon drakhqee min ṭamoeta dṣaname, o min zanyoeta, o min bisra dhaywane khneeqe, o min dima.
ENG: but that we write unto them, that they abstain from the pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from what is strangled, and from blood.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Sabab min dawre qamaye ke makrizee bnamoosa dmoeshe gaw kl mdeeta, o ke qaree-leh kl shabta gaw knoeshyatayhy.“
ENG: For Moses from generations of old hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ، ܘܥܲܡ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܕܓܲܒܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܫܲܕܪܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܥܲܡ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ. ܘܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܲܪ ܫܲܒܵܐ، ܘܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ، ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܗܲܕܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah qṭee' lhoon shleekhe o khwardiqne, o 'am klaha 'edta, dgabee nashe minayhy o shadree-lhoon lanṭyookhy 'am pawloos o barnwa. O goebe-lhoon oep leehoeda dke paesh qirya bar shaba, o lsheela, gawre mhadyane gaw akhoonwate.
ENG: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܚܢܲܢ، ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ، ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܠܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ، ܘܒܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܒܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Shoedirhoon 'amayhy ktawa, bemara, ”akhnan, shleekhe o khwardiqne, deewakh akhoonwatawkhoon, shadoere ywakh shlame lklayhy akhoonwate dmin imwate banṭyookhy, o bsoereea, o bqeeleeqeea.
ENG: and they wrote thus by them, The apostles and the elder brethren unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, greeting:

ASY: ”ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ، ܘܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܝܼܵܠܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Shmee' lan dzeel-lhoon nashe minan lkis lawkhoon dla psasa dee-an, o shgheesh-lhoon ilawkhoon bhemizmane o moeshgish-lhoon kheealawkhoon.
ENG: Forasmuch as we have heard that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls; to whom we gave no commandment;

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܕܓܲܒܲܚ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܲܕܪܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܲܢ̈ ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ،
TRL: ”Boet aha moekhshikh lan dgabakh khakma nashe o shadrakh-lhoon lkis lawkhoon 'am moekhiban barnwa o pawloos,
ENG: it seemed good unto us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܚܲܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܲܝܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”nashe ddweekhay yna khayayhy boet shima dmaran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ASY: ”ܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܘܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: ”Shadoere ywakh 'amayhy eehoeda o sheela damree lawkhoon bhemizman mindee dkteew lan.
ENG: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves also shall tell you the same things by word of mouth.

ASY: ”ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ:
TRL: ”Bseem-laha-leh roekha dqoedsha o oep akhnan dla paesh moetwa 'alawkhoon yoeqra boesh zawda min ane deena ananqaye:
ENG: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;

ASY: ”ܕܪܵܚܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܚܹܐ ܠܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܘܵܢ ܚܢܝܼܩܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ. ܪܵܒܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܢܵܛܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ. ܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Drakhqeetoon min diwkhe dweekhe lṣaname, o min dima, o min khalta dbisra dhaywan khneeqa, o min zanyoeta. Raba ṣpayee bit 'awdeetoon in naṭreetoon ganawkhoon min ane. Poeshoen bshayna.“
ENG: that ye abstain from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication; from which if ye keep yourselves, it shall be well with you. Fare ye well.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ، ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Ane gawre dpeesh-lhoon shoedre ṣle-lhoon lanṭyookhy, joemi' lhoon kinsha min 'edta o yoebil-lhoon igarta ilayhy.
ENG: So they, when they were dismissed, came down to Antioch; and having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dqirya-lhoon, khde-lhoon raba dpeesh-lhoon yoebe liba.
ENG: And when they had read it, they rejoiced for the consolation.

ASY: ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ ܘܫܝܼܠܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܼܠܸܢܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ.
TRL: Eehoeda o sheela, kad bganayhy nwee-e ywaw, yoebil-lhoon liba lakhoonwate o khoelinay-lhoon bhemizman.
ENG: And Judas and Silas, being themselves also prophets, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Min bar dhwe-lhoon tama qa khad zawna, peesh-lhoon shoedre bshlama byad akhoonwate lkis anee dshoedray ywaw.
ENG: And after they had spent some time there, they were dismissed in peace from the brethren unto those that had sent them forth.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Eena sheela bseem-laha-leh dpaesh wa tama.
ENG: But it seemed good to Silas to remain there

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena pawloos o barnwa peesh-lhoon gaw anṭyookhy ayka draba khene 'amayhy malpee waw o makrizee waw hemizman dmarya.
ENG: But Paul and Barnabas tarried in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ، ”ܕܵܝܪܲܚ ܘܬܵܦܩܲܚ ܒܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܲܢ̈ ܒܟܠ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܚܵܙܲܚ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: Min bar khakma yawmane, meereh pawloos lbarnwa, ”dayrakh o tapqakh bakhoonwatan bkl mdeeta dmoekriz lan gawoeha hemizman dmarya, o khazakh dakhee yna.“
ENG: And after some days Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us return now and visit the brethren in every city wherein we proclaimed the word of the Lord, and see how they fare.

ASY: ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܵܪܩܘܿܣ.
TRL: Barnwa ba'e wa labil wa 'amayhy lyookhanan, haw dke paesh qirya marqoos.
ENG: And Barnabas was minded to take with them John also, who was called Mark.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܡܦܘܼܠܝܼܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena pawloos la bseem-laha-leh dlabil wa-leh 'amayhy, sabab shweeqay ywa eeman deewaw gaw pampoeleea, o la zeel-leh 'amayhy lpoelkhana.
ENG: But Paul thought not good to take with them him who withdrew from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܩܲܪܵܨܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܒܲܪܢܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܩܘܿܣ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ.
TRL: Boet aha hwe-laha maqaraṣoeta beylayhy o preesh-lhoon. Barnwa loebil-leh lmarqoos, o zeel-lhoon byama lqiwproos.
ENG: And there arose a sharp contention, so that they parted asunder one from the other, and Barnabas took Mark with him, and sailed away unto Cyprus;

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ، ܟܲܕ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Pawloos goebe-leh lsheela o pleeṭ-leh, kad soepe-lhoon ileh akhoonwate lshapaqat dmarya.
ENG: but Paul chose Silas, and went forth, being commended by the brethren to the grace of the Lord.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ ܘܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܝܹܐ ܠܥܹܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: 'weereh gaw soereea o qeeleeqeea maqwoeye l'edate.
ENG: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܕܲܪܒܹܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܠܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ. ܓܵܘ ܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܬܲܠܡܝܼܕܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܬܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܸܢܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh pawloos ldarbe mdeeta, o min tama lloesṭra. Gaw loesṭra eet wa khad talmeeda shimeh ṭeemateoos, broona dkhda bakhta yhoedayta mhoeminta, eena baboehy yawnaya ywa.
ENG: And he came also to Derbe and to Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewess which believed; but his father was a Greek.

ASY: ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܠܘܼܣܛܪܵܐ ܘܐܝܼܩܵܢܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Akhoonwate dgaw loesṭra o eeqanoon ke hamzimee waw ṣpayee boet dee-eh.
ENG: The same was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܲܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܒܲܣ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܘܓܙܝܼܪܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Pawloos b'e-leh dlabil-leh 'ameh. Bas shqeel-leh o gzeereh, sabab eet waw yhoedaye bhay doeka, o klayhy ke yad'ee waw dbaboehy yawnaya ywa.
ENG: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews that were in those parts: for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: zeel-lhoon min mdeeta lmdeeta bemara lnashe dnaṭree poeqdane dpeesh-lhoon moetbe byad shleekhe o khwardiqne dgaw oorishlim.
ENG: And as they went on their way through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, which had been ordained of the apostles and elders that were at Jerusalem.

ASY: ܘܥܹܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܩܘܝܼܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܙܵܝܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܒܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O 'edate payshee waw moeqwee-e bhaymanoeta, o zaydee waw kl yoom bminyana.
ENG: So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.

ASY: ܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܒܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܦܪܘܼܓ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܘܓܵܠܵܛܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Khdeerhoon pawloos o khawrawateh batra dproegheea o galaṭeea, sabab moeklee-ay-leh roekha dqoedsha min lmakroeze gaw aseea.
ENG: And they went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been forbidden of the Holy Ghost to speak the word in Asia;

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܚܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܘܼܣܝܼܵܐ، ܓ̰ܘܼܪܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܒܹܬܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ.
TRL: Eeman dte-lhoon ltkhoeme dmoeseea, joerib-lhoon d'awree lbetooneea, eena roekha deeshoo' la shweeq-leh ilayhy d'awree.
ENG: and when they were come over against Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia; and the Spirit of Jesus suffered them not;

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܘܼܣܝܼܵܐ ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܛܪܘܿܐܘܿܣ.
TRL: Haygah 'weerhoon min moeseea o ṣle-lhoon lṭroooos.
ENG: and passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.

ASY: ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܵܝܵܐ، ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܬܵܐ ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ ܘܗܲܝܸܪܲܢ.“
TRL: Blayle pawloos khze-leh khizwa dkhad nasha maqedoonaya, kilya parpoele bee-eh o bemara, ”ta lmaqedooneea o hayiran.“
ENG: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There was a man of Macedonia standing, beseeching him, and saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ، ܡܘܼܠܝܸܙ ܠܲܢ ܓ̰ܲܠܕܹܐ ܕܐܵܙܲܠ݇ܚ ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܲܚ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Min bar dkhze-leh pawloos aha khizwa, moelyiz lan jalde dazakh lmaqedooneea, sabab qṭee' lan dalaha qiryan eewa dmakrizakh ilayhy.
ENG: And when he had seen the vision, straightway we sought to go forth into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܛܪܘܿܐܘܿܣ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܬܪܘܼܨܵܐ ܠܣܵܡܘܿܬܪܵܩܹܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܢܹܐܵܦܘܿܠܝܼܣ.
TRL: O min ṭroooos ṭre lan o zeel lan troeṣa lsamootraqe, o byawma khena lneapoolees.
ENG: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis;

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ، ܩܘܿܠܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ. ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O min tama zeel lan lpeeleepoos, qoolooneea roomayta, o mdeeta qamayta boekhdana dmaqedooneea. O peesh lan gaw aha mdeeta khakma yawmane.
ENG: and from thence to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the first of the district, a Roman colony: and we were in this city tarrying certain days.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܲܢ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܢܲܗܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ. ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Byawma dshabta pleeṭ lan lbadar min tar'a dmdeeta lmarza dnahra ayka dkhsheew lan deet wa doeka dṣloota. teew lan tama o hoemzim lan 'am bakhtate djmee'e ywaw.
ENG: And on the sabbath day we went forth without the gate by a river side, where we supposed there was a place of prayer; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which were come together.

ASY: ܚܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܘܼܕܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܙܲܒܢܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܓܘܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܬܹܐܘܿܛܝܼܪܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܘܼܗ̇ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Khda min anee bakhtate loedeea ywa, zabnanta dargwana, saghdanta dalaha, min mdeeta dteooṭeera. Aha pteekh-leh liboeha Marya, o moeṣyit-laha lmindeeane dhamzoemay ywaw pawloos.
ENG: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one that worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, to give heed unto the things which were spoken by Paul.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗ̇ܝ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܗ̇، ܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ، ܬܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܘܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܝܼ.“ ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܠܝܸܨܵܐ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: Min bar d'meed-laha hay o kleh baytoeha, poerpil-laha bee-an bemara, ”in bikhshawa ytoon dhoeminta ywan bmaran, teymoen o poeshoen gaw baytee.“ o raba qam malyiṣa lan.
ENG: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.

ASY: ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܨܠܘܿܬܵܐ، ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܚܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܨܵܡܵܐ. ܟܹܐ ܡܲܝܬܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܒܩܨܵܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: Hwe-laha kad bezala ywakh waw ldoeka dṣloota, tpeeq-laha bee-an khda khamta deet wa-laha roekha dqṣama. Ke maytya wa raba zoeze qa marawatoeha bqṣamta.
ENG: And it came to pass, as we were going to the place of prayer, that a certain maid having a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܵܬ݇ܪܲܢ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ، ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: Aha brata betaya ywa bar pawloos o baran maqwoekhe o bemara, ”ane nashe eena regawate dalaha 'ilaya, o makroeze yna ilawkhoon oerkha dpoerqana.“
ENG: The same following after Paul and us cried out, saying, These men are servants of the Most High God, which proclaim unto you the way of salvation.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܣܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ”ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ ܕܦܵܠܛܲܬܝ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇.“ ܘܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: 'weed-laha hadkha raba yawmane, bkharta sqeed-leh pawloos o deereh o meereh lhay roekha, ”bshima deeshoo' msheekha bipqada ywin ilakhy dpalṭaty minoeha.“ o har bhay 'dana pleeṭ-laha minoeha.
ENG: And this she did for many days. But Paul, being sore troubled, turned and said to the spirit, I charge thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And it came out that very hour.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܘܼܗ̇ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܸܢܘܼܗ̇ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܩܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܓܪܝܼܫܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon marawatoeha dzeel-laha minoeha hewee dqnayta dzoeze, dweeq-lhoon lpawloos o lsheela o greeshay-lhoon lshoeqa qam goerane.
ENG: But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they laid hold on Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers,

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܒܸܚܒ݂ܵܛܘܼܗ̇ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܲܢ،
TRL: O kad moetyay-lhoon lkis shaleeṭe, meerhoon, ”ane nashe yhoedaye yna, o bikhwaṭoeha yna mdeetan,
ENG: and when they had brought them unto the magistrates, they said, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,

ASY: ”ܘܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܥܵܕܲܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܩܲܒܠܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“
TRL: ”O makroeze yna ilan 'adate dle-ylaha qanoonayta ilan dqablakh-lhoon o la d'awdakh-lhoon, sabab akhnan roomaye ywakh.“
ENG: and set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to receive, or to observe, being Romans.

ASY: ܨܦܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܠܚܹܐ ܘܡܸܚܝܹܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ṣpeekh-leh 'alayhy kinsha raba, o pqeed-lhoon shaleeṭe dpayshee waw shoelkhe o mikhye bshawṭe.
ENG: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent their garments off them, and commanded to beat them with rods.

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܸܚܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܛܹܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܗܸܫܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O min bar dmikhyay-lhoon raba, diryay-lhoon gaw beyt aseere, o pqeed-lhoon lnaṭoora dbeyt aseere dnaṭerhoon bhishyaroeta.
ENG: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ، ܕܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܩܵܘܕܵܐ.
TRL: O haw kad qoebil-leh hadkha poeqdana, diryay-leh gaw bayta gawaya dbeyt aseere, o seereh aqlatayhy bqawda.
ENG: who, having received such a charge, cast them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.

ASY: ܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܫܲܒܘܼܚܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܫܡܵܥܲܝ.
TRL: Bpalga dlayle pawloos o sheela ṣaloeye ywaw o shaboekhe lalaha, o aseere bishma'ay.
ENG: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns unto God, and the prisoners were listening to them;

ASY: ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܘܕܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܢܝܲܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܣܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Minshiltane hwe-leh rawdana goera, o sh'eesh-lhoon binyate dbeyt aseere. Har bhay 'dana pteekh-lhoon klayhy tar'ane o shre-lhoon isoere dklayhy aseere.
ENG: and suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison-house were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened; and every one’s bands were loosed.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܹܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܩܵܛܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܪܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad r'eesh-leh naṭoora dbeyt aseere o khze-leh tar'ane pteekhe, shqeel-leh saypa o b'e-leh dqaṭel wa-laha ganeh, sabab khsheew-leh 'reeqe ywaw aseere.
ENG: And the jailor being roused out of sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword, and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܠܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ. ܟܠܲܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.“
TRL: Eena pawloos qre-leh ileh bqala rama o meereh, ”la 'awdet lganoekh beeshta. Klan lakha ywakh.“
ENG: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.

ASY: ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܫܪܵܓ݂݇ܝܵܐ ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܘܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܪܲܬܪܘܼܬܹܐ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܫܝܼܠܵܐ.
TRL: Ṭleeb-leh naṭoora shraya o rkheeṭ-leh lgawa kad ratroete, o npeel-leh qam aqlate dpawloos o sheela.
ENG: And he called for lights, and sprang in, and, trembling for fear, fell down before Paul and Silas,

ASY: ܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܡܵܪ̈ܲܝ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܐ؟“
TRL: Poelṭay-leh lbadar o boeqireh minayhy, ”maray, moodee 'awden dpayshen poerqa?“
ENG: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܩܹܬ، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: O anee joewib-lhoon, ”hamin bmaran eeshoo' o bit parqet, at o kleh baytoekh.“
ENG: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus, and thou shalt be saved, thou and thy house.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: Haygah hoemzim-lhoon ileh hemizman dmarya o lklayhy anee dgaw bayteh.
ENG: And they spake the word of the Lord unto him, with all that were in his house.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܘܚܘܼܠܸܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܲܝܗܝ، ܘܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܹܗ.
TRL: Loeblay-leh bhay 'dana blayle, o khoelilay-leh min darbatayhy, o 'meed-leh haw o klayhy nashe dbayteh.
ENG: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, immediately.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ، ܘܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Loeblay-leh lbayteh o moetiw-leh qamayhy mekhoelta, o khde-lhoon klayhy, haw o nashe dbayteh, sabab hoeminhoon balaha.
ENG: And he brought them up into his house, and set meat before them, and rejoiced greatly, with all his house, having believed in God.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܠܦܲܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܠܢܵܛܘܿܪܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܵܪܹܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh yawma, shoedirhoon shaleeṭe lparashe damree lnaṭoora dbeyt aseere dshare lanee nashe.
ENG: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܠܘܿܛܘܼܢ ܘܙܹܠ݇ܡܘܼܢ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh goera dbeyt aseere lpawloos, ”shaleeṭe bemara yna, dpaysheetoon shirye. Adeea plooṭoen o zemoen bshlama.“
ENG: And the jailor reported the words to Paul, saying, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore come forth, and go in peace.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܘܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ؟ ܠܵܐ. ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܠܲܢ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”mkhe-lhoon ilan dla dyanta qam 'ayne dkleh kinsha kad akhnan roomaye ywakh, o dre-lhoon ilan gaw beyt aseere. Adeea ba'ee dpalṭee lan bṭishwa? La. Shwooq atee bganayhy o palṭee lan.“
ENG: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men that are Romans, and have cast us into prison; and do they now cast us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and bring us out.

ASY: ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: zeel-lhoon parashe o hoeqe-lhoon lshaleeṭe. O kad shmee' lhoon droomaye ywaw, zdee' lhoon.
ENG: And the serjeants reported these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans;

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܚܲܠܬܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis layhy shaleeṭe o ṭleeb-lhoon pakhalta minayhy, o poerpil-lhoon bee-ayhy dpalṭee waw min mdeeta.
ENG: and they came and besought them; and when they had brought them out, they asked them to go away from the city.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܠܘܼܕܝܼܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dpleeṭ-lhoon min beyt aseere, 'weerhoon lbayta dloedeea. Tama khze-lhoon lakhoonwate. Min bar dyoehbay-lhoon liba, pleeṭ-lhoon min tama.
ENG: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.

ASY: ܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܡܦܝܼܦܘܿܠܝܼܣ ܘܐܵܦܘܿܠܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܹܣܵܠܘܿܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khdeerhoon pawloos o sheela gaw mdeenate dampeepoolees o apoolooneea, o te-lhoon ltesalooneeqe, ayka deet wa knoeshta dyhoedaye.
ENG: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܕܲܬ. ܘܩܵܐ ܬܠܵܬ ܫܲܒܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: 'weereh pawloos lknoeshta aykh deet wa-leh 'adat. O qa tlat shabate hwe-leh bidrasha 'amayhy min ktabe.
ENG: and Paul, as his custom was, went in unto them, and for three sabbath days reasoned with them from the scriptures,

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܘܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܘܩܵܐܹܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Kad pashoeqe o madoe'e ilayhy dwale ywa dmsheekha qabil wa khasha o qaem wa min gaw meete, bemara, ”aha eeshoo' dana makroeze ywin ilawkhoon msheekha-yleh.“
ENG: opening and alleging, that it behoved the Christ to suffer, and to rise again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom, said he, I proclaim unto you, is the Christ.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܬܒܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܕܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khakma min yhoedaye hoeminhoon o tbee' lhoon lpawloos o lsheela, o hadkha oep raba min yawnaye zad'ane min Alaha, o khad minyana ṣpayee dbakhtate dee'e.
ENG: And some of them were persuaded, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܚܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܩܵܐ، ܘܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܨܦܵܚܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܵܣܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ. ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܲܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: Eena yhoedaye khene boekhil-lhoon, o dweeq-lhoon nashe beeshe min shoeqa, o joemi' lhoon kinsha raba o moeshgish-lhoon lmdeeta, o 'weed-lhoon ṣpakhta 'al bayta deeasoon kad biṭ'aya lpawloos o lsheela. B'e-lhoon dpalṭee waw-lhoon o sapee waw-lhoon lkinsha.
ENG: But the Jews, being moved with jealousy, took unto them certain vile fellows of the rabble, and gathering a crowd, set the city on an uproar; and assaulting the house of Jason, they sought to bring them forth to the people.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܝܼܵܣܘܿܢ ܘܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܒ݂ܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ،
TRL: Eena eeman dla moechkhay-lhoon tama, greesh-lhoon leeasoon o lkhakma akhoonwate lkis reshane dmdeeta, kad maqwoekhe o bemara, ”ane nashe khweeṭ-lhoon lklaha doenye, o adeea mṭe-lhoon lakha,
ENG: And when they found them not, they dragged Jason and certain brethren before the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܵܣܘܿܢ ܩܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ، ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: ”O eeasoon qoeblay-leh gaw bayteh. Ane klayhy biplakha yna dalqoewl dpoeqdana dqesar, kad bemara deet malka khena shimeh eeshoo'.“
ENG: whom Jason hath received: and these all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.

ASY: ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Shgheesh-lhoon reshane dmdeeta o kinsha kad shmee' lhoon ane.
ENG: And they troubled the multitude and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܪ̈ܵܒܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܵܣܘܿܢ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Min bar dshqeel-lhoon 'arabe min eeasoon o min akhoonwate, shiryay-lhoon.
ENG: And when they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܠܒܹܪܘܿܐܵܐ. ܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-leh layle, shoedirhoon akhoonwate lpawloos o lsheela lberooa. Kad mṭe-lhoon tama, 'weerhoon gaw knoeshta dyhoedaye.
ENG: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Beroea: who when they were come thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.

ASY: ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܹܪܘܿܐܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܥܲܠܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܬܹܣܵܠܘܿܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܨܲܚܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܠܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Yhoedaye dgaw berooa raba boesh m'alye ywaw btakhmanta min yhoedaye dgaw tesalooneeqe, sabab qoebil-lhoon lhemizman bṣiwyana ṭawa, o kl yoom ke ṣakhṣee waw ktabe likhzaya in mindeeane dbemaray ywaw pawloos shareere ywaw.
ENG: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, examining the scriptures daily, whether these things were so.

ASY: ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Hoeminhoon raba min yhoedaye, o oep bakhtate yawnaye myoeqre, o raba gawre yawnaye.
ENG: Many of them therefore believed; also of the Greek women of honourable estate, and of men, not a few.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܹܣܵܠܘܿܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܪܘܿܐܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܚܒ݂ܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon yhoedaye dtesalooneeqe dpawloos makroeze ywa hemizman dalaha gaw berooa, te-lhoon oep tama o moeshgish-lhoon o khweeṭ-lhoon lkinsha.
ENG: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed of Paul at Beroea also, they came thither likewise, stirring up and troubling the multitudes.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܝܵܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܪܘܿܐܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah akhoonwate bjaldoeta shoedirhoon lpawloos lyama, eena sheela o ṭeemateoos peesh-lhoon gaw berooa.
ENG: And then immediately the brethren sent forth Paul to go as far as to the sea: and Silas and Timothy abode there still.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܦܫܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܘܼܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܬܹܢܘܿܣ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܸܦܪܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܩܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܫܲܕܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܠܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O anee dmoepshiṭ-lhoon lpawloos moemṭe-lhoon ileh hal atenoos mdeeta. Eeman dbiprasha ywaw pqeeday-leh pawloos dshadree ileh lsheela o lṭeemateoos bjaldoeta.
ENG: But they that conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timothy that they should come to him with all speed, they departed.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܬܹܢܘܿܣ ܠܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܠܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ، ܥܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܡܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad pawloos bispara ywa gaw atenoos lsheela o lṭeemateoos, 'eeq-laha 'aloehy eeman dkhze-leh mdeeta mleeta ṣaname.
ENG: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him, as he beheld the city full of idols.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܠ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܙܵܕܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܓܵܘ ܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܬܵܦܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha ke daresh wa kl yawma gaw knoeshta 'am yhoedaye o yawnaye zad'ane min Alaha, o gaw shoeqa lanee dtapqee waw bee-eh.
ENG: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with them that met with him.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܦܝܼܠܵܣܘܿܦܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܦܝܼܩܘܼܪܘܿܣ ܘܕܐܸܣܛܘܿܐܝܼܩܘܿ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ. ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܩܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܲܒܪܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ،“ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܘܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ.
TRL: Khakma peelasoope min yoelpana dapeeqoeroos o disṭooeeqoo ke darshee waw 'ameh. Khakma minayhy ke amree waw, ”moodee-yleh bemara aha laqṭana dkhabre?“ o khene ke amree waw, ”aha makroeze-yleh boet alahe noekhraye,“ sabab pawloos makroeze ywa boet eeshoo' o qyamta.
ENG: And certain also of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers encountered him. And some said, What would this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܵܓܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܡܲܕܥܸܬ ܠܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟
TRL: Haygah dweeq-lhoon o moete-lhoon ileh lareeoos pagoos o meerhoon ileh, ”ke maṣeyt mad'it lan moodee-yleh aha yoelpana khata dmaloepe ywit?
ENG: And they took hold of him, and brought him unto the Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by thee?

ASY: ”ܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ. ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Bishma'a ywakh dmaloepe ywit mindeeane noekhraye. Ba'akh dyad'akh moodee yna.“
ENG: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.

ASY: ܐܵܬܹܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܘܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Atenaye o klayhy noekhraye 'amrane dtama ke ma'biree waw klaha 'danayhy hamzoeme o bishma'a mindeeane khate.
ENG: (Now all the Athenians and the strangers sojourning there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.)

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܵܓܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܬܹܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܕܒܟܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Haygah kle-leh pawloos gaw areeoos pagoos o meereh, ”nashe atenaye, bikhzayawkhoon eewin dbkl oerkha nashe saghdane dalahe ytoon.
ENG: And Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus, and said, Ye men of Athens, in all things I perceive that ye are somewhat superstitious.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ’ܩܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ.‘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܹܗ ܒܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kad bikhdara ywin wa, khze-lee mindeeane dke saghdeetoon ilayhy. O khze-lee khad madbkha kteewa 'aloehy, ’qa Alaha la dee'a.‘ aha dakhtoon kad la beeda'eh bisghada ytoon ileh, bit makrizin ilawkhoon boet dee-eh.
ENG: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription, TO AN UNKNOWN GOD. What therefore ye worship in ignorance, this set I forth unto you.

ASY: ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܘܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܢܝܹܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”Aha-yleh Alaha dbre-leh ldoenye o kl mindee dgawoeha, haw eeleh mara dshmaya o dar'a, o le khaye gaw haykle binye beedate,
ENG: The God that made the world and all things therein, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;

ASY: ”ܘܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܦܠܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܲܦ̮ܫܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: ”O le paesh pleekha ileh beedate dbnaynasha, o 'al mindee le-yleh sneeqa, sabab haw yoebil-leh lklayhy nashe khaye o nawsha o kl mindee.
ENG: neither is he served by men’s hands, as though he needed anything, seeing he himself giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;

ASY: ”ܘܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ. ܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”O min khad nasha bre-leh lklayhy imwate dbnaynasha dhawee bi'mara 'al pata dklaha ar'a. Preesh-leh ilayhy zawne o doekane ayka dhawee bikhaya,
ENG: and he made of one every nation of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, having determined their appointed seasons, and the bounds of their habitation;

ASY: ”ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܨܲܚܨܝܼ ܘܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܠܹܗ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܢ.
TRL: ”Dhawee biṭ'aya ileh, qawma dṣakhṣee o machkhee-leh, apin dle-yleh rikhqa min kl khad minan.
ENG: that they should seek God, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he is not far from each one of us:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܘܒܸܓ̰ܘܵܓ̰ܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܘܝܼܘܲܚ. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܵܫܘܿܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ’ܕܡܸܢܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܛܘܿܗܡܲܢ.‘
TRL: ”Sabab bee-eh bikhaya ywakh o bijwaja ywakh, o eewakh. Aykh doep khakma mashookhe deeawkhoon meerhoon, ’dmineh-yleh ṭoohman.‘
ENG: for in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain even of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

ASY: ”ܒܲܣ ܐܸܢ ܛܘܿܗܡܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܫܒܲܚ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܡܹܐ ܠܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܢܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܨܲܠܡܲܢܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Bas in ṭoohman min Alaha-yleh, le-ylaha khsheekhta dkhashbakh Alaha ke dame ldahwa yan lsema yan lkepa, nqeera boemanoeta o bṣalmanta dbarnasha.
ENG: Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and device of man.

ASY: ”ܒܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܲܥܒܲܪ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ،
TRL: ”Bzawne dda'bar Alaha 'weereh min aha la da'ta, eena adeea bipqada-yleh lklayhy nashe bkl doeka tawibee,
ENG: The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked; but now he commandeth men that they should all everywhere repent:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab goebe-leh yawma dbee-eh daen l'alma bzadeeqoeta byad nasha dpreesh-leh, o moedi' leh ileh lkl khad eeman dmoeqim-leh ileh min gaw meete.“
ENG: inasmuch as he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܫܵܡܥܲܚ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon boet qyamta min meete, khakma minayhy moeskhirhoon, o khene meerhoon, ”ba'akh dsham'akh minoekh boet aha khda gaha kheta.“
ENG: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said, We will hear thee concerning this yet again.

ASY: ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O pleeṭ-leh pawloos min gawayhy.
ENG: Thus Paul went out from among them.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܬܒܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ. ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܹܘܣܝܼܘܿܣ، ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܵܓܘܿܣ، ܘܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܕܵܡܵܪܝܼܣ، ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Khakma minayhy tbee' lhoon lpawloos o hoeminhoon. Khad minayhy eewa dyanewseeoos, min hadame dareeoos pagoos, o khda bakhta shimoeha damarees, o khene 'amayhy.
ENG: But certain men clave unto him, and believed: among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܬܹܢܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܘܿܪܲܢܬܘܿܣ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh pawloos min atenoos o zeel-leh lqoorantoos.
ENG: After these things he departed from Athens, and came to Corinth.

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܦܘܼܢܛܘܿܣ، ܠܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܛܵܠܝܼܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܠܵܘܕܝܘܿܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܦܩܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ. ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Tama moechikh-leh khad yhoedaya shimeh aqiloos, min bnay poenṭoos, la raba min qam hada teea ywa min eeṭaleea 'am bakhteh preesqila, sabab qlawdyoos qesar pqeeda ywa dklayhy yhoedaye palṭee min roome. Pawloos zeel-leh lkis layhy,
ENG: And he found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome: and he came unto them;

ASY: ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܚܝܵܛܬܵܐ ܕܟ̰ܲܕܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ ܘܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O sabab shoela dpawloos khyaṭta dchadre ywa aykh shoela daqiloos o preesqila, peesh-leh pawloos lkis layhy o pleekh-lhoon m'oedale.
ENG: and because he was of the same trade, he abode with them, and they wrought; for by their trade they were tentmakers.

ASY: ܘܟܠ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܪܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ.
TRL: O kl shabta ke daresh wa gaw knoeshta 'am yhoedaye o yawnaye, o ke jarib wa dmaqbil wa-lhoon dhaminee.
ENG: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܝܼܠܵܐ ܘܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܹܗ ܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Kad ṣle-lhoon sheela o ṭeemateoos min maqedooneea, pawloos dweekha-leh klaha 'daneh lmakroeze hemizman lyhoedaye, deeshoo' eeleh msheekha.
ENG: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was constrained by the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܹܗ ܘܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܢܦܝܼܨ ܠܹܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܕܸܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܪܹܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܸܢܝܲܬܝܼ ܨܦܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena yhoedaye qeem-lhoon ldalqoewleh o gadpee waw. Haygah pawloos npeeṣ-leh joeloehy o meereh ilayhy, ”dimawkhoon breshawkhoon. Min adeea inyatee ṣpeeta-ylaha, o bezala ywin lkis imwate.“
ENG: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook out his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܛܸܛܘܿܣ ܝܘܼܣܛܘܿܣ، ܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-leh pawloos min tama o 'weereh lbayta dkhad nasha shimeh ṭiṭoos yoesṭoos, saghdana dalaha, haw dbayteh bdipna dknoeshta ywa.
ENG: And he departed thence, and went into the house of a certain man named Titus Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.

ASY: ܩܪܝܼܣܦܘܿܣ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܩܘܿܪ̈ܲܢܬܵܝܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܘܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Qreespoos, goera dknoeshta, hoemineh bmaran, haw o kleh bayteh, o raba qoorantaye eeman dshmee' lhoon hoeminhoon o 'meed-lhoon.
ENG: And Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܬܩܹܬ،
TRL: O meereh Marya blayle bkhizwa lpawloos, ”la zad'et, ila hamzim o la shatqet,
ENG: And the Lord said unto Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܠܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܚܲܙܕܸܓ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Sabab ana 'amoekh eewin, o nasha le qaem ldalqoewloekh dkhazdig-loekh, sabab eet-lee 'ama raba baha mdeeta.“
ENG: for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to harm thee: for I have much people in this city.

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܘܐܸܫܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܲܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O peesh-leh pawloos tama khda sheta o ishta yarkhe maloepay hemizman dalaha.
ENG: And he dwelt there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܓܵܐܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Kad galeeoon shaleeṭa dakhaeea ywa, jmee' lhoon yhoedaye o dweeq-lhoon lpawloos o moete-lhoon ileh lkis dayana.
ENG: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul, and brought him before the judgment-seat,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܦܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܵܓ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.“
TRL: O meerhoon, ”aha nasha khapoeṭe-yleh lnashe dsaghdee lalaha boerkhate lbadar min namoosa.“
ENG: saying, This man persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

ASY: ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܐܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܦܠܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܣܸܪܝܵܐ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: B'e-leh pawloos lhamzoeme, eena galeeoon meereh lyhoedaye, ”in aha nasha 'weeda-yleh mindee beesha yan pleema yan sirya, wale-ylaha ilee dsham'enawkhoon,
ENG: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked villany, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܪܵܫܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܸܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܫܪܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena sabab aha khda 'ilta-ylaha boet drashta 'al hemizmane, o shimane, o namoosa ddeeawkhoon, shreymoen-laha bganawkhoon. Ana le ba'eyn dhaweyn dayana dane mindeeane.“
ENG: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves; I am not minded to be a judge of these matters.

ASY: ܘܛܪܝܼܕܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܹܗ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ.
TRL: O ṭreeday-leh min koersyeh ddeewan.
ENG: And he drave them from the judgment-seat.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܣܘܼܣܬܹܢܝܼܣ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܡܚܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܐܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܬܘܼܚܡܸܢܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Haygah klayhy yhoedaye dweeq-lhoon lsoestenees, goera dknoeshta, o mkhe-lhoon ileh qam koersya ddeewan. Eena galeeoon la toekhmineh boet ane.
ENG: And they all laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment-seat. And Gallio cared for none of these things.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܓܵܘ ܩܘܿܪܲܢܬܘܿܣ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ ܘܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ. ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܓܪܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܘܣܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܢܟܪܹܐܘܿܣ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܸܕܪܵܐ.
TRL: Peesh-leh pawloos gaw qoorantoos raba yawmane. Haygah shweeq-leh bshayna lakhoonwate o zeel-leh byama lsoereea 'am preesqila o aqiloos. Min qam dazel wa moegri' leh kawseh gaw qankreoos, sabab ndeera ywa nidra.
ENG: And Paul, having tarried after this yet many days, took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence for Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn his head in Cenchreae: for he had a vow.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ ܘܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܕܪܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kad mṭe-lhoon lapisoos, shweeq-leh pawloos lpreesqila o aqiloos o 'weereh lknoeshta o dreesh-leh 'am yhoedaye.
ENG: And they came to Ephesus, and he left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

ASY: ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܵܐ ܩܒܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: B'e-lhoon mineh dpaesh wa lkis layhy boesh zawda, eena pawloos la qbeel-leh.
ENG: And when they asked him to abide a longer time, he consented not;

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܸܫܒ݂ܵܩܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ.
TRL: Eeman dbishwaqay ywa bshayna, meereh ilayhy, ”in Alaha basma-leh bit dayren mindrish lkis lawkhoon.“ o zeel-leh byama min apisoos.
ENG: but taking his leave of them, and saying, I will return again unto you, if God will, he set sail from Ephesus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܣܘܼܚܒܸܪܹܗ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-leh lqesarya, soekhbireh l'edta dtama, o ṣle-leh lanṭyookhy.
ENG: And when he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and saluted the church, and went down to Antioch.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܛܝܘܿܟ݂ܝ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܠܵܛܝܼܵܐ ܘܕܦܪܘܼܓ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܡܲܩܘܘܼܝܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: Min bar dpeesh-leh gaw anṭyookhy qa khad zawna, khdeereh min doeka ldoeka batra dgalaṭeea o dproegheea, maqwoeye liba dklayhy talmeede.
ENG: And having spent some time there, he departed, and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia in order, stablishing all the disciples.

ASY: ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܵܦܲܠܘܿ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܠܵܠܵܐ ܘܝܵܕܥܵܢܵܐ ܕܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khad nasha yhoedaya shimeh apaloo min 'amrane daliksandreea te-leh lapisoos. Aha khad gawra ywa malala o yad'ana dktabe.
ENG: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, a learned man, came to Ephesus; and he was mighty in the scriptures.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܘܼܠܡܸܕܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܚܲܡܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.
TRL: Peesha ywa toelmida boerkha dmarya, o khameema ywa broekha, o ke hamzim wa o malip wa bmilyoeta boet eeshoo', apin dle yade' wa shwooq min ma'moodeeta dyookhanan.
ENG: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spake and taught carefully the things concerning Jesus, knowing only the baptism of John:

ASY: ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܓܵܘ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ ܘܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ، ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܝܬܲܝܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܦܪܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Shoere-leh hamzoeme bjoerat gaw knoeshta. Eeman dshmee' lhoon ileh preesqila o aqiloos, moete-lhoon ileh lbaytayhy o boesh zawda moeprim-lhoon ileh oerkha dalaha.
ENG: and he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more carefully.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܵܐ، ܚܘܼܦܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܘܼܝܸܪܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ،
TRL: Eeman db'e-leh dazel wa lakhaeea, khoepiṭ-lhoon ileh akhoonwate, o kteew-lhoon ltalmeede dqablee waw-leh. Eeman dmṭe-leh, hoeyireh raba lanee dhoemine ywaw byad shapaqat,
ENG: And when he was minded to pass over into Achaia, the brethren encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him: and when he was come, he helped them much which had believed through grace:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ke daresh wa bkhayla 'am yhoedaye qam kinsha, o ke makhze wa min ktabe deeshoo' eeleh msheekha.
ENG: for he powerfully confuted the Jews, and that publicly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܵܦܲܠܘܿ ܓܵܘ ܩܘܿܪܲܢܬܘܿܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܐܲܬܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: Kad apaloo gaw qoorantoos eewa, pawloos khdeereh gaw atrawate 'ilaye o te-leh lapisoos. Tama khze-leh khakma talmeede.
ENG: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper country came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples:

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ”ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ.“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy, ”qoebil lawkhoon roekha dqoedsha eeman dhoeminawkhoon?“ anee joewib-lhoon, ”la, oep le ywakh shmee'e deet roekha dqoedsha.“
ENG: and he said unto them, Did ye receive the Holy Ghost when ye believed? And they said unto him, Nay, we did not so much as hear whether the Holy Ghost was given.

ASY: ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܒܲܣ ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟“ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܒܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ.“
TRL: Boeqireh minayhy pawloos, ”bas bmoodee 'meed lawkhoon?“ o anee joewib-lhoon, ”bma'moodeeta dyookhanan.“
ENG: And he said, Into what then were ye baptized? And they said, Into John’s baptism.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܝܘܿܚܲܢܵܢ ܡܘܼܥܡܸܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: meereh ilayhy pawloos, ”yookhanan moe'mid-leh ma'moodeeta dtyawoeta, bemara l'ama dhaminee waw bhaw dbetaya ywa bareh, deeleh eeshoo'.“
ENG: And Paul said, John baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Jesus.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon aha, 'meed-lhoon bshima dmaran eeshoo'.
ENG: And when they heard this, they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܢܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: O moetiw-leh eeda 'alayhy pawloos o ṣle-leh roekha dqoedsha 'alayhy, o hoemzim-lhoon blishane o noebe-lhoon.
ENG: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

ASY: ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O klayhy ane eewaw aykh tri'sar gawre.
ENG: And they were in all about twelve men.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ، ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: 'weereh pawloos lknoeshta o hoemzim-leh bjoerat tama qa tlata yarkhe, bidrasha bkhayla boet malkoeta dalaha.
ENG: And he entered into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, reasoning and persuading as to the things concerning the kingdom of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܼܩܫܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܸܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܲܕܪܲܫܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܛܘܼܪܵܢܘܿܣ.
TRL: Eena nashe minayhy moeqshe-lhoon libayhy o la moeṣyit-lhoon, o hoemzim-lhoon sirya 'al oerkha qam kinsha. Haygah pawloos pleeṭ-leh min lkis layhy, o shqeel-leh talmeede 'ameh, o kl yoom ke daresh wa gaw madrashta dkhad nasha shimeh ṭoeranoos.
