ENG: But when some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Aha greesh-laha tartey shine, o hadkha klayhy yhoedaye o yawnaye dbi'mara ywaw gaw oekhdana daseea shmee' lhoon hemizman dmarya.
ENG: And this continued for the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.

ASY: ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ،
TRL: O 'weed-leh Alaha khayle goere byad pawloos,
ENG: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܝܵܠܸܚܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܕܵܩܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܲܬܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܘܒܵܣܡܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Hadkha dyalikhyate o barwane ddaqree waw bpaghreh maytee waw o matwee waw-lhoon 'al mree'e o basmee waw, o oep roekhe beeshe palṭee waw minayhy.
ENG: insomuch that unto the sick were carried away from his body handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܕܦܲܠܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ”ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Khakma yhoedaye dbikhdara ywaw o jaroebe dpalṭee waw roekhe beeshe min nashe bshima dmaran eeshoo', ke amree waw, ”bshima deeshoo', haw dpawloos makroeze-yleh, bipqada ywin ilawkhoon dpalṭeetoon.“
ENG: But certain also of the strolling Jews, exorcists, took upon them to name over them which had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, I adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.

ASY: ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܣܩܹܘܵܐ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Shaw'a bnoone dkhad nasha yhoedaya shimeh sqewa, goera dkahne, ke 'awdee waw aha.
ENG: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, a chief priest, which did this.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇، ”ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܵܢ، ܘܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܵܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ؟“
TRL: Joewib-laha ilayhy roekha beeshta o meeraha, ”leeshoo' ke yad'an, o lpawloos ke yad'an, eena akhtoon manee ytoon?“
ENG: And the evil spirit answered and said unto them, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?

ASY: ܘܫܘܝܼܪܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܓ݂ܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܸܚܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܲܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܥܪܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: O shweereh 'alayhy haw nasha deet wa bee-eh roekha beeshta, o ghleeb-leh lklayhy, o mikhyay-leh, hadkha dshoelkhaye o darbane 'reeq-lhoon min haw bayta.
ENG: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and mastered both of them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܩܝܼܪܵܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Kad peesh-laha dee'ta aha lklayhy yhoedaye o yawnaye 'amrane dgaw apisoos, npeel-laha zdoe'ta 'al klayhy, o peesh-leh khqeera shima dmaran eeshoo'.
ENG: And this became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, that dwelt at Ephesus; and fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܵܘܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܫܘܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܲܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Raba min anee dhoeminhoon ke atee waw o mawdee waw galyaeet bshoelane d'weeday ywaw.
ENG: Many also of them that had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܬܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܩܕܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ. ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܛܝܼܡܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܫܒܘܼܢܵܐ ܠܚܲܡܫܝܼ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܹܐܡܵܐ.
TRL: Oep raba kharashe joemi' lhoon ktabayhy o moeqday-lhoon qam klayhy. Khoeshbinhoon ṭeemayhy o seeq-leh khishboena lkhamshee alpe dsema.
ENG: And not a few of them that practised curious arts brought their books together, and burned them in the sight of all: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha prees-laha o goerwis-laha hemizman dmarya bkhayla.
ENG: So mightily grew the word of the Lord and prevailed.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ ܘܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ.“
TRL: Min bar ane, moetiw-leh pawloos blibeh dazel loorishlim min gaw maqedooneea o akhaeea, meereh, ”min bar dazen tama, ba'eyn dkhazeyn oep lroome.“
ENG: Now after these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܸܪ̈ܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܘܐܵܪܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ.
TRL: Shoedireh trey min hayiranoehy, ṭeemateoos o arisṭoos, lmaqedooneea, o haw peesh-leh gaw aseea qa khad mitkha.
ENG: And having sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O hwe-leh bhaw zawna raba shghoeshya 'al oerkha dmsheekhayoeta.
ENG: And about that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܚܵܫܹܠ ܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܕܝܼܡܲܛܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܕܟܹܐ ܬܲܪܸܨ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܪܛܹܡܝܼܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܣܹܐܡܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܡܛܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܐܘܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eet wa khad khashel sema shimeh deemaṭreeoos dke tariṣ wa ṣaname darṭemees min sema, o ke mamṭe wa yoetrana raba loemane.
ENG: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines of Diana, brought no little business unto the craftsmen;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܩܢܵܝܬܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: Aha joemi' leh lklayhy nashe dke palkhee waw bshoela doemanoeta o meereh ilayhy, ”ya nashe, ke yad'eetoon dqnaytan min aha poelkhana-ylaha,
ENG: whom he gathered together, with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this business we have our wealth.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܲܪܥܘܼܫܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܡܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܬܘܼܪܨܹܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Adeea bikhzaya ytoon o bishma'a dakhee aha pawloos mar'oeshe-yleh o madoere nashe raba, la akhchee gaw apisoos, eena khacha paysha bklaha aseea, bemara dalahe dpeeshe yna toerṣe beedate le yna alahe.
ENG: And ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܬܲܓܵܪܘܼܬܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܪܛܹܡܝܼܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܠܵܗܬܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܣܓ݂ܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܒܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܘܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܣܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܘܼܗ̇.“
TRL: ”Adeea la akhchee bizda'a ywakh dtagaroetan bit baṭla, eena oep haykla darṭemees alahta goerta bit paesh moesleea, o oep alahta bganoeha dke paysha sgheedta baseea o bklaha doenye bit paesh sleeba khiqroeha.“
ENG: and not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana be made of no account, and that she should even be deposed from her magnificence, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܪܛܹܡܝܼܣ ܕܐܵܦܸܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Kad shmee' lhoon ane, peesh-lhoon milye khimta, o moeqwikh-lhoon o meerhoon, ”goerta-ylaha arṭemees dapisaye.“
ENG: And when they heard this, they were filled with wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.

ASY: ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܵܥܬܵܐ ܘܓܘܼܪܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܠܓܵܐܝܼܘܿܣ ܘܠܐܵܪܸܣܛܲܪܟ݂ܘܿܣ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ.
TRL: Shgheesh-laha klaha mdeeta, o rkheeṭ-lhoon klayhy ldoeka djma'ta o goergish-lhoon 'amayhy lgaeeoos o larisṭarkhoos, nashe maqedoonaye deewaw khawrawate dpawloos boerkha.
ENG: And the city was filled with the confusion: and they rushed with one accord into the theatre, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܟܸܣ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܟܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Pawloos b'e-leh d'aber lkis kinsha, eena talmeede qam maklee-leh.
ENG: And when Paul was minded to enter in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܵܥܬܵܐ.
TRL: Oep khakma min goerane daseea, khawrawate dpawloos, shoedirhoon lkis-leh parpoele bee-eh dla 'aber ldoeka djma'ta.
ENG: And certain also of the chief officers of Asia, being his friends, sent unto him, and besought him not to adventure himself into the theatre.

ASY: ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kinsha shgheesha ywa. Khakma maqwoekhe ywaw khad mindee, o anee khene khad mindee khena. O raba minayhy le ywaw beeda'a qamoodee jmee'e ywaw tama.
ENG: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was in confusion; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.

ASY: ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܵܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܘܿܣ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܓ̰ܲܘܸܒ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: Yhoedaye deet waw tama moete-lhoon laqama khad yhoedaya shimeh aliksandroos, o ṭleeb-lhoon mineh dhamzim wa. Aha sh'eesh-leh eedeh o b'e-leh djawib wa boet ganeh qa kinsha.
ENG: And they brought Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made a defence unto the people.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܚܲܕ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܣܵܥܲܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܪܛܹܡܝܼܣ ܕܐܵܦܸܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eena kad dee' lhoon dyhoedaya ywa, moeqwikh-lhoon klayhy bkhad qala qa mitkha dtartey sa'ate, bemara, ”goerta-ylaha arṭemees dapisaye.“
ENG: But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܵܦܸܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܵܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܦܸܣܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܢܵܛܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܕܐܵܪܛܹܡܝܼܣ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܘܕܨܲܠܡܘܼܗ̇ ܕܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ،
TRL: Eena sapra dmdeeta moeshle-leh lkinsha o meereh, ”nashe apisaye, klaha doenye ke yad'a dmdeeta dapisaye eelaha naṭranta dhaykla darṭemees goerta, o dṣalmoeha dṣle-leh min shmaya,
ENG: And when the townclerk had quieted the multitude, he saith, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there who knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is temple-keeper of the great Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܸܣܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܗ̇، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܫܸܠܝܹܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܡܲܠܝܲܙܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kad ane le atee lisrawa, o nasha le maṣe hamzim dalqoewloeha, wale-ylaha dhaweytoon shilye o la 'awdeetoon mindee bmalyazta.
ENG: Seeing then that these things cannot be gainsaid, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash.

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܠܝܼܒܹܐ ܗܲܝܟܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܓܕܝܼܦܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܬܲܢ.
TRL: ”Moete lawkhoon ane nashe lakha kad le yna sleebe haykle o la gdeepe 'al alahtan.
ENG: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of our goddess.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܼܡܲܛܪܝܼܘܿܣ ܘܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܒܐܘܼܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܕܲܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܸܠܬܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”In aha deemaṭreeoos o khawrawateh boemanoeta eet-lhoon qwalta 'al khad nasha, eet deewan o eet dayane. Shwooqoen dmaqriwee 'iltayhy khad lhaw khena.
ENG: If therefore Demetrius, and the craftsmen that are with him, have a matter against any man, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls: let them accuse one another.

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓ̰ܡܵܥܬܵܐ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O in eet mindee zawda dbiṭlaba ytoon, bit paesh shirya gaw jma'ta qanoonayta.
ENG: But if ye seek anything about other matters, it shall be settled in the regular assembly.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܘܲܢܕܹܢܘܿܣ ܝܼܘܲܚ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܠܝܼܡܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܩܲܘܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.“
TRL: ”Adeea gaw qewandenoos eewakh dpayshakh leeme boet shghoeshya dhwe-leh idyoom yawma, o le maṣakh jawibakh mindee 'al daha, sabab layt wa 'ilta dqawim wa aha mindee.“
ENG: For indeed we are in danger to be accused concerning this day’s riot, there being no cause for it: and as touching it we shall not be able to give account of this concourse.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܒܘܼܪܒܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dmeereh ane, boerbiz-leh lkinsha.
ENG: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ، ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dshle-leh shghoeshya gaw apisoos, qre-leh pawloos ltalmeede, o yoehbay-leh liba, shweeqay-leh o pleeṭ-leh zeel-leh lmaqedooneea.
ENG: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul having sent for the disciples and exhorted them, took leave of them, and departed for to go into Macedonia.

ASY: ܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khdeereh bhaw atra, o yoebil-leh liba lnashe bhemizmane raba o te-leh latra dyawnaye.
ENG: And when he had gone through those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܠܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ ܕܕܵܐܹܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Peesh-leh tama tlata yarkhe. Haw hdeera ywa lezala lsoereea, eena qṭee' leh blibeh ddaer min gaw maqedooneea bhay dyhoedaye 'weed-lhoon boeṣa 'aloehy.
ENG: And when he had spent three months there, and a plot was laid against him by the Jews, as he was about to set sail for Syria, he determined to return through Macedonia.

ASY: ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܣܹܘܦܵܛܪܘܿܣ، ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܹܪܘܿܐܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܪܸܣܛܲܪܟ݂ܘܿܣ ܘܣܲܩܘܼܢܕܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܹܣܵܠܘܿܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܘܓܵܐܝܼܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܲܪܒܹܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܛܘܼܟ݂ܝܼܩܘܿܣ ܘܛܪܘܿܦܝܼܡܘܿܣ.
TRL: Pleeṭ-lhoon 'ameh sewpaṭroos, broona dpoeroos min berooa mdeeta, o arisṭarkhoos o saqoendoos min tesalooneeqe, o gaeeoos min darbe mdeeta, o ṭeemateoos, o min aseea ṭoekheeqoos o ṭroopeemoos.
ENG: And there accompanied him as far as Asia Sopater of Beroea, the son of Pyrrhus; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܲܢ، ܘܣܦܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܛܪܘܿܐܘܿܣ.
TRL: Ane zeel-lhoon min qam dee-an, o speerhoon 'alan gaw ṭroooos.
ENG: But these had gone before, and were waiting for us at Troas.

ASY: ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܲܛܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܛܪܘܿܐܘܿܣ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Akhnan ṭre lan byama min peeleepoos min bar 'eda dpaṭeere. Min bar khamsha yawmane mṭe lan lkis layhy bṭroooos. Peesh lan tama shaw'a yawmane.
ENG: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we tarried seven days.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܠܸܩܨܵܝܵܐ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ، ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ. ܘܡܘܼܪܝܸܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܲܡܬܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma qamaya dshabta jmee' lan liqṣaya lakhma, o shoere-leh pawloos lhamzoeme. O moeryikha-leh hamzamteh hal palga dlayle, sabab byawma khena hdeera ywa dazel wa.
ENG: And upon the first day of the week, when we were gathered together to break bread, Paul discoursed with them, intending to depart on the morrow; and prolonged his speech until midnight.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܲܡܦܹܝ̈ܕܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܸܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Eet waw lampeyde raba gaw 'ileeta djmee'e ywakh waw gawoeha.
ENG: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where we were gathered together.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܸܘܛܝܼܟ݂ܘܿܣ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܵܘܹܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܫܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܲܩܘܼܪܬܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܫܸܢܬܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܒܵܩܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܩܝܼܠܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O eet wa tama khad 'layma shimeh iwṭeekhoos teewa gaw kawe, 'weera bshinta yaqoerta. O kad moeryikha-leh pawloos hemizman qa raba 'dana, haw 'layma 'weera bshinta npeel-leh min tabaqa dtlata, o peesh-leh shqeela kad meeta.
ENG: And there sat in the window a certain young man named Eutychus, borne down with deep sleep; and as Paul discoursed yet longer, being borne down by his sleep he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.

ASY: ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܚܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Ṣle-leh pawloos, o npeel-leh 'aloehy o khpeeq-leh, o meereh ilayhy, ”la zad'eetoon, khaya-yleh.“
ENG: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Make ye no ado; for his life is in him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܥܸܠܸܠ، ܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܙܪܵܩܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: seeq-leh mindrish 'ilil, qṣe-leh lakhma o kheel-leh. O min bar dhoemzim-leh hal zraqa dshimsha, zeel-leh.
ENG: And when he was gone up, and had broken the bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: nashe loebil-lhoon lhaw 'layma khaya lbayta, o raba khde-lhoon.
ENG: And they brought the lad alive, and were not a little comforted.

ASY: ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܵܣܘܿܣ، ܕܫܵܩܠܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܙܘܼܗ̇ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܒܸܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: Akhnan zeel lan qamayta bgamee o ṭre lan lasoos, dshaqlakh wa lpawloos 'aman min tama, sabab hadkha moeryizoeha ywa dhaw bit azel wa ltama bbirza.
ENG: But we, going before to the ship, set sail for Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, intending himself to go by land.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܘܿܣ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܡܝܼܛܘܿܠܝܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: Eeman dtpeeq-leh bee-an gaw asoos, shqeel lan ileh o te lan lmeeṭooleene.
ENG: And when he met us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܝܼܘܿܣ. ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܣܵܡܘܿܣ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܡܝܼܠܹܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: Byawma khena ṭre lan min tama o te lan lbalqoewl dgazarta dkeeoos. O byawma khena te lan lsamoos, o byawma dbar mineh lmeeleṭoos.
ENG: And sailing from thence, we came the following day over against Chios; and the next day we touched at Samos; and the day after we came to Miletus.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܩܛܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܠܸܒܹܗ ܕܛܵܪܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܲܪܩܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܝܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܥܹܐܕܵܐ ܕܦܲܢܛܹܩܘܼܣܛܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Pawloos qṭee'a ywa blibeh dṭare wa min lkis apisoos dla 'arqil wa gaw aseea, sabab malyoeze ywa din maṣe wa qa 'eda dpanṭeqoesṭe hawe wa gaw oorishlim.
ENG: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, that he might not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hastening, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܠܹܛܘܿܣ ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܠܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Min meeleṭoos shoedireh lapisoos o qre-leh lkhwardiqne d'edta.
ENG: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to him the elders of the church.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dte-lhoon lkis-leh, meereh ilayhy, ”akhtoon ke yad'eetoon dha min yawma qamaya d'weeree laseea dakhee hwe-lee lkis lawkhoon klaha 'dana,
ENG: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, after what manner I was with you all the time,

ASY: ”ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܕܸܡܥܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܓ̰ܘܼܪ̈ܵܒܹܐ ܕܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܘܼܨܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Biplakha lmarya bkl makeekhoeta o bdim'e, o bjoerabe dtpeeq-lhoon beeee min boeṣe dyhoedaye.
ENG: serving the Lord with all lowliness of mind, and with tears, and with trials which befell me by the plots of the Jews:

ASY: ”ܘܠܵܐ ܚܣܝܼܟ݂ ܠܝܼ ܕܡܲܟܪܸܙܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ، ܘܕܡܲܠܦܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ،
TRL: ”O la khseekh-lee dmakrizin wa ilawkhoon mindee deet-leh yoetrana, o dmalpin wa lawkhoon galyaeet, o min bayta lbayta,
ENG: how that I shrank not from declaring unto you anything that was profitable, and teaching you publicly, and from house to house,

ASY: ”ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”O ke yaben wa sahdoeta lyhoedaye o lyawnaye ddayree lkis Alaha btyawoeta, o haminee bmaran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: testifying both to Jews and to Greeks repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܘܸܡ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: ”O adeea kad peesha ywin seera broekha, bezala ywin loorishlim. Le ywin beeda'a moodee bit qawim ilee tama.
ENG: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:

ASY: ”ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܕܸܥ ܠܝܼ ܕܒܟܠ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܵܦܩܝܼ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: ”Roekha dqoedsha akhchee ke madi' lee dbkl mdeeta beyt aseere o oelṣane bit tapqee beeee.
ENG: save that the Holy Ghost testifieth unto me in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܘܼܗ̇ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܛܝܼܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܕܬܲܡܸܡܸܢ ܪܲܗܛܝܼ ܘܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܠܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܠܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eena ana le ywin bikhshawoeha khad mindee ganee deet-laha ṭeema lkis-lee, dtamimin rahṭee o khilmat dsoepe-leh ilee Maran eeshoo', lishada lewangaleeoon dshapaqat dalaha.
ENG: But I hold not my life of any account, as dear unto myself, so that I may accomplish my course, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܗܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܕܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܦܵܬܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܕܚܕܝܼܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”O adeea, ha, ana beeda'a ywin, dmindrish patee le khazeytoon-laha klawkhoon, akhtoon dkhdeeree gawawkhoon o moekriz-lee malkoeta.
ENG: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I went about preaching the kingdom, shall see my face no more.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ، ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: ”Boet aha bemara ywin ilawkhoon idyoom, dikhya ywin min dima dklayhy nashe,
ENG: Wherefore I testify unto you this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܫܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܡܲܕܘܼܥܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab la shle-lee min lmadoe'awkhoon kleh ṣiwyana dalaha.
ENG: For I shrank not from declaring unto you the whole counsel of God.

ASY: ”ܢܛܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܪܥܝܼܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܩܲܡ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܲܦܸܣܩܘܿܦܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇، ܕܡܲܪܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܙܒ݂ܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܕܸܡܹܗ.
TRL: ”Nṭooroen lganawkhoon o lklaha mar'eeta, hay dqam 'abed lawkhoon roekha dqoedsha apisqoope 'aloeha, dmar'eytoon l'edta dmsheekha, hay dzweena-leh bdimeh.
ENG: Take heed unto yourselves, and to all the flock, in the which the Holy Ghost hath made you bishops, to feed the church of God, which he purchased with his own blood.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܹܐܒܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܛܘܿܦܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܥܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana beeda'a ywin dmin bar dazen bit 'awree gawawkhoon debe khaṭoope, o le 'awdee rakhme 'al mar'eeta.
ENG: I know that after my departing grievous wolves shall enter in among you, not sparing the flock;

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܟ̰ܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܘܓܵܪܫܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: ”Oep min gawawkhoon bit qaymee nashe dbit hamzimee mindeeane pcheele o garshee talmeede barayhy.
ENG: and from among your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ. ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܬܠܵܬ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܒܐܝܼܡܵܡܵܐ، ܠܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܡܲܪܬܝܼܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܥܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: ”Boet aha hweymoen r'eeshe. Dkhooroen dla shle-lee tlat shine, blayle o beemama, leeawa marteeanoeta bdim'e d'ayne lkl khad minawkhoon.
ENG: Wherefore watch ye, remembering that by the space of three years I ceased not to admonish every one night and day with tears.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܣܲܦܘܼܝܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܒܵܢܝܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O adeea sapoeyawkhoon eewin balaha o bhemizman dshapaqateh, hay dke maṣya banya lawkhoon o yawa lawkhoon yartoeta 'am klayhy qadeeshe.
ENG: And now I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you the inheritance among all them that are sanctified.

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܘܼܗܘܸܬܵܐ ܠܣܹܐܡܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Le ywin shoehwita lsema yan ldahwa yan ljoele doep khad nasha.
ENG: I coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.

ASY: ”ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܝܼ̈ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܝܼ ܘܠܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Akhtoon ke yad'eetoon dane eedatee mle-lhoon lsneeqoetee o lsneeqoeta danee deewaw 'amee.
ENG: Ye yourselves know that these hands ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.

ASY: ”ܩܲܡ ܡܲܕܥܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܲܝܸܪܲܚ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ. ܕܵܟ݂ܪܲܚ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ، ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ.‘“
TRL: ”Qam mad'inawkhoon bkl mindee d'weed-lee, dakhee bpoelkhana qishya wale-ylaha dhayirakh lanee deena zaboene. Dakhrakh hemizmane dmaran eeshoo' msheekha dmeereh, ’ṭoewa lhaw dyabil, zawda min lhaw dshaqel.‘“
ENG: In all things I gave you an example, how that so labouring ye ought to help the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܒܘܼܪ̈ܟܵܟܘܼܗܝ ܥܲܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh ane hemizmane, breek-leh 'al boerkakoehy 'am klayhy khene o ṣoele-leh.
ENG: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

ASY: ܒܟܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ. ܚܦܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܢܫܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Bke-lhoon klayhy. Khpeeq-lhoon lpawloos o nsheeq-lhoon ileh.
ENG: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul’s neck, and kissed him,

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ܕܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܵܗ̇ ܦܵܬܹܗ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܦܫܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܓܵܡܝܼ.
TRL: Eena boesh zawda psheem-lhoon byad hemizman dmeereh, dkhena le khazee waw-laha pateh. Haygah moepshiṭ-lhoon ileh hal gamee.
ENG: Sorrowing most of all for the word which he had spoken, that they should behold his face no more. And they brought him on his way unto the ship.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܪܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܘܼܙ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܩܘܿܣ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܪܘܿܕܘܿܣ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܠܦܵܐܛܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dpreesh lan minayhy, ṭre lan byama doez o te lan lqoos, o byawma khena lroodoos, o min tama lpaṭara.
ENG: And when it came to pass that we were parted from them, and had set sail, we came with a straight course unto Cos, and the next day unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:

ASY: ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܦܹܘܢܝܼܩܹܐ؛ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: Moechikh lan gamee bi'wara lpewneeqe; seeq lan gawoeha o ṭre lan.
ENG: and having found a ship crossing over unto Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܡܘܼܒܝܸܢܵܗ̇ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܣܸܡܵܠܵܐ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܣܘܼܪܝܼܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܨܘܿܪ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܩܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܛܲܥܢܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Min bar dmoebyinaha gazarta dqiwproos, shweeqa lan lgeba dsimala o ṭre lan lsoereea, o te lan lṣoor, sabab tama bit sapqa wa gamee ṭa'noeha.
ENG: And when we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed unto Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܣܹܩ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Tama moechikh lan talmeede, o peesh lan lkis layhy shaw'a yawmane. Ane meerhoon lpawloos broekha dla aseq loorishlim.
ENG: And having found the disciples, we tarried there seven days: and these said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not set foot in Jerusalem.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܬܘܼܡܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ. ܡܘܼܦܫܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ، ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܝܵܠܲܕ݇ܝ̈ܗܝ، ܗܲܠ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܟ ܠܲܢ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: Eena kad toemim-lhoon anee yawmane, pleeṭ lan o zeel lan boerkha. Moepshiṭ-lhoon ilan anee talmeede, o bakhtatayhy o yalayhy, hal lbadar min mdeeta, o min tama hal marza dyama. Tama breek lan o ṣoele lan.
ENG: And when it came to pass that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey; and they all, with wives and children, brought us on our way, till we were out of the city: and kneeling down on the beach, we prayed,

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Min bar dshweeq lan bshayna khad lhaw khena, akhnan 'weeran gaw gamee, o anee deerhoon lbatayhy.
ENG: and bade each other farewell; and we went on board the ship, but they returned home again.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܨܘܿܪ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܦܛܵܠܵܡܹܐܘܿܣ. ܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dṭre lan byama min ṣoor mṭe lan lpṭalameoos. Tama dre lan shlama lakhoonwate, o shre lan lkis layhy khad yawma.
ENG: And when we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais; and we saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܠܝܼܦܘܿܣ ܡܲܫܚܸܕܵܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma khena pleeṭ lan o te lan lqesarya, o shre lan gaw bayta dpeeleepoos mashkhidana, haw deewa khad min shaw'a.
ENG: And on the morrow we departed, and came unto Caesarea: and entering into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, we abode with him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܒܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܬܘܼܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܢܲܒܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Eet wa-leh arba' bnate btoelate dke nabee waw.
ENG: Now this man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܫܸܡܹܗ ܐܵܓ݂ܵܒ݂ܘܿܣ.
TRL: Kad akhnan tama ywakh waw raba yawmane, ṣle-leh khad nweea min eehoed, shimeh aghawoos.
ENG: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܢ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܬܲܣܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܨܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܣܪܝܼ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܲܣܡܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܣܲܦܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Aha te-leh lkis lan, o shqeel-leh tasma dkhaṣa dpawloos, o seereh eedate o aqlate dganeh, o meereh, ”hadkha bemara-yleh roekha dqoedsha, hadkha bit asree yhoedaye doorishlim lmara daha tasma o bit sapee-leh limwate.“
ENG: And coming to us, and taking Paul’s girdle, he bound his own feet and hands, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܒܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lan aha, akhnan o nashe dtama poerpil lan bpawloos dla azel wa loorishlim.
ENG: And when we heard these things, both we and they of that place besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܒܟ݂ܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܫܡܵܛܹܗ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܝܼ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܕܡܵܝܬܹܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.“
TRL: Haygah joewib-leh pawloos, ”qamoodee bibkhaya ytoon o bishmaṭeh ytoon libee? Ana hdeera ywin la akhchee dpayshen seera, eena oep dmayten gaw oorishlim boet shima dmaran eeshoo'.“
ENG: Then Paul answered, What do ye, weeping and breaking my heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܫܠܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܲܢ، ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Kad la moeṣyit-leh ilan, shle lan o meeran, ”shwooq dhawe ṣiwyana dmarya.“
ENG: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗܘܼܕܸܪܲܢ ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Min bar ane yawmane, hoediran o seeq lan loorishlim.
ENG: And after these days we took up our baggage, and went up to Jerusalem.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܠܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܡܢܵܣܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܫܵܪܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Khakma talmeede min qesarya te-lhoon 'aman o loebil-lhoon ilan lbayta dmnasoon ayka dbit sharakh waw. Aha min qiwproos eewa, o khad min talmeede qamaye.
ENG: And there went with us also certain of the disciples from Caesarea, bringing with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we should lodge.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe lan loorishlim, qoebil-lhoon ilan akhoonwate bkhadoeta.
ENG: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܘܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܕܚܵܙܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂. ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Byawma khena akhnan o pawloos zeel lan dkhazakh waw lya'qoow. Klayhy khwardiqne tama ywaw.
ENG: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.

ASY: ܕܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐܵܬܘܼܬܵܐܝܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Dre lan shlama 'alayhy, o hoeqe-leh ilayhy pawloos atoetaeet kl mindee d'weed-leh Alaha byad khilmateh gaw imwate.
ENG: And when he had saluted them, he rehearsed one by one the things which God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܲܚܘܿܢܲܢ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܛܲܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon aha, shoebikh-lhoon lalaha o meerhoon lpawloos, ”akhoonan, bikhzaya ywit, alpe dyhoedaye hoemine yna, o klayhy ṭanane yna boet namoosa.
ENG: And they, when they heard it, glorified God; and they said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of them which have believed; and they are all zealous for the law:

ASY: ”ܘܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܕܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܪܩܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܘܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܠܵܐ ܓܵܙܪܝܼ ܒܢܘܿܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܠܵܐ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܥܝܵܕܲܢ.
TRL: ”O peeshe yna moekhbire boet deeoekh dmaloepe ywit lklayhy yhoedaye dbikhaya yna gaw imwate dparqee min moeshe, o dbemara ywit dla gazree bnoonayhy, o la naṭree 'yadan.
ENG: and they have been informed concerning thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.

ASY: ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: ”Moodee 'awdakh? Shareeraeet anee bit sham'ee dteea ywit lakha.
ENG: What is it therefore? they will certainly hear that thou art come.

ASY: ”ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܠܘܼܟ݂. ܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܢܸܕܪܵܐ.
TRL: ”'wood mindee damrakh-loekh. Eet lakha arb'a nashe dndeere yna nidra.
ENG: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

ASY: ”ܠܲܒܸܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܲܟ݂ܝܼ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܦܪܸܥ ܢܲܦܩܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܪܥܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܫܲܝܗܝ. ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܪܹܐܙܵܐ ܘܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: ”Labil ane nashe o dakhee ganoekh 'amayhy. Pri' napqate dgar'ee reshayhy. O klayhy bit yad'ee dmindee dpeesh-leh meera boet deeoekh doegla-yleh, o at bikhdara ywit breza o binṭara lnamoosa.
ENG: these take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges for them, that they may shave their heads: and all shall know that there is no truth in the things whereof they have been informed concerning thee; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, keeping the law.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܩܘܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܕܸܡܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܘܵܢ ܚܢܝܼܩܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boet anee dhoeminhoon min imwate, akhnan kteew lan ilayhy o moeqwe lan dhawee binṭara ganayhy min bisra dweekha lṣaname, o min dima, o min bisra dhaywan khneeqa, o min zanyoeta.“
ENG: But as touching the Gentiles which have believed, we wrote, giving judgment that they should keep themselves from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what is strangled, and from fornication.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܟܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ. ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܠܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܡܸܡܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܲܟ݂ܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah byawma khena loebil-leh pawloos lanee nashe o doeke-leh ganeh 'amayhy. O 'weereh lhaykla lmadoe'e eeman bit tamimee yawmane ddakhayta dpaesh moeqriwa qoerbana min geba dkl khad minayhy.
ENG: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them went into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܦܪܵܩܵܐ، ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܡܘܼܫܓܸܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: Eeman dshaw'a yawmane qoerbinhoon lipraqa, khakma yhoedaye min aseea khze-lhoon lpawloos gaw haykla. Ane moeshgish-lhoon lkleh kinsha o dweeq-lhoon ileh,
ENG: And when the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude, and laid hands on him,

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܗܲܝܸܪܘܼܢ ܠܲܢ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܥܲܡܲܢ ܘܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܲܢ ܘܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܹܗ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܫܚܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ.“
TRL: O moeqwikh-lhoon, ”nashe bnay eesrayel, hayiroen lan. Aha-yleh haw nasha dmaloepe-yleh lklayhy nashe bkl doeka dalqoewl d'aman o dnamoosan o daha doeka. Oep moe'bireh yawnaye gaw haykla o shkheem-leh-laha doeka qadeeshta.“
ENG: crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place: and moreover he brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath defiled this holy place.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܛܪܘܿܦܝܼܡܘܿܣ ܐܵܦܸܣܵܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ.
TRL: Min qamayta khizye ywaw 'ameh ṭroopeemoos apisaya gaw mdeeta, o bikhshawa ywaw dpawloos moe'bireh ywa lhaykla.
ENG: For they had before seen with him in the city Trophimus the Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܹܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܪܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܹܐ.
TRL: Haygah shgheesh-laha klaha mdeeta, o rkheeṭ-leh 'ama min klayhy gebane. Dweeq-lhoon lpawloos o poeliṭ-lhoon ileh lbadar min haykla, o bjaldoeta dweeray-lhoon tar'ane.
ENG: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they laid hold on Paul, and dragged him out of the temple: and straightway the doors were shut.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ، ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܫܓ݂ܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: O kad ba'ee waw liqṭaleh, mṭe-leh khabra lrab alpa dkhaylawate droomaye, dklaha oorishlim shgheeshta-ylaha.
ENG: And as they were seeking to kill him, tidings came up to the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in confusion.

ASY: ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ، ܘܪܚܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܘܠܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Bjaldoeta haw shqeel-leh 'ameh dakhshe o rab ima, o rkheeṭ-lhoon tama. Eeman dnashe khze-lhoon lrab alpa o ldakhshe, kle-lhoon min limkhaya lpawloos.
ENG: And forthwith he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down upon them: and they, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, left off beating Paul.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܘܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܣܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܹܫܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: te-leh rab alpa o dweeq-leh lpawloos, o pqeed-leh dasree waw-leh btartey sheshlate. O boeqireh mineh dmanee ywa o moodee ywa bi'wada.
ENG: Then the chief captain came near, and laid hold on him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and inquired who he was, and what he had done.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܸܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܩܘܲܚܬܲܝܗܝ ܪܲܒ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܲܒܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܩܲܠܥܵܐ.
TRL: Eena khakma maqwikhee waw khad mindee o khene khad mindee khena. O min maqwakhtayhy rab khayla la dee' leh manee ywa hamzoeme shrara. Haygah pqeed-leh dlablee waw-leh pawloos lqal'a.
ENG: And some shouted one thing, some another, among the crowd: and when he could not know the certainty for the uproar, he commanded him to be brought into the castle.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܕܵܪ̈ܵܓ̰ܹܐ، ܙܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܛܥܝܼܢܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Kad mṭe-leh pawloos ldaraje, zeed-leh shghoeshya gaw kinsha, hadkha ddakhshe ṭ'eenhoon lpawloos.
ENG: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the crowd;

ASY: ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܘܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ، ”ܩܛܘܿܠ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Kinsha raba betaya ywa bareh o maqwoekhe, ”qṭool-leh.“
ENG: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, Away with him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܩܲܠܥܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂؟“ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ؟
TRL: Kad pyasha ywa moe'bira pawloos lqal'a, meereh lrab alpa, ”eet-lee psasa dhamzimin 'amoekh?“ o haw joewib-leh, ”ke yad'et lishana yawnaya?
ENG: And as Paul was about to be brought into the castle, he saith unto the chief captain, May I say something unto thee? And he said, Dost thou know Greek?

ASY: ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܘܦܘܼܠܸܛ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: ”Le ywit at haw miṣraya dmin qam ane yawmane 'weed-loekh shghoeshya o poeliṭ-loekh 'amoekh gaw bareea arb'a alpe qaṭoole?“
ENG: Art thou not then the Egyptian, which before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܵܪܣܘܿܣ ܕܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ، ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܫܸܡܵܐ. ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܫܵܒ݂ܩܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”ana yhoedaya ywin min ṭarsoos dqeeleeqeea, mdeeta mare shima. Biṭlaba ywin minoekh dshawqet-lee dhamzimin 'am ane nashe.“
ENG: But Paul said, I am a Jew, of Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and I beseech thee, give me leave to speak unto the people.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ، ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܥܲܠ ܕܵܪ̈ܵܓ̰ܹܐ ܘܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ:
TRL: Kad yoebil-leh ileh psasa, kle-leh pawloos 'al daraje o sh'eesh-leh eedeh lnashe. Eeman dshle-lhoon, hoemzim-leh ilayhy blishana 'iwraya:
ENG: And when he had given him leave, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with the hand unto the people; and when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew language, saying,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ.“
TRL: ”nashe akhoonwate o babawate, shmi'moen joewabee adeea.“
ENG: Brethren and fathers, hear ye the defence which I now make unto you.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܥܸܒ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܫܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ،
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon dhoemzim-leh ilayhy blishana 'iwraya, boesh zawda shle-lhoon. O meereh ilayhy pawloos,
ENG: And when they heard that he spake unto them in the Hebrew language, they were the more quiet: and he saith,

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܛܵܪܣܘܿܣ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܒܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ. ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܡܘܼܠܦܵܐ ܓܡܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܒܝܲܕ ܓܲܡܠܝܼܐܹܝܠ، ܘܛܲܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ.
TRL: ”Ana yhoedaya ywin peesha leeda gaw ṭarsoos mdeeta, batra dqeeleeqeea, eena goerwis-lee gaw aha mdeeta. Peesh-lee moelpa gmeeraeet namoosa dawahatan byad gamleeeyl, o ṭanana ywin wa lkis Alaha dakhee doep akhtoon eetoon klawkhoon idyoom.
ENG: I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city, at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict manner of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as ye all are this day:

ASY: ”ܘܟܘܼܡܸܪܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܬܵܒܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܒܹܐܣܵܪܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܸܕܪܵܝܲܝ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O koemiree hal mawta ltab'ane daha oerkha kad besara gawre o bakhtate o bidrayay gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: and I persecuted this Way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

ASY: ”ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ. ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܓܲܪ̈ܝܵܬܹܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܘܼܥܠܸܡܹܐ.
TRL: ”Goera dkahne o klayhy khwardiqne ke maṣee yawee sahdoeta boet aha. Shqeel-lee igaryate qa akhoonwate gaw darmsooq, o zeel-lee tama dmayteyn wa-lhoon ane nashe loorishlim seere dpayshee waw toe'lime.
ENG: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and journeyed to Damascus, to bring them also which were there unto Jerusalem in bonds, for to be punished.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܙܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܵܘܓ̰ܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܝܼ،
TRL: ”Kad qoerbinee ldarmsooq, aykh palga dyawma ywa, minshiltane zreeq-leh bahra lawjana min shmaya lkhadirwanee,
ENG: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and drew nigh unto Damascus, about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.

ASY: ”ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟‘
TRL: ”Npeel-lee 'al ar'a o shmee' lee qala bemara ilee, ’shaool, shaool, qamoodee kamoeree ywit?‘
ENG: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܩܸܪܝܼ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟‘ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ.‘
TRL: ”Boeqiree, ’maree, manee ywit?‘ joewib-leh, ’ana ywin eeshoo' naṣraya haw dat kamoereh ywit.‘
ENG: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”nashe deewaw 'amee khze-lhoon bahra, eena la shmee' lhoon qala dhaw dhamzoeme ywa 'amee.
ENG: And they that were with me beheld indeed the light, but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܝܼ، ’ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ، ܡܵܪܝܼ؟‘ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܩܘܼܡ ܘܥܒ݂ܘܿܪ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܙܹܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ.‘
TRL: ”Haygah boeqiree, ’moodee ba'eyt d'awden, maree?‘ meereh Maran ilee, ’qoem o 'woor ldarmsooq, o tama bit payshet meera boet klayhy mindeeane dpeeshe yna moeryize iloekh d'awdet.‘
ENG: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.

ASY: ”ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܐܝܼܕܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܘܩܲܡ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܝܼ ܠܝܼ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܡܘܼܣܡܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Dweeq-lhoon beedee anee deewaw 'amee o qam ma'biree-lee ldarmsooq, sabab khiqra dhaw bahra moesmeea ywa ilee.
ENG: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ، ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ،
TRL: ”te-leh lkis-lee khad nasha shimeh khananya, zadeeqa boerkha dnamoosa aykh dyawee waw sahdoeta boet dee-eh klayhy yhoedaye 'amrane dtama,
ENG: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews that dwelt there,

ASY: ”ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܕܸܦܢܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ، ܚܙܝܼ.‘ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܘܚܝܼܪܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: ”Kle-leh bdipnee o meereh, ’shaool, akhoonee, khzee.‘ har bhay 'dana khze-lee o kheeree bee-eh.
ENG: came unto me, and standing by me said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And in that very hour I looked up on him.

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܩܲܡ ܓܲܒܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ، ܘܚܵܙܹܝܬ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܘܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ،
TRL: ”meereh ilee, ’Alaha dawahatan qam gabe-loekh min qamayta dyad'et ṣiwyaneh, o khazeyt lhaw zadeeqa, o sham'et hemizmane min poemeh,
ENG: And he said, The God of our fathers hath appointed thee to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

ASY: ”’ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”’bit haweyt ileh sahda lklayhy bnaynasha boet kl mindee dkhze-loekh o shmee' loekh.
ENG: For thou shalt be a witness for him unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.

ASY: ”’ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ؟ ܩܘܼܡ ܘܥܡܘܿܕ ܘܦܘܼܫ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂، ܟܲܕ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܫܸܡܹܗ.‘
TRL: ”’wadeea lmoodee ywit bispara? Qoem o 'mood o poesh dikhya min khṭeeatoekh, kad at biqraya bshimeh.‘
ENG: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on his name.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܕܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܠܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ،
TRL: ”Eeman ddeeree loorishlim, 'weeree lhaykla lṣaloeye,
ENG: And it came to pass, that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,

ASY: ”ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܚܸܙܘܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܡܲܠܝܸܙ ܘܦܠܘܿܛ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”O khze-lee lmarya bkhizwa, o meereh ilee, ’malyiz o plooṭ min oorishlim bjaldoeta sabab le qablee-laha sahdoetoekh boet deeee.‘
ENG: and saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: because they will not receive of thee testimony concerning me.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ، ’ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܕܵܪܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܵܚܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Ana meeree, ’maree, ane nashe beeda'a yna dke dareyn wa gaw beyt aseere o makheyn wa gaw klayhy knoeshyate lanee dhaminee waw beeoekh.
ENG: And I said, Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:

ASY: ”’ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܦܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܣܵܗܕܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܘܿܣ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ. ܫܠܝܼܡ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܢܛܝܼܪܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.‘
TRL: ”’weeman dshpeekh-leh dima dsahdoekh isṭapanoos, ana kilya ywin wa 'am qaṭoole. Shleem-lee ilayhy, o nṭeeree joele danee dbiqṭaleh ywaw.‘
ENG: and when the blood of Stephen thy witness was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting, and keeping the garments of them that slew him.

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ’ܙܹܠ݇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܪܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܠܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.‘“
TRL: ”Haygah meereh ilee, ’ze, sabab ana shadoeroekh eewin rikhqa lgaw imwate.‘“
ENG: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee forth far hence unto the Gentiles.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܠܲܝܗܝ ܘܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܫܩܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܸܚܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: Shmee' lhoon lpawloos hal aha hemizman, haygah moerim-lhoon qalayhy o moeqwikh-lhoon, ”shqooloen-laha nasha m'al pata dar'a, sabab le-yleh khsheekha likhaya.“
ENG: And they gave him audience unto this word; and they lifted up their voice, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.

ASY: ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܘܫܲܠܘܼܚܹܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܕܲܪܘܼܝܹܐ ܥܲܦܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܵܘܵܐ.
TRL: Shoere-lhoon maqwoekhe o shaloekhe joelayhy o daroeye 'apra gaw hawa.
ENG: And as they cried out, and threw off their garments, and cast dust into the air,

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܒܸܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܠܥܵܐ، ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ ܘܨܘܼܚܨܝܼܵܐ ܕܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Haygah pqeed-leh rab alpa dma'biree-leh gaw qal'a, o paesh mikhya bshawṭe o ṣoekhṣeea dyade' wa qamoodee nashe hadkha maqwoekhe ywaw 'aloehy.
ENG: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, bidding that he should be examined by scourging, that he might know for what cause they so shouted against him.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܬܲܣܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܚܝܵܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ”ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܡܵܚܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad seerhoon ileh btasmate dpaesh wa mikhya bshawṭe, meereh pawloos lrab ima dkilya ywa tama, ”qanoonayta-ylaha ilawkhoon dmakheytoon bshawṭe lnasha roomaya kad la peesha deena?“
ENG: And when they had tied him up with the thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ؟ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Eeman dshmee' leh rab ima aha, zeel-leh lkis rab alpa o meereh ileh, ”moodee ywit bi'wada? Aha nasha roomaya-yleh.“
ENG: And when the centurion heard it, he went to the chief captain, and told him, saying, What art thou about to do? for this man is a Roman.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܹܐ.“
TRL: O te-leh rab alpa lkis pawloos o boeqireh mineh, ”moor ilee, roomaya ywit?“ joewib-leh ileh, ”he.“
ENG: And the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? And he said, Yea.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܩܸܢܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ.“
TRL: meereh rab alpa, ”ana pree'a ywin zoeze raba dqinyoeha ywin aha kheroeta.“ joewib-leh pawloos, ”ana peesha ywin wa leeda roomaya.“
ENG: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this citizenship. And Paul said, But I am a Roman born.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܨܲܚܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܐܘܼܦ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah anee dba'ee waw ṣakhṣee waw lpawloos shweeq-lhoon ileh. Oep rab alpa bganeh zdee' leh eeman ddee' leh droomaya ywa, sabab seereh ywa.
ENG: They then which were about to examine him straightway departed from him: and the chief captain also was afraid, when he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܠܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܩܒ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ. ܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܡܘܼܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Byawma khena b'e-leh rab alpa leeda'a bshareeroeta qamoodee yhoedaye biqwala ywaw 'al pawloos. Shre-leh ileh, o pqeed-leh lgoerane dkahne o lknoeshya djam'ee waw. Moete-leh lpawloos o moekle-leh gawayhy.
ENG: But on the morrow, desiring to know the certainty, wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.

ASY: ܚܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܵܠܝܼܬܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܐܸܢܝܲܬ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.“
TRL: Kheereh pawloos bknoeshya dyhoedaye o meereh, ”nashe akhoonwate, ana toemimoeha ywin waleetee qam Alaha bkl inyat ṭawta hal aha yawma.“
ENG: And Paul, looking stedfastly on the council, said, Brethren, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.

ASY: ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܡܵܚܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܦܘܼܡܹܗ.
TRL: Pqeed-leh khananya goera dkahne lanee dkilye ywaw lkis pawloos dmakhee waw-leh 'al poemeh.
ENG: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܕܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܘܸܪܵܐ. ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܘܒܸܕܝܵܢܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܫܡܵܛܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܡܵܚܝܼ ܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: meereh ileh pawloos, ”Alaha bit makhe-loekh, ya goeda moekhwira. At dteewa ywit o bidyanee aykh namoosa, bganoekh bishmaṭa ywit namoosa, kad bipqada ywit dmakhee-lee?“
ENG: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: and sittest thou to judge me according to the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܡܲܣܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: Anee dkilye ywaw tama meerhoon ileh, ”masloeye ywit lgoera dkahne dalaha?“
ENG: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God’s high priest?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ’ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܬ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.‘“
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”akhoonwatee, le yad'en wa goera dkahne-yleh, sabab kteewa-yleh, ’la hamzimit beeshta 'al resha d'amoekh.‘“
ENG: And Paul said, I wist not, brethren, that he was high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of a ruler of thy people.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܘܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܘܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܘܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Eeman ddee' leh pawloos dkhad sahma minayhy zadoeqaye ywaw, o khad sahma preeshe, moeqwikh-leh lknoeshya, ”nashe akhoonwate, ana khad preesha ywin, o broona dpreeshe, o pyasha ywin deena sabab eet-lee hewee 'al qyamta min gaw meete.“
ENG: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Brethren, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees: touching the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܬܪܹܝ ܓܲܒܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Eeman dmeereh aha, npeel-leh shghoeshya beyl preeshe o zadoeqaye, o peesh-leh kinsha trey gabe,
ENG: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and Sadducees: and the assembly was divided.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܲܕܘܼܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܘܕܝܼ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab zadoeqaye ke amree dlayt qyamta, o la malake, o la roekha, eena preeshe ke mawdee bklayhy ane.
ENG: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.

ASY: ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܩܘܲܚܬܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܬܵܐ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܣܵܦܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܲܒܵܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܕܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܘܼܚܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܘܐܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ؟“
TRL: O hwe-laha maqwakhta khaylanta, o qeem-lhoon khakma sapre min gaba dpreeshe o dreesh-lhoon, bemara, ”le ywakh machoekhe mindee beesha baha nasha. O in roekha yan malakha hoemzim-leh 'ameh, moodee mindee khirba eet baha?“
ENG: And there arose a great clamour: and some of the scribes of the Pharisees’ part stood up, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: and what if a spirit hath spoken to him, or an angel?

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܙܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ. ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܨܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܘܡܲܥܒܸܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܠܥܵܐ.
TRL: Kad zeed-leh shghoeshya, zdee' leh rab alpa 'al pawloos dla paesh 'weeda qiṭ'aṭe. Shoedireh dakhshe o pqeed-leh dṣalee waw o shaqlee waw-leh bkhayla o ma'biree waw-leh gaw qal'a.
ENG: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the castle.

ASY: ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܗܘܝܼ ܠܸܒܵܢܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܣܵܗܕܹܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܓܵܘ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ.“
TRL: Blayle khena kle-leh Marya lkis pawloos o meereh ileh, ”hwee libana, dakhee dyoebil-loekh sahdoeta ilee gaw oorishlim, hadkha wale-ylaha iloekh dsahdet ilee oep gaw roome.“
ENG: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer: for as thou hast testified concerning me at Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܟܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܪܡܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh yawma, 'weed-lhoon milka yhoedaye o 'weed-lhoon khirma 'al ganayhy, bemara dle akhlee o le shatee hal dqaṭlee-leh pawloos.
ENG: And when it was day, the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܒܡܵܘܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ.
TRL: Anee d'weed-lhoon aha qawla bmawmate zawda min arb'ee nashe ywaw.
ENG: And they were more than forty which made this conspiracy.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܚܸܪܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܪܸܡ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܲܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܛܵܥܡܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Ane te-lhoon lkis goerane dkahne o khwardiqne o meerhoon ilayhy, ”khirma moekhrim lan 'al ganan dle ṭa'makh mindee hal dqaṭlakh-leh pawloos.
ENG: And they came to the chief priests and the elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܘܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܡܲܚܒܸܪܘܼܢ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܩܵܛܠܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܡܵܛܹܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Adeea akhtoon o knoeshya makhbiroen lrab alpa dmayte-leh lkis lawkhoon aykh din ba'eytoon dyad'eetoon boesh zawda boet dee-eh, o akhnan hdeere ywakh dqaṭlakh-leh min qam dmaṭe lakha.“
ENG: Now therefore do ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you, as though ye would judge of his case more exactly: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to slay him.

ASY: ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܚܵܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܠܥܵܐ ܘܗܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Shmee' leh broona dkhata dpawloos baha boeṣa, te-leh o 'weereh gaw qal'a o hoeqe-leh lpawloos.
ENG: But Paul’s sister’s son heard of their lying in wait, and he came and entered into the castle, and told Paul.

ASY: ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܲܒܲܝ ܐܸܡܹ̈ܐܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܲܒܸܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Qre-leh pawloos lkhad min rabay ime o meereh ileh, ”labil aha 'layma lkis rab alpa sabab eet-leh khad mindee damer ileh.“
ENG: And Paul called unto him one of the centurions, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath something to tell him.

ASY: ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܠܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܝܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܹܪ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Loebil-leh rab ima l'layma lkis rab alpa o meereh ileh, ”pawloos aseera qre-leh ilee o b'e-leh minee dmayteyn-laha 'layma lkis-loekh sabab eet-leh khad mindee damer iloekh.“
ENG: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and saith, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and asked me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say to thee.

ASY: ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܘܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ”ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: Dweeq-leh rab alpa beeda d'layma o loebil-leh lkhad geba o boeqireh mineh, ”moodee ba'eyt damret-lee?“
ENG: And the chief captain took him by the hand, and going aside asked him privately, What is that thou hast to tell me?

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܛܵܠܒܝܼ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܡܲܨܠܹܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: meereh ileh, ”yhoedaye soezgire yna dṭalbee minoekh dqaydamta maṣleyt-leh pawloos lkis knoeshya aykh din ba'ee boesh zawda leeda'a boet dee-eh.
ENG: And he said, The Jews have agreed to ask thee to bring down Paul tomorrow unto the council, as though thou wouldest inquire somewhat more exactly concerning him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܚܪܸܡܹܐ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܠܹܐ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܘܠܹܐ ܫܵܬܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܠܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: ”Eena at la sham'et 'alayhy, sabab zawda min arb'ee nashe minayhy 'weede yna boeṣa o moekhrime ganayhy dle akhlee o le shatee hal dqaṭlee-leh. Adeea hdeere yna o bispara lqawla minoekh.“
ENG: Do not thou therefore yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves under a curse, neither to eat nor to drink till they have slain him: and now are they ready, looking for the promise from thee.

ASY: ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܲܝܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܕܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ.“
TRL: Shoedireh rab alpa lhaw 'layma o meereh ileh, ”lnasha la amret dmoedi' loekh aha ilee.“
ENG: So the chief captain let the young man go, charging him, Tell no man that thou hast signified these things to me.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܠܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܪ̈ܲܒܲܝ ܐܸܡܹ̈ܐܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܬܪܲܝܡܵܐܐ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܗܲܠ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܒܣܵܥܲܬ ܕܬܫܲܥ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܥܲܡ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܪ̈ܲܟܵܒܹܐ، ܘܬܪܲܝܡܵܐܐ ܕܵܪ̈ܝܵܢܹܐ ܕܪ̈ܘܼܡܚܹܐ.
TRL: Haygah qre-leh rab alpa ltrey min rabay ime o meereh ilayhy, ”hadroen trayma dakhshe dazee hal qesarya bsa'at dtsha' dlayle, 'am shaw'ee rakabe, o trayma daryane droemkhe.
ENG: And he called unto him two of the centurions, and said, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night:

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܗܲܕܪܘܼܢ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܬܝܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܡܲܡܛܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܘܼܠܡܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Oep hadroen haywane dmatyiwee lpawloos o mamṭee-leh bkhoelmana lkis weeleks shaleeṭa.“
ENG: and he bade them provide beasts, that they might set Paul thereon, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.

ASY: ܘܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ،
TRL: O kteew-leh igarta hadkha,
ENG: And he wrote a letter after this form:

ASY: ܩܠܵܘܕܝܘܿܣ ܠܘܼܣܝܼܘܿܣ، ܩܵܐ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܢܲܨܝܼܚܵܐ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ: ܫܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Qlawdyoos loeseeoos, qa shaleeṭa naṣeekha weeleks: shlama.
ENG: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix, greeting.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܕܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܩܛܵܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܘܼܨܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܕܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Aha gawra peesha ywa dweeqa byhoedaye o anee hdeere ywaw liqṭaleh. Eena te-lee ana 'am dakhshe o poeṣe-lee ileh eeman ddee' lee droomaya-yleh.
ENG: This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be slain of them, when I came upon them with the soldiers, and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.

ASY: ܒܥܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܩܒ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: B'e-lee dyad'en wa 'ilta dqwalta dmoete-lhoon 'aloehy, moeṣle-lee ileh qam knoeshya.
ENG: And desiring to know the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him down unto their council:

ASY: ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܕܩܒ݂ܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܲܝܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܸܪܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Moechikh-lee dqwalta d'aloehy boet namoosayhy ywa. Eena layt wa 'aloehy 'ilta dkhashekh wa lmawta, yan dpaesh wa dirya gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: whom I found to be accused about questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ. ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܸܠܬܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Kad peesh-lee moekhbira boet boeṣa dpeesha ywa 'weeda 'aloehy, shoediree ileh lkis-loekh bjaldoeta. Pqeed-lee oep lqawlane dmaqriwee 'iltayhy 'aloehy lkis-loekh.
ENG: And when it was shewn to me that there would be a plot against the man, I sent him to thee forthwith, charging his accusers also to speak against him before thee.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܩܝܼܕܹܐ، ܠܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܛܝܼܦܵܛܪܘܿܣ.
TRL: Haygah dakhshe, aykh dpeesh-lhoon pqeede, loebil-lhoon lpawloos blayle o moete-lhoon lmdeeta danṭeepaṭroos.
ENG: So the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris.

ASY: ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܪ̈ܲܟܵܒܹܐ ܕܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܠܥܵܐ.
TRL: O byawma khena shweeq-lhoon lrakabe dazee 'ameh, o anee deerhoon lqal'a.
ENG: But on the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪ̈ܲܟܵܒܹܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܵܐ ܠܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe-lhoon rakabe lqesarya, yoebil-lhoon igarta lshaleeṭa, o soepe-lhoon lpawloos ileh.
ENG: and they, when they came to Caesarea, and delivered the letter to the governor, presented Paul also before him.

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܐܘܼܚܕܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: O kad qirya-leh shaleeṭa boeqireh min aynee oekhdana ywa. Eeman ddee' leh dmin qeeleeqeea ywa,
ENG: And when he had read it, he asked of what province he was; and when he understood that he was of Cilicia,

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ”ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܹܢܘܼܟ݂ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܵܛܝܼ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܟ݂.“ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܩܲܨܪܵܐ ܕܗܹܪܘܿܕܸܣ.
TRL: meereh ileh, ”bit sham'enoekh eeman dmaṭee lakha qawlane d'aloekh.“ o pqeed-leh dnaṭree waw-leh gaw qaṣra dheroodis.
ENG: I will hear thy cause, said he, when thine accusers also are come: and he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s palace.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܡܫܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܢܲܢܝܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ، ܘܥܲܡ ܛܲܪܛܸܠܘܿܣ، ܚܲܕ ܡܲܠܵܠܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܕܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܒ݂ܵܠܬܲܝܗܝ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar khamsha yawmane ṣle-leh khananya goera dkahne lqesarya 'am khakma khwardiqne, o 'am ṭarṭiloos, khad malala, o moedi' lhoon lqwaltayhy 'al pawloos qam shaleeṭa.
ENG: And after five days the high priest Ananias came down with certain elders, and with an orator, one Tertullus; and they informed the governor against Paul.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܸܩܒ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܛܲܪܛܸܠܘܿܣ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܘܝܼܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܚܵܝܵܐ ܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܬܲܓܒܲܪܬܘܼܟ݂، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܬܘܼܪ̈ܵܨܹܐ ܗܘܝܼܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܡܕܲܒܪܵܢܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Eeman dpeesh-leh moetya pawloos, shoere-leh biqwala ṭarṭiloos qam weeleks o meereh, ”hwee-e ywakh bikhaya braba shlama tkhoot tagbartoekh, o raba toeraṣe hwee-e yna gaw aha 'ama tkhoot mdabranoetoekh.
ENG: And when he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy much peace, and that by thy providence evils are corrected for this nation,

ASY: ”ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܘܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܛܵܥܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܵܐ ܢܲܨܝܼܚܵܐ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ.
TRL: ”Bkl mindee o bkl doeka, raba ṭa'nane dminta ywakh minoekh ya naṣeekha weeleks.
ENG: we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.

ASY: ”ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܟ̰ܸܚܸܢܘܼܟ݂ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܕܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܠܲܢ ܒܟܸܪܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Dla makchikhinoekh zawda, parpoele ywin beeoekh dsham'et lan bkiryoeta in basma-laha makeekhoetoekh.
ENG: But, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I entreat thee to hear us of thy clemency a few words.

ASY: ”ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܵܒ݂ܛܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܕܵܪܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܘܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܨܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Bikhzaya ywakh daha nasha khawṭana-yleh o daryana dshghoeshya gaw yhoedaye bklaha doenye, o resha dyoelpana dnaṣraye-yleh.
ENG: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:

ASY: ”ܐܘܼܦ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܫܚܵܡܵܐ ܠܗܲܝܟܠܲܢ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܕܵܝܢܲܚ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܲܢ.
TRL: ”Oep b'e-leh lishkhama lhayklan. Boet aha dweeq lan ileh o b'e lan ddaynakh-leh aykh namoosan.
ENG: who moreover assayed to profane the temple: on whom also we laid hold: and we would have judged him according to our law.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܘܼܣܝܼܘܿܣ ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܲܢ ܘܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”Eena te-leh loeseeoos rab alpa 'am khayla raba o shqeel-leh min eedan o shoedireh ileh lkis-loekh.
ENG: But the chief captain Lysias came and with great violence took him out of our hands,

ASY: ”ܘܐܸܢ ܨܲܚܨܹܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܘܲܚ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.“
TRL: ”O in ṣakhṣeyt-leh bganoekh, bit yad'et lshareeroeta dklayhy ane qwalyate dbi'waday ywakh 'aloehy.“
ENG: commanding his accusers to come before you. from whom thou wilt be able, by examining him thyself, to take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Oep yhoedaye beeawa yna sahdoeta 'aloehy o bemara dane qwalyate shareere yna.
ENG: And the Jews also joined in the charge, affirming that these things were so.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܪܡܝܼܙ ܠܹܗ ܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܲܝܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܝܼ.
TRL: Min bar drmeez-leh shaleeṭa lpawloos dhamzim wa, meereh pawloos, ”beeda'a ywin dqa raba shine hweea ywit dayana 'al aha oemta. Boet aha bikhdaya ywin dyaben joewab boet ganee.
ENG: And when the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, Paul answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do cheerfully make my defence:

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܠܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ke maṣeyt yad'et dlayt zawda min tri'sar yawmane dseeq-lee loorishlim lisghada.
ENG: seeing that thou canst take knowledge, that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem:

ASY: ”ܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܠܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܚܝܘܼܡܹܐ ܠܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܒܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Qawlane d'alee la khze-lhoon ilee bidrasha 'am oep khad gaw haykla, o la makhyoeme lkinsha bknoeshyate yan gaw mdeeta.
ENG: and neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man or stirring up a crowd, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city.

ASY: ”ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܡܲܣܒܸܬܝܼ ܠܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”O le maṣee masbitee lqwalyate dadeea bi'waday yna 'alee.
ENG: Neither can they prove to thee the things whereof they now accuse me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܘܕܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܹܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܒܸܩܪܵܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܢܵܐ ܗܲܪܵܛܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܒܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Eena mawdoeye ywin lkis-loekh dke saghden lalaha dawahatan baha oerkha dbiqrayoeha yna haraṭeeqoeta, o hamoene ywin bklayhy mindeeane dkteebe yna bnamoosa o bnwee-e.
ENG: But this I confess unto thee, that after the Way which they call a sect, so serve I the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets:

ASY: ”ܘܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O eet-lee hewee balaha aykh ane nashe eet-lhoon, dbit hawya qyamta min gaw meete, dzadeeqe o d'awale.
ENG: having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there shall be a resurrection both of the just and unjust.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܓ̰ܲܪܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܢܝܲܬ ܕܟ݂ܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܡܝܼܢܵܐܝܼܬ.
TRL: ”Boet aha qishyaeet jaroebe ywin dhawe-lee inyat dkheeta qam Alaha o bnaynasha ameenaeet.
ENG: Herein do I also exercise myself to have a conscience void of offence toward God and men alway.

ASY: ”ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܪܘܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܛܵܝܸܦܝܼ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ.
TRL: ”Min bar raba shine te-lee loorishlim o moete-lee irwana qa miskene dbnay ṭayipee, o oep moeqriw-lee diwkha.
ENG: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings:

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ. ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܸܢܫܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ana doekhyoeha ywin wa ganee eeman dmoechikh-lhoon ilee bhaykla. Layt waw kinsha 'amee, oep la bi'wada ywin wa shghoeshya.
ENG: amidst which they found me purified in the temple, with no crowd, nor yet with tumult: but there were certain Jews from Asia—

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܟܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena eet waw yhoedaye min aseea, aynee dwale ywaw dkalee waw qamoekh lakha o maqriwee waw qwalyatayhy in eet-lhoon mindee 'alee.
ENG: who ought to have been here before thee, and to make accusation, if they had aught against me.

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܢ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܢܘܼܫܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Yan ane deena lakha, shwooq amree bganayhy in moechikh-lhoon beeee gnaha eeman dkle-lee qam knoeshya.
ENG: Or else let these men themselves say what wrong-doing they found, when I stood before the council,

ASY: ”ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ، ܕܟܠܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ’ܐܝܼܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ.‘“
TRL: ”Qawma boet aha pyasha ywin deena, dkle-lee gawayhy o meeree bqala rama, ’eet qyamta min gaw meete, o boet aha hemizman pyasha ywin deena beeawkhoon idyoom.‘“
ENG: except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question before you this day.
