ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ، ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܒܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܘܼܣܝܼܘܿܣ، ܪܲܒ ܐܲܠܦܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܝܢܹܢ ܒܹܝܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Haygah weeleks, dke yade' wa-laha aha oerkha bmilyoeta, shoedray-leh, bemara, ”eeman date loeseeoos, rab alpa, haygah bit daynen beylawkhoon.“
ENG: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will determine your matter.

ASY: ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܕܢܵܛܹܪܹܗ ܘܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܫܵܒܹܩ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܘܬܲܓܒܸܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Pqeed-leh lrab ima dnaṭereh o yabil-leh kheroeta, o shabeq anee dke yad'ee-leh datee o tagbiree-leh.
ENG: And he gave order to the centurion that he should be kept in charge, and should have indulgence; and not to forbid any of his friends to minister unto him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܕܘܼܪܣܸܠܵܐ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܬܵܐ. ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar khakma yawmane te-leh weeleks 'am bakhteh doersila yhoedayta. O qre-lhoon lpawloos o shmee' lhoon mineh hamzoeme boet haymanoeta beeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: But after certain days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, which was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܕܒ݂ܵܩܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܵܐ، ܘܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ، ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܙܹܠ݇، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܕܪܸܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܘܼܟ݂.“
TRL: Kad hamzoeme ywa boet zadeeqoeta, o dwaqta dgana, o dyanta dbit atya, zdee' leh weeleks o meereh, ”adeea ze, eeman dhawe-lee pirsat bit shadrin baroekh.“
ENG: And as he reasoned of righteousness, and temperance, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, Go thy way for this time; and when I have a convenient season, I will call thee unto me.

ASY: ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܕܫܵܩܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܸܫܘܲܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܲܕܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܵܬ݇ܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܠܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Bhewee ywa weeleks dshaqel wa rishwat min pawloos. Boet aha ke shadir wa bareh min 'dana l'dana o hamzim wa 'ameh.
ENG: He hoped withal that money would be given him of Paul: wherefore also he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܫܵܘܦܹܗ ܦܲܪܩܝܼܘܿܣ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ ܩܵܐ ܡܲܫܦܲܪܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Min bar tartey shine, peesh-leh shoekhlipa weeleks, o te-leh lshawpeh parqeeoos pehisṭoos. Eena weeleks qa mashparta lkis yhoedaye, shweeq-leh lpawloos gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus; and desiring to gain favour with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ ܠܐܲܬܪܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Min bar tlata yawmane mṭe-leh pehisṭoos latra, o seeq-leh min qesarya loorishlim.
ENG: Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.

ASY: ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: te-lhoon lkis-leh goerane dkahne o reshane dyhoedaye, o moeqriw-lhoon ileh qwalyatayhy 'al pawloos.
ENG: And the chief priests and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul; and they besought him,

ASY: ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܕܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܕܫܲܕܸܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܨܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Ṭleeb-lhoon mineh d'abed khda ṭawta ilayhy, dshadireh pawloos loorishlim, sabab hadoere ywaw d'awdee boeṣa 'aloehy dqaṭlee-leh.
ENG: asking favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem; laying wait to kill him on the way.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ”ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܠܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Joewib-leh pehisṭoos, ”pawloos pyasha-yleh nṭeera gaw qesarya, o ana bganee bit azen ltama bjaldoeta.
ENG: Howbeit Festus answered, that Paul was kept in charge at Caesarea, and that he himself was about to depart thither shortly.

ASY: ”ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩܘܼܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܥܲܡܝܼ ܘܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܠܛܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Shwooqoen khakma min reshanawkhoon atee 'amee o makhzee qwalyatayhy 'al aha nasha, in 'weeda-yleh mindee khilṭa.“
ENG: Let them therefore, saith he, which are of power among you, go down with me, and if there is anything amiss in the man, let them accuse him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܡܵܢܝܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܨܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Min bar dpeesh-leh tama min tmanya hal 'isra yawmane, ṣle-leh lqesarya, o byawma khena teew-leh 'al koersya ddeewan o pqeed-leh dmaytee-leh pawloos.
ENG: And when he had tarried among them not more than eight or ten days, he went down unto Caesarea; and on the morrow he sat on the judgment-seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܘܼܗܝ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܨܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܩܸܫܝܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܲܣܒܸܬܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Eeman dte-leh pawloos, jmee' lhoon yhoedaye lkhadirwanoehy, anee dṣilye ywaw min oorishlim. Moete-lhoon raba qwalyate qishye 'aloehy, eena la mṣe-lhoon masbitee mindee.
ENG: And when he was come, the Jews which had come down from Jerusalem stood round about him, bringing against him many and grievous charges, which they could not prove;

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܸܛܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: Haygah joewib-leh pawloos o meereh, ”le ywin khiṭya 'al namoosa, o la 'al haykla, o la 'al qesar.“
ENG: while Paul said in his defence, Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܕܕܵܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܕܐܵܣܩܹܬ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ؟“
TRL: Eena pehisṭoos kad bib'aya ddare minta lyhoedaye, meereh lpawloos, ”ba'eyt dasqet loorishlim o tama payshet deena qamee 'al ane qwalyate?“
ENG: But Festus, desiring to gain favour with the Jews, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ.
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”ana adeea kilya ywin qam koersya ddeewan dqesar, ayka dwale-ylaha ilee dpayshen deena. Le ywin 'weeda khirba lyhoedaye, dakhee dbganoekh raba ṣpayee ke yad'et.
ENG: But Paul said, I am standing before Caesar’s judgment-seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou also very well knowest.

ASY: ”ܐܸܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܲܚܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܕܡܵܝܬܹܢ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܹܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܣܲܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ. ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”In 'weeda ywin mindee khirba dkhashekh lmawta, le ywin makhpoele dmayten. Eena in ane qwalyate dpeeshe yna moetye 'alee byad yhoedaye le yna shareere, oep khad le maṣe sape-lee ilayhy. Qam qesar ba'eyn payshen deena.“
ENG: If then I am a wrong-doer, and have committed anything worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if none of those things is true, whereof these accuse me, no man can give me up unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡ ܡܵܘܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܕܲܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ”ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܒܵܥܹܝܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ؟ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܬ.“
TRL: Haygah pehisṭoos, min bar dhoemzim-leh 'am mawtwa ddayane, joewib-leh, ”qam qesar ba'eyt payshet deena? Lkis qesar bit azet.“
ENG: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Thou hast appealed unto Caesar: unto Caesar shalt thou go.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܘܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܒܲܪܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܠܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ ܠܸܬܦܵܩܵܐ ܒܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ.
TRL: Min bar khakma yawmane ṣle-lhoon agirpa malka o bakhteh barneeqe lqesarya litpaqa bpehisṭoos.
ENG: Now when certain days were passed, Agrippa the king and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and saluted Festus.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ ܠܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܦ̮ܝܼܠܹܟܣ.
TRL: Kad peesh-lhoon lkis-leh raba yawmane, meereh pehisṭoos lagirpa malka, ”eet khad nasha aseera lakha peesha min 'dana dweeleks.
ENG: And as they tarried there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix:

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܩܲܡ ܡܲܕܸܥ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܘܵܪ̈ܕܸܩܢܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dzeel-lee loorishlim, qam madi' lee boet dee-eh goerane dkahne o khwardiqne dyhoedaye, o ṭleeb-lhoon dpaesh deena.
ENG: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for sentence against him.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܕܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ ܠܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܟܵܠܹܐ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܠܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.‘
TRL: ”Ana joewib-lee ilayhy, ’le-ylaha 'adat droomaye lidyana lkhad nasha min qam dkale pata gaw pata 'am qawlane d'aloehy, dhawe-leh pirsat ljawoebe 'al mindee dpeesha-yleh meera 'aloehy.‘
ENG: To whom I answered, that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man, before that the accused have the accusers face to face, and have had opportunity to make his defence concerning the matter laid against him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܥܲܪܩܲܠܬܵܐ، ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eeman dte-lhoon lakha, dla 'arqalta, byawma khena teew-lee 'al koersya ddeewan o pqeed-lee dmaytee-leh nasha lkis-lee.
ENG: When therefore they were come together here, I made no delay, but on the next day sat down on the judgment-seat, and commanded the man to be brought.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ، ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܣܦܝܼܪܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Eeman dqeem-lhoon qawlanoehy lhamzoeme 'aloehy, la moekhze-lhoon khda beeshta bee-eh, aykh dspeeroeha ywin wa.
ENG: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such evil things as I supposed;

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܢܘܼܩܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܬܵܘܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eet waw khakma noeqze o doerashe boet tawdeeta dganayhy, o boet khad nasha shimeh eeshoo' dmeet-leh, eena pawloos bemara-yleh dkhaya-yleh.
ENG: but had certain questions against him of their own religion, and of one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

ASY: ”ܟܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܨܲܚܨܹܝܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܫܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܩܸܪܝܼ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Kad le maṣeyn wa ṣakhṣeyn 'al ane shoele, boeqiree mineh in ba'e wa dazel wa loorishlim o tama paesh wa deena.
ENG: And I, being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, asked whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܩܹܣܲܪ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܢܛܝܼܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܫܲܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: ”Eena haw ke ba'e dpaesh nṭeera hal dpaesh deena qam qesar. Haygah pqeed-lee dpaesh nṭeera hal dshadrineh lkis qesar.“
ENG: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept till I should send him to Caesar.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܠܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ”ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܫܵܡܥܹܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.“ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ”ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܠܹܗ.“
TRL: meereh agirpa lpehisṭoos, ”oep ana ba'eyn dsham'en-laha nasha.“ joewib-leh pehisṭoos, ”qaydamta bit sham'et-leh.“
ENG: And Agrippa said unto Festus, I also could wish to hear the man myself. Tomorrow, saith he, thou shalt hear him.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܹܗ ܒܲܪܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܙܘܼܚܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܪ̈ܲܒܲܝ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܟܲܕ ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܐܬܝܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Byawma khena agirpa 'am bakhteh barneeqe te-lhoon bzoekha goera, o 'weerhoon lbeyt deena 'am rabay alpe o reshane dmdeeta, o kad pqeed-leh pehisṭoos, peesh-leh moetya pawloos.
ENG: So on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and they were entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and the principal men of the city, at the command of Festus Paul was brought in.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܘܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܟܠܹܗ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܣܲܪܝܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܡܲܩܘܘܼܚܹܐ ܕܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: O meereh pehisṭoos, ”ya agirpa malka, o klawkhoon deetoon lakha 'aman, bikhzaya ytoon-laha nasha dboet dee-eh kleh ṭayipa dyhoedaye qweel-lhoon lkis-lee gaw oorishlim o oep lakha gaw qesarya, kad maqwoekhe dkhena le-yleh khsheekha dkhaye.
ENG: And Festus saith, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye behold this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews made suit to me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ. ܘܟܲܕ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܩܹܣܲܪ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܕܫܲܕܪܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: ”Eena ana khze-lee dle-yleh 'weeda mindee dkhashekh lmawta. O kad bganeh ṭleeb-leh dpaesh deena byad qesar, ana qṭee' lee dshadrineh lkis-leh.
ENG: But I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death: and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܵܬܸܪܓ̰ܲܡܥ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܵܬܒܹܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܪܝܼ ܩܹܣܲܪ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܦܪܝܼܫܵܐܝܼܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܨܲܚܨܵܝܬܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܵܬܒܹܢ.
TRL: ”Eena le ywin khatirjam' moodee katben boet dee-eh qa maree qesar. Boet aha moete-lee qamawkhoon, o preeshaeet qam deeoekh, ya malka agirpa, dmin bar aha ṣakhṣayta hawe-lee mindee dkatben.
ENG: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I may have somewhat to write.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܢܵܢܵܐ ܠܫܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܠܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.“
TRL: ”Sabab khze-lee dle-yleh khad shoela hawnana lshadoere aseera o la lmadoe'e qwalyate d'aloehy.“
ENG: For it seemeth to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not withal to signify the charges against him.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܬ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܦܘܼܫܛܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: meereh agirpa lpawloos, ”eet-loekh psasa dhamzimit boet ganoekh.“ haygah pawloos poeshṭa-leh eedeh o shoere-leh ljawoebe o meereh,
ENG: And Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth his hand, and made his defence:

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܟܵܠܹܝܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܘܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܸܢ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܒ݂ܵܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ،
TRL: ”Ya malka agirpa, ana raba bikhdaya ywin dkaleyn qamoekh idyoom o jawibin lklayhy qwalyate dyhoedaye bi'waday yna 'alee,
ENG: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, that I am to make my defence before thee this day touching all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews:

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܝܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܘܼܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܕܫܵܡܥܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܒܡܲܪܝܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܢܵܐ.
TRL: ”Boesh zawda dat ke yad'et klayhy 'yade o doerashe dyhoedaye. Boet aha parpoele ywin beeoekh dsham'et-lee bmaryakhta dbena.
ENG: especially because thou art expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܚܝܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܝܼ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: ”Klayhy yhoedaye ke yad'ee dakhee khye-lee ha min yaloetee gaw 'ama dganee o oep lakha gaw oorishlim.
ENG: My manner of life then from my youth up, which was from the beginning among mine own nation, and at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;

ASY: ”ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܕܒܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܕܬܵܘܕܝܼܬܲܢ ܚܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Ke yad'ee-lee min khad zawna yareekha, o in ba'ee ke maṣee yawee sahdoeta boet deeee, dbyoelpana qishya dtawdeetan kheea ywin aykh khad preesha.
ENG: having knowledge of me from the first, if they be willing to testify, how that after the straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

ASY: ”ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈، ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ،
TRL: ”O adeea sabab eet-lee hewee bqawla d'weed-leh Alaha 'am awahatan, idyoom pyasha ywin deena,
ENG: And now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers;

ASY: ”ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܚܵܙܝܼ ܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܦܝܼܛܵܐܝܼܬ، ܒܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ. ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ، ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܩܒ݂ܵܠܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Haw qawla dtri'sar shawṭe bhewee yna dkhazee-leh toemima kad anee bi'wada khilmat lalaha khpeeṭaeet, blayle o byawma. Ya malka agirpa, boet aha hewee deet-lee, yhoedaye biqwala yna 'alee.
ENG: unto which promise our twelve tribes, earnestly serving God night and day, hope to attain. And concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, O king!

ASY: ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: ”Qamoodee bikhshawa ytoon le-ylaha dhamoene in Alaha maqim meete?
ENG: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God doth raise the dead?

ASY: ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܚܕܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܢܵܨܪܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shareeraeet ana bganee khda 'dana qṭee' lee blibee dwale ywa d'awden wa raba dalqoewloeta 'al shima deeshoo' naṣraya.
ENG: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

ASY: ”ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ. ܕܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܣܲܙܓܸܪܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”O 'weed-lee aha mindee gaw oorishlim. Dre-lee raba qadeeshe gaw beyt aseere bshoelṭana dshqeel-lee min goera dkahne. O eeman dpayshee waw qṭeele, ana ke sazgirin wa 'am qaṭoole.
ENG: And this I also did in Jerusalem: and I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death, I gave my vote against them.

ASY: ”ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܠܟܢܘܼܫܬܵܐ ܠܬܲܥܠܘܼܡܲܝ، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܡܕܝܼܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܠܟܲܡܘܼܪܲܝ.
TRL: ”Raba gahe ke azen wa min knoeshta lknoeshta lta'loemay, o ke 'awden wa khayla 'alayhy dgadpee waw. O sabab milya ywin wa karba 'alayhy, zeel-lee oep lmdeenate khene lkamoeray.
ENG: And punishing them oftentimes in all the synagogues, I strove to make them blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.

ASY: ”ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܘܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܠܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: ”Shqeel-lee shoelṭana o psasa min goera dkahne o zeel-lee ldarmsooq boet aha neesha.
ENG: Whereupon as I journeyed to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests,

ASY: ”ܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܒܘܼܫ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܡܲܒܪܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܝܼ ܘܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܹܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Bpalga dyawma, boerkha, ya malka, khze-lee bahra min shmaya, boesh bahrana min bahra dshimsha mabroeqe lkhadirwanee o lkhadirwane danee deewaw 'amee.
ENG: at midday, O king, I saw on the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them that journeyed with me.

ASY: ”ܟܠܲܢ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܘܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܪܵܡܵܝܵܐ، ’ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܫܵܐܘܿܠ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ؟ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܸܡܚܵܝܵܐ ܪܲܦܣܵܐ ܠܢܸܟܣܹ̈ܐ.‘
TRL: ”Klan npeel lan 'al ar'a, o shmee' lee qala bemara ilee blishana aramaya, ’shaool, shaool, qamoodee kamoeree ywit? 'Asqa-ylaha iloekh limkhaya rapsa lnikse.‘
ENG: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying unto me in the Hebrew language, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the goad.

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܝܼ، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ، ܡܵܪܝܼ؟‘ ܘܡܵܪܲܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ، ’ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܟܲܡܘܼܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܬ.
TRL: ”Ana boeqiree, ’manee ywit, maree?‘ o Maran joewib-leh, ’ana ywin eeshoo', haw dat kamoereh ywit.
ENG: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

ASY: ”’ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܘܼܡ، ܘܟܠܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܘܼ̈ܟ݂. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܓܲܒܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܦܲܠܵܚܵܐ ܘܣܵܗܕܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܸܢܝܼ، ܘܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܝܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: ”’eena qoem, o klee 'al aqlatoekh. Boet aha 'ilta peesh-lee khizya iloekh dgabeynoekh palakha o sahda 'al mindeeane dkhze-loekh minee, o 'al mindeeane dhdeera ywin dmakhzeynoekh.
ENG: But arise, and stand upon thy feet: for to this end have I appeared unto thee, to appoint thee a minister and a witness both of the things wherein thou hast seen me, and of the things wherein I will appear unto thee;

ASY: ”’ܒܸܬ ܦܲܨܸܝܢܘܼܟ݂ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܕܘܼܪܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: ”’bit paṣiynoekh min 'ama dyhoedaye, o min imwate dshadoeroekh eewin gawayhy,
ENG: delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom I send thee,

ASY: ”’ܕܦܵܬܚܹܬ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܕܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܠܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܕܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ.‘
TRL: ”’dpatkhet 'aynayhy ddayree min khishka lbahra, o min shoelṭana dsaṭana lkis Alaha, dqablee poekhala dkhṭeeate, o sahma 'am anee deena mqoedshe bhaymanoeta beeee.‘
ENG: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among them that are sanctified by faith in me.

ASY: ”ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ܫܠܝܼܡ ܠܝܼ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܙܘܵܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: ”O hadkha ya malka agirpa, shleem-lee-laha khizwa shmayanaya,
ENG: Wherefore, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

ASY: ”ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܵܘ ܕܲܪܡܣܘܿܩ، ܘܕܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ، ܘܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܕܬܲܘܸܒܝܼ ܘܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Moekriz-lee qamayta lanee dgaw darmsooq, o dgaw oorishlim, o bkleh atra deehoed, oep limwate noekhraye, dtawibee o dayree lkis Alaha o palkhee poelkhane khsheekhe ltyawoeta.
ENG: but declared both to them of Damascus first, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judaea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܟܠܵܐ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: ”Boet aha, dweeq-lhoon ilee yhoedaye gaw haykla o b'e-lhoon qaṭlee-lee.
ENG: For this cause the Jews seized me in the temple, and assayed to kill me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܼܝܸܪܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܠܓܘܼܪܵܐ. ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܒܲܕܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ،
TRL: ”Eena Alaha hoeyiree-yleh hal aha yawma, o bishada ywin lz'oora o lgoera. O le ywin bemara mindee lbadar min haw dnwee-e o moeshe meerhoon dbit hawe,
ENG: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand unto this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses did say should come;

ASY: ”ܕܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܪܸܙ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܘܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.“
TRL: ”Dbit qabil khasha msheekha, o bit hawe haw qamaya dqaem min gaw meete, o bit makriz bahra l'ama dganeh o limwate noekhraye.“
ENG: how that the Christ must suffer, and how that he first by the resurrection of the dead should proclaim light both to the people and to the Gentiles.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ ܒܩܵܠܵܐ ܪܵܡܵܐ، ”ܫܘܼܕܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ! ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܫܲܕܘܼܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Kad hadkha jawoebe ywa pawloos boet ganeh, meereh pehisṭoos bqala rama, ”shoedinoekh, pawloos! Yoelpanoekh raba shadoenoekh eeleh.“
ENG: And as he thus made his defence, Festus saith with a loud voice, Paul, thou art mad; thy much learning doth turn thee to madness.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܫܘܼܕܸܢܵܐ ܝܵܐ ܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ ܢܲܨܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܕܨܲܠܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”le ywin shoedina ya pehisṭoos naṣeekha, ila hemizmane dshareeroeta o dṣaleeloeta hamzoeme ywin.
ENG: But Paul saith, I am not mad, most excellent Festus; but speak forth words of truth and soberness.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ، ܘܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܛܸܫܝܹܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܛܸܫܘܵܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab malka ke yade' lklayhy ane, boet aha hamzoeme ywin bjoerat qamoehy, o hamoene ywin dane le yna ṭishye mineh, sabab le yna peeshe 'weede bṭishwa.
ENG: For the king knoweth of these things, unto whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him; for this hath not been done in a corner.

ASY: ”ܝܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܸܬ ܒܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ؟ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܸܬ.“
TRL: ”Ya malka agirpa, ke haminit bnwee-e? Ana beeda'a ywin dke haminit.“
ENG: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ، ”ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܝܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܠܝܼ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܝܵܐ؟“
TRL: Joewib-leh agirpa, ”bikhshawa ywit bkhda 'dana hadkha kreeta maṣeyt 'awdet-lee dhaweyn msheekhaya?“
ENG: And Agrippa said unto Paul, With but little persuasion thou wouldest fain make me a Christian.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ”ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܟܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ، ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܫܡܵܥܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܝܼ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܸܣܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Joewib-leh pawloos, ”b'dana kreeta yan yareekhta, biṭlaba ywin min Alaha la akhchee at eena klayhy anee dbishma'ee yna idyoom dhawee waw aykh deeee, shwooq min ane isoere.“
ENG: And Paul said, I would to God, that whether with little or with much, not thou only, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except these bonds.

ASY: ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܘܫܲܠܝܼܛܵܐ، ܘܒܲܪܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝ݇ܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Qeem-leh malka, o shaleeṭa, o barneeqe, o anee dteebe ywaw 'amayhy.
ENG: And the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: Kad pleeṭ-lhoon, hoemzim-lhoon khad 'am dhaw khena o meerhoon, ”aha nasha le-yleh 'weeda mindee dkhashekh lmawta yan lbeyt aseere.“
ENG: and when they had withdrawn, they spake one to another, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܵܓܸܪܦܵܐ ܠܦܹܗܸܣܛܘܿܣ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܩܹܣܲܪ.“
TRL: meereh agirpa lpehisṭoos, ”aha nasha bit paesh wa shirya in la hawe wa ṭleeba dpaesh deena byad qesar.“
ENG: And Agrippa said unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܛܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܛܵܪܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܐܝܼܛܵܠܝܼܵܐ، ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܠܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܚܲܕ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܝܘܼܠܝܘܿܣ، ܡ̣ܢ ܣܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܩܹܣܲܪ.
TRL: Kad peesh-laha qṭee'ta dṭarakh wa byama leeṭaleea, soepe-lhoon lpawloos o laseere khene d'ameh lkhad rab ima shimeh yoelyoos, min see'ta dqesar.
ENG: And when it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܣܝܼܩ ܠܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܪܵܡܸܢܛܘܿܣ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܚܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ. ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܐܵܪܸܣܛܲܪܟ݂ܘܿܣ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܹܣܵܠܘܿܢܝܼܩܹܐ.
TRL: O seeq lan gaw gamee deewa min adraminṭoos mdeeta, dbi'wara ywa min tkhoema daseea, o ṭre lan. Eet wa 'aman gaw gamee arisṭarkhoos maqedoonaya min tesalooneeqe.
ENG: And embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail unto the places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea, Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܨܲܝܕܘܿܢ، ܘܝܘܼܠܝܘܿܣ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ. ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܠܟܸܣ ܚܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܵܬܹܗ ܠܡܲܢܝܘܼܚܹܐ.
TRL: Byawma khena mṭe lan lṣaydoon, o yoelyoos 'weed-leh ṭawta 'am pawloos. Shweeq-leh dazel lkis khawrawateh lmanyoekhe.
ENG: And the next day we touched at Sidon: and Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him leave to go unto his friends and refresh himself.

ASY: ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܩܸܘܦܪܘܿܣ.
TRL: Ṭre lan min tama, o sabab pawkhe dalqoewlan eewaw, ṭre lan qoerba dqiwproos.
ENG: And putting to sea from thence, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܩܝܼܠܝܼܩܝܼܵܐ ܘܦܲܡܦܘܼܠܝܼܵܐ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܡܹܘܪܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܘܼܩܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dṭre lan byama lbalqoewl dqeeleeqeea o pampoeleea, mṭe lan lmewra mdeeta gaw loeqeea.
ENG: And when we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܛܪܵܝܵܐ ܠܐܝܼܛܵܠܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇.
TRL: Tama moechikh-leh rab ima khda gamee min aliksandreea biṭraya leeṭaleea, o moetiw-leh ilan gawoeha.
ENG: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy; and he put us therein.

ASY: ܒܸܛܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܥܲܣܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܩܢܝܼܕܘܿܣ. ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܵܘܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܩܪܹܛܹܐ ܠܒܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܣܵܠܵܡܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: Biṭraya ywa neekha qa raba yawmane, o b'asqoeta mṭe lan qoerba dqneedoos. O sabab pawkhe dalqoewlan eewaw, ṭre lan bdipna dqreṭe lbalqoewl dsalamoona.
ENG: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and were come with difficulty over against Cnidus, the wind not further suffering us, we sailed under the lee of Crete, over against Salmone;

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܥܲܣܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܛܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ”ܠܡܹܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ،“ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܕܠܵܐܣܹܐܵܐ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Kad b'asqoeta biṭraya ywakh waw min tama, mṭe lan ldoeka dke paysha qreeta ”lmene shapeere,“ qoerba dlasea mdeeta.
ENG: and with difficulty coasting along it we came unto a certain place called Fair Havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܗܲܠ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܨܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܵܦܵܪ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܙܘܼܗܵܪܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ،
TRL: Peesh lan tama raba 'dana, hal d'weereh oep ṣawma dyhoedaye, o sapar boerkha dyama hwe-laha 'asqa. Haygah yoebil-leh zoehara pawloos o meereh,
ENG: And when much time was spent, and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast was now already gone by, Paul admonished them,

ASY: ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܣܵܦܵܪܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܘܚܘܼܣܪܵܢܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܛܲܥܢܵܐ ܘܠܓܵܡܝܼ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܠܓܵܢܵܬܲܢ̈.“
TRL: ”nashe, bikhzaya ywin dsaparan bit hawya boelṣana o khoesrana raba 'al ṭa'na o lgamee, o oep lganatan.“
ENG: and said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the lading and the ship, but also of our lives.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܠܣܲܦܵܢܵܐ ܘܠܡܵܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ،
TRL: Eena rab ima shmee' leh lsapana o lmara dgamee boesh zawda min dlpawloos,
ENG: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship, than to those things which were spoken by Paul.

ASY: ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܠܡܹܐܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܓܵܘܹܗ ܒܣܸܬܘܵܐ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܡܘܼܚܫܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܠܛܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܵܛܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܦܸܘܢܸܟܣ ܘܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܣܸܬܘܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܡܹܐܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܪܹܛܹܐ، ܓܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܵܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܠܵܓܲܪܒܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܪܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: O sabab haw lmena le khashekh wa lipyasha gaweh bsitwa, raba minan moekhshikh-lhoon dpalṭakh waw min tama, bhewee dmaṭakh waw lpiwniks o payshakh waw bsitwa tama. Aha khad lmena ywa gaw qreṭe, gashoeqe lataymna dma'rwa o lagarbya dma'rwa.
ENG: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to put to sea from thence, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there; which is a haven of Crete, looking north-east and south-east.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ، ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܓܪܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܢܓܵܪ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܕܸܦܢܵܐ ܕܩܪܹܛܹܐ.
TRL: Kad mkhe-leh pawkha makeekha dtaymna, khsheew-lhoon aha ywa haw mindee dba'ee waw. Haygah greesh-lhoon langar o ṭre-lhoon bdipna dqreṭe.
ENG: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close in shore.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܬܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ”ܐܹܘܪܵܩܠܹܝܕܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Min bar khad mitkha kirya, khda boeran khaylanta mkhe-laha dke paysha wa qreeta ”ewraqleydoon.“
ENG: But after no long time there beat down from it a tempestuous wind, which is called Euraquilo:

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓ̰ܢܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܟܵܠܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗ̇. ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܐܝܼܕܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܠܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܒܘܼܪܵܢ.
TRL: Peesh-laha jneewta gamee byad boeran o la mṣe-laha kalya wa qamoeha. Roepe lan eeda, o peesh lan loeble byad boeran.
ENG: and when the ship was caught, and could not face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܘܕܵܐ، ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܵܘܬܟܵܐ.
TRL: Kad ṭre lan tkhoot khda gazarta dpaysha wa qreeta qawda, bkhayla mṣe lan dawqakh-laha lawtka.
ENG: And running under the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat:

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܩܘܼܢܒܵܐ، ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܘܚܠܝܼܨܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ. ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܣܹܠܵܐ ܕܣܘܼܪܬܸܣ، ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܲܢܓܵܪ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܛܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ.
TRL: Eeman dmoeṣle-lhoon lqoenba, dre-lhoon khawle tkhoot gamee o khleeṣa-lhoon. O sabab bizda'a ywaw dla hawya napla 'al doeka dsela dsoertis, dre-lhoon langar o peesh-laha ṭreeta gamee.
ENG: and when they had hoisted it up, they used helps, under-girding the ship; and, fearing lest they should be cast upon the Syrtis, they lowered the gear, and so were driven.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܡܸܚܝܹܐ ܒܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܛܲܥܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Byawma khena hadkha peesh lan mikhye bboeran khaylanta droepe lan ṭa'na gaw yama.
ENG: And as we laboured exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw the freight overboard;

ASY: ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O byawma dtlata beedatayhy roepe-lhoon lmindeeane dgamee gaw yama.
ENG: and the third day they cast out with their own hands the tackling of the ship.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܘܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܒܝܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܘܼܪܵܢ ܚܲܠܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܛܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Kad shimsha o kawkhbe la moebyinhoon qa raba yawmane, o boeran khaloene ywa, peesh-laha qṭee'ta ilan klaha hewee dpoerqana.
ENG: And when neither sun nor stars shone upon us for many days, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was now taken away.

ASY: ܩܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܹܝܬ݇ ܦܲܠܓܲܝܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܝܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܲܨܝܸܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܠܵܐ ܛܵܪܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܪܹܛܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܩܲܒܠܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܘܚܘܼܣܪܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Qa raba 'dana nashe le ywaw kheele mindee, haygah kle-leh pawloos bey palgayhy o meereh, ”ya nashe, wale ywa dmaṣyiteetoon waw ilee, o la ṭarakh wa min qreṭe dla qablakh waw aha oelṣana o khoesrana.
ENG: And when they had been long without food, then Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܛܠܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܩܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܪܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Adeea biṭlaba ywin minawkhoon dhaweytoon libane, sabab le ṭalqa oep khda gana minawkhoon, eena akhchee gamee bit paysha moekhriwta.
ENG: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܕܸܦܢܝܼ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܝܘܸܢ ܘܐܸܠܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ،
TRL: ”Sabab kle-leh bdipnee baha layle malakha dalaha, haw dana dee-eh ywin o ileh ke 'awden khilmat,
ENG: For there stood by me this night an angel of the God whose I am, whom also I serve,

ASY: ”ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ’ܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܥܹܬ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܟܵܠܹܝܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܩܹܣܲܪ؛ ܘܗܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܣܵܦܵܪ ܥܲܡܘܼܟ݂.‘
TRL: ”O meereh, ’la zad'et pawloos, wale-ylaha dkaleyt qam qesar; o ha, Alaha bshapaqateh yoebil-leh iloekh lklayhy anee dbi'wada yna sapar 'amoekh.‘
ENG: saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must stand before Caesar: and lo, God hath granted thee all them that sail with thee.

ASY: ”ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܝܵܐ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܝܼ.
TRL: ”Hadkha hweymoen libane, ya gawre, sabab hamoene ywin balaha dhadkha bit hawe aykh dhoemzim-leh 'amee.
ENG: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even so as it hath been spoken unto me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܪܘܼܦܝܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena wale-ylaha dpayshakh roepye 'al khda gazarta.“
ENG: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܝܠܹܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥܣܲܪ، ܟܲܕ ܗܹܫ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܸܪܝܹܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܕܹܪܝܼܵܬܸܩ، ܒܦܲܠܓܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܠܹܐ، ܛܵܪ̈ܝܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܲܕ ܒܸܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: O eeman dhwe-leh layle darba'sar, kad hesh pyasha ywakh waw ṭirye-laha geba o lhaw geba byama dadereeatiq, bpalga dlayle, ṭaryane dgamee khsheew-lhoon dqarboene ywaw lkhad birza.
ENG: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven to and fro in the sea of Adria, about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some country;

ASY: ܟܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܬܠܵܬܝܼ ܘܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܡܸܬܪܹ̈ܐ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ، ܟܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܸܣܪܝܼ ܘܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܡܸܬܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Keel-lhoon l'oemqa o khze-lhoon deewa maykh tlatee o shaw'a mitre. O min bar dṭre lan khad mitkha, keel-lhoon l'oemqa mindrish o khze-lhoon deewa maykh 'isree o shaw'a mitre.
ENG: and they sounded, and found twenty fathoms: and after a little space, they sounded again, and found fifteen fathoms.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܙܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܵܚܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܩܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܠܲܢܓܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ، ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܕܙܵܪܹܩ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kad bizda'a dla makhakh waw lqaye, dre-lhoon arb'a langare bkharta dgamee, ṣaloeye dzareq yawma.
ENG: And fearing lest haply we should be cast ashore on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for the day.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܛܵܪ̈ܝܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܥܪܵܩܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܡܝܼ. ܡܘܼܨܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܠܵܘܬܟܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܒܡܵܗܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܵܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܵܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܲܢܓܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܓܵܡܝܼ.
TRL: Eena ṭaryane dgamee b'e-lhoon li'raqa min gamee. Moeṣle-lhoon llawtka 'al yama, bmahana dba'ee waw daree waw langare min qam gamee.
ENG: And as the sailors were seeking to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would lay out anchors from the foreship,

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܘܠܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ، ”ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܟܵܠܝܼ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܪܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ.“
TRL: Haygah pawloos meereh lrab ima o ldakhshe, ”in ane nashe la kalee 'aman gaw gamee, akhtoon le parqeetoon.“
ENG: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܒ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܘܬܟܵܐ ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah dakhshe qṭee' lhoon lkhawle dlawtka o shweeq-lhoon napla wa.
ENG: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܨܲܦܪܵܐ، ܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ. ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐܲܢܹܐ ܐܲܪܒܲܥܣܲܪ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܣܦܝܼܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܛܥܝܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: Min qam ṣapra, poerpil-leh pawloos bklayhy dakhlee waw mekhoelta. meereh ilayhy, ”ane arba'sar yawmane speerawkhoon o mindee le ytoon ṭ'eeme.
ENG: And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take some food, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.

ASY: ”ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܵܟ݂ܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܹܝܬܘܿܢ. ܡܸܙܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܠܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Adeea parpoele ywin beeawkhoon dakhleetoon mekhoelta dkhayeytoon. Mizta min resha dkhad minawkhoon le napla.“
ENG: Wherefore I beseech you to take some food: for this is for your safety: for there shall not a hair perish from the head of any of you.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܘܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܩܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܹܐܟ݂ܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dmeereh hadkha, shqeel-leh lakhma o shoebikh-leh lalaha qam klayhy, qṣe-leh o shoere-leh lekhala.
ENG: And when he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all: and he brake it, and began to eat.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܘܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Peesh-lhoon yoebe liba klayhy, o shqeel-lhoon oep anee o kheel-lhoon.
ENG: Then were they all of good cheer, and themselves also took food.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܬܪܲܝܡܵܐܐ ܘܫܲܒ݂ܥܝܼ ܘܐܸܫܸܬ ܓܵܢܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eet waw gaw gamee trayma o shaw'ee o ishit ganate.
ENG: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܐ݇ܟ݂ܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܣܒ݂ܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܩܘܼܠܩܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܡܝܼ ܒܪܲܦܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar dkheel-lhoon o swee' lhoon, qoelqil-lhoon lgamee brapayta dkhiṭe gaw yama.
ENG: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܕܪܲܥܢܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܣܝܼܦܵܐ، ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܠܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܬܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kad hwe-leh yawma, la dee' lhoon lhay ar'a, eena khze-lhoon khad dra'na dyama deet wa-leh seepa, khsheew-lhoon in maṣya bit maklee-laha gamee tama.
ENG: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they perceived a certain bay with a beach, and they took counsel whether they could drive the ship upon it.

ASY: ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܠܲܢܓܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܘܫܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܒ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܵܘܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܪܸܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܘܼܢܒܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܘܛܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ.
TRL: Qṭee' lhoon llangare o shweeqay-lhoon gaw yama, o shre-lhoon khawle dsawkane, o moerim-lhoon qoenba lpawkha o ṭre-lhoon lbirza.
ENG: And casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time loosing the bands of the rudders; and hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܠܣܹܠܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܩܘܼܪܸܨ ܠܹܗ ܓܹܒܘܼܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܝܼܓ̰ ܠܹܗ، ܘܓܹܒܘܼܗ̇ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܘܼܛܩܸܛܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܠܲܦܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena mkhe-laha gamee lsela dyama o qoeriṣ-leh geboeha qamaya o la jweej-leh, o geboeha kharaya peesh-leh qoeṭqiṭa byad lape.
ENG: But lighting upon a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground; and the foreship struck and remained unmoveable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.

ASY: ܕܲܚܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܩܵܛܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܪܩܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܣܚܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Dakhshe b'e-lhoon dqaṭlee waw laseere dla 'arqee waw boerkha dskhayta.
ENG: And the soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܲܒ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܥܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ. ܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܚܵܝܵܐ ܕܪܲܦܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܝܵܡܵܐ ܘܡܵܛܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ،
TRL: Eena rab ima moeklee-ay-leh min li'wada aha shoela, sabab ba'e wa dpariq wa lpawloos. Pqeed-leh lanee dke yad'ee waw skhaya drapee waw-laha ganayhy qamayta gaw yama o maṭee waw lbirza,
ENG: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stayed them from their purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves overboard, and get first to the land:

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܕܲܦܹ̈ܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܩܸܛܥܵܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܡܝܼ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O anee khene teew-lhoon 'al dape o 'al qiṭ'aṭe dgamee. Hadkha klayhy mṭe-lhoon lbirza khaye.
ENG: and the rest, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. And so it came to pass, that they all escaped safe to the land.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܒܸܪܙܵܐ ܨܵܠܵܡܲܬ، ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܠܹܛܹܐ.
TRL: Eeman dmṭe lan lbirza ṣalamat, dee' lan dhay gazarta ke paysha wa qreeta meeleṭe.
ENG: And when we were escaped, then we knew that the island was called Melita.

ASY: ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܪ̈ܲܚܡܵܢܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܸܠܲܢ. ܫܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܩܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܕܫܵܚܢܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ ܒܸܪܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܩܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: 'Amrane dgazarta raba mrakhmane ywaw ilan. Sheerhoon noera o qre-lhoon ilan dshakhnakh waw sabab miṭra bir'aya ywa o qarta ywa.
ENG: And the barbarians shewed us no common kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

ASY: ܓ̰ܘܼܡܸܥ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܚܕܵܐ ܕܲܣܬܵܐ ܕܩܸܪ̈ܫܹܐ ܘܡܘܼܬܒܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ. ܘܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܐܵܟܸܕܢܵܐ ܘܛܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܝܼܕܹܗ.
TRL: Joemi' leh pawloos khda dasta dqirshe o moetbay-leh 'al noera. O min khimta dnoera pleeṭ-leh khad akidna o ṭpe-leh beedeh.
ENG: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, a viper came out by reason of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܵܡܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܠܚܘܼܘܹܐ ܬܸܠܝܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ”ܕܠܵܐ ܫܸܟ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܛܘܿܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܦܪܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܵܡܵܐ، ܗܵܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܵܝܹܐ.“
TRL: Eeman dkhze-lhoon 'amrane dhay gazarta lkhoewe tilya beeda dpawloos, meerhoon khad lhaw khena, ”dla shik aha nasha qaṭoola-yleh. Oep in dpreeq-leh min yama, haqoeta la shweeq-laha dkhaye.“
ENG: And when the barbarians saw the beast hanging from his hand, they said one to another, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped from the sea, yet Justice hath not suffered to live.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܫܥܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܘܼܘܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܠܓܵܘ ܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena pawloos sh'eesh-leh lkhoewe min eedeh lgaw noera, o mindee khirba la hwe-leh ileh.
ENG: Howbeit he shook off the beast into the fire, and took no harm.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܒܸܬ ܙܵܐܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ. ܟܲܕ ܣܦܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܪܒܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܝܼܵܠܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ، ”ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Anee khsheew-lhoon dbit zaer wa, yan minshiltane bit napel wa meeta. Kad speerhoon khad mitkha yareekha o khze-lhoon dmindee khirba la hwe-leh ileh, shoekhlip-lhoon kheealayhy o meerhoon, ”aha khad Alaha-yleh.“
ENG: But they expected that he would have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but when they were long in expectation, and beheld nothing amiss came to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܪ̈ܥܵܬܹܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܦܘܼܦܠܝܼܘܿܣ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhay doeka eet waw ar'ate dkhad nasha shimeh poepleeoos. Aha goera dgazarta ywa, o qoebil-leh ilan bkhadoeta gaw bayteh qa tlata yawmane.
ENG: Now in the neighbourhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius; who received us, and entertained us three days courteously.

ASY: ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܦܠܝܼܘܿܣ ܡܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܲܡܚܲܡܬܵܐ ܘܒܡܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܡܲܥܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܡܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܫܘܝܼܬܵܐ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܨܘܼܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܕܹܗ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܘܒܘܼܣܸܡ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Baba dpoepleeoos mree'a ywa bkhamkhamta o bmar'a dma'ye o dmeekha ywa bshweeta. 'weereh pawloos lkis-leh o ṣoele-leh, o moetiw-leh eedeh 'aloehy o boesim-leh.
ENG: And it was so, that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery: unto whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laying his hands on him healed him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܡܪ̈ܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܣܡܹܐ.
TRL: Eeman dhwe-laha aha, anee khene dmree'e ywaw gaw gazarta te-lhoon lkis-leh o peesh-lhoon boesme.
ENG: And when this was done, the rest also which had diseases in the island came, and were cured:

ASY: ܡܝܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܒܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܸܦܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܘܵܕܹ̈ܐ ܠܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܲܢ.
TRL: Myoeqirhoon ilan boerkhate raba, o eeman dbiplaṭa ywakh waw min tama, moetiw-lhoon zwade lsneeqoetan.
ENG: who also honoured us with many honours; and when we sailed, they put on board such things as we needed.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܡܝܼ ܐܵܠܸܟܣܲܢܕܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܣܸܬܘܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܓܵܙܲܪܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܨܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܐܲܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܓ̰ܲܡܹ̈ܐ، ܟܵܣܬܘܿܪ ܘܦܘܿܠܲܟܣ.
TRL: Min bar tlata yarkhe ṭre lan bkhda gamee aliksandrayta dpeeshta ywa bsitwa gaw gazarta. Eet wa 'aloeha ṣoerta dtrey alahe jame, kastoor o poolaks.
ENG: And after three months we set sail in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the island, whose sign was The Twin Brothers.

ASY: ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܣܵܪܵܩܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Mṭe lan lsaraqoosa o peesh lan tama tlata yawmane.
ENG: And touching at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܛܪܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܘܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܪܸܓ݂ܝܼܘܿܢ. ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܡܚܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܚܵܐ ܕܬܲܝܡܢܵܐ، ܘܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܦܘܼܛܝܼܐܹܠܘܿܣ.
TRL: Min tama ṭre lan o mṭe lan lrigheeoon. Byawma khena mkhe-leh pawkha dtaymna, o byawma dtrey mṭe lan lpoeṭeeeloos.
ENG: And from thence we made a circuit, and arrived at Rhegium: and after one day a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli:

ASY: ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܲܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ.
TRL: Tama moechikh lan akhoonwate, o poerpil-lhoon bee-an dpayshakh waw lkis layhy shaw'a yawmane. Bkharta zeel lan lroome.
ENG: where we found brethren, and were entreated to tarry with them seven days: and so we came to Rome.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܫܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐ݇ܬܵܝܬܲܢ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܼܪܚܲܢ ܗܲܠ ܫܘܼܩܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܵܦܝܼܘܿܣ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܗܲܠ ܬܠܵܬ ܚܵܢܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܫܘܼܒܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dshmee' lhoon akhoonwate dtama boet taytan, pleeṭ-lhoon loerkhan hal shoeqa dke paesh qirya apeeoos, o khakma khene te-lhoon 'aman hal tlat khanawate. Eeman dkhizyay-leh pawloos, shoebikh-leh lalaha o shqeel-leh liba.
ENG: And from thence the brethren, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius, and The Three Taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܠܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ، ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܕܥܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܹܗ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܢܵܛܘܿܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܕܲܚܫܵܐ.
TRL: Kad mṭe lan lroome, pawloos peesh-leh shweeqa d'amer wa bnawsheh tkhoot naṭooroeta dkhad dakhsha.
ENG: And when we entered into Rome, Paul was suffered to abide by himself with the soldier that guarded him.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܠܪܹ̈ܫܵܢܹܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܓ̰ܡܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܥܲܡܲܢ ܘܥܵܕܲܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܲܢ̈، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ ܘܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܪ̈ܗ݇ܘܿܡܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: Min bar tlata yawmane qre-leh pawloos lreshane dyhoedaye, o eeman djmee' lhoon meereh ilayhy, ”nashe akhoonwate, apin dla 'weed-lee mindee dalqoewl d'aman o 'adate dawahatan, peesh-lee dweeqa aseera gaw oorishlim o soepya lroomaye.
ENG: And it came to pass, that after three days he called together those that were the chief of the Jews: and when they were come together, he said unto them, I, brethren, though I had done nothing against the people, or the customs of our fathers, yet was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans:

ASY: ”ܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܡ ܨܲܚܨܝܼ ܠܝܼ ܘܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: ”Anee qam ṣakhṣee-lee o b'e-lhoon dsharee waw-lee sabab la moechikh-lhoon beeee 'ilta khsheekhta lmawta.
ENG: who, when they had examined me, desired to set me at liberty, because there was no cause of death in me.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܠܝܸܨ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܛܠܝܼܒ ܠܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܩܹܣܲܪ. ܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܛܵܝܸܦܝܼ.
TRL: ”Eena eeman dqeem-lhoon yhoedaye o moelyiṣ-lhoon ilee, ṭleeb-lee dpayshen deena byad qesar. La khashweetoon teea ywin dhamzimin dalqoewl dṭayipee.
ENG: But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar; not that I had aught to accuse my nation of.

ASY: ”ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܹܫܸܠܬܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Boet aha qre-lee ilawkhoon dkhazeynawkhoon o hamzimin 'amawkhoon, sabab boet hewee deesrayel ana peesha ywin seera baha sheshilta.“
ENG: For this cause therefore did I entreat you to see and to speak with me: for because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܩܘܼܒܠܹܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܼܗܘܼܕ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐ݇ܬܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܒܸܪܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: O anee joewib-lhoon, ”le ywakh qoeble ktawa min eehoed boet deeoekh, o la nasha min akhoonwate dteea-yleh min tama moekhbira yan hoemzima-yleh mindee beesha boet deeoekh.
ENG: And they said unto him, We neither received letters from Judaea concerning thee, nor did any of the brethren come hither and report or speak any harm of thee.

ASY: ”ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܫܵܡܥܲܚ ܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ.“
TRL: ”Eena akhnan bib'aya ywakh dsham'akh minoekh, at moodee bikhshawa ywit, sabab beeda'a ywakh bkl doeka nashe hamzoeme yna dalqoewl daha yoelpana.“
ENG: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against.

ASY: ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܕܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ. ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܪܲܡܫܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܵܗܕܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܲܣܒܘܼܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Soezgirhoon djam'ee waw 'ameh khad yawma, o te-lhoon lkis-leh khad minyana goera ayka dshirya ywa pawloos. Min qaydamta o hal ramsha hoemzim-leh 'amayhy boet malkoeta dalaha, o moekhze-leh ilayhy sahdwate kad masboete min namoosa dmoeshe o min nwee-e boet eeshoo'.
ENG: And when they had appointed him a day, they came to him into his lodging in great number; to whom he expounded the matter, testifying the kingdom of God, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning till evening.

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Khakma minayhy hoeminhoon bmindee dmeereh, eena khene la hoeminhoon.
ENG: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ”ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ،
TRL: La soezgirhoon m'oedale, o pleeṭ-lhoon min bar dpawloos meereh ane hemizmane, ”shareeraeet hoemzim-leh roekha dqoedsha lawahatawkhoon byad esha'ya nweea, bemara,
ENG: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Isaiah the prophet unto your fathers,

ASY: ܙܹܠ݇ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܘܿܪ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ’ܫܡܵܥܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Ze lkis aha 'ama o moor ilayhy, ’shma'a bit sham'eetoon o le parmeytoon, o khzaya bit khazeytoon o le yad'eetoon.
ENG: saying, Go thou unto this people, and say, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall in no wise understand; And seeing ye shall see, and shall in no wise perceive:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܠܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܘܢܵܬܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܘܼܩܪܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܫܡܵܥܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܒܢܵܬܝܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܦܲܪܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܘܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ ܕܒܲܣܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ.‘
TRL: Sabab khleem-leh liba daha 'ama, o natyatayhy yoeqrinhoon min lishma'a, o cheem-lhoon 'aynayhy, dla khazee b'aynayhy o sham'ee bnatyatayhy, o parmee blibayhy o dayree lkis-lee dbasminhoon.‘
ENG: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes they have closed; Lest haply they should perceive with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And should turn again, And I should heal them.

ASY: ”ܝ݇ܕܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܝܼ.“
TRL: ”di'moen hadkha, adeea poerqana dalaha peesh-leh shoedra limwate, o anee bit maṣyitee.“
ENG: Be it known therefore unto you, that this salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles: they will also hear.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܘܼܪܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܸܕܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Min bar dhoemzim-leh pawloos hadkha, pleeṭ-lhoon yhoedaye o shoere-lhoon bidrasha beyl ganayhy.
ENG: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, having much dispute among themselves

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܬܲܪܬܹܝ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܗ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܐܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ. ܘܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Peesh-leh tama pawloos tartey shine gaw bayta ddweeqeh ywa baghra. O ke qabil wa lklayhy nashe datee waw lkis-leh.
ENG: And he abode two whole years in his own hired dwelling, and received all that went in unto him,

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܡܲܠܸܦ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܓܲܠܝܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Ke makriz wa ilayhy boet malkoeta dalaha o malip wa boet Maran eeshoo' msheekha galyaeet o dla maklayta.
ENG: preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, none forbidding him.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ، ܪܹܓܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܠܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Pawloos, rega deeshoo' msheekha, qirya dhawe shleekha, dpeesh-leh preesha lmakroeze ewangaleeoon dalaha.
ENG: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Aha-yleh ewangaleeoon dqoewil-leh min qamayta byad nweeoehy gaw ktabe qadeeshe,
ENG: which he promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܝܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܐ،
TRL: Boet brooneh dpeesh-leh leeda min zar'a ddaweed min paghreh nashaya geba,
ENG: concerning his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh,

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܝܲܕ ܩܝܵܡܬܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: O haw dpeesh-leh dee'a broona dalaha bkhayla droekha dqadeeshoeta, byad qyamteh min gaw meete, eeshoo' msheekha Maran.
ENG: who was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection of the dead; even Jesus Christ our Lord,

ASY: ܒܝܼܹܗ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܫܸܡܹܗ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܲܢ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܫܠܝܼܚܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܩܵܪܲܚ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܨܝܸܬܝܼ ܠܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bee-eh o boet khatir dshimeh shqeel lan shapaqat o shleekhoeta dqarakh lbnaynasha min gaw klayhy imwate dmaṣyitee lhaymanoeta.
ENG: through whom we received grace and apostleship, unto obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name’s sake:

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Oep akhtoon gaw anee ytoon dpeeshe yna qirye deeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: among whom are ye also, called to be Jesus Christ’s:

ASY: ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shapaqat o shlama 'amawkhoon min Alaha baban o min Maran eeshoo' msheekha, lklayhy moekhibe dalaha dgaw roome dpeeshe yna qirye qadeeshe.
ENG: To all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: Qamayta shakoere ywin lalahee byad eeshoo' msheekha boet klawkhoon, dpeeshta-ylaha hoemzimta boet haymanoetawkhoon gaw kleh 'alma.
ENG: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.

ASY: ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܟܪܲܙܬܵܐ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܕܠܹܐ ܫܵܠܹܝܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܕܟ݂ܵܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܨܠܘܿܬܝܼ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Bishada-yleh ilee Alaha, haw dke 'awden khilmat ileh min kleh libee byad makrazta dewangaleeoon dbrooneh, dle shaleyn min lidkharawkhoon gaw ṣlootee bkl 'dana.
ENG: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you, always in my prayers

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܬܚܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eet-lee hewee adeea bṣiwyana dalaha bit patkha oerkha dateyn lkis lawkhoon.
ENG: making request, if by any means now at length I may be prospered by the will of God to come unto you.

ASY: ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܚܵܙܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܐ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇،
TRL: Ba'eyn dkhazeynawkhoon dyabenawkhoon mawhawta roekhanayta dpaysheetoon khoeline beeoeha,
ENG: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

ASY: ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܡܘܼܩܘܝܼܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Dana o akhtoon m'oedale payshakh moeqwee-e bhaymanoeta dkhad haw khena.
ENG: that is, that I with you may be comforted in you, each of us by the other’s faith, both yours and mine.

ASY: ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܝܼ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܘܼܟܠܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Ba'eyn dyad'eetoon akhoonwatee, draba gahe moetiw-lee blibee dateyn lkis lawkhoon doep beeawkhoon hawe-lee ṭ'oenta aykh dgaw imwate khene, eena hal adeea peesha ywin moekleea.
ENG: And I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you (and was hindered hitherto), that I might have some fruit in you also, even as in the rest of the Gentiles.

ASY: ܕܲܝܢܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ، ܠܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Daynana ywin lyawnaye o lnoekhraye, lkhakeeme o lsakhle.
ENG: I am debtor both to Greeks and to Barbarians, both to the wise and to the foolish.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܦܘܼܛܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܲܫܚܸܕܸܢ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܓܵܘ ܪܗ݇ܘܿܡܹܐ.
TRL: Boet aha khapoeṭe ywin dmashkhidin ewangaleeoon oep ilawkhoon dgaw roome.
ENG: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are in Rome.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܢܟ݂ܵܦܵܐ ܒܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܟܠ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab le ywin binkhapa bewangaleeoon sabab khayla dalaha-yleh qa poerqana dkl dhamin, qamayta lyhoedaye o haygah lyawnaye.
ENG: For I am not ashamed of the gospel: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܓܵܘ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܫܘܼܠܵܡܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab gaw ewangaleeoon peeshta-ylaha gleeta zadeeqoeta dke atya min Alaha, zadeeqoeta deelaha byad haymanoeta, min shoeraya o hal shoelama, aykh deeleh kteewa: zadeeqa bhaymanoeta bit khaye.
ENG: For therein is revealed a righteousness of God by faith unto faith: as it is written, But the righteous shall live by faith.

ASY: ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܘܟܦܘܼܪܝܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܚܢܵܩܘܼܗ̇ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܥܵܘܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Pyasha-ylaha gleeta karba dalaha min shmaya 'al kleh 'awla o kpoerya dbnaynasha, anee dbikhnaqoeha yna shareeroeta byad 'awlayhy,
ENG: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold down the truth in unrighteousness;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܸܠܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Sabab da'ta dalaha peeshta-ylaha gleeta ilayhy, sabab Alaha gilyoeha-yleh ilayhy,
ENG: because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God manifested it unto them.

ASY: ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܵܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܲܙܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ: ܚܲܝܠܹܗ ܐܵܒܵܕܝܼܢܵܝܵܐ، ܘܟܝܵܢܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܝܵܐ. ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܪܡܝܼܹܐ ܒܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܪܝܹܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܗܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Ha min shoeraya dbreeta, deelayate la mitkhazyane dalaha peeshe yna khizye: khayleh abadeenaya, o kyaneh alahaya. Ane ke payshee poermee-e bmindeeane dpeeshe yna birye, hadkha dnashe layt-lhoon mahana.
ENG: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse:

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܚܩܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܫܘܼܟܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܦܝܼܩܹܐ ܒܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܘܚܘܼܫܟܸܢܹܗ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܝܼܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Oep in ddee' lhoon lalaha, la khqeerhoon ileh aykh Alaha, o la shoekirhoon ileh, ila hwe-lhoon speeqe bkhoeshabayhy, o khoeshkineh libayhy la parmeeana.
ENG: because that, knowing God, they glorified him not as God, neither gave thanks; but became vain in their reasonings, and their senseless heart was darkened.

ASY: ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܚܲܟܝܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: meerhoon bganayhy dkhakeeme yna, eena hwe-lhoon sakhle.
ENG: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

ASY: ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ، ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܨܲܠܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܒܲܥ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܪܸ̈ܓ̰ܒܹܐ.
TRL: Shoekhlip-lhoon tishbookhta dalaha la mayoota bdmoeta dbarnasha mayoota, bdmoeta dṣalme dṭayre, o dhaywane darba' aqlate, o drijbe.
ENG: and changed the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܡܲܣܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Boet aha, Alaha soepyay-leh lṭanpoeta bshahwatyate dlibayhy d'awdee maslayta bpaghra d'oedale.
ENG: Wherefore God gave them up in the lusts of their hearts unto uncleanness, that their bodies should be dishonoured among themselves:

ASY: ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܓܠܵܐ، ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܒܵܪܝܵܢܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܥܵܠܡܝܼܢ، ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: Shoekhlip-lhoon shrara dalaha ldoegla, o sgheed-lhoon o 'weed-lhoon khilmat lbreeta boesh zawda min lbaryana, deeleh mboerkha l'alam 'almeen, ameyn.
ENG: for that they exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܢܟܸܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܢܸܩܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܟܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha, soepyay-leh Alaha lshahwatyate mankipane. Oep niqbayhy shoekhlip-lhoon shoelayhy kyanaya lhaw deeleh dalqoewl dkyana.
ENG: For this cause God gave them up unto vile passions: for their women changed the natural use into that which is against nature:

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܘܼܪ̈ܙܲܝܗܝ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ ܟܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܢܸܩܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܪܝܼܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܐܘܼܪ̈ܙܹܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܡ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܫܪܝܼܚܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Oep oerzayhy shweeq-lhoon shoela kyanaya dniqbe o shreekh-lhoon bshahwatta dkhad lhaw khena. Oerze 'weed-lhoon ṭanpoeta khad 'am haw khena, o hadkha qoebil-lhoon lganayhy dyanta dkhsheekhta ywa lshreekhoetayhy.
ENG: and likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another, men with men working unseemliness, and receiving in themselves that recompense of their error which was due.

ASY: ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܣܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܪܸ̈ܥܝܵܢܹܐ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: O aykh dla b'e-lhoon dyad'ee lalaha, soepyay-leh Alaha lri'yane baṭeele d'awdee mindeeane dle yna khsheekhe li'wada.
ENG: And even as they refused to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up unto a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not fitting;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܠܝܹܐ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܒܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ، ܛܲܡܲܥܟܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܲܚܸܠܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܸܛܠܵܐ، ܡܲܩܲܪܵܨܘܼܬܵܐ، ܦܸܠܡܵܐ، ܣܪܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܣܦܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Peesh-lhoon milye 'awla, beeshoeta, ṭama'karoeta, ṭanpoeta, bakhilanoeta, qiṭla, maqaraṣoeta, pilma, sreeqoeta, hemizmane speeqe,
ENG: being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

ASY: ܩܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܢܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܨܲܥܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܚܵܬܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܫܲܒ݂ܗܸܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ ܒܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Qawlane, sanyane dalaha, ṣa'rane, khatrane, shawhirane, machkhane doerkhate beeshe, la maṣyitane lawahe,
ENG: backbiters, hateful to God, insolent, haughty, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ.
TRL: Dla parmayta, dla mhoemnoeta, dla khoeba, dla rakhme.
ENG: without understanding, covenant-breakers, without natural affection, unmerciful:

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܣܵܡܵܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Oep in dke yad'ee deet dyanta dalaha, danee d'awdee aykh dane khsheekhe yna lmawta, la akhchee ke 'awdee-lhoon, ila eet-lhoon boesama banee d'awdee-lhoon.
ENG: who, knowing the ordinance of God, that they which practise such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but also consent with them that practise them.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܝܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܡܵܗܵܢܵܐ. ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܠܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ.
TRL: Boet aha, kl man deewit ya barnasha, layt-loekh mahana. At deewit bidyana lkhene, lganoekh bidyana ywit, sabab bi'wada ywit anee mindeeane dbee-ayhy bidyana ywit lkhene.
ENG: Wherefore thou art without excuse, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest dost practise the same things.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Eena beeda'a ywakh ddyanta dalaha shareerta-ylaha 'al anee d'awdee ane.
ENG: And we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against them that practise such things.

ASY: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܒܸܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܟܲܕ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܲܝ ܝܘܸܬ، ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܩܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟
TRL: At ya barnasha dbidyana ywit lkhene dbi'wada yna ane, kad oep at bganoekh bi'waday ywit, bikhshawa ywit bit parqet min dyanta dalaha?
ENG: And reckonest thou this, O man, who judgest them that practise such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

ASY: ܝܲܢ ܡܲܣܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܥܘܼܬܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܹܗ، ܘܡܲܪܝܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܢܹܗ، ܘܚܡܵܠܬܹܗ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܡܲܟܝܼܟ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܗܲܕܘܼܝܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Yan masloeye ywit l'oetra dmakeekhoeteh, o maryakhta dbeneh, o khmalteh, o le ywit beeda'a dmakeekhoeta dalaha mhadoeyoekh eelaha ltyawoeta?
ENG: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܸܫܝܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܠܵܐ ܬܲܘܸܒܵܢܵܐ، ܓ̰ܲܡܘܼܥܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܠܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Eena boet qishyoetoekh o liboekh la tawibana, jamoe'e ywit 'al ganoekh karba lyawma dkarba dalaha, eeman dpaysha gleeta dyanta zadeeqta dee-eh.
ENG: but after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up for thyself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

ASY: ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Alaha bit pare' lkl khad aykh poelkhaneh.
ENG: who will render to every man according to his works:

ASY: ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܛܵܥܝܼ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܘܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ،
TRL: Lanee dbkhmalta 'awdee poelkhane ṭabe o ṭa'ee shoewkha o eeqara o la mayootoeta, bit yabil khaye dl'alam,
ENG: to them that by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honour and incorruption, eternal life:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܠܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ ܘܟܲܪܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eena lanee deena anaye o la shalmane lshrara, ila dke palkhee 'awla, bit hawya khimta o karba.
ENG: but unto them that are factious, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, shall be wrath and indignation,

ASY: ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܵܐ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Bit hawe oelṣana o joenjara lkl khad d'abed beeshta, qamayta lyhoedaya, o haygah lyawnaya.
ENG: tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that worketh evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܘܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܘܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܟܠ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena khiqra o eeqara o shlama lkl d'abed ṭawta, qamayta lyhoedaya o haygah lyawnaya.
ENG: but glory and honour and peace to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܙܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܬܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab layt khzayta dpata lkis Alaha.
ENG: for there is no respect of persons with God.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܕܠܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܛܵܠܩܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܹܐ.
TRL: Klayhy anee dlayt-lhoon namoosa o khṭe-lhoon, dla namoosa bit ṭalqee, o anee deet-lhoon namoosa o khṭe-lhoon, byad namoosa bit payshee deene.
ENG: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned under law shall be judged by law;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab le-ylaha anee dsham'ee namoosa bit payshee moekshiṭa qam Alaha, ila anee dnaṭree namoosa bit payshee moekshiṭe.
ENG: for not the hearers of a law are just before God, but the doers of a law shall be justified:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܟܝܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܼܢܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab eeman imwate, dlayt-lhoon namoosa, o kyanaeet 'awdee mindeeane dpeeshe yna ṭleebe byad namoosa, anee eena namoosa qa ganayhy, oep in dlayt-lhoon namoosa.
ENG: for when Gentiles which have no law do by nature the things of the law, these, having no law, are a law unto themselves;

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܙܝܼ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢܝܲܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܡܲܢܟ݂ܘܼܣܲܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܓ̰ܲܘܘܼܒܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Bhay dke makhzee poelkhana dnamoosa kteewa gaw libayhy. Oep inyatayhy bishada-ylaha 'alayhy, o khoeshabayhy mankhoesay yna yan jawoebe ilayhy.
ENG: in that they shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience bearing witness therewith, and their thoughts one with another accusing or else excusing them;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܫܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܛܸܫܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܝܼ ܡܲܚܒܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Aha bit hawya bhaw yawma dalaha daen shoele ṭishye dbnaynasha byad eeshoo' msheekha, aykh ewangaleeoon deeee makhboere-yleh.
ENG: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my gospel, by Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܬ ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ، ܘܒܸܕܪܵܝܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܬ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: In at biqrayoeha ywit ganoekh yhoedaya, o bidrayoeha ywit heweeoekh 'al namoosa, o bi'wada ywit shoewhara dke yad'et lalaha,
ENG: But if thou bearest the name of a Jew, and restest upon the law, and gloriest in God,

ASY: ܘܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܬ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ، ܘܒܸܦܪܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܹ̈ܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܡܘܼܠܦܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ،
TRL: O ke yad'et ṣiwyaneh, o biprasha ywit mindeeane myoeqre sabab peesha ywit moelpa byad namoosa,
ENG: and knowest his will, and approvest the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law,

ASY: ܘܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܗܲܕܝܵܢܵܐ ܠܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ،
TRL: O hamoene ywit bganoekh deewit mhadyana lsimye, o bahra lanee deena gaw khishka,
ENG: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them that are in darkness,

ASY: ܘܬܲܠܡܸܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܣܲܟ݂ܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܲܠܘܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܘܼܡܝܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܘܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ،
TRL: O talmidana dsakhle, o malpana dyaloede, sabab eet-loekh doemya dda'ta o dshrara bnamoosa,
ENG: a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth;

ASY: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܝܼܘܸܬ ܡܲܠܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܦܸܬ ܠܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂؟ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܓܵܢܒ݂ܝܼ، ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܓܢܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ؟
TRL: At deewit maloepe lkhene, le hawya dmalpit lganoekh? At dmakroeze ywit lkhene dla ganwee, ganoekh bignawa ywit?
ENG: thou therefore that teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

ASY: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ، ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܓܲܝܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ؟ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܟܹܐ ܣܵܢܹܝܬ ܨܵܢܲܡܹ̈ܐ، ܓܵܢܘܼܟ݂ ܫܲܠܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܗܲܝܟܠܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: At dbemara ywit dnashe la 'awdee gayaroeta, ganoekh bi'wada ywit gayaroeta? At dke saneyt ṣaname, ganoekh shaloekhe ywit haykle?
ENG: thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?

ASY: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܡܲܣܠܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܡܵܛܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ؟
TRL: At dbi'wada ywit shoewhara bnamoosa, masloeye ywit lalaha byad shmaṭta dnamoosa?
ENG: thou who gloriest in the law, through thy transgression of the law dishonourest thou God?

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܕܝܼܦܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa: boet deeawkhoon shima dalaha ke paesh gdeepa gaw imwate.
ENG: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, even as it is written.

ASY: ܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܦܲܝܕܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܢܵܛܪܹܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܫܵܡܛܹܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܘܼܪܠܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Gzoerta eet-laha payda in naṭret namoosa, eena in shamṭet namoosa, gzoerta hwe-laha 'oerloeta.
