ENG: For circumcision indeed profiteth, if thou be a doer of the law: but if thou be a transgressor of the law, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܢܵܛܪܝܼ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܫܝܼܒܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Hadkha in anee dle yna gzeere naṭree poeqdane dnamoosa, le payshee khsheebe aykh din gzeere yna?
ENG: If therefore the uncircumcision keep the ordinances of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision?

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܥܘܼܪܠܵܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܬܲܡܸܡ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܫܡܵܛܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ؟
TRL: O haw deeleh 'oerla bpaghra eena ke tamim namoosa, le daen iloekh deet-loekh ktawa o gzoerta eena bishmaṭa ywit namoosa?
ENG: and shall not the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfill the law, judge thee, who with the letter and circumcision art a transgressor of the law?

ASY: ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܲܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܒܲܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܒܸܣܪܵܐ.
TRL: Yhoedaya le-yleh haw dbaraeet yhoedaya-yleh, o la gzoerta hay dbaraeet bbisra.
ENG: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

ASY: ܐܸܠܵܐ، ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܓܵܘܵܐܝܼܬ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ. ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Ila, yhoedaya haw eeleh dgawaeet yhoedaya-yleh, o gzoerta hay-ylaha dhawya min liba, broekha o la bkteewta. Khiqra daha le-yleh min bnaynasha ila min Alaha.
ENG: but he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.

ASY: ܒܲܣ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܙܵܘܕܘܼܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܲܝܕܵܐ ܕܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Bas, moodee-ylaha zawdoenyoeta dyhoedaya, yan moodee-yleh payda dgzoerta?
ENG: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what is the profit of circumcision?

ASY: ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Raba bkl oerkha, sabab qamayta peesh-lhoon yoebe ilayhy hemizmane dalaha.
ENG: Much every way: first of all, that they were intrusted with the oracles of God.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ؟ ܟܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܲܛܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟
TRL: Moodee in khakma minayhy la haminee? Ke hawya dla haymanoetayhy baṭla mhoemnoeta dalaha?
ENG: For what if some were without faith? shall their want of faith make of none effect the faithfulness of God?

ASY: ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܟܠ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܕܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܕܓ݂ܵܠܒܹܬ ܟܲܕ ܕܵܝܢܝܼ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Khas-lee. Alaha shareera-yleh, apin dkl barnasha dagala-yleh, aykh deeleh kteewa: dpayshet moekshiṭa bhemizmanoekh, o dghalbet kad daynee-loekh.
ENG: God forbid: yea, let God be found true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy words, And mightest prevail when thou comest into judgment.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐܝܼܬ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ؟ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܢܵܐܗܲܩ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܝܬܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܲܪܒܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܢ؟ (ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ.)
TRL: Eena in 'awla dee-an makhze-laha zadeeqoeta dalaha boesh preeshaeet, moodee amrakh? Maṣakh amrakh dalaha nahaq eeleh dmaytoeye-yleh karbeh 'alan? (aykh barnasha hamzoeme ywin.)
ENG: But if our unrighteousness commendeth the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who visiteth with wrath? (I speak after the manner of men.)

ASY: ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ؟
TRL: Khas-lee. In la, dakhee bit daen Alaha l'alma?
ENG: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܕܲܓܵܠܘܼܬܝܼ ܡܲܙܝܘܼܕܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܹܫ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ؟
TRL: O in dagaloetee mazyoede-ylaha lshrara dalaha lkhiqra dee-eh, qamoodee hesh pyasha ywin deena maykh khad khaṭaya?
ENG: But if the truth of God through my lie abounded unto his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

ASY: ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܓܵܕܦܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܢ ܘܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ”ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܒܝܼܫܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܠܛܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ؟“ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Qamoodee la paysha meerta, aykh dkhakma ke gadpee 'alan o amree dakhnan ke amrakh, ”'awdakh beeshate dpalṭee minayhy ṭawate?“ dyanta dhadkha nashe shareerta-ylaha.
ENG: and why not (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), Let us do evil, that good may come? whose condemnation is just.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ؟ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ؟ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Moodee amrakh? Akhnan yhoedaye boesh ṣpayee ywakh min khene? Hich la. Sabab qṭee' lan qamayta dyhoedaye o yawnaye klayhy tkhoot khṭeeta yna.
ENG: What then? are we in worse case than they? No, in no wise: for we before laid to the charge both of Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin;

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܠܲܝܬ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܕ،
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa: layt zadeeqa, oep la khad,
ENG: as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one;

ASY: ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܕܦܲܪܡܹܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܕܛܵܥܹܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Layt khad dparme, layt khad dṭa'e lalaha.
ENG: There is none that understandeth, There is none that seeketh after God;

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ؛ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܲܝܕܵܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Klayhy qleeb-lhoon; klayhy m'oedale hwe-lhoon dla payda, layt oep khad d'abed ṭawta.
ENG: They have all turned aside, they are together become unprofitable; There is none that doeth good, no, not so much as one:

ASY: ܒܵܠܘܿܥܲܝܗܝ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܒܠܸܫܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܦܸܠܡܵܐ، ܘܣܲܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܟܸܕܢܹ̈ܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܣܸܦܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Baloo'ayhy qawra pteekha-yleh, o blishanayhy ke hamzimee pilma, o sama dakidne tkhoot sipwatayhy-yleh.
ENG: Their throat is an open sepulchre; With their tongues they have used deceit: The poison of asps is under their lips:

ASY: ܦܘܼܡܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܠܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܵܘܛܬܵܐ ܘܡܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Poemayhy milya-yleh lawṭta o mareeroeta,
ENG: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:

ASY: ܘܐܲܩܠܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܩܲܠܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܫܲܦܘܼܟܹܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: O aqlatayhy qaloele yna lshapoeke dima.
ENG: Their feet are swift to shed blood;

ASY: ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܫܲܩܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܲܝܗܝ ܝܢܵܐ،
TRL: Khrawa o shaqeeoeta boerkhatayhy yna,
ENG: Destruction and misery are in their ways;

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: O oerkha dshlama le yad'ee-laha,
ENG: And the way of peace have they not known:

ASY: ܘܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: O zdoe'ta dalaha layt qam 'aynayhy.
ENG: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܹܗ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܕܟܠ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܐ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܡܵܐ ܘܟܠܹܗ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha beeda'a ywakh dmindee dbemara-yleh namoosa, bemareh-yleh lanee deena tkhoot namoosa, dkl poema paesh cheema o kleh 'alma hawe tkhoot dyanta qam Alaha.
ENG: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it speaketh to them that are under the law; that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may be brought under the judgment of God:

ASY: ܒܝܲܕ ܢܛܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܲܚ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Byad nṭarta dnamoosa oep khad le paesh moekshiṭa qam Alaha, ila bnamoosa boesh zawda ke parmakh deewakh khaṭaye.
ENG: because by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for through the law cometh the knowledge of sin.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena adeea zadeeqoeta dalaha peesh-laha gleeta dla namoosa, o sheed-lhoon 'aloeha namoosa o nwee-e.
ENG: But now apart from the law a righteousness of God hath been manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ،
TRL: Aha zadeeqoeta min Alaha ke atya byad haymanoeta beeshoo' msheekha qa klayhy anee dhaminee, dla poershoenya,
ENG: even the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ unto all them that believe; for there is no distinction;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܚܣܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab klayhy khṭe-lhoon, o khseerhoon min khiqra dalaha.
ENG: for all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܹܐ ܚܘܼܪܵܝܝܼ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،
TRL: Eena ke payshee moekshiṭe khoerayee bshapaqat byad poerqana deeleh beeshoo' msheekha,
ENG: being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܣܵܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܹܗ. ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܡܲܪܝܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒܹܐܢܹܗ ܦܘܼܚܠܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܢ̈ ܕܕܲܥܒܲܪ.
TRL: Haw dalaha moeqriw-leh khoesaya byad haymanoeta bdimeh. 'weed-leh aha dmakhze zadeeqoeteh, sabab bmaryakhta dbeneh poekhlay-leh khṭeeatan dda'bar.
ENG: whom God set forth to be a propitiation, through faith, by his blood, to shew his righteousness, because of the passing over of the sins done aforetime, in the forbearance of God;

ASY: ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܹܗ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܫܸܛ ܠܟܠ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Moekhze-leh zadeeqoeteh baha zawna, dhaw hawe zadeeqa o makshiṭ lkl dhamin bmaran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: for the shewing, I say, of his righteousness at this present season: that he might himself be just, and the justifier of him that hath faith in Jesus.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ؟ ܒܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ. ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ؟ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟ ܠܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bas ayka-yleh shoewhara? Bṭeel-leh. Byad aynee namoosa bṭeel-leh? Byad poelkhane? La. Eena bnamoosa dhaymanoeta.
ENG: Where then is the glorying? It is excluded. By what manner of law? of works? Nay: but by a law of faith.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܢܛܵܪܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ke yad'akh dbarnasha ke paesh moekshiṭa byad haymanoeta o la bnṭarta dnamoosa.
ENG: We reckon therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.

ASY: ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ؟ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ؟ ܗܹܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܹܗ،
TRL: Qamoodee Alaha, Alaha dyhoedaye-yleh akhchee? Le-yleh oep Alaha dimwate? He. Oep Alaha dimwate-yleh,
ENG: Or is God the God of Jews only? is he not the God of Gentiles also? Yea, of Gentiles also:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܫܸܛ ܠܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܠܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܪ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab eet khad Alaha akhchee, o haw ke makshiṭ lyhoedaye o limwate har byad haymanoeta.
ENG: if so be that God is one, and he shall justify the circumcision by faith, and the uncircumcision through faith.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܒܲܛܘܼܠܹܗ ܝܘܲܚ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܡܲܩܘܘܼܝܹܗ ܝܘܲܚ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Moodee amrakh, baṭoeleh ywakh namoosa byad haymanoeta? Khas-lee. Maqwoeyeh ywakh namoosa.
ENG: Do we then make the law of none effect through faith? God forbid: nay, we establish the law.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ؟ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܫ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܚܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܗܘܵܠ ܟܝܵܢܵܝܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Boet aha moodee amrakh boet baban awraham? Dakhee peesh-leh mcheekha gaw aha ahwal kyanayta?
ENG: What then shall we say that Abraham, our forefather according to the flesh, hath found?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab in awraham peesha ywa moekshiṭa bpoelkhane, ke maṣe wa 'abed wa shoewhara, eena la qam Alaha.
ENG: For if Abraham was justified by works, he hath whereof to glory; but not toward God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ؟ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab moodee-yleh bemara ktawa? Hoemineh awraham balaha o peesh-laha khoeshbinta ileh lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: For what saith the scripture? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned unto him for righteousness.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ، ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dkhad nasha palekh, poer'aneh le paesh khoeshbina ileh aykh khda mawhawta, ila aykh khad poer'ana.
ENG: Now to him that worketh, the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but as of debt.

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܟܫܸܛ ܠܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܹܗ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O haw dla palekh eena hamin balaha dke makshiṭ l'awale, haymanoeteh khoeshbinta-ylaha ileh lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is reckoned for righteousness.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܲܫܒܸܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ:
TRL: Oep daweed meereh hadkha mindee eeman dhoemzim-leh boet ṭoewa dhaw nasha dalaha ke khashbin ileh zadeeqoeta dla poelkhane, meereh:
ENG: Even as David also pronounceth blessing upon the man, unto whom God reckoneth righteousness apart from works,

ASY: ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܥܵܘܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܟܣܹܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Ṭoewa lanee d'awlayhy peesh-leh poekhla ilayhy, o peesh-lhoon moekse khṭeeatayhy.
ENG: saying, Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, And whose sins are covered.

ASY: ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܚܲܫܒܸܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܚܛܝܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Ṭoewa lnasha dmarya la khashbin ileh khṭeeteh.
ENG: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not reckon sin.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܛܘܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ؟ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܲܢ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Aha ṭoewa eeleh akhchee lnashe dgzeere yna yan oep lnashe dle yna gzeere? meeran dhaymanoeta dawraham peesh-laha khoeshbinta ileh lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: Is this blessing then pronounced upon the circumcision, or upon the uncircumcision also? for we say, To Abraham his faith was reckoned for righteousness.

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ؟ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ؟ ܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Dakhee peesh-laha khoeshbinta ileh lzadeeqoeta? Min qam dpeesh-leh gzeera, yan min bar dpeesh-leh gzeera? La min bar dpeesh-leh gzeera, ila min qam dpeesh-leh gzeera.
ENG: How then was it reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision:

ASY: ܘܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܙܘܼܪܬܵܐ، ܚܵܬܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ، ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: O qoebil-leh neeshanqa deeleh gzoerta, khatma dzadeeqoeta deet wa-leh bhaymanoeta min qam dpaesh wa gzeera. Hadkha, awraham eeleh baba dklayhy anee dhaminee oep in dle yna gzeere, dpaysha khoeshbinta ilayhy zadeeqoeta.
ENG: and he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned unto them;

ASY: ܘܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܬܵܒܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܬܒܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܙܝܼܪܵܐ.`
TRL: O eeleh oep baba danee deena gzeere, la akhchee deena gzeere, ila tab'ane yna lhaymanoeta dakhee dawraham tbee' leh min qam dpaesh wa gzeera.`
ENG: and the father of circumcision to them who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham which he had in uncircumcision.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܲܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܝܵܪܘܿܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab le ywa byad namoosa dhwe-leh qawla lawraham yan bnoonoehy dhaw bit hawe yaroota d'alma, ila byad zadeeqoeta dhaymanoeta.
ENG: For not through the law was the promise to Abraham or to his seed, that he should be heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܚܵܝܝܼ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܝܵܪ̈ܘܿܬܹܐ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܝܕܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab in anee dkhayee bnamoosa hawee yaroote, haymanoeta bṭeelta-ylaha, o qawla layt-leh payda,
ENG: For if they which are of the law be heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is made of none effect:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܠܲܝܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܫܡܵܛܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab namoosa ke mayte karba, o ayka dlayt namoosa, layt oep shmaṭta dnamoosa.
ENG: for the law worketh wrath; but where there is no law, neither is there transgression.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܘܝܼܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܬܵܒܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܢ.
TRL: Boet aha, qawla ke ate byad haymanoeta, qa dhawe byad shapaqat o paesh moeqweea lklayhy bnoone dawraham, la akhchee lanee deena tab'ane dnamoosa, ila oep lanee deena shareeke bhaymanoeta dawraham, haw deeleh baba dklan.
ENG: For this cause it is of faith, that it may be according to grace; to the end that the promise may be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܹܐ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܵܪܹܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: Dakhee deeleh kteewa: 'weed-lee iloekh baba lraba imwate. Awraham baban eeleh qam Alaha haw dbee-eh hoemineh, Alaha dke makhe meete, o qare mindeeane dlayt, aykh deena.
ENG: (as it is written, A father of many nations have I made thee) before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth the things that are not, as though they were.

ASY: ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ، ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܙܲܪܥܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Dalqoewl dhewee, awraham bhewee hoemineh o hwe-leh baba lraba imwate, aykh dpeesha ywa meera: hadkha bit hawe zar'oekh.
ENG: Who in hope believed against hope, to the end that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken, So shall thy seed be.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܒܘܼܢ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܹܗ، ܟܲܕ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܸܡܵܐܐ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܡܲܪܒܥܵܐ ܕܣܲܪܵܐ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: La peesh-leh zaboen bhaymanoeteh, kad beeda'a ywa dpaghreh aykh meeta ywa, sabab aykh ima shine ywa, o oep marb'a dsara meeta ywa.
ENG: And without being weakened in faith he considered his own body now as good as dead (he being about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah’s womb:

ASY: ܒܟܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܠܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܗ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Bkleh aha, boet qawla dalaha la peesh-leh plee'a bla haymanoeta, ila khoelineh bhaymanoeta, beeawa tishbookhta lalaha.
ENG: yea, looking unto the promise of God, he wavered not through unbelief, but waxed strong through faith, giving glory to God,

ASY: ܒܩܸܘܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܬܲܡܘܼܡܹܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Bqiwyoeta hoemineh dalaha maṣe wa ltamoeme qawla d'weed-leh 'ameh.
ENG: and being fully assured that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha peesh-laha khoeshbinta ileh lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: Wherefore also it was reckoned unto him for righteousness.

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Le ywa akhchee boet khatir dee-eh dpeesh-laha meerta aha,
ENG: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was reckoned unto him;

ASY: ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܫܒܸܢܲܢ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Ila oep boet dee-an dalaha khashbinan zadeeqe, akhnan dhamoene ywakh balaha, haw dmoeqim-leh lmaran eeshoo' min gaw meete,
ENG: but for our sake also, unto whom it shall be reckoned, who believe on him that raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܢܵܗܲܢ̈ ܘܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܟܫܲܛܬܲܢ.
TRL: Haw dpeesh-leh soepya lmawta boet gnahan o moeqima boet makshaṭtan.
ENG: who was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Bas kad peesh lan moekshiṭe bhaymanoeta eet lan shlama 'am Alaha byad Maran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: Being therefore justified by faith, let us have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ;

ASY: ܒܝܼܹܗ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܩܲܪܒܲܢܬܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇، ܘܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Bee-eh eet lan qarbanta bhaymanoeta-laha shapaqat dkilye ywakh qiwye gawoeha, o bikhdaya ywakh bhewee dshoewkha dalaha.
ENG: through whom also we have had our access by faith into this grace wherein we stand; and let us rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܲܢ̈ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܡܣܲܝܒܪܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: La akhchee hadkha, ila bikhdaya ywakh boelṣanan sabab beeda'a ywakh doelṣana bit yabil lan msaybranoeta,
ENG: And not only so, but let us also rejoice in our tribulations: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;

ASY: ܘܡܣܲܝܒܪܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܲܢ ܢܸܣܝܵܢܵܐ، ܘܢܸܣܝܵܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ،
TRL: O msaybranoeta ke yawa lan nisyana, o nisyana ke yabil lan hewee,
ENG: and patience, probation; and probation, hope:

ASY: ܘܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܢܟܸܦܵܐ ܠܲܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܦܸܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: O hewee le mankipa lan, sabab khoeba dalaha peesh-leh moeshpikha gaw liban byad roekha dqoedsha dyoebil-leh ilan.
ENG: and hope putteth not to shame; because the love of God hath been shed abroad in our hearts through the Holy Ghost which was given unto us.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܥܵܘܵܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab bhay 'dana deewakh waw zaboene msheekha meet-leh min geba d'awale.
ENG: For while we were yet weak, in due season Christ died for the ungodly.

ASY: ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܩܲܫܕܸܪ ܕܡܵܐܹܬ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Baṣoore nashe ke maytee min geba dkhad nasha zadeeqa, eena qawma dkhad qashdir dmaet min geba dkhad nasha ṭawa.
ENG: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: for peradventure for the good man some one would even dare to die.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܒܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܟܲܕ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܢ.
TRL: Eena Alaha moekhze-leh khoebeh ilan, kad khaṭaye ywakh waw, hadkha msheekha meet-leh min geban.
ENG: But God commendeth his own love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܹܐ ܒܕܸܡܹܗ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܦܘܼܪܩܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Kad peesh lan moekshiṭe bdimeh, kma boesh zawda bit payshakh poerqe min karba dalaha bee-eh.
ENG: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, shall we be saved from the wrath of God through him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܣܘܼܙܓܸܪܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܦܘܼܪܩܹܐ ܒܚܲܝܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eeman deewakh waw dishmine dalaha, peesh lan soezgire 'ameh byad mawta dbrooneh, eena adeea dsoezgire ywakh kma boesh zawda bit payshakh poerqe bkhayoehy.
ENG: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by his life;

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܣܲܙܓܲܪܬܵܐ.
TRL: O la akhchee hadkha, eena oep bikhdaya ywakh balaha byad Maran eeshoo' msheekha, dbee-eh qoebil lan sazgarta.
ENG: and not only so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܘܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Dakhee dkhṭeeta 'weeraha gaw 'alma byad khad nasha, o mawta te-leh byad khṭeeta, hadkha mawta te-leh 'al klayhy nashe sabab klayhy khṭe-lhoon.
ENG: Therefore, as through one man sin entered into the world, and death through sin; and so death passed unto all men, for that all sinned:—

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܬܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Min qam dpaesh wa yoewa namoosa, eet wa khṭeeta gaw 'alma. Eena khṭeeta le-ylaha khoeshbinta khṭeeta eeman dlayt namoosa.
ENG: for until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܼܟܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܕܵܡ ܗܲܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܛܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܫܡܵܛܬܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܕܵܡ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Eena hoekim-leh mawta min 'dana dadam hal 'dana dmoeshe, oep 'al anee dla khṭe-lhoon bshmaṭta dpoeqdana aykh adam, haw deewa ṭoewsa dhaw date wa.
ENG: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the likeness of Adam’s transgression, who is a figure of him that was to come.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܒܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܹܗ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena mawhawta le-ylaha aykh gnaha. Sabab in bgnaha dkhad nasha raba meet-lhoon, kma boesh zawda shapaqat dalaha, o mawhawteh bshapaqat dkhad nasha, eeshoo' msheekha, zeed-laha lraba nashe.
ENG: But not as the trespass, so also is the free gift. For if by the trespass of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God, and the gift by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound unto the many.

ASY: ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ. ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܢܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܲܟܫܲܛܬܵܐ.
TRL: Mawhawta le-ylaha aykh khṭeeta dkhad nasha. Dyanta te-laha min bar khṭeeta dkhad nasha o moete-laha khayawoeta, eena mawhawta te-laha min bar raba gnahe o moete-laha makshaṭta.
ENG: And not as through one that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment came of one unto condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses unto justification.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܒܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܟܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܦܸܪܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܟܡܝܼ ܒܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: In bgnaha dkhad nasha mawta hoekim-leh byad khad nasha, boesh zawda anee dqablee piryoeta dshapaqat o mawhawta dzadeeqoeta bit hakmee bkhaye byad khad nasha, eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: For if, by the trespass of the one, death reigned through the one; much more shall they that receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, even Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ، ܡܲܟܫܲܛܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Bas dakhee dbgnaha dkhad nasha dyanta te-laha 'al klayhy bnaynasha, hadkha bzadeeqoeta dkhad, makshaṭta hwe-laha lkhaye qa klayhy bnaynasha.
ENG: So then as through one trespass the judgment came unto all men to condemnation; even so through one act of righteousness the free gift came unto all men to justification of life.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܥܵܨܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܒܡܲܨܝܲܬܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab dakhee db'aṣeeoeta dkhad nasha raba hwe-lhoon khaṭaye, bmaṣyatta dkhad nasha raba bit payshee 'weede zadeeqe.
ENG: For as through the one man’s disobedience the many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one shall the many be made righteous.

ASY: ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܙܵܝܕܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇، ܐܘܼܦ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܝܼܕ ܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: Namoosa te-leh dzayda wa gnaha, eena ayka dkhṭeeta zeed-laha, oep shapaqat boesh zeed-laha,
ENG: And the law came in beside, that the trespass might abound; but where sin abounded, grace did abound more exceedingly:

ASY: ܕܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܗܘܼܟܸܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܟܡܵܐ ܒܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܝܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Daykh dhoekim-laha khṭeeta bmawta, hadkha oep shapaqat bit hakma bzadeeqoeta dmaytya khaye dl'alam beeshoo' msheekha Maran.
ENG: that, as sin reigned in death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ؟ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܓܵܘ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܙܵܝܕܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ؟
TRL: Bas moodee amrakh? Payshakh gaw khṭeeta dzayda shapaqat?
ENG: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

ASY: ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܲܚ ܓܵܘܘܼܗ̇؟
TRL: Khas-lee. Akhnan dmeet lan lkhṭeeta dakhee khena khayakh gawoeha?
ENG: God forbid. We who died to sin, how shall we any longer live therein?

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܠܲܢ ܕܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܠܚܲܝܘܼܕܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܡܵܘܬܹܗ ܥܡܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ؟
TRL: Le ytoon beeda'a dakhnan klan d'meed lan lkhayoede 'am eeshoo' msheekha, bmawteh 'meed lan?
ENG: Or are ye ignorant that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ. ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܚܵܝܲܚ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Boet aha peesh lan qweere 'ameh byad ma'moodeeta lmawta. O dakhee dqeem-leh msheekha min gaw meete byad shoewkha dbaba, hadkha oep akhnan khayakh khaye khate.
ENG: We were buried therefore with him through baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we also might walk in newness of life.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܫܘܼܪܸܟܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܒܡܵܘܬܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܫܲܪܸܟܲܚ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܹܗ.
TRL: In shoerike ywakh 'ameh bmawteh, bit sharikakh 'ameh oep bqyamteh.
ENG: For if we have become united with him by the likeness of his death, we shall be also by the likeness of his resurrection;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܲܢ ܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܕܒܲܛܸܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܘܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܲܚ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab beeda'a ywakh dbarnashan 'ateeqa peesh-leh zqeepa 'ameh dbaṭil paghra khaṭaya o dla hawakh khena 'awde dkhṭeeta.
ENG: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be done away, that so we should no longer be in bondage to sin;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܸܪܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab haw deeleh meeta peesha-yleh shirya min khṭeeta.
ENG: for he that hath died is justified from sin.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܡ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܲܚ.
TRL: Kad meet lan 'am msheekha, hamoene ywakh doep 'ameh bit khayakh.
ENG: But if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ. ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Sabab beeda'a ywakh dmsheekha qeem-leh min gaw meete, o le maet khena. Mawta layt-leh shoelṭana 'aloehy.
ENG: knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death no more hath dominion over him.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ، ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܚܵܝܲܝ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܚܵܝܲܝ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab mawta dmeet-leh, meet-leh khda gaha akhchee lkhṭeeta, eena khaye dbikhayay-yleh, bikhayay-yleh lalaha.
ENG: For the death that he died, he died unto sin once: but the life that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܚܫܘܿܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep akhtoon khshoowoen ganawkhoon meete lkhṭeeta, eena khaye lalaha beeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: Even so reckon ye also yourselves to be dead unto sin, but alive unto God in Christ Jesus.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܘܼ̈ܗ̇.
TRL: Boet aha la shawqeetoon dkhṭeeta hawe-laha shoelṭana bpaghrawkhoon mayoota d'awdeetoon shahwatyatoeha.
ENG: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey the lusts thereof:

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܙܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܙܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O la maqriweetoon hadame dpaghrawkhoon zayna d'awla lkhṭeeta, ila maqriwoen ganawkhoon lalaha aykh nashe moeqime min mawta lkhaye, o maqriwoen hadamawkhoon aykh zayne dzadeeqoeta lalaha.
ENG: neither present your members unto sin as instruments of unrighteousness; but present yourselves unto God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab khṭeeta le 'awda shoelṭana 'alawkhoon, sabab le ytoon tkhoot namoosa ila tkhoot shapaqat eetoon.
ENG: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under law, but under grace.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ؟ ܚܵܛܲܚ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Bas moodee 'awdakh? Khaṭakh sabab le ywakh tkhoot namoosa ila tkhoot shapaqat? Khas-lee.
ENG: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace? God forbid.

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܲܕ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܠܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܝܲܢ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܠܫܠܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܠܲܒܠܵܐ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Le ytoon beeda'a eeman dmaqriweetoon ganawkhoon 'awde lkhad, akhtoon 'awde dhaw eetoon dshalmeetoon ileh, yan lkhṭeeta dke labla lmawta yan lshlamta dke labla lzadeeqoeta?
ENG: Know ye not, that to whom ye present yourselves as servants unto obedience, his servants ye are whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܐܸܣܟܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܣܘܼܦܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena minta min Alaha oep in deetoon waw 'awde dkhṭeeta moeṣyit lawkhoon min kleh libawkhoon liskeema dyoelpana dpeesha ywa soepya ilawkhoon.
ENG: But thanks be to God, that, whereas ye were servants of sin, ye became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto ye were delivered;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Peesh lawkhoon shirye min khṭeeta o hwe lawkhoon 'awde lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: and being made free from sin, ye became servants of righteousness.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܚܝܼܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܝܵܐ. ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܛܲܢܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܕܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܥܵܘܠܵܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܘܼܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh bnaynasha hamzoeme ywin sabab mkheele ytoon bkyana nashaya. Dakhee dke maqriweetoon waw hadamawkhoon l'awdoeta dṭanpoeta o d'awla li'wada 'awla, adeea maqriwoen-lhoon l'awdoeta dzadeeqoeta li'wada qadeeshoeta.
ENG: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye presented your members as servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity, even so now present your members as servants to righteousness unto sanctification.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman deetoon waw 'awde dkhṭeeta, le ytoon waw zabṭ lzadeeqoeta.
ENG: For when ye were servants of sin, ye were free in regard of righteousness.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܲܝܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܢܟ݂ܵܦܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ؟ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܠܵܛܲܝܗܝ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Moodee payda eet waw lawkhoon haygah min anee mindeeane dadeea binkhapa ytoon bee-ayhy? Ane plaṭayhy mawta-yleh.
ENG: What fruit then had ye at that time in the things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܦܠܵܛܲܝܗܝ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Eena adeea dpeesh lawkhoon shirye min khṭeeta o 'awde dalaha ytoon, eet lawkhoon ṭ'oenyate dqadeeshoeta, o plaṭayhy eeleh khaye dl'alam.
ENG: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto sanctification, and the end eternal life.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܵܩܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Sabab haqa dkhṭeeta mawta-yleh, eena mawhawta dalaha khaye dl'alam eelaha beeshoo' msheekha Maran.
ENG: For the wages of sin is death; but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

ASY: ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ. ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Akhoonwatee, hamzoeme ywin ilawkhoon aykh anee dke yad'ee namoosa. Ke yad'eetoon dnamoosa eet-leh shoelṭana 'al khad nasha kma dhaw nasha khaya-yleh.
ENG: Or are ye ignorant, brethren (for I speak to men that know the law), how that the law hath dominion over a man for so long time as he liveth?

ASY: ܩܵܐ ܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Qa ṭoewsa, khda bakhta gweerta seerta-ylaha bgawroeha kma dgawroeha khaya-yleh. Eena in maet gawroeha, bit paysha shreeta min qanoona dgwara.
ENG: For the woman that hath a husband is bound by law to the husband while he liveth; but if the husband die, she is discharged from the law of the husband.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܓܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܡܵܐܹܬ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܘܼܗ̇، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓܲܝܵܪܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܓܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha in gawra lkhad khena kad gawroeha khaya-yleh, bit paysha qreeta gayarta. Eena in maet gawroeha, peesh-laha shreeta min qanoona o le-ylaha gayarta oep in dgawra lkhad khena.
ENG: So then if, while the husband liveth, she be joined to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if the husband die, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she be joined to another man.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܡܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܛܥܘܼܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep akhtoon, akhoonwatee, meet lawkhoon lnamoosa byad paghra dmsheekha dhaweytoon lkhad khena, haw dqeem-leh min gaw meete dyabakh ṭ'oenyate lalaha.
ENG: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ; that ye should be joined to another, even to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit unto God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܙܘܼܒܛܸܢܹܐ ܒܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ، ܫܲܗܘܲܬܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܪܥܸܫܹܐ ܓܵܘܲܢ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܕܵܡܲܢ̈ ܕܡܲܒܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman deewakh waw zoebṭine bkyana khaṭaya, shahwatyate dkhṭeeta peeshe ywaw moer'ishe gawan byad namoosa, o biplakha ywaw gaw hadaman dmabree waw mawta.
ENG: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions, which were through the law, wrought in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܫܸܪܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܙܘܼܒܛܸܢܲܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܒܚܲܕ݇ܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܥܲܬܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Eena adeea peesh lan shirye min namoosa sabab meet lan lhaw dzoebṭinan eewa. Adeea bi'wada ywakh khilmat bkhatoeta droekha, o la b'ateeqoeta dktawa.
ENG: But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that wherein we were holden; so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ؟ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ. ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܫܲܗܘܸܬܸܬ.“
TRL: Moodee amrakh? Namoosa khṭeeta-yleh? Khas-lee. Le yad'en wa moodee ywa khṭeeta ila byad namoosa dee' lee. Le yad'en wa moodee ywa shahwatta in namoosa la amer wa, ”la shahwitit.“
ENG: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid. Howbeit, I had not known sin, except through the law: for I had not known coveting, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܲܕ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ، ܡܘܼܒܪܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܘܝܼ ܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܠܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܝܼܬܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Eena khṭeeta kad moechikh-laha 'ilta byad poeqdana, moebre-laha gawee shahwatta. Sabab bla namoosa khṭeeta meetta-ylaha.
ENG: but sin, finding occasion, wrought in me through the commandment all manner of coveting: for apart from the law sin is dead.

ASY: ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܚܝܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Qamayta ana khaya ywin wa dla namoosa, eena eeman dpoeqdana te-leh, khṭeeta khye-laha o ana meet-lee.
ENG: And I was alive apart from the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab poeqdana deewa qa khaye, khze-lee qa mawta ywa.
ENG: and the commandment, which was unto life, this I found to be unto death:

ASY: ܘܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ، ܥܘܼܠܕܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܩܲܡ ܩܵܛܠܵܐ ܠܝܼ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O khṭeeta moechikh-laha 'ilta bpoeqdana, 'oelde-laha ilee, o qam qaṭla-lee byad poeqdana.
ENG: for sin, finding occasion, through the commandment beguiled me, and through it slew me.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܟܹܐܢܵܐ، ܘܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha namoosa qadeesha-yleh, o poeqdana qadeesha-yleh, o kena, o ṭawa.
ENG: So that the law is holy, and the commandment holy, and righteous, and good.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܒܝܸܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܡܘܼܥܒܸܪܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܕܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bas haw deewa ṭawa hwe-leh ilee mawta? Khas-lee. Eena khṭeeta dmabyina aykh khṭeeta, moe'biraha beeee mawta byad ṭawta, dhadkha byad poeqdana khṭeeta paysha dee'ta raba khaṭayta.
ENG: Did then that which is good become death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might be shewn to be sin, by working death to me through that which is good;—that through the commandment sin might become exceeding sinful.

ASY: ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܙܘܼܒܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܚܲܕ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Beeda'a ywakh dnamoosa roekhanaya-yleh, eena ana le ywin roekhanaya, zoebna aykh khad 'awda dkhṭeeta.
ENG: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܣܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: Mindee dbi'wada ywin le ywin beeda'a, sabab mindee dbṣiwyanee-yleh le ywin bi'wada, ila mindee dbisnaya ywin, haw bi'wada ywin.
ENG: For that which I do I know not: for not what I would, that do I practise; but what I hate, that I do.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ، ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: O in bi'wada ywin mindee dle ba'eyn 'awden, bishada ywin dnamoosa ṭawa-yleh.
ENG: But if what I would not, that I do, I consent unto the law that it is good.

ASY: ܡܲܒܝܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: Mabyoene-ylaha dle ywin ana bi'wada hadkha, ila khṭeeta dbi'mara-ylaha beeee.
ENG: So now it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwelleth in me.

ASY: ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܝܼ، ܝܲܥܢܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܝܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܨܵܝܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ.
TRL: Beeda'a ywin dlayt mindee ṭawa bi'mara beeee, ya'ne gaw kyanee khaṭaya, sabab bib'aya ywin d'awden ṭawta eena le ywin mṣaya d'awden.
ENG: For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me, but to do that which is good is not.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ، ܗ̇ܝ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: Sabab ṭawta dba'eyn 'awden le ywin bi'wada, ila beeshta dle ba'eyn 'awden, hay bi'wadoeha ywin.
ENG: For the good which I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I practise.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܝܼ.
TRL: In bi'wada ywin mindee dle ba'eyn li'wada, le ywin khena ana bi'wadeh ila khṭeeta dbi'mara-ylaha beeee.
ENG: But if what I would not, that I do, it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwelleth in me.

ASY: ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܓܵܘܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Adeea moechikh-lee khad namoosa, eeman dba'eyn 'awden ṭawta, beeshta gawee-ylaha.
ENG: I find then the law, that, to me who would do good, evil is present.

ASY: ܒܸܚܕܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܝܼ،
TRL: Bikhdaya ywin bnamoosa dalaha deeleh gaw libee,
ENG: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ، ܒܸܦܠܵܫܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ، ܘܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܕܵܡܝܼ̈.
TRL: Eena bikhzaya ywin khad namoosa khena gaw hadame dpaghree, biplasha dalqoewl dnamoosa dri'yanee, o bi'wadee-yleh aseera lnamoosa dkhṭeeta deeleh gaw hadamee.
ENG: but I see a different law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members.

ASY: ܘܵܝ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܲܩܝܼ! ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܨܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Way 'alee barnasha shaqee! Manee bit paṣe-lee min aha paghra mayoota?
ENG: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me out of the body of this death?

ASY: ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܟܝܵܢܝܼ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Shakoere ywin lalaha beeshoo' msheekha Maran. Hadkha bri'yanee 'awda ywin lnamoosa dalaha, eena bkyanee khaṭaya 'awda ywin lnamoosa dkhṭeeta.
ENG: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then I myself with the mind serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha min adeea layt khayawoeta lanee deena beeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: There is therefore now no condemnation to them that are in Christ Jesus.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܡ ܫܵܪܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab beeshoo' msheekha namoosa droekha dkhaye qam share-lee min namoosa dkhṭeeta o dmawta.
ENG: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܝܵܢܲܢ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ، ܫܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ،
TRL: Sabab mindee dla mṣe-leh 'abed namoosa, boet zaboenoeta dkyanan khaṭaya, shoedireh Alaha broona dganeh bdmoeta dpaghra dkhṭeeta, o boet khṭeeta, 'weed-leh mare gnaha lkhṭeeta bpaghreh,
ENG: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God, sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and as an offering for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:

ASY: ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܬܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܒܘܼܗ̇ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܒܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Dpaysha moekmilta zadeeqoeta dbiṭlaboeha-yleh namoosa minan, akhnan dle ywakh bikhdara bkyana khaṭaya ila broekha.
ENG: that the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the spirit.

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܝܼ ܒܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܝܝܼ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒ݂ܝܼ.
TRL: Anee dke khayee bkyana khaṭaya mindeeane dkhṭeeta ke khashwee, eena anee dbroekha ke khayee, mindeeane droekha ke khashwee.
ENG: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the spirit the things of the spirit.

ASY: ܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܐ ܕܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܐ ܕܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܫܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Takhmanta dkyana khaṭaya mawta-ylaha, o takhmanta dkyana roekhanaya khaye-ylaha o shlama.
ENG: For the mind of the flesh is death; but the mind of the spirit is life and peace:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܲܚܡܲܢܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܕܸܫܡܸܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܙܲܒܛ.
TRL: Sabab takhmanyate dkyana khaṭaya dishmin dalaha yna, sabab le yna zabṭ lnamoosa dalaha, o le maṣee hawee zabṭ.
ENG: because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can it be:

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܫܵܦܪܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O anee deena zabṭ lkyana khaṭaya le maṣee shapree lalaha.
ENG: and they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܐܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Eena akhtoon le ytoon zabṭ lkyana khaṭaya ila lroekha, in roekha dalaha bi'mara-yleh gawawkhoon. In khad layt-leh roekha dmsheekha, haw le-yleh dmsheekha.
ENG: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you. But if any man hath not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: In msheekha bi'mara-yleh gawawkhoon, paghrawkhoon meeta-yleh min khṭeeta geba, eena roekhawkhoon khayta-ylaha sabab peesh lawkhoon 'weede zadeeqe.
ENG: And if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin; but the spirit is life because of righteousness.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܠܦܲܓ݂ܪ̈ܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ ܕܒܸܥܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: O in roekha dhaw dmoeqim-leh leeshoo' min meete bi'mara-yleh gawawkhoon, haw dmoeqim-leh lmsheekha min meete bit makhe oep lpaghrawkhoon mayoote byad roekheh dbi'mara-yleh gawawkhoon.
ENG: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwelleth in you, he that raised up Christ Jesus from the dead shall quicken also your mortal bodies through his Spirit that dwelleth in you.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܲܝܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ ܕܚܵܝܲܚ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Hadkha akhoonwatee, le ywakh daynane lkyana khaṭaya dkhayakh bee-eh,
ENG: So then, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܚܵܝܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܟܝܵܢܵܐ ܚܲܛܵܝܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܡܲܡܝܸܬܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab in khayeytoon bkyana khaṭaya, bit mayteetoon, eena in broekha mamyiteetoon lpoelkhane dpaghra, bit khayeytoon.
ENG: for if ye live after the flesh, ye must die; but if by the spirit ye mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܕܝܹܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab anee dpeeshe yna mhoedye broekha dalaha, ane bnoone dalaha yna.
ENG: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܹ̈ܐ ܠܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ”ܐܲܒܵܐ، ܒܵܒܵܐ.“
TRL: Sabab akhtoon la qoebil lawkhoon roekha d'awda lawkhoon mindrish 'awde lzdoe'ta, ila qoebil lawkhoon roekha dbroonoeta dbeeoeha biqraya ywakh, ”aba, baba.“
ENG: For ye received not the spirit of bondage again unto fear; but ye received the spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܪܘܼܚܲܢ، ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ.
TRL: Haw roekha bganeh beeawa-yleh sahdoeta lroekhan, dbnoone dalaha ywakh.
ENG: The Spirit himself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are children of God:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܝܵܪ̈ܘܿܬܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܝܵܪ̈ܘܿܬܹܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܐܸܢ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܲܚ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܚܩܝܼܪܹܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab bnoone ywakh, yaroote ywakh, yaroote dalaha o bnay yartoeta 'am msheekha, din janjirakh 'ameh, bit payshakh khqeere 'ameh.
ENG: and if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with him, that we may be also glorified with him.

ASY: ܚܵܬܸܪܓ̰ܲܡܥ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܕܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪ̈ܲܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܹܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܕܒܸܩܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: Khatirjam' eewin djoenjaran daha zawna le yna khsheekhe dpayshee moedbiqe 'am khiqra dpaesh gilya ilan.
ENG: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed to us-ward.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܠܗܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܸܠܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab breeta blheeqoeta bispara-ylaha lgilyana dbnoone dalaha.
ENG: For the earnest expectation of the creation waiteth for the revealing of the sons of God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܣܪܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܗ̇، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܒܛ، ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ،
TRL: Sabab breeta peesh-laha 'weedta zabṭ lsreeqoeta, la bṣiwyanoeha, ila bṣiwyana dhaw d'weeda-leh zabṭ, bhewee,
ENG: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not of its own will, but by reason of him who subjected it, in hope

ASY: ܕܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܲܒ݂ܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܚܩܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Doep hay bganoeha paysha shreeta min 'awdoeta dkhrawa lkheroeta khqeerta dbnoone dalaha,
ENG: that the creation itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܬܲܢܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܠ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab beeda'a ywakh dbreeta klaha tanoekhe-ylaha boelṣane hal adeea.
ENG: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܬܲܢܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܓܵܢܲܢ ܘܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܲܢ.
TRL: O la akhchee hadkha, eena oep akhnan deet lan roekha, deelaha ṭ'oenta qamayta, tanoekhe ywakh bganan o bispara dpayshakh 'weede bnoone, lpoerqana dpaghran.
ENG: And not only so, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for our adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.

ASY: ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܦܘܼܪܩܹܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܚܙܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ. ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܦܹܪ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܚܵܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ؟
TRL: Baha hewee peesh lan poerqe. Eena hewee dpaysha khzeeta le-ylaha hewee. Manee bit saper bhewee 'al mindee dkhaze-leh?
ENG: For by hope were we saved: but hope that is seen is not hope: for who hopeth for that which he seeth?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܘܲܚ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܣܵܦܪܲܚ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena in bhewee ywakh 'al mindee dle ywakh bikhzayeh, haygah bit saprakh 'aloehy bkhmalta.
ENG: But if we hope for that which we see not, then do we with patience wait for it.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܝܸܪ ܠܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܬܲܢ. ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܨܲܠܲܚ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܪܦܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܢ ܒܬܵܢܲܚܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep roekha ke hayir lzaboenoetan. Le yad'akh dakhee ṣalakh, eena roekha bganeh ke parpil min geban btanakhyate dle atee lhamzoeme.
ENG: And in like manner the Spirit also helpeth our infirmity: for we know not how to pray as we ought; but the Spirit himself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered;

ASY: ܘܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܨܲܚܨܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܪܦܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: O haw dke ṣakhṣe libawate ke yade' ri'yana droekha, sabab roekha ke parpil min geba dqadeeshe aykh ṣiwyana dalaha.
ENG: and he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to the will of God.

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܵܠܚܝܼ ܠܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܸܒܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܘܼܒܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Ke yad'akh dalaha ke 'abed klayhy mindeeane dpalkhee lṭawta lanee dke makhibee lalaha, lanee dgoebyay-leh qa neesha dee-eh,
ENG: And we know that to them that love God all things work together for good, even to them that are called according to his purpose.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܪܫܝܼܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: ”Sabab anee dalaha dee'ay-leh min qamayta rsheemay-leh min qam 'dana dhawee bdmoeta dbrooneh, dhaw hawe boekhra gaw raba akhoonwate.
ENG: For whom he foreknew, he also foreordained to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren:

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܪܫܝܼܡܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ؛ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܸܪܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ؛ ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܚܩܝܼܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: O anee dqamayta rsheemay-leh, qiryay-leh; o anee dqiryay-leh, moekshiṭay-leh; o anee dmoekshiṭay-leh, khqeeray-leh.
ENG: and whom he foreordained, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ؟ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܓܹܒܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܲܢ؟
TRL: Moodee amrakh boet ane? In Alaha lgeban eeleh, manee ke maṣe hawe dalqoewlan?
ENG: What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܣܝܼܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܬܘܼܣܠܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܢ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ؟
TRL: Haw dla khseekh-leh lbroona dganeh, ila toeslim-leh min geba dklan, dakhee 'ameh le yabil lan kl mindee?
ENG: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also with him freely give us all things?

ASY: ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܒܹܩ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܘܼܒܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܟܫܸܛ.
TRL: Manee bit dabeq gnaha 'al goebye dalaha? Alaha-yleh haw dmakshiṭ.
ENG: Who shall lay anything to the charge of God’s elect? It is God that justifieth;

ASY: ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܐܹܢ؟ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ، ܘܥܲܠ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܢ.
TRL: Manee bit daen? Msheekha eeshoo' dmeet-leh o qeem-leh, o 'al yameena dalaha-yleh o parpoele-yleh min geban.
ENG: who is he that shall condemn? It is Christ Jesus that died, yea rather, that was raised from the dead, who is at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.

ASY: ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܫ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ؟ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܥܵܘܩܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܪܕܘܼܦܝܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܟܸܦܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܩܹܘܲܢܕܹܢܘܿܣ، ܝܲܢ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ؟
TRL: Manee bit paresh lan min khoeba dmsheekha? Oelṣana, yan 'awqana yan rdoepya, yan kipna, yan shoelkhayoeta, yan qewandenoos, yan saypa?
ENG: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܼܟ݂ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܩܛܝܼܠܹܐ ܟܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܠܦܪܵܡܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܹܐ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa: boet deeoekh pyasha ywakh qṭeele kleh yawma, aykh 'irbe lpramta peeshe ywakh khoeshbine.
ENG: Even as it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ݂ܵܠܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܝܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: Eena gaw klayhy ane boesh zawda min ghalbane ywakh byad haw dqam makhib lan.
ENG: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܕܠܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܲܥܬܝܼܕ، ܘܠܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Sabab hamoene ywin, dla mawta, o la khaye, o la malake, o la khaylawate, o la mindeeane dqaem, o la mindeeane dda'teed, o la khayle,
ENG: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܪܵܘܡܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܦܵܪܫܝܼ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: O la rawma, o la 'oemqa, o la mindee khena deeleh birya maṣee parshee lan min khoeba dalaha deeleh beeshoo' msheekha Maran.
ENG: nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

ASY: ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܲܓܘܼܠܹܐ، ܘܐܸܢܝܲܬܝܼ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠܝܼ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ،
TRL: Shrara hamzoeme ywin bmsheekha, o le ywin dagoele, o inyatee bishada-ylaha 'alee broekha dqoedsha,
ENG: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Ghost,

ASY: ܕܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ، ܘܚܲܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܦܪܵܩܵܐ.
TRL: Dpashamta goerta eet-lee, o khasha min gaw libee le-yleh bipraqa.
ENG: that I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܒܓܵܢܝܼ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܚܪܸܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܘܚܸܙܡܵܢܝܼ̈ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab ana ba'eyn wa dbganee haweyn wa moekhrima min msheekha boet khatir dakhoonwatee, o khizmanee bpaghra,
ENG: For I could wish that I myself were anathema from Christ for my brethren’s sake, my kinsmen according to the flesh:

ASY: ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܘܘܲܥܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܘܣܓ݂ܵܕܬܵܐ ܘܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Deena bnay eesrayel, o dee-ayhy-ylaha broonoeta, o khiqra, o wa'de, o yabalta dnamoosa, o sghadta o qawle,
ENG: who are Israelites; whose is the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service of God, and the promises;

ASY: ܘܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܘܼܬܹܗ ܓܹܒܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ، ܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܡܝܼܢ، ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: O dee-ayhy yna awahate, o minayhy-yleh msheekha min nashoeteh geba, haw deeleh Alaha 'al kl, mboerkha l'almeen, ameyn.
ENG: whose are the fathers, and of whom is Christ as concerning the flesh, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܼܣܲܪ̈ܠܵܝܹܐ،
TRL: Eena le-ylaha bṭeelta hemizman dalaha. Sabab klayhy anee deena min bnay eesrayel le yna eesarlaye,
ENG: But it is not as though the word of God hath come to nought. For they are not all Israel, which are of Israel:

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܼܢܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: O la anee deena min zar'a dawraham bnoone dawraham eena, ila beeskhaq bit paesh yoewa iloekh zar'a.
ENG: neither, because they are Abraham’s seed, are they all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.

ASY: ܝܲܥܢܹܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܵܘܠܵܐ، ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܹܐ ܠܙܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Ya'ne, le-ylaha dbnoone dpaghra deena bnoone dalaha, ila bnoone dqawla, ane yna khoeshbine lzar'a.
ENG: That is, it is not the children of the flesh that are children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned for a seed.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ: ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ، ܘܣܲܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab aha-ylaha hemizman dqawla dpeeshta ywa meerta: maykh aha 'dana bit ateyn, o sara bit hawe-laha broona.
ENG: For this is a word of promise, According to this season will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܪܲܦܩܵܐ ܙܘܼܘܸܓ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܡ ܚܲܕ، ܥܲܡ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ.
TRL: O la akhchee aha, eena oep rapqa zoewig-laha 'am khad, 'am baban eeskhaq.
ENG: And not only so; but Rebecca also having conceived by one, even by our father Isaac—

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܹܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܩܘܝܼܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܓܲܒܵܝܬܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab min qam dpayshee waw leede bnoone, o min qam d'awdee waw ṭawta yan beeshta, peesh-leh moeqweea neesha dalaha bgabayta,
ENG: for the children being not yet born, neither having done anything good or bad, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth,

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܓܲܒܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇: ܗ̇ܘ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ.
TRL: La byad poelkhane ila byad haw dke gabe peesh-leh meera iloeha: haw goera bit 'abed khilmat lhaw z'oora.
ENG: it was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܡܘܼܚܸܒ ܠܝܼ، ܘܠܥܹܣܘܿ ܣܢܹܐ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa: lya'qoow moekhib-lee, o l'esoo sne-lee.
ENG: Even as it is written, Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܫܪܵܪܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Moodee amrakh? Layt shrara lkis Alaha? Khas-lee.
ENG: What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? God forbid.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܡܘܼܫܹܐ: ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܥܲܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ.
TRL: Sabab meereh lmoeshe: bit 'awden rakhme 'al man d'awden rakhme, o bit 'awden shapaqat 'al man d'awden shapaqat.
ENG: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܓ̰ܲܪܸܒ ܒܚܲܝܠܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha, le-ylaha kleeta 'al haw dba'e, o la 'al haw djarib bkhayleh, ila 'al rakhme dalaha.
ENG: So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that hath mercy.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܦܸܪܥܘܿܢ: ܩܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܩܸܡܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܕܡܲܚܙܹܝܢ ܚܲܝܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܘܼܟ݂، ܘܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܫܸܡܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab peesh-leh meera gaw ktawa lpir'oon: qa aha neesha qam maqiminoekh, dmakhzeyn khaylee beeoekh, o dpaesh dee'a shimee gaw klaha ar'a.
ENG: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, For this very purpose did I raise thee up, that I might shew in thee my power, and that my name might be published abroad in all the earth.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ، ܘܡܲܩܫܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܵܥܹܐ ܡܲܩܫܹܐ ܠܸܒܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha, Alaha ke 'abed rakhme lman dba'e 'abed rakhme, o maqshe liba dman dba'e maqshe libeh.
ENG: So then he hath mercy on whom he will, and whom he will he hardeneth.

ASY: ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܕܵܒܹܩ ܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܢ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܢܝܼ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܟܵܠܹܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ؟“
TRL: Qawma bit amret ilee, ”qamoodee Alaha bit dabeq gnaha 'alan? Sabab manee maṣe kale dalqoewl dṣiwyaneh?“
ENG: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he still find fault? For who withstandeth his will?

ASY: ܠܵܐ. ܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܓ̰ܲܘܸܒܸܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܠܓܵܒ݂ܠܵܢܵܐ، ”ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܩܲܡ ܓܵܒ݂ܠܹܬ ܠܝܼ؟“
TRL: La. Manee ywit at ya barnasha djawibit lalaha? Maṣya amra gweelta lgawlana, ”qamoodee hadkha qam gawlet-lee?“
ENG: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why didst thou make me thus?

ASY: ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܚܵܪܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܗܲܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܒ݂ܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܕܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܠܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܘܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܡܲܣܠܵܝܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Layt-leh pakhara shoelṭana 'al ṭeena d'abed har min khda gweelta dṭeena khad mana leeqara o haw khena lmaslayta?
ENG: Or hath not the potter a right over the clay, from the same lump to make one part a vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܟܲܪܒܹܗ ܘܡܲܕܸܥ ܚܲܝܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܪܝܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܹܐܢܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܲܪܒܵܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܠܛܠܵܩܵܐ؟
TRL: Moodee in Alaha b'e-leh dmakhze karbeh o madi' khayleh, moeryikh-leh beneh 'al mane dkarba deena hoedre lṭlaqa?
ENG: What if God, willing to shew his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering vessels of wrath fitted unto destruction:

ASY: ܘܕܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܠܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܲܝ ܠܹܗ ܠܚܸܩܪܵܐ،
TRL: O dmakhze yoetrana dshoewkheh lanee deena hoedre lrakhme, anee dmin qamayta hoedray-leh lkhiqra,
ENG: and that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he afore prepared unto glory,

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܲܝ ܠܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Oep akhnan, anee dalaha goebyay-leh, la akhchee min yhoedaye eena oep min imwate.
ENG: even us, whom he also called, not from the Jews only, but also from the Gentiles?

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܗܘܿܫܲܥ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܹܝܢܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܘܗ̇ܝ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܬܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܹܝܢܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: Dakhee doep hoosha' nweea meereh: anee dle yna 'amee, bit qareynhoon 'amee, o hay dle-ylaha moekhibta, bit qareynaha moekhibta.
ENG: As he saith also in Hosea, I will call that my people, which was not my people; And her beloved, which was not beloved.

ASY: ܘܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ: ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܥܲܡܝܼ، ܬܵܡܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O bit hawya bdoeka dpeeshta ywa meerta ilayhy: le ytoon 'amee, tama bit payshee qirye bnoone dalaha khaya.
ENG: And it shall be, that in the place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people, There shall they be called sons of the living God.

ASY: ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܘܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܹܠܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ، ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: Esha'ya moeqwikh-leh boet eesrayel o meereh: oep in dhawe minyana dbnay eesrayel aykh sela dyama, akhchee khad sahma minayhy bit pareq.
ENG: And Isaiah crieth concerning Israel, If the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, it is the remnant that shall be saved:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܓ̰ܲܠܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܬܲܡܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab Marya bjaldoeta bit tamim-leh shoeleh 'al ar'a.
ENG: for the Lord will execute his word upon the earth, finishing it and cutting it short.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ: ܐܸܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܚܲܝܠܬܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܕܘܿܡ ܘܒܸܬ ܕܵܡܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܥܵܡܘܿܪܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh dmeereh esha'ya min qamayta: in Marya khayltana la hawe wa shweeqa ilan zar'a, bit hawakh waw aykh sdoom o bit damakh waw l'amoora.
ENG: And, as Isaiah hath said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, We had become as Sodom, and had been made like unto Gomorrah.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܕܐܸܡܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha amrakh, dimwate dle ywaw biṭ'aya lzadeeqoeta moechikh-lhoon zadeeqoeta, zadeeqoeta deelaha bhaymanoeta.
ENG: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܕܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena bnay eesrayel, dbiṭ'aya ywaw lzadeeqoeta dke atya min namoosa, la moechkha-lhoon.
ENG: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, did not arrive at that law.

ASY: ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܬܘܼܪܩܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܩܲܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Qamoodee? Sabab le ywaw biṭ'aya bhaymanoeta ila bpoelkhane dnamoosa. Boet aha toerqil-lhoon bkepa dtarqalta.
ENG: Wherefore? Because they sought it not by faith, but as it were by works. They stumbled at the stone of stumbling;

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܓܵܘ ܨܸܗܝܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܩܲܠܬܵܐ، ܘܩܵܝܵܐ ܕܢܦܵܠܬܵܐ، ܘܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܟܹܦ.
TRL: Dakhee deeleh kteewa: bit matbin gaw ṣihyoon kepa dtarqalta, o qaya dnpalta, o man dhamin bee-eh le nakep.
ENG: even as it is written, Behold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offence: And he that believeth on him shall not be put to shame.

ASY: ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܫܲܗܘܲܬܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܝܼ ܘܦܲܪܦܲܠܬܝܼ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܪܩܝܼ.
TRL: Akhoonwatee, shahwatta dlibee o parpaltee balaha boet bnay eesrayel eelaha dparqee.
ENG: Brethren, my heart’s desire and my supplication to God is for them, that they may be saved.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܝܗܝ ܕܛܲܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab bishada ywin min gebayhy dṭanane yna qa Alaha, eena la bda'ta.
ENG: For I bear them witness that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܝܼ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Kad la beeda'a kenoeta dalaha, o biṭ'aya dmachkhee kenoeta dganayhy, la hwe-lhoon zabṭ lkenoeta dalaha.
ENG: For being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܟܠ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ.
TRL: Sabab msheekha-yleh khoetama dzadeeqoeta dke atya byad namoosa, dhawya zadeeqoeta lkl dhamin.
ENG: For Christ is the end of the law unto righteousness to every one that believeth.

ASY: ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Moeshe kteew-leh boet zadeeqoeta dke atya byad namoosa o meereh: kl man d'abed ane bit khaye bee-ayhy.
ENG: For Moses writeth that the man that doeth the righteousness which is of the law shall live thereby.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ، ”ܠܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܬ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂، ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܣܹܩ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ؟‘ ܝܲܥܢܹܐ ܕܡܲܨܠܹܐ ܠܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ،
TRL: Eena zadeeqoeta dke atya byad haymanoeta ke amra, ”la amret gaw liboekh, ’manee bit aseq lshmaya?‘ ya'ne dmaṣle lmsheekha,
ENG: But the righteousness which is of faith saith thus, Say not in thy heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down:)

ASY: ”ܝܲܢ ’ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܨܵܠܹܐ ܠܥܘܼܡܩܵܐ؟‘ ܝܲܥܢܹܐ ܕܡܲܐܣܸܩ ܠܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.“
TRL: ”Yan ’manee bit ṣale l'oemqa?‘ ya'ne dmasiq lmsheekha min meete.“
ENG: or, Who shall descend into the abyss? (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.)

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ؟ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ، ”ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܩܘܼܪܒܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇، ܐܘܼܦ ܓܵܘ ܦܘܼܡܘܼܟ݂ ܘܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇،“ ܝܲܥܢܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܘܼܗ̇ ܝܘܲܚ،
TRL: Eena moodee ke amra? Ke amra, ”hemizman qoerboekh eelaha, oep gaw poemoekh o liboekh eelaha,“ ya'ne hemizman dhaymanoeta dmakroezoeha ywakh,
ENG: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach:

ASY: ܕܐܸܢ ܡܵܘܕܹܝܬ ܒܦܘܼܡܘܼܟ݂ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܡܸܢܸܬ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܩܹܬ.
TRL: Din mawdeyt bpoemoekh deeshoo' Maran eeleh, o haminit bliboekh dalaha moeqim-leh ileh min gaw meete, bit parqet.
ENG: because if thou shalt confess with thy mouth Jesus as Lord, and shalt believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܠܸܒܘܼܟ݂ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܸܬ ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܬ ܡܘܼܟܫܸܛܵܐ، ܘܒܦܘܼܡܘܼܟ݂ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܘܕܹܝܬ ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܪܩܹܬ.
TRL: Sabab bliboekh ke haminit o ke payshet moekshiṭa, o bpoemoekh ke mawdeyt o ke parqet.
ENG: for with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ: ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܟܹܦ.
TRL: Dakhee dbemara-yleh ktawa: kl man dhamin bee-eh le nakep.
ENG: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be put to shame.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܦܘܼܪܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܝܗܘܼܕܵܝܵܐ ܘܝܵܘܢܵܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܪܵܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܒܲܪܸܟ݂ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܵܪܝܼ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab layt poershoenya beyl yhoedaya o yawnaya, sabab khad Marya-yleh 'al klayhy, o raba ke barikh lanee dqaree-leh.
ENG: For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek: for the same Lord is Lord of all, and is rich unto all that call upon him:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܵܪܹܐ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܹܩ.
TRL: Sabab kl man dqare bshima dmarya bit pareq.
ENG: for, Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܪܝܼ ܒܫܸܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܕܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ؟ ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܒܚܲܕ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ؟ ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Eena dakhee bit qaree bshima dkhad dle haminee bee-eh? O dakhee bit haminee bkhad dle yna shmee'e boet dee-eh? O dakhee bit sham'ee dla makrizana?
ENG: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?

ASY: ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܪܸܙܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ؟ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܟܡܵܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܫܚܸܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ!
TRL: O dakhee bit makrizee in le yna peeshe shoedre? Aykh deeleh kteewa: kma shapeere yna aqlate dmashkhidane dewangaleeoon!
ENG: and how shall they preach, except they be sent? even as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things!

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ: ܡܵܪܝܼ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܢ؟
TRL: Eena klayhy bnay eesrayel la qoebil-lhoon lewangaleeoon. Aykh dmeereh esha'ya: maree, manee hoemineh lhemizmanan?
ENG: But they did not all hearken to the glad tidings. For Isaiah saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܵܥܬܵܐ، ܘܫܡܵܥܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha, haymanoeta ke atya min shma'ta, o shma'ta min hemizman dmsheekha.
ENG: So belief cometh of hearing, and hearing by the word of Christ.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ: ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ؟ ܗܹܐ، ܫܡܝܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ. ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܡܲܪ̈ܙܵܢܹܐ ܕܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eena ana baqoere ywin: le yna shmee'e anee? He, shmee'e yna. Bklaha ar'a pleeṭ-leh qalayhy, o bmarzane ddoenye hemizmanayhy.
ENG: But I say, Did they not hear? Yea, verily, Their sound went out into all the earth, And their words unto the ends of the world.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ؟ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܒܲܚܸܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܟܪܸܒܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܡܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Mindrish baqoere ywin, la dee' lhoon bnay eesrayel? Min qamayta moeshe meereh: bit 'awdenawkhoon dbakhileetoon boemta dle-ylaha oemta, o bit makribinawkhoon boemta dla parmayta.
ENG: But I say, Did Israel not know? First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation, With a nation void of understanding will I anger you.

ASY: ܐܹܫܲܥܝܵܐ ܩܘܼܫܕܸܪܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܛܥܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܝܼ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܩܸܪܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܝܼ.
TRL: Esha'ya qoeshdireh o meereh: peesh-lee moechkha lanee dla ṭ'e-lhoon ilee, o peesh-lee gilya lanee dla boeqirhoon 'alee.
ENG: And Isaiah is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I became manifest unto them that asked not of me.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܟܠܹܗ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܦܘܼܫܸܛ ܠܝܼ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܝܼ̈ ܠܟܸܣ ܥܲܡܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܵܢܵܐ، ܘܡܲܩܪܸܨܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena boet eesrayel meereh: kleh yawma poeshiṭ-lee eedatee lkis 'ama la maṣyitana, o maqriṣana.
ENG: But as to Israel he saith, All the day long did I spread out my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.

ASY: ܒܲܩܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ، ܪܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܥܲܡܹܗ؟ ܚܵܣ ܠܝܼ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܝܼܘܸܢ، ܡ̣ܢ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܕܒܸܢܝܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: Baqoere ywin, roepe-leh Alaha l'ameh? Khas-lee. Oep ana min bnay eesrayel eewin, min zar'a dawraham, min shawṭa dbinyameyn.
ENG: I say then, Did God cast off his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
