ENG: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; it is not therefore not of the body.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܝܢܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܡܵܥܬܵܐ؟ ܘܐܸܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܵܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܩܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܪܹܝܚܵܐ؟
TRL: In kleh paghra hawe wa 'ayna, ayka bit hawya wa shma'ta? O in kleh paghra hawe wa nata, ayka bit hawya wa shqalta dreykha?
ENG: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܠܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܕܘܼܟܹܗ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena adeea, Alaha moeryiz-leh lhadame dgaw paghra kl khad bdoekeh, aykh dbseem-laha-leh.
ENG: But now hath God set the members each one of them in the body, even as it pleased him.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ؟
TRL: In hawee waw klayhy khad hadama, dakhee bit hawe wa paghra?
ENG: And if they were all one member, where were the body?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Eena aykh deeleh, eet raba hadame eena khad paghra-yleh.
ENG: But now they are many members, but one body.

ASY: ܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܵܐ ܠܐܝܼܕܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܵܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ،“ ܘܪܹܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܐܵܡܹܪ ܠܐܲܩܠܵܐ، ”ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܟ݂ܝ.“
TRL: 'Ayna le maṣya amra leeda, ”le ywan sneeqta ilakhy,“ o resha le maṣe amer laqla, ”le ywin sneeqa ilakhy.“
ENG: And the eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee: or again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

ASY: ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܚܝܼܠܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Ila boesh zawda, hadame dke khashbakh-lhoon boesh mkheele, eet sneeqoeta boesh raba 'alayhy.
ENG: Nay, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be more feeble are necessary:

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܝܲܩܪܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܒܐܵܕܵܒܘܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ،
TRL: O anee hadame dke khashbakh-lhoon boesh baṣoore gaw paghra, boesh zawda ke myaqrakh-lhoon, o anee hadame dnkheepta yna, badaboeta ke khashbakh-lhoon,
ENG: and those parts of the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness;

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܗܲܕܵܡܲܢ̈ ܕܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܙ ܠܹܗ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ،
TRL: Kad hadaman deeqara layt-lhoon sneeqoeta, eena Alaha moeryiz-leh hadame dpaghra, o yoebil-leh eeqara zawda lhadame deewaw sneeqe,
ENG: whereas our comely parts have no need: but God tempered the body together, giving more abundant honour to that part which lacked;

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܵܓ݂ܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܐ ܐܵܟܹܠ ܚܲܡ ܗܲܪ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Dla hawe poelagha gaw paghra ila kl hadama akel kham har dhaw khena.
ENG: that there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪܝܼ ܥܲܡܹܗ، ܘܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ، ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܕܵܡܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܨܚܝܼ.
TRL: In khad hadama janjir, klayhy hadame ke janjiree 'ameh, o in khad hadama paesh myoeqra, klayhy hadame ke paṣkhee.
ENG: And whether one member suffereth, all the members suffer with it; or one member is honoured, all the members rejoice with it.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܕܵܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܓܵܘܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha, akhtoon eetoon paghra dmsheekha, o kl khad minawkhoon hadama-yleh gaweh.
ENG: Now ye are the body of Christ, and severally members thereof.

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܬܪܹܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ، ܘܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ؛ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܣܲܡܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܵܨܝܼ ܗܲܝܸܪܝܼ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܬܲܓܒܲܪܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ.
TRL: O moetiw-leh Alaha gaw 'edta qamayta shleekhe, o dtrey nwee-e, o dtlata malpane; bar hada 'awdane dkhayle goere, o anee deet-lhoon mawhwate dbasamta, o anee dmaṣee hayiree lkhene, o anee deet-lhoon mawhawta dtagbarta, o anee dhamzimee blishane preeshe.
ENG: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondly prophets, thirdly teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, divers kinds of tongues.

ASY: ܩܵܡܘܿ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Qamoo klayhy shleekhe yna? Yan klayhy nwee-e yna? Yan klayhy malpane yna? Yan klayhy 'awdane dkhayle goere yna?
ENG: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?

ASY: ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܵܣܲܡܬܵܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܫܩܝܼ؟
TRL: Yan klayhy eet-lhoon mawhwate dbasamta? Yan klayhy ke hamzimee blishane? Yan klayhy ke pashqee?
ENG: have all gifts of healings? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

ASY: ܛܥܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܙܸܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ.
TRL: Ṭ'eymoen min kleh libawkhoon mawhwate boesh goere. Eena adeea bit makhziynawkhoon oerkha boesh ṣpayee.
ENG: But desire earnestly the greater gifts. And a still more excellent way shew I unto you.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܘܒܕܡܲܠܲܐܟܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܚܵܫܵܐ ܕܙܲܡܙܸܡ ܝܲܢ ܨܸܨܠܵܐ ܕܟ̰ܲܢܟ̰ܸܢ.
TRL: In blishane dbnaynasha hamzimin o bdmalake, eena khoeba layt-lee, hwe-lee aykh nkhasha dzamzim yan ṣiṣla dchanchin.
ENG: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am become sounding brass, or a clanging cymbal.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܪ̈ܵܙܹܐ ܘܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܕܡܵܨܹܝܢ ܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܫܲܢܹܝܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ، ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: O in hawe-lee nweeoeta, o yad'en klayhy raze o klaha da'ta, o in hawe-lee klaha haymanoeta hada dmaṣeyn ṭoerane shaneyn, eena khoeba layt-lee, le ywin mindee.
ENG: And if I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܟܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܝܼ ܠܡܸܣܟܹܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐܸܢ ܣܲܦܹܝܢ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܝܼ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܸܩܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: O in yaben kleh mindeeee lmiskene, o in sapeyn paghree dpaesh moeqda eena khoeba layt-lee, mindee le ywin biqnaya.
ENG: And if I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it profiteth me nothing.

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܹܐܢܹܗ ܘܡܪܲܚܡܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ. ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܒܲܚܸܠ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܬܹܪ، ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Khoeba yareekhta-ylaha beneh o mrakhmana-yleh. Khoeba le bakhil, le khater, le 'abed shoewhara.
ENG: Love suffereth long, and is kind; love envieth not; love vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܢܟܸܦ، ܠܹܐ ܛܵܠܹܒ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܠܹܐ ܟܵܪܹܒ، ܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܒ݂ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܝܼܫܵܐ.
TRL: Khoeba le mankip, le ṭaleb mindee dganeh, le kareb, le khashew mindee beesha.
ENG: doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not its own, is not provoked, taketh not account of evil;

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܒܥܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܕܹܐ ܒܫܪܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: Khoeba le khade b'awla ila ke khade bshrara.
ENG: rejoiceth not in unrighteousness, but rejoiceth with the truth;

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܸܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܟܹܐ ܚܵܡܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Khoeba ke qabil kl mindee, ke hamin bkl mindee, ke paesh bhewee 'al kl mindee, ke khamel 'al kl mindee.
ENG: beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ. ܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܠܝܼ، ܘܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܬܩܝܼ، ܘܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܠܵܐ.
TRL: Khoeba hich le napel. Nweeawate bit baṭlee, o lishane bit shatqee, o da'ta bit baṭla.
ENG: Love never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they shall be done away; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there be knowledge, it shall be done away.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܢܲܒܲܚ.
TRL: Sabab khacha ke yad'akh o khacha ke nabakh.
ENG: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܝܵܐ ܟܵܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܒܵܛܹܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܵܡܝܼܠ.
TRL: Eena eeman datya kameeloeta, haygah bit baṭel haw dle ywa kameel.
ENG: but when that which is perfect is come, that which is in part shall be done away.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܟܹܐ ܚܵܫܒܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܐܲܝܟ݂ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܛܠܲܝ ܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܠܕ݇ܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman dyala ywin wa aykh yala ke hamzimin wa, aykh yala ke khashben wa, o aykh yala ke parmeyn wa. Eena eeman dhwe-lee gawra boeṭlay-lee mindeeane dyaloeta.
ENG: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child: now that I am become a man, I have put away childish things.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܸܢ ܚܸܫܟܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܢܵܘܪܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܙܲܚ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܵܬܵܐ. ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܒܟܵܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܟܵܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab adeea aykh din khishkana bikhzaya ywakh bnawra, eena haygah bit khazakh pata gaw pata. Adeea baṣoora ke yad'en, eena haygah bit yad'en bkameeloeta dakhee dpeesha ywin dee'a bkameeloeta.
ENG: For now we see in a mirror, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I have been known.

ASY: ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ: ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ، ܘܚܘܼܒܵܐ؛ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܝܗܝ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Adeea ane tlata ke payshee: haymanoeta, o hewee, o khoeba; eena boesh goera gawayhy khoeba-yleh.
ENG: But now abideth faith, hope, love, these three; and the greatest of these is love.

ASY: ܢܦܘܿܠܘܼܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܛܲܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܢܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Npooloen bar khoeba, o hweymoen ṭanane lmawhwate roekhanaye, eena boesh zawda dnabeytoon.
ENG: Follow after love; yet desire earnestly spiritual gifts, but rather that ye may prophesy.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܲܕ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܹܐ ܦܲܪܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܪ̈ܵܙܹܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab khad dhamzim blishana khena, le-yleh hamzoeme lnashe ila lalaha, sabab oep khad le parme-leh, hamzoeme-yleh raze broekha.
ENG: For he that speaketh in a tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God; for no man understandeth; but in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܲܒܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܘܠܚܵܠܲܢܬܵܐ ܘܠܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: Eena haw dnabe hamzoeme-yleh lnashe lbinyana o lkhalanta o lyabalta dliba.
ENG: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men edification, and comfort, and consolation.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܲܒܹܐ ܒܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Haw dhamzim blishana khena bibnaya-yleh lganeh, eena haw dnabe bibnaya-yleh l'edta.
ENG: He that speaketh in a tongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.

ASY: ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܢܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܢܲܒܹܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܦܲܫܸܩ ܩܵܐ ܒܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Ba'eyn dklawkhoon hamzimeetoon blishane, eena ba'eyn boesh zawda dnabeytoon. Haw dnabe boesh goera-yleh min haw dhamzim blishane, ila in pashiq qa bnayta d'edta.
ENG: Now I would have you all speak with tongues, but rather that ye should prophesy: and greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.

ASY: ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐܸܢ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܓܸܠܝܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ؟
TRL: Adeea akhoonwatee, in ateyn lkis lawkhoon hamzoeme blishane, moodee ṭawta bit 'awden ilawkhoon in la yabenawkhoon gilyana yan da'ta yan nweeoeta yan yoelpana?
ENG: But now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I speak to you either by way of revelation, or of knowledge, or of prophesying, or of teaching?

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܫܲܒܝܼܒܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܩܝܼܬܵܪܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼ ܩܵܠܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܦܘܼܪܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܩܝܼܢܬܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡܚܝܼܬܵܐ؟
TRL: Oep mindeeane dlayt-lhoon khaye aykh shabeeba yan qeetara, ke yawee qala, eena in layt khad poershoenya gaw qale, dakhee yad'akh aynee qeenta pyasha-ylaha mkheeta?
ENG: Even things without life, giving a voice, whether pipe or harp, if they give not a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܩܲܪܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܚܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܩܵܠܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܕܸܪ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܦܠܵܫܵܐ؟
TRL: O in qarna la makhya khad qala preesha, manee bit hadir ganeh lplasha?
ENG: For if the trumpet give an uncertain voice, who shall prepare himself for war?

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܨܸܦܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ؟ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܗܵܘܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep akhtoon, in la hamzimeetoon blishana hemizmane ṣipye, dakhee bit paesh dee'a mindee dhamzimeetoon? Bit haweytoon hamzoeme gaw hawa.
ENG: So also ye, unless ye utter by the tongue speech easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye will be speaking into the air.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܚܲܕ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܥܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Oep in deet raba lishane preeshe gaw doenye, eena layt khad dla ma'naya.
ENG: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and no kind is without signification.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܝܵܕܥܹܢ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܚܲܕ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܗ̇ܘ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ.
TRL: Eena in la yad'en moodee khad bemara-yleh, bit haweyn aykh noekhraya lkis haw dhamzoeme-yleh, o haw bit hawe noekhraya lkis-lee.
ENG: If then I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be to him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh will be a barbarian unto me.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܹܐ، ܒܥܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܙܵܝܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܘܗܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܒܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha oep akhtoon, sabab raba ba'eytoon dhawe lawkhoon mawhwate roekhanaye, b'eymoen boesh zawda dzaydeetoon bmawhwate lbinyana d'edta.
ENG: So also ye, since ye are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek that ye may abound unto the edifying of the church.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܚܲܕ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܨܲܠܹܐ ܕܦܲܫܸܩ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ.
TRL: Boet aha, haw dhamzim bkhad lishana, shwooq ṣale dpashiq moodee-yleh hamzoeme.
ENG: Wherefore let him that speaketh in a tongue pray that he may interpret.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܨܲܠܹܝܢ ܒܚܲܕ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܨܲܠܘܼܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Sabab in ṣaleyn bkhad lishana la dee'a, roekhee-ylaha ṣaloeye, eena ri'yanee le-yleh bi'wada hich mindee.
ENG: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ؟ ܒܸܬ ܨܲܠܹܝܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ. ܒܸܬ ܙܵܡܪܹܢ ܒܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܘܐܘܼܦ ܒܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ.
TRL: Bas moodee 'awden? Bit ṣaleyn broekhee o oep bri'yanee. Bit zamren broekhee o oep bri'yanee.
ENG: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܚܲܕ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܦܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܡܹܪ، ”ܐܵܡܹܝܢ“ ܥܲܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܸܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ؟
TRL: In shakoere ywit lalaha broekha akhchee, khad dle-yleh peesha moelpa dakhee bit amer, ”ameyn“ 'al mindee dshakoere ywit, in le yade' moodee ywit bemara?
ENG: Else if thou bless with the spirit, how shall he that filleth the place of the unlearned say the Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he knoweth not what thou sayest?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܕܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܬ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab at ṣpayee bi'wada ywit dshakoere ywit, eena haw khena le-yleh pyasha binya.
ENG: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

ASY: ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Shakoere ywin lalaha dana boesh zawda min klawkhoon ke hamzimin blishane.
ENG: I thank God, I speak with tongues more than you all:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܚܲܡܸܫ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܲܦܪܸ̈ܡܵܢܹܐ ܕܡܲܠܦܸܢ ܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܥܸܣܪܵܐ ܐܲܠܦܹ̈ܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ.
TRL: Eena gaw 'edta ba'eyn dhamzimin khamish hemizmane maprimane dmalpin lkhene min dhamzimin 'isra alpe hemizmane blishana la dee'a.
ENG: howbeit in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might instruct others also, than ten thousand words in a tongue.

ASY: ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܝܵܠܹ̈ܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܓܡܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Akhoonwatee, la haweytoon yale z'oore btakhmantawkhoon. Min beeshta geba hweymoen yale z'oore, eena btakhmantawkhoon hweymoen gmeere.
ENG: Brethren, be not children in mind: howbeit in malice be ye babes, but in mind be men.

ASY: ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܘܒܣܸܦܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܸܢ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܡܥܝܼ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Peesha-yleh kteewa bnamoosa, dmarya bemara-yleh: blishane khene o bsipwate khene bit hamzimin-laha 'ama, eena oep haygah le sham'ee ilee.
ENG: In the law it is written, By men of strange tongues and by the lips of strangers will I speak unto this people; and not even thus will they hear me, saith the Lord.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܢܝܼܫܲܢܩܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܠܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Hadkha lishane neeshanqa yna, la lmhoemne eena lanee dle yna mhoemne. Eena nweeoeta qa mhoemne-ylaha o la qa la mhoemne.
ENG: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to the unbelieving: but prophesying is for a sign, not to the unbelieving, but to them that believe.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܥܵܐ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܡܘܼܠܦܹܐ ܝܲܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܹ̈ܐ، ܠܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܕܫܘܼܕܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Hadkha in klaha 'edta jam'a m'oedale, o klayhy hamzimee blishane, o 'awree anee dle yna peeshe moelpe yan dle yna mhoemne, le amree dshoedinawkhoon?
ENG: If therefore the whole church be assembled together, and all speak with tongues, and there come in men unlearned or unbelieving, will they not say that ye are mad?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܚܲܕ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܠܦܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ، ܘܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܢܲܒܘܼܝܹܐ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܢܟܸܣܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena in 'aber khad dle-yleh peesha moelpa yan khad la mhoemna, o akhtoon klawkhoon haweytoon naboeye, bit paesh moenkisa min klawkhoon o bit paesh deena min klawkhoon.
ENG: But if all prophesy, and there come in one unbelieving or unlearned, he is reproved by all, he is judged by all;

ASY: ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܓܸܠܝܹܐ ܐ݇ܪ̈ܵܙܹܐ ܕܠܸܒܹܗ، ܘܒܸܬ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܘܣܵܓܹܕ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܐܵܡܹܪ، ”ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܹܗ.“
TRL: Bit payshee gilye raze dlibeh, o bit napel 'al pateh o saged lalaha o amer, ”bshareeroeta Alaha gawawkhoon eeleh.“
ENG: the secrets of his heart are made manifest; and so he will fall down on his face and worship God, declaring that God is among you indeed.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈؟ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܓ̰ܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܙܡܘܿܪܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܓܸܠܝܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ، ܝܲܢ ܦܘܼܫܵܩܵܐ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܠܒܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bas moodee amrakh akhoonwatee? Eeman djam'eetoon in khad eet-leh mazmoora, yan khad khabra dyoelpana, yan gilyana, yan lishana, yan poeshaqa, 'woodoen klayhy ane lbnayta d'edta.
ENG: What is it then, brethren? When ye come together, each one hath a psalm, hath a teaching, hath a revelation, hath a tongue, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܵܐ، ܗܲܡܙܸܡܘܼܢ ܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ، ܘܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܥܕܵܢܹܗ، ܘܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܦܲܫܸܩ.
TRL: In hamzimeetoon blishana, hamzimoen trey yan tlata, o la zawda, o kl khad b'daneh, o khad khena pashiq.
ENG: If any man speaketh in a tongue, let it be by two, or at the most three, and that in turn; and let one interpret:

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܠܲܝܬ ܦܲܫܩܵܢܵܐ ܫܵܬܹܩ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܵܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ، ܘܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܒܹܝܠܹܗ ܘܒܹܝܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: In layt pashqana shateq hamzimana gaw 'edta, o hamzim beyleh o beyl Alaha.
ENG: but if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.

ASY: ܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܵܪܫܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: Trey yan tlata nwee-e hamzimee, o anee khene parshee mindee dpeesha-yleh hoemzima.
ENG: And let the prophets speak by two or three, and let the others discern.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܫܵܬܹܩ.
TRL: Eena in khad mindee paesh gilya lkhad deeleh teewa, haw qamaya shateq.
ENG: But if a revelation be made to another sitting by, let the first keep silence.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܢܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܚܲܕ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܝܵܠܦܝܼ ܘܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab klawkhoon maṣeytoon nabeytoon khad bar dhaw khena, dklayhy yalpee o dklayhy payshee yoebe liba.
ENG: For ye all can prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted;

ASY: ܪ̈ܘܼܚܹܐ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Roekhe dnwee-e zabṭ eena lnwee-e,
ENG: and the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܫܓ݂ܘܼܫܝܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܹܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Sabab Alaha le-yleh Alaha dshghoeshya ila dshlama. Aykh deeleh bklayhy 'edate dqadeeshe,
ENG: for God is not a God of confusion, but of peace; as in all the churches of the saints.

ASY: ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܫܬܝܼܩܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ. ܠܲܝܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܝܼ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܬܵܒܥܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Bakhtate hawee shteeqe gaw 'edta. Layt-lhoon psasa dhamzimee, ila hawee tab'ane aykh doep namoosa bemara-yleh.
ENG: Let the women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but let them be in subjection, as also saith the law.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܒܵܥܝܼ ܝܵܠܦܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܒܲܩܪܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܲܒ݂ܪ̈ܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: In ba'ee yalpee mindee, shwooq baqree min gawranayhy gaw bayta, sabab nkheepta-ylaha lbakhta dhamzima gaw 'edta.
ENG: And if they would learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home: for it is shameful for a woman to speak in the church.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ؟ ܝܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܢܲܦ̮ܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܛܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇؟
TRL: Min lkis lawkhoon pleeṭ-laha hemizman dalaha? Yan ilawkhoon bnawshawkhoon mṭe-laha?
ENG: What? was it from you that the word of God went forth? or came it unto you alone?

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܵܫܹܒ݂ ܕܢܒ݂ܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܲܢ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܝܵܕܹܥ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܒܸܟܬܵܒܲܝ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܢܵܐ.
TRL: In khad minawkhoon khashew dnweea-yleh yan roekhanaya, yade' ṣpayee dane dbiktabay ywin ilawkhoon poeqdana dmaran eena.
ENG: If any man thinketh himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him take knowledge of the things which I write unto you, that they are the commandment of the Lord.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܹܥ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܵܐ.
TRL: Haw dle yade' aha, la paesh dee'a.
ENG: But if any man is ignorant, let him be ignorant.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܡܲܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܛܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܢܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܠܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܲܡܙܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܠܸܫܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Hadkha akhoonwatee, makhzeymoen ṭnana dnabeytoon o la makleytoon hamzamta blishane.
ENG: Wherefore, my brethren, desire earnestly to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܪܹܐܙܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܒܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena kl mindee paesh 'weeda rezanaeet o boerkha khsheekhta.
ENG: But let all things be done decently and in order.

ASY: ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܡܲܕܥܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܟܸܠܝܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Adeea akhoonwatee, ba'eyn dmad'inawkhoon boet ewangaleeoon, haw dmoekriz-lee ilawkhoon o dakhtoon qoebil lawkhoon o adeea kilye ytoon bee-eh,
ENG: Now I make known unto you brethren, the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye received, wherein also ye stand,

ASY: ܘܒܝܼܹܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܦܪܝܼܩܹܐ ܐܸܢ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܘܼܟܪܸܙ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܒܲܣ ܣܪܝܼܩܵܐܝܼܬ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: O bee-eh peesh lawkhoon preeqe in dawqeetoon bhemizman dmoekriz-lee ilawkhoon. In la dawqeetoon, bas sreeqaeet hoeminawkhoon.
ENG: by which also ye are saved; I make known, I say, in what words I preached it unto you, if ye hold it fast, except ye believed in vain.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܘܼܦܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܝܼ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܢ̈ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab soepe-lee ilawkhoon mindee boesh ananqaya dqoebil-lee, deeleh dmsheekha meet-leh boet khṭeeatan dakhee dkteewa-yleh.
ENG: For I delivered unto you first of all that which also I received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܒ݂ܝܼܪܵܐ، ܘܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ،
TRL: O peesh-leh qweera, o qeem-leh byawma dtlata dakhee dkteewa-yleh,
ENG: and that he was buried; and that he hath been raised on the third day according to the scriptures;

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܫܸܡܥܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܠܬܪܸܥܣܲܪ ܬܲܠܡܝܼ̈ܕܹܐ.
TRL: O peesh-leh khizya lshim'oon kepa, o haygah ltri'sar talmeede.
ENG: and that he appeared to Cephas; then to the twelve;

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܡܸܫܡܵܐܐ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܗܡܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar minayhy peesh-leh khizya lzawda min khamishma akhoonwate bkhda gaha, sahma zawda minayhy khaye yna o khakma minayhy dmeeke yna.
ENG: then he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain until now, but some are fallen asleep;

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haygah peesh-leh khizya lya'qoow, o min bar mineh lklayhy shleekhe.
ENG: then he appeared to James; then to all the apostles;

ASY: ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܡܘܼܪܚܸܫܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Bkharta dklayhy, aykh dlmoerkhisha, peesh-leh khizya oep ilee.
ENG: and last of all, as unto one born out of due time, he appeared to me also.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܓܵܘ ܫܠܝܼܚܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܚܹܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܫܠܝܼܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܘܼܡܸܪܝܼ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ana boesh baṣoora ywin gaw shleekhe, o le khashkhen dpayshen qirya shleekha, sabab koemiree l'edta dalaha.
ENG: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܘܸܢ، ܘܫܵܦܵܩܲܬܹܗ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܠܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܠܝܼܚ ܠܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܩܸܫܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ؛ ܠܵܐ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܵܗ̇.
TRL: Eena bshapaqat dalaha eewin mindee deewin, o shapaqateh beeee la hwe-laha baṭeelta. Sabab pleekh-lee boesh qishya min klayhy; la ana ila shapaqat dalaha dbeeee-ylaha.
ENG: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not found vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Bas in ana yan anee, hadkha makroeze ywakh o hadkha hoeminawkhoon.
ENG: Whether then it be I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܕܩܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟
TRL: O in msheekha pyasha-yleh moekriza dqeem-leh min gaw meete, dakhee nashe gawawkhoon bemara yna dlayt qyamta dmeete?
ENG: Now if Christ is preached that he hath been raised from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܠܲܝܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ، ܒܲܣ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: In layt qyamta dmeete, bas oep msheekha le-yleh qeema min gaw meete.
ENG: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither hath Christ been raised:

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ، ܒܲܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܟܵܪܘܿܙܘܼܬܲܢ ܘܒܲܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܘܼܦ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: O in msheekha le-yleh qeema, baṭeelta-ylaha karoozoetan o baṭeelta-ylaha oep haymanoetawkhoon,
ENG: and if Christ hath not been raised, then is our preaching vain, your faith also is vain.

ASY: ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܗܘܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܕܲܓܵܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ.
TRL: O akhnan bihwaya ywakh sahde dagale dalaha, sabab sheed lan dalaha moeqim-leh lmsheekha min meete. Eena la moeqim-leh in meete le qaymee.
ENG: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we witnessed of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead are not raised.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ، ܒܲܣ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab in meete le qaymee, bas oep msheekha le-yleh qeema,
ENG: For if the dead are not raised, neither hath Christ been raised:

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ، ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܗܹܫ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ،
TRL: O in msheekha le-yleh qeema, haymanoetawkhoon baṭeelta-ylaha, o hesh akhtoon gaw khṭeeatawkhoon eetoon,
ENG: and if Christ hath not been raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.

ASY: ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: O anee ddmeeke yna bmsheekha ṭleeqe yna.
ENG: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܐܲܢܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܘܼܫ ܫܲܩܝܼ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: In akhchee bane khaye eet lan hewee bmsheekha, akhnan boesh shaqee ywakh min klayhy nashe.
ENG: If in this life only we have hoped in Christ, we are of all men most pitiable.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܩܝܼܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܡܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena adeea msheekha qeema-yleh min gaw meete o hwe-leh ṭ'oenta qamayta danee ddmeeke yna.
ENG: But now hath Christ been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of them that are asleep.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab dakhee dmawta te-leh byad khad nasha, hadkha hwe-laha qyamta dmeete byad khad nasha.
ENG: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܐܵܕܵܡ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܝܬܝܼ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܚܝܼܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab dakhee dbadam klayhy ke maytee, hadkha bmsheekha klayhy bit payshee moekhee-e.
ENG: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܪܹܐܙܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ.
TRL: Eena kl khad breza dganeh, msheekha ṭ'oenta qamayta, haygah anee deena dmsheekha eeman date.
ENG: But each in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; then they that are Christ’s, at his coming.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܚܘܼܬܵܡܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܣܲܦܹܐ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܒܲܛܸܠ ܟܠ ܪܹܫܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܘܟܠ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ.
TRL: Haygah bit hawe khoetama, eeman dsape malkoeta lalaha baba, min bar dbaṭil kl reshanoeta o kl shoelṭana o kl khayla.
ENG: Then cometh the end, when he shall deliver up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have abolished all rule and all authority and power.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܲܟܸܡ ܗܲܠ ܕܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ.
TRL: Sabab wale-ylaha dhakim hal dmatiw klayhy dishminoehy tkhoot aqlateh.
ENG: For he must reign, till he hath put all his enemies under his feet.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܸܫܡܸܢ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܒܘܼܛܠܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haw dishmin kharaya dbit paesh boeṭla mawta-yleh.
ENG: The last enemy that shall be abolished is death.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ،“ ܕܠܵܐ ܫܸܟ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܚܒ݂ܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab moetiw-leh kl mindee tkhoot aqlateh. Eena eeman dmeereh, ”kl mindee peesh-leh moetwa tkhoot aqlateh,“ dla shik le-yleh bikhwasha Alaha lganeh bkl mindee dmoetiw-leh tkhoot aqlate dmsheekha.
ENG: For, He put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he saith, All things are put in subjection, it is evident that he is excepted who did subject all things unto him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܙܲܒܛ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܠ ܒܟܠ.
TRL: Eeman dklayhy mindeeane payshee 'weede zabṭ ileh, haygah broona bganeh bit paesh 'weeda zabṭ lhaw dmoetiw-leh kl mindee tkhoot aqlateh, dhawe Alaha kl bkl.
ENG: And when all things have been subjected unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subjected to him that did subject all things unto him, that God may be all in all.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܠܲܝܬ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܥܡܝܼܕܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟ ܐܸܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܗܲܪ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ، ܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܸܥܡܵܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܝܗܝ؟
TRL: In layt qyamta, moodee bit 'awdee anee dbipyasha 'meede min geba dmeete? In meete har le qaymee, qamoodee yna bi'mada min gebayhy?
ENG: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why then are they baptized for them?

ASY: ܘܩܵܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܲܬܒܲܚ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܘܲܢܕܹܢܘܿܣ ܟܠ ܣܵܥܲܬ؟
TRL: O qamoodee akhnan matbakh-laha ganan gaw qewandenoos kl sa'at?
ENG: Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?

ASY: ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܗܲܪ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܘܸܢ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܵܪܲܢ، ܟܠ ܝܘܿܡ ܒܸܡܝܵܬܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: Shareeraeet, akhoonwatee, har aykh deewin bi'wada shoewhara beeawkhoon beeshoo' msheekha Maran, kl yoom bimyata ywin.
ENG: I protest by that glorying in you, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܦܠܝܼܫ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܘܝܼܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ؟ ܐܵܟ݂ܠܲܚ ܘܫܵܬܲܚ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܵܝܕܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܝܬܲܚ.
TRL: In aykh barnasha pleesh-lee 'am haywane kewee-e gaw apisoos, moodee yoetrana eet-lee in meete le qaymee? Akhlakh o shatakh, sabab qaydamta bit maytakh.
ENG: If after the manner of men I fought with beasts at Ephesus, what doth it profit me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܚܠܸܛܹܐ، ܫܵܘܬܵܦܘܼܬܵܐ ܣܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܘܼܒܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: La paysheetoon moekhliṭe, shawtapoeta sreeta ke makhriwa doebare shapeere.
ENG: Be not deceived: Evil company doth corrupt good manners.

ASY: ܬܥܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܠܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܫܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܲܝܬ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܡܲܢܟ݂ܘܼܦܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: T'ooroen lzadeeqoeta, o shleymoen min khṭeeta, sabab eet nashe dlayt bee-ayhy da'ta dalaha. Bemara ywin aha lmankhoepawkhoon.
ENG: Awake up righteously, and sin not; for some have no knowledge of God: I speak this to move you to shame.

ASY: ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܲܩܸܪ، ”ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ؟ ܒܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ؟“
TRL: Qawma khad baqir, ”dakhee bit qaymee meete? Bmoodee paghra bit qaymee?“
ENG: But some one will say, How are the dead raised? and with what manner of body do they come?

ASY: ܝܵܐ ܣܲܟ݂ܠܵܐ، ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܙܵܪܥܹܬ ܠܹܐ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܐܸܢ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ.
TRL: Ya sakhla, mindee dzar'et le khaye in la maet.
ENG: Thou foolish one, that which thou thyself sowest is not quickened, except it die:

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܒܸܙܪܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܸܬ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܲܢܕܸܟܬܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܬܵܐ، ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܚܸܛܹ̈ܐ ܝܲܢ ܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Mindee dbizra'a ywit le-yleh haw paghra dbit hawe, ila dandikta shoelkhayta, qawma dkhiṭe yan barzar'a khena.
ENG: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but a bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other kind;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ. ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܫܸܟܠܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Eena Alaha ke yabil-leh paghra aykh dbasma-leh. Lkl khad shikla dbarzar'a ke yabil paghra dganeh.
ENG: but God giveth it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.

ASY: ܟܠ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܬܸܓ݂ܡܵܐ ܕܒܸܣܪܵܐ. ܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܘܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܛܲܝܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kl bisra le-yleh khad tighma dbisra. Eet bisra dnashe, eet bisra dhaywane, eet bisra dṭayre o eet bisra dnoene.
ENG: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one flesh of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another flesh of birds, and another of fishes.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ ܐܲܪ̈ܥܵܢܵܝܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eet paghre shmayanaye o eet paghre ar'anaye, eena khiqra dpaghra shmayanaya khad mindee-yleh o khiqra dpaghra ar'anaya khad mindee khena.
ENG: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܫܸܡܫܵܐ ܘܐܝܼܬ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܣܲܗܪܵܐ. ܐܝܼܬ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ، ܘܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܵܘܟ݂ܒ݂ܵܐ ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ.
TRL: Eet khiqra dshimsha o eet khiqra dsahra. Eet khiqra dkawkhbe, o kawkhwa min kawkhwa preesha-yleh bkhiqra.
ENG: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differeth from another star in glory.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ. ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha bit hawya oep qyamta dmeete. Paghra dpyasha-yleh zree'a kharwana-yleh, bit paesh moeqima dla khrawa.
ENG: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ.
TRL: Ke paesh zree'a bnkheepta, ke paesh moeqima bkhiqra, ke paesh zree'a bzaboenoeta, o ke paesh moeqima bkhayla.
ENG: it is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܙܪܝܼܥܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܟܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܡܘܼܩܸܡܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ. ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܟܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܬ ܐܘܼܦ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Ke paesh zree'a paghra kyanaya, ke paesh moeqima paghra roekhanaya. In eet paghra kyanaya, eet oep paghra roekhanaya.
ENG: it is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ”ܐܵܕܵܡ، ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܬܵܐ،“ ܘܐܵܕܵܡ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܡܲܚܝܼܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa, ”adam, barnasha qamaya, hwe-leh gana khayta,“ o adam kharaya roekha makheeana.
ENG: So also it is written, The first man Adam became a living soul. The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܢܲܦ̮ܫܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Eena roekhanaya la te-leh qamayta, ila nawshanaya, o haygah roekhanaya.
ENG: Howbeit that is not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; then that which is spiritual.

ASY: ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ؛ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Barnasha qamaya min ar'a ywa, ar'anaya; barnasha dtrey min shmaya ywa.
ENG: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is of heaven.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ. ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh deewa barnasha ar'anaya, hadkha yna oep anee dmin ar'a. Aykh deeleh barnasha shmayanaya, hadkha yna oep anee dmin shmaya.
ENG: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܒ݂ܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܠܵܒ݂ܫܲܚ ܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Aykh dlweesh lan dmoeta dbarnasha ar'anaya, hadkha bit lawshakh dmoeta dbarnasha min shmaya.
ENG: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܒܸܣܪܵܐ ܘܕܸܡܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܝܵܪܬܝܼ ܡܲܠܟܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܵܪܹܬ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bemara ywin ilawkhoon akhoonwatee, bisra o dima le maṣee yartee malkoeta dalaha, o khrawa le yaret la kharwanoeta.
ENG: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

ASY: ܫܡܸܥܡܘܼܢ ܕܐܵܡܪܹܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܪܵܙܵܐ: ܟܠܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܡܟܲܚ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܟܠܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܹܐ،
TRL: Shmi'moen damrenawkhoon raza: klan le damkakh, eena klan bit payshakh shoekhlipe,
ENG: Behold, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

ASY: ܡܸܢܫܸܠܬܵܢܹܐ، ܒܛܲܪܦܲܛܬܵܐ ܕܥܲܝܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܵܚܝܵܐ ܩܲܪܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܵܪܵܝܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܲܪܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܵܚܝܵܐ ܘܒܸܬ ܩܵܝܡܝܼ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ، ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܹܐ.
TRL: Minshiltane, bṭarpaṭta d'ayna, eeman dmakhya qarna kharayta, sabab qarna bit makhya o bit qaymee meete dla khrawa, o akhnan bit payshakh shoekhlipe.
ENG: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab wale-ylaha daha kharwana labesh la kharwanoeta, o aha mayoota labesh la mayootoeta.
ENG: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܵܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܠܵܐ ܚܵܪܒ݂ܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ ܠܵܒܹܫ ܠܵܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܘܼܬܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܡܸܡܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܒܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܓ݂ܵܠܸܒܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman daha kharwana labesh la kharwanoeta, o aha mayoota labesh la mayootoeta. Haygah bit paesh toemima mindee dkteewa-yleh: peesh-leh blee'a mawta bghaliboeta.
ENG: But when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܓ݂ܵܠܸܒܘܼܬܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ؟ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܸܟܣܘܼܟ݂، ܝܵܐ ܩܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ؟
TRL: Ayka-ylaha ghaliboetoekh, ya mawta? Ayka-yleh niksoekh, ya qawra?
ENG: O death, where is thy victory? O death, where is thy sting?

ASY: ܢܸܟܣܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Niksa dmawta khṭeeta-yleh, o khayla dkhṭeeta namoosa-yleh.
ENG: The sting of death is sin; and the power of sin is the law:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܓ݂ܵܠܸܒܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Eena shakoere ywin lalaha dke yabil lan ghaliboeta byad Maran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: but thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈ ܡܘܼܚܸܒܹ̈ܐ، ܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܫܵܥܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܚܲܠܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܒܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܕܥܲܡܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܲܛܝܼܠܵܐ ܒܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha, akhoonwatee moekhibe, kleymoen qiwye o la sha'sheetoon, khaloene bkl zawna bpoelkhana dmarya, kad yad'eetoon d'amlawkhoon le-yleh baṭeela bmarya.
ENG: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not vain in the Lord.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܓ̰ܲܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܩܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܠܥܹܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܓܵܠܵܛܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Boet mindee djam'eetoon qa qadeeshe, 'woodoen oep akhtoon aykh dpqeed-lee l'edate dgaw galaṭeea.
ENG: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I gave order to the churches of Galatia, so also do ye.

ASY: ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܚܕܵܐ ܟܡܵܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܬܹܗ، ܘܚܲܡܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܓ̰ܵܡܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܙܘܼܙܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Byawma qamaya dshabta kl khad minawkhoon matiw khda kmayoeta dzoeze, aykh dpeesha-yleh yoewa qateh, o khame-laha lkis-leh deeman dateyn la hawya jama'ta dzoeze.
ENG: Upon the first day of the week let each one of you lay by him in store, as he may prosper, that no collections be made when I come.

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܵܛܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܐܸܓܲܪ̈ܝܵܬܹܐ ܠܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܲܒܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܠܲܒܠܝܼ ܕܒ݂ܵܚܝܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܐܘܿܪܸܫܠܸܡ.
TRL: Haygah eeman dmaṭeyn lkis lawkhoon bit yaben igaryate lnashe dgabeytoon-lhoon dlablee dwakhyatawkhoon loorishlim.
ENG: And when I arrive, whomsoever ye shall approve by letters, them will I send to carry your bounty unto Jerusalem:

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܚܵܫܚܵܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܙܠ݇ܝܼ ܥܲܡܝܼ.
TRL: O in khashkha doep ana azen, haygah anee bit azee 'amee.
ENG: and if it be meet for me to go also, they shall go with me.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܪ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܹܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Min bar d'awren min gaw maqedooneea, bit ateyn lkis lawkhoon, sabab har bit 'awren min gaw maqedooneea.
ENG: But I will come unto you, when I shall have passed through Macedonia; for I do pass through Macedonia;

ASY: ܩܵܘܡܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܢ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܸܢܹܗ ܣܸܬܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܘܗܲܝܸܪܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܒܣܵܦܵܪܝܼ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ݇ܢ.
TRL: Qawma payshen lkis lawkhoon qa khad zawna yan ma'birineh sitwa lkis lawkhoon, o hayireetoon-lee bsaparee layka dazen.
ENG: but with you it may be that I shall abide, or even winter, that ye may set me forward on my journey whithersoever I go.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܚܵܙܹܝܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܥܲܪܩܸܠܸܢ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܸܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab le ba'eyn dadeea qa mitkha kirya khazeynawkhoon kad bi'wara 'al oerkhee, sabab bhewee ywin d'arqilin qa khad zawna lkis lawkhoon, in Marya basma-leh.
ENG: For I do not wish to see you now by the way; for I hope to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܦܸܣܘܿܣ ܗܲܠ ܦܲܢܛܹܩܘܼܣܛܹܐ،
TRL: Eena bit payshen gaw apisoos hal panṭeqoesṭe,
ENG: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܩܵܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܐ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ، ܘܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab tar'a goera peesh-leh pteekha ilee qa poelkhana mare yoetrana, o dalqoewlaye raba yna.
ENG: for a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܙܵܕܹܥ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ.
TRL: In ate ṭeemateoos lkis lawkhoon khzeymoen dla zade' kma deeleh lkis lawkhoon, sabab biplakha-yleh lmarya aykh ana biplakha ywin.
ENG: Now if Timothy come, see that he be with you without fear; for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do:

ASY: ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܲܣܠܹܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ. ܡܲܦܫܸܛܘܼܢ ܠܹܗ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܹܗ ܝܘܸܢ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: nasha la masle ileh. Mapshiṭoen-leh bshlama date lkis-lee, sabab bispareh ywin 'am akhoonwate.
ENG: let no man therefore despise him. But set him forward on his journey in peace, that he may come unto me: for I expect him with the brethren.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܲܢ ܐܵܦܲܠܘܿ، ܪܵܒܵܐ ܦܘܼܪܦܸܠ ܠܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܲܡ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܲܪ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Boet akhoonan apaloo, raba poerpil-lee bee-eh date lkis lawkhoon 'am akhoonwate, eena har la b'e-leh date wa, eena adeea bit ate eeman dhawe-leh 'dana.
ENG: But as touching Apollos the brother, I besought him much to come unto you with the brethren: and it was not at all his will to come now; but he will come when he shall have opportunity.

ASY: ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܪܥܝܼܫܹܐ ܘܟܠܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ. ܗܘܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܸܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܲܠܸܢܘܼܢ.
TRL: Hweymoen r'eeshe o kleymoen qiwye bhaymanoeta. Hweymoen libane o khalinoen.
ENG: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

ASY: ܥܒ݂ܘܿܕܘܼܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܫܘܼܠܵܢܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܚܘܼܒܵܐ.
TRL: 'woodoen klayhy shoelanawkhoon bkhoeba.
ENG: Let all that ye do be done in love.

ASY: ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܲܐ. ܐܵܢܝܼ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܠܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ke yad'eetoon, akhoonwatee, nashe dbayta disṭapana. Anee qamaye ywaw dhoeminhoon gaw akhaeea, o moetiw-lhoon ganayhy lkhilmat dqadeeshe.
ENG: Now I beseech you, brethren (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have set themselves to minister unto the saints),

ASY: ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܫܵܠܡܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ، ܘܠܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܗܲܝܸܪ ܘܦܵܠܹܚ ܥܲܡܲܢ.
TRL: Parpoele ywin beeawkhoon dshalmeetoon lhadkha nashe, o lkl man dhayir o palekh 'aman.
ENG: that ye also be in subjection unto such, and to every one that helpeth in the work and laboureth.

ASY: ܚܕܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܣܛܲܦܵܢܲܐ ܘܦܲܪܛܘܼܢܵܛܘܿܣ ܘܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܩܘܿܣ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܠܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Khde-lee dte-lhoon isṭapana o parṭoenaṭoos o akhaeeqoos, sabab anee mle-lhoon baṣooroeta deeawkhoon.
ENG: And I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they supplied.

ASY: ܡܘܼܢܝܸܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܪܘܼܚܝܼ ܘܠܪܘܼܚܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܡܝܲܩܪܘܼܢ ܠܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Moenyikh-lhoon lroekhee o lroekhawkhoon. Myaqroen lhadkha nashe.
ENG: For they refreshed my spirit and yours: acknowledge ye therefore them that are such.

ASY: ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܥܹܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ. ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܩܸܠܘܿܣ ܘܦܪܝܼܣܩܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܲܝܬܲܝܗܝ ܒܝܼܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܡܵܪܲܢ.
TRL: Beeawa yna shlama ilawkhoon 'edate dgaw aseea. Oep aqiloos o preesqila 'am 'edta dgaw baytayhy beeawa yna shlama raba ilawkhoon bmaran.
ENG: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Prisca salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܲܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܕܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ. ܗܲܒ݂݇ܠܘܼܢ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܢܫܘܼܩܬܵܐ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: Klayhy akhoonwate lakha bidraya yna shlama ilawkhoon. Haloen shlama khad lhaw khena bnshoeqta qadeeshta.
ENG: All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

ASY: ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܒܸܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܝܼ.
TRL: Ana pawloos biktawa ywin aha shlama beeda dganee.
ENG: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.

ASY: ܡ̇ܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܲܚܸܒ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܘܼܚܪܸܡܵܐ. ܡܵܪܲܢ ܐܸܬ݂ܵܐ.
TRL: Man dla makhib lmaran eeshoo' msheekha hawe moekhrima. Maran it݂ܵ.
ENG: If any man loveth not the Lord, let him be anathema. Maranatha.

ASY: ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Shapaqat dmaran eeshoo' msheekha 'amawkhoon.
ENG: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

ASY: ܚܘܼܒܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ. ܐܵܡܹܝܢ.
TRL: Khoebee 'am klawkhoon beeshoo' msheekha. Ameyn.
ENG: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.

ASY: ܦܵܘܠܘܿܣ ܫܠܝܼܚܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܵܐ، ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܩܘܿܪܲܢܬܘܿܣ، ܘܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܟ݂ܵܐܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Pawloos shleekha deeshoo' msheekha bṣiwyana dalaha, o ṭeemateoos akhoona, l'edta dalaha gaw qoorantoos, o lklayhy qadeeshe deena bklaha akhaeea.
ENG: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in the whole of Achaia:

ASY: ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܘܫܠܵܡܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܵܒܲܢ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Shapaqat o shlama ilawkhoon min Alaha baban o min Maran eeshoo' msheekha.
ENG: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܒܵܒܵܐ ܕܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ،
TRL: Mboerkha-yleh Alaha o baba dmaran eeshoo' msheekha, baba drakhme o Alaha dklaha yabalta dliba,
ENG: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort;

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܲܢ̈، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܝܲܕ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܓܵܢܲܢ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Haw dke yabil lan liba gaw klayhy oelṣanan, doep akhnan maṣakh yabakh liba lanee deena gaw klayhy oelṣane, byad yabalta dliba dakhnan bganan qaboele ywakh min Alaha.
ENG: who comforteth us in all our affliction, that we may be able to comfort them that are in any affliction, through the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܟܹܐ ܙܵܝܕܝܼ ܓܵܘܲܢ ܚܲܫܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܙܵܝܕܵܐ ܓܵܘܲܢ.
TRL: Sabab dakhee dke zaydee gawan khashe dmsheekha, hadkha oep yabalta dliba byad msheekha ke zayda gawan.
ENG: For as the sufferings of Christ abound unto us, even so our comfort also aboundeth through Christ.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ. ܘܐܸܢ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܹܐ ܠܸܒܵܐ، ܕܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܲܚ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ.
TRL: In payshakh moelyiṣe, boet khatir dyabalta dliba ilawkhoon o poerqanawkhoon ke payshakh moelyiṣe. O in payshakh yoebe liba, boet khatir deeawkhoon ke payshakh yoebe liba, dhawya beeawkhoon khmalta gaw oelṣane doep akhnan bee-ayhy ke payshakh moelyiṣe.
ENG: But whether we be afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation; or whether we be comforted, it is for your comfort, which worketh in the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer:

ASY: ܘܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܲܢ̈، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: O hewee-an boet deeawkhoon qweeta-ylaha, sabab ke yad'akh aykh deetoon shareeke boelṣanan, hadkha shareeke ytoon oep byabalta dliba ilan.
ENG: and our hope for you is stedfast; knowing that, as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so also are ye of the comfort.

ASY: ܒܵܥܲܚ ܕܝܵܕܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܲܢ̈، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܕܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܣܝܼܵܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܝܠܲܢ، ܗܲܠ ܕܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܲܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Ba'akh dyad'eetoon, akhoonwatan, boet oelṣana dtpeeq-leh bee-an gaw aseea, deewa zawda min khaylan, hal dqṭee' lan hewee-an oep min khaye,
ENG: For we would not have you ignorant, brethren, concerning our affliction which befell us in Asia, that we were weighed down exceedingly, beyond our power, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

ASY: ܘܪܥܝܼܫ ܠܲܢ ܒܠܸܒܲܢ ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܩܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܵܪܲܚ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O r'eesh lan bliban ldyanta dmawta, qa dla darakh hewee-an 'al ganan ila 'al Alaha dke maqim meete.
ENG: yea, we ourselves have had the answer of death within ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܦܲܨܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܲܢ. ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܠܲܢ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ،
TRL: Haw dqam paṣe lan min mawta hadkha goera, o bit pariq lan. Eet lan hewee bee-eh dbit pariq lan mindrish,
ENG: who delivered us out of so great a death, and will deliver: on whom we have set our hope that he will also still deliver us;

ASY: ܒܗܵܝܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܨܠܵܘܵܬܵܘ̈ܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܢ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܟܪܝܼ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܥܲܠ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܒܨܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhayarta dṣlawatawkhoon boet dee-an. Haygah raba bit shakree lalaha boet dee-an 'al mawhawta dpeeshta-ylaha yoebilta ilan bṣlawate draba nashe.
ENG: ye also helping together on our behalf by your supplication; that, for the gift bestowed upon us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on our behalf.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܲܢ: ܐܸܢܝܲܬܲܢ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܕܝܼܪܲܢ ܓܵܘ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܒܩܲܕܝܼܫܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܡܗܘܼܡܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܚܸܟ݂ܡܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܝܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Aha-yleh shoewharan: inyatan bishada-ylaha dkhdeeran gaw 'alma, o boesh zawda lkis lawkhoon, bqadeeshoeta o bmhoemnoeta dmin Alaha, la bkhikhmta nashayta ila bshapaqat dalaha.
ENG: For our glorying is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God, we behaved ourselves in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܵܨܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܵܪܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܝܲܢ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ. ܘܐܝܼܬ ܠܝܼ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܪܡܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Le ywakh biktawa ilawkhoon mindee shwooq min haw dmaṣeytoon qareytoon yan parmeytoon. O eet-lee hewee dbkharta bit parmeytoon bmilyoeta,
ENG: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or even acknowledge, and I hope ye will acknowledge unto the end:

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܘܼܪܡܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ، ܕܫܵܩܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܒܸܬ ܫܵܩܠܲܚ ܫܘܼܒ݂ܗܵܪܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Aykh dpoerme lawkhoon ilan khacha, dshaqleetoon shoewhara bee-an dakhee doep akhnan bit shaqlakh shoewhara beeawkhoon byawma dmaran eeshoo'.
ENG: as also ye did acknowledge us in part, that we are your glorying, even as ye also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܵܬܸܪܓ̰ܲܡܥ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܒܘܼܪܟܹܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ.
TRL: Sabab khatirjam' eewin baha, o hadkha b'e-lee dateyn wa lkis lawkhoon qamayta dpaysheetoon waw mboerke gaha dtartey.
ENG: And in this confidence I was minded to come before unto you, that ye might have a second benefit;

ASY: ܒܥܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܪܚܝܼ ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ، ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܕܵܝܪܹܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܵܡܵܐ، ܘܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܡܲܦܫܸܛܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܝܼ ܠܝܼܗܘܼܕ.
TRL: B'e-lee dateyn lkis lawkhoon boerkhee lmaqedooneea, o mindrish dayren lkis lawkhoon min tama, o haygah mapshiṭeetoon-lee leehoed.
ENG: and by you to pass into Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come unto you, and of you to be set forward on my journey unto Judaea.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܛܵܥܬܵܐ، ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܬܲܚܡܲܢܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ؟ ܝܲܢ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܘܐܵܡܪܹܢ، ”ܗܹܐ، ܗܹܐ، ܘܠܵܐ، ܠܵܐ؟“
TRL: Kad bi'wada ywin wa qṭa'ta, bikhshawa ytoon dla takhmanta 'weed-lee? Yan 'weed-lee aykh dnashe 'almaye ke 'awdee o amren, ”he, he, o la, la?“
ENG: When I therefore was thus minded, did I shew fickleness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be the yea yea and the nay nay?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܲܢ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ”ܗܹܐ ܘܠܵܐ.“
TRL: Eena dakhee dalaha mhoemna-yleh, hemizmanan ilawkhoon le ywa ”he o la.“
ENG: But as God is faithful, our word toward you is not yea and nay.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܝܼ ܘܒܣܸܠܘܵܢܘܿܣ ܘܒܛܝܼܡܵܬܹܐܘܿܣ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ”ܗܹܐ ܘܠܵܐ،“ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ”ܗܹܐ“ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab broona dalaha, eeshoo' msheekha, dpeesha ywa moekriza ilawkhoon beeee o bsilwanoos o bṭeemateoos le ywa ”he o la,“ ila bee-eh-ylaha ”he“ bkl zawna.
ENG: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timothy, was not yea and nay, but in him is yea.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܝܼܢܵܐ ”ܗܹܐ،“ ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ ”ܐܵܡܹܝܢ“ ܠܫܘܼܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab klayhy qawle dalaha bee-eh eena ”he,“ o boet aha ke amrakh ”ameyn“ lshoewkha dalaha.
ENG: For how many soever be the promises of God, in him is the yea: wherefore also through him is the Amen, unto the glory of God through us.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܲܩܘܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܩܲܡ ܡܵܫܹܚ ܠܲܢ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Haw dke maqwe lan 'amawkhoon o qam mashekh lan bmsheekha, Alaha-yleh.
ENG: Now he that stablisheth us with you in Christ, and anointed us, is God;

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܚܵܬܡܹܗ ܥܲܠܲܢ، ܘܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܪܘܼܚܹܗ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܪܲܗܒ݂ܘܿܢܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܢ.
TRL: O moetiw-leh khatmeh 'alan, o yoebil-leh ilan roekheh dhawe rahwoona gaw liban.
ENG: who also sealed us, and gave us the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

ASY: ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܩܪܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܓܵܢܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܒܵܥܹܝܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܵܣܟܹܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܬܲܥܠܲܡܬܵܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܪܝܼ ܠܩܘܿܪܲܢܬܘܿܣ.
TRL: Ana biqraya ywin lalaha sahda 'al ganee, sabab ke ba'eyn wa khasken wa lawkhoon min ta'lamta, boet aha la deeree lqoorantoos.
ENG: But I call God for a witness upon my soul, that to spare you I forbare to come unto Corinth.

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܵܥܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܫܘܼܠܛܵܢܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܦܵܠܚܲܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: La sabab ba'akh waw d'awdakh waw shoelṭana 'al haymanoetawkhoon, eena dpalkhakh waw 'amawkhoon lkhadoetawkhoon, sabab biklaya ytoon qiwye bhaymanoetawkhoon.
ENG: Not that we have lordship over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܩܛܝܼܥ ܠܝܼ ܒܠܸܒܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܐ،
TRL: Hadkha, qṭee' lee blibee dla ateyn lkis lawkhoon khda gaha kheta bpashamta,
ENG: But I determined this for myself, that I would not come again to you with sorrow.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܡܲܦܫܸܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܡܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܚܕܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܦܫܸܡ ܠܝܼ؟
TRL: Sabab in ana mapshiminawkhoon, manee bit makhde-lee shwooq min haw dmoepshim-lee?
ENG: For if I make you sorry, who then is he that maketh me glad, but he that is made sorry by me?

ASY: ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܵܬܹܝܢ ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܹܢ ܡܘܼܦܫܸܡܵܐ ܒܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܚܕܝܼ ܠܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܵܬܸܪܓ̰ܲܡܥ ܝܼܘܸܢ ܕܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܫܲܪܸܟܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܝܼ.
TRL: Kteew-lee aha mindee sabab eeman dateyn dla payshen moepshima banee dwale-ylaha dmakhdee-lee, sabab khatirjam' eewin dklawkhoon bit sharikeetoon bkhadoetee.
ENG: And I wrote this very thing, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.

ASY: ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܒܡܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܘܒܪܵܒܵܐ ܕܸܡ̈ܥܹܐ، ܠܵܐ ܕܡܲܦܫܸܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܕܡܲܕܥܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܟܡܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܝܼ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Kteew-lee ilawkhoon boelṣana goera o bmareeroeta dliba o braba dim'e, la dmapshiminawkhoon ila dmad'inawkhoon kma khoebee raba-yleh ilawkhoon.
ENG: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be made sorry, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܘܝܼܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܡܘܼܦܫܸܡܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܓܲܪܘܸܣܸܢܹܗ ܚܲܒܪܵܐ، ܒܚܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܡܘܼܦܫܸܡܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܟܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Eena in khad hweea-yleh 'ilta dpashamta, le-yleh ilee moepshima, ila, dla garwisineh khabra, bkhda oerkha, moepshima-yleh lklawkhoon.
ENG: But if any hath caused sorrow, he hath caused sorrow, not to me, but in part (that I press not too heavily) to you all.

ASY: ܒܲܣܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܲܥܠܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܪܵܒܵܐ.
TRL: Basa-ylaha ileh ta'lamta dkhad hadkha nasha byad raba.
ENG: Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many;

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܒܠܝܼܥܵܐ ܒܦܵܫܲܡܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ.
TRL: Min geba daha wale-ylaha dpakhleetoon o yaweetoon liba lkhad hadkha nasha, dla paesh blee'a bpashamta boesh zawda.
ENG: so that contrariwise ye should rather forgive him and comfort him, lest by any means such a one should be swallowed up with his overmuch sorrow.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܲܪܦܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܕܡܲܩܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܝܼܹܗ ܚܘܼܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Boet aha parpoele ywin dmaqweytoon bee-eh khoebawkhoon.
ENG: Wherefore I beseech you to confirm your love toward him.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܝܼ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܕܓ̰ܲܪܒܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܐܸܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܨܝܸܬܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ.
TRL: Oep sabab aha kteew-lee ilawkhoon, djarbinawkhoon din bit haweytoon maṣyitane bkl mindee.
ENG: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye are obedient in all things.

ASY: ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܦܲܚܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܲܚܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܘܼܚܠܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ‐‐ܐܸܢ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܦܲܚܘܼܠܹܐ‐‐ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Lman dakhtoon pakhleetoon, oep ana pakhoele ywin. Sabab mindee dana poekhla ywin‐‐in eet wa mindee lpakhoele‐‐'weeda ywin boet deeawkhoon qam pata dmsheekha.
ENG: But to whom ye forgive anything, I forgive also: for what I also have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, for your sakes have I forgiven it in the person of Christ;

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܥܵܒܹܕ ܠܹܐܒܹ̈ܐ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܣܵܛܵܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܲܚ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܲܢܕܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Dla 'abed lebe ilan saṭana, sabab ke yad'akh-lhoon pandoehy.
ENG: that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܠܛܪܘܿܐܘܿܣ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܬܲܪܥܵܐ،
TRL: Eeman dte-lee lṭroooos makroeze ewangaleeoon dmsheekha, Marya pteekh-leh ilee tar'a,
ENG: Now when I came to Troas for the gospel of Christ, and when a door was opened unto me in the Lord,

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸܥܝܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܸܠܝܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܸܚ ܠܝܼ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܝܼ ܛܸܛܘܿܣ ܬܵܡܵܐ. ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ، ”ܦܘܼܫܘܼܢ ܒܫܲܝܢܵܐ،“ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܠܡܵܩܹܕܘܿܢܝܼܵܐ.
TRL: Eena ri'yanee le ywa shilya, sabab la moechikh-lee akhoonee ṭiṭoos tama. Haygah meeree ilayhy, ”poeshoen bshayna,“ o zeel-lee lmaqedooneea.
ENG: I had no relief for my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went forth into Macedonia.

ASY: ܫܲܟܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܘܸܢ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܓ݂ܵܠܸܒܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܓܵܠܹܐ ܒܝܼܲܢ ܪܹܝܚܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܹܗ ܒܟܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ.
TRL: Shakoere ywin lalaha dke yabil lan ghaliboeta bmsheekha bkl 'dana, o ke gale bee-an reykha dda'teh bkl doeka.
ENG: But thanks be unto God, which always leadeth us in triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest through us the savour of his knowledge in every place.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܪܹܝܚܵܐ ܒܲܣܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܪܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab reykha baseema dmsheekha ywakh lkis Alaha, lanee dpreeqe yna o lanee dbiṭlaqa yna.
ENG: For we are a sweet savour of Christ unto God, in them that are being saved, and in them that are perishing;

ASY: ܠܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܪܹܝܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܘܠܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܪܹܝܚܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ. ܘܡܵܢܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܠܵܐ؟
TRL: Lkhakma reykha dmawta ywakh lmawta, o lkhene reykha dkhaye lkhaye. O manee-yleh khsheekha-laha shoela?
ENG: to the one a savour from death unto death; to the other a savour from life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܕܚܵܒ݂ܛܝܼ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡܲܚ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܡܗܘܼܡܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܕܪܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Le ywakh maykh raba khene dkhawṭee-laha hemizman dalaha, ila bmsheekha ke hamzimakh qam Alaha bmhoemnoeta, aykh nashe shoedre min Alaha.
ENG: For we are not as the many, corrupting the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God, speak we in Christ.

ASY: ܫܲܪܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܠܸܚܩܵܪܵܐ ܓܵܢܲܢ؟ ܝܲܢ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܕܐܸܓܲܪ̈ܝܵܬܹܐ ܕܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܟܬܝܼܒܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܲܢ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؟
TRL: Sharakh mindrish likhqara ganan? Yan sneeqe ywakh aykh nashe khene, digaryate dkhiqra payshee kteebe ilawkhoon yan minawkhoon?
ENG: Are we beginning again to commend ourselves? or need we, as do some, epistles of commendation to you or from you?

ASY: ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܲܢ، ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܸܒܲܢ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܬܵܐ ܘܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: Akhtoon eetoon igartan, peeshta kteewta 'al liban, hay dpeeshta-ylaha dee'ta o qreeta bkl nasha.
ENG: Ye are our epistle, written in our hearts, known and read of all men;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܝ݇ܕܝܼܥܹܐ ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܐܸܓܲܪܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬܲܢ، ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܒܸܕܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܘܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐܦܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܸܒܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܣܪܵܐ.
TRL: Peeshe ytoon dee'e dakhtoon eetoon igarta min msheekha, ṭ'oenta dkhilmatan, peeshta kteewta, la bbidyoeta ila broekha dalaha khaya, la 'al loekhe dkepa ila 'al libawate dbisra.
ENG: being made manifest that ye are an epistle of Christ, ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in tables that are hearts of flesh.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha hewee eet lan bmsheekha lkis Alaha.
ENG: And such confidence have we through Christ to God-ward:

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܚܵܫܒܲܚ ܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܓܵܢܲܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܨܵܝܬܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇،
TRL: La khashbakh dakhnan ke maṣakh 'awdakh mindee bganan, eena mṣaytan min Alaha-ylaha,
ENG: not that we are sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God;

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܲܡ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܡܨܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܒܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܒܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܛܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܚܹܐ.
TRL: Haw dqam yabil lan mṣayta li'wada khilmat bwa'da khata, la bkteewta ila broekha, sabab kteewta ke qaṭla eena roekha ke makhe.
ENG: who also made us sufficient as ministers of a new covenant; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܢܩܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܒܐܵܬܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܠ ܠܘܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐܦܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗ̇ܘ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ،
TRL: In khilmat dmoete-laha mawta, dpeeshta ywa nqeerta batwate 'al loekhe dkepa, hwe-laha bkhiqra, dakhee dbnay eesrayel la mṣe-lhoon likhyara 'al pata dmoeshe boet haw khiqra, oep in dkhiqra 'awrana ywa,
ENG: But if the ministration of death, written, and engraven on stones, came with glory, so that the children of Israel could not look stedfastly upon the face of Moses for the glory of his face; which glory was passing away:

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ!
TRL: Hadkha kma boesh zawda khilmat droekha bit hawya boesh bkhiqra!
ENG: how shall not rather the ministration of the spirit be with glory?

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ!
TRL: In khilmat dmoete-laha dyanta hwe-laha bkhiqra, kma boesh zawda bkhiqra bit hawya khilmat dmoete-laha zadeeqoeta!
ENG: For if the ministration of condemnation is glory, much rather doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܒܥܲܝܢܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܵܪܹܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab haw dpeesha ywa yoewa bkhiqra, adeea layt-leh khiqra b'ayna dhaw deeleh boesh mare khiqra.
ENG: For verily that which hath been made glorious hath not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasseth.

ASY: ܘܐܸܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܢܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܒܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܦܵܝܫܵܢܵܐ!
TRL: O in 'awrana hadkha hwe-leh bkhiqra, kma boesh zawda bit hawe bkhiqra haw deeleh payshana!
ENG: For if that which passeth away was with glory, much more that which remaineth is in glory.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ، ܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܓܘܼܪܬܵܐ ܡܲܦܠܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ.
TRL: Kad eet lan aha hewee, joerat goerta maploekhe ywakh.
ENG: Having therefore such a hope, we use great boldness of speech,

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܕܡܘܼܟܣܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܵܬܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܝܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܥܲܠ ܫܲܦ̮ܩܵܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Le ywakh aykh moeshe dmoeksa-leh pateh dla khayree waw bnay eesrayel 'al shawqa 'awrana.
ENG: and are not as Moses, who put a veil upon his face, that the children of Israel should not look stedfastly on the end of that which was passing away:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܪܸ̈ܥܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܣܸܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܲܠ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܟܲܣܵܝܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܘܿܪܵܝܬܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ. ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܲܣܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena ri'yanayhy simye ywaw sabab hal idyoom yawma hay kasayta ke paysha eeman doorayta paysha qreeta. Aha kasayta le-ylaha peeshta shqeelta, sabab akhchee bmsheekha ke paysha shqeelta.
ENG: but their minds were hardened: for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remaineth unlifted; which veil is done away in Christ.

ASY: ܗܲܠ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ، ܟܲܣܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܠ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Hal idyoom yawma eeman dnamoosa dmoeshe ke paesh qirya, kasayta dreeta-ylaha 'al libayhy.
ENG: But unto this day, whensoever Moses is read, a veil lieth upon their heart.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܟܸܣ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠܬܵܐ ܟܲܣܵܝܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dnasha minayhy daer lkis Marya, ke paysha shqeelta kasayta.
ENG: But whensoever it shall turn to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

ASY: ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܬܵܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܚܹܐܪܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Marya roekha-yleh, o ayka deeleh roekha dmarya tama eet kheroeta.
ENG: Now the Lord is the Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

ASY: ܘܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܟܠܲܢ ܒܦܵܬܵܐ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܒܢܵܘܪܵܐ، ܘܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܘܼܚܠܸܦܹܐ ܠܕܡܘܼܬܹܗ، ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܠܚܸܩܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܐܵܬܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: O akhnan klan bpata gleeta khiqra dmarya makhzoeye ywakh aykh bnawra, o pyasha ywakh shoekhlipe ldmoeteh, min khiqra lkhiqra, haw dke ate min Marya, haw deeleh roekha.
ENG: But we all, with unveiled face reflecting as a mirror the glory of the Lord, are transformed into the same image from glory to glory, even as from the Lord the Spirit.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܒܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܣܵܩܕܲܚ.
TRL: Hadkha, kad eet lan aha khilmat brakhme dalaha, le saqdakh.
ENG: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, even as we obtained mercy, we faint not:

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܘܼܗ̇، ܪܘܼܦܝܲܝ ܝܘܲܚ ܫܘܼܠܹ̈ܐ ܛܸܫܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ. ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܸܚܕܵܪܵܐ ܒܦܸܠܡܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܡܲܦܟ̰ܘܼܠܹܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܫܲܪܝܼܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܫܝܼܛܬܵܐ ܡܲܚܫܘܼܚܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܓܵܢܲܢ ܠܐܸܢܝܲܬ ܕܟܠ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Min geboeha, roepyay ywakh shoele ṭishye dnkheepta. Le ywakh bikhdara bpilma, o la mapchoele hemizman dalaha, ila bshareeroeta psheeṭta makhshoekhe ywakh ganan linyat dkl nasha qam Alaha.
ENG: but we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܡܘܼܟܣܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܲܢ، ܡܘܼܟܣܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ،
TRL: O oep in moeksa-yleh ewangaleeoon dee-an, moeksa-yleh lanee dbiṭlaqa yna,
ENG: But and if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled in them that are perishing:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܡܘܼܣܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܪܸ̈ܥܝܵܢܹܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܡܸܢܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܝܼ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܕܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab Alaha daha 'alma moesme-leh ri'yane dla haminane, dla khazee bahra dewangaleeoon dkhiqra dmsheekha, haw deeleh dmoeta dmarya Alaha.
ENG: in whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of the unbelieving, that the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not dawn upon them.

ASY: ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܵܢܲܢ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡܲܟܪܘܼܙܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܕܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܝܼܘܲܚ ܪܹ̈ܓܵܘܵܬܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ.
TRL: Akhnan le ywakh makroeze boet ganan, ila makroeze ywakh deeshoo' msheekha eeleh Marya, o dakhnan eewakh regawate ilawkhoon boet khatir deeshoo'.
ENG: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus’ sake.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܫܟܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܙܵܪܹܩ،“ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܙܵܪܹܩ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܢ، ܕܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ ܕܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܬܸܫܒܘܿܚܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܦܵܬܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab Alaha dmeereh, ”min khishka bahra zareq,“ 'weed-leh bahra dzareq gaw liban, dyabil bahra dda'ta dtishbookhta dalaha bpata dmsheekha.
ENG: Seeing it is God, that said, Light shall shine out of darkness, who shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܣܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܕܐܵܗܵܐ ܓܲܢ݇ܒܵܪܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܢ.
TRL: Eena eet lan aha seemta bmane dṭeena lmakhzoeye daha gabaroeta dkhayla min Alaha-ylaha o la minan.
ENG: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God, and not from ourselves;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܓܹܒܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܛܒ݂ܝܼܚܹܐ. ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܚܒ݂ܝܼܛܹܐ ܒܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܢ̈، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܩܛܝܼܥܘܼܗ̇ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ،
TRL: Peeshe ywakh moelyiṣe min kl geba, eena le ywakh ṭweekhe. Peeshe ywakh khweeṭe bkhoeshaban, eena le ywakh qṭee'oeha hewee-an,
ENG: we are pressed on every side, yet not straitened; perplexed, yet not unto despair;

ASY: ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܟܘܼܡܪܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܘܼܢܦܸܠܹܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܛܠܝܼܩܹܐ.
TRL: Peeshe ywakh koemre, eena le ywakh peeshe shweeqe, peeshe ywakh moenpile, eena le ywakh ṭleeqe.
ENG: pursued, yet not forsaken; smitten down, yet not destroyed;

ASY: ܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܛܥܝܼܢܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܲܢ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܲܢ.
TRL: Kl zawna ṭ'eene ywakh bpaghran mawta deeshoo', doep khaye deeshoo' payshee khizye bpaghran.
ENG: always bearing about in the body the dying of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our body.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܝܼܘܲܚ ܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܒܟܠ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܣܘܼܦܝܹܐ ܠܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܵܬܸܪ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܓܵܘ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܲܢ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab akhnan deewakh khaye, bkl 'dana pyasha ywakh soepye lmawta boet khatir deeshoo', dpayshee khizye khaye deeshoo' gaw paghran mayoota.
ENG: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus’ sake, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our mortal flesh.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܝܼܲܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܦܠܵܚܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Hadkha mawta biplakha-yleh bee-an, eena khaye biplakha yna beeawkhoon.
ENG: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

ASY: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ: ܗܘܼܡܸܢܝܼ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܝܼ، ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܲܢ، ܘܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܲܢ.
TRL: Aykh deeleh kteewa: hoeminee, o boet aha hoemzim-lee, oep akhnan har bhaw roekha dhaymanoeta hoeminan, o boet aha hoemzim lan.
ENG: But having the same spirit of faith, according to that which is written, I believed, and therefore did I speak; we also believe, and therefore also we speak;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ، ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܡܵܪܲܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܥܲܡ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܘܒܸܬ ܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܲܢ ܥܲܡܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܟܸܣ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab beeda'a ywakh, dhaw dmoeqim-leh lmaran eeshoo' min gaw meete bit maqim oep ilan 'am eeshoo', o bit maqriw lan 'amawkhoon lkis-leh.
ENG: knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also with Jesus, and shall present us with you.

ASY: ܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ ܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇، ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܙܝܵܕܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ، ܡܲܙܝܸܕܵܐ ܫܵܟܲܪܬܵܐ ܠܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Klaha aha lyoetrana deeawkhoon eelaha, dshapaqat deelaha bizyada gaw nashe raba, mazyida shakarta lkhiqra dalaha.
ENG: For all things are for your sakes, that the grace, being multiplied through the many, may cause the thanksgiving to abound unto the glory of God.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܣܵܩܕܲܚ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܒܲܪܢܵܫܲܢ ܒܲܪܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܚܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܲܢ ܓܵܘܵܝܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܘܼܕܸܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ،
TRL: Boet aha la saqdakh, apin dbarnashan baraya bikhrawa-yleh, eena barnashan gawaya pyasha-yleh khoedita yawma byawma,
ENG: Wherefore we faint not; but though our outward man is decaying, yet our inward man is renewed day by day.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܲܢ ܩܲܠܘܼܠܵܐ ܘܥܵܒ݂ܘܿܪܵܐ ܗܲܕܘܼܪܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܥܵܠܡܝܼܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܙܵܐܹܕ ܒܪܲܒܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab oelṣanan qaloela o 'awoora hadoere-yleh ilan khiqra 'almeenaya dzaed braboeta.
ENG: For our light affliction, which is for the moment, worketh for us more and more exceedingly an eternal weight of glory;

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܓܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ ܥܵܠܡܝܼܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha le ywakh gashoeqe lmindeeane dpyasha yna khizye ila lanee dle yna pyasha khizye, sabab mindeeane dke payshee khizye zawnanaye yna, eena anee dle payshee khizye 'almeenaye yna.
ENG: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.
