ENG: For indeed we have had good tidings preached unto us, even as also they: but the word of hearing did not profit them, because they were not united by faith with them that heard.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܗܘܼܡܸܢܲܢ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܲܚ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܓܵܘ ܟܲܪܒܝܼ، ”ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܢܝܵܚܬܝܼ،“ ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܹܐ.
TRL: Eena akhnan dhoeminan 'awrakh lhay nyakhta, dakhee dmeereh: aykh dme-lee gaw karbee, ”le 'awree lnyakhtee,“ apin dpoelkhanoehy ha min shoeraya dbreeta peeshe yna moekmile.
ENG: For we which have believed do enter into that rest; even as he hath said, As I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ: ܢܝܼܚ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܒܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab bkhda doeka hadkha meereh boet yawma dshabta: neekh-leh Alaha min klayhy poelkhanoehy byawma dshabta.
ENG: For he hath said somewhere of the seventh day on this wise, And God rested on the seventh day from all his works;

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܗܲܪ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܠܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܢܝܵܚܬܝܼ.
TRL: Mindrish har bhay doeka meereh: le 'awree lnyakhtee.
ENG: and in this place again, They shall not enter into my rest.

ASY: ܒܟܠܵܗ̇ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܠܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܹܘܲܢܓܲܠܝܼܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܟܪܸܙܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Bklaha aha khakma hesh bit 'awree lnyakhta, eena anee dewangaleeoon peesh-leh moekriza ilayhy la 'weerhoon sabab la moeṣyit-lhoon.
ENG: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some should enter thereinto, and they to whom the good tidings were before preached failed to enter in because of disobedience,

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܪܫܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܕܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ”ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ،“ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܝܲܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܼܡܙܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܵܘܝܼܕ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ: ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܐܸܢ ܫܵܡܥܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܩܵܠܹܗ، ܠܵܐ ܡܲܩܫܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܸܒܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Mindrish Alaha rsheem-leh khad yawma khena, dqre-leh ”idyoom yawma,“ eeman dmin bar khad zawna yareekha hoemzim-leh byad daweed aykh dmeereh qamayta: idyoom in sham'eetoon qaleh, la maqsheytoon libawkhoon.
ENG: he again defineth a certain day, saying in David, after so long a time, Today, as it hath been before said, Today if ye shall hear his voice, Harden not your hearts.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܲܪ ܢܘܿܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ، ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܗܲܡܙܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܕ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab in eeshoo' bar noon hawe wa yoewa ilayhy nyakhta, Alaha le hamzim wa min bar hada boet khad yawma khena.
ENG: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܐܝܼܬ ܫܲܒܬܵܐ ܕܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Bas eet shabta dnyakhta lṭayipa dalaha.
ENG: There remaineth therefore a sabbath rest for the people of God.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܥܵܒܹܪ ܠܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܢܝܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܘܼܢܝܸܚ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Hadkha man d'aber lnyakhta dalaha moenyikh-leh oep min poelkhanoehy, aykh dalaha moenyikh-leh min poelkhanoehy.
ENG: For he that is entered into his rest hath himself also rested from his works, as God did from his.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܦܛܲܚ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܢܝܵܚܬܵܐ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܢܵܦܹܠ ܒܫܩܵܠܬܵܐ ܕܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܥܵܨܝܼܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ.
TRL: Boet aha khapṭakh li'wara lhay nyakhta, doep khad la napel bshqalta dṭoewsa min 'aṣeeoeta danee.
ENG: Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, that no man fall after the same example of disobedience.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܚܲܝܠܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܚܲܪܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܣܲܝܦܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܦܘܼܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܦܪܵܫܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܵܐ ܘܕܪܘܼܚܵܐ، ܘܕܘܲܪ̈ܝܼܕܹܐ ܘܕܡܘܼܚܵܐ ܘܕܓܲܪ̈ܡܹܐ، ܘܟܹܐ ܕܵܝܢܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܘܪܸ̈ܥܝܵܢܹܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab khayta-ylaha hemizman dalaha o khaylanta-ylaha, o boesh khareepta-ylaha min kl saypa dtrey poemane. Ke 'awra hal prashta dgana o droekha, o dwareede o dmoekha o dgarme, o ke dayna khoeshabe o ri'yane dliba.
ENG: For the word of God is living, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword, and piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and quick to discern the thoughts and intents of the heart.

ASY: ܘܠܲܝܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܸܪܝܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܛܸܫܝܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ؛ ܐܸܠܵܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܘܼܠܚܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܘܓܸܠܝܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܲܝܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܓ̰ܘܼܘܵܒ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O layt mindee birya dhawe ṭishya mineh; ila klayhy mindeeane shoelkhaye yna o gilye qam 'ayne dhaw dbit yabakh joewab ileh.
ENG: And there is no creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܒܡܵܘܕܵܝܬܲܢ.
TRL: Bas kad eet lan goera dkahne 'ilaya, haw d'weereh lshmaya, eeshoo' broona dalaha, shwooq dawqakh qiwye bmawdaytan.
ENG: Having then a great high priest, who hath passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܫܲܪܸܟ ܥܲܡܲܢ ܒܚܲܫܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܝܵܬܲܢ̈، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܒܟܠ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܡܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܲܢ، ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab layt lan goera dkahne dla maṣe sharik 'aman bkhasha gaw zaboenoeyatan, ila eet lan khad dpeesha ywa joerba bkl oerkha maykh dee-an, akhchee dla khṭeeta ywa.
ENG: For we have not a high priest that cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but one that hath been in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܲܚ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܠܟܘܼܪܣܝܵܐ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ، ܕܩܲܒܠܲܚ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܘܕܡܲܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܲܚ ܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ ܠܗܵܝܲܪܬܲܢ ܒܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bas shwooq qarbinakh bjoerat lkoersya dshapaqat, dqablakh rakhme o dmachkhakh shapaqat lhayartan b'dana dsneeqoeta.
ENG: Let us therefore draw near with boldness unto the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and may find grace to help us in time of need.

ASY: ܟܠ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܓܘܼܒܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܫܝܼܡܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܦܵܠܹܚ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܘܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Kl goera dkahne deeleh peesha goebya min bnaynasha, peesha-yleh rsheema min geba dbnaynasha dpalekh lmindeeane deena dalaha, dmaqriw qoerbane o diwkhe min geba dkhṭeeate,
ENG: For every high priest, being taken from among men, is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܡܪܲܚܡܵܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܘܒܸܚܠܵܛܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܐܘܼܪ̈ܚܵܬܹܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܟܪܝܼܟ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha haw ke maṣe hawe mrakhmana lanee dle yad'ee o bikhlaṭa yna boerkhate, sabab oep haw bganeh kreekha-yleh bzaboenoeta.
ENG: who can bear gently with the ignorant and erring, for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity;

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha wale-ylaha dmaqriw diwkhe la akhchee boet khṭeeate dganeh, eena oep boet khṭeeate dṭayipa.
ENG: and by reason thereof is bound, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

ASY: ܘܗܸܟ̃ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܩܵܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܘܼܒܝܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܲܗܪܘܿܢ.
TRL: O hich nasha le shaqel-leh aha eeqara qa ganeh, ila paesh goebya byad Alaha, dakhee deewa ahroon.
ENG: And no man taketh the honour unto himself, but when he is called of God, even as was Aaron.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ ܝܘܸܬ ܐܲܢ݇ܬ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܐܸܕܝܘܿܡ ܩܲܡ ܡܲܠܸܕܸܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Hadkha oep msheekha la shqeel-leh khiqra qa ganeh dhwe-leh goera dkahne, ila Alaha meereh ileh: broonee ywit at, ana idyoom qam malidinoekh.
ENG: So Christ also glorified not himself to be made a high priest, but he that spake unto him, Thou art my Son, This day have I begotten thee:

ASY: ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܒܚܕܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ.
TRL: Dakhee bkhda doeka kheta meereh: at eewit kahna l'alam, bsidra dmalkeezdiq.
ENG: as he saith also in another place, Thou art a priest for ever After the order of Melchizedek.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ، ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܒܵܥܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܦܲܪ̈ܦܲܠܝܵܬܹܐ ܒܡܲܩܘܲܚܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܕܸܡܥܹ̈ܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܡܝܼܥܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܫܠܝܼܡ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eeman deewa bpaghra ar'anaya, msheekha moeqriw-leh ba'oeyate o parpalyate bmaqwakhyate khaylane o bdim'e lhaw dke maṣe wa dpariq wa-leh min mawta, o peesh-leh shmee'a sabab shleem-leh lalaha.
ENG: Who in the days of his flesh, having offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and having been heard for his godly fear,

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐܸܢ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܨܝܲܬܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ؛
TRL: O oep in dbroona ywa, eena leep-leh maṣyatta min mindeeane dqoebil-leh khasha bee-ayhy;
ENG: though he was a Son, yet learned obedience by the things which he suffered;

ASY: ܘܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܸܠܬܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܫܵܠܡܝܼ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: O sabab peesh-leh moekmila, hwe-leh 'ilta dpoerqana l'alam lklayhy anee dshalmee ileh,
ENG: and having been made perfect, he became unto all them that obey him the author of eternal salvation;

ASY: ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܪܫܝܼܡܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ.
TRL: O peesh-leh rsheema goera dkahne balaha bsidra dmalkeezdiq.
ENG: named of God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܠܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܲܣܩܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܦܲܫܘܼܩܹܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܲܩܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܫܡܵܥܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eet lan raba lhamzoeme boet aha, eena 'asqa-ylaha lpashoeqe sabab yaqoere ytoon bshma'ta.
ENG: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard of interpretation, seeing ye are become dull of hearing.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܲܕ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܲܠܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܫ ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܕ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܸܣܛܘܼܟ݂ܣܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܠܚܲܠܒ݂ܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܠܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab kad wale ywa baha 'dana dhaweytoon waw malpane, eena hesh sneeqe ytoon lkhad khena dmalip lawkhoon isṭoekhse dshoeraya dhemizmane dalaha. Sneeqe ytoon lkhalwa, la lmekhoelta qweeta.
ENG: For when by reason of the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need again that some one teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of solid food.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܚܵܝܹܐ ܒܚܲܠܒ݂ܵܐ، ܗܹܫ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܠܲܝܬ ܠܹܗ ܢܸܣܝܵܢܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab kl man dkhaye bkhalwa, hesh yala z'oora-yleh, o layt-leh nisyana bhemizman dzadeeqoeta.
ENG: For every one that partaketh of milk is without experience of the word of righteousness; for he is a babe.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܬܵܐ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܦܠܸܚܝܼ ܪܹ̈ܓ݂ܫܲܝܗܝ ܠܸܦܪܵܫܵܐ ܒܹܝܠ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܘܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena mekhoelta qweeta qa nashe goere-ylaha, anee dmaplikhee reghshayhy liprasha beyl ṭawta o beeshta.
ENG: But solid food is for fullgrown men, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܘܡܵܛܲܚ ܠܟܵܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܵܢܲܚ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܸܢܝܲܬ ܕܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: Bas shawqakh shoeraya dyoelpana dmsheekha o maṭakh lkameeloeta, o la banakh mindrish binyat dtyawoeta min poelkhane meete o dhaymanoeta balaha,
ENG: Wherefore let us cease to speak of the first principles of Christ, and press on unto perfection; not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

ASY: ܘܝܘܼܠܦܵܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܲܥܡܘܿܕܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܣܝܵܡ ܐܝܼܕܹ̈ܐ، ܘܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܝܼܘܵܢ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: O yoelpana boet ma'moodeeate, o syam eede, o qyamta dmeete o deewan dl'alam.
ENG: of the teaching of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ، ܐܸܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܦܣܵܣܵܐ.
TRL: Aha bit 'awdakh, in Alaha yabil lan psasa.
ENG: And this will we do, if God permit.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܚܕܵܐ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܗܪܸܢܹܐ، ܘܛܥܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܵܘܗܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܒܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab anee dbkhda 'dana peesh-lhoon boehrine, o ṭ'eem-lhoon mawhawta shmayanayta, o hwe-lhoon shareeke broekha dqoedsha,
ENG: For as touching those who were once enlightened and tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,

ASY: ܘܛܥܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܛܵܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܚܲܝܠܹ̈ܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ،
TRL: O ṭ'eem-lhoon hemizman ṭawta dalaha, o khayle dzawna date,
ENG: and tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the age to come,

ASY: ܘܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܕܸܪܹܐ ܠܬܝܵܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ ܒܸܙܩܵܦܹܗ ܝܢܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܹܗ ܝܢܵܐ ܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ.
TRL: O npeel-lhoon, le maṣya khda gaha kheta payshee moedire ltyawoeta, sabab mindrish bizqapeh yna broona dalaha o bi'wadeh yna nkheepta qam 'alma.
ENG: and then fell away, it is impossible to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܬܝܵܐ ܡܸܛܪܵܐ ܕܢܵܦܠܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗ̇ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܘܝܵܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܸܩܢܵܐ ܕܚܵܫܹܚ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܦܠܝܼܚܬܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܩܲܒܠܵܐ ܒܘܼܪܟܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ar'a dke shatya miṭra dnapla 'aloeha raba gahe, o yawa yiqna dkhashekh lanee dboet dee-ayhy peeshta-ylaha pleekhta, ke qabla boerkta min Alaha.
ENG: For the land which hath drunk the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receiveth blessing from God:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܦܵܠܛܵܐ ܟܸܬܘܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܝܼܘܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܘܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܠܝܼܛܬܵܐ، ܕܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܸܕܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena ar'a dpalṭa kitwe o qeeware moesleeta-ylaha o qoerba-ylaha dpaysha leeṭta, dbkharta bit paysha moeqidta.
ENG: but if it beareth thorns and thistles, it is rejected and nigh unto a curse; whose end is to be burned.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܦܸܢ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܡܘܼܚܸܒܝܼ̈، ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܘܼܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Eena apin hamzoeme ywakh hadkha, moekhibee, hewee-an qweeta-ylaha beeawkhoon boet shoelane boesh shapeere gawawkhoon deena seere bpoerqana.
ENG: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܵܐܗܲܩ ܕܡܲܢܫܹܐ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܚܙܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܒܝܲܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܩܲܕܝܼܫܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܗܹܫ ܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab Alaha le-yleh nahaq dmanshe poelkhanawkhoon o la khoeba dmoekhze lawkhoon boet shimeh byad khilmat d'weed lawkhoon lqadeeshe, hay dhesh bi'wada ytoon.
ENG: for God is not unrighteous to forget your work and the love which ye shewed toward his name, in that ye ministered unto the saints, and still do minister.

ASY: ܒܸܒܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܗܲܪ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܦܵܛܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܲܠ ܚܲܪܬܵܐ، ܠܡܲܟܡܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ،
TRL: Bib'aya ywakh dkl khad minawkhoon makhze har aha khapaṭoeta hal kharta, lmakmalta dheweeawkhoon,
ENG: And we desire that each one of you may shew the same diligence unto the fulness of hope even to the end:

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܲܟܣܸܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܵܡܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܒܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܝܵܪ̈ܘܿܬܹܐ ܕܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Dla haweytoon maksilane, ila haweytoon damyane lanee dbhaymanoeta o bkhmalta hwe-lhoon yaroote dqawle.
ENG: that ye be not sluggish, but imitators of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

ASY: ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܝܵܡܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ،
TRL: Eeman dalaha 'weed-leh qawla lawraham, me-leh bganeh, sabab layt wa khad boesh goera mineh dyame wa bee-eh,
ENG: For when God made promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he sware by himself,

ASY: ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ: ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐܝܼܬ ܒܲܪܘܼܟܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܒܲܪܟܸܢܘܼܟ݂، ܘܡܲܙܝܘܼܕܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܡܲܙܝܸܕܸܢܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Bemara: shareeraeet baroeke bit barkinoekh, o mazyoede bit mazyidinoekh.
ENG: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

ASY: ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܣܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ، ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: O hadkha min bar dspeereh awraham khad mitkha, qoebil-leh mindee dpeesha ywa qoewila ileh.
ENG: And thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܝܵܡܝܼ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܫܲܪܸܪܵܐ ܠܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܘܟܹܐ ܚܵܬܡܵܐ ܠܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܘܼܪ̈ܵܫܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab nashe ke yamee bhaw deeleh boesh goera minayhy, o mawmeeta ke msharira lmindee dpeesha-yleh meera o ke khatma lklayhy doerashe.
ENG: For men swear by the greater: and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܟܲܕ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܡܲܚܙܹܐ ܠܝܵܪ̈ܘܿܬܹܐ ܕܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܫܲܚܠܸܦ، ܡܘܼܩܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܒܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Hadkha, kad b'e-leh Alaha dboesh zawda makhze lyaroote dqawla dṣiwyaneh le shakhlip, moeqwe-leh ileh bmawmeeta.
ENG: Wherein God, being minded to shew more abundantly unto the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath:

ASY: ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܒܬܪܹܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܸܫܬܲܚܠܸܦܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܕܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܕܲܓܸܠ، ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܲܢ ܝܲܗ݇ܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܸܒܵܐ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܕܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܒܹܝܬ ܓܵܘܣܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܕܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܢ.
TRL: Alaha 'weed-leh aha, hadkha dbtrey mindeeane la mishtakhlipane, dbee-ayhy Alaha le maṣe dagil, hawe lan yabalta dliba qweeta, akhnan dbiṭ'aya ywakh bar beyt gawsa bee-eh, dawqakh bhewee dmoetiwta-ylaha qaman.
ENG: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to lay hold of the hope set before us;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܠܲܢܓܵܪ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܩܵܐ ܓܵܢܵܐ، ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܩܘܝܼܬܵܐ ܘܚܵܬܸܪܓ̰ܲܡܥ، ܘܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܕܣܸܬܪܵܐ،
TRL: Aha hewee aykh langar eelaha qa gana, hewee qweeta o khatirjam', o ke 'awra lhaw geba khena dsitra,
ENG: which we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and stedfast and entering into that which is within the veil;

ASY: ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܡܸܢܲܢ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܢ، ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ.
TRL: Ayka deeshoo' zeel-leh min qam minan, o 'weereh min geban, o hwe-leh ilan goera dkahne l'alam bsidra dmalkeezdiq.
ENG: whither as a forerunner Jesus entered for us, having become a high priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܫܵܠܝܼܡ ܘܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܟܲܕ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܸܕܝܵܪܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓ݂ܠܵܒܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ ܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ،
TRL: Aha malkeezdiq eewa malka dshaleem o kahna dalaha 'ilaya. Haw tpeeq-leh bawraham kad awraham bidyara min ghlabta dmalke, o malkeezdiq boerikh-leh ileh,
ENG: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of God Most High, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him,

ASY: ܘܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ. ܟܲܕ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܫܸܡܹܗ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܪܓܸܡܵܐ ”ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ،“ ܘܕܬܪܹܝ، ”ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܫܵܠܝܼܡ،“ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܪܓܸܡܵܐ، ”ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܕܫܠܵܡܵܐ.“
TRL: O awraham yoebil-leh ileh ma'sare min kl mindee. Kad qamayta shimeh pyasha-yleh toergima ”malka dzadeeqoeta,“ o dtrey, ”malka dshaleem,“ dpyasha-yleh toergima, ”malka dshlama.“
ENG: to whom also Abraham divided a tenth part of all (being first, by interpretation, King of righteousness, and then also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܘܕܠܵܐ ܝܸܡܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܫܲܪܒܬܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܠܵܐ ܚܘܼܬܵܡܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ؛ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Dla baba o dla yima, dla sharbta, dla shoeraya dyawmane o dla khoetama dkhaye; bdmoeta dbroona dalaha, kahna-yleh l'alam.
ENG: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like unto the Son of God), abideth a priest continually.

ASY: ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܟܡܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܒܵܒܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܣܠܵܒܬܵܐ.
TRL: Khzeymoen kma goera ywa aha nasha dileh awraham baba yoebil-leh ma'sare dslabta.
ENG: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the chief spoils.

ASY: ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܸܦܩܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܘܝܼ ܕܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ، ܝܲܥܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ، ܟܲܕ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܨܵܐ ܕܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܦܠܝܼܛܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Namoosa bipqada-yleh danee min bnoone dlewee dqablee kahnoeta, shaqlee ma'sare min ṭayipa, ya'ne min akhoonwatayhy, kad oep anee min khaṣa dawraham pleeṭe yna.
ENG: And they indeed of the sons of Levi that receive the priest’s office have commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though these have come out of the loins of Abraham:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܪ̈ܒܵܬܹܐ ܕܠܹܘܝܼ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܘܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena aha dle-yleh min sharbate dlewee, shqeel-leh ma'sare min awraham, o boerikh-leh lawraham deet wa-leh qawle.
ENG: but he whose genealogy is not counted from them hath taken tithes of Abraham, and hath blessed him that hath the promises.

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܫܸܟ، ܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܒܵܨܘܿܪܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܒܘܼܪܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Dla shik, haw boesh baṣoora peesha-yleh mboerkha bhaw boesh goera.
ENG: But without any dispute the less is blessed of the better.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܓܹܒܵܐ، ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܡܵܝܘܿܬܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܠܝܼ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ؛ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܕܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Min khad geba, nashe mayoote ke shaqlee ma'sare; min haw geba khena, haw dpeesh-laha yoebilta sahdoeta 'aloehy dkhaya-yleh.
ENG: And here men that die receive tithes; but there one, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܕܐܘܼܦ ܠܹܘܝܼ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܹܐ ܫܵܩܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ، ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܥܣܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ،
TRL: O oep maṣakh amrakh, doep lewee, haw dke shaqel wa ma'sare, yoebil-leh ma'sare byad awraham,
ENG: And, so to say, through Abraham even Levi, who receiveth tithes, hath paid tithes;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ ܬܦܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܠܹܘܝܼ ܗܹܫ ܓܵܘ ܚܲܨܵܐ ܕܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab eeman dmalkeezdiq tpeeq-leh bawraham, lewee hesh gaw khaṣa dbaboehy ywa.
ENG: for he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchizedek met him.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܟܵܡܝܼܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܹܘܵܝܹ̈ܐ (ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ)، ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܗܪܘܿܢ؟
TRL: In kameeloeta hawya wa byad kahnoeta dlewaye (sabab beeoeha peesh-leh yoewa namoosa lṭayipa), moodee sneeqoeta eet wa lkahna khena bsidra dmalkeezdiq, o la bsidra dahroon?
ENG: Now if there was perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it hath the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be reckoned after the order of Aaron?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܫܘܼܚܠܵܦܵܐ ܒܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܐܵܢܲܢܩܵܝܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܫܘܼܚܠܵܦܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ayka deet shoekhlapa bkahnoeta, ananqayta-ylaha dhawe oep shoekhlapa bnamoosa.
ENG: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܐ ܐܲܢܹܐ، ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܘܐܘܼܦ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ.
TRL: Haw dboet dee-eh peeshe yna meere ane, min khad shawṭa khena-yleh, o oep khad min haw shawṭa le-yleh 'weeda khilmat 'al madbkha.
ENG: For he of whom these things are said belongeth to another tribe, from which no man hath given attendance at the altar.

ASY: ܒܲܗܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܡܵܪܲܢ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܲܒ݂ܛܵܐ ܕܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ ܒܘܼܬ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bahranta-ylaha dmaran te-leh min shawṭa deehoeda, haw dmoeshe la meereh mindee 'aloehy boet kahne.
ENG: For it is evident that our Lord hath sprung out of Judah; as to which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priests.

ASY: ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܒܲܗܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇، ܐܸܢ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ،
TRL: O boesh zawda bahranta-ylaha, in bdmoeta dmalkeezdiq qaem kahna khena,
ENG: And what we say is yet more abundantly evident, if after the likeness of Melchizedek there ariseth another priest,

ASY: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܚܲܝܹ̈ܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܸܬܒܲܛܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Haw dhwe-leh kahna la bnamoosa dpoeqdane dbnaynasha, eena bkhayla dkhaye la mitbaṭlane.
ENG: who hath been made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ: ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܒܣܸܕܪܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܝܼܙܕܸܩ.
TRL: Sabab peesh-laha yoebilta sahdoeta 'aloehy: at eewit kahna l'alam, bsidra dmalkeezdiq.
ENG: for it is witnessed of him, Thou art a priest for ever After the order of Melchizedek.

ASY: ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܒܛܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܙܲܒܘܼܢ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܘܕܠܵܐ ܝܘܼܬܪܵܢܵܐ،
TRL: Poeqdana qamaya bṭeel-leh sabab zaboen eewa o dla yoetrana,
ENG: For there is a disannulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and unprofitableness

ASY: (ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܗܸܟ̃ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ)، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܒܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܕܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܲܚ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: (sabab namoosa la moekmil-leh hich mindee), ila bre-leh khda hewee boesh ṣpayee dbeeoeha qarbinakh lalaha.
ENG: (for the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in thereupon of a better hope, through which we draw nigh unto God.

ASY: ܘܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܠܵܐ ܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒ݂ܵܐ. ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: O le ywa bla mawmeeta dpeesh-leh yoewa. khene hwe-lhoon kahne dla mawmeeta,
ENG: And inasmuch as it is not without the taking of an oath

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܒܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ܝ݇ܡܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܹܗ، ”ܐܲܢ݇ܬ ܝܼܘܸܬ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.“
TRL: Eena haw hwe-leh kahna bmawmeeta byad Alaha dmeereh ileh: me-leh Marya o le daer min mawmeeteh, ”at eewit kahna l'alam.“
ENG: (for they indeed have been made priests without an oath; but he with an oath by him that saith of him, The Lord sware and will not repent himself, Thou art a priest for ever);

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܪܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ.
TRL: Boet aha mawmeeta, eeshoo' hwe-leh 'arawa dwa'da boesh ṣpayee.
ENG: by so much also hath Jesus become the surety of a better covenant.

ASY: ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܹܗ ܕܥܲܪܩܸܠܝܼ ܒܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Eet waw raba kahne, sabab mawta la shweeq-leh d'arqilee bkahnoetayhy.
ENG: And they indeed have been made priests many in number, because that by death they are hindered from continuing:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ، ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܫܲܚܠܸܦܵܐ ܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܹܗ.
TRL: Eena sabab eeshoo' khaya-yleh l'alam, hich le shakhlipa kahnoeteh.
ENG: but he, because he abideth for ever, hath his priesthood unchangeable.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܦܲܪܸܩ ܟܠܵܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܵܬܝܼ ܠܟܸܣ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܝܼܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܦܲܪܦܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: Boet aha ke maṣe pariq klanaeet lanee datee lkis Alaha bee-eh, sabab bkl zawna khaya-yleh dparpil min gebayhy.
ENG: Wherefore also he is able to save to the uttermost them that draw near unto God through him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܡܵܐ، ܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ، ܦܪܝܼܫܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܪܡܵܐ ܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܡܲܝܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Hadkha goera dkahne khsheekha-yleh ilan, deeleh mqoedsha, dla moema, dikhya, preesha min khaṭaye, o moerma 'ilil min shmaye,
ENG: For such a high priest became us, holy, guileless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

ASY: ܕܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܣܢܝܼܩܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܐܝܼܬ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ، ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ، ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: Dle-yleh sneeqa dmaqriw diwkhe yawmaeet aykh anee goerane dkahne khene, qamayta boet khṭeeate dganeh, haygah boet khṭeeate dṭayipa, sabab khda gaha akhchee moeqriw-leh diwkha boet khṭeeatayhy eeman dmoeqriwa-leh ganeh.
ENG: who needeth not daily, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people: for this he did once for all, when he offered up himself.

ASY: ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܡܲܬܸܒ݂ ܓܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܲܝ̈ܢܵܫܵܐ ܙܲܒܘܼܢ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܡܵܘܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܕܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܓܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Namoosa ke matiw goerane dkahne min bnaynasha zaboen, eena hemizman dmawmeeta, dte-laha min bar namoosa, seem-laha broona dpeesha ywa 'weeda gmeera l'alam.
ENG: For the law appointeth men high priests, having infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was after the law, appointeth a Son, perfected for evermore.

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܢܝܼܫܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܹܐܡܵܪܲܝ ܝܘܲܚ: ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܬܪܘܿܢܘܿܣ ܕܥܸܠܵܝܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Aha-yleh neesha dmindeeane dbemaray ywakh: eet lan khad hadkha goera dkahne, haw deeleh teewa 'al yameena dtroonoos d'ilaya bshmaye,
ENG: Now in the things which we are saying the chief point is this: We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,

ASY: ܘܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܢܨܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܘܠܵܐ ܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ.
TRL: O dbi'wada-yleh khilmat gaw beyt qoedsha, mashkna shareera, haw dalaha nṣeew-leh o la barnasha.
ENG: a minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܪܫܝܼܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܘܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܐܘܼܦ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܠܡܲܩܪܘܼܒܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab kl goera dkahne peesha-yleh rsheema dmaqriw qoerbane o diwkhe. Hadkha wale-ylaha doep aha hawe-leh mindee lmaqroebe.
ENG: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is necessary that this high priest also have somewhat to offer.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ، ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܝܼܬ ܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܝܼ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: In hawe wa 'al ar'a, hich le hawe wa kahna, sabab eet 'al ar'a anee dmaqriwee qoerbane aykh dnamoosa bemara-yleh.
ENG: Now if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, seeing there are those who offer the gifts according to the law;

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܒܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܘܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܠܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܸܒܢܵܝܵܐ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ: ܡܲܣܸܡ ܒܵܠܵܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܬ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܡܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܡܘܼܚܙܝܼܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂ ܥܲܠ ܛܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Anee ke 'awdee khilmat gaw beyt qoedsha deeleh bdmoeta o ṭilaneeta dmindeeane shmayanaye, aykh dpeesh-leh meera lmoeshe eeman dhdeera ywa libnaya mashkna: masim bala d'awdet klayhy mindeeane bhay dmoeta dpeesh-laha moekhzeeta iloekh 'al ṭoera.
ENG: who serve that which is a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses is warned of God when he is about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern that was shewed thee in the mount.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܕܵܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܒܘܼܫ ܥܸܠܵܝܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܸܨܥܵܝܵܐ ܕܚܲܕ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܬܐܸܣܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ.
TRL: Eena adeea haw qoebil-leh khda khilmat boesh 'ilayta min khilmat danee kahne, aykh deeleh miṣ'aya dkhad wa'da boesh ṣpayee, sabab peesha-yleh shoetisa 'al qawle boesh ṣpayee.
ENG: But now hath he obtained a ministry the more excellent, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which hath been enacted upon better promises.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܠܲܝܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܚܸܠܛܵܐ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܠܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪܹܝ.
TRL: Sabab in layt wa mindee khilṭa bhaw wa'da qamaya, le hawya wa doeka liṭ'aya lhaw dtrey.
ENG: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then would no place have been sought for a second.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܚܸܠܛܵܐ ܒܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ، ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܗܵܐ، ܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ، ܘܥܲܡ ܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܗܘܼܕܵܐ.
TRL: Eena Alaha khze-leh khilṭa bṭayipa, o meereh: ha, betaya yna yawmane, bemara-yleh Marya, eeman d'awden wa'da khata 'am beyt eesrayel, o 'am beyt eehoeda.
ENG: For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, That I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah;

ASY: ܠܹܐ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܝܼ ܥܲܡ ܒܵܒܵܘܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ ܕܕܒ݂ܝܼܩ ܠܝܼ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܦܘܼܠܛܲܝ ܠܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܟܲܕ ܠܵܐ ܢܛܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܘܲܥܕܝܼ، ܘܐܵܢܵܐ ܦܬܝܼܠ ܠܝܼ ܒܵܠܝܼ ܡܸܢܲܝܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ.
TRL: Le hawe aykh wa'da d'weed-lee 'am babawatayhy bhaw yawma ddweeq-lee beedatayhy o poelṭay-lee min miṣreyn, kad la nṭeerhoon wa'dee, o ana pteel-lee balee minayhy, bemara-yleh Marya.
ENG: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers In the day that I took them by the hand to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt; For they continued not in my covenant, And I regarded them not, saith the Lord.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܹܢ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ: ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܢܗܘܿܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܝܼ̈ ܒܪܸ̈ܥܝܵܢܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܸܬ ܟܵܬܒܹܢܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ. ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܝܢ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܘܐܵܢܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܐܸܠܝܼ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab aha-yleh wa'da dbit yaben lbeyt eesrayel min bar anee yawmane, bemara-yleh Marya: bit matbinhoon namoosee bri'yanayhy, o bit katbenhoon 'al libayhy. Bit haweyn ilayhy lalaha, o anee bit hawee ilee lṭayipa.
ENG: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel After those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, And on their heart also will I write them: And I will be to them a God, And they shall be to me a people:

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܠܹܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܫܒ݂ܵܒܹܗ، ܘܠܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܲܠܸܦ ܠܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܼܗܝ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ، ”ܝ݇ܕܸܥ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ،“ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܒܸܬ ܝܵܕܥܝܼ ܠܝܼ، ܡ̣ܢ ܙܥܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܗܲܠ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: O nasha hich le malip lshwabeh, o la nasha malip lakhoonoehy, bemara, ”di' lmarya,“ sabab klayhy bit yad'ee-lee, min z'oora o hal goera.
ENG: And they shall not teach every man his fellow-citizen, And every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: For all shall know me, From the least to the greatest of them.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܬ ܦܲܚܠܸܢ ܥܵܘܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܕܵܟ݂ܪܹܢܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Sabab bit pakhlin 'awlayhy, o khṭeeatayhy khena le dakhrenhoon.
ENG: For I will be merciful to their iniquities, And their sins will I remember no more.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܩܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ”ܚܲܕܬܵܐ“ ܠܐܵܗܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܬܝܼܩܵܐ. ܘܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܥܘܼܬܩܸܢܵܐ ܘܣܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ، ܩܘܼܪܒܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܸܬܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Kad qre-leh ”khadta“ laha qawla, haw qamaya peesh-leh 'ateeqa. O mindee deeleh 'oetqina o seewa, qoerba-yleh lityama.
ENG: In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. But that which is becoming old and waxeth aged is nigh unto vanishing away.

ASY: ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܵܐ ܣܓ݂ܵܕܬܵܐ ܘܒܹܝܬ ܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܐܲܪܥܵܢܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Wa'da qamaya eet wa-leh qanoone qa sghadta o beyt qoedsha ar'anaya.
ENG: Now even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and its sanctuary, a sanctuary of this world.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ، ܒܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܢܵܪܬܵܐ، ܘܦܵܬܘܿܪܵܐ ܘܠܲܚܡܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ؛ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫܬܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab mashkna peesha ywa hoedra, bdoeka qamayta dbee-eh eet wa mnarta, o patoora o lakhma mqoedsha; aha peeshta ywa qreeta doeka mqoedishta.
ENG: For there was a tabernacle prepared, the first, wherein were the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the Holy place.

ASY: ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܣܸܬܪܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ، ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܟܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܩܕܘܿܫ ܩܘܼܕܫܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Min bar sitra dtrey, eet wa doeka kheta dke paysha wa qreeta qdoosh qoedshe,
ENG: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holy of holies;

ASY: ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡܲܕܒܚܵܐ ܕܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܒܸܣܡܵܐ، ܘܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܩܪܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܒܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܓܹܒܵܢܹ̈ܐ. ܘܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܵܐܢܵܐ ܕܕܲܗܒ݂ܵܐ ܒܸܚܒ݂ܵܫܵܐ ܡܲܢܢܵܐ، ܘܚܘܼܛܪܵܐ ܕܐܲܗܪܘܿܢ ܕܒܘܼܪܛܸܢܹܗ، ܘܠܘܼܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ.
TRL: Ayka deet wa madbkha ddahwa qa bisma, o qewoeta dwa'da qreemta bdahwa min klayhy gebane. O eet waw gaw qewoeta mana ddahwa bikhwasha manna, o khoeṭra dahroon dboerṭineh, o loekhe dwa'da.
ENG: having a golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was a golden pot holding the manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;

ASY: ܥܸܠܸܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܟܪ̈ܘܿܒܹܐ ܕܚܸܩܪܵܐ ܕܒܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܚܘܼܣܵܝܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܲܢ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܡܙܸܡܲܚ ܒܡܸܠܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: 'Ilil min qewoeta eet waw kroobe dkhiqra dbi'wada ṭilaneeta 'al doeka dkhoesaya. Eena adeea layt lan 'dana dhamzimakh bmilyoeta boet ane.
ENG: and above it cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy-seat; of which things we cannot now speak severally.

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ، ܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܓܵܘ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܠܡܲܟܡܘܼܠܹܐ ܚܸܠܡܲܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Kad kl mindee peesha ywa hadkha hoedra, kahne bkl zawna ke 'awree waw gaw doeka qamayta lmakmoele khilmatayhy.
ENG: Now these things having been thus prepared, the priests go in continually into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the services;

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܩܕܘܿܫ ܩܘܼܕܫܹ̈ܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܒܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ، ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܘܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܸܠܛܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ.
TRL: Eena akhchee goera dkahne ke 'aber wa lqdoosh qoedshe, khda gaha bsheta, o la dla dima, dmaqriw wa-leh min geba dganeh o min geba dkhilṭe dṭayipa.
ENG: but into the second the high priest alone, once in the year, not without blood, which he offereth for himself, and for the errors of the people:

ASY: ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܕܥܒ݂ܵܪܬܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܓܠܝܼܬܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܒܸܟܠܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ.
TRL: Baha, roekha dqoedsha makhzoeye-yleh doerkha d'warta ldoeka boesh mqoedishta min klayhy doekane hesh le ywa peeshta gleeta kma dmashkna qamaya biklaya ywa.
ENG: the Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holy place hath not yet been made manifest, while as the first tabernacle is yet standing;

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܕܩܵܐܹܡ، ܕܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܘܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒܹܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܲܟܡܸܠܝܼ ܐܸܢܝܲܬ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ܵܢܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Aha khad ṭoewsa-yleh qa zawna dqaem, dqoerbane o diwkhe dpeeshe ywaw moeqribe le maṣee waw makmilee inyat dmaqriwanayhy,
ENG: which is a parable for the time now present; according to which are offered both gifts and sacrifices that cannot, as touching the conscience, make the worshipper perfect,

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܹܐܟ݂ܘܼܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܫܬܵܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܚܵܠܲܠܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܦܪ̈ܝܼܫܹܐ، ܩܵܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܒܲܪ̈ܢܵܫܵܝܹܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܗܲܠ ܕܐܵܬܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܬܘܼܪܵܨܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab ane eewaw akhchee boet mekhoelyate o shtayate o khalalyate preeshe, qanoone barnashaye dpeeshe moetbe hal date wa zawna khata dtoeraṣa.
ENG: being only (with meats and drinks and divers washings) carnal ordinances, imposed until a time of reformation.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ، ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܛܵܒ݂ܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܝܼܹܐ، ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܓܵܘ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܘܒܘܼܫ ܓܡܝܼܪܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܒܸܢܝܵܐ ܒܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܘܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena eeman dmsheekha te-leh, goera dkahne dṭawate deena tee-e, 'weereh mgaw mashkna boesh goera o boesh gmeera, la peesha binya bnasha o le-yleh min aha breeta.
ENG: But Christ having come a high priest of the good things to come, through the greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this creation,

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫܬܵܐ، ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ، ܘܡܘܼܐܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: O la 'weereh bdima d'ize o dmoeje, eena 'weereh bdima dganeh ldoeka boesh mqoedishta, khda gaha akhchee, o moete-leh poerqana dl'alam.
ENG: nor yet through the blood of goats and calves, but through his own blood, entered in once for all into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܡܲܪܝܲܣܬܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ ܘܬܵܘܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܸܛܡܵܐ ܕܫܲܪܸܚܬܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܛܲܡ̈ܐܹܐ ܩܲܕܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܒܲܪܵܐܝܼܬ،
TRL: Sabab in maryasta ddima d'ize o tawre o qiṭma dsharikhta 'al anee deewaw ṭame qadsha wa-lhoon dhawee waw dikhye baraeet,
ENG: For if the blood of goats and bulls, and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling them that have been defiled, sanctify unto the cleanness of the flesh:

ASY: ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܝܲܕ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܡܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܕܲܟܹܐ ܐܸܢܝܲܬܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܲܚ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ!
TRL: Kma boesh zawda dima dmsheekha, haw dbyad roekha dl'alam moeqriwa-leh ganeh dla moema lalaha, bit dake inyatan min poelkhane meete d'awdakh khilmat lalaha khaya!
ENG: how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish unto God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܝܼܠܹܗ ܡܸܨܥܵܝܵܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܚܵܕ݇ܬܵܐ. ܘܒܗ̇ܝ ܕܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܹܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܹܐ ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܕܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܠܥܵܠܲܡ.
TRL: Boet aha, haw eeleh miṣ'aya dwa'da khata. O bhay dmeet-leh boet poerqana dkhṭeeate dpeeshe ywaw 'weede tkhoot wa'da qamaya, anee dpeeshe yna qirye bit qablee qawla dyartoeta dl'alam.
ENG: And for this cause he is the mediator of a new covenant, that a death having taken place for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant, they that have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܘܲܨܝܲܬ، ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܠܡܲܚܙܘܼܝܹܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܘܲܨܝܲܬ.
TRL: Sabab ayka deet waṣyat, wale-ylaha lmakhzoeye mawta dhaw d'weed-leh waṣyat.
ENG: For where a testament is, there must of necessity be the death of him that made it.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܕܵܐ ܘܲܨܝܲܬ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ؛ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܗܸܟ̃ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܲܨܝܲܬ ܚܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab khda waṣyat eet-laha khayla akhchee eeman dnasha meeta-yleh; layt-laha hich khayla kma dhaw d'weeda-yleh waṣyat khaya-yleh.
ENG: For a testament is of force where there hath been death: for doth it ever avail while he that made it liveth?

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܫܘܼܬܐܸܣܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: Boet aha oep haw wa'da qamaya le ywa peesha shoetisa dla dima.
ENG: Wherefore even the first covenant hath not been dedicated without blood.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܲܕ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܟܠܹܗ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ، ܥܲܡ ܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܘܥܲܡܪܵܐ ܕܩܸܪܡܝܼܙ ܘܙܘܿܦܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܪܝܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܟܠܹܗ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab kad meereh moeshe klayhy poeqdane lkleh ṭayipa aykh namoosa, shqeel-leh dima dmoeje o d'ize, 'am meea o 'amra dqirmeez o zoopa, o moeryis-leh 'al ktawa o 'al kleh ṭayipa,
ENG: For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses unto all the people according to the law, he took the blood of the calves and the goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself, and all the people,

ASY: ܘܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ، ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܦܩܝܼܕܵܐ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܠܸܢܛܵܪܵܐ.
TRL: O meereh ilayhy: aha-yleh dima dwa'da, dpeesh-leh pqeeda ilawkhoon balaha linṭara.
ENG: saying, This is the blood of the covenant which God commanded to you-ward.

ASY: ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܥܲܠ ܡܲܫܟܢܵܐ ܘܥܲܠ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܵܐܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: O hadkha oep 'al mashkna o 'al klayhy mane dkhilmat moeryis-leh dima.
ENG: Moreover the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry he sprinkled in like manner with the blood.

ASY: ܘܓܵܘ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ، ܚܲܕ݇ܟ̰ܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܟܠ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܕܸܡܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܵܐ، ܘܕܠܵܐ ܫܵܦܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܦܘܼܚܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: O gaw namoosa, khacha paysha kl mindee bdima ke paesh doekhya, o dla shapakhta ddima layt poekhala.
ENG: And according to the law, I may almost say, all things are cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܘܼܡܝܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܒܓܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܒܝܲܕ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܲܢܹܐ.
TRL: Bas wale ywa anee deena doemye dmindeeane shmayanaye payshee waw doekhye byad ane diwkhe, eena mindeeane shmayanaye bganayhy byad diwkhe boesh ṣpayee min ane.
ENG: It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫܬܵܐ ܒܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܛܘܼܦ̮ܣܵܐ ܕܗ̇ܝ ܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇، ܕܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܲܢ؛
TRL: Sabab msheekha la 'weereh ldoeka mqoedishta bneeta beedate, deewa ṭoewsa dhay doeka shareerta, eena 'weereh lshmaya bganoeha, dadeea paesh gilya qam Alaha min geban;
ENG: For Christ entered not into a holy place made with hands, like in pattern to the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear before the face of God for us:

ASY: ܘܠܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܫܡܲܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܓܵܢܹܗ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܟܹܐ ܥܵܒܹܪ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܟܵܗܢܹ̈ܐ ܟܠ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܸܫܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: O la 'weereh lshmaya dmaqriw ganeh raba gahe, aykh dke 'aber goera dkahne kl sheta ldoeka mqoedishta la bdima dganeh.
ENG: nor yet that he should offer himself often; as the high priest entereth into the holy place year by year with blood not his own;

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܒܲܣ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܪܵܒܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܕܝܼܵܐ ܒܚܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܒ݂ܢܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܲܛܸܠ ܠܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܕܒ݂ܵܚܬܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܹܗ.
TRL: In hawya wa hadkha, bas wale ywa dqabil wa khasha msheekha raba gahe min shoeraya dbreeta. Eena adeea bkharta dzawne, peesh-leh gilya khda gaha dbaṭil lkhṭeeta bdwakhta dganeh.
ENG: else must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once at the end of the ages hath he been manifested to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

ASY: ܘܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܬܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܪܫܝܼܡܬܵܐ ܠܒܲܪܢܵܫܵܐ ܕܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܐܹܬ، ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܕܝܼܘܵܢ،
TRL: O dakhee dpeeshta-ylaha rsheemta lbarnasha dkhda gaha maet, o min bar hada eet deewan,
ENG: And inasmuch as it is appointed unto men once to die, and after this cometh judgment;

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ܵܐ ܕܛܵܥܹܢ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܪܵܒܵܐ، ܘܒܸܬ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܓܸܠܝܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܕܬܲܪܬܹܝ، ܠܵܐ ܕܛܵܥܹܢ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܝܬܹܐ ܦܘܼܪܩܵܢܵܐ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Hadkha oep msheekha khda gaha peesh-leh moeqriwa dṭa'en khṭeeate draba, o bit paesh gilya gaha dtartey, la dṭa'en khṭeeta, eena dmayte poerqana lanee dbispara yna ileh.
ENG: so Christ also, having been once offered to bear the sins of many, shall appear a second time, apart from sin, to them that wait for him, unto salvation.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܛܸܠܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܹܗ ܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܢܘܿܡܵܐ ܕܐܵܢܝܼ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ، ܒܝܲܕ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒܹܐ ܐܲܡܝܼܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܒܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐ، ܠܵܐ ܡܨܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܲܟܡܸܠ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܩܲܪܒܸܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܸܣܓ݂ܵܕܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab namoosa eet wa-leh ṭilaneeta dmindeeane ṭabe dbit atee waw, eena bganeh le ywa qnooma danee mindeeane, boet aha, byad diwkhe dpyasha ywaw moeqribe ameenaeet sheta bsheta, la mṣe-leh makmil lanee dqarbinee waw lisghada.
ENG: For the law having a shadow of the good things to come, not the very image of the things, they can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect them that draw nigh.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܠܹܐ ܫܵܠܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܲܝܗܝ؟ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܣܵܓ݂ܕܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܕܘܼܟ݂ܝܹܐ ܘܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܪܵܥܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܓܢܵܗܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: In maṣe waw, le shalee waw min qoerbanayhy? Sabab saghdane khda gaha akhchee bit payshee waw doekhye o khena le ra'shee waw bgnaha dkhṭeeate.
ENG: Else would they not have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more conscience of sins?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܡܲܕܟܲܪܬܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܫܹܢ݇ܬܵܐܝܼܬ،
TRL: Eena anee diwkhe khda madkarta dkhṭeeta yna shetaeet,
ENG: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance made of sins year by year.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܓ̰ܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܕܲܟܹܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Sabab dima dmoeje o d'ize le maṣe dake khṭeeate.
ENG: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܕܘܼܢܝܹܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܸܪܘܼܟ݂ ܐܸܠܝܼ.
TRL: Boet aha eeman dmsheekha te-leh ldoenye meereh: diwkhe o qoerbane la b'e-loekh, eena paghra hoediroekh ilee.
ENG: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, But a body didst thou prepare for me;

ASY: ܒܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܩܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Bdiwkhe moeqde o bdiwkhe min geba dkhṭeeta la bseem-laha-loekh.
ENG: In whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hadst no pleasure:

ASY: ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܝܼ، ”ܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ، ܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂؛ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܫܘܼܪܵܝܵܐ ܕܟܬܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܟܬܝܼܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܝܼ.“
TRL: Haygah meeree, ”ha te-lee, ya Alaha, d'awden ṣiwyanoekh; aykh dbshoeraya dktawa kteewa-yleh boet deeee.“
ENG: Then said I, Lo, I am come (In the roll of the book it is written of me) To do thy will, O God.

ASY: ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ، ܘܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܡܘܼܩܕܹ̈ܐ ܘܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܹܒܵܐ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܒܥܹܐ ܠܘܼܟ݂، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܣܝܼܡ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܘܼܟ݂ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ،“ ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܒܹܐ ܒܝܲܕ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ.
TRL: Qamayta meereh, ”diwkhe o qoerbane, o diwkhe moeqde o qoerbane min geba dkhṭeeta la b'e-loekh, o la bseem-laha-loekh bee-ayhy,“ apin dpeeshe yna ṭleebe byad namoosa.
ENG: Saying above, Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein (the which are offered according to the law),

ASY: ܘܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܗܵܕܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ، ”ܗܵܐ، ܐ݇ܬܹܐ ܠܝܼ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܘܼܟ݂.“ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܒܲܛܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܘܹܐ ܠܬܪܲܝܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: O min bar hada meereh, ”ha, te-lee d'awden ṣiwyanoekh.“ hadkha baṭoele-yleh lqamaya dmaqwe ltrayana.
ENG: then hath he said, Lo, I am come to do thy will. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

ASY: ܒܗ̇ܘ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܹܐ ܒܡܲܩܪܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܦܲܓ݂ܪܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܚܕܵܐ ܓܵܗܵܐ ܐܲܚܟ̰ܝܼ.
TRL: Bhaw ṣiwyana peeshe ywakh mqoedshe bmaqrawta dpaghra deeshoo' msheekha khda gaha akhchee.
ENG: By which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

ASY: ܟܠ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܩܵܐܹܡ ܝܵܘܡܵܐܝܼܬ ܘܥܵܒܹܕ ܚܸܠܡܲܬ ܘܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܗܲܪ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܲܪ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܝܼ ܡܵܫܝܼ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kl kahna ke qaem yawmaeet o 'abed khilmat o maqriw har anee diwkhe dhar le maṣee mashee khṭeeate.
ENG: And every priest indeed standeth day by day ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, the which can never take away sins:

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܐ ܗܲܡܵܫܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Eena aha kahna eeman dmoeqriw-leh qa hamasha khad diwkha boet khṭeeta, teew-leh min yameena dalaha.
ENG: but he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

ASY: ܗܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܝܓܵܗ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܬܒܹܐ ܕܸܫܡܸܢܘܼ̈ܗܝ ܟܘܼܒ݂ܫܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ،
TRL: Ha min haygah bispara-yleh dpayshee moetbe dishminoehy koewsha tkhoot aqlateh,
ENG: from henceforth expecting till his enemies be made the footstool of his feet.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܚܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܵܐ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܲܡܝܼܢܵܐܝܼܬ ܠܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܢܵܐ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܹܐ.
TRL: Sabab bkhad qoerbana moekmila-yleh ameenaeet lanee deena mqoedshe.
ENG: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

ASY: ܐܘܼܦ ܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܸܣܗܵܕܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܒܐܵܗܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܵܝܬܵܐ:
TRL: Oep roekha dqoedsha bishada-yleh ilan baha, eeman dmeereh min qamayta:
ENG: And the Holy Ghost also beareth witness to us: for after he hath said,

ASY: ܐܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܘܲܥܕܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܥܵܒ݂ܕܹܢ ܥܲܡܲܝܗܝ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܒܹܐܡܵܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ: ܒܸܬ ܡܲܬܒܸܢ ܢܵܡܘܿܣܝܼ̈ ܓܵܘ ܠܸܒܲܝܗܝ، ܘܒܸܬ ܟܵܬܒܹܢܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܚܘܼܫܵܒܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Aha-yleh wa'da dbit 'awden 'amayhy min bar anee yawmane, bemara-yleh Marya: bit matbin namoosee gaw libayhy, o bit katbenhoon gaw khoeshabayhy.
ENG: This is the covenant that I will make with them After those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws on their heart, And upon their mind also will I write them; then saith he,

ASY: ܘܐܘܼܦ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܠܹܐ ܕܵܟ݂ܪܹܢ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܘܥܵܘܠܲܝܗܝ.
TRL: O oep meereh: le dakhren khena khṭeeatayhy o 'awlayhy.
ENG: And their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.

ASY: ܘܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܚܠܹܐ، ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܣܢܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܡܲܩܪܲܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܩܘܼܪ̈ܒܵܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܚܛܝܼܵܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O eeman dane peesh-lhoon poekhle, khena layt sneeqoeta lmaqrawta dqoerbane boet khṭeeate.
ENG: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ، ܐܲܚܘܿܢܘܵܬܝܼ̈، ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܐܲܬ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܪܵܐ ܠܒܹܝܬ ܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ ܒܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܝܼܫܘܿܥ،
TRL: Bas hadkha, akhoonwatee, eet lan joerat li'wara lbeyt qoedsha bdima deeshoo',
ENG: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus,

ASY: ܒܚܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ ܚܲܕܬܵܐ ܘܚܵܝܬܵܐ ܕܦܬܝܼܚܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܓܵܘ ܣܸܬܪܵܐ، ܕܝܼܠܹܗ ܦܲܓ݂ܪܹܗ،
TRL: Bkhda oerkha khadta o khayta dpteekha-leh ilan min gaw sitra, deeleh paghreh,
ENG: by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

ASY: ܘܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܟܵܗܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܒܲܝܬܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ،
TRL: O kad eet lan kahna goera 'al bayta dalaha,
ENG: and having a great priest over the house of God;

ASY: ܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܩܲܪܒܸܢܲܚ ܒܠܸܒܵܐ ܫܲܪܝܼܪܵܐ، ܒܬܘܼܟ݂ܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܠܸܒܲܢ ܡܘܼܪܝܸܣܵܐ ܘܕܸܟ݂ܝܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܸܢܝܲܬ ܒܝܼܫܬܵܐ، ܘܦܲܓ݂ܪܲܢ ܚܘܼܠܸܠܵܐ ܒܡ̈ܝܼܵܐ ܕܸܟ݂ܝܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Shwooq qarbinakh bliba shareera, btoekhlana dhaymanoeta, liban moeryisa o dikhya min inyat beeshta, o paghran khoelila bmeea dikhye,
ENG: let us draw near with a true heart in fulness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our body washed with pure water:

ASY: ܘܫܒ݂ܘܿܩ ܕܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܩܸܘܝܵܐ ܒܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܲܢ ܕܟܹܐ ܡܵܘܕܲܚ ܒܝܼܘܼܗ̇، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܢ.
TRL: O shwooq dawqakh qiwya bhewee-an dke mawdakh beeoeha, sabab mhoemna-yleh haw dqoewil-leh ilan.
ENG: let us hold fast the confession of our hope that it waver not; for he is faithful that promised:

ASY: ܘܬܲܚܡܸܢܲܚ ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܡܲܥܒܸܪܲܚ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܒܩܲܝܪܲܬ ܕܚܘܼܒܵܐ ܘܕܦܘܼܠܚܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܛܵܒܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: O takhminakh dakhee ma'birakh khad lhaw khena bqayrat dkhoeba o dpoelkhane ṭabe.
ENG: and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and good works;

ASY: ܠܵܐ ܫܵܒ݂ܩܲܚ ܓ̰ܡܵܥܬܲܢ ܡܥܘܼܕܵܠܹ̈ܐ، ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܵܕܲܬ ܠܸܥܒ݂ܵܕܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܝܵܗ݇ܒܲܚ ܠܸܒܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ، ܘܒܘܼܫ ܙܵܘܕܵܐ ܟܡܵܐ ܕܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܕܩܲܪܒܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܗ̇ܘ ܝܵܘܡܵܐ.
TRL: La shawqakh jma'tan m'oedale, aykh dkhakma eet-lhoon 'adat li'wada, eena yabakh liba khad lhaw khena, o boesh zawda kma dbikhzaya ytoon dqarboene-yleh haw yawma.
ENG: not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as ye see the day drawing nigh.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܸܢ ܚܵܛܲܚ ܒܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܓܵܢܲܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܲܢ ܝ݇ܕܲܥܬܵܐ ܕܫܪܵܪܵܐ، ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܠܲܝܬ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Sabab in khaṭakh bṣiwyana dganan min bar dqoebil lan da'ta dshrara, khena layt pyasha diwkha qa khṭeeta,
ENG: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more a sacrifice for sins,

ASY: ܐܸܠܵܐ ܣܦܵܪܬܵܐ ܡܲܙܕܸܥܵܢܬܵܐ ܠܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ، ܘܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܐܵܟܹܠ ܠܕܸܫܡܸܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Ila sparta mazdi'anta ldyanta, o-laha dnoera dbit akel ldishmine.
ENG: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and a fierceness of fire which shall devour the adversaries.

ASY: ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܵܡܘܿܣܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܹܗ ܕܠܵܐ ܪ̈ܲܚܡܹܐ ܥܲܠ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܬܪܹܝ ܝܲܢ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Kl man dmoesle-leh lnamoosa dmoeshe meet-leh dla rakhme 'al poema dtrey yan tlata sahde.
ENG: A man that hath set at nought Moses’ law dieth without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses:

ASY: ܟܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܩܫܝܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܚܫܵܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܝܵܐ ܕܝܵܢܬܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܕܘܼܫܕܸܫ ܠܹܗ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܬܚܘܿܬ ܐܲܩܠܵܬܹ̈ܗ، ܘܠܕܸܡܵܐ ܕܘܲܥܕܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܝܼܹܗ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܩܘܼܕܫܵܐ، ܚܫܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܫܚܝܼܡܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܪܘܼܚܵܐ ܕܫܵܦܵܩܲܬ.
TRL: Kma boesh qsheeta bikhshawa ytoon bit hawya dyanta lhaw ddoeshdish-leh lbroona dalaha tkhoot aqlateh, o ldima dwa'da, haw dbee-eh peesh-leh mqoedsha, khsheew-leh khad mindee shkheema, o moesle-leh lroekha dshapaqat.
ENG: of how much sorer punishment, think ye, shall he be judged worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܹܗ: ܕܝܼܝܼ ܝܠܹܗ ܬܘܼܥܠܵܐ، ܐܵܢܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܪܥܹܢ. ܘܡܸܢܕܪܸܫ: ܒܸܬ ܕܵܐܹܢ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܠܛܵܝܸܦܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab beeda'a ywakh lhaw dmeereh: deeee-yleh toe'la, ana bit par'en. O mindrish: bit daen Marya lṭayipeh.
ENG: For we know him that said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

ASY: ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܡܲܙܕܸܥܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܠܸܢܦܵܠܵܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܝܼܕܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܚܵܝܵܐ.
TRL: Mindee mazdi'ana-yleh linpala gaw eedate dalaha khaya.
ENG: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

ASY: ܕܟ݂ܘܿܪܘܼܢ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܒܲܗܪܵܐ، ܕܵܐܟ݂ܝܼ ܟܠܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܸܘܝܹܐ ܒܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܐܵܓ݂ܘܿܢܵܐ.
TRL: Dkhooroen yawmane qamaye eeman dqoebil lawkhoon bahra, dakhee kle lawkhoon qiwye bjoenjare goere gaw aghoona.
ENG: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were enlightened, ye endured a great conflict of sufferings;

ASY: ܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܣܠܝܼܹܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܠܵܘܡܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܐܘܼܠܨܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܘܚܲܕ݇ܟܡܵܐ ܓܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܫܲܪ̈ܝܼܟܹܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܲܢܹܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Khakma gahe peesh lawkhoon moeslee-e qam nashe blawme o boelṣane, o khakma gahe hwe lawkhoon shareeke 'am anee dane qoebil-lhoon.
ENG: partly, being made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, becoming partakers with them that were so used.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܚܲܫܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ، ܘܒܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܣܠܵܒܬܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ، ܟܲܕ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܩܢܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܘܦܵܝܫܵܢܬܵܐ ܒܫܡܲܝܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab qoebil lawkhoon khasha aykh anee dgaw beyt aseere, o bkhadoeta qoebil lawkhoon slabta dmindeeawkhoon, kad beeda'a deet lawkhoon qnayta boesh ṣpayee o payshanta bshmaya.
ENG: For ye both had compassion on them that were in bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your possessions, knowing that ye yourselves have a better possession and an abiding one.

ASY: ܒܲܣ ܠܵܐ ܪܲܦܹܝܬܘܿܢ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ؛ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ ܓܘܼܪܵܐ.
TRL: Bas la rapeytoon heweeawkhoon; eet-laha poer'ana goera.
ENG: Cast not away therefore your boldness, which hath great recompense of reward.

ASY: ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܚܵܡܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܨܸܒ݂ܝܵܢܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܒܸܬ ܩܲܒܠܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Wale-ylaha dkhamleetoon, hadkha dmin bar d'awdeetoon ṣiwyana dalaha, bit qableetoon mindee dqoewil-leh.
ENG: For ye have need of patience, that, having done the will of God, ye may receive the promise.

ASY: ”ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܚܲܕ ܡܸܬܚܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܹܐܬܵܝܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܒܸܬ ܐܵܬܹܐ، ܘܠܹܐ ܥܲܪܩܸܠ.“
TRL: ”Sabab bkhad mitkha kirya, haw dbetaya-yleh bit ate, o le 'arqil.“
ENG: For yet a very little while, He that cometh shall come, and shall not tarry.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܸܬ ܚܵܝܹܐ ܙܲܕܝܼܩܝܼ، ܘܐܸܢ ܕܵܐܹܪ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ، ܠܹܐ ܒܵܣܡܵܐ ܠܵܗ̇ ܓܵܢܝܼ ܒܝܼܹܗ.
TRL: Eena bhaymanoeta bit khaye zadeeqee, o in daer lbara, le basma-laha ganee bee-eh.
ENG: But my righteous one shall live by faith: And if he shrink back, my soul hath no pleasure in him.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܠܒܵܬ݇ܪܵܐ ܠܸܛܠܵܩܵܐ، ܐܸܠܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܗܲܡܸܢܝܼ ܘܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܦܘܼܪܩܹܐ ܓܵܢܵܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ.
TRL: Eena akhnan le ywakh min anee ddayree lbara liṭlaqa, ila min anee dhaminee o payshee poerqe ganatayhy.
ENG: But we are not of them that shrink back unto perdition; but of them that have faith unto the saving of the soul.

ASY: ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܬܘܼܟ݂ܠܵܢܵܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܗܹܒ݂ܝܼ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ، ܘܫܘܼܪܵܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ.
TRL: Haymanoeta toekhlana-ylaha boet mindeeane deet hewee 'alayhy, o shoerara boet mindeeane dle payshee khizye.
ENG: Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the proving of things not seen.

ASY: ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܹ̈ܐ ܩܲܕ݇ܡܵܝܹ̈ܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܫܘܼܪܸܪܹܐ.
TRL: Boet aha haymanoeta nashe qamaye peesh-lhoon mshoerire.
ENG: For therein the elders had witness borne to them.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܲܪܡܘܼܝܹܐ ܝܘܲܚ ܕܟܠܵܗ̇ ܒܪܝܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܫܘܼܬܐܸܣܬܵܐ ܒܗܹܡܸܙܡܵܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ. ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܡܸܬܚܲܙܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܠܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܒܸܪܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܒܝܘܼܢܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta parmoeye ywakh dklaha breeta peesh-laha shoetista bhemizman dalaha. Hadkha dmindeeane mitkhazyane le yna peeshe birye min mindeeane dmabyoene yna.
ENG: By faith we understand that the worlds have been framed by the word of God, so that what is seen hath not been made out of things which do appear.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܵܒܹܝܠ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܒ݂ܚܵܐ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܡ̣ܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܵܐܹܝܢ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ، ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܗܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܣܗܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܩܘܼܪܒܵܢܹܗ. ܗܹܫ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܗܲܡܙܘܼܡܹܐ ܝܠܹܗ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܡܝܼܬܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta habeyl moeqriw-leh diwkha lalaha boesh ṣpayee min haw dqaeyn moeqriw-leh, o hadkha peesh-laha sheedta ileh dzadeeqa ywa, eeman dalaha sheed-leh boet qoerbaneh. Hesh bhaymanoeta hamzoeme-yleh, apin dmeeta-yleh.
ENG: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had witness borne to him that he was righteous, God bearing witness in respect of his gifts: and through it he being dead yet speaketh.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ ܚܢܘܿܟ݂ ܕܠܵܐ ܚܵܙܹܐ ܡܵܘܬܵܐ؛ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܫ݇ܟ̰ܚܵܐ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܫܘܼܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡ̣ܢ ܩܵܕ݇ܡ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܫܘܼܢܝܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܵܗ̇ ܣܗܝܼܕܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܕܝܼܹܗ ܕܫܦܝܼܪܹܗ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta peesh-leh shoenya khnookh dla khaze mawta; o la peesh-leh moechkha sabab Alaha shoene-leh ileh, sabab min qam dpaesh wa shoenya, peesh-laha sheedta boet dee-eh dshpeereh lalaha.
ENG: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and he was not found, because God translated him: for before his translation he hath had witness borne to him that he had been well-pleasing unto God:

ASY: ܕܠܵܐ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐ݇ܢܵܫܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܗܸܟ̃ ܫܵܦܹܪ ܠܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩܲܪܒܸܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܘܵܠܹܐ ܝܠܵܗ̇ ܕܗܲܡܸܢ ܒܐܝܼܬܘܼܬܹܗ ܘܟܹܐ ܦܵܪܹܥ ܠܛܵܥܝܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܸܠܹܗ.
TRL: Dla haymanoeta nasha le maṣe hich shaper lalaha, sabab kl man dqarbin ileh wale-ylaha dhamin beetoeteh o ke pare' lṭa'yane dileh.
ENG: And without faith it is impossible to be well-pleasing unto him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that seek after him.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܢܘܿܚ، ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܡܘܼܪܥܸܫܵܐ ܒܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܗܹܫ ܠܵܐ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܚܸܙܝܹܐ، ܒܙܕܘܼܥܬܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܝܬܵܐ ܒܢܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܩܹܒ݂ܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܦܲܪܸܩ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܒܢܲܝ̈ ܒܲܝܬܹܗ. ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܹܗ ܕܝܼܢܹܗ ܠܥܵܠܡܵܐ ܘܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܝܵܪܘܿܬܵܐ ܕܙܲܕܝܼܩܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܵܗ̇ ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta nookh, kad peesh-leh moer'isha balaha boet mindeeane hesh la peeshe khizye, bzdoe'ta alahayta bne-leh qewoeta dpariq wa lbnay bayteh. Bhaymanoeteh deeneh l'alma o hwe-leh yaroota dzadeeqoeta deelaha bhaymanoeta.
ENG: By faith Noah, being warned of God concerning things not seen as yet, moved with godly fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ، ܟܲܕ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܕܐܵܙܹܠ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܕܘܼܟܵܐ ܕܒܸܬ ܦܵܝܫܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܝܘܼܗ݇ܒܸܠܬܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܠܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ، ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܹܗ ܘܐ݇ܙܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܠܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܕܵܥܵܐ ܠܐܲܝܟܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܹܐܙܵܠܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta awraham, kad peesh-leh qirya dazel wa ldoeka dbit paysha wa yoebilta ileh lyartoeta, moeṣyit-leh o zeel-leh, apin dle ywa beeda'a layka ywa bezala.
ENG: By faith Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out unto a place which he was to receive for an inheritance; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܫܪܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܢܘܼܟ݂ܪܵܝܬܵܐ، ܘܥܡܝܼܪܹܗ ܒܡܲܫܟܢܹ̈ܐ ܥܲܡ ܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܘܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂، ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܝܼܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܵܪܬܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܲܡܹܗ ܗܲܪ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta shre-leh bar'a dalaha qoewil-leh ileh aykh dbar'a noekhrayta, o 'meereh bmashkne 'am eeskhaq o ya'qoow, anee deewaw bnay yartoeta 'ameh har dhaw qawla.
ENG: By faith he became a sojourner in the land of promise, as in a land not his own, dwelling in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܣܦܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ ܕܐܝܼܬ ܠܵܗ̇ ܒܸܢܝܲܬ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܘܼܡܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܘܒܵܢܝܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab bispara ywa lmdeeta deet-laha binyat, hay doemanoeha o banyanoeha Alaha-yleh.
ENG: for he looked for the city which hath the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܣܲܪܵܐ ܒܓܵܢܘܼܗ̇ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܚܲܝܠܵܐ ܕܗܲܨܠܵܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ، ܘܗܘܼܨܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ، ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܫܸܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܗܵܨܲܠܬܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܵܗ̇ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒ݂ܝܼܕܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܘܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܗ̇ ܡܗܘܼܡܢܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta oep sara bganoeha qoebil-laha khayla dhaṣla wa broona, o hoeṣil-laha yala, apin d'weerta ywa min shine dhaṣalta, sabab hoeminaha dhaw d'weeda ywa qawla iloeha mhoemna-yleh.
ENG: By faith even Sarah herself received power to conceive seed when she was past age, since she counted him faithful who had promised:

ASY: ܘܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܕ ܓܲܒ݂ܪܵܐ، ܘܟܲܕ ܗ̇ܘ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܡܝܼܬܵܐ، ܗܘܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܙܲܪܥܹܗ ܦܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܟܵܘܟ݂ܒܹ̈ܐ ܕܫܡܲܝܵܐ، ܘܕܠܵܐ ܡܸܢܝܵܢܵܐ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܣܹܠܵܐ ܕܥܲܠ ܡܲܪܙܵܐ ܕܝܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: O hadkha min khad gawra, o kad haw aykh meeta, hwe-leh zar'eh pirya aykh kawkhbe dshmaya, o dla minyana aykh sela d'al marza dyama.
ENG: wherefore also there sprang of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of heaven in multitude, and as the sand, which is by the sea shore, innumerable.

ASY: ܐܲܢܹܐ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܝܼܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ. ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܠܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܚܸܙܝܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܪܸܚܩܵܐ ܘܚܦܝܼܩܲܝ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܘܡܘܼܕܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܘܡܵܫܵܚܲܛܹ̈ܐ ܒܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Ane klayhy meet-lhoon gaw haymanoeta. La qoeblay-lhoon qawle, eena khizyay-lhoon min rikhqa o khpeeqay-lhoon, o moede-lhoon dnoekhraye ywaw o mashakhaṭe bar'a.
ENG: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them and greeted them from afar, and having confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܐܵܡܪܝܼ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ، ܡܲܕܘܼܥܹܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܕܒܸܛܥܵܝܵܐ ܝܢܵܐ ܠܚܲܕ ܒܹܝܬ ܡܲܥܡܪܵܐ.
TRL: Sabab anee damree hadkha mindeeane, madoe'e yna dbiṭ'aya yna lkhad beyt ma'mra.
ENG: For they that say such things make it manifest that they are seeking after a country of their own.

ASY: ܐܸܢ ܗܵܘܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܬܲܚܡܘܼܢܹܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܕܦܠܝܼܛ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܹܗ، ܒܸܬ ܗܵܘܹܐ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܸܪܣܲܬ ܕܕܵܝܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܥܲܠܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: In hawee waw takhmoene boet atra dpleeṭ-lhoon mineh, bit hawe waw-lhoon pirsat ddayree waw 'aloehy.
ENG: And if indeed they had been mindful of that country from which they went out, they would have had opportunity to return.

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܫܲܗܘܘܼܬܹܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܠܚܲܕ ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ، ܐܲܬܪܵܐ ܫܡܲܝܵܢܵܝܵܐ. ܒܘܼܬ ܐܵܗܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܢܟ݂ܝܼܦ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܐܲܠܵܗܲܝܗܝ، ܘܗܘܼܕܸܪܹܗ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܡܕܝܼܢ݇ܬܵܐ.
TRL: Eena shahwoete ywaw lkhad atra boesh ṣpayee, atra shmayanaya. Boet aha la nkheep-leh Alaha dpaesh qirya alahayhy, o hoedireh ilayhy mdeeta.
ENG: But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܠܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܟܲܕ ܦܝܵܫܵܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܵܐ، . ܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ ܗܕܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܕܡܲܩܪܸܒ݂ ܠܒܪܘܿܢܹܗ ܝܼܚܝܼܕܵܝܵܐ،
TRL: Bhaymanoeta moeqriw-leh awraham leeskhaq kad pyasha joerba, . Haw dqoebil-leh qawle hdeera ywa dmaqriw lbrooneh eekheedaya,
ENG: By faith Abraham, being tried, offered up Isaac: yea, he that had gladly received the promises was offering up his only begotten son;

ASY: ܐܵܦܸܢ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܹܗ: ܡ̣ܢ ܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܒܸܬ ܦܵܠܹܛ ܙܲܪܥܵܐ ܐܸܠܘܼܟ݂.
TRL: Apin dalaha meera ywa ileh: min eeskhaq bit paleṭ zar'a iloekh.
ENG: even he to whom it was said, In Isaac shall thy seed be called:

ASY: ܐܲܒ݂ܪܵܗܵܡ ܗܘܼܡܸܢܹܗ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܡܵܨܹܐ ܡܲܩܸܡ ܠܹܗ ܐܘܼܦ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ. ܘܒܚܕܵܐ ܐܘܼܪܚܵܐ، ܟܹܐ ܡܵܨܲܚ ܐܵܡܪܲܚ، ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܠܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܝܼܬܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Awraham hoemineh dalaha maṣe maqim-leh oep min meete. O bkhda oerkha, ke maṣakh amrakh, dqoebil-leh leeskhaq min meete.
ENG: accounting that God is able to raise up, even from the dead; from whence he did also in a parable receive him back.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܝܼܣܚܵܩ ܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܘܠܥܹܣܘܿ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܸܢܕܝܼܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܕܲܥܬܝܼܕ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta eeskhaq boerikh-leh lya'qoow o l'esoo boet mindeeane dda'teed.
ENG: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even concerning things to come.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܲܥܩܘܿܒ݂ ܟܲܕ ܒܸܡܝܵܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܘܼܪܸܟ݂ ܠܹܗ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܡ̣ܢ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ ܕܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܘܣܓ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܟܲܕ ܓܸܢܝܵܐ ܥܲܠ ܪܹܫܵܐ ܕܚܘܼܛܪܹܗ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta ya'qoow kad bimyata ywa boerikh-leh lkl khad min bnoone dyawsip, o sgheed-leh kad ginya 'al resha dkhoeṭreh.
ENG: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܵܘܣܸܦ، ܟܲܕ ܩܘܼܪܒܸܢܹܗ ܠܸܡܝܵܬܵܐ، ܡܘܼܕܟܸܪܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܦܠܵܛܬܵܐ ܕܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܦܩܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܲܪ̈ܡܘܼܗܝ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta yawsip, kad qoerbineh limyata, moedkireh boet plaṭta dbnay eesrayel min miṣreyn, o pqeed-leh boet garmoehy.
ENG: By faith Joseph, when his end was nigh, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܐܲܒ݂ܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܘܼܫܹܐ ܛܘܼܫܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܠܹܗ ܬܠܵܬܵܐ ܝܲܪ̈ܚܹܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܦܝܼܫ ܠܹܗ ܝ݇ܠܝܼܕܵܐ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܚܙܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܝܵܠܵܕ݇ܐ ܫܲܦܝܼܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܩܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta awahe dmoeshe ṭoeshe-lhoon ileh tlata yarkhe eeman dpeesh-leh leeda, sabab khze-lhoon dyala shapeera ywa, o la zdee' lhoon min poeqdana dmalka.
ENG: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months by his parents, because they saw he was a goodly child; and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܡܘܼܫܹܐ، ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܓܘܼܪܘܸܣ ܠܹܗ، ܡܘܼܚܦܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܕܦܵܐܹܫ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܸܪܝܵܐ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܒܪܵܬܵܐ ܕܦܸܪܥܘܿܢ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta moeshe, eeman dgoerwis-leh, moekhpil-leh dpaesh wa qirya broona lbrata dpir'oon.
ENG: By faith Moses, when he was grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter;

ASY: ܓܘܼܒܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܕܓ̰ܲܢܓ̰ܸܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܥܲܡ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܘܠܵܐ ܩܵܐ ܚܲܕ ܙܲܒ݂ܢܵܐ ܟܸܪܝܵܐ ܡܲܒܣܸܡ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ،
TRL: Goebe-leh djanjir wa 'am ṭayipa dalaha o la qa khad zawna kirya mabsim wa bkhṭeeta,
ENG: choosing rather to be evil entreated with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;

ASY: ܩܵܒܲܠܬܵܐ ܕܠܵܘܡܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܚܘܼܫܒܸܢܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܒܘܼܫ ܡܵܘܬܪܵܢܬܵܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܝܼܡܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܝܵܪܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܦܘܼܪܥܵܢܵܐ.
TRL: Qabalta dlawma boet msheekha khoeshbina-leh boesh mawtranta min klayhy seemate dmiṣreyn, sabab bikhyara ywa lpoer'ana.
ENG: accounting the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt: for he looked unto the recompense of reward.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܫܒ݂ܝܼܩܵܐ ܠܹܗ ܡܸܨܪܹܝܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܙܕܝܼܥ ܠܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܸܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܵܐ، ܘܚܡܝܼܠ ܠܹܗ ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܸܚܙܵܝܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܚܸܙܝܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta shweeqa-leh miṣreyn, o la zdee' leh min khimta dmalka, o khmeel-leh sabab bikhzaya ywa lhaw dle paesh khizya.
ENG: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܹܗ ܦܸܨܚܵܐ ܘܡܘܼܪܝܸܣ ܠܹܗ ܕܸܡܵܐ، ܕܠܵܐ ܕܵܩܹܪ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܒܝܼܲܝܗܝ ܩܵܛܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܒܘܼܟ݂ܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta 'weed-leh piṣkha o moeryis-leh dima, dla daqer wa bee-ayhy qaṭlana dboekhre.
ENG: By faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of the blood, that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܢܲܝ̈ ܝܼܣܪܵܝܹܠ ܥܒ݂ܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܒܝܵܡܵܐ ܕܣܘܿܦ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܥܲܠ ܐܲܪܥܵܐ ܒܵܪܘܿܙܬܵܐ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܸܨܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܸܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܥܵܒ݂ܪܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ، ܚܢܝܼܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta bnay eesrayel 'weerhoon byama dsoop aykh d'al ar'a baroozta, eena eeman dmiṣraye joerib-lhoon d'awree waw, khneeq-lhoon.
ENG: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were swallowed up.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܢܦܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܫܘܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܼܪܝܼܚܘܿ، ܡ̣ܢ ܒܵܬ݇ܪ ܕܚܕܝܼܪܹܗ ܛܵܝܸܦܵܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܝܗܝ ܫܲܒ݂ܥܵܐ ܝܵܘܡܵܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta npeel-lhoon shoere deereekhoo, min bar dkhdeereh ṭayipa lkhadirwanayhy shaw'a yawmane.
ENG: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been compassed about for seven days.

ASY: ܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܪܵܚܵܒ݂ ܙܵܢܝܼܬܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܛܠܝܼܩ ܠܵܗ̇ ܥܲܡ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܵܐ ܡܘܼܨܝܸܬ ܠܗܘܿܢ، ܣܵܒܵܒ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܵܗ̇ ܠܓܵܫܘܿܫܹ̈ܐ ܒܫܠܵܡܵܐ.
TRL: Bhaymanoeta rakhaw zaneeta la ṭleeq-laha 'am anee dla moeṣyit-lhoon, sabab qoebil-laha lgashooshe bshlama.
ENG: By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with them that were disobedient, having received the spies with peace.

ASY: ܡܘܿܕܝܼ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ݇ܢܵܐ ܐܵܡܪܹܢ؟ ܠܲܝܬ ܠܝܼ ܥܕܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܩܹܝܢ ܒܘܼܬ ܓܸܕܥܘܿܢ، ܘܒܵܪܵܩ، ܘܫܸܡܫܘܿܢ، ܘܢܲܦ̮ܬܲܚ، ܘܕܵܘܝܼܕ، ܘܫܡܘܼܐܹܝܠ، ܘܢܒ݂ܝܼܹ̈ܐ،
TRL: Moodee khena amren? Layt-lee 'dana dhaqeyn boet gid'oon, o baraq, o shimshoon, o nawtakh, o daweed, o shmoeeyl, o nwee-e,
ENG: And what shall I more say? for the time will fail me if I tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah; of David and Samuel and the prophets:

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܒܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ ܓ݂ܠܝܼܒ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܡܲܠܟܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܘܥܒ݂ܝܼܕ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܟܹܐܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܘܫܩܝܼܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܩܵܘܠܹ̈ܐ، ܘܐ݇ܟ̰ܝܼܡ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܡܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪ̈ܝܵܘܵܬܹܐ،
TRL: Anee dbhaymanoeta ghleeb-lhoon lmalkwate, o 'weed-lhoon kenoeta, o shqeel-lhoon qawle, o cheem-lhoon poeme daryawate,
ENG: who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

ASY: ܡܘܼܟ̰ܡܸܥ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܠܵܗܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܘܼܪܵܐ، ܘܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܘܼܨܝܹܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܣܲܝܦܵܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܘܼܠܸܢܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܙܲܒܘܼܢܘܼܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܢܹ̈ܐ ܓܵܘ ܦܠܵܫܵܐ، ܘܡܘܼܥܪܸܩ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܚܲܝܠܵܘܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܕܢܘܼܟ݂ܪ̈ܵܝܹܐ.
TRL: Moechmi' lhoon lahe dnoera, o peesh-lhoon poeṣye min poema dsaypa, peesh-lhoon khoeline gaw zaboenoeyate, peesh-lhoon khaylane gaw plasha, o moe'riq-lhoon khaylawate dnoekhraye.
ENG: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, waxed mighty in war, turned to flight armies of aliens.

ASY: ܒܲܟ݂ܬܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܝܼܬܲܝ̈ܗܝ ܒܩܝܵܡܬܵܐ. ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܹܐ ܗܲܠ ܡܵܘܬܵ‌ܐ، ܘܡܘܼܚܦܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܕܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܦܪܝܼܩܹܐ، ܕܩܵܢܝܼ ܗ݇ܘܵܘ ܚܕܵܐ ܩܝܵܡܬܵ‌ܐ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ.
TRL: Bakhtate qoebil-lhoon meetayhy bqyamta. Eena khene peesh-lhoon joenjire hal mawta‌, o moekhpil-lhoon dpayshee waw preeqe, dqanee waw khda qyamta‌ boesh ṣpayee.
ENG: Women received their dead by a resurrection: and others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

ASY: ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܣܚܸܪܹܐ ܘܡܸܚܝܹܐ ܒܫܵܘܛܹ̈ܐ، ܘܗܹܫ ܐ݇ܚܹܪ̈݇ܢܹܐ ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܐ݇ܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ ܘܕܸܪܝܹܐ ܓܵܘ ܒܹܝܬ ܐܲܣܝܼܪܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: khene peesh-lhoon moeskhire o mikhye bshawṭe, o hesh khene peesh-lhoon seere o dirye gaw beyt aseere.
ENG: and others had trial of mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

ASY: ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܪܓ̰ܝܼܡܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܢܣܝܼܪܹܗ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܪܒܹܐ، ܦܝܼܫ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܘܼܡܝܸܬܹܐ ܒܦܘܼܡܵܐ ܕܣܲܝܦܵܐ. ܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܟܲܕ ܠܒ݂ܝܼܫܹܐ ܓܸܠܕܵܐ ܕܥܸܪ̈ܒܹܐ ܘܕܥܸܙܹ̈ܐ، ܣܢܝܼܩܹܐ، ܡܘܼܠܝܸܨܹܐ ܘܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܸܪܹܐ،
TRL: Peesh-lhoon rjeeme, peesh-lhoon nseereh, peesh-lhoon joerbe, peesh-lhoon moemyite bpoema dsaypa. Khdeerhoon kad lweeshe gilda d'irbe o d'ize, sneeqe, moelyiṣe o joenjire,
ENG: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, they were tempted, they were slain with the sword: they went about in sheepskins, in goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, evil entreated

ASY: ܐܵܢܝܼ ܕܠܹܐ ܚܵܫܹܚ ܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ ܥܵܠܡܵܐ. ܚܕܝܼܪܗܘܿܢ ܓܵܘ ܒܲܪ̈ܝܼܹܐ ܘܛܘܼܪ̈ܵܢܹܐ، ܘܒܓܸܦܝܵܬܹ̈ܐ ܘܒܟ̰ܸܠܦܵܦܹ̈ܐ ܕܐܲܪܥܵܐ.
TRL: Anee dle khashekh wa ilayhy 'alma. Khdeerhoon gaw baree-e o ṭoerane, o bgipyate o bchilpape dar'a.
ENG: (of whom the world was not worthy), wandering in deserts and mountains and caves, and the holes of the earth.

ASY: ܟܠܲܝܗܝ ܐܲܢܹܐ ܗܘܹܐ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܥܲܠܲܝܗܝ ܣܵܗܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܒܘܼܬ ܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܲܝܗܝ، ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܠܵܐ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܗܘܿܢ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܕܦܝܼܫܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܘܼܘܸܠܵܐ ܐܸܠܲܝܗܝ،
TRL: Klayhy ane hwe-lhoon 'alayhy sahdoeta boet haymanoetayhy, eena la qoebil-lhoon mindee dpeesha ywa qoewila ilayhy,
ENG: And these all, having had witness borne to them through their faith, received not the promise,

ASY: ܟܲܕ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܗܘܼܕܪܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܡܸܢܕܝܼ ܒܘܼܫ ܨܦܵܝܝܼ ܐܸܠܲܢ، ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܠܵܐ ܕܝܼܲܢ ܐܵܢܝܼ ܠܹܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼ ܡܘܼܟܡܸܠܹܐ.
TRL: Kad Alaha hoedra-yleh khad mindee boesh ṣpayee ilan, hadkha dla dee-an anee le payshee moekmile.
ENG: God having provided some better thing concerning us, that apart from us they should not be made perfect.

ASY: ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܐܘܼܦ ܐܲܚܢܲܢ، ܟܲܕ ܐܝܼܬ ܠܲܢ ܚܕܵܐ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܥܢܵܢܵܐ ܕܣܵܗܕܹ̈ܐ ܠܚܵܕܸܪ̈ܘܵܢܲܢ، ܪܲܦܲܚ ܡܸܢܲܢ ܟܠ ܝܘܼܩܪܵܐ ܘܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ ܕܚܠܝܼܨܬܲܢ ܝܼܠܵܗ̇، ܘܪܵܚܛܲܚ ܒܚܡܵܠܬܵܐ ܠܐܵܓ݂ܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܬܒ݂ܵܐ ܝܠܹܗ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܲܢ.
TRL: Hadkha oep akhnan, kad eet lan khda hadkha 'nana dsahde lkhadirwanan, rapakh minan kl yoeqra o khṭeeta dkhleeṣtan eelaha, o rakhṭakh bkhmalta laghoona dmoetwa-yleh qaman.
ENG: Therefore let us also, seeing we are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

ASY: ܚܵܝܪܲܚ ܒܝܼܫܘܿܥ، ܪܹܫܵܐ ܘܡܲܟܡܸܠܵܢܵܐ ܕܗܲܝܡܵܢܘܼܬܵܐ، ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܘܼܬ ܚܲܕܘܼܬܵܐ ܕܡܘܼܬܸܒ݂ܬܵܐ ܝܗ݇ܘܵܐ ܩܵܕ݇ܡܘܼܗܝ ܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܙܩܝܼܦܵܐ، ܡܘܼܣܠܹܐ ܠܹܗ ܠܢܟ݂ܝܼܦܬܵܐ، ܘܝ݇ܬܝܼܒ݂ ܠܹܗ ܥܲܠ ܝܲܡܝܼܢܵܐ ܕܬܪܘܿܢܘܿܣ ܕܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ.
TRL: Khayrakh beeshoo', resha o makmilana dhaymanoeta, haw dboet khadoeta dmoetiwta ywa qamoehy qoebil-leh zqeepa, moesle-leh lnkheepta, o teew-leh 'al yameena dtroonoos dalaha.
ENG: looking unto Jesus the author and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising shame, and hath sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

ASY: ܚܙܹܝܡܘܼܢ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܕܩܘܼܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ ܚܲܕ ܗܲܕܟ݂ܵܐ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠܘܼܬܵܐ ܠܓܵܢܹܗ ܡ̣ܢ ܚܲܛܵܝܹ̈ܐ، ܕܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܵܐ ܣܵܩܕܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܘܠܵܐ ܦܵܝܫܝܼܬܘܿܢ ܪܸܦܝܹܐ ܒܪܸܥܝܵܢܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ.
TRL: Khzeymoen lhaw dqoebil-leh khad hadkha dalqoewloeta lganeh min khaṭaye, dakhtoon la saqdeetoon o la paysheetoon ripye bri'yanawkhoon.
ENG: For consider him that hath endured such gainsaying of sinners against themselves, that ye wax not weary, fainting in your souls.

ASY: ܒܝܲܕ ܦܠܵܫܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܕܲܠܩܘܼܒ݂ܠ ܕܚܛܝܼܬܵܐ، ܗܹܫ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܡܸܛܝܹܐ ܠܫܵܦܲܟ݂ܬܵܐ ܕܕܸܡܵܐ.
TRL: Byad plashawkhoon dalqoewl dkhṭeeta, hesh le ytoon miṭye lshapakhta ddima.
ENG: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin:

ASY: ܘܡܘܼܢܫܹܐ ܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܠܢܵܨܝܼܗܲܬ، ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐ݇ܡܝܼܪܵܗ̇ ܐܸܠܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ: ܒܪܘܿܢܝܼ، ܠܵܐ ܡܲܣܠܹܝܬ ܬܲܥܠܲܡܬܵܐ ܕܡܵܪܝܵܐ، ܘܠܵܐ ܣܵܩܕܹܬ ܐܝܼܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܢܟܸܣ ܠܘܼܟ݂،
TRL: O moenshe lawkhoon lnaṣeehat, hay dmeeraha ilawkhoon aykh dlbnoone: broonee, la masleyt ta'lamta dmarya, o la saqdet eeman dmankis-loekh,
ENG: and ye have forgotten the exhortation, which reasoneth with you as with sons, My son, regard not lightly the chastening of the Lord, Nor faint when thou art reproved of him;

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܬܲܥܠܸܡ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܲܚܸܒ، ܘܟܹܐ ܡܲܡܪܸܥ ܠܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܕܩܲܒܸܠ ܠܹܗ.
TRL: Sabab Marya ke ta'lim lman dmakhib, o ke mamri' lkl khad broona dqabil-leh.
ENG: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, And scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

ASY: ܣܵܒܵܒ ܒܘܼܬ ܬܲܥܠܲܡܬܵܐ ܩܲܒܘܼܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܓ̰ܘܼܢܓ̰ܵܪܵܐ، ܘܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܠܹܚ ܒܝܼܵܘܟ݂ܘܿܢ ܐܲܝܟ݂ ܕܠܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ. ܣܵܒܵܒ ܠܐܲܝܢܝܼ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܠܹܐ ܬܲܥܠܸܡ ܒܵܒܘܼܗܝ؟
TRL: Sabab boet ta'lamta qaboele ytoon joenjara, o Alaha ke palekh beeawkhoon aykh dlbnoone. Sabab laynee broona le ta'lim baboehy?
ENG: It is for chastening that ye endure; God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is there whom his father chasteneth not?

ASY: ܐܝܼܢܵܐ ܐܸܢ ܐܲܚܬܘܿܢ ܠܹܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ ܦܝܼܫܹܐ ܬܘܼܥܠܸܡܹܐ، ܕܟܠ ܚܲܕ ܒܪܘܿܢܵܐ ܟܹܐ ܦܵܐܹܫ ܬܘܼܥܠܸܡܵܐ، ܒܲܣ ܛܥܘܼܢܬܵܐ ܕܙܵܢܝܘܼܬܵܐ ܝܬܘܿܢ، ܘܠܵܐ ܒܢܘܿܢܹ̈ܐ.
TRL: Eena in akhtoon le ytoon peeshe toe'lime, dkl khad broona ke paesh toe'lima, bas ṭ'oenta dzanyoeta ytoon, o la bnoone.
